reviews.description: I have been coming to this place for a few months at least once a month for a book club.  The place has a menu that changes regularly and old favorites to keep you coming back. My favorite are the deluxe tots with the over easy egg on top.  They also have a great Happy Hour that you can check out on Facebook.  I highly recommend their frozen Margaritas too.    The place has ample parking and there are a lot of cool local shops in the same area, like a plant shop. There is also great indoor/outdoor seating.  You place your food and drink orders at the bar and pickup your food outside when your buzzer goes off. Also, huge plus is that it is pet friendly.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Came here with some friends and this place was awesome! Lots of open seating for good social distancing. Dog and kid friendly. Areas for games and even a playground. There is a stage for live music and when we visited the one man band was great.

reviews.author: Ana S.
reviews.description: We came here for St. Patrick's day with family.  It's hidden but very nicely decorated. The atmosphere was relaxed, I particularly loved their food. Margaritas are not my first pick but my nephew recommended them, they were too strong to enjoy the taste.  It was a busy night and our first time there as well, we walked up to a long line to place our orders. When we finally reached the front the bartender looked and sounded a little frustrated. Her customer service can use a little refreshing.  Be careful when placing your order there is a tree root sticking out which tripped many people including myself. Overall I would return solely for the food not so much their drinks

reviews.author: Melanie O.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday when they had a vegan market going on and really enjoyed ourselves! They have plenty of seating inside and outside and a good selection of beers on tap. We stayed inside and felt like it was quiet enough to have a conversation despite how busy it was and if you like the louder atmosphere, they had a DJ outside.

reviews.author: Christopher W.
reviews.description: Great beer garden perfectly located for bike social rides. This was the place where I had my first real michelada. They also feature a menu full of frozen margaritas in many different flavors. The perfect refreshment before and after the ride.

reviews.author: Jair O.
reviews.description: Great outdoor venue for socially distanced drinks and food. My friend ordered 5 different beers, ranging from IPAs to sours, and they were all delicious! Our second round included frozen margaritas - my personal favorite was the prickly pear, though the mango was enjoyable as well.   The menu was short and sweet, but the Korean bbq wings were spicy and delicious, and the fries were exceptionally crispy and hot. I was impressed.  Great atmosphere and crowd in the evening, and a band was playing live music all throughout. It was a bit loud for my taste, but still possible to hold a conversation. Would definitely return again!

reviews.author: Justine S.
reviews.description: Great place! It's a very large outdoor space with lots of tables so even when it feels busy it's still socially distanced. Big selection of beer, great margaritas, and the hamburger is SO good and the fries are even better. Wings are great too. I've only been during the daytime when it's very family friendly, with a playground and trains periodically running by which the kids seem to love staring at. I've been there on both Saturday and Sunday afternoons and we've never had an issue getting a table (although as the weather gets hotter, finding a table in the shade might get tougher!)

reviews.author: Bea C.
reviews.description: Visited Monday, after a long walk from the Pearl To Alamo. It was closed. So we were disappointed. We saw Burleson, which somehow I thought it was so much further out.  It's across the street!!  When we got there, we were welcomed with a friendly smile.  I got a chamoy margarita which was delicious. It hit the spot after walking in the sun.  We ate there and I got the burger, it was great! My husband got the chicken sandwich and he said it was the best!  Great place to hang out at. I enjoyed my time there. I almost catnapped a grey kitty that was roaming around.  It was such a nice find! Glad we finally got to visit!

reviews.author: Adriana S.
reviews.description: Where fun meets trains. When you're at a crossroads. Do you have some fun or a lot of fun or none train sty

reviews.author: JG W.
reviews.description: Bro... been here three times and got kicked out twice. After like two shots. Fuck this place and the soft ass bartenders  they pay to much attention to your business instead of pouring drinks like they're paid to do. They're bartenders not security, they should stop trying to intervene in shit they're not supposed to do. My brother in law said she looked like an ex and she cut us off because of that. Sorry that you're insecure and ugly but don't take that out on us

reviews.author: Desiree B.
reviews.description: I loved this place! The margaritas are strong and it's very spacious. Staff wears masks, there's hand sanitizer and a food truck outside. This is a fun safe place to hang out with while still being safe.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Live music outside and plenty of seating. Very dive bar feel. The burgers are actually not bad and the tater tots are crispy.   Suggestions- Covered outdoor seating available if its raining  Moose Out

reviews.author: Kelli J.
reviews.description: Such a cute place - great for when the weathers nice and you wanna relax and grab a drink outside. They also have indoor seating. Like the name suggests they have an extensive beer list. They also have wine but no liquor. The frozen margs are wine based and seemed too be a hit amongst the crowd. I tried the canned rosè - $12 enough for 2 glasses. Nothing fancy about the place but overall a good time. Also good for kids!

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Love Burleson. IF Mother Nature is bring fear this is the perfect place to sit out hanging out with friends enjoying a few drinks is and playing Somme games. I think how it's also a family friendly place with a fenced in outdoor area and play scape for kids

reviews.author: Bridgette R.
reviews.description: This is my updated review of Burleson. My husband and I went there on Friday night and the vibe was awesome. There was a great DJ playing excellent music. I had 2 Sky Trooper IPAs and I loved it. And I had my first burger there and it was FREAKING DELISH. It was char-grilled perfection. The bun was also char-grilled to perfection. It is a thin patty and the fixings are simple, lettuce, tomato, onion I think, mustard, and maybe pickles. It was a classic American burger. No frills, just thrills.   Then I thought about this burger every day since and we decided to go there today and bring the whole family. It was a Monday and I have been told to never go out to eat on a Monday b/c the regular chef/kitchen staff are not on duty. But who knows if that is even true or not.  Anyway.....I ordered 2 BURGERS for myself. That is how good I thought they were. And before I forget, the FRIES are the BOMB!!!!  I had my first bite of this Monday afternoon burger and I have to say I was disappointed. The bun was barely toasted and the char-grilled flavor was not as significant. The bun I could tell was a wee bit old and a wee bit dry. I was sad. The burger wasn't bad but it wasn't the burger I had on Friday night which was SUPER CRAZY AWESOME. What happened Burleson?   I still love your vibe and I will still make this my happy place for sure and I am hoping this was a fluke.   And another really cool thing I have to share from our Monday visit is that their coke was running a bit weak so the bartender brought us bottled cokes instead and didn't charge us extra. We didn't even ask for this nor did we complain about the soda he just noticed and brought them to us of his own volition. The staff is so nice here and I LOVE the place.  People are always having a great time here. You can bring the dog, the fam, or friends and just chillax yourself.  Please take care of that burger.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: We went on a bike ride from Elmemdorf Lake down Apache Creek and decided to hit a couple of bars in this area during our ride.  This was on my list to try, so we stopped at this old building that houses numerous businesses along the Alazan creek with a view of SA skyline.  This area is changing in front of our eyes, so get over there before it completely gets a makeover.  Though I am excited to see Alazan creek walk/bike trail that will lead you to Woodlawn Lake in the near future!  There was a good quiet crowd outside enjoying a nice Sunday winter day.  Went inside to look around and chat with the bartender about how they picked this place out of everywhere in SA.  It started with a caramel maker...  The whole building smelled like Chai tea as they were mixing it upstairs, so go on a Sunday if you want the sweet smell of Chai as you sip on your beer.  I decided to go for Copperhead ;) which was a Pale Ale that was full of malty notes.  This was a solid beer as I sipped at the tables outside and admired the SA skyline in the distance.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: The unintended effect of transplants coming to San Antonio cannot be discounted. Areas a generation that seemed overlooked are coming alive. Thus the same warehouse in the Westside that houses "Shotgun Coffee Roasters"  becomes an intermediary. A coffeehouse, a brewery in the Westside? Say it isn't so but at least for now our city is experiencing a renaissance of sorts . As a result more unique businesses are hedging their bets, opening up  in our city. Which brings me to the Vista Brewing Company.   I could go on, using flowery verbage to describe my experience here but why. So I will give you the rundown. Parking is very problematic. You can park in residential areas but be careful. Vehicles come down the street and like Sammy Hagar "They can't drive 55!" It's housed in the same building as "Shotgun Coffee Roasters" an excellent coffeehouse by the way. It is really small with some indoor seating with more outdoors. So basically you go to the counter and order your pour. The taplist while a bit limited has something for everyone. I settled on their "Middle Trinity" a Belgian Tripel. I would remiss if I didn't comment on the tapmasters as they are friendly.  My understanding is that this is their third location the other two being: Beecave and Driftwood. While they don't serve food in the foreseeable future they will have rotating foodtrucks. I must admit the beer I had was not too bad. It was much more sweeter, boozier than I anticpated. So sitting here I did have a critique. Since this area is close by an open ravine there appeared to be an insect issue. I was bit a few times and shooed off mosquitoes whilst drinking my beer. I hope they consider bringing in a pest controller periodically.  Still I recommend coming here. It is a unique addition to this area. A brewery in the Westside? I never thought I would imagine seeing one here in my lifetime. The Vista Brewing Company is a charming place with good beers and service to match. Will patrons  that never frequent this area venture outside their comfort zone to come here? I don't know. Time will tell. Next time I come I'm drinking inside.

reviews.author: Paulo D.
reviews.description: Cool hidden spot to get some good beers and enjoy the weather. They have the coffee roasters next door so this is a good place to work/study or just relax. Beer is also great.

reviews.author: Joseph A.
reviews.description: Visited on a Saturday afternoon and this place was super chill. Bartender was very friendly and had good suggestions. Great spot, - the converted warehouse it's in is very cool and outdoor area was nice. Beers were light and crisp. I had the American Pale Ale and  the weizen and would recommend both (nice day-drinking beers ). I do not typically like wheat beers because I find them too heavy, but theirs was light but full of flavor.  Looking forward to visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Joe V.
reviews.description: In a very cool spot next to shotgun roasters. Some really good beer, I recommend the lambic style Grato or the juicy IPA. We stayed inside and had a great time. I'm excited to try their next offerings.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Big Hops is my favorite place for craft beer on this side of town. Marlyna and Joe are exactly the type of people that you love to have serving you beer. Not just great bartenders but down to earth people that have turned into good friends that I look forward to talking to whenever I go in. Love coming in to try some new beers whenever I have some extra time on my hands. Taps rotate all the time so it's always fun to see what they have!

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: One of my favorite craft beer spots in San Antonio. The rotation of taps makes it fun to experience. You may have the same beer twice but you may not. Always something new to try in a calm chill environment. The variety of TVs keep it interesting and the patio is great during the summer.

reviews.author: Shayne D.
reviews.description: The guy behind the bar wasn't only knowledgeable, he was extremely friendly. The prices were great and the beer selection was of vast variety.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a beer while waiting for a table at a nearby restaurant. They have a good selection of beer and even have cider and mead. If you're in need of a snack, they sell pretzels and popcorn. It looks like they have happy hour and on Mondays happy hour is all day.   The place has inside and outside seating. Parking is shared with the other businesses, but there's plenty.

reviews.author: gedaph d.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been to Big Hops a few times now. We were so excited to find it so close to our house! We are IPA fans and Big Hops has some delightful choices.  Their employees are super inviting and friendly plus very informed about their beers. We have gotten wonderful recommendations from them. Can't wait to go ba

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! They allow you to bring in your own food. They have a large  selection of beers and a few cans of wine. The atmosphere is very relaxing, it has a feel of of a sports bar. The staff is very nice as well.

reviews.author: kev c.
reviews.description: Decent rotating beer list. They also allow for half pours so you dont have to get 10oz of a 10% beer, back to back. They also allow outside food to be brought in or delivered. The only reason not 5 stars is with only one person working, the wait can get a bit long.

reviews.author: Al P.
reviews.description: It's located in the middle of shopping center with outside and inside seating. The bartender was very helpful in offering up suggestions and there was large selection of craft beers from many Texas breweries.

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: This is my favorite location out of all the Big Hop locations, not just because it's super close to my house but the guest service is phenomenal! Not only are the beer connoisseur knowledgeable but the have a great sense of humor and easy going. I never feel rushed and they give great descriptions of the brews.   I chose their flight which is $9 for 4 options. I chose mostly IPAs but not sure what the exact ones I tried but everything was so good and I've been several times after this they always have opportunities to grab a free glassware with purchase of beer of course!   The location is so convenient and I love their beer options. I will be going here any chance I get to get my IPA fix and to try some new options!

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: This location is fairly small. It is Located in a shopping center. Nice draft beer selection and canned beers. Want some food? you can order pizza from the place next door.  Small front patio with 4 picnic tables. We just want to check out this new location.    It's not close to home so I'll keep driving out to the Huebner location but if it's close to you and you are looking for a neighborhood bar stop by and check it out.

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Love their tap variety, they get some things that you can't find everywhere, and I love that! The people are friendly and knowledgeable and I appreciate their hospitably. Big Hops has my heart!!

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: Big Hops across SA are great but this one is our favorite.  Helpful staff, great beer - what could be better? Though the music tends to be a little loud to have conversation.  They have events most every day too - happy hour, trivia night, etc.  No food here but they are totally cool with bringing in food to enjoy with more than 30 seasonal taps.  Lots of TVs too and outdoor seating for those rare perfect SA days. Board games and cards too. Overall great place!

reviews.author: Monique R.
reviews.description: My friend and I decided to check out Big Hoops on Shanefield. Their location is quaint, and very welcoming. They have 4 other locations in San Antonio. I thought they been open for a while now, however this was their 3rd day of being open. As a celebratory post opening, we offer chocolate cake. Such a nice detail. We the only customers in there, but I bet once word gets out it will be very busy. Daniel and Maryla (?) were exceptional and great customer service!!! We will definitely be back because of them. I had a Austin Eastcider Blood Orange and my friend stuck to the IPA route.  Everything was reasonable priced, and in the future they are supposed weekly specials. Bring your growlers to get filled here. They also sell crowler's as well.

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: Quiet but great beer options if you are one of those loner beer drinkers such as I sometimes..but who isn't right..right? This is one of those places you can take an edition of the current and read it with a tall pint of beer. There beer options are endless, they have an app, they scroll across a TV, there is a TV. When I went I saw a dog competition, enjoyed my beer which was the SA Beer Weep 8 hop beer and talked to my boyfriend about how awesome this place was. Great service!

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: We love the selection they have. The atmosphere and concept are awesome as well. Unfortunately the female server is extremely rude and unwelcoming. I'm not really sure what her problem is but customer service is her job and she is seriously lacking. I'm not sure if it's cuz I had use my military ID (didn't have my license) or its because I am a female but wow. I've never had worse service than this in my entire life. Hopefully next time we come there is someone else because I honestly feel degraded.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: My favorite spot to come get a craft beer. Would love if they expanded their music taste to country music though.

reviews.author: Annabelle L.
reviews.description: They never fail to serve a great IPA, customer service is always great and the atmosphere is so welcoming. We've been here a handful of times and always get a good recommendation from their tap list and ALWAYS a good time.

reviews.author: Alicia T.
reviews.description: This is a great place to fill up growlers and go OR to hang out with friends. The offer a diverse selection of local craft beers. They even have a few ciders, meads, and fruit beers. Big Hops hosts events like Trivia Night, they welcome outside food. We love to grab a pizza from Stout's Pizza next door!  They have limited seating both inside and outside. The staff is patient and welcoming. Stop by for a cold brew or two; they have something for everyone!

reviews.author: K.C. L.
reviews.description: This is the best thing on this side Of town when it comes to beer. I personally love the location because it's right behind my apartment I can walk there. The staff is super chill and very knowledgeable on what they have on tap. I always get a warm greeting when I come in. Their beer/cider selection is pretty great. You can also download the app untappd and view their beer menu on the app so that way you're not holding up the line lol. All in all I freaking love big hops. They have a valued customer here!

reviews.author: Randy A.
reviews.description: What an awesome establishment! The beer selection is great. They have a good atmosphere with a few tables inside and out they also have a few games for you and your friends to enjoy well drinking some cold ones.   *** recommend this establishment ***

name: Yard House
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Sunday

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: For being a chain this place is great. It does get really really busy but the food and atmosphere is great. They have a TON of beers on tap 130+ to be exact. The food menu is massive too! Our server was awesome and gave us good recommendations. The only downfall was the wait and waiting area and at night if you sir far away by the windows it gets really cold. Other than that I can't really complain. Def worth trying.   JK's pro tip. CALL AHEAD on weekends!

reviews.author: Oscar R.
reviews.description: We've been here many many times both with the family and by ourselves  I'm gonna give it a quick rundown-  If you're here for the alcohol and entertainment live shows-this is your place, lots of TV's, lots of alcohol choices    The food has gone a little down hill for me, but if you're getting basic low end food that seems to always be good  But if your getting expensive steaks or seafood plates, which btw range from $18-$40, this is not the place for that, better off at other expensive eatery around the area.   Burgers are great, they discontinued their lamb burger, that's a BIG downer bummer for me  Nachos are awesome and very filling and they are not stingy   Salads are also very good here especially the kale ceasar salad I highly recommend it, this is a MUST   Kids meal range from cheese sliders, fish and chips, macaroni(I think it's the KRAFT box kind), personal pizzas and chicken strips   Jambalaya is a MUST(with penne pasta), the lunch half portion is huge I can only imagine the dinner portion   Pizzas are ok   Their version of chicken and waffles called Nashville chicken and pancakes is awwwwwesome that's a MUST along with their Nashville chicken burger   I'll still continue to come here because I've been here enough times to know what's good and what is not

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: This place is open late even though the mall is closed. It was a little difficult to find the entrance but once we found it, we were seated and service was quick.  All the food we had was delicious and portions were big.  It's a typical Yardhouse vibe. Dark atmosphere and a good place to catch a game and drink. I did hear that they are no longer doing happy hour food but not sure why.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Yard House is a casual bar/restaurant. It always has a good selection of beers on tap. They food is good too. I usually get the poke (sushi) nachos. I recommend Yard House for a good beer on tap, a relaxed and casual atmosphere, and some good food. I give it an 8/10 rating.

reviews.author: Shaquanda M.
reviews.description: Love this restaurant! The service was great.  The waitress was super patient with me as I didn't know what to order. I just went with some basic wings because I was being so indecisive. But they were no basic wings okay. Those wings were too good. Hot saucy and crispy at the same time, which is hard to accomplish. The blue cheese was good too.  I got sweet potato on the side with a maple syrup which was also very good. Will definitely be back for the wings very soon.

reviews.author: Aaron R.
reviews.description: The pizza was so good. Thin and packed with delicious condiments in every bite. Eight slices were enough for just me and the crushed peppers were the finishing touch. The tea absent from this picture was as good too. Flavor wise it was what I needed and wanted.  The service was so friendly and always making sure we had enough to drink. The waiting time was around 20 minutes on a busy weekend downtown but worth the wait. They had screens all around showing a sport's game. The sitting was comfortable and the noice level very reasonable.   I would definitely come again and keep on trying their different options and enjoying either the view you can get or just watch a game. I can say I recommend it hundred percent. Provecho!

reviews.author: Jillian P.
reviews.description: Epic location, epic draft beer selection.  Come for the beer and stay for the views! They have an epic selection of local beer on tap (see photo). We came for lunch and I had to sample some San Antonio brews.  Ended up trying the Honey Blonde ale and Nitro Pecan Porter. Both are worthy of repeating. For food, we started with Miguel's Queso (creamy with a kick, definitely cheese-forward). Then we shared a plate of vampire tacos and the chicken avocado sandwich.  The sandwich was just OK, but the tacos were excellent! Soft flour tortillas coated in cheese and fried to a crisp... What's not to love??!  Would come back after dark for views of the river walk.

reviews.author: Blake B.
reviews.description: I had a great time stopping by this yard house location for a quick bite and beer. As expected for a Friday night it was pretty loud and the bar was packed but it didn't take long for me to get seated for my party of 1. My server was awesome and he did great even after sharing it was his 3rd day on the job. He was attentive and made sure I was taken care of. To no surprise the gardein wings were amazing, that whiskey black pepper flavor is everything! The side salad was simple by made well and the beer selection can't be beat! It's a solid choice if you're wanting a dinner or lunch in the area and especially if you're looking for a place to catch a sporting event with all of their TVs!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: I started with Grand Patron Margarita and it's so good. (I've ordered a couple). We got the guac and chips app which was also really good - very fresh and had really good flavor. The chips it came with where perfect for dipping and perfectly salty. Our server Nick is super helpful and polite. When we asked about different entrees, he was knowledgeable and able to give us very descriptive details about different items. For dinner I ordered a Baja fish taco, Baja shrimp taco, and blackened shrimp taco - with fries. And he got the 8oz pepper crusted filet with the kale and romaine Caesar salad.  Everything we ordered was AMAZING. I especially loved both shrimp tacos. The steak was cooked perfectly and so delicious. We will definitely be back while in town. Kudos to Yard House for a job very well done!

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: I was recently in San Antonio and decided to try the Yard House restaurant near my hotel. I had never dined at a Yard House before. I wasn't certain what to order, but I wanted a big healthy salad and I ordered their large Cobb salad. (mixed greens, baby tomatoes, edamame, carrots, radish, egg, bleu cheese, corn, bacon, avocado, ranch) I was very surprised by the size of the salad and with the variety of items it consisted of. It was so good and I know that I took more than half of it home for a second meal. I'm definitely going back to Yard House to order this big salad again!

reviews.author: Jerome M.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of Yard House as I been to a couple just to watch the games and have a few beers. This one did not disappoint. Went straight to the bar and ordered a few beers and the Korean BBQ Cheesesteak. This was perfectly made. The meat was tender and tasty, perfect amount of cheese and the bread wasn't hard. I love cheesesteaks and this Korean version was awesome. I also had the fries and they were crispy and perfectly cut as they weren't too thin or too thick. Great meal, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: While visiting San Antonio for a convention, our hotel was located across from Yard House, which made it super convenient. We visited late on our first night, around 9pm, and it was still busy. I would assume people visiting the river walk keep this location consistently busy. We ended up sitting at the bar since it was only two of us and could skip the wait.   We order the Zoodle bowl with shrimp and the Steak Bowl. Both were very good! I was surprised how much I enjoyed the zoodles since it was my first time trying them. The price was a little steep, but there were quite a few shrimp to make up for it. Service was fairly consistent and we enjoyed our dinner!

reviews.author: JA V.
reviews.description: Came in for lunch on a Sunday. We were sat quickly. The waiter was great with suggestions. The food was really good. I ordered an old fashioned and it was good. The food came out quick and the payment process at the table ziosk was easy! Great place!

reviews.author: Jeanne D.
reviews.description: Great food, great atmosphere, great service! First time we have ever been here and definitely will come back again! We shared poke nachos and they were spectacular! Perfect balance of sweet and spicy without being too heavy. I wish I can make this at home!

reviews.author: Thomas T.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers! Happy hour specials on appetizers. Food menu has some really good choices also

reviews.author: Christina K.
reviews.description: I ordered the mac and cheese with the vegetarian 'Gardein' chicken. The mac and cheese itself was fine, but the 'Gardein' chicken was literally frozen in the center. This was especially disappointing because I had ordered it for takeout, so I didn't realize the issue until I was already home.

reviews.author: Andrea K.
reviews.description: Most of our food was okay but not outstanding. The salad was delicious! The location is convenient close to the riverwalk mall. They do have a huge selection of beer choices so I think that's where they must stand out. Service was good.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Where to begin... After walking on the River Walk mid day on Memorial Day, I was in the mood for a good chargrilled hamburger  I poked around in Yelp and found this promising looking place.  They were tucked away on an upper floor of Rivercenter Mall, a little pricey, and we had to wait a little to be seated, and a little for our food to be served. And by the way, not an exhorbitant amount of time. It was just busy.  But.... Oh. My. Gosh.  The burger was perfect, one of the best I've had in a while. The first bite had that just a bit of charred crunch and charred flavor, followed by melt in your mouth perfect burger. My wife got fries with hers that were fresh cut properly cooked.  The waiter read my mind by bringing me a two glass refill of my tea/lemonade.  Everything was great. Just a perfect experience. This is a sign of a great manager and staff. My favorite upscale burger place in the area

reviews.author: Steve P.
reviews.description: Stop by Sam antonio and found this spot.  Lobster crab and shrimp.  Mushroom and kale garlic noodles.  Taste like sweet Lo Mein.   Was interesting tasting.  What I wanted.  Something different.

reviews.author: Nigel D.
reviews.description: Very disappointed with our experience here at the Yard House.   Our server was all over it one minute then she would disappear and you wouldn't see her again for ages.  I ordered a second beer half way through my meal and didn't receive it until about 5 minutes after I finished my meal.     As for the food, our cheese curds appetizer was probably the highlight of the meal.  My wife has a Caesar Kale salad with Chicken and the Chicken Tortilla Soup. The chicken was very salty and the soup came out barely warm.   I ordered the fish and chips and the fish had been fried so long I honestly thought when they put it down in front of me I was being pranked.  It was almost the color of a brownie, but no it wasn't a prank!   The fish was a thick filet so thankfully once I touched the batter and it exploded into 10,000 pieces the fish inside was still somewhat edible.    When it came to paying our bill we used the machine on the end of the table but it turned out to be out of receipt paper.  We were traveling on business so had to have a receipt for expense purposes.  We ended up having to wait about 10 minutes for our server to appear and tell her what we needed.  She disappeared for 10 minutes then came back with the wrong receipt.   It took another 5 minutes for her to return with the correct receipt.  If you are coming here for classic rock.  Unless you consider Ah Ha - Take on me and  other similar 90's pop Classic Rock then you are probably going to be disappointed.

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: Some of the best beer in San Antonio! We absolutely love the atmosphere and is one of our favorite places to come after work. We always love to come on Wednesday nights for the $3 beer special if you buy their refillable glass. Employees are always friendly and willing to have a conversation. We will for sure be bringing our out of town friends here. I highly recommend to anyone in the Helotes/ San Antonio area.

reviews.author: Meilinn T.
reviews.description: The reason why I love this location more than their original is because of the quaintness of the place. It's small and theres a large patio where you can just chill out with your friends.   The Helotes' old town is amazing because the patio is shared by multiple businesses which means you can eat and drink whatever you want from the stores. You can't bring in outside drinks or food but the atmosphere is great. The ambiance is complete with outdoor lights--- which I, as many are, am a sucker for.   On Wednesdays, there is a person who is playing live. Due to COVID, the tables are separated 6 feet apart and no one is supposed to move the seats to keep everyone apart. If you haven't tried this location, I would definitely recommend it.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: With different beers on tap and a welcoming atmosphere, this place will be a success. It shares its patio with wine 101 and some other small businesses. On opening day, they had a good crowd, but the ordering went  smoothly. The bartender served while the cashier checked people out.   I tried the wine barrel beer. It was very smooth with a hint of oak. Definitely a little different, but very good.   For now, they only serve beer. If you want a snack, wine 101 has a good selection.   They have a small area with patio tables under the patio, but the common area also has some tables under the shade of the trees.   Street parking is available. It can be limited and you may have to walk a little depending on the day.

reviews.author: Tim B.
reviews.description: Casual outdoor beer garden with great beer in the heart of Old Town Helotes. No food at the brewery but plenty of choices steps away.

reviews.author: Charlene P.
reviews.description: Great service and my porter was awesome! I just wish they had an option for my gluten fee husband. Outdoor seating was beautiful. Thanks for the free sticker!!

reviews.author: Rich S.
reviews.description: Nice little annex of the brewery. Lots of outside area( shared with several other places). Inside small, seats maybe 16-20 people. Outside a couple picnic tables with a chicken now and then. I'll surely check out the main brewery.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love drinking Jefeweizen. Cute building among the other businesses. Friendly staff. Unfortunately have to sit outside due to COVID, but honestly what's new at this point. Nice outside environment with plenty of spread out tables.

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: We love this place. So glad Busted Sandal opened up a tasting room so close to us. There's good food selections from the cracked mug and Wine 101 and gelato also. Nice atmosphere. Kid friendly even though the first page of wine 101's menu would suggest otherwise (calm down ). The staff at all of the places there are super nice and work together. And sometimes there's random chickens walking around.

reviews.author: Marsha M.
reviews.description: This is a great spot to enjoy a good beer in the time of Covid.   There is a huge tree shaded courtyard where you can sit and enjoy a Fall afternoon.   However they do not serve food and the other businesses are really missing a great opportunity.  We went on Sunday afternoon and none were open.  We saw many people come and leave when they discovered The Cracked Mug was closed all Sunday and Wine 101 does not open its kitchen until 4:00.  Seems a huge missed opportunity for these businesses, as I said, at a time when people are looking for places they can go and enjoy a nice open air space.  We enjoyed our beer, and their beer is good, but left to get food elsewhere.

reviews.author: Madeline B.
reviews.description: This place is super good and has great beer! The staff is super fun and personable, and they're great at helping you find the perfect beer for you! I will definitely be back, and I highly recommend this place to any beer lover! Eric and Rachel took great care of us!

reviews.author: Mary Kate M.
reviews.description: The Modernist is definitely the best bar in the city. Each bartender is creative, kind, and knowledgeable. My friends and I have been coming here for at least three years; the laid back atmosphere (the indoor bar is essentially a living room) is the perfect atmosphere to enjoy a one-of-a-kind cocktail (or three) with friends. If you're abstaining, or have had a few too many, they make excellent non-alcoholic drinks as well. Heads up for first-timers: there's no menu, so be prepared to talk to your bartender about what you'd like and be open to trying new things--that's the best part! It's also handy to know that they don't accept parties that are larger than 6 to maintain the cozy vibe.

reviews.author: Rene M.
reviews.description: I've been here several times, and this is by far my favorite speakeasy! I came in with my spouse and a friend, and we had such a great time.  Every time i come here I always try something different which makes every experience very interesting. You basically just tell the bartender what you feel like drinking as far as flavors (sweet, fruity, botanical, warm, spicy, etc..) and they make a special drink just for you. It seems like they also have signature drinks that they make, Which I have to try soon.   Austin was our bartender and he took very great care of us. Every drink he made was perfection.   The prices are very fair, they make all their cocktails with high grade ingredients and still charge a pretty average price. I love this place and would recommend everyone to come.

reviews.author: Lorena M.
reviews.description: Recently visited this place on a cold night. They provided little blankets for us when we sat outside. Also had a few fire pits that's we could gather around to stay warm.   Craft cocktails were very good. They can make everything you can think of.  Smooth jazzy music was playing throughout the night. Cool vibes.

reviews.author: Alex G.
reviews.description: What a unique place to grab a drink! When I heard The Modernist was a literal house that has been transformed, I really had no idea what I was in store for. The outside of the building is so inconspicuous but the inside is so romantic! Truly a great date spot if you want something intimate. My one complaint is that the seating here is incredibly limited (because an actual small house) but at least it's easy enough to join a waitlist and get a text when there's space for you!

reviews.author: Amanda G.
reviews.description: Cool little hole in the wall bar, like everyone mentioned they don't have a menu and will make you a drink depending on your pallet. These bartenders are so talented!

reviews.author: Maegan B.
reviews.description: Great vibe! Amazing drinks, highly recommended white sangria, it smells and tastes like summer.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: So yes, I did walk past this place three to four times before calling my friend that night. The outside was completely unexpected just as the inside and interior of the place was. I enjoyed the ambiance and the romantic setting. The Old Fashions here are made to perfection - I loved watching the process. The bartender was very diligent in his work and also quiet which was a first for me. I may visit again to get the full experience of their worthy cocktails.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: A gem in San Antonio nearly the Pearl area. It was worth the wait to enter a warm and perfectly lit room to have a drink made to your tastes and with care. The noise level is just right and allows you to actually hear the person or people you're there with. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. I wish I lived in the city as I'd be a regular here!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: This is the speakeasy to go to in San Antonio. You can trust the bartender on their recommendations. They do a great job and provide excellent service. If you enjoy speakeasies, come check this spot out. David, the bartender will take care of you.

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: The modernist is so fun! I love the style and that it's in an old home. Very MadMen feel - mid-century modern. I've been here a few times all at different times of the week and day. After work for a cocktail is quiet. Thursday and Friday nights out with friends is lively! The bartenders are knowledgeable and make some awesome libations! Go here and have a great time! Don't forget to tip those bartenders either.

reviews.author: Cassandria A.
reviews.description: This was my first time at The Modernist and honestly I have no complaints. Everything was as expected and my date and I had a lovely evening. The ambiance was just right, right along with the flow of people coming in and out. It was warm and cozy inside and the staff was friendly and attentive. Our cocktails were great, we ended up staying for about 3 or 4 each. We will return

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved this place. You will completely miss it from the outside without looking at the address. Very cozy, mood lighting, and intimate. It'd be great for a date night. There is no menu. The manager David was the bartender and made some awesome concoctions. Will definitely be going again.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: A totally unique, amazing experience in San Antonio. Speakeasy vibe in what looks like a converted house on Grayson street- you'll know you're at the right place based off the mailbox. Walk into a dimly lit, intimate vibe. Feeling adventurous? Tell them your spirit of choice, and they'll ask you some follow up questions to make you a unique cocktail. Seriously such a fun experience. Want to stick to your favorite, tried and the cocktail? They'll make that for you too! Not drinking alcohol but don't want to miss out on the fun? They'll make non alcoholic drinks also. Really an amazing vibe and experience.

reviews.author: Kelsey R.
reviews.description: This bar does not look like a bar from the outside, but when you walk in, you will be pleasantly surprised. It looked like we were walking into someone's house! They make some very cool cocktails.  My boyfriend and I just walked up to the bartender and told them what kind of liquor we wanted and flavor profile. They concocted something for us based off what we said! It was very cool and a must go to while in SA!

reviews.author: Amanda E.
reviews.description: Lovely bar in an intimate setting. I love the retro vibes and the craft cocktails! Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Easily my favorite cocktail bar in SA. Moved from DC in 2020 (SA is my hometown) and this place can compete with anything there, easily!  Now here is the caveat, you have to have at least some idea of what flavors and liquors you may want in your drink as there is no menu.  If you don't, the bartenders (who are freaking awesome) will try to fill in the gaps with a series of questions to gauge your taste.  A great place for cocktail lovers and those new/getting to the cocktail scene!  I've never been disappointed with a drink I've had and hope you won't either! Cheers!

reviews.author: Brandy G.
reviews.description: This is, low-key, one of the best bars in San Antonio. Located in an unassuming, unlabeled home, you'll be greeted with dim lighting and a relaxed ambiance when you walk in. This place makes for a great date night spot to enjoy unique cocktails and cozy up on one of the couches in the space. There's also an outdoor lounge if hanging out outside surrounded by twinkling lights is more up your alley. :)  What I really love about this place are the bartenders. You won't find a drink menu at The Modernist. The bartenders are prepped and ready to make any drink or cocktail you could probably request, but what makes this place truly unique is if you tell the bartender what type of liquor or flavors you like in your drink they'll whip up a concoction on the spot for you. I've gone both routes and have never been disappointed.   Check them out during your next night out. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Yvette S.
reviews.description: Came here on a Tuesday night and ordered two drinks, was told they'd bring them outside for us. Drinks never came so we decided to leave. Not sure if they cater to their regulars or something but I definitely won't be returning..

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem in San Antonio!  It's where the locals drink.  Blink and you'll miss it but don't underestimate this place.   They won't sit parties larger than 6, so it's a great date night spot.  The mixologist is always on point.  Tell them what kind of drinks you like, sweet, spicy, etc. and they'll mix up a drink just for you.   We love hitting up the Modernist after dinner for an end cap!

reviews.author: Kiki M.
reviews.description: First and foremost, this place has awesome bartenders who truly care about the craft of concocting quality cocktails.   Initially, I wasn't sure if I arrived at the right place because it's almost disguised as a regular house. This makes it all the more of a cozy experience.   The bartender who served me was such a delight. He made me two delicious drinks that are in my top five favorite drinks of all time. He used smoked salt to complement my spicy vodka drink (nameless) which was such a great pairing. My second drink was a pisco sour which had the right amount of egg foam and a well balanced alcoholic portion. MAGICAL!   Overall I highly recommend coming here if you want an authentic bar experience without the noise from regular bars that just want to churn out mediocre drinks. Consider this place a little secret that you're in on. Also, free parking near downtown? You can't beat that. BRAVO MODERNIST!!!!!!!! You have my heart.

reviews.author: Amie W.
reviews.description: This place is a must have for all craft beer lovers.  There is a very diverse beer menu and a beer for even the pickiest of beer drinkers.  Every beer is so flavorful and unique and the staff is very knowledgeable on them all.  The new owners are great and I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Pretty neat little brewery that features sour beers. There isn't any indoor seating so it could be miserable on a hot day. Fortunately we visited in January and the weather was great.  The beers are pretty good. I would make a return trip.

reviews.author: Krysmrtn M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this gem waking around New Braunfels.   What a great place to visit!   The beer was great and the customer service was exceptional.  Thank you Michael for a great Sunday!  I highly recommend this place!   So charming.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Pretty decent establishment with a good variety of beers.  But as someone else mentioned, they specialize in sours.  They did have one Heffe when I was here today, but they said they are discontinuing it and only going to offer sours.  Sours are really not my taste, but to each his or her own.  I sampled a couple of the sours and they were ok, but again, just not my cup of tea, so I won't judge them on that.  Staff was very friendly, very knowledgeable about the different beer selections.  The clientele that we hung out with and spoke with were also very friendly and cool.  Bar area was kind of small but there is also a bit of seating back in the brewing area.  And yes, they do offer flights.

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: We stopped by here because our friends live here in town. We are from a micro brew and wine Mecca. And we were throughly impressed with all of the brews here!!! We tried all 8 beers they had on tap at the time of our visit! The blond one and Orono were some of our favs. But the pklfkr was different and good. I also really loved their shivas tears. In all I was throughly impressed. I would HIGHLY recommend this place!!!!!!

reviews.author: Ruby L.
reviews.description: I really liked this spot. It's small and cozy. It was super early when we went. They literally were opening their doors as we rolled in. We stayed for a good hour. The service was good. I see a lot of people complaining about their sours lol. That's literally all the serve! It is a brewery that specializes in sour beer. I personally like sours and ciders so for me it was great, but If you prefer IPAs then this might not be the spot for you.

reviews.author: Grix P.
reviews.description: Dear city of New Braunfels:  I hope you understand what you have here. New Braunfels brewing Co is in my opinion, one of the best breweries of Texas, definitely the best when it comes to sours (in my humble opinion).  I am gonna go ahead and sound like a pretentious douche, but my husband and I are huge fans of sours, and we have been to over 60 breweries around the country. This one is absolutely a keeper.  The brewery is ran by a family that lives in town, they do everything from cutting the fruit that goes into their beer, to brewing and marketing, so don't expect fanciness, a very small group of people runs the entire show. They are usually very good about updating their menu on facebook.   Remember, this brewery specializes in sours, you will not find the regular styles like Lagers, IPAs and Stouts and such. If you are looking for anything other than sours, please skip it instead of giving it a bad review.  The tap room may be tiny, but it's packed with awesomeness and flavor. The staff is super nice and knowledgeable, and they are always ready to help you and tell you all you need to know about sour beer.  This brewery is not a place to hang out for a long time with your friends, but more of a place for doing a quick tasting and take some bottles home. This is absolutely not a good place for large groups.  I recommend that you buy a flight, which is $8 for 4 small pours, that way you can taste different things. If you want to commit to just one, the prices are very reasonable.   My favorites are Saison de Nefle, Hell yeah! and PKL FKR.  We like their stuff so much that we bought a membership to their club, which is totally worth it.

reviews.author: Frances M.
reviews.description: Sour sour sour. This is place to go when you are not a wimp and willing to try some fantastic beer. Expect sour. Don't come here and taste the beer and make a fuss because you don't like sour beer. My favorite is PKLFKR. YUP. Pickles.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Do not do business with this company - I have no idea about their product but I leased them a piece of equipment and have had collection problems  - severe - lied to me - STAY AWAY

reviews.author: Ibrahim S.
reviews.description: everything is sour.. please think twice before you get anything  we got 2 flight ,it makes 8 different kind of beer  everything was sour

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Wheats and sours, that's it.  Two beers I never drink but NB Brewery specializes in them.  A small store front brewery in the heart of historic downtown. Very friendly staff were quite informative.  Only the second time I have tried a sour, first time at Jester King and I did not like. They gave me a free taste and off I went.  We quite liked the sours actually better than some of the wheats. We tasted 5 of the 8 taps and liked all but one.   The sours are like a double fermented beer inoculated with live bacteria and can be quite puckering. Some are barrel aged up to a year.  If you're in town I highly recommend stopping in. You can even wander around the small brewery on your own.  Oh btw, they will pour you a cup to go. New Braunfels allows open containers, drink up!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Sweet little brewery tucked into the downtown brewery. Really enthusiastic and knowledgable staff! They can tell you all about their brewery and their beer. Really small inside area, but a nice little beer garden out back. No food.   Also, importantly, if you don't like sour beers - I wouldn't make the trip. That is what they specialize in, and every beer on tap is some form of sour except one.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: We definitely hadn't planned to stop by New Braunfels Brewing Co on our last brewery tour, but while we were at Faust Brewing, the bartender let us know they were having an anniversary party. We decided to stop by and see what they had to offer.  It turned out that most of their beers leaned toward the sour end. Sours aren't necessarily my favorite, but I was intrigued by the pickle beer. (Not a fan.) However, they had some dark sours that were actually delicious! This was our third brewery of the day...so that may have influenced my taste buds, but no matter...I still enjoyed them. And the anniversary party was hopping and it seemed like a lot of people love this place.  We'd like to go back and check them out on a non-party day, just to see what they've got. Definitely on our list of places to go again!

reviews.author: Drew P.
reviews.description: We were just looking for a beer, but I love sours so it was a nice surprise that they specialize in sour beers. I had the Jose rosé gose after sampling a couple of others. Nothing was extremely sour, so this might be a good starting point for someone new to sour beers. Very knowledgeable, friendly staff.

reviews.author: Dallas P.
reviews.description: I like their beers, even the PKL FKR, but I'm not a fan of sours.   This tasting room is small, no food, but the location is good.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: I was sooo excited to taste these guys beer. Thier website promised some adventure in a cup. Ummmm DISAPPOINTED, is all I can say.   1. They don't change the website, but to quote the guy pouring, "nothing in life is a sure thing". I'm pretty sure the "on tap now" list is supposed to be a sure thing. Thanks for not only being a Dick, but for wasting my time.   2. All of the beer follows the ode if a little spice is perfect the whole bottle must make it better. Not good. I tried 6 of the 8 beers hoping for one I could finish. NOPE   First clue I should have just turned around was the bartender asking me if I was hungover.  (Nope, but thanks for telling me I look like s°~×  before saying welcome to our brewery)   NEVER AGAIN

reviews.author: Chiqui B.
reviews.description: We had an accidental run in with this brewery. We happened to spot it as we were getting out of our vehicle on our way to another place. The open sign was calling us, and for it being past 8:00, finding a brewery open that late is unique.  The tasting room is fairly small with a few bar stools and a bench in the brewing room. They  invited me to go in the brew room to take pictures.  These brewers are some of the nicest we've met so far. Great company and conversation. They even recommended some other local businesses, which I now have bookmarked.   The beer: they specialize in wheat beer. That's not typically the style of beer I enjoy, but I did find one called the "Hot Child"- a cucumber and jalapeño infused beer. We only had time to have one beer as their tasting room closes at 9:00. Currently their tasting room is open Thursday-Friday 5-9pm. I hope to see these guys at Wurstfest someday.

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: If you love sours, this place is for you. Six solid choices but #1 (Blondine) and # 6 (Fyre Dancer) were our favorites. Small inside but outdoor patio available. Did notice very clean bathrooms and Danielle was very friendly.  Recommended...

reviews.author: Marjorie C.
reviews.description: Laid back brewing place. Small bar inside but you can walk through the brewery and they have picnic tables in the back. You can order a flight of beers. They have variety of sour beers on tap. I really like their hefeweizen which is smooth and easy on the palate.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: This place was decorated really well and had a cool vibe. The inside area is small, the workers were really friendly. This place was mostly sours, but they had a good hefeweizen. I happen to like berlinerweiss' and the OLV FKD was delicious. The others weren't really my type of beer I like, but was a good setting to get a flight and try something new.

name: The Esquire Tavern
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Janet W.
reviews.description: Such a historic tavern! So glad it has been saved amidst the new large buildings going up around it. We enjoyed a delicious meal on the patio overlooking the Riverwalk. Our waitress Kamryn took great care of us! She is so personable and took a few moments to chat even though I know she was really busy. Everything was served promptly, exactly as ordered. Food was delicious, lots of interesting drink selections, local beers, and a great atmosphere. We will definitely go back!

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: Great bar atmosphere with friendly and talented bartenders - modified my drink with perfection! Took excellent care of us. Will be back when I'm here in May!

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: The food and drinks were outstanding! Our server, Hannah, did a wonderful making recommendations and providing friendly service! Unique atmosphere. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: Great service from Charles tonight. The drinks were super fun and the food was yummy.  Shrimp Wraps would be better as a salad and the red onion was a bit over powering but the shrimps were cooked perfect!  Cheeseburger was delish even without the bun

reviews.author: Evelyn D.
reviews.description: Was able to get last minute reservations here on a Saturday night, so very happy  The place is dark and loud so not easy for conversation.  We ordered wine which came quickly. Then ordered our food. Eventually the waitress showed up and tried to give us a salad with the wrong meat, a burger and another sandwich instead of soup, oops wrong table. And then took a long time for us to get our food out. I think they might have forgotten to place the order. Once the food showed up the salad with grilled chicken was very tasty. The Postale soup was delicious. And the bison burger was cooked perfectly. The side on the bison was a  GIARDINIERA which was a bit on the spicy side.

reviews.author: Sammy S.
reviews.description: The oldest, and probably the slowest bar in San Antonio. We caught a ROACH skittering on top of our table when we had finished eating...   Before that, we waited half an hour for our drinks before asking the server where they were; they had never put in the order so we waited longer. Once our table upstairs was ready, the new server and his assistant introduced themselves and then never came back to take our order. We waited 20 minutes while we saw him go back and forth by our table, completely ignoring us. At one point we went up to him to tell him we were ready to order... He told us we would get faster service ordering food at the bar. I don't get what the point is in having a server then?   I only give it two stars b/c the interior was pretty cool, but the service was probably the worst I've experienced in a long time. Food was so-so. Deviled eggs tasted off. Didn't cook the burger to preference. French fries were meh. Paid $15 for a piña colada that was probably only pineapple juice with crushed iced. I was surprised since this place had so many raving reviews.

reviews.author: Rod C.
reviews.description: If you're craving a unique old school setting with some character, then the Esquire tavern should be on your "must do" list.  Friendly mixologists, an extensive selection of spirits and did I mention the setting??  AWESOMENESS!  The vibe here is great, I usually stop in when catching a show at the Aztec or Majestic theatre.  If you're staying down town San Antonio or catching a nearby show swing on by and experience some tasty character!   Enjoy!!

reviews.author: Jim P.
reviews.description: Conveniently located in downtown San Antonio on the Riverwalk, The Esquire has a cozy old time atmosphere. I bellied up to the bar and noticed it is so long, it seems to go across the street! The menu is typical pub food and I opted for the fried seafood platter and my favorite beer, Shiner Bock.  The belly buster portions of tasty fish, prawns and delicious french fries  was more than I could handle and I hated to not clean my plate (There are starving people in China you know) leaving a lone piece of fish. I was admonished for wasting it by a guy down the bar when I threw in the towel. Lively atmosphere for a Wednesday night with some classic rock being played on the jukebox. Definitely want to return again as I would describe in one word "FUN"!

reviews.author: Anna S.
reviews.description: Our favorite place while visiting! Staff is great! This is easy and safe to walk to. Check them out!

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by for cocktails and a snack last month.  The drinks were tasty and strong, the food was great, and the atmosphere was awesome.  Dark and moody decor with loud rock playing.  We loved this place and we'll be back next time we make it to San Antonio.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: Thank god for actual good human beings that are left in this crazy world.   Long story short Leo saw me struggling with my two kids and literally stopped what he was doing to help me truly came on the other side of the bar and assisted me.   Little gestures like that will make a customers experience. With out going into detail thank you for what you did. I definitely recommend this spot simply because of my interaction with Leo

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Really neat, historic tavern on the Riverwalk.  We decided just to drop by for drinks.  I had a margarita.  Wooooo-weeeee!  They do not skimp on the alcohol here!!!  The drink was tiny, but I was really feeling it by the time I was done!  My husband had a beer and enjoyed it.  Service was good and the atmosphere was dark like an old saloon.  My husband enjoyed the taxidermy decor.

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: I wouldn't recommend coming here if it weren't for the burgers, seriously.   The prices are absurd.   I ordered an appetizer and didn't realized I have 'added on' all these items. It wasn't clearly listing all these items as 'add ons', but regardless, I walked out with a $100 bill totaled up with 4 drinks, two burgers, and an appetizer that's petite size.   It may have sound as if there's a lot of content here, but trust me, I'm still hungry.   The burgers though, cooked perfectly, the buns are so good, and the perfect amount of each and every ingredient.

reviews.author: Carissa B.
reviews.description: This is our favorite place to go when we visit downtown San Antonio. Drinks are amazing, food is delicious and the live music is incredible!

reviews.author: Jillian P.
reviews.description: 10 out of 10 for ambiance, food and overall experience!  This spot was recommended by a "foodie friend," so my expectations were already high. All that said, I was BLOWN away by the whole experience. We came on Repeal Day - a celebration of the day prohibition ended- and there was a live jazz band and a burlesque style performance.   It. Was. Epic.  I am honestly considering flying back to San Antonio next December just to experience their Repeal Day celebrations again!   Beyond the show, the food and drinks are also worthy of a repeat. The drinks were strong (I would expect nothing less from a previous speakeasy) and had fun names and creative concoctions.   We ordered the plantain chips to start, the brisket sandwich and pork snitzel, topped of with the fried apple pie for dessert. Everything was well prepared and delicious.   Already looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: Stopped by for dinner on  Sunday. It was relatively empty and we were happy about that. The ambience at this place is nice warm and cozy.  We ordered the Bexar Hug and Fancy CVS cocktails. For appetizers, we ordered chalupitas and chili salt fries. Really liked the chalupitas but the fries were okay. For main course, we ordered the jerk shrimp wraps and bison burger. Both these were really good. For the dessert, we ordered the fried apple pie. I am so glad we ordered this inspite of being very full. This was delicious and so flavorful. Not overly sweet but deliciousness in every bite.   This place is huge so there is ample seating. Recommend stopping by this place on the river walk for good food great ambience and good service.

reviews.author: JILL V.
reviews.description: THE MENU IN THE PHOTOS IS NOT WHAT THEY ARE USING. We were all prepared to order. We got to the restaurant and were advised that they were not using the menus that people have posted in the photo section. It appears they've taken the favorites out of each sub part and put that on one menu. Be very careful when you enter this restaurant. it is extremely dark. If you enter from the Riverwalk side you'll be faced with a set of stairs immediately. We ordered the steak and it was excellent. We sat outside on the balcony, which I would highly recommend. Interesting drinks offered. We did arrive for Happy Hour and got a couple $$ off apps.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Beautiful 1900s rustic like bar - this is mainly a review for the cocktails. We ordered an Old Fashion and a Long Island. The presentation was clean and flavors were bold. My bartender explained how he does not use much sugar if none at all in the Old Fashion and because of that it was a hit.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: After waiting 45 minutes for our food this is what we got. There were 7 of us and 5 ordered the Esquire burger. Here's what they looked like - wouldn't fill a slider bun. We're asked "pink or no pink" burger was so charred we couldn't eat them. The waitress was great and not her fault . She felt horrible about it. Just my opinion but there are dozens of places we have eaten at that are so much better around here!! Just a heads up!!

reviews.author: Tony A.
reviews.description: AWARENESS: Hungry walking around the River Walk in San Antonio, my wife and I happened upon The Esquire Tavern.  A nice, well maintained "old school" building with an outdoor patio area overlooking the river.  Nice!  NARRATIVE: The Esquire Tavern is an old school tavern.  They have an extensive beer, wine and spirits menu also a food menu guaranteed to satisfy the best frugal taste buds.  When I saw on the menu they offered a home made fried Bologna sandwich, I was done looking.  My sandwich came with a huge slice of fried Bologna, almost an half an inch thick.  Savory, rice and not greasy.  It was so good that before we headed back to home, I made it point to return and grab another sandwich.   SCENE: The Esquire Tavern is located on E. Commerce Street just off of S. Saint Marry's Street and the patio area of the restaurant overlooks the famous "River Walk."  RECOMMENDATION(S): San Antonio has so many great places to eat, its hard to recommended a few or just one.  I can say, the reason The Esquire Tavern stands out in my mind is that Bologna sandwich.  I will NEVER be able to think about San Antonio without thinking about it.

name: Bar 1919
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: I can't believe I have never reviewed 1919.  It was my first bar when I turned 21, and it is still a regular bar I come to.   Their craft drinks are amazing, and they used to have a bartender works towards the left side of the bar that I love the way he makes my cocktails, but the last few times I have visited, I couldn't find him.   Their house tequila shots are amazing; hence, anything that is made with the house tequilas are amazing as well. Our favorite and one of a kind would be the 'Bloody Mary'. Ask for house tequila with blue cheese. Trust me, it won't go wrong.

reviews.author: Adrienne M.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been here a few times and never had an issue with the 'door man' checking our IDs. We're both clearly over 30. But last night, we were hassled at the door by a smart mouthed employee and we won't EVER return. Too bad for you as my husband loves good bourbon and we've spent a good amount of $$$ here in the past.  I know it's hard to find good employees, but if they're running your customers off, it may be a good time to reassess their role.  Update - to Don M - we had our IDs and showed them to the guy. He didn't identify himself at first and just grabbed me while I was walking by.  My husband and I haven't been asked for our IDs when we've visited previously, so your explanation doesn't hold up.

reviews.author: Maryann N.
reviews.description: The sun was down, the moon was out - my husband and I embarked on our 6 stop journey for the night. First stop- Bar 1919. I've been here before with the girls and today I came with my husband - both times a flashlight was needed.   This bar gives me a little bit of gentlemen club vibes , bottle everywhere, very dim lighting, men bartenders dressed up, cigar cabinet.   Definitely a nice place for a small group of 2-3 to have amazingly crafted drinks and conversation. Not really a girls night out type of feel. It's a small place so the best seats are around the bar but I believe there are 2 couches for a more relaxed feel.   Our bartender was such a gentlemen and surprised us with our drinks because my husband and I didn't know what to order. We got the bluegrass and the righteous- both so delicately crafted with a skill - our bartender for sure had a bachelor's degree on this.  My insides exploded with each sip. So yummy. There really is a drink for everyone in this. I definitely recommend this bar.

reviews.author: Cindy R.
reviews.description: This amazing bar is hidden below a large building. We had a tough time finding it until a local helped us. The drink menu is the most extensive I've ever seen! Every detail was hand made and presented. It truly feels like your in an old bar feeling.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: The drinks and bartenders at this "speakeasy" are top notch.  Some of the best drinks I've ever had.  The decor of the place is fine.  Def leave the over priced crappy drinks at the river walk and come here.

reviews.author: Jocy C.
reviews.description: I really love having friends all over the place.  I was in San Antonio for Zumba but I found out a Yelp friend had just moved to San Antonio.  I went to meet up with him and he chose Bar 1919.  Bar 1919 is a speakeasy in the Blue Star Complex.  Parking is relatively easy to find in the plaza but the bar is hidden in the back of the plaza underground.  It took me a few minutes to find it.    I ordered 2 cocktails off their specials menu.  Both were delicious!    RUN to this place if you LOVE speakeasies and cocktails.  Definitely an experience.  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!

reviews.author: Kassie O.
reviews.description: What Can't I say???? This 20 minute or so... experience into this smoky kinda darkish mysterious bar was -Unreal- I did not know what to expect!!??? Service Was Superb Cocktails that'll blow your socks off! The Confidence of our bartender and his speed in -CRAFTING- our Cocktails was insanity! -SPOT ON PRECISION- "Infreakn'credible!" We WILL be RETURNING W/Company in tow!!!

reviews.author: Jando S.
reviews.description: 1919 has all the vibes that make a speakeasy great: excellent drinks, friendly bartenders, a relaxed ambiance, and in a location that is hidden just enough away from the hooplah that is reality. (#1) This is truly one of my favorite places in all of San Antonio.  First timers are more than likely going to get lost coming here. The signage is minimal at best and it's hard to see / hear anything that's going on. A key item is the illuminated "Joe's Jazz" sign above the basement level where the bar is located. Look beneath the street level railing and notice the blacked out windows. If one is lucky, they might even catch someone drinking along the limited outdoor seating, but inside is where all the action is. (#2)  The elongated bar, along with the ambient lights behind it, is magical in its own little way. It's easy to be impressed with the space and ventilation (#3), where there is seating on each end in the form of couches and tables. I personally think the bar is the best place to be.  It doesn't take a cocktail connoisseur to notice the bartenders are more like mixologists. Their crafty ways can whip up one hell of a drink and the kind that isn't just perfect for a photo op, but complex with its own liquor'y way. Whether it's a classic cocktail like a sazerac or an old fashioned, or one of their signature concoctions like the muthafuckah jones or pimm's cup, everyone is in for a treat. Personally, I like the to tell the bartender a spirit I'm feeling and just let him / her surprise me with something. It's worked quite well.  Whether it's a date night or a night cap, this is an excellent place to enjoy an adult beverage. Drinks are understandably in the $12-18 range and are certainly on the upper echelon of libations. Come alone or bring a friend and step into an oasis that only speakeasies like 1919 can provide. _____________ (#1) Or if to be taken literally, a very large parking lot. (#2) Not a poor choice of words, at all. (#3) Fancy cocktails and hot weather is not anyone's idea of a good time.

reviews.author: Dan C.
reviews.description: A true proper bar in San Antonio with an immense selection of spirits and truly delicious crafted cocktails. Really fell in love with the drinks and the service here, and Im looking forward to visit it again during my next trip to San Antonio this April.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Cool little speak easy under another business right by Blue Star. Good selection of drinks. Cool vibe. Would go again .

reviews.author: Peyton G.
reviews.description: Came here after watching a band play at the Blue Star Brewery next door. Ordered a 1919 Bloody Mary with the spicy tequila and It was so good it will be hard to drink amy mix based bloody mary again. It came with two mini pickles and an olive wrapped in blue cheese. The ambience was perfect and I will definitely be returning.

reviews.author: Julian G.
reviews.description: Johnny is a super bartender, extremely charismatic and knew just what to recommend. We loved him so much that we brought him a bite to eat; along with something for ourselves. Next time you're here, ask for Johnny.   - Julian and Faith

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a cocktail and relax on a couch with friends. It may take you a minute to figure out how to enter the establishment, but that's the fun of it. I love that it truly has a speakeasy vibe.   This time we decided to try a pour of Pappy Van Winkle  and a cocktail. First, for those that want to have a taste of pappy without breaking the bank, this is your place. They have reasonably priced options. I tried the righteous cocktail. It was perfect. Not too sweet. Great taste. They do offers plenty of cocktails and have a lot of liquor to choose from.      Right now, during the covid pandemic, they do have someone at the door checking your temperature and escorting your group to your seats.  Parking is shared and can be difficult.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: The term speakeasy doesn't really apply here. There are no illicit transactions taking place. No secrets. In fact, THE SECRET IS OUT. 1919 has over 400 reviews at the moment, which is a tad on the high side for anything [in San Antonio], and it's not hard to understand why. THIS PLACE IS EXCELLENT.  They have it all when it comes to booze. You could LITERALLY fill a moderately-priced above-ground pool with all the amber liquid they have on display. There are clear alcohols available too, but bartenders take much more pride(trust me) in the aged stuff that tends to fall on the visual spectrum somewhere between golden and brown.  Some reviews say they have over 1000 bottles. This is seeable and believable, but what's truly impressive within 1919: the bartenders have knowledge and details on all these obscure bottles AND they can steer you in some tasty directions.

reviews.author: Luis A.
reviews.description: Without a trace. That's all. That drink is delicious and tasty. The ambiance in this bar is unique chic.

reviews.author: Kevin T.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stumbled into this place on a whim on our last day in San Antonio, just trying to find something to do before our flight. It was completely empty when we arrived (given it was a Monday at like 4 PM) so we thought it might have been closed, but thankfully it was not.  When we saw that they had $5 happy hour cocktails, the gloves were off and the Asian glows were on. Unbeknownst to us, one of the best drinks we'll ever have was about to be made, and for only $5(!?) Five bucks in Chicago gets you no more than a shot of bottom shelf tequila at best!  All the other drinks we tried were excellent as well but I honestly can't remember which ones they were. But the Waterfall is one I definitely will not forget.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: A fantastic place to relax and have a cocktail. Yes...it's open. Go down the stairs and open the doors. The bartenders are knowledgeable and attentive. We tried 4 different cocktails and they were all tasty.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Bar 1919 is a gem of a place in San Antonio's craft cocktail scene!  The Mixologist and staff here know their stuff and always provide top notch service.  With over 1,600 bottles on their reinforced shelves, there is something to satisfy anyone's taste and introduce you to something new that becomes your new favorite cocktail (example Crimson Pearl for someone that doesn't like gin) I'm a bourbon and whiskey connoisseur so Bar 1919 is simply heaven for me! Plus they normally have $4 Jameson as a daily special which is a deal I'll take all day everyday.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
