reviews.description: This place is fantastic. Incredible drinks and I recommend challenging them to their "call your mom it's so good" cocktail. We had Jason and Spencer challenge each other to their "best drink" and it was fantastic. When visiting SA, this is a perfect place to drop in.

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: One of the best bars in the city. Speak easy with live jazz and world class bartenders, this is a MUST visit if visiting San Antonio, and a stomping ground for the natives.

reviews.author: Jai C.
reviews.description: Great way to find out about awesome restaurants and get some yummy eats!  Amazing how many businesses came together in order to offer different flavors and experiences under one roof.  Texas Pride, Maggianos, Magic Time Machine, Creole Kitchen, Outback Steakhouse, Drew's American Grill, and Nicha's just to name a few.  There was even a VIP section that served more of a full-on sample for those that paid the extra cash for their ticket.  They even had giveaways and a live band that kept the motion in full swing.  Everyone seemed to be very happy with the event.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: There were so many great restaurants representing!  They really thought everything out. Beer and wine were flowing from some prestigious wineries and breweries!  They had a giant big screen TV for the Cowboys game, which was really appreciated!  The live music was great, singing all kinds of Texas cover tunes. They rocked!  All kinds of great booths were present. It was awesome.

reviews.author: Patrick I.
reviews.description: A gem!  We found this oasis tucked back in the woods outside loop 1604 a few weekends ago and fell in love.  Beautifully lit Beer garden, live music, outdoor picnic tables and a covered patio. Large play area for the kids with a backyard / residential size "fort" and swing set. They had a dozen beers on tap and a couple wine slushees.  We really liked the hazy IPA and the Lucas Pilsner.  The peanut butter stout and the amber are also very good. They are only open two weekends a month, so check the website and plan to make some great memories!

reviews.author: Niki C.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden gem out in the country. When you drive down the road you wonder where you are going but when you live in the area you know. Bringing you live music and great beer on tap is always a plus when finishing out the work week. If you have kiddos and scared of babysitting there is even a play area and a dance floor to enjoy.

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: It was definitely a drive coming out here, but it was an easy drive, since there was not a lot of traffic. There were lots of beer options - ten of them! We got the mother board which is a sampler of all the beers. My SO and I got one mother board to share and sample all the beers. It was a lot of fun and we each had our favorites. There was lots of cute shaded outdoor space, and a patio with misters. There was a tiny table inside, as well, but it's mainly geared towards outdoor seating. There was a Mediterranean food truck on-site as well, we didn't check it out, but it's good to know there's a food option. We enjoyed coming out here and hope to be back!

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: This is such a unique brewery that is off the beaten path but well worth the drive. There is ample dirt parking and plenty of outdoor seating. There is a covered patio but limited seating. You'll also find a small 21+ seating area. Come with your friends or bring your whole family as they have a huge play area for the kids and ample space for them to roam around. They also have games for adults such as washers and corn hole.  The entire venue is clean and well maintained. In lieu of Covid masks are required indoors when ordering your beer, and they have hand sanitizer stations setup throughout.   My beverages of choice were the Reese's Stout and Hobanero. The Reese wasn't very peanut buttery but it was still a nice light smooth stout. The Hobanero was fun with an IPA touch and not as hot/spicy as I anticipated it to be. You also have the option to have it dressed and I highly recommend it. Besides beer they have wine and soft drinks available as well as light snacks. You can bring in outside food but they do have a food truck on-site. Check their website for information on live music and what food trucks will be there for your visit.   If you're visiting or live in the San Antonio area I highly recommend adding this brewery on your places to visit. Especially while the weather is so nice!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Cactus Land has been on our radar for a while but it seemed like every Time we tried to go they weren't open. Be sure to check their website before making the trek out here! I think they're usually open two weekends a month. It took us a good 45-50 minutes to get here from far west San Antonio. However! This place is awesome and you can make a day out of it and also hit up seersucker (gin/vodka) while you're in the area.   They offer beer flights and different sizes of each beer and have a good variety of beers. Our favorites were the Lucas and sienna ale. The staff was super friendly. The inside area is small with only a couple of tables. Outside area is covered and has fans. There is a large yard area and games. They have a stage for live music for the evenings. Great beer and a nice location once you get there!

reviews.author: Susanna S.
reviews.description: What a fun place! Great beer (the pancake beer is excellent if you like a porter), play area for the kids, yummy taco truck, and excellent service! The live music was good too! I highly recommend and will be back!

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Take the drive and give this place a chance.  It is pretty busy though.  Great views and great beer.  The band or musician is pretty good too.    Pros: price, quality of beer, food truck, music, customer service One con: too many kids running around

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Craft Breweries in Texas remind me of the stories of lore. Of settlers, prospectors who came here to seek their fortunes. Their only resource an entrepreneurial spirit that led them to certain success or ruin. Cactus Land Brewery in Adkins, Texas continues in that tradition with an absolutely charming place, a friendly vibe and with flavors as spacious this side of the Pecos.  Coming from San Antonio it's really not too far a drive from here. It's hidden in a labyrinth of small winding roads punctuated by tractors. I've experienced breweries in different settings: industrial areas, a college town, by the ocean. I must admit experiencing a brewery in the country is unique and a first for me. If you look across the way there is another property with horses.   I think I was initially struck by the sight of that, seeing a brewery in the middle of country land. It feels like by design the idea was to contrast the vibe of a brewery with the rugged terrain. For example their taproom is small but exquisitely decorated. The outdoor area is more vast with ample seating and tables. The balance between nature and the urban sensibilities of a brewery are simply yet beautifully stated. I can only imagine this place when the weather becomes cooler, in autumn.   Which brings me to all the important things. The aesthetics as I've alluded to are impeccable. I like that there's a visible board with all available taps: names, abv, pour sizes and prices. Above all the service was excellent. The principal owner, southern drawl and all was beyond friendly. I've been to breweries where staff motions for you to make a decision. Here the owner understands that you don't choose a beer, a beer chooses you.   As far as their offerings they have something for everyone's taste: gose's, ipa's, stouts and blondes. In addition they offer sampler sizes, flights and crowlers. I tried the "Reese" a peanut butter stout, "Texas Juice" a hazy ipa in vogue at the moment and " Eat your Breakfast" another stout with maple syrup. I think out of all of them I enjoyed the "Reese" the most. Drinking it reminded me of tearing into a package of peanut butter cups. I tend to think they understand that we attach memories to flavors. Thus beers are brewed with this in mind.  Cactus Land Brewery is a small place big on charm. The beers have flavors as big as a ten gallon hat, made better by excellent service. This taproom is a perfect escape especially from the hustle/bustle of the city. If you like trying out new breweries put this on your check off list.   ps. (Yes there's more!) I don't know why but I felt like any moment George Strait was gonna walk in and say, "Well excuse me but I think you got my chair."

reviews.author: Marcella M.
reviews.description: This is our local success story! The third anniversary and it is packed with people from San Antonio and surrounding areas. Cactus Land is brewing some of the best beer in the country and trust me, we've tried a lot!   Catch them the first and third weekend a month. Try their varieties of beer from Ale's to IPA's to Stout, there is something for everyone. This is another great example of a family run, family fun business that is catching the beer lovers attention! It's a true hidden gem. Hidden in the middle of nowhere for now but they are building on and I'm sure it will be noticed!

reviews.author: Viri R.
reviews.description: I was surprised to see a brewery in Adkins, Tx when looking to get a drink. My boyfriend and I decided to check it out since it had pretty good reviews.  The drive is very scenic and green which I enjoyed. We went on a Friday at 7 p.m. and it was a packed house. There was plenty of parking in the area. They had live music going when we got there and we were greeted with friendly faces all around. There was plenty of seating outside. We got to try samples and the person helping us was wonderful and made recommendations based on what our favorite beer was.  The prices were reasonable and we payed $17 dollars for a flight a 10 oz beer. I decided to go with their 10 oz snifter Salted Pilsner with Lucas in the rim. This would have to be one of best beers I have had from a brewery that I loved. My boyfriend got the flight of different beers and his favorite was the Oreo Stout that literally tasted like Oreos. It was delicious and I appreciated the fact that these are flavors you can't find anywhere else.  The environment is laid back and somewhere you can go to enjoy the sunset and hear some live music. I will totally be coming back to enjoy a beer on the weekend.

reviews.author: Priscilla T.
reviews.description: My husband and I wanted to check out this place for a while now but we weren't sure if it was kid friendly! Lucky for us we checked out the reviews before hand and saw that they are definitely kid friendly!  Not only was the LUCAS beer delicious the experience and vibe was so chill and relaxing. We got a root beer drink for my daughter, a flight for me and a pint for my husband and combined our bill was about 24$. For us that was such a great price for the enjoyment of the property and live music.  The land it sits on is beautiful and when we showed up they had grouchy mamas food truck!  There is picnic tables to sit on under a large beautiful tree  Or tables and chairs to sit on under a porch like area that has a fan going for the heat.  They also offer complementary cups for water.  Towards the side of that porch is where they have a playground for the kiddos with two sings and two slides!  They also have the land gated where your kids can run and play.  If you want to bring a ball for you child to play with it probably would be a good idea while enjoying your beer.  Overall I loved the atmosphere! We will def be back!one last thing! The staff was very friendly and helpful! It was our first time so they offered samples of the beer which was perfect for picking my drinks!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: A diamond in the rough! Ha kidding this place is a diamond sitting on a diamond piece of land! Gorgeous farm views engulfing this little brewery just a hop skip and a jump out of town. If you are looking for a little date night and listen to some music check the spot out.   Suggestions- Check the schedule since they are small still they aren't open all the time.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Dusten F.
reviews.description: Looking for something to do on the 1st or 3rd weekend of the month? Then head on over to CLB.   They're a small scale brewery who knows what they're doing. They are also one of the few breweries in the San Antonio area, in my opinion, that consistently puts out great beers. Whether you're in the mood for something light and calm or have a hankering for a bit of excitement for the old tastebuds...they wont't let you down. They always have a nice variety of styles on tap to choose from.  Check their website before going to see who will be playing on stage and what food truck will be serving up dishes.

reviews.author: Maricela M.
reviews.description: We LOVE Cactus Land! We've been coming since they opened and they have come a long way! We appreciate the atmosphere and the owners are so friendly. Great beer, great music, and a beautiful sunset! We are locals but the drive is worth it if you're coming from town.

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: So far my favorite IPA in the area. Loved that they had a true hazy and juicy IPA- both the Texas Juice and the Prodigal sun (think that's what it was called). The place itself is quaint, with plenty of outdoor space for kids/pets.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: Love that it is dog friendly and they have a nice grass area. They have a small stage for live music and a play ground for the kids. Loved the Grouchy Mamas food truck that was here. This was my first time so I'm not sure if that food truck is a regular or if they change them out from time to time but the grouchy mamas food truck was delicious. I'm not a beer drinker so I appreciated that they offered wine. The beers my boyfriend got were pretty good. His favorite was the lucas Pilsner. The only thing that I don't like is that they are only open rarely ever lol it has taken us a whole year and a half for us to come here when it worked with our schedules.

reviews.author: Anthony V.
reviews.description: Hidden gem  Nice little spot out in the country, plenty of seating, live music stage and a small playground for the kiddos. Had a couple of their beers and the cider. They have something for everyone including root beer.

reviews.author: Kristin T.
reviews.description: The environment, scenery, people and brew is amazing! We come here just about every chance we get. They're kid friendly, accommodating and have live music. The set-up is so perfect.   I bring friends from work (who don't mind the drive) and we all work by the airport!   ... I cant say enough. Definitely my favorite brewery in the SA area.

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Came out here with some buddies to try the craft brews. Wasn't sure what to expect because Cactus Land Brewing is basically in the middle of nowhere. The locations is small but very cool, there is a stage where two bands played while we were there. There is a covered patio and it was pet friendly. There were an assortment of beers available for purchase. As a group we had a little more than half the menu, there was a beer for every beer drinker. Give this local spot a try.

reviews.author: Kiley G.
reviews.description: Saw this pop up in a Facebook event invite and decided to give it a try and we are so glad we did! First off, we have a 3yo and I was so happy to see that this place is super family friendly. There's cornhole, a playground and plenty of grass to run around in. On top of that they do offer NA drinks so it was easy to keep our kiddo happy. We tried a lot of their beers and I have to say I enjoyed the majority of them. (I may be in love with Raspberry PopPop). They had a good little acoustic set going on and a very nice food truck. The whole thing was incredibly chill and we can't wait to go again but bring friends this time. LOVE!!!

name: The Friendly Spot
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Jose T.
reviews.description: Very cool outdoor spot. They have a ton of beers on tap from all over the country and more in a bottle. Plenty of outside seating with a cool rustic vibe. You order at the bar from a fairly limited mostly Mexican menu. They call you when it's ready. They have a cool slide for the kids and it's dog friendly. They had the nachos half price so we went with those. The steak were good but the chicken were very tasty. Both had some queso blanco, black beans a sauce.  My only issue is the food took forever and when we went to ask the guy said he got distracted and forgot to call us so the food was Luke warm. We were there for lunch but I'm sure at night it's much cooler

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Have you ever wondered where you can get an over priced dry burger AND tetanus? Head on down to The Friendly Spot and pull up a rusted chair presumably rescued from the wreck of the titanic! If you're tired of having kids, drop them off at DeathTrap Playland which is conveniently attached to the sitting area. A cargo net from the late 1980's and playground equipment assembled from leftover construction material by a blind person awaits your kids, also offering a parting gift of pin worms! If you're unsure what to do with your weekend and you hate your friends and family, make sure to make plans at The Friendly Spot and have some of the most unfriendly memories possibly!  Seriously, this place is a severe tetanus infection waiting to happen. Between the rusted chairs and the death-trap kids "play area" there is no safe place to sit or relax. As a healthcare professional, I cannot believe this abomination is allowed to stay open. Do NOT go here. STAY AWAY!!

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: Met up here with friends and family! It's a great spot if you have young kids and want to relax with some adult beverages.  Staff is friendly and helpful. Food is decent and the drinks are good.  It takes a long time to get your food order so be prepared to wait.  I had the cauliflower and chickpea tacos; they were flavorful with great textures.  The mahi majo tacos lacked seasoning.  The nachos were yummy and great for sharing.  Kids food was what you'd expect from a fast food place.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: This really is a friendly spot! Dined in with friends on a Friday during rush hour. The weather was absolutely beautiful. To top off our long week the service was great and drafts were refreshing!

reviews.author: Alisha C.
reviews.description: Worst service ever. Said food would take 30 minutes it's been nearly 2 hours and we still haven't gotten our food.

reviews.author: Diane H.
reviews.description: We loved this place for years, loved it a lot...but the last couple of years, the line to just get a beer pulled takes 30 mins no matter when you come. How hard is it to add one more beer puller? We are here on a Monday at 2. Literally 30 people in line, one bartender, back bar not open.  Bartender is now telling people not to order food. I get it's hard to find fast food employees, but there are good tips to be had here. I am quite sure they can hire bit of help at the taps. Feel bad for the bartender...not his fault. Just poor management...

reviews.author: Edmarie L.
reviews.description: Five stars for atmosphere. A great spot with something for the entire family, including your furry friends. The kids enjoyed the park while we enjoyed drinks and some bites. The food is standard bar food, but I will give them credit for their fries. The best hand cut fries I've had in San Antonio, well seasoned and crispy. The drinks were super tasty too, highly recommend the blood orange mule. Bonus, they had bomb pops for the kids. A perfect spot to spend a beautiful afternoon.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: The perfect meeting place for people who have pets, enjoy the outside and want to share a beverage with friends.  The Friendly Spot has been around for years and is the spot for a relaxed drink and meal. They have plenty of seating to meet friends for a drink before heading to explore South Town, or just hanging out.   Although, I did not have food this last visit, I was able to enjoy a sunny Sunday with friends after breakfast. They all ordered the Sangria, which looked pretty good, while I had the Watermelon GT. It wasn't crowded at all, which is a plus in these Covid times, and there was plenty of seating.  This is a good hangout to enjoy Summer evenings, or cooler Fall days. Its location is ideal, and their prices affordable. You can't go wrong as a start to your evening, or an early morning meeting.

reviews.author: Steve F.
reviews.description: I went on a Friday afternoon. The front was super busy which was cool. There was a huge back space that had plenty of seating. There was a bar in front and in back. Both had excellent servers.   The thing that set this bar off from others was the fact that it had so much to do. There was a slide, multiple projector screens for movies, foozeball, giant connect 4, etc.   The name was night a lie. Everyone there was super friendly. The house cocktails were super tasty. And at a decent price. I really enjoyed this place.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: This ice house has a ton of options when it comes to beer, and they have a few house drinks that looked delicious. It gets pretty busy on the weekends so the bar lines get longer, but the property is so big that you'll be able to find a seat without a problem. We'll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Idelia R.
reviews.description: I have had the pleasure of visiting The Friendly Spot a number of times, as it is a local San Antonio gem.  They have a great beer selection with both draft and cans/bottles available.  The selection ranges from the big name domestics and imports to the local craft beer Texas produces.  They do a great job of keeping the selection relevant with seasonal beers as well.  The food is pretty good.  I would compare it to any good local eatery.  The brisket nachos have a subtle smokey flavor and the Friendly burger is juicy and bursts with flavor on every bite.  Since they use quality ingredients, the Friendly burger can be a tad salty with the seasoning on the burger and the amazing slices of bacon that are used.  My favorite drink though would be the Wutang frozen beverage.  It goes down so easy and can be a pretty sneaky drink, so be careful, but you really cannot go wrong ordering it.  Whether you're from San Antonio, or just visiting, you really cannot go wrong stopping by this local gem.

reviews.author: Magda G.
reviews.description: Went yesterday.  Family friendly place.  The food was good. That white queso was delicious. However, the employee (with long beard) was very rude to us. He was taking our order and I kindly asked him for 2 frozen margaritas. He responded with "we don't have any frozen margaritas."  There's a frozen drink machine directly behind him so we asked "What's that frozen drink?"  In a very condescending tone, he rudely replied and said "Not a frozen Margarita!"  His response was rude and uncalled for.  He could have just answered the question.

reviews.author: Jeff Y.
reviews.description: Good place to set outside and have a PACKAGED beer. Lot of draft beer handles, but I never seen people buying it. Bet there is a lot of old beer in those lines.   Restroom are first come first serve. Typical of what you would expect in a beer dive. Ladies...you may want to have some of your own toilet paper with you.   Kids playground adds an unexpected twist.   I would stop in again.

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: First visit was enough for a lifetime.   Service was given begrudgingly.  For was over cooked.   We ordered Steak Nachos which turned out to be a processed meat.  The place had everything going for it;  nice outdoor atmosphere, great selection of beers.  But absolutely zero customer care.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: First time going and probably won't be back. A bug fell into my buddies beer and instead of getting him a new one the manager said "your outside buddy I don't know what to tell you. If I replaced everyones drink I wouldn't have a business." Then when we tried closing our tabs and the bartender told us "Yall can go to the end of the line like everybody else, or y'all can leave and we'll close it for you with a 20% tip." Just unnecessary comments and rude! Better off calling this place the unfriendly spot.

reviews.author: Zahkyia H.
reviews.description: Cool place to watch the game and hang out. All outdoor seating. Two bars. Cheap drinks. Cool staff. I really enjoyed the sangria. They disinfected each table after every customer.

reviews.author: Amanda J.
reviews.description: My first time here. Meeting some family friends. First time learning about and being at an ice house.  Was told it was an outdoor venue. Wasn't sure what to expect.  I was pleasantly surprised. I went on a Tuesday, nachos are 1/2 off.  Lots of seating. Old school seats that I loved! Food was okay.  I tried the ranch nachos and the fried cheese curds.  The sangria was .  That is a must!  This is a fun place to hang out and watch a game.   It is a place I'd go back to!  The atmosphere is FUN!

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: A local favorite in Southtown! Mostly outdoor seating, there is a few tables in the back that are inside.   There are 2 bars, a front bar and back bar. The back bar is almost always less people in line and they have more beers on tap. Your tab runs both front and back bars and you can order food at either as well.   They have a giant blow up screen and projector for all the big games and some TV's in the back as well.   Dog friendly.

reviews.author: Jackie B.
reviews.description: Friendly atmosphere as advertised. Cute decor. Good drinks. Family friendly. Dogs allowed. Fun place to go!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to hang out and enjoy drinks and food. It is also a great spot for pet owners. Parking is available along side residential homes.

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I love this place. Love the outdoors time, hot or cold. Plenty of fire pits to keep warm, nice to sit in the shade in this Texas heat, but I'm used to it. Not for everyone, but they have a place indoors to chill on hot summer days. I'd fire up the pit on a summer night, if they would let me.    They do change the beer menu quite a bit, but they do have there regular beers. Staff is friendly and helpful. Sorry, no beer flights, and I see why, you don't want to get something your not happy with, plus they will give you sample.  They have a kitchen, we've eaten her before, so I can only recommend what we have tried, the pretzels, the pizza, and the bratz.    Now they are about to open a coffee bar, can't wait for that.

reviews.author: Belinda L.
reviews.description: Oh my goodness. My friend Jenn went with my Hubby and I. We arrived during an event they were having. It's so open and spacious outside. The wrought iron seats are comfortable and there's a fire pit. The BEER selection, YUM-0. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Shelby K.
reviews.description: This place is so beautiful and relaxing!  Such friendly service in a family-oriented atmosphere. Their beers and food are DELICIOUS.  You can tell a lot of care is put into the ingredient selection and preparation.  ALSO: they serve the most incredible coffee here - yes, this is a coffee destination!  Their espresso is smooth and bold, and they offer specialty coffees with housemade syrups only - no fake oily stuff. Doesn't matter what you're in the mood for, this is a fantastic place to hang out with friends and family. You'll have a great time just like we did!

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: So what do you do if you are off the beaten tracks outside of SA.. roaming around from New Berlin to New Braunfels and looking for a bit more  action .. Yelp actually points me me that there is an actual brewery in middle of nowhere, just drive through some windy roads to get there.  Well that seems like a fun adventure on a Saturday afternoon.    Little did I know that this little brewery would be located in the middle of a preserve.  This is where hiking trails meets beers. No masks need rules just some friendly owners ready to talk beer and God's country.   Well let me back up a bit as the hiking part is not quite is not quite available aw of 2021.  But the owners of this wonderful property own all of the acres of this incredible property so maybe this may become the next latest and greatest thing since yoga and beer drinking came to be..  I loved everything about this place.  It was spread out so you could find a spot without being disturbed.  They had picnic tables to hang out under the trees, even rocking chairs for grandma. Totally open to all age groups from the kiddos to oldies but goodies.  Normally I'd not want what could be described as chaos in a normal brewery setting but with the beauty and spaciousness everyone seems to get along and make it work.  Kids and AA/NA 'rs are drinking the hibiscus tea while the majority are enjoying a freshly brewed beer.    Beers are a nice mix here. They have nice light options for the Texas heat like a 4.8% Pilsner kolsch Hefeweizen and orange juice infused pale.  Then they get more serious going to a stout w/marshmallow graham crackers and coco nibs and get all the way to a 9% imperial stout with blackstrap molasses that comes regular or bourbon barrel aged. Those only come in a 6 oz pour which was appreciative considering we all do need to sometime and head back to civilization...  I loved all of the beers especially the Pilsner as it was so refreshing in a hot day.  But even the darker beers were super smooth.  I also loved how they gave you taste tests before committing.     They even gave a bit of entertainment going on with a guitar player on the outdoor patio.  Kids were dancing and adults hanging out with their pets. Yep i didn't see anyone not having a fun time, especially when most people have been deprived so to say over the past year, cough cough:D  This was a great find for us venturers, and I wholeheartedly recommend you bring your friends and family to this wonderful scenic treasure.  Yes Beer does exist in God'scountry. Say Amen to that ..

reviews.author: Wilma K.
reviews.description: I give them 5 starts because the beers and food are always good. But they need to bring back manmosa beer.  I had the ham and cheese warm and delicious. My husband got the croissant panini, he said it was very good.

reviews.author: Sandra D.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a cold one, Goldenboy and Manmosa, very tasty.  There is a lot of shade, cold beer, and a kitchen too.

reviews.author: Jason H.
reviews.description: Awesome family owned joint.  Fresh and delicious beer.  This place is becoming the scene for families and those that enjoy a nice outdoor atmosphere.  Highly recommend you attend on the their events, should not be at all disappointed.  Only struggle they are having is they can't seem to keep pace with all their new fans (aka customers) and they sold out of chow my last visit.

reviews.author: Jill B.
reviews.description: After driving past twice figures it out! And we were so pleasantly surprised.  Great beer but even better food.  That kitchen!!  Wow!! The best chicken salad croissant I have ever had. Super nice staff.   My son finally got to relax in the rocking chairs on the porch. (Been. Stressful summer).  We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Julie J.
reviews.description: Great brewery with a real good chill ambiance. Has a wonderful large outdoor area with plenty of trees and perfect for kids to run around in. Beer and food was great too and they even have live music on some days.

reviews.author: Ben L.
reviews.description: Went for the first time this past Friday and loved it.  The beers were so good.  Some really interesting flavors! My 2 favorites were the Pina Jalapeño beer and the Brothers Keeper!  The pizza was nice too!  Spacious outdoor area with plenty of shade.  Definitely planning on going back.

reviews.author: Bryan G.
reviews.description: This is a first class family friendly brewery with some very unique beers.  They just get better and better with their improvements to the grounds and sitting areas.  They also have great food trucks which really rounds out a great time.  Highly suggest you visit if you haven't already.

reviews.author: Angela A.
reviews.description: Loved this brewery! Wonderful staff! Beautiful outdoor space. Delicious pizza and great beer. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: This place is a little hidden but I think that's what I like about it. Off the beaten path of 1863, snuggled in the countryside with abundant outdoor seating and space for dogs to play and kids to run. There is shade, which is nice but an inside area for those triple-digit days. There are outdoor fire pits for when the weather is actually enjoyable in Texas.  There is usually an on-site food truck on the weekends. The beer is very crafty and creative. My first 2 visits were very excellent. Recently, my trips have still been enjoyable but a bit disappointing. While I admire the creative side of their brews, I do not care for everything to be fruit-infused. I don't mine 1 beer being fruity, but when that is all there is to choose from (other than the Kolsch) it gets old, fast. When I first was visiting this brewery I loved their porters. I haven't seen them in months. I think I would frequent this place like i used to if there were more non-fruity options.  Other than that, I love how it's family-owned, a large, open space, and just a relaxing atmosphere. Hopefully some non-fruity porters or ambers show up soon so I can head back out.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: 5 STONES = 5 STARS!  A bit of the beaten path, BUT YOU MUST GO! One of the coolest breweries I have ever visited. Beautiful location, both the brewery and the gorgeous outdoor seating area.  Feels quintessentially central Texan. LOVE IT. It was made all the more enjoyable by the live music being played the night of my visit. This place would be worth going to if the beer wasn't very good....but that is FAR from the case. The beers are fantastic with a wide range of both familiar and eclectic styles. You can get 5oz pours of anything, enabling you to try quite a few without getting too tipsy. The customer service was friendly as can be. I will 100% be back next time I am in the area. Drink local!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: What a change from their previous location in Cibolo. They have a beautiful outdoor seating area that is kids friendly and a large selection of beer. I also like their brezel with the sauce.  They had a food truck on the premises when we were there. We definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: 5 Stones Brew produces some great Brews!! The staff is very kind and professional. The outdoor atmosphere and music is excellent as well as the food.

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: This brewery seems to just be getting started, but they're headed in the right direction.  I loved their beers! The facilities were clean and well-ventilated.  I was disappointed that they didn't have all sizes in stock of their merchandise, and they didn't have any to-do cans for sale either. Food trucks would also be a wise improvement, but perhaps they didn't have trucks on the day we came.

reviews.author: Chad L.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved this brewery when I visited just this past wed (11 Sep 19) amazing beer plus everyone was so friendly. Loved the story on how the brewery decided on their name! Can't wait to be a regular when I move to New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Colby M.
reviews.description: Nice brewery in start up mode.   Beautiful facility that looks brand new.   Beers here are really good. When we went they had a lot of fruit forward beers (manmosa, peach beer, dry-hopped manmosa)   There is plenty of outdoor seating. They also have chairs and tables inside.  I'm not sure if the address has been corrected, this place can be tough to find so keep your eyes peeled on approach.

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: Amazing beers and an open atmosphere. Food looked really good as well. Keep rocking guys!!

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: This is a very cool place with lots of beers!! First time here and made some friends too. The staff is friendly and great and very knowledgeable. We will make this one of our go to spots. Plenty of parking which I know is a worry as some breweries but don't worry they ha e lots of local brews too and with out the parking hassle since they are located in a huge shopping center. Do your self a favor and drop in by!!!

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: This was the 2nd Big Hops I've been to and while it's larger than the first there's something kind of lost when the space is 4X bigger. Sure, there's plenty of activities: (pool, video games) but there's something missing when there are that many more tables and more bar space.  Had I visited this location first I think I would rate it higher, but the Huebner location had a more cozy, local watering hole type vibe.   I liked the depth of beer on taps but it doesn't substitute having everyone in the place singing 'Happy Birthday' to the bartender; still a great, fun place but a little more distant and that makes a big difference when you're sipping beer in a new city.

reviews.author: Amanda V.
reviews.description: If you are one that enjoys a good craft beer at a not so crowded place, this should definitely be a place you try out. Its great for small and bigger crowds and most importantly for all walks of life. The staff is always very knowledgeable and super friendly. They have games, good music and TV's there to be able to watch your favorite team on game nights too. Its an awesome place to go just to meet up with a couple friends, lowkey date night, or even take a book or laptop to do some work/journaling while enjoying a tasteful beer of your choice. My favorite thing about Big Hops is the very calming neighborhood bar feel. Super glad this place is still up and running even during the mess of COVID.

reviews.author: Steve F.
reviews.description: Good environment. It was chill for a beer while we were running around. They have an extensive selection which I really appreciate. The service was very friendly and willing to offer samples. Happy hour 3-7 has a dollar off beer.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Nice place to stop in for a cold one on a hot day. Nice, but compared to a couple of other watering holes a small selection of beers, but then again larger than most. They offer a growler service which is cool.  I've never done that but I noticed a couple of folks brining empties in.  It's in a strip near Hobby Lobby on Bitters. Parking is plentiful.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: Your typical amazing Big Hops, on steroids. This is my first visit to the Bitters location and this place is super dope. I am calling it the flagship tap room.   This is one of the bigger locations, that I know of. They have a ton of craft beers on tap. The service is friendly as I come to know Big Hops to have. Not only friendly but knowledgeable.   This location has a pool table and arcade games. Lots of space to enjoy your party and the music. Big Hops does not serve food but there is plenty of food options around. They allow you to bring outside food in. If you don't want to bring food in they serve Rico's products for bar snacks.

reviews.author: John A.
reviews.description: Really happy this place survived COVID-19! Haven't been here in over a year. Still great environment and staff. I wish beer was colder but I can deal.

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Love this place.  Been twice.  Customer service is on point.  A little hard to find but Google maps will not steer you wrong: follow Google maps.  Great job everybody, keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This place is the bomb.com!  Like the other three locations, they are clean, the staff is friendly, VERY knowledgeable and PASSIONATE about their beer selection.  Plenty of local and out of state micro brews available here.  Don't expect to find any Bud or Miller products.  Mike served us today and after I ordered my beer, he said "if you like that one, you might like this one.  It's a bit different but..." and then he continued to describe the flavor of the beer and gave me a free sample.  I was really impressed by the interaction and the beer knowledge he had.  It looks like they have 33 beers on tap and they also have a good selection of canned beers.    A lot of their draft beers can't be found in local stores but fear not; you can purchase a growler from them (or bring your own) and bring it back for refills of whatever they have on tap.  Support this local business and get here fast - you will thank me for it later!  If this location isn't near you, find one of the other three locations.

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: Yep. Still awesome. This is such a great place that celebrates all walks of life. My friend invited me over to enjoy the Smash Bros tournament again, and it was a lot of fun. I didn't imbibe alcohol this time around, but everyone's beers looked delish.  The bar is still kept very clean, and everyone participating in the tournament shows great sportsmanship. There's a table closer to the door who also hangs out here week after week, and they spend hours drawing and making art. There's enough space to accommodate lots of groups of folks, even an outdoor patio for more legroom (though the interior itself is definitely roomy)  I'm not sure if this is a regular thing, but a food truck parked out back and provided some Asian eats for hungry gamers and artists alike. I love that with all the BH you can bring in food, as I brought my dinner from Chipotle earlier that evening.  Perhaps my most absolute favorite thing was a visit from a customer who had the most adorable, softest, plushiest shiba inu. omg. Best doge. (yes, dogs are allowed on the patio!)

reviews.author: John Q.
reviews.description: My team and I had a great experience at Big Hops.  The Bar tenders were patient and willing to talk / give you samples to try and the selection is great.  I really do enjoy saying, I like this type of beer, (they may or may not have it) and they go - OH - well if you like that, then you'll love this!  - I generally do love what they offer up!  It's always fun to go to places like that and try new things.  If I had one gripe it would be that they didn't serve food, but that's OK b/c if I remember correctly there are a couple of good choices in the area.  Definitely give Big Hops a try!

reviews.author: Wayne S.
reviews.description: Love this place selection is awesome always something new hard to beat a place that gives so many options and is always happy to see you.. gets a bit crowded when its not rona season but i do recommend this place

reviews.author: Jesus H.
reviews.description: Pretty awesome place to just go relax and have a beer! They seem to have awesome events (went to the May the 4th be with you event and got a beer with a souvenir cup for only $7.50!).  They have a really good variety of craft beer as well as games to keep you entertained. They have a patio outside and I believe they have a food truck on certain days. If you like to try different kinds of beer, this is definitely the place for you!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: This place is farther away from my normal spot, which is Big Hops on Huebner, but not by much. What draws me to the Huebner location is the proximity to my work and the ability to hide there whilst traffic does its thing outside with me not in it, but merrily sippin' IPAs instead.  But what draws me to the Bitters location is far more innate for me. Sure, they have much of the same beer and deals, but here they have SMASH BROS. If there's one thing I love in tandem with beer, it's video games, and especially THIS video game. I've been an avid player of Smash Brothers since its inception on the Nintendo 64. Needless to say, me and my brother have found a spot to be every Wednesday night from now until the sun consumes the earth.  For those not into video games, they always have sports up on the many TVs and they have things like: darts, pool, and even a LIBRARY for nerds! (me). The latter had me the most excited, because it's one of those DIY libraries where people just contribute willy-nilly and I think that's rad.  If you like beer (good beer), you owe it to yourself to check this place out!

reviews.author: Roy Q.
reviews.description: We made the mistake of trying to hit up Bucanero's for Mother's Day. While we shouldn't have waited for about 2.5 hours for a table to free up,  I suppose the best of things are always accidentally beget.   While we waited, we wandered into the plaza next door and jumped into Big Hops. We didn't expect much, as we knew nothing of this place, but we quickly fell in love!!  While I'm not the beer person, I was still able to enjoy their small selection of wine and cider. We absolutely loved the subtle geek culture everywhere and the inviting staff. On our next visits we were allowed to bring in the sandwiches we got at Fire Subs next door to get an alcoholic refreshment to go with it. This place offers a casual vibe that's perfect for meeting your amigos in a non-formal setting. They also have some board games you can play with on a shelf.   So if you're looking for a casual chat and beer, this place makes for a great rendezvous point!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: If you want a quick getaway with a couple crafts and growler fills check this place out. We've been a couple times and it's nice having the  variety of crafts on tap! Check the schedule for weekday activities!   Suggestions- They don't offer food with exception of pretzels so eat beforehand.Or ask if you can bring tacos from next door.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Maitina M.
reviews.description: Difficult to not but like this joint. It gots beer and a lot of it! 80% Texas beer.   Live music on Fridays. Fun games to grab and play with a group (jenga, dominoes, boggle, etc.). Super casual. Music too loud? Step outside. Chill place to hang out.

reviews.author: Johnny B.
reviews.description: Beer-to-go 6-pack prices from the cooler is not the same as any other taproom/growler fill station I've ever been to. Whereas they usually sell them for around the same price as anywhere else, even liquor stores, I drove across town for a 6-pack after finding it on Untappd. What usually goes for $15 for the 6-pack they wanted $42. Went down the st to a liquor store and got it for $15. It was just a mass produced IPA, not some bourbon barrel aged stouts.

reviews.author: Fawn G.
reviews.description: We stumbled into Big Hops on a quiet Saturday evening after a wild shopping spree at Hobby Lobby.   The place is pretty huge actually! Wall to wall chalkboard menus displayed their beer selection and the upcoming events. There's a back smoking section past the pool table. The place had quiet a few picnic tables and ample bar seats.   You can tell this establishment makes a major name for itself selling tshirts, stickers and growlers in several different sizes. We settled on the 64 oz growler which holds 4 pints I believe.   Service was a little off to me. The server kept asking what I wanted and what was I having, so when I said "I'll just have some water", I was a little surprised when she handed me a glass and said "serve yourself over there" and pointed to the water jug. She became super friendly after I told her I was on a detox though.   This place comes prepared with a board game library. We found boggle in the mix. I love that game to pieces so we played a few rounds before settling on a beer to fill the growler and headed home.   We'll definitely be rolling through to catch up on some of the local beers in the future.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: This place use to be New Orleans Bar. I always loved Big Hops, with their always endless selection of craft beers (not sure if that is good or bad for my liver, haha). The service is always top notch and the bartenders are knowledgeable.   They also have a outside patio which is great when weather is nice.   There are plenty tvs inside to catch a game. I was here watching the Warriors/Spurs G2 and they also had free pizza, which is great.   I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Dylan M.
reviews.description: Really cool bar with happy hour from 5-8 everyday! Even Saturday! Martini selection is top notch. All drinks made with their own craft liquor. Regular prices are really good compared to nearby bars.   Events every weekend. Comedy show every Saturday at 8pm. Welcoming to every group, right to left.

reviews.author: Beth G.
reviews.description: Came for their sip and shop on Sunday. They had an amazing cucumber watermelon lemonade. The venue is very cute and they have indoor and outdoor seating. Very nice bartenders. They have tabletop games you can play which you sip on your cocktail.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Stopped in for the Tamale Festival on Sunday, December 5, 2021.  Nice to see the area's new bars and restaurants that you can walk to from Alamo Beer.  We got a couple dozen tamales and order Gin drinks for the ladies and guys got the straight whiskey.  The gin drinks were priced at the craft drink price of $9.50, while the straight whiskey was $14.  Thought the whiskey was a little high in price, so next time I'll stick with a craft cocktail.  Liked the outside patio area as we sipped our drinks and ate spicy pork and been and cheese tamales.

reviews.author: Dara R.
reviews.description: A few weeks ago my friends at Variety's Brunch on wheels had a teacher appreciation brunch. As per usual we enjoyed some bar favorites. I bought a bottle of whisky to go. Cheers

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place to catch up with friends over drinks. They have whiskey and vodka. You can shoot them straight or grab yourself a cocktail. They have a good range of martinis to choose from. They also have beer available.   I had the old fashioned. It decided to keep it simple and do the traditional. It was not bad. It didn't come with the orange peel like I'm used to, but you could definitely taste the citrus.   They have inside and outside seating.   The night we went, they only had one bartender, so it did take a while to order and receive drinks.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I both lived in Las Vegas and have a special connection to a hotel called The Artisan. She also loves chandeliers, so when I saw there was a place called Artisan Distillery with chandeliers, I knew we would have to go on our vacation to San Antonio.  Because we were there midweek and it was Covid times, we were the only ones there except for the owner Nick. That was fine with me as I wasn't trying to pick up this stupid disease. Nick was very welcoming to us and our dog, and we promptly ordered happy hour drinks for herself and a dog cocktail. Yes, they have dog cocktails!  Nick was very hands-on in explaining his process and we end up getting two cocktails each because the first round were so good. Actually, my girlfriend wanted to have a third! But we hadn't even eaten dinner so we pay our bill after two rounds.  Nick said they're on the move soon so I imagine the space will be even better after that. But he was a great host and I would love to go back if I was ever in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Diem L.
reviews.description: Last review I wrote, we were visiting San Antonio.. now that we live in San Antonio, my boyfriend and I came back and we're so glad the drinks taste the same, maybe even better! Everything is fresh and as much as I hate strong drinks, these martinis are dangerous because they're so smooth.. be careful because they'll catch up to you! They have a new venue with lots of seating and a stage, we enjoyed the drag show that was put on that Friday night. Nick was there working the bar and he's just a great host as ever. So glad we're locals now and we get a chance to visit anytime we want!

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: New, larger location. Big outdoor patio area with stage and live music. Indoor bar and seating are with awesome. Drinks made using locally distilled flavored vodka, gin and whiskey. There's a room behind the bar with a stage and seating area that has live comedy shows on Saturday

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: The good:  Decent downtown location and parking isn't too tough in this area.    The vibe inside is chill, and it's a clean joint.  Comfy chairs and couches to lounge on, and they have a nice little patio.    The tour of the distillery is very informative.  The owner explains all the magic that goes into making the perfect vodka.  Unfortunately, the good ends there.  I'm not a liquor aficionado by any means, but every time drink "A" or drink "B" was ordered, it was an entirely different taste and even a different color (it just depends on who you order it from).  At one point, I ordered the Hillbilly Moonshine, and the bartender asked me where I saw that one.  I had to show the menu and the ingredients to him.  What???  The "consistent inconsistency" with the drinks causes them to lose 3 full stars.

reviews.author: Brian F.
reviews.description: Fantastic gem.  Came in right at opening and eavesdropped on a tour wrapping up.   Fantastic spirits.  Had the bourbon neat, wow!!!  Got a quick tour and bottle out own vodka bottles with a custom signature.  Awesome experience!!   Looking forward to going back.

reviews.author: Jewelisa B.
reviews.description: Came for a tour and was absolutely blown away by what I learned! We got to meet the owner Nick and he was such a nice guy and knows his stuff.  I won't lie I was a hard corn fan of Tito's Vodka till I got to try Texas Pride Vodka, no comparison at all! You can just taste the smoothies of Texas pride.  Also got to try the white chocolate martini  loved! Husband had the Spicy cucumber Martini he enjoyed it also. But what blew me away was the Chamoy shot  I will definitely eat coming back for that and the cherry bombs   Nice spot to enjoy some fantastic drinks and listen to music. Or just come here to pregame before heading out to the clubs.  Thank you so much Nick for the very informal tour! I can really tell you put you heart and soul into making that Vodka.

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: Such a fun spot added to the Broadway/Downtown area!   It might not look like it on the outside but you'll be whisked into a place that takes pride on their drinks as they are not only a bar but a full distillery.  The happy hour prices can't be beat and their drinks are so so good. You really have to take advantage of the back room for a fun mixer or event for friends/family. We did a white elephant exchange and the room was perfect.  You have to come check this place out. If you're heading there right now, have an extra martini for me please.

reviews.author: Jerry J.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the "tour" which is really just a chance to sit down with the owner and distiller and talk about how vodka and other spirits are made.  It was entertaining and informative.  At the end you get to sample some product and see how it is made.  Finally you can bottle and label your own bottle to take home for $12 which the master distiller will autograph for you.  Then you can hang out at the bar and drink.  They seem to have a local following at have delicious mixed drinks made with fresh fruit.  A very fun thing to do on an afternoon in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: I came here for an event (Drink and Click) and it was during Happy Hour. The place was full of photographers, models and equipment so of course no tours were given. However, it was nice to sit back and enjoy the scenery, the photographers at work, bartenders at work and models at work.  I found it kind of weird there were kids there but whatever. There is also a patio area where you can sit outside and it was a beautiful night.  I had a lemon drop martini and because it was happy hour it was only $5.00. It was the bartenders first day and he did a fantastic job!!! I like this place and would definitely come back if I were in the mood for some vodka.

reviews.author: Julie Ann I.
reviews.description: I just realized I failed to leave a review when we did a tour back in July 2017 for my birthday weekend. The tour with Nick was really fun, learned a lot about vodka. It's a small distillery but the atmosphere is good for cocktails and they have a section to have a private party with a crystal chandelier. They make unique cocktails made with their vodka made in-house a Texas vodka and a Spike one made with a cactus. The vodka's are smooth! You can buy bottles directly there and what's cool is that you can fill your bottle!   So happy we toured Artisan and will come back when we visit back.

reviews.author: Dan H.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a 6pm tour and Taste.  The owner/distiller gave us a good history and tour of the distillery.  Very informative and explained the process in a way that made it easy to understand.  Good taste samples.   Large menu of drinks and all day Happy Hour in Thursday with $5 drinks.   Very friendly and personable. Nice location in a good easy to find area.

reviews.author: Jamie S.
reviews.description: This was amazing! Nick gave a fantastic tour! I learned a few things and tasted some delicious spirits. The spirits were absolutely amazing. A definite must for locals or out of towners.

reviews.author: Vero U.
reviews.description: Was in the area with friends and we stumbled upon this place.  Stopped in for one drink, pickle martini and a twist on an old fashion.  We sat outside and ended up making new friends while playing Jenga, it turned out to be a pretty cool spot to have a drink.

reviews.author: TarynAshleigh M.
reviews.description: BEST SURPRISE DATE NIGHT EVER! I cannot day enough fantastic things about this place! Excellent quality drinks, SUPURB spirits, great service; Nick, the owner, is so knowledge and passionate about his craft which makes the experience that much better! If still available, do the distillery tour through Groupon, it will not disappoint!! We are so glad we stumble upon this gem, count on us to be regulars!

reviews.author: Kevin D.
reviews.description: The owner, Nick, was very knowledgeable with regards to his craft.  Being in the trades myself, conversing with someone who's an expert in their field is a pleasure. The experience was amazing. Drinks reasonably priced when on happy hour the tasting was great, let us taste everything we wanted. I appreciate a self employed business owner who takes pride in his work. I look forward to buying his products at Total Wine and coming back for another bottle of his Cask Strength whiskey! Great job Nick! Well be back.   Much love from Houston!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I admit that I was confused and thought the nearby restaurant was open for dinner, but we had walked here from our Airbnb and went with it. It's actually a really fun concept. The beer selection was great. We sat at the metal table section and just enjoyed the evening, there is a picnic table area also that was very cute. My son was happy as can be with a slice of cheese pizza. My husband and I ordered hot dogs, which were actually pretty good. We liked the sauce options. Another couple rolled up on bikes with a toddler. So if you feel weird about dragging your kid along, don't! The guy running the place was friendly and quickly served us. I imagine if you wanted to talk his face off about beers, he would welcome that. I just really enjoy a chill place with good beers!

reviews.author: Ryan F.
reviews.description: simple but good beer selection and delectable hot dogs. The aluminum chairs are uncomfortable, but the picnic tables are a good spot to hang and admire the cars parking valet across the street. Wednesday through Friday, I hope you like house music.

reviews.author: D P.
reviews.description: This place is great and has so much potential.  It's a novel idea but needs a little tweaking. It's a great place to gather with friends and comfortable outside dining . The problem is the dining... where is the food?  They only have pizza and often "run out".I noticed many people bringing their own food.  It's seems like this business would be way more lucrative if they could serve the many people wanting something to eat too.

reviews.author: Matt R.
reviews.description: Got there late around 9:30pm on the night I flew into town.  Wanted to check out a local watering spot for a drink and this place seemed like the perfect fit.  A stones throw away from the BnB I was staying at it was a bit tight inside of what seemed to be a former gas station.  There is seating outside but was cold about 45 degrees so opted for the cramped interior.  Had a really good selection craft beers where I enjoyed a Belgian Triple.  The place closed down around 10pm on this early off peak weekday so had to walk a few doors down to find an open kitchen for late dinner.

reviews.author: Lily L.
reviews.description: The Station Cafe is my FAVORITE lunch spot in Southtown.   Each sandwich is a treasure, but don't sleep on the soups and salads. I'm not in love with the pizza, but there's so many options that it's a minor roadblock.   My favorite meals: - Turkey Pesto Sandwich - Soup of the Day and Pesto Pasta Salad  The staff there is quick and friendly; what more could you ask for? Side note - their website is not regularly updated so the prices at the counter may be a tid bit more than what is listed.   TIP: Order ahead for pick-up. The line to order can be pretty lengthy, but if you have a take out order, you can skip ahead!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: The Filling Station Tap Room is like some brew gateway before you hit the main hubs like Blue Star or The Friendly Spot. Though small, it has lots of charm. Inside it fits the brew keep and no more than 6 people at any given time. There is a chalkboard that has the brews on tap, mostly and mainly IPA's. Along the walls are the remnants of tap handles of long gone kegs for example Sierra Nevada, Guadalupe Brewing Co., Firestone etc.                   The brew keep serves you your selection. Music from a college station radio cast is piping on the stereo. It's small and on a winter night after work, extremely cozy. But above all and I would be re missed if I did not overstate this, the brews are beyond El Cheapo! Some or most of these brews go for 7 bucks just down the road.. Here the beers typically range from 2 bucks to 6. That is so cool, especially in the bourgie King William District where you are charged just for looking at anything.            I do like this place but I do have a few issues with it.    1.) I don't get the whole plastic cup thing. I know you are getting a brew at a substantial discount but some of these brews are noble and sit and drink better in glass. Bud is meant for a plastic cup but not a Brooklyn Chocolate Stout! It deserves a better place than in some arbitrary Dixie cup to showcase it's masterpiece of flavor!   2). I noticed on their Facebook that they seldom update their brew selections. They should do this weekly. The Growler and The Friendly Spot do this regularly. Just one quick pic of their brew selections on the chalkboard, put it on their page and then vamonos. I know they have a twitter account now, which is helpful. They  typically get a crowd, from the looks of it bike riders that probably goes there on a daily basis. And buys on a whim. But what about your untypical patron? You have a great selection of brews why not showcase them?  3.)   The third issue, and I believe the most important is what really sets the brewpubs from places that just tap brew for you. The server served us our beer and did not say anything instead choosing to play with his phone. Places like The Busted Sandal and The Ten Eleven are hosts by proxy, and will talk your ear out about their brews or in most cases beer in general. I like that and as a rule of thumb most brew lovers appreciate that touch. A simple, "how's it going", "if you need anything let me know" or "what brings you here today" goes a long way. We don't have to be best friends. Just fake it. But acknowledge we are there and be on with your business.       Given these things I like this place. The brews are cheap. I like the intimate vibe, cozy space. And I definitely will be coming back. If you want an alternative to The Friendly Spot, whose brews can be pricey or just want to go to a place to chill check this place out. On cold winter nights they have wood burning outside at no extra charge...

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: This place doesn't have food. All they have is beer. This is misleading and a waste of time. Stopped by on a Saturday night looking for pizza and drink. The cafe serves food but only during the week. The bartender was a dick too. 3 stars for the beer selection.

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: A tiny little hipster place in SA TX!   This place is tiny, and they had a few seats inside, with a few outside as well.   The bartender was super friendly and welcoming. He explained what they had - mostly local or Texas-based beer, but other basics as well. AND, they did have cider.    Outside, it was a quiet area to sit and enjoy our beer and company.

reviews.author: Kelvin P.
reviews.description: I love IPA's and that is what they serve.  If they only served it in a real glass, they'd have my 5 1/2 stars.  Oh well, they'll just have to get 5.     I like how they note the alcohol content and IBU of each beer.

reviews.author: Flying T.
reviews.description: Dog hump review on Tap Room. 10+ quality verietals on tap. FOUR bar stools, but ample shaded patio space. Food next door in co-owned Station Cafe - cheap and good, deli type place,  has hot toasted sandwiches for $6. Plastic cups cuz seating is outdoors, and it's only the inside bartender working - nobody to take care of glassware... Only 4 stars cuz SoTex is too hot to have to sit outside (I'm Denverite, so YMMV).

reviews.author: Adrian M.
reviews.description: Fine place to catch a beer with several on tap. Nothing fancy here. Plastic cups, probably because most of the sitting is outside. Prices were very reasonable as two draws were under $10. We had the Kolsch and the Brown Ale. The Brown Ale was better.

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.description: A laid-back, beer loving and serving joint-- plenty on tap. The gas station-turned tap room has seating outside and is a true ode to old San Antonio. Good priced pints, and a decent pour to boot.  If you love hoppy beer, GO HERE.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stopped here on New Years Eve for a beer... First words out of the bartenders mouth is "I'm closing in two minutes" Ummm ok, so can I have a beer, or should I go?  After I ordered, two of the beers we wanted weren't available, but he couldn't be bothered to tell us, just didn't serve us those beers.  Oh, and the credit card machine is through a cellphone. So if there is a crowd forget trying to pay in anything but cash.   Piss Poor Business Practices. This place has such potential, but fails hard.

reviews.author: Cassio S.
reviews.description: If your north of downtown looking for a beer check out Attagirl. If you find yourself south of downtown then Filling station tap room is your best bet for dozens of beers taps on a constant rotation.   I also challenge someone to find a better price on craft beers on tap. Most beers pour for $4.50 and less. I'm not talking your old man's miller lite. I'm talking great big bold, high abv beers from some of America's best breweries.  Only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is because they are closed Sunday. What ever happened to Sunday funday?   Ps. Mainly outdoor seating, if the weather is not great find somewhere else.

reviews.author: Shawn C.
reviews.description: What's not to like. The owner has preserved a piece of history by converting an old Texaco Filling Station into draft brew house. The barkeep let me taste everything I was interested in. They have 4 or 5 seats inside, a covered patio area with tables, and a couple of tables in the old horseshoe driveway.  There's not much to say except this is a fantastic neighborhood concept blending and keeping history in the local community while invigorating the economy.  And a bigger plus... if you live nearby, you can walk or stagger instead of risking a DUI or causing injury to a pedestrian.  Also while there is technically no good at the Filling Station, the owner owns the Station Cafe next door.  Cons, you can't leave an open tab at the Filling Station and use the same credit card next door for food. Pros, you can bring your beer from the Filling Station into the Station Cafe.  Can't wait until I'm back in San Antonio... I will be back!

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: Love this little spot.  Awesome beer selection, great food from the station cafe out back, and overall a really really cool concept.  I'm so thankful to have this place within walking distance of my apartment.. Easy place to swing through for a cold one or 2... Or 5.  The two bartenders I've had so far are pretty friendly, but you have to tease the conversation out of them. Overall cool guys who seem to know what they're talking about in terms of the beer.  Another plus is that they play sports games on their tv outside.  Two suggestions:  extend your hours.  Both for the bar and for the food.  I think the demand is there to support it.  Next suggestion, maybe consider increasing the size of the TV.  The small one tucked up in the window is charming, but I feel a larger tv with better sound could attract a bigger crowd.  Very cool spot with great beers and a super chill vibe.  One of my favorite King William hang outs.  Will be a regular here for sure.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Stopped here for a quick drink while walking downtown. This is a cool little service station type watering hole that should be on any beer lovers list. They have only micro brews with quite a few Texas varieties.

reviews.author: Patrick S.
reviews.description: The Filing station is great buut when combined with the little restaurant owned by the same place next door it's awesome! Very low key hipsterish, lots of bicyclist and soccer fans (outside TV) .  This place has a tiny little indoor bar with a lot of great beer. They have an extensive outdoor seating area between the bar building and their sister restaurant which has some super affordable, super delicious food. The pizza is good, the sandwiches are grand. I have never had a bad sandwich but I have regretted when I didn't get something with aoli knowing that I could have enjoyed that deliciousness. Dog friendly. Big bonus for me is that they always have my favorite local (if Blanco counts as local) beer, Devil's Backbone, I don't think there should be a bar in SA that doesn't carry this delicious, reasonably priced gem.

reviews.author: Ali V.
reviews.description: Our favorite place when in San. WOW. the place is super hipster, super awesome, the whole area around the bar is fantastic as well. Many awesome music venues around there.  old gas station turned to a bar- EXCELLENT idea. Great bar selection as well, can't complain!

reviews.author: Jala C.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been wanting to try this place for awhile now but they are only open Monday - Friday.  We finally made it there on our Friday night date night after hearing they had tapped a keg of Real Ale Sisyphus that had been sitting over a year.  Um, Yes please!!!    We were delighted to find it was true and received our pour.  The place is very tiny but there is outdoor seating.  It was pretty packed when we got there and most outdoor seating was taken.  We stood off to the side and within a minute two guys waived us over and said we could sit with them -- cool people, yes!  We enjoyed our beers and made some new friends.     We heard the restaurant side is outstanding and makes some pretty good grub.  You can take the food over to the bar side and we saw some sandwiches/pizza that did look appetizing.   However, it was all about our Sisyphus on this night.  Thank you Filling Station for surprising us with one of our favorite beers out of no where!  That is some good beer management there!   We would be back more if they were open on weekends but we will get what we can take.  We definitely return.

name: Cured
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kristen P.
reviews.description: Imagine this: you walk inside a really cool old building and you are greeted by hanging cured meats and a friendly host. Would you stay? Of course you would. This is Cured and you came here for that exact thing.  And if you stay, you'll enjoy every minute of your time here. From delicious dishes to exceptional service, Cured does not miss.  All I wanted for my 34th birthday was charcuterie. Gimme some meat and cheese to ring in my next revolution around the sun, and I'll be happy (provided I don't get gout). I wasn't a fan of one of the meat options being offered on the charcuterie and both the server and chef were able to provide me with an alternative choice to replace the original meat.  The cheeses on the cheese plate were absolute perfection and when paired with the black pepper toast, divine.  Not only was the food out of this world but so were the drinks. Hands down, the best dirty martini I've had in a long time, if not ever. I also tried the Rose Quartz, a gin drink with cardamom, pineapple, lemon, and beets. It was very tough not to order 4 more of those.  We ordered the bread pudding for dessert and it was brought out with candles in celebration. When I say the service from each person working was top notch, I truly mean it. Everyone did everything they could to ensure that we were happy.  If you like cured meats, this is seriously the place to be. A fantastic lunch served by a fantastic group of people.

reviews.author: Jennine K.
reviews.description: Came for dinner for 3, with a reservation. There was a valentines duck tasting menu happening at the time, and the server said it would be enough for 3. She was right the servings sizes were huge! We also got the reseve charcuterie board, which was probably the best charcuterie I've had.  - whole duck breast with duck heart dirty rice - cured foie gras - duck egg creme brulee - reseve charcuterie plate: 9 month pork belly, 60 day salami, Spanish chorizo, chicken liver mousse, smoked duck ham, apple jalapeño pork rillettes - heritage hog poutine

reviews.author: Brooke N.
reviews.description: Review Edit: Cured's manager Winnie went out of her way to made it right with me! She was also incredibly professional and invited me to come back for a better experience. Apparently, my previous experience is not the norm so I gladly accept the invite and place to re-visit Cured in the near future. (Will further update review).  Bottom line up front: I can't believe they have the gall to charge what they do for disappointing and inedible dishes. DO NOT ORDER the charcuterie board.   Probably the ugliest bunless burger you'll ever see, and it is accompanied with really weird tasting and textured American cheese. For an upscale place like Cured where we paid over $100 for LUNCH, you'd think it would come with gourmet cheeses instead of standard cheap American cheese but I wanted to trust the chef and so I (regretfully) ordered it anyway. The patty was small and overcooked. To come with no fixings and no condiments other than ketchup, is bold and confident, however unfortunately so at a major disappoinment. The confidence lacks self awareness. Just like the charcuterie board. A handful pieces of decent, not mind blowing, meats . Of the two jams was extremely bitter and inedible, to include one of the two mustard seeds, and the ginger infused pickles. So 50% of the board meh and the other 50% down right bitter and unappetizing. I couldn't believe the price they were charging for that junk. My spouse got the lamb, which was fine but the snap peas were soooo oily and way over seasoned! We couldn't even finish it. And the polenta was straight up bland. What is going on here?!  Anyway, if I have anything positive to say it's that the service was great.

reviews.author: Swaz F.
reviews.description: We went here for the first time for Happy Hour so this review is for our Happy Hour Experience.    The drinks special were creative and delicious and only $5. We  ordered fried Quail legs from the Happy Hour menu which was crispy and well seasoned.  We also had charcuterie board as a starter and everything on the board were paired together for maximum tasting experience.  For dinner we had Sunday supper fried chicken dinner.  The chicken was moist, tender, and super tasty.  It came with grits, cornbread, and collards which made the meal a total southern comfort food experience.  Our server took great care of our party ensuring our drinks were refreshed and returned to check on us to make sure we had everything we needed.  Overall we enjoyed ourselves here while visiting from Charlotte NC.

reviews.author: Trish D.
reviews.description: Wow! What a wonderful find at the famous Pearl in San Antonio. Everything was hand crafted to a tasteful selection of cheeses, charcuteries, honey biscuits that melt in your mouth, and artisan cocktails. We had a brunch that will be remembered.

reviews.author: Philip B.
reviews.description: Just had a terrific dining experience at Cured! I'm really not sure what they could do to not earn 5 stars! We started with the reserve charcuterie plate. Among the favorites were pork butter, smoked duck ham, jalapeño pork rillettes, and 30 day bresaola. For an entree, we shared the 30 day dry aged ribeye. We ordered it medium and it was cooked to perfection.   After dinner (and with very little room left in my stomach) we order the bread pudding. It was delicious. I've had lots of bread pudding in my lifetime and this easily ranked towards the top of the list.   The service was wonderful and we made friends at the table next to us. The manager saw us having a good time and came by to pour our combined group a round of complimentary wine. That really helped solidify a wonderful experience.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: The Pearl is one of those great places with a variety of restaurants, shops, coffee spots and wine bars. Unfortunately, they are hit or miss. I guess the feeling is the area sells itself and, it does, but the food should decidedly be a part of that sell. This was the case for Cured.  I really wanted to like Cured.
