It was a different concept and had some interesting looking plates. The location, as mentioned, was outstanding and the restaurant itself had plenty of seating. But that was all it had to offer. The happy hour was minute, and they only offered quail legs as a HH food. These were .50c during happy hour, so the price was not bad at all, but that was the only happy hour food offering, which is quite meager for a HH menu.  As a meal, my friends and I shared the Cheese Plate for $30. This was already too pricey for a platter with only three cheese selections. We had to add their Foie Gras and Summer Sausage for $8.00 each to have some meats in the platter. At the waiter's recommendation, we included an order of four HH quail legs and two bottles of their punch special for $20 each.  Overall, service was pretty good. The waiter was attentive and kept the drink servings going, so the issue was never the service. But, other than location, that is all that Cured had to offer. The prices were too high and the food underwhelming. The pate was tasteless, and I was not impressed with the summer sausage. I did like the quail legs, but I wish they were meatier. Even the punch got cloyingly sweet after the first glass.  I know that charcuterie plates tend to be pricey, but with only three cheese selections, more cheese was needed, at least, more charcuterie board selections. Ultimately, I felt that Cured was not worth it and, quite frankly, there are too many places in the Pearl that can give them a run for their money.

reviews.author: William S.
reviews.description: They wife and I were going to go here for our 20 year anniversary but after reviewing the menu I just can't see paying $85 for a ribeye and I raise cattle or $75 for duck breast. If you got deep pockets, go for it. You might have great food but.

reviews.author: Frank J.
reviews.description: Disclaimer: I can only speak to the happy hour menu (which surprisingly also happens on saturdays!)  The patio punch is a rum-based drink with lemonade and blueberry flavoring and was delicious! The cost was $20 and could be shared well with 4 people. The drink wasn't overpowered with the taste of the rum and I'd definitely return for this drink again.  The quail legs were amazing. The meat was tender and the outside breading was very tasteful. The legs were topped with honey and rosemary and came at 50 cents a piece. They are an amazing light snack and I'd highly recommend you give them a try.

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: Super b-e-a-u-tiful space in the center of The Pearl District! We ordered the cheese plate which was a really generous size with 3 different cheeses, one for everyone! We also got the boudin empanadas which really tasted more like pulled pork instead of the Cajun flavor I'm used to. The bartender was great! We had a couple of drinks off the menu then I had her create something based on things I love. Would definitely visit again, especially to try the meat plate!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch on a Sunday. The ambiance is nice, as you are greeted with a display of smoked and cured meats. We opted for the cheese and meat board combo, which was presented beautifully to us. The accoutrements were lovely as well - pickles, mustard seed, honeycomb, savory and sweet jam, peppers. It came with toasted baguette slices. I loved the 3 cheeses, particularly the water buffalo. The 3 meats were good as well - fave was the duck rillette, which was smoked. The mussels in the tin were a bit underwhelming, as they were gritty. The menu does mark a section as "Tins" but it's written pretty small, so we were surprised when the tin arrived. The sides of bacon, grits, and cat head biscuits were good. I would say the bacon was the least impressive of the 3, and the biscuits the most impressive, as they were doused with butter and honey. Their welcoming amuse bouche was a great way to start the experience. Lovely ambiance, and there are areas where you can look through a glass floor and see plants or stones beneath. Service was kind and appropriately attentive.

reviews.author: Paula A.
reviews.description: They have a great happy hour that's appeal to locals with fried quail legs and I'll let you find out the rest yourself.  The mussels are delicious and the poutine which also useful leftover to spice up eggs or something like that from home.   The cocktails are special and they make really great ice cream sandwiches.  They also have meat which I'm not an expert on but I strongly recommend googling the menu and go give it a try.  It is also a nice atmosphere at historic Pearl and great outdoor seating pet friendly.

reviews.author: Reena J.
reviews.description: We came here with our kids; the staff were kind, attentive and the food was great. The building use to be a government building that was remodeled- definitely recommend coming here if you are in San Antonio.

reviews.author: J E.
reviews.description: While visiting The Pearl on a Sunday, during the farmers market we came here for brunch. We got here right as they opened, so it wasn't busy. We were quickly greeted and seated and enjoyed the view of the curing fridge as we entered. Our server was amazing... She was VERY friendly. Additionally, the GM kept stopping by to check on us. The menu is really nicely done, especially for brunch... So many great options too!! Their burger tasted amazing... so did the fried chicken and donuts! Cocktails were nicely done too! Overall, we loved our visit and would recommend it!!!

reviews.author: Jose Raul P.
reviews.description: I've been here several times and I have never been disappointed. Service is great! Staff is friendly! And the food tastes phenomenal! This place is the type of place that will encourage you to try things out of your comfort zone and you'll be glad you did.   The charcuterie boards are unmatched. They are authentic and not the trends we've seen lately. Wedge salad was good, blue cheese was a bit strong for my taste, but my date enjoyed it. The fried oyster sandwich is something I've never seen before, it was however delicious! Drinks are strong, so you'll get your moneys worth.   Great place to have dinner at the pearl, perfect for a date!

reviews.author: Martha M.
reviews.description: I love this happy hour! I believe it's 3-6 every day. They have quail legs for .50 only during happy hour and they are absolutely delicious. The staff is always friendly, they have a variety of beers and fabulous cocktails. The spot is open, light and inviting. Never a miss!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The ambiance of this place is great! I took my wife here for a nice celebratory dinner and it was a really cute spot at the pearl. We started off with a charcuterie board and two entrees. The charcuterie board was good but it wasn't really what I was expecting. Very fancy for sure but the different spreadable meats were kind of odd. I think I prefer a more standard charcuterie board with regular meats cheeses and crackers/bread. We got the burger and the BOT. Both were terrific. The burger was a little small but very tasty and fried oysters were very good! I really did enjoy the experience it just seemed a little pricey especially the charcuterie board and the kitchen seemed under staffed or something bc it took a long time to get the food. Our waitress was terrific so it was still a terrific experience.   Overall: 4.41 stars

reviews.author: Humberto A.
reviews.description: Besides this place serving excellent meals. This review will focus on one of their servers Brian who went up and beyond to make sure we had a memorable experience at Cured and while he was charming and knowledgeable about the menu and the charcuterie board pros and cons he always kept a smile on and made it feel more like we were at home not at a restaurant. Kudos for the excellent meal and please keep the customer service experience top notch because Brian sure is an asset to Cured. Cheers and let the good times roll

reviews.author: China D.
reviews.description: My friends and i came to Cured as an appetizer before our dinner reservation. The inside of this restaurant is super cool, they did a great job renovating this space. Excellent vibes for small group dinner or grabbing drinks for a date. The staff is very friendly and helpful at explaining the menu. We opted for some cocktails, although they have an excellent beer list too. We decided to try the two charcuterie boards, both the meat and cheese platter. Everything was excellent and it was fun for our group to try new things. Note that you can ask for additional bread free of charge :) We absolutely loved this place and the area is cool too. I'll definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: Perfect date night vibes or drinks with friends. Overall Cured has no faults but didn't hit me with any dishes that I needed to come back.  It's a very chic looking place though and you have a great area to walk around in afterwards.

name: Cullum's Attagirl
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Stephen L.
reviews.description: A twist on some classics with interesting combos for the adventurous. It's not just chicken wings... it's  chicken wings, perfectly seasoned, an insane crunch, a juicy inside and a mouthwatering second bite... it's not just a fried bologna sandwich... it's... well you get where I'm going with this! Food, drink, hangout, laugh, etc. they got it all! It was a fun chill spot for a Sunday Afternoon, empty spaces to sit but people were coming and going the entire time! Nice little hidden gem off the St. Mary's Strip area, definitely worth checking out!   Food: 10/10  Customer Service: 10/10  Beer Selection: 10/10  Jams: 10/10

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: Stopped by on Sunday.  Ordered 2 Nashville hot wings (count 2) Pimento, fried bologna sandwich  1 canned untitled art beer 1 Guadalupe stout   Price- $50+  with tip = $62, OUCH....   Yes the wings were "large" but they were (count them) 2 wings. The spice was over the top for my husband that really enjoys spicy hot food. So hot that there was no flavor. He couldn't eat the second one and that says a lot. My sandwich- was eh. White bread dried (like it had been sitting out) didn't help.  Place was not busy on Sunday afternoon.  Definitely not how I remember it.   Sticker shock for sure.

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Was in the St. Mary's area to hit another place on a Sunday afternoon, but it was closed.  There are a number of places in that area, and Callum's caught my eye in my Yelp search.  I'd heard enough about them through a FB group, so we decided to give them a try.  Man, what a good decision!  My wife ordered the San Antonio hot sandwich, and I got a large order of the boneless San Antonio hot.  I also ordered the cheese fries.  The heat of the chicken is no joke, but the flavours are fanTAStic.  And the portions are filling - my wife couldn't quite finish the sandwich, and I chose to take a good amount of the boneless home, since I knew that would travel better than the fries, so I finished the fries there.  It was a little pricey, but over-sizing my boneless order didn't help.  And again, everything was so good, and I've got some to eat later at home, so it all works out.  You have a number of choices in the St Mary's area, but you should make a point of hitting this place.

reviews.author: Stine S.
reviews.description: Fun place for Sunday brunch. We loved the San Antonio Hot chili oil, which we got a side of to try. Wes great for dipping fries in. I got the vegan-ish sandwich and partner got the chicken and waffles. Staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Rochelle R.
reviews.description: Definitely will be returning! Wings, fried bologna sandwich and Gucci ranch! Shut up and take my money!

reviews.author: Charlie G.
reviews.description: Best friend chicken sandwich in town and I love it on the potato bun. I get the spicy San Antonio sandwich

reviews.author: Nigel D.
reviews.description: Small dive restaurant with awesome atmosphere and a disco ball!  My wife had the PBandJ wings and Chicken Livers. I had the Honey Butter Chicken Biscuit with Crispy Fried Egg.   She said the wings were good and the livers were probably the best she had ever had.   My biscuit sandwich was good, the biscuit was great the, egg was great and the chicken was pretty good but not great.  We both said we would quite happily eat here again if we were in this area of town.

reviews.author: Christi J.
reviews.description: The reason for 3 stars is mainly the pricing. I think it's a bit much to pay ~$20 for 6 wings that were good... but not that good. If they changed their pricing, then this place is pretty decent and worth checking out. It's small inside but they do offer outdoor seating which is nice. You do order your food at the front and they bring your food out to you.   We had ordered Tyme fries, San Antonio hot wings, and their chicken sandwich. The fries were crispy and full of flavor. Wings were pretty spicy in my opinion so I didn't enjoy it very much; it was also on the oily side due to the spices. Their chicken sandwich was very tasty and cooked to perfection. Their Gucci ranch is pretty good (and I would get this if you're ordering their hot wings... you'll need it).   They don't have a private parking lot so it's mainly street parking which wasn't so bad since it wasn't super busy.

reviews.author: Deborah B.
reviews.description: Wow. What a creative menu! And so many beers on tap!   We sampled the deviled eggs (super chilled and super creamy, might have been a tad improved with some salt), the OG chicken (a stunningly good sammich) and the vegan chicken (a slab of fried gold -- tofu, that is). Both sammiches were slathered with neon sauce, which was some bright green poppyseed deliciousness. We ate outside at the white picnic tables and had a lovely alfresco dinner. There are many things left to try; we will be back!

reviews.author: Joey M.
reviews.description: Good god! I have been here plenty times and have been blown away every single time! The flavors, the atmosphere, the tap beers and mimosas....  When coming to Cullum's take a second to breathe before eating your food, take a moment to really enjoy that first bite Bcs those flavors and all around goodness of every meal there will start getting your taste buds jumpin

reviews.author: Angel S.
reviews.description: Lived up to the hype! Been on my list since day 1. Went with the Brown Bag Fried Chicken and the OG Chicken Sando.    No frills kind of spot. Just quirky, delicious and they do what they do very, very well.. Folks order up at the counter or order ahead and they bring the food out to you. There's a cute patio dining area and more places to sit inside.   The chicken itself is remarkable and the sandwich was perfectly done. The balance of crunch and juice was perfect. It was maybe the messiest, most crunchiest, 5 mins I've had this year. The fried egg was clutch!   We chose the Garlic and Thyme for the Brown Bag Fried Chicken and Fries   Was hoping for more chicken but what we had was actually some of THE best fried chicken we've ever had.    GET YOUR HANDS ON THIS CHICKEN!   Been here before? What did you get?

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: I love the outside patio and the colors and vibe. It's a order at the front and sit down place. They have a great selection of beers and drinks.   We got the Girls Thyme Fries, bologna sandwich, and the wings. The fries were so good and crispy, great flavor! I'd get an order for each person because the large was still a little small for 2. The wings are spicy!! Very good but prepared for spicy. Ranch sauce is a must with fries or wings. The bologna sandwich was good but wish the bread was different or toasty.   Overall, it's a good spot and a nice place for a bit to east anytime but night is the best vibe.

reviews.author: Kathryn '.
reviews.description: $85 for wings and Frito pie in a bag. Wings were over cooked. Truffle fries were the only good thing we ordered.

reviews.author: Dorie B.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times and have mixed reviews as a result. The first time was great but my most recent experience was not so much. I had the same thing both times, the OG chicken sandwich. The most recent time the chicken was fried so long it was tough. This made it hard to eat as a sandwich. I finally submitted and tried to use the spork they gave me but that was worse. It would bend each time I tried to stab the chicken. We wanted to sit outside because it was a nice day but the flies were literally swarming us. It was a constant struggle to keep them away. I know this is a natural consequence to sitting outside but there was also a large trash can in the immediate area that wasn't helping the situation.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Even if parking can be challenging, everyone must make an occasional pilgrimage to Attagirl. Some of the best Chicken and Waffles in San Antonio are to be had here. They have an ever revolving beer selection, in good taste. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Mari A.
reviews.description: Delicious chicken, very crispy and full of flavors.  Seating is limited indoors as well as outdoors. NO ice for beverages and NO kids menu. NO parking lot,  you have to park in front of people's houses. Service mediocre. Digital menu.

reviews.author: Bryan S.
reviews.description: Hey Cullum?! Attagirl!!! Initial thoughts when approaching this establishment was, "okay... I think we're at the wrong place." I couldn't be any more wrong. I was in fact at my destination of choice! I decided to go with a safe bet; the OG chicken. I mean, if it's not broken, don't fix it! I'm happy to report there's nothing to fix here. Besides a little too much coleslaw, the sandwich was crafted to perfection! Juice, crispy, etc. The good food along side the good beer ensures you're gonna have an immaculate time when feasting at this hidden gem!

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: Top notch chicken spot in the Monte Vista/Tobin Hill area. I had the Hot San Antonio Chicken Sandwich and it lit me up. Like jumping into the deep end and remembering you can't swim style...in over my head! Like I don't really remember anything 10 minutes before or after I ate it type of hot! I don't blame Cullum's or the sandwich, I blame my wimpy-ass mouth for failing me! Lots of foods say they are hot and I never even give it a second thought, but this one is pretty damn spicy...GOOD but you are gonna feel it for a bit.  The Buffalo Chicken is more for people with sensitive to extreme heat...like me, sadly. It is really good. I got a bite of one just as my tongue came back to life after the San Antonio Hot and it was about as tasty a chicken sammich as you're gonna find. Look at the pic! The damn thing is beautiful!  Get over there an check them out for anything chicken.  See more on IG @cheatday_SA

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Yum, yum. Outstanding food paired with a large craft beer selection. Don't look for a sign- they know they don't have one. This is not fast food. Sit back with a craft and enjoy the wait. It's worth it.  Nashville hot chicken is ligit and very spicy. The spice is from the frying oil and the seasoning - the true way. Most try to make it spicy with a sauce- not here. The freshly cut fries with thyme and garlic are enough to make you come here.  RIP Jim.

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: Atta YES! I love this place. They are known for their chicken and have a tiny menu, but they have one veganish entree. It's called the vegan-ish job and it is AWESOME. It's fried tofu on a bun, and it is straight up delicious. I think the bun has honey on it, so it's not really vegan, hence the name. And the last time we were here, my bf added a fried egg to his veganish job, which made it even less vegan, but it was a very nice addition. I do recommend that combo. All the sides we have tried here have been winners as well - disco fries, creamed corn, and their gucci goat salad. Yummy! They also have a nice little variety of craft beers on tap. And the workers are very friendly. But the best part of this place is the veganish job. I don't often advocate for places with only one vegetarian option, but this one is too good to pass up. It's a small spot with indoor and outdoor seating, but totally worth the stop. And they know that they don't have a sign. Come in and grab a sandwich and beer and have a great food experience.

reviews.author: Rich H.
reviews.description: This place is AWESOME! Great happy hour. They have great craft beer selection to go along with their full bar. They serve food so you are welcome to bring something in or have it delivered. They do provide food on Sunday during football season. Oh ya......THE BAR STAFF ROCKS!!

reviews.author: Laiah L.
reviews.description: Moved here 2 years ago and Stout House Bandera was the first bar my father and I ventured out to and instantly fell in love! We knew in that moment we would be regulars here. The atmosphere is very chill and neighborly. The bartenders are absolutely amazing. There are 2 pool tables and they also have 2 dart boards which I love to play. A great selection of beer, booze, and seltzers ( you can also find yourself a good ol' shot of Malort here) It's a great place to bring friends and family if your looking to have a few drinks, play some games, have awesome conversations, and meet great people. If you like to watch sport and have a brewski they are always playing all the games and if you don't see yours just ask! They have been very accommodating when ever we ask for the Cubs or Bears game  Love this bar

reviews.author: Monica L.
reviews.description: This is a very casual friendly neighborhood bar type of place.  They have seating outside and plenty of seating inside.  They have 2 quarter pool tables that you can hang out and enjoy a friendly game.  The bartender was so helpful when I didn't know what I wanted to drink and her recommendation of Deep Eddy Lemon and cranberry juice is a new favorite now!  She was the only one working, but no one went without a drink and she had a friendly smile for everyone.

reviews.author: Stephen C.
reviews.description: Nice casual hang type of atmosphere. Music not too loud, drinks taste great. They have a really nice selection of mixed drinks that are catered to ladies AND men. Excellent service from waitstaff and bar staff. Will come back many times, it's a gem.

reviews.author: Tricia G.
reviews.description: Lele took great care of us and let me tell you the beer selection is amazing, especially if you don't drink the typical Mich Ultra and Bud Light. I mean they have it but the also have some great crafts as well. The shot selection is awesome. Lele suggested a root beer shot that surprised us! Go check it out, I loved the atmosphere!

reviews.author: Joe S.
reviews.description: Was there on a Saturday, and Nadia was probably the best bartender I've had in a while! Great beer selection, offered a wide variety of shots for us, and was very attentive to all the guests at the bar! Will definitely be back!! Thanks Nadia!! Too bad your cowboys lost yesterday!! Go Bucs!!!

reviews.author: Cathey O.
reviews.description: Absolutely love our neighborhood area bar!  We always have such a great time...great selection of beers, cocktails and wine.  They are taking the Covid situation very serious, and are maintaining a clean, yet still fun environment.  We had an amazing time this last visit, but had a slight computer glitch at the end of the night effecting our bill.  Tricia (the GM) contacted me back right away, and was super helpful!  Thanks to her amazing attention to customer service, we will continue being loyal customers!

reviews.author: Roger M.
reviews.description: The Stout House is one of the best bars I have ever been too off of Bandera and the 151. Great staff with minimum wait times while ordering drinks. The Stout House bar has many craft brews to choose from with an amazing selections of coctails. If you don't know what to drink ask one of the bartenders to make something that fit your sweet or sour pallet. The staff is friendly, approachable with an amazing "Bloody Marry Bar" on Sundays. It's clean, well kept, and you can play pool or darts at your leisure. They are always throwing different events throughout the weekday. If you are looking for a good time; come out and visit the Stout House in Helotes, you will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: I have sort of followed this place off yelp since it first opened but never actually made it out because of the reviews. We were invited out so we gave it a shot.   First you walk in and the first thing that hits you is the smell of old stale beer Oh you know the smell- it's that sour, no one has cleaned the bar mats correctly kinda smell. Then your eyes adjust and you are like hmmm,  for a place that is fairly new and in the outskirts of Helotes this place is really run down. Not like shabby cool- just like cardboard boxes on top of an open area., close to the ceiling - may be a fire hazard - but more like scary walk to the restroom kinda place. I actually saw a staff member clean the wood top table with Fabuloso and the stench permeated for some time- just what  I want when trying l to enjoy a drink...... when you look around you see the obligatory beer signs but then you also note that there are a bunch of advertisements for upcoming events. Like too too many that it makes the walls look littered.   With the word "stout" in the name of the place one expects to have lots of different kinds of microbrews. Sure they have one descheutes stout and one elisyan and maybe 2-3  but other taps are your big corp, beer (bud, Miller, etc).  They do have full bar options. Moscow mules served in copper mugs though ginger beer was flat.   There is no food in the joint but I saw several patrons walk in with pizza boxes from the place next door.   The crowd was loud, obnoxiously loud. Not sure how many decibels this places hits but it must be ridiculously high- my ears were buzzing.    Crowd- A little to old to be taking shots at 6pm but hey whatever. Appeared that highs school football parents and grandparents were getting ready for the season. The cont shrieking if one patron was enough to push is out of the place.   That was our experience, so now how about sharing yours?

reviews.author: Ellie G.
reviews.description: White big guy bartender was a super dick when trying to orde, and apparently he's the manager ??? Slow ass bartending and bad customer service

reviews.author: Alexandra B.
reviews.description: Went in December 15th and was greeted by a super nice bartender. He was so cool and made us super good drinks. We each had one pitcher of a peach Long Island. Loved the atmosphere. Would have given 5 stars but after the guy got off shift a girl went on shift and she had the worst attitude. Super rude to us and told us we needed to be careful how much we drank. We had only had the one drink a piece and babied it for a good while. I understand not over serving... but she was just ridiculous and barely gave us a beer. So because she had such an attitude we didn't even finish our beer we just left.

reviews.author: Ed F.
reviews.description: I've never ever In my life have a bar gm send my debit card info from one bar to the next to see if I was there or not . Then when I get ready to leave my truck is on three flats . I called the owner mr William hue to try to rectify the situation and I was talked at and not listened too . Now we are here . Here ya go . They treat you like trash and when you don't accept their treatment, this is how they treat you . I'm out 700 for the tow and tires .

reviews.author: Catherine S.
reviews.description: Good music, nice service. The beer selection is legit, and they have a full bar if beers not your thing. They also allow you to bring in your own food. BYOF.

reviews.author: Reby G.
reviews.description: I loveeeeeee Stout House!!!!  Although I'm not a beer drinker it is to my knowledge that their selection of stouts is very welcoming. Their quick service and kind words have always made me feel important and cherished by the crew that mans the bar. Their music is ran by a jukebox, but thank Jesus the people who attend there have stellar taste in music so you'll groove all night long. An outdoor patio greets you warmly and their specials are consistent too. Easy place to chill for hours.   **The girl bartender was rude once a while back without justification, but to avoid any negative feelings about Stout House I ask for drinks from the guys behind the bar.

reviews.author: Jade M.
reviews.description: Went here for Harry Potter trivia with a group of friends. They don't have any food but you can bring pizza in from next door. Trivia was fun and drinks were economically priced. A-okay neighborhood bar.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: The neighborhood bar everyone wish they had. Stout has a great selection of craft brews and daily drink specials. They typically show all the major sporting events on their many TVs. If you are looking for a drama-free environment this is the place for your. Kick back enjoy a drink and listen to good music.

reviews.author: Gabriella A.
reviews.description: This bar is great! Lele is one of the best and most attentive bartenders ever. She always remembers our usual drink orders. A variety of beers on tap that I rarely see elsewhere as well as great daily drink specials. Nights get pretty crazy but during happy hour it is a chill vibe at this bar. Not to mention a yummy pizza-by-the-slice restaurant next door.

reviews.author: Tammie R.
reviews.description: Met up with a group of girlfriends here on a Saturday night to catch up and it was perfect. Our bartendress was awesome, the drinks were quick and the environment was chill. There were lots of open seats; I don't know how to explain it - inside setup looks like picnic-type high bar tables everywhere, Lol! Forgive me, I don't even know if that's typical. Just something I've seen for the first time. There is also a patio outside.   Location is great! There is a pizza place next door, cupcake shop close by and a Silverado movie theater within walking distance. No issues with parking. A great hangout spot to stop by before or after a movie, shoot some darts, play beer pong and get a few drinks.  Only downsides are I had a Long Island and a Pineapple Rum and didn't get a buzz (usually I'm good with just a Long Island), and they don't serve any food/appetizers (NADA). So, great hangout place, but not for strong drinks or snacking ;)

reviews.author: Angi M.
reviews.description: Good place for sports and trivia!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Drinks are cold and cheap!!!!! Service is great!!! Patrons are all pleasant!

reviews.author: Eliab G.
reviews.description: It's a great little bar, but if your looking to chill in a quiet location, this is not it. It's fun during sports and they have a digital jukebox try the 8 dollar mini pitcher drinks!!

name: Bar America
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Angelina W.
reviews.description: I love this place. Always a good time with friends or siblings. Brunch on Sunday was nice with Bucho. The outside patio and roof top area are nice. Roof top has a pretty great view. Mimosa set up is a nice price at $10-11 I believe. I've seen it change before though. Would continue to come back for the drinks. Not all customer service has been great though.

reviews.author: Janelle W.
reviews.description: I love their drinks! This bar has so much to offer. There's a DJ, TVs playing sports, the pool table, and the rooftop view.

reviews.author: Vincent G.
reviews.description: I have been going to Bar America for 8 years now. Continuously having a worse and worse experience as time went on. I do love the remodel they did and how there is a ton more space, but that does not supersede the management and service you will receive.  This last visit was the last time I will be going to Bar America. I had some friends in town and I wanted them to enjoy a nice Sunday Funday while avoiding the Texas heat. Every other time except this last time, minors have been allowed. We were trying to be responsible and we brought a 20 yr old that does not/ will not drink, to hang out and drive us all home safely. Well the 'manager' came over and let us know that we will have to go because "they do not allow anyone in the bar that is 18, 19 or 20 because of they could be drinking and its a TABC violation".  I could go on and on about the other times that have been similarly awful, but I will sum it up to.... rude management/ staff and there a ton of other better places to go. [Southtown 101 is fun, clean and friendly]

reviews.author: Chaya H.
reviews.description: Not personable at ALL, manager was horrible and was very dismissive. She attempted to take our order then walked off and we got a waiter....we ended Up leaving...the waiter wasn't bad though.

reviews.author: Masey D.
reviews.description: Amazing!! I went there for my 21st birthday and the menus were customized and the table was beautifully setup. The waiter was very professional and polite. He even brought me a slice of key lime pie for my birthday. Overall great experience

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: I love Bar America the food is pretty damn good for being a bar and they have brunch options in the weekends. It's a perfect spot to watch the games since they have multiple screens.   You have to stand in line to order, not like other bars where you can stand anywhere to order so just keep that in mind if you haven't been. Theres the rooftop view as well with some nice photo ops.   The music and vibe is spot on and the service is pretty good, well rounded spot you make have to wait a little longer on game days but that's everywhere.

reviews.author: Prissy J.
reviews.description: I was under the impression I was going to a bar, not NIOSA. Absolutely disgusting bathroom situation. There's enough illness going around these days without this noAside from the fact that they were PORTA POTTIES (!!!) they were porta potties that were almost filled to the brim. At least at fiesta you know what you're getting into and they keep them maintained for the most part. If a bar cannot have proper bathrooms, then it shouldn't be open to the public. Get your crap together, Bar America! No pun intended.   Chorizo tater tots were bomb tho.  Update: Bar America whined to yelp and got my photo of their DISGUSTING porta potty removed, so you'll have to use your imagination. Picture a big blood clot on top of a pile of urine saturated toilet paper surrounded by turds.

reviews.author: Anthony R.
reviews.description: Draft beer is priced fairly. Expect zero personality and/or smiles from the staff. Maybe they aren't paid or treated well?  Or maybe you just gotta do better SA.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Good bar to hang out with friends. They have good bar prices. I don't think anyone would feel out of place. They have inside and outside seating with a cool upstairs area where you have a good view of the tower.  The bartenders are fast. They have many drink options.  We rented an area for a birthday party and everything went as planned. FYI if you are bringing a gift, make sure it is not alcohol because they won't let you take it in.  Parking can be a pain. It is street parking.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: I really enjoy it here! Been twice.. once on a random night of the week. Decent crowd, super friendly bar staff both times. The second visit was on a Sunday for brunch and to watch football. Again. Super friendly bar staff, and they are super quick and efficient. Probably the fastest moving bar staff I've seen in a while, considering the amount of people they're serving.   My friend got me hooked onto their pickle and chamoy shots! Holy guacamole, my mouth is watering just thinking about them!   On Sunday's they open at noon, and they do have a brunch menu which includes wings, chicken and waffles, brisket migas, breakfast sandwich and my favorite the chorizo and cheese tots! The price point is excellent. The tots are big enough to share. There was 2 of us and we shared brisket migas and the tots. And it was plenty of food. The tots were LOADED with chorizo, and it was god quality chorizo, and the tots were fried crisp! Not soggy or soft at all! It was perfect!   They offer $10 mimosa set ups, too! A bottle of champs and either cranberry, orange or pineapple juice. There are a lot of drink specials offered daily, even during Sunday brunch. There is a patio, and a rooftop bar as well. Ample amounts of tables and bar stools all over the bar, plenty of TVs. And on Sunday, after the game, there was a DJ! So it's the perfect spot for a Sunday funday.   Parking can be hard, but you can park right down, less than a 5 minute walk in the school district parking lot, behind Batallion.   Definitely going to have to come back for their brunch!!

reviews.author: Dewayne W.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars would - terrible service and menu. Spent $20 on 2 appetizers and they weren't half the cost. Go anywhere else for food in SanAntonio - only come here if your want to get hammered.

reviews.author: Brandon I.
reviews.description: such an amazing bar! very clean and socially distanced!! this bar is a MUST when y'all come out in SATX! Christy and Erica are very prompt and soooooo genuine!! ASK FOR THEM! AMAZING JOB!!! keep up the cleanliness and fun times!!

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.description: Attempted to have a beer here last night. I was refused entrance due to a 3x3 Texas tattoo on my upper right elbow. Completely ridiculous. I'm moderately tattooed but that specific one didn't pass their judgment. For an establishment that sells lone star and lone star light this is completely ridiculous. Do y'all know what state y'all are located in? Take your money and beer drinking elsewhere. Skip this lame place.  Brian, you must have me confused with another patron. My wife was not with me, or has posted a review (she's not even on yelp) my mom hasn't contacted you and I do not have a 210 tattoo anywhere on my body. Y'all should try and adjust your 'dress code' y'all sell Texas beer for crying out loud.

reviews.author: John X.
reviews.description: Dj on deck, live entertainment is always a plus. Could use better parking, just saying. Great Sunday drink specials. Pool table available for those who like billiards

reviews.author: Geoff D.
reviews.description: Hows business  peeps? That's what you f***3rs get for being shitty to your customers!.  Bahahshshshahahahahhahahahhahaaaaaaa!

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Went here on Sunday to watch the Brazil vs. Switzerland game.  Got there just as they opened (shocked they didn't open for the earlier Mexico vs. Germany game, which would have been a better view of the TV over Francis Bogside).  We got 4 chairs at the bar and enjoyed the food selection and the $2 Modelo drafts and $3 well tequila shots.   Atmosphere - Relaxed open space that has a number of tables and benches with tons of TV's around the outside wall.  DJ Tony Phoenix (https://www.facebook.com/DJTonyPhx/) was spinning some great tunes as the crowd enjoyed their Sunday afternoon.  Place was packed and I was told it was like that most Sundays.    Food/Drinks - The drink specials are great here as I saw a number of Mimosa sets going out of the bar.  Our party got the fish tacos and the chorizo with taters that was plenty of food.  Next time I am going with the chicken and waffle option that seemed to be the most popular item ordered.    Service -All food and drinks are ordered at the bar, so they are attentive and make sure everyone has food and drinks.  Kept the bar clean and highly enjoyed our bartenders that were nice and spent time chatting with us.  They work really hard.  Overall - Check this place out.  Good food and drinks, great service, and perfect location off the River Walk.

reviews.author: Yevette H.
reviews.description: I really loved this place when they 1st reopened. I even gave it 5 stars. But in the last couple yrs it's not my tiny dive bar anymore. I mean good for them but I don't have anything in common with the new crowd. A younger "hipper" kinda place now.  The beer selection is still primo and the happy hour prices are great. I just want to sit and have a nice conversation without the little hipsters bumping into me.

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.description: ***Delete if not allowed*** I know this place serves food, but we have never been there for it. After last night it is doubtful we ever will be.   We took a Lyft from the Pearl, 9 of us, to go to Bar America last night. Previously we have had a lot of fun and the DJ was good when we were there. We arrived before half our party and paid $20 for 4 of is to get in. Apparently they have a cover charge now, no big deal we are used to that in Chicago.   We go order drinks and wait for the rest to arrive. They are immediately turned away at the door, not because they are busy, but because one friend is 24. Yes, twenty four. We asked to speak with a manager and are told that just last night they started implementing a 25 and up rule. Why? Because of the shooting they had outside the bar in September? I'm sorry but you are just now implementing this????  We decided we werent staying and maybe had been there all of 10 minutes, including the time spent talking to the manager. Because of this new found rule we asked for our cover charge back. I didn't think it was too much to ask given we had just arrived. The manager refused. We paid $20 to hear a crappy DJ play one song.  Now, I get that the shooting most definitely had a negative impact on their business. But if you are going to alienate your biggest clientele (21-24) you probably shouldn't be operating as a bar. Stick to food and close at 11 like other restaurants. Don't advertise that you have a DJ and turn people away at the door. People who are of legal drinking age. As you can see the place was dead at 10:30 last night.   But good came out of it. We went right down the road to Jokesters. Never heard of the place before but after taking a Lyft across town we wanted something close. The doorman laughed when we asked if we were too young, apparently they were aware of the new rule and were getting all the clientele Bar America wouldn't let in. They were packed, service was fast and the DJ was awesome. He played current and all of the 80s and 90s favorites. We definitely will go back there.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Bar America is back and better than ever!  Newly renovated exposed brick and finished hardwood interior and rooftop deck are classy and awesome, and a good selection of reasonably-priced spirits, beers, and cocktails to choose from.  Haven't tried the food, but I heard it's pretty good.  There was a hip DJ there last night, and they brought back the pool table thank God!  It's just about the only pool table in Southtown when you're looking to satisfy the need for a clean break, some neat clicks, and feel the gratification of a fine shot dropping into the pocket.  Back patio is currently being finished up at the time of posting (Feb '20) in conjunction with another welcomed coffee shop establishment.  Undoubtedly will be fantastic once it's fully open to everyone's enjoyment.  View from the rooftop to the downtown skyline should be spectacular!

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: Queso with chorizo fries save the day here just as much as the brisket tacos! There's this amazing day called Wednesday that has trivia night courtesy of Geeks who drink!! If you want the best drink of the night get the cucumber martinis for five bucks or the 2 dollar blue moons. Yes 2 dollars!!  Some house specialities include: Chamoy shots, cucumber Margaritas and the michealdas....if you're feeling BRUNCHY you got fish tacos on sundays and they open at a great time noon! So stop by but if you stop play some badass Jams on TouchTunes!!

name: Quarry Hofbrau and Beer Garden
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: If you've had a long week, then this is the place for you. Order a Dos A Rita and go for a dip the swimming pool sized glass. By the time you find the bottom, you're problems will seem further away. The pickle chips are crisp, well battered, and savory. The pretzel was a little heavy on the salt, but the beer cheese is perfectly balanced to bring out the creaminess of the cheese and the sweet malt of the beer.   Dog friendly patio is a nice touch. The service was good and I get the prices were fair for the massive drink portion size you receive.

reviews.author: Crawfish G.
reviews.description: Stopping by.  Now I have not been into this establishment yet but I plan on it since I am new to the area and it looks super cute, I often browse Yelp to find great places to try out. I stumbled upon this place and went to read my first review. Someone made a review about this place regarding a bartender touching her hair in the bathroom, and how another waiter was talking over there food on their table. I just want to say *because I'm totally irked by those comments* if you choose to dine out at a public establishment - that is your choice. Confronting someone in the bathroom about them adjusting their features (which is definitely "an invasion of space" but lets talk about social distancing, right? LOL) These workers are working to provide a great experience for you as the customer. If you are scared of being out in public and someone coming to close of contact with your food (even though you're out in public ordering food at a public restaurant that has to be cooked by other people, assorted by other people, and served by other people) then you should order takeout! If your main goal is to go out to eat and criticize normal human beings for being themselves and trying their best to show up everyday, then hit the road, JACK!   Anyway, I can't wait to stop by this place as it looks very cool. Peace!

reviews.author: Patrick S.
reviews.description: So my wife have been eye balling this place for a while when eating at Ida Claire's so after a plane ride with no alcohol or food my wife says hay let's go get a beer and I say let's do this! We got there and the parking lot was full so naturally being social butterfly that I am I'm like shit!  So we walk in and it's dead should have taken that as a red flag. So we sat down had some pretty decent service at first my kid ordered the kids burger and she barely touched so I took a bite after while of her not touching it and figured out why it was flavorless so no more mystery there. The wife and I ordered some beers we wanted to try and everything we wanted was out which was a bummer but we settled on one and it was cold and did the trick for the time being, and then we decided to order the cheese and sausage board and when it showed up we weren't impressed it looked like the cheese had been sitting out for a few hours and the sausage was cold, and from one peace to the other it tasted all the same they just tried to present it nicely, I wished I had taken a picture but my bad. So to make a long story endless the good was the beer was cold the bad was everything else. We won't be back.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: The Quarry Hofbrau and Beer Garten is a great place to rendezvous with family and friends. It has a spacy outside area; the drinks and food are favorable, and the service was excellent. The location also can't be beat. It is across from the Quarry and a couple of blocks away from pretty Alamo Heights, which is definite plus. All in all, a perfect place to sit and enjoy, especially with the cooler weather upon us.  We all ordered the Wurst plate which comes with three types of sausage, a bit of sauerkraut, and two choices of sides. In my case, I ordered the sweet potato fries and grilled veggies. Everything on the plate was well-prepared and the portion was large enough for a second meal of leftovers. Our young waitress was new but handled the service like a pro and was very attentive.  This is a place that I could visit and have, over and over. It is not too pricy, comfortable atmosphere, tasty food/drinks and awesome service. It hits all marks. Really, there isn't much not to like in this place. Absolutely recommend it for an after-Quarry visit.

reviews.author: T S.
reviews.description: The food was good. Service was slow and waiter had no personality. We ordered meals for our kids and the price showed 5.99 but they charged us 6.99. We told the waiter and he just apologized but didn't try to make it right. When I said well that's not our fault he half heartedly told me I could talk to a manager. We won't be back. Manager came by and apologized but still didn't make it right. I know it's two bucks but it's the point.

reviews.author: Bruno S.
reviews.description: It has the potential of a 5 star rating.  It really deserves a 2 star rating but here's why I gave it 3... they still have the best variety and best Dos-A-Ritas in San Antonio.  One of the best outdoor beer gardens in SA.  But, last night was our first visit since the renovation (If I remember right I had given them a 4 star review prior to their Reno).  Here is why it was a 2: Boiled down to customer service.  The hostess was not even close to being pleasant.  We were on a date night and I asked to be seated outside so we can enjoy the music and some drinks near the stage.  So she tries to sit me as a far away as possible in the corner area with a peekaboo view of life.  I did tell her [again] I would prefer to be seated near the stage and pointed out all the empty tables.    Our waiter was great, friendly, and his bright personality made up for the poor experience we had received so far.  The margaritas were still as amazing as I remembered them.  We ordered appetizers.  My wife loves the fried pickles from here and they didn't disappoint.  I normally would order their Cheese and Sausage board but I ordered the Wurtzel by mistake.  When the Wurtzel came it actually Looked really good so I kept it.  First bite in and the middle of the pretzel was cold as was the sausage (so gross).  Not to mention the lady who brought them over plopped them on the table and left (another grumpy employee).  Here's the thing, it wasn't even that busy.  Makes you wonder why... since they have one of the nicest outdoor seating areas with a stage and live music in that area.  The weather was beautiful and not as hot as it typically gets during this time of year.  Back to my point, it wasn't busy so why was the overall service so poor?   Even though the band sounded great, a couple of mosquito bites into the evening we decided to leave and try somewhere else.  Shout out to the Nathan Lugo Band! We only stayed as long as we did because y'all sounded great.  After their renovation it offers much more of a family vibe with an outdoor play area for kids, relaxed seating areas, and just gorgeous patio and beer garden.   We used to absolutely love coming here it was one of our favorite spots for a date night and to bring friends/family for large groups.  Hopefully the owners select a competent manager and take a hard look at their customer service.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Met with some friends here for dinner to catch up and we thought to order appetizers; however, when the server put the appetizer down on the table EVERYONE WAS IN SHOCK. It was like having a full meal on top of our actual meal. Nonetheless, great service! We had such a fun time!

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Parking can be hard because of Ida Claire next door. Once you do park you are typically seated right away. They have a nice large patio that sometimes have live music as well. It's good for large group gatherings. Personally, I've never found anything I love on the menu. I don't mind their appetizers - normally I get the queso. I find their margaritas are a little too sweet for my preference.

reviews.author: Seymour B.
reviews.description: Damien, is very friendly and attentive and always carries a smile. He is also bilingual and makes you very comfortable and welcomed. He gives great service and remembers his orders well. Ask for him, he will help you enjoy your time here!

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: This was the second time here for supper.  We were with San Antonio Roses for a group meeting, about 30 people.   Took awhile before we could order food and appetizers.  The waitress was a little overwhelmed with the crowd. I ordered my margarita before sitting down, but the two waters never showed up. We ordered fried pickles and a Reuben sandwich with sweet potato fries.  Wife ordered a glass of Pinot Noir.  The fried pickles were great, hot and crispy, but need more ranch on the side.  The Reuben was okay, but the sweet potato fries were cold.  We had to ask for napkins, silverware, and ketchup.  The wine was a small pour, smelled, and didn't taste right.   We returned it.  I tried to use their website "Toast" to critique the dinner, but it was blocking me!  Tara earned her automatic 20%, but we won't be back.

reviews.author: Kirk D.
reviews.description: First off I'm sorry I didn't get a picture of those delicious chicken diablos but they were so dang good I eat them before they cooled down. Which means they were fresh out the kitchen. The beer selection is great if you're here for that and the bartender Mitch is a pleasure to deal with. Seriously though order the chicken diablos.

reviews.author: Leon W.
reviews.description: My daughter and I ate lunch today and the food was great, the service was excellent and the atmosphere superb. Even parking was convenient! The bratwurst sausage was tasty, the pretzel had great flavor. My daughter said the brisket enchiladas were good and the beer garden was very nice as well as the patio.  The grilled asparagus with butter were superb. I recommend this restaurant. Social distancing was in place and staff wore masks.

reviews.author: Mary P.
reviews.description: This was my first time coming here and the waitress Emma is amazing. She took care of everything I wanted and did everything the way I liked it and I am one of those difficult people that likes things a certain way. I will come back again and specifically ask for Emma because she rocks!

reviews.author: Amy C.
reviews.description: Great food, awesome waitress! I got the burger, however this place is well known for their brisket. Their brisket nachos or brisket grilled cheese seem to be the most popular.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: I had a hankering for their brisket jalapeño poppers and they delivered! They are big,tasty and filling. I also had two of their $5 cocktails that were on offer. The Irish Drop Shot and the Reverse Irish Drop Shot. The Irish Drop Shot was a delicious drink with some sweetness to it. It's the perfect amount of sweetnes. The Reverse Irish Drop Shot wasn't as sweet. I will recommend the Irish Drop Shot. The service was great. I never felt neglected. I will be back again.

reviews.author: Dédalo P.
reviews.description: Their Brisket Nachos are great. Some of their BBQ is solid. The potato salad was unacceptable. I don't think they make their potato salad in house. It tasted like something pre-packaged from a grocery store. We waited over an hour to get our food and the waiter wasn't very apologetic about that. Their drinks are fantastic. The staff needs to step up their game, they weren't very friendly. I would go there again based on a couple of the dishes and drinks. I felt like the staff just happened to be having a bad day the day we were there.

reviews.author: Carlton B.
reviews.description: Food was amazing and the waiters was down to earth which made the experience pleasant. Plus a live singer.

reviews.author: Jecca G.
reviews.description: We had our company party there and wow - we were blown away. The service was wonderful and my team had a great time. Ashley, the manager was very nice and Johnny and Julie were very attentive. I can t say enough good things about their place. We also enjoyed Austin Forrest playing that night. I would recommend for large groups. Thank you for making our holiday party memorable.

reviews.author: Ricardo B.
reviews.description: Had been a while since I came to this place.  Well to another location before but not to the original.  Joe the manager greeted us and welcomed us from the get go.  Our server Johnny was awesome taking care of business.  Also shout out to Meagan one of the bussers , she was doing her thing bussing a table but made sure we were getting taken care of.  Stopped by our table to see if we needed anything.  Afterwards met with Joe the manager and felt like a VIP.  Stop by and visit.  I highly recommend it.  We look forward to going back.

reviews.author: Rene M.
reviews.description: Great food! Great ambiance! I had the queso blanco and the turkey sandwich. Delicious! They had live music and out waiter was on point!  The drinks were tasty and priced fairly. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Mia F.
reviews.description: Had Mako's for dinner. We had gone before when they first opened. It's wasn't great, but it wasn't bad. I went a second time, and it got better. For our third try, we went on February 26th for a 9 pm dinner.   We order the following:  Share: shrimp campechana Salad: traditional Greek salad  Savor mako's bacon cheeseburger and creole fried chicken.  Signature cocktails: cucumber mako-Rita and whiskey sour.   All I can say is everything was amazingly delicious. The server was terrific. She had great recommendations and knew the menu well. She made sure things got filled in a timely matter. I still can't stop thinking about the food! They also have delicious fermented red jalapeños made in-house. OMGosh! I'm obsessed! I can not wait to go again.

reviews.author: Gilberto R.
reviews.description: The service and the food should have been way better for the prices they charge.   Salmon appetizer was the saving grace of the night.  Seafood Paella was a bowl of grease soaked rice with a few bites of seafood and some shrimp.  Pork shoulder had some weird sour flavor to it.  Tried to save it with a chocolate cheesecake at the end but nope. It was a chocolate brownie, nowhere close to tasting like a cheesecake, it was dense and dry, also had some strange flavor that we were trying to guess but couldn't figure out what it was.

reviews.author: Natalie M.
reviews.description: Update: I've come here two more times since my initial review, and am upping the stars to five! Though it is pricy, it is very worth it. Last night my experience was awesome sitting in the bar. Our server was Paul, the bartender, who was extremely friendly and quirky.  Makos will definitely be my go to for higher end cuisine moving forward. I recommend everyone check them out!

reviews.author: Dezeray C.
reviews.description: So this is my first time here, to make a reservation online was easy but I did pick a time that I knew wasn't going to be busy to have a great experience. The food was amazing however the menu is very limited but during Covid I have seen that restaurant menu have become limited. I enjoyed the wedge salad added shrimp, I know salad uhh but nope it was amazing they had croutons that were bacon omg it was yummy. The started was a shrimp campechana with some tostada, the size is a little small but it was great because I got to finish my whole entree. The only complaint I would say was our waitress, at first I did give her a benefit of the doubt, but as she countined to get tables it just felt that she ignored me more and more. The reason I put three star was because the food was amazing, the servers who were not our server were helpful wish I could have tip them instead. She just seem to avoid the table, said she would be back and just took a while. At the end she did completely forget about us which left me upset, I did wait a few days because I wanted to clear my head before writing a review. The food was so amazing that I might be back but might do take out next time which is sad because it's a nice environment to enjoy a meal I just don't want to experience that kind of service again. Placed the new menu on here because it does seem like the stuff on yelp are older. The waitress did stated that everything on yelp was old so here something to help. Wishing the restaurant the best, maybe it was just bad timing for me, we'll see on my next visit

reviews.author: Patty H.
reviews.description: First off, the place is a very relaxed atmosphere. The hostess/waitress was super nice.  The place looked clean inside and the outside patio too. Don't expect to see or hear the creek though it's kind of a ways away. We went during brunch hours and we had the place to ourselves considering it was already 2pm. Brunch ends at 3 and dinner starts at 4pm. I had the oyster mushroom omelet and the lentil soup. I wish they served bread for the table. It would go great with my lentil soup. The soup was perfect! The roasted potatoes could've been a little less roasted. My omelet was a little bit over fried. I'm not sure if that's the way they always do it. The waitress mentioned a happy hour from 3-6pm during the week with some $5 drink specials. I would return to try their  dinner menu.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I chose to dine alone this evening. I used the Yelp app to help me decide, and Mako's ended up being the perfect location. I made a reservation; it wasn't needed, but I wanted to be on the safe side. I was seated quickly at a high top near the bar where I could still enjoy the peace of dining alone, with the background noise of quiet conversation from others and ESPN playing above the bar.   I'd made it just in time for the Happy Hour specials and decided on a $5 old fashioned and the $5 Gouda ranch wedge ($1 with grilled shrimp1). I added the butternut squash bisque after placing my initial order, and it was the right choice. The funny thing is I can't quite describe what made it tasty, but I cleaned the bowl! The salad was pure perfection...seriously...you canNOT go wrong. I'm not sure if it was the tangy pickled onion, the smoky lardon bacon,  or the perfectly grilled shrimp that made the salad so scrumptious, but I'm already planning my next visit for that one item alone.   Since I wasn't stuffed from my satisfying meal, I decided to indulge in dessert. I chose the poached pear with the Portofino wine reduction and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was delicious, but SUPER sweet. So, if you're not into that, pass on this dessert. Even though it's a small dessert, it's perfect to share because it's probably too rich for one person (except me!).   This will not be my last time enjoying happy hour here; I've already text a friend to suggest this as a new monthly get together spot! Next time I'll sit outside!   Side Note: I definitely recommend the "Smoked" old fashioned made with star of anise, juniper berry, and mesquite chips. Ask to see a demonstration to add to the overall experience. It was a pure delight. It somehow took a simple $5 cocktail to the next level.

reviews.author: Alecia B.
reviews.description: We were in the area for a volleyball tournament and wanted to find somewhere for a good drink and lunch. Let's just say we stopped by again for dinner on the way home! The food is exceptional and the chef is talented. We loved the bartender and our servers. Highlights were the burger, salmon tartare and the delicious market salad. Thanks for having us!

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: We found this new trendy spot in Cibolo, Texas. The host was very accommodating when we arrived, if you wanted to wear a mask then they wore mask and if you were comfortable and not wearing a mask then they would not wear a mask.  He sat us all down as we were still waiting for three people from our party. Once our full party had arrived, we had to wait. Unfortunately the waitress took over 10 minutes to come to our table to at least offer some water.  Overall our experience was very great! Unfortunately I did not take a lot of pictures because it was my sisters birthday. But I did manage to sneak in a picture of my cheeseburger which was very light. And I don't mean light in a bad way I mean it as in a satisfying way. Must try!   Their cocktails are also very delicious. I had the cucumber margarita cocktail if I'm not mistaken, and it was very light and subtle at the same time. But boozy!   The only part that I was not super happy with was that the waitress mentioned to us that she had ordered a special surprise for my sister which was their almond cake. As a gift from her. So to me that means that the dessert is on them. But surprisingly when I received the ticket the almond cake was on there. I did not feel like I really wanted to argue over the almond cake but as I stated the way she mentioned it to me is that she was covering the cake. So for that reason I did remove one star.  Something that I really liked about this place was the bathroom. As a first time Mama i've noticed that many restaurants don't have a baby changing table. Or if they have a baby changing table it's very dirty. This place had a very awesome baby changing station. They had diapers, they had wipes, they had waste bags. You think of it and they had it!  Thanks To their management for this!   Great place to eat! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Mako's is a really nice restaurant! The staff was very friendly, the restaurant was nicely decorated and had great ambiance. The food and drinks we ordered were delicious. One of the previous reviews mentioned the Aunt Bees Knees being delicious so I decided to try it and it was really good. My wife got the salmon and I ordered the Pork Shoulder. The salmon was delicious (probably not worth $30 but it did taste very good) and the pork shoulder was also very good as well. One thing I will caution in regards to the pork shoulder is that it is very fatty. There was a lot of fat on the sides of the lean pork that added flavor for sure but wasn't very healthy. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and they were delicious. A lot of good flavor.   We enjoyed our time at Mako especially since the staff was so nice. However, the price was really not worth it. I'm going to give it 5 stars bc there isn't a 4.5 star option and the experience was worth more than a 4 but I don't think I'd be coming back mainly because of the price of the food. It was good though; so if you don't mind paying extra then this is a good spot for date night or to enjoy a nice evening dinner.   Overall: 4.5 stars

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking for fine dining , a place to celebrate something special, or just want fantastic food and feel extra special them look no further than Mako's!  We celebrated our anniversary and wanted to experience a place we hadn't been to.  Walking in we were immediately seated.  Wait staff was jovial and attentive.   Our appetizers were very good and filling (we should have only ordered one but couldn't decide between the two) fried Brussels and Levantine trio. Our entrees were equally difficult to choose but ultimately my husband ordered the 1855 beef coulotte, medium rare.  It was cooked exactly how he wanted with red on the center and juices running in every bite.  You could even taste the hint of coffee spice.  The turnips and carrots were prepared in a Marchand de vin sauce, complimented it nicely.  My entree was the chickpea crusted salmon.  I loved every bite!  It had a slight char on the outside but very moist on the inside.  The tomato and eggplant stew it came with also delicious.   Easily a five star restaurant that I'd recommend and plan on returning to.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: We had a party of about 25-30 people, talk about organized chaos. The servers were on top of it as we were changing seats, walking around, it was definitely professional.  The booking and reserving was so easy too.  Everyone enjoyed their food, my paella was awesome. I also tried their steak and their fried chicken...I would order it all if I could afford it. There is no competition with flavor and quality of their ingredients.  I thank the restaurant and we all enjoyed our time.

reviews.author: William V.
reviews.description: I don't usually leave bad reviews, but unfortunately I feel compelled to in this case.  We ordered the butternut squash bisque, scallops, and paella.  Butternut squash bisque was basically flavored oil with some seeds... there was literally a layer of oil on the top when it came out... I still pressed on and gave it a chance though... it tasted ok at best... In general I'm a human vacuum cleaner so I ate the entire thing, but I would not recommend it if you're looking for an actual bisque/soup.  The scallops were tiny and it only came with 3.... The bed of risotto that the scallops were on had a very odd taste... not like an old taste, or like the food was rotten, it was just seasoned horribly. Again I stomached the entire thing, but the portion size was so small that I was done with the entire plate in literally 3-4 bites.... Total rip-off for the $34 price point.   The Paella.... my mom sent it back.. i tried it before she did though and I wouldn't have been able to stomach it. It was absolutely horrible. Terrible flavor, overcooked seafood, odd tasting sausage, and about 1/4 cup of rice... we couldn't even see the rice when the plate first came out because there was so little. Is this shrinkflation or just normal for this place? I have no idea...   I would not normally have even posted this review but.... After we told the server we'd be sending the Paella back, she stopped by the table that the owner was sitting at and let him know... He never came over to talk to us about it.... and when the server came back, she said the kitchen agreed that it was bad LOL. What?   They were nice enough to comp that dish, but again, the owner/manager/whoever never came by to talk to us about it, apologize, ask how everything else was, nothing.... On our way out we walked past the table the owner was sitting at... he said "sorry about that, have a good one." LOL  Never again

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: The Food and atmosphere is awesome. We have been coming here since they opened. Have never been disappointed. They have a great brunch and Happy Hour. Best old fashion in town!

reviews.author: Tamara N.
reviews.description: Went here for my birthday dinner and really enjoyed the ambiance. The drinks were tasty and the food was good! Service was a bit slow considering how little people there were and the food portions were a bit small considering the price. However, it was overall very enjoyable and would recommend for a cute night out!

reviews.author: Antoinette H.
reviews.description: My husband and I went here for the first time and luckily arrived before happy hour was over.  We ordered the deep fried brussel sprouts and they were the best tasting brussel sprouts I ever had! I had the salmon meal and my husband ordered the seafood paella.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  We are looking forward to coming back in the near future and luckily it's close to where we live.

reviews.author: Brandon M.
reviews.description: I'm only giving 4 stars because you need a reservation, but when you show up the place is empty. We tried just showing up with out one and Theo place was empty, but they said we could not be seated without a reservation.

reviews.author: Terri M.
reviews.description: Great place. The food was excellent. Staff very friendly and funny.  Beautifully decorated. Nice patio.  Say they have music. Did not for brunch, hope they will.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Eagle E.
reviews.description: "Mako on the Creek"I pulled into their parking lot which was super full of cars, things were really happening here! I called from the parking lot and asked the hostess the question "can you accommodate a party of one,   the hostess said hold on one moment let me check with my manager and see. She came back shortly and said yes we would love to have you, however,  we are extensively busy and there might be a longer wait for your dinner than normal. She then went on to say HOWEVER,, we will make sure that your drinks are right on time.    OMG, this place is amazing, the drinks were amazing the food was amazing and funny enough there was no long wait for my food, Mako on the Creek was amazing! I wish I knew the hostesses name to compliment,  the amazing bartender's name is Sara and the general manager is the most wonderful person....and, the  Chef gets huge kudos for his expertise in his craft. The Ribeye was amazing! Mako on the Creek is amazing!

reviews.author: Ofelia C.
reviews.description: My husband made a reservation here for my birthday and everything was amazing. From the service to the aesthetic and especially the food. Our waitress was very attentive and on point with everything. The food was amazing, I really enjoyed the strong yet delicious whiskey sours while waiting for our food.. The rib eye was tender and very tasty, the octopus was tender and divine! My girls (daughters) enjoyed their food as well considering they are picky. I would absolutely come back. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Tyrone B.
reviews.description: This is a nice and very good restaurant a must try if your in Cibolo. The tomahawk steak was delicious and the mussels were awesome. Would recommend a try.

reviews.author: Tony B.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, Go!   Pro tip: Where loose, breathable clothing. Your in south TX and this is outside. Be comfortable n dress down. Flip flops, T-shirt n shades. Way down south.   This is the place where I've had one of my top 2 fav burritos of all time, and that Is my fav food y'all.  Look for the red truck with the pulled pork! Mmm mmm expletive!  Secondly, they have some good beers here. They proudly gloated they were one of the few venues in Texas to have Saint Arnold's Pumpkinator - an Imperial pumpkin beer! I've only had 2, and I'm a PRO beer snob. If you haven't had it, you should! Salivate now. https://www.saintarnold.com/seasonal-beers/  Anyway, there's a small playground for kids. The bathrooms are less than desirable but I don't rate bathrooms, unless they are so bad they are worth staying away from.   Another pro tip: if you get there past 6 on a weekend, parking will be rough. Go early, beat crowds. Enjoy a hill country sunset as you walk out not entirely sober as others are just getting there, and smile. Or stay n sober eatin' mo' food truck stuff.

reviews.author: Adrien S.
reviews.description: Really good. Always have a variety of choices for a good eats. You can even check their schedule on their website. I come here from time to time and I'm never disappointed.  Definitely recommend checking it out

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: Sunday's here are fantastic! The music and DJ Monks is great. I had the sushi truck and the Thai style truck. Both were fabulous. The bartenders are great. This is a great spot to be outdoors with a wide variety of food, drinks and music

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: iiiiiiii LOVE this place! Great selections! Everything is outdoor! The have the games on if you're interested in that. Plenty of beer options. Lots of bench seats. Only issue is parking. Parking an be a B, but we managed that's to my excellent parallel parking skills from NJ ;)  For sure a must try place! We went close to dusk and got to see how the place really glowed at night. Very beautiful.

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: Such a fun place! The whole family loves it! This place is just a blast! It's good for coffee, dinner or drinks!

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: When the weather is nice we catch me and my family here every Friday. Bartenders are amazing, food trucks offer a great variety of food, and my kids love the playground. My husband and I don't get much help with our kids so for our 'date night' or to unwind from the week we go here, order a drink, kids play, and RELAX. We love the live music as well. This place is a GEM

reviews.author: Debbie H.
reviews.description: Yummy food trucks in a comfortable outdoor setting.  Everything from a full serviced bar to barbecue, turkey legs, burgers, gyros, falafels, taquitos, and everything in between.  I got a delicious (huge) chicken gyro; my husband a burger a fries.  Food was prepared quickly and was delicious.  Loved the setting.  Plenty of food.  Not cheap.  With tip I paid $35 for two of us and we only had a can of soda with the food.  Can't wait to bring my son here when he visits me.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Always a pleasure to "pop in" at The point for a sampling of one of there many craft beers - and to experience a new food truck...Last time we were there we enjoyed the visit in the rain - as we were under there canopy roof!  One of our favs!

reviews.author: Adrian F.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to hangout. The food is great. They also have a coffee shop. Don't let me forget about the bar. If I could come every weekend I would. They also have a playground and basketball court for the kids. And it is pet friendly..

reviews.author: Lacey V.
reviews.description: This food truck park is our favorite! It's close to home and the drinks and food are top notch!   I almost always get the Sang-mosa, a sweet, bubbly mix of house made sangria and Prosecco. We also love the brisket sandwiches, although you'll need a nap after you eat one. We've only been here since Covid started so it's always been nearly empty, but I'm excited to go when it's busier too.

reviews.author: Yolie C.
reviews.description: I had never wrote a bad review, but today I'd really had to, I had a party of 10 people we had came to celebrate a birthday and we had purchased from every food truck plus drinks on the bar, we all had spent more than 200 dollars we were having a good time when this Latina that owns this place comes out talking to us unprofessional for having a meal that was gluten free for my daughter, and said that she was trying to make a LIVING!! Like really for one meal that certain people can't eat! Unprofessional Never Coming back to this place, be careful not anyone can have the same foods!! I work for customer service! That rude owner really needs to change her attitude!!

reviews.author: Andre M.
reviews.description: So today was our first time here and we met up with our family. We took a look at the food trucks and we weren't craving anything there and not to mention we literally had gyros for lunch. Not knowing you can't bring outside food or drinks we brought seafood. The manger came up to us rudely while we were eating saying "you guys can't bring outside food or drinks we're trying to make a living here but I will let y'all finish" but our family members literally spent 200$ dollars here on food and drinks from the food trucks.
