I understand if we all would of brought it but it was literally just 2 of us and there was 6 of us at the table.I just thought it was very unprofessional how rude the manager came off.Sorry you guys don't offer more varieties. She could of told us in a more polite way but instead ruined the good time we were having. First and last time here.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: A unique spot.   A local influencer recommended this spot on instagram and I thought the photos looked amazing. I was pleased when I arrived. There is an "open air bar" and a bunch of food truck options.  This is for sure a hidden gem. The bar has a wide selection of drinks with a friendly smile. If you are not sure what you want to eat today, there is a variety of food trucks to choose from. From Tex-mex to bbq. It is also a cool hangout spot for you and your friends.   I would like to point out a special shop nestled in the park. It is a coffee shop and they have some of the best teas and brews. It's a full fledged cafe so bring your laptop and get some homework done

reviews.author: Gregg E.
reviews.description: The Point is a great place for food, drink, family, friends, music and fun!  Job well done to the truck and park owners!

reviews.author: Angel S.
reviews.description: I came for the food, but stayed for everything else (and the food)! This has been on my list since moving #SATX...should not have waited that long. Don't make the same mistake if you still haven't been here. The collection of food trucks and shops is purely awesome! @thepointpark consists of @holysmokesa @justthedripsatx @cilantromfft @nygrillexpress @thebackporchbar hosted by @beardxican (Noel Rocks). But I became a fan boy when I was able to chat with owner Denise @eclecticsatx. This boss works her butt off to build something very special on Boerne Stage Rd just minutes from @therimsa. I've been meaning to come by but it was a recent post she made that brought me here. The post has since been taken down (I hope she puts it back up) because of worries that it could offend some patrons but I applauded her for expressing herself and the message in general. See, it seems some people don't understand that this is PRIVATE PROPERTY! It's an operational business like any other establishment yet some folks stroll right in with outside food and drinks and then take a table. Like, what?People, these food trucks and businesses on premises are there to serve you, not watch you support other businesses. This should be common sense, but it's not, and Denise is trying to make sure folks know just remember this. Well, I have no problem saying it, "STOP THAT SHIT!".  Support these local businesses and come to eat, drink and enjoy what this spot has to offer. That's what what we did. I When you go you MUST try the Texas Twinkies from holysmokesa...like, holy wow! And make sure to chat with Noel when you grab your drink. You can't miss him@and won't forget him. To all my fellow #YelpElite, GET HERE ASAP!

reviews.author: Jenn K.
reviews.description: We haven't been there since lockdown. The food selection is great, whatever day you go. In normal times, it has big rocks, a playground and some outside seating (that does not work now).   We miss going, but quarantine takeout from every place has been amazing. We will go back when it's safe, but order remote until then. This spot has some of the best food trucks in town, IMHO.

reviews.author: Crystal P.
reviews.description: This is place is great and my family loves coming here. Our youngest enjoys the playground and ice cream. The rest of us enjoy the food trucks and beer selection. Their establishment is always clean and the workers are all very nice. I have been coming here for a few years and have yet to have a bad experience!! I am so happy this place was able to stay running despite all the craziness from COVID.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: This place always has a great vibe. Their live music is always awesome. We enjoyed the barbecue truck the other day there's brisket on top of fries. My favorite truck is the lobster truck. Definitely check out their website before you go and it'll tell you what trucks are there. A huge beer selection and a couple of wine choices. It's a great neighborhood spot and the people are always nice.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Maybe you know - why is food truck food typically so expensive? There's no overheard like buildings, leases, servers, bussers, Albanian mobsters...what gives???  A few misses here this day! Patroned around 4 PM on a 95 degree Saturday. Not many folks there and that's likely due to the heat and it being between peak dining times. Lots of shady seating though and thankful that the music they play isn't ear-piercingly loud.   The first truck (Gus' Colombian Cuisine) we wanted to order from was closed. Lights were on, window was open, but no one was home. We stood there for a minute like doofuses since there wasn't a sign saying he was gone or when he'd be back. Strike 1.   So, we decided to try a shrimp and lobster roll from Curb. Informed out of brioche rolls so cannot make that item. Strike 2. Settled on a shrimp and lobster club sandwich or whatever it's called. It was good but $19 good? I don't know about that. Plus, there's no discount for paying with cash instead of cc. The other trucks offer that.  Got an order of 5 egg rolls from the Pho truck for $6. That guy gets around and never disappoints. Rolls were hot and crispy! Great value!  Checked in on Yelp and got a free non-alcoholic drink at the bar - a big glass bottle Coke! There's a cooler on the bar for free water, which was nice. Those were pluses. They have some fans blowing and skeeter spray on some of the tables. The kids liked the play structure and basketball hoop. $4 small lime snocones hurt the wallet, but the kids liked them.   Since they didn't earn a third strike, we'll probably revisit when the weather is cooler and closer to lunch or dinner when all the trucks are open and hopefully fully stocked. If it's sold out, then please indicate that on the menu with a sticker or a magnet. If you're closed, then please put out a sign and say when you'll be back. Easy fixes that keep people informed (and happy) before they try to order.

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: This is the foremost best hangout in San Antonio and the owners name it this way and what a relaxed fun atmosphere!

reviews.author: Kathryn C.
reviews.description: Love this coffee shop. We do our book club meetings here and they are just great. Recently added more food options that are yummy. Good prices and lots of coffee, beer, and wine options.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Another Pub ride down on the Mission trail.  Little sketchy crossing the bridge on Roosevelt.  Wish they would make a bigger bike lane.  Walked in on a Sunday afternoon and they had coffee, beers and food with a wide open area inside.  The patio is big too that overlooks the river.  Enjoyed a couple of beers as we listened to smooth music inside.  People were enjoying the day and chatting with one another.  Also a note is Rosey's Fish and Chips food truck is here on Friday nights.  They use to come right outside my neighborhood at Dooryard on Wedne, but the tenants complained about it....bastards!

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: Rich, dark, delicious coffee. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Mellow and welcoming vibes. It's the perfect hang out during the day. Those empanadas are legit delicious. Local artwork adorns the eclectic walls. It's simply a place I would love to spend time in.   Don't be fooled by the low key exterior or the industrial neighbors, this place is legit and we will be returning to see it take on its night time persona. Super excited to return to introduce the hubby to Yuengling now that it's finally available outside the Northeast. This place is exactly what we needed today.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: Chicago's absolutely awesome Dark Matter coffee in San Antonio!! As far as I know,  Tandem is the only place in town that brews espresso with Dark Matter, or that you can find DM beans to purchase. Happy happy happy!!  In addition to just destination coffee,, Tandem is right on the Mission Reach of the Greenway, near Confluence Park. Convenient stop-off from a bike ride or hound walk for a beer (they have 12ish really nice taps, and a selection of cans too). Huge dog-friendly yard with giant beer pong set up. Across the street from an art school - awesome works for sale on Tandem's walls. Great periodic events listed on their socials.  A half-mile from South BBQ - picking up to-go lunch at South and a coffee at Tandem is my favourite Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Irma D.
reviews.description: We went right before they closed for the evening.  The batista accomodated our order despite running out of some items--understood since it was the end of the night. He still made two perfect drinks and we enjoyed the wide couch to watch films on while he prepared the drinks.  Next time going back to try rest of menu and enjoy the patio!

reviews.author: Celina M.
reviews.description: Love the vibe at this locally owned shop! The drinks are made to perfection (and if they're not quite right they will make it so!) Food has been a welcome addition, love the gooey grilled cheese (pictured)! Lots of fun activities and hosted events. If you want a real neighborhood coffee shop this is it! They are always supporting local artists, vendors, nonprofits, etc. can't go wrong with good drinks, good food, good people!

reviews.author: Beatrice C.
reviews.description: Family friendly! We enjoy Tuesday trivia, great coffee on the way to work. My husband enjoys Monday nights trying out a new beer and taking home a complimentary glass. Best of all it's located on the South side of San Antonio! What's not to love?

reviews.author: Brian F.
reviews.description: So glad a spot like this is open on the border of the Southside/South Town.    Each time I've gone, in recent time, there's been a different employee working the counter but each experience has been great!!  Coffee brand is delicious and I couldn't wait to take my wife; did so this past weekend finally.   Inside decor is cool and hip.  Outside patio and garden are spacious, various seating and colorful. There's also a few fire pits throughout the grassy area, trash can beer pong and the WiFi reaches the entire patio without an issue.    Haven't tried the food yet and the beer selection is okay. Hope the rotate the taps frequently.   Really hope this COVID doesn't claim this spot!!!

reviews.author: Mari C.
reviews.description: So glad to have a place like this on the South side. The baristas are knowledgeable, and make a great cup of coffee! Their signature coffee drinks are delicious and potent. Try the "Jefa", it's stellar! The service is great, very clean and you feel safe as cdc protocols are followed closely. Their beer selection is impressive. The patio is great, there is plenty of seating. My 4 year old loves to grab a hot chocolate and run around the outdoor seating area. Dogs are welcome! Feels like home.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: This place is the bomb. Open early for coffees and pastries. Stay open late and have an amazing craft beer draft list as well as craft cans and bottles. Awesome Happy Hour specials. Tons of outdoor seating.   Been going to their Saturday morning yoga with Mobile Om and staying for the live music.   My new hangout.

reviews.author: Karen A.
reviews.description: Dark matter coffee is one of the best roasters to enter the SA market. Creating delicious blends of coffee exclusively for Tandem.  Come try a cup today!  Atmosphere is great to get work done during the day, or to have a good time in the evening.  Lots of beer options from our local breweries and our staple favorites available,   Great art work from local artists.  Come see for yourself!   If our door is open, we are open!  Set hours to be posted soon.   CHECK OUT OUR FACEBOOK PAGE  https://www.facebook.com/tandemsatx/    We are located at 310 Riverside, San Antonio, TX 78210 7a-9p.  7 d a week

reviews.author: Basseema A.
reviews.description: I went here for the first time this past Saturday and loved the place a lot. There was an event going on, which I tabled at, and live music that was super enjoyable both as a vendor and a customer! The snack selection is great and the beer and wine menu is as well but I don't drink so I like that there is coffee there too a lot. The bartenders/baristas are also the best! Cant wait to be back just to hang out and to table there again!

reviews.author: Megan M.
reviews.description: We're visiting from California and found this brewery off the river walk trail. If you're local, what a great date to ride along the trail, stop for a beer and a snack or bring your kids and enjoy a Texas cola in the afternoon and warm cozy drinks in the morning.   They've spaced out their outdoor seating, offering a variety of picnic tables, chairs, and ready to-go fire pits for enjoying your beer or coffee.  We had the vegan frito pie, with a little spice, sliced avocado and queso, empanadas and a couple of local beers.  Come support this local business as capitalism allows the ingenuity of the independent business owner to give us all a unique experience.

reviews.author: Shawn D.
reviews.description: This place is legit. Massive beer selection with a lot of great Texas beers on tap and an extensive list of wines also. Conveniently located close to downtown. Worth checking out.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Great new place in the area, excellent brews from award-winning brewmasters in San Antonio.  Cool sciencey decor - haven't tried the coffee, but I'd imagine it to be a great place to study or work.  Huge outdoor patio and lawn - great place to hang out on a nice day or evening.

reviews.author: Nella G.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great location, and awesome outdoor patio. I grabbed a coffee with my parents. Coffee is bomb, and was impressed to find out they have house made syrups. I was little confused about the couches, they seemed very dirty, and one was in front of the refrigerators...The decor needs some TLC and they could have a better Mexican beer selection.

reviews.author: Noah M.
reviews.description: Stellar coffee, great vibe, very chill! The staff is awesome and knowledgeable! They carry Dark Matter Coffee, Fat Tummy Empanadas and Bread Box Kolaches which are all amazingly delicious! Plus it's right off the Mission trail, so it's a perfect place to start/finish your bike ride! Their beer list is on point as well, great Tx craft selection!

reviews.author: Jessica V.
reviews.description: Best new coffee bar in town! Delicious coffee with a chill vibe and tasty snacks. Their tap list is fire too with lots of local pours.  Plus their patio furniture is all old school Spurs colors - CANT BEAT IT!

reviews.author: Daniel D.
reviews.description: This place is a unique spot its a bar theme with a starbucks flare, it is very family oriented. I was there outside with my son and wife, me drinking a beer my wife a coffee and my son an abuelitas hot chocolate with a Tandem twist. Then played the giant beer pong game with my son which he had a blast. The outdoor lights the cool art themed interior makes you feel relaxed to slow life down just a bit to enjoy the the little things in life and watch your family smile! Especially at these not so pleasant times. Ask for Balde he is great brista/ bartender/ musician!

reviews.author: Jay R.
reviews.description: Nice vibe! Great customer service and large selection to chose from! Tons of beers and coffee in house.

reviews.author: Babatunde A.
reviews.description: Completely unprofessional arrived and the business had a trump flag being waved right at the parking entrance which is a business as a black man felt completely uncomfortable attending this establishment. As a business they should be present themselves as professional.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Such a fan of Seersucker Southern Style gin! If you don't like gin, you will like Seersucker Gin! Trust me.   It is an adorable place to hang out any day of the week! The grounds are beautiful, ample amount of parking. There are rocking chairs on the covered porch, picnic tables, plush chairs and ottomons, bean bag toss and bocce ball set up outside with fans.   There are a few tables inside the tasting room, along with the bar, restrooms, merchandise for sale and the distillery. The tasting room is right in the middle of the distillery, so you see all the working parts that go into making the gin and Cinco vodka.  They offer free tours on Saturday's at 3 PM, and request that you RSVP on their website. Trey, the owner, was the one who gave the tour. He is a fun and interactive guy, so you definitely will not be bored. We were able to taste their Cinco Vodka, Gin, Lemon Flavored Gin and Limeaide Gin. Then we each purchased a cocktail to take on the tour with us.   Fun fact - Seersucker was the first gin to be made with real fruit juice, not just flavored. They also have trademarked the "Southern Style Gin." Who knew this little hidden gem was in San Antonio!   Seersucker is pet friendly, as long as your pet is leashed.  They also pop fresh popcorn daily.

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: What an adorable spot to hang out for an afternoon! The employees were friendly and  informative.  Plenty of seating on the patio and picnic benches under trees. Also, plenty of parking. The property is well kept.  Tasted the vodka,  gin, lemon gin, and lime gin.  All of which were very good, but the lemon and lime were my favorites.   The owner was very friendly and knowledgeable. He conducted the tour, which was very interesting and informative.    Would be a fun place for a group event.  Will definitely return.

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: Wow, LOVED this place!   Delicious gin - not a typo, this stuff is the real deal. They specialize in their original creation of southern style gin which is naturally "flavored" with citrus varieties.   When you visit this place, you'll feel like you just arrived at someone's chic farm. The design and decor of this distillery are a dream. Charming from the moment you pull in, you'll notice outdoor games, relaxing seating options, and an adorable porch. Perfection is in the details and this placed nailed it. Can't wait to go back!   It's a drive from the city-center but well worth it for the serenity this space has to offer. You don't want to miss it!!!

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: This is such a great day trip to experience with your friends and family. I prefer to park my car at the Pearl and simply take a Lyft so I don't have to worry about drinking and driving.   Seersucker Gin currently has three different flavors and they're deemed as a Southern Style Gin. The current flavors are lime, lemon, and neat. They distill everything on-site and they're super passionate about their product.  If you're a newb to gin, Seersucker is a great introduction to the gin world. It's very clean and is a great base for signature cocktails. You gotta try the bees knees. Literally one of the best drinks to have in the Summer.  They have plenty of outdoor seating and the patio is gorgeous. Have a Seersucker drink during the sunset and you'll be set.

reviews.author: Anthony P.
reviews.description: I love this hidden gem!  My first visit was as a guest of a yelp elite member, and this gin quickly became my spirit of choice.  My favorite is the limeade which goes great with topochico.  I made my second visit when they let me host my birthday party.  The bartender was awesome and provided a tasting for all of my guests.    The distillery is a cool place to stop in for a bit, and the outdoor area is nice as well.  There are games and tables set up outside to hang out while you enjoy one of their many different drinks.  Make sure to check out their new grapefruit gin.  I think I have a new favorite!

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: If you're a fan of gin, bocce ball, and rocking chairs on shaded front porches, then Seersucker Distillery is the place for you. We have visited the distillery three times now, and have been pleased with the atmosphere, the service, and the gin!  Family owned, this distillery hits the mark with its self-guided tours (guided tours are available by reservation), friendly and knowledgeable mixologists (there's no delayed gratification here... drink while you tour), and casual outdoor spaces.  So, take a leisurely drive outside the city, enjoy a refreshing Seersucker and Soda with lime, and throw out the jack for a friendly game of bocce ball. Cheers

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Seersucker provides a really fun, different southern vibe for the San Antonio area! We came here on a Saturday and got here around 5- it was about a 40 minute drive for us from northwest SA. Even on Saturday they close at 7. My husband and I split a flight which included the cinco vodka, seersucker vodka, and the four gin flavors (original, lemon, lime, and grapefruit). They also offer/use topo Chico. Our group then proceeded to try/share a few of the drinks which all were good. You can buy bottles on location- it's $25 for 750ml. They also provide recipe cards which have very feasible/easy recipes for you to make at home. The outside area is cute and probably really enjoyable anytime other than the summer- but we couldn't bring ourselves to stand outside when it's 100 even to enjoy washers, corn hole, hibachi ball, or horseshoes. We plan on coming back sometime and trying out cactus land brewery as well while we are in the area- but they're only open once a month so that takes more coordination. Overall a cute little distillery and addition to SA.

reviews.author: Duane A.
reviews.description: Great owners, great gin, awesome location and scenery! We'll be back soon, and often!

reviews.author: Ernest T.
reviews.description: Enjoyed the atmosphere while watching the 145th Kentucky Derby. The drinks were on point!

reviews.author: Marilyn R.
reviews.description: Love love love the environment. I really enjoyed this distillery. The gin is awesome, and the Gin Gin Mule was super good.   I enjoyed learning about how the distillery is growing.   I would highly recommend this distillery!

reviews.author: Edna R.
reviews.description: I will be honest... this is the first time I have heard of this liquor. I was able to try their lemon and limeade flavors neat. I have not been able to drink gin neat before. Up until now, my favorite had been New Amsterdam. However, this gin was so delicious AND its local! Win - win!  I visited the distillery for the first time yesterday. My boyfriend and I went for a tasting and touring event. I absolutely loved the concept. The distillery is open to the public Thursday - Sunday. The bar is in the middle so you have the view of the whole place. There are lawn games and chairs so you can have fun outside. Rocking chairs on the porch make it feel so southern. It is a bit of a drive but it's worth it! The bartenders as well as the owner were friendly. I will definitely have to go back with friends!  FYI: They also make vodka!!!

reviews.author: Briana D.
reviews.description: I have been looking forward to checking out the distillery for a couple of months. I finally had time to check it out with a group of girls over the Labor Day weekend. The outside area and inside tasting areas are so cute. When we walked into the tasting area, we were not greeted or welcomed. We kindly asked about recommendations and the bartenders kept cutting their fruit slices and wouldn't even make eye contact. We were the only ones there... Let's just say they need to work on their customer service. We probably won't make this drive again due to the unpleasant experience.

reviews.author: Jonathan S.
reviews.description: Seersucker was awesome, staff is great, drinks are reasonably priced, me and my gf have been there twice already and will continue to go there!

reviews.author: Tybee S.
reviews.description: Went on a whim with friends.  So creative and fun.  Went with the gang then went back on a date the next weekend.  You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Susan N.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. Drinks are reasonably priced, the place is modern, and the staff is very welcoming. Will definitely be going back soon. This place deserves more business!

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: Excellent time today. Skyler was an excellent host, sharing the history and details throughout the tasting. Tried a variety of cocktails with our group of 5 and all raved about them. Will definitely return again.

reviews.author: Keith J.
reviews.description: Definitely a drive if you don't live on the south side of town but worth it.  A quaint place that has outdoor activities, i.e. bocce ball, corn hole and more for the young and young at heart. The staff is nice, knowledgeable and very helpful.  We did the tour which was informative and fun. The drinks were delicious and inexpensive.  Don't forget the gift shop, lots of items reasonably priced. We can't wait to visit again in Jan when they feature a new gin flavor.

name: The General Public
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Carmen L.
reviews.description: We've been here 6x in the last month! Brunch and HH are great, can't beat the taste and value but Joe is the best server! He's great, very attentive and personable, and stays after his shift to make sure our last orders have come to our table. We've enjoyed coming alone and with kids on the patio always well taken care of!

reviews.author: Millie C.
reviews.description: Came for Culinaria 2022!  I ordered the Crab hush puppies, shrimp and "grits," and brownie parfait.  Shrimp and cauliflower grits was by far the favorite. The texture and flavor were both on point. Shrimp was seasoned well and not over cooked.  Crab hush puppies were fresh, crispy, and came with a maple butter.  The brownie crunch parfait was a fun ending to the meal topped with the right amount of whipped cream (is there ever such a thing as too much whipped cream?) Definitely recommend, and I will be coming back to try the other items on their regular menu.  Our server was Mary and she was the bomb! Always on top of the orders and didn't rush our table at all.

reviews.author: Kristal C.
reviews.description: The general manager Mr. Hunter was very attentive and dedicated to the foodies crowd.; two adults and one 12 year old eating at the bar section.   First he made it confortable after the new bar tender was "uncomfortable with our TEXAS Constitution LAWS"!.... To serve food at the bar with a 12 year old kid!!!   We are ordering food and feeding happy with Mr. Hunter caring for us. Very happy experience!   Thank you!    Well it was a blessing!!!    He was an advocate to the best drinks and food for

reviews.author: Elizabeth A.
reviews.description: This is my second time here, and it is so great! Caleb was my bartender, and drinks were solid. The happy hour is EVERYTHING.  Ended up bringing work friends here after having a blast.  Definitely going to be a regular

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: Well I went back to GP for happy hour last week. Totally opposite experience. I get we're in a pandemic but sheesh. My friend and I both ordered Moscow mules. She asked for a splash of pineapple juice in hers, I did not. We both got pineapple juice anyway. Once we got our check, we learned that we were charged an extra $2.24 per drink, for a splash of pineapple juice. So happy hour was pointless. Not to mention the service wasn't good, despite it not being too busy and there were multiple servers. I should have just asked for the manager but I hate doing that. We stayed patient with the server the whole time and just paid our check to leave. This was last week and I'm still disappointed about the experience.

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: Under staffed and under Managed. Drinks were decent. Food quality was bad and took a while for two appetizers  Ordered Tater tot with chief's toppings came out with cheese, a whole sunny side up egg and 2 strips of bacon.  Kung pow lettuce chicken wraps were awful Flavor and presentation.

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: After a short hike, we stopped by to get drinks. We ended up trying all the variations of the caesar salad. It was good plain and the seasoning on the shrimp and chicken was good too. Shrimp was a bit overcooked.  Our server was Tommy. He was fabulous. Really nice and had good knowledge of the menu. I normally wouldn't order a salad, but on his recommendation, I did.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: General Public seems to have been humming along since the conception of the Rim. Its corner location almost blends in too well with the high-class neutral-toned neighborhood. I myself have been guilty of passing right on by towards bigger brighter louder spots, my mistake. As I am the cheapest person I know with a taste for expensive cocktails, I'm not sure why I ever stopped anywhere else nearby.  The Happy Hour is unbeatable if you arrive at 3pm. Every hour the drinks increase by a dollar, so it pays to duck out of work before the 5pm whistle. The food is great too, if you're into that sorta thing.

reviews.author: Jose L.
reviews.description: If you go to the general public for happy hour, like I have 3 times this past week, I would definitely recommend getting the Tots, Green Chile Grilled cheese, or the bacon sliders. Such an amazing happy hour in general and everything on the happy hour menu is good. You would not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Really cute spot at the rim! The wife and I stopped in just to grab some apps for happy hour and we were really pleased. The indoor and outdoor seating was great and the staff was very nice. Our waitress was Skylar and she was awesome. We ordered two apps and they were both delicious. The hushpuppies and the grilled cheese bites. Happy hour is from 3-6 and is half priced drinks and apps and if you show up at 3 it's only $3 for each app. I recommend this spot for sure!   Overall: 4.7

reviews.author: Rene M.
reviews.description: The food is good, great for mimosas at brunch time.  I've been here several time in the past two months, and the menu just doesn't jive with me. I wish there was more I could say..

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: Great selection of cocktails and beer. Every time I've gone, the food has been phenomenal especially on lunch specials! Gwen was our bartender today and was sweet and quick! Great service

reviews.author: Serena R.
reviews.description: Wanted to sit on the patio, but the foul smell of the trash nearby overpowered everything. We had to eventually move inside and decided to sit at the bar area. Two males barley acknowledged us and took care of us, asked for ketchup and 10 min later he brought it out to us after we were already done with our food. The energy and attitude we got was so unprofessional and I will not be coming back nor recommend due to poor customer service.

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: Anytime anyone wants to do happy hour, I suggest this place. Hands down, THE BEST happy hour EVER anywhere. Service is fast. The happy hour food menu is plentiful, the drinks are big, and the restaurant is just plain cool. Happy hour here is price of the hour starting at 3PM, which is an insanely good prices. We're usually the 4-5PM crowd, and it's just as good. The grilled cheese bites are the most bang for your buck, HUGE servings for the price and really gooey cheese. Loaded tots are my second go to, and easy to share with a friend. Ranch water a light, but the HH margs here are tall and strong. I have nothing but good words for this place!

reviews.author: Austin B.
reviews.description: No matter how many times I come to this place, I never tire of it! Great drinks (and prices), amazing food, and good music! They even pour their liquor the right way haha.   Sunday funday for brunch with either $1 mimosas or $15 bottle with your choice of juices! Amazing.   And ALWAYS ask for LuLu if she's working! She's the best and just takes such great care as well as have a little fun with you.   #generalpublic for the win!

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: This whole concept is amazing. Menu is different but delicious. Had beer tasting paired with Girl Scout cookies and our salad, mushrooms and lettuce wraps were all perfect. The amount of prawns in the salad was a value. Great staff too, a definite must!

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: Really fun place for happy hour and in a good area for dinning and night life. The bar staff are continually checking up and making sure you're enjoying your drinks and food.

reviews.author: Alannah T.
reviews.description: Absolutely love coming here! Thank you to our amazing server Joe! Also to the bartender Caleb for making us a little special margarita, aka Sally's Margarita. It's just their house marg with a little hibiscus! Chef AJ you're amazing, that chicken was fire also the crab hush puppies are nuts! Sorry for no photos, we ate too quickly.

reviews.author: Hluas Nraug N.
reviews.description: My group had our second brunch hear. We started at southernlieght for the frozen mimosas, then came here for the bloodmary pitcher and hush puppies.  Those two didn't disappoint, honestly everything our group got was good except for the enchilada I didn't really enjoy that so minus 1 start for that.  Our servers Johnathon and Nicole were awesome .  We will be coming back here before we go home.

reviews.author: Abi C.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. From the atmosphere, to the drinks, to staff, to the brunch. Nicole and Jonathan were very attentive and kind. All smiles, and wholesome food. We're so glad to have stumbled upon this eatery on a Sunday afternoon. Just look at the food, it says it all. Their Bloody Marys were thick and full of flavors. Well worth the $20 for 4 glass full. Perfect amount of spice. We ended up getting two pitchers to quench out thirst.

name: The Pigpen
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lakisha T.
reviews.description: Stopped in during a college visit and this place was pretty nice. The food was set up very nice for a large group. Getting through the lines for food was easy peasy. Although I don't eat meat, it all looked delicious. And whomever sautéed the mix veggies is my hero. That with the baked potatoes and cream corn, good God.... Yummy. A must visit.

reviews.author: Savannah D.
reviews.description: Getting accurate hours of operation for this place is impossible post COVID. Their phone message tells you to check the website and the website and actual availability aren't ever congruent. Called the Smoke Shack Nextdoor with the exact same issues.  Regardless, if you're lucky and make it whenever it's open the good and drinks make all the false starts and locked doors worth the struggle

reviews.author: Tom L.
reviews.description: So we're in town to celebrate or 38th anniversary and decided to stop here for some food and entertainment. OMG, you can't go wrong with this place.   I'm totally impressed!

reviews.author: Denise C.
reviews.description: Love The Pigpen!  Great food, cold beer and if you're lucky to catch some live music it completes the visit. Don't forget to catch brunch on Sunday. Also...please come back, we miss Pigpen.

reviews.author: William L.
reviews.description: Food: I got the tacos (shrimp, pulled pork, and brisket) and thought they were pretty solid. They used flour tortillas and they were toasted beautifully. The tacos were large and filled with stuff so I left feeling full. I also got an IPA and that was solid too.  Experience: I went on a Friday around early evening and it wasn't too busy. They have an outdoor space that has a playground and the food truck (where the food comes from) and an inside space with lots of tables and benches. You can order everything at the bar and they'll give you a number so your food can be delivered to you. Service was fast and friendly.  Value: The tacos were $3 per, which is a bit pricey, but worth it given the size. The booze is cheap too! I highly recommend as a spot to get drinks and some good drunchies.

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: I'm a little torn with pigpen.   I love that it's a neighborhood bar.  It's that whole jungle gym  in the center of everything- well, that is just not my vibe. I want to chill at a bar and enjoy people watching and that doesn't include watching other people's children.   Food is available - brisket tends to be over smoked for my taste. The frozen margaritas are a bit too sweet. They do have a brunch buffet on sundays. Live music at times. Parking is a bit limited on site so you have to park across the streets or in the neighborhood.   Felt that the bar was a little understaffed - took a while to get our order even though we were sitting at the bar and even though it wasn't very busy.   But stop by and check it out to see what you think.

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.description: I have always wanted to try this place out. Well, today was the day. Bro, this is the bees knees of brunches. I brunched so hard today it was ridiculous. The only downfall I will point out is the powdered eggs. Everything else is make you want to slap your momma good. $16 buffet breakfast brunch with live acoustic on stage. Cmon man! You can't Texas an harder than that! Got there at 10:15 am and there was a line out the door. The parking lot was also just as packed. This was the perfect hangover cure. Most definitely recommended. Go on in and getchya some!

reviews.author: Juan G.
reviews.description: Brunch Hotspot! They are temporarily closed due to covid, how we be sure to go visit them when they re-open, they offer an all you can eat brunch for the low price of $16 and $8 for kids! What??? Who does that? They do! I'm talking about Smoke Shack Brisket, fried catfish, blueberry sausage, grits, pancakes, biscuits and did I mention Smoke Shack's bbq!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: This is our go to spot most Wednesdays and Sundays. Good place for kids and is a good environment. Have never been to their brunch which i hear is amazing but the line to get in is usually wrapped around the building.  Whats good?  Brisket nachos - very good. Brisket cheese sandwich - awesome. Frozen moscow mule - fiance loves them. Lots of texas beer. There really isnt anything on their food menu that is not good. Would i say this place is better tham Alamo BBQ Co on grayson?  Unfortunately, yes. Even though both places are good. I think the organization of Pig Pen/Smoke Shack is much better. I also believe the quality of the food is WAY better. Price is much better too. If you have never been. Go check them out. Guaranteed a good time.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: What a gem! Came today for the Sunday brunch and what a treat!  Primarily a bar with indoor picnic seating inside. Outdoor sports another bar, with a large play scape for the kids. More picnic tables and some smaller tables around. Food truck sits in the back and opens after the brunch closes at 2. No kiddos after 9 at night.  So, the buffet....just about any southern classic breakfast item you can imagine. Biscuits, sausage, pancakes, blueberry sausage, eggs, bacon, black eye peas, collard greens, fried catfish, fried chicken, cheesy grits, brisket, blueberry cobbler, etc etc. Everything is outstanding. Delicious well priced mimosas and bloody Mary's.   Since there are instruction signs on what to do when you walk in, here's a hint. As you enter the doors, head to the left to the end of the bar to grab your disposable plate and your choice of beverage. Coffee and juices are included in your buffet price16 pp and 8 for kids.stake out a place to sit(make friends since you will sitting with others). Buffet is to the back wall. Make sure you get a new plate each time you go back for more.   Live blues music was also such a great surprise and really could have sat there mush longer listening to the acoustic music and song. Really will be back!

reviews.author: Bridgette R.
reviews.description: The Pig Pen is my neighborhood joint. I have been here many times. I would make it my regular hangout but it doesn't carry any beer that my husband likes so we tend to go where he can get a good stout.   They usually have at least one or two IPA's on tap and that makes me happy.  As a hamburger lover, I have to give their hamburger just an average score. It's good but not amazing. Fries are good too.   My favorite menu item is the BBQ brisket nachos. They are OUTSTANDING and HUGE. You can share these for sure.  The BBQ Brisket grilled cheese is yummy too. The wings are pretty good. The tacos are okay. My son enjoys the hot wings and fried pickles.  We have only gone for brunch once before COVID and the brunch selection was pretty massive and everything was pretty tasty. I was pleased with the fried chicken and the brisket. I wasn't pleased with the price. It is expensive.   If you have little ones they have a great outdoor area for seating and a little playscape for the kiddos. And on Tuesday nights they have open mic nite. They have so much to offer.  Service has always been good and everyone is always friendly. I think you will be pleased if you visit The Pig-Pen. I think it is a perfect place during COVID b/c you can order everything outside and eat outside as well. Pay them a visit, please.

reviews.author: Francisco A.
reviews.description: Had a friend visiting from out of town and all he'd eaten was Mexican or Tex-Mex since he got here on Friday. We definitely had to switch it up today. So we decided to try out Pigpen and omg we were not disappointed. The food was freaking awesome.  When we walked in they were absolutely packed, it was a little chaotic and for being my first time it was slightly overwhelming for a bit since we didn't know where to go or what to do. We stood in a line that was apparently for the food, but we needed to be in the line to pay first, so I slipped out from one line and into the other leaving my dude in the food line so we wouldn't lose our spot.  I paid the bartender, then slipped back in line for the food. It is set up buffet style on Sunday's, hence the line to get food. When we finally got to the food, it looked so good! Eggs, hash brown, silver dollar pancakes, biscuits, tortillas, breakfast sausage links, breakfast sausage patties, grits, Mac and cheese, collard greens, black eyed peas, pulled pork, bacon, brisket, blueberry cobbler, peach cobbler and then all the fixings, coffee, juice, fresh fruit... and everything was freaking amazing! Literally amazing!  The brisket was tender, and had a great flavor. It wasn't the best brisket I've ever had but it was super super good. For a quick comparison, Augie's down the street has better brisket overall. But, this being what it was, a buffet, the brisket was better than expected, so hats off to the cook on that.  The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 was because there is no direction as far as when you arrive. For someone who had never been, It was super Overwhelming and my anxiety level was through the roof. I literally started sweating. I know it sounds crazy but for someone who deals with social anxiety it was almost enough to make me walk out the door. To be fair, there was a sign, telling you "seat yourself, pay for food and order drinks at the bar" but the long lines that were literally to the door were a bit perplexing until I was able to figure out what was going on. A host or a quick explanation of the process by an employee would have been welcome. Overall this place was super good but the inside seating can be a bit snug and be prepared to be friendly because it is set up kind of picnic style. Oh and they had live music! You can't beat that. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: Large portions, slow service and not too friendly. I hadn't been here in over a year and feel that the quality of the food has gone down. The quantity is a bit overwhelming, but I suppose it matches the price. The brisket grilled cheese was okay, a little over salted. The fries were like grease sponges that seemed like they had been sitting out for awhile and then flash fried them again. There was very little potato and a whole lot of grease. This used to be a good spot. Will not be rushing  back anytime soon.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: I would never go here on a hot day. It wasn't terribly hot when I went and I was still sweating like a pig (in a pen) sitting outside.  The layout was a little confusing. The food was decent. I had to add salt to the onion rings.   The employees didn't talk much.

reviews.author: Leah D.
reviews.description: Ok, first of all I would have never guessed this place would have turned into what it has. It is nestled back behind the smoke shack off broadway in the Alamo heights area. It's a little neighborhood bar that has a pretty interesting souther brunch on sundays. All of their food is catered by the smoke shake and it looks like that have some pretty awesome drinks to pair.   You walk in and buy your plate (buffet at $16 per person) and I'm sure you can take it from there. They have a very southern variety of foods such as collard creams, pinto beans, biscuits and gravy and grits. They also have pancakes, eggs, bacon, brisket Mac n cheese and sausage. But not just any sausage, they have a link STUFFED WITH BLUEBERRY PRESERVES. It was very good and I loved how unique it was. The service was really great and friendly and really just had a great small community vibe to it. Definitely a local hit spot.   I would probably return. The price is high but the food really was good. The only thing I'd change is since it's buffet style, it's hard to keep the food hot or even warm. Other than that though super solid southern take on brunch!

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: This review is for the Sunday brunch:  Just discovered this place has a Sunday brunch buffet and all I can say is that I wish I knew about this sooner! The brunch is about $16 and has a nice assortment of breakfast foods and barbecue. I tried a bit of everything and I have to say the mac n cheese and collard greens really stood out! The brisket and pulled pork were pretty good for a buffet. There was live music inside and the bar was open to order drinks/buckets. Overall, solid food and a great atmosphere. Looking forward to coming back for another Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: Solid food, but foodtruck-slow service.  Dropped into The Pigpen at a Monday noon start due to the Smoke Shack's being closed for a Food Network shoot.  No worries, as The Pigpen still offered the transcendental brisket grilled cheese.  Unfortunately, it's only life-changing if you can get the sandwich before your lunch hour is up.  Brisket grilled cheese was surprisingly light for a sandwich made of meat, cheese, and an unhealthy helping of fried butter.  The bread gave way with a light crunch, and the cheese must have been detuned/desalted as to not overpower the soft, juicy brisket that retained a subtle smoky punch - though not as smoke rich as the burnt ends of the artist formerly known as Oklahoma Joe's in KCMO.  Fried onion rings similarly featured a light batter, not the breaded mummification found at lesser joints.  Unfortunately, the grilled cheese took a half hour to reach the table despite my being the second table to order for lunch service.  By 12:30, quoted food times stretched to an hour, and out-of-town guests looking for Smoke Shack offerings began to trickle out the door, unsatisfied.  Next time, will visit the Smoke Shack for Smoke Shack meats.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: This is an amazing brunch!   After seeing so many good reviews about this place for brunch I was finally able to come here with some out of town friends and my husband. Everyone loved it! (That includes my husband who doesn't love brunch the way that I do.) The bbq (brisket and pulled pork) was definitely the unanimous favorites by everyone.   My first round, I took a little of everything that looked good to me to try a bite of each. My favorites that I got a bigger portion of on round 2 was the pulled pork, brisket, bacon, mac and cheese and biscuit/gravy (the fresh biscuits had just come out). Even saying that, everything else I had round 1 was good (sausage, eggs, hashbrowns, fried catfish).  I'd say for first timers, if you want to try something and it's low, just wait for your 2nd time through the line. They are constantly replenishing the food.  Great food and a relaxing way to do brunch with some friends. Our friends stayed for 2+ hours, we were there for just over an hour.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: I give their Soul Food Sunday 5 stars! They have fun live music, delicious food, tasty drinks and a playground.

reviews.author: Clarissa P.
reviews.description: Popped in for a beer and snack with bae. Great selection of beer for CHEAP!!! Plus frozen margs on deck B-). Tons of local beers and plenty of liquor selection as well.   We split the cheeseburger sliders and it was a great snack. Staff is super nice and there's ample seating inside as well as outside. They also offer and all you can eat Sunday brunch buffet for $16 a person!!! That's a STEAL. Will definitely be coming back next time we're in SA. Great date spot on the cheap.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: We celebrated happy hour here on a Tuesday. Beer was delicious and food decent. They had live music in the back room - I believe it was a jazz band playing. The back room was packed! really cool area to explore.

reviews.author: Valerie R.
reviews.description: My hubby and I only had a limited time to enjoy a quick bite to eat without the kids so I didn't have a chance to look up reviews before picking a place. If I had seen the reviews, I definitely would have chosen a different place!My hubby wanted to enjoy some cold beer on tap with our meal so we decided to check this place out since we were nearby.   We dined outside since it was such a beautiful day. There were no actual menus so we had to scan the QR code to check out the menu on our phones. We were greeted in a timely manner, the waitress was very pleasant. My hubby ordered a beer and I ordered a Southtown Mule to start off with and for our meals we went with a salad with chicken tenders and a turkey melt.  I was surprised that the beer selection wasn't better with it being a brewery and all. As far as the cocktails, all are made with beer since this establishment only has a beer and wine license so keep that in mind if you prefer cocktails with liquor. My Southtown Mule was just okay. It was a bit too sour for me and reminded me of a cheap sport's bar drink.   The turkey melt was a bit disappointing to put it nicely. The turkey was dry and they forgot the tomatoes. At least the bread was perfectly toasted and the fries were homemade and were actually good. I was STARVING so I didn't feel like waiting for the order to be corrected. I asked the waitress for ranch Dressing which definitely saved the sandwich and made it somewhat enjoyable. The salad had 2 super large core/butt end chunks in it. I don't know about you but I don't really enjoy having that in my salad. It just shows pure laziness, that says a lot about the care that they put into their food. The chicken tenders were average, not bad but not exactly good. Again, ranch Dressing saved yet another food item.   The only reason that I'm being generous with the three stars is because the homemade fries were good and so was the ranch Dressing. The ranch definitely salvaged our meals! We left feeling disappointed. When you have kids and you FINALLY get some adult time for a quick date, it's extremely frustrating when everything is sub par. Sadly, we won't be returning.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: This place could be so much better and it's really down to some things that they could totally control. Their beers are actually not that bad. I tried both of their sours and they were some of the better sours I've had in Texas so far. Unfortunately, when I asked for a taster it was brought out to me in those little paper cups that you put ketchups in at McDonald's.   What kind of brewery gives out tasters like that? I would hope that there would be a little more pride in their product than to present it like pills at a nursing home.   Similarly, service was...questionable. Our server didn't just seem new but discombobulated. He couldn't answer questions about their beers but I had to point out what I was talking about on the menu.   Their beers are good, they are but it doesn't reflect it in so many ways.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be challenging, however their food is good! Haven't seen some of their heritage Belgian Sours in a while... Used to have two excellent sours, one with tamarind and another named after aliens; both were absolutely wonderful.  Where are those mythical duck confit nachos? 3 stars, until the good ol' days return.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: To keep things short and simple - the location is great! This area is amazing and always lively. Perfect for any occasion in my opinion. Now back to Blue Star Brewing. The food was mediocre. I wasn't quite happy about our entrées, but the staff and our server were super friendly and attentive which was great. I have not yet to indulge in their brew, but from many I've been told their brew is the reason of service and dining in.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: Have you ever just wanted a change in where you eat out? Try something new? I did and spearheaded a trip to Southtown! We walked in, received a hello and water immediately! Great start! We then sat for OVER a half an hour before ANYONE acknowledged us again and that was after we went to the bar and inquired if we could order any time soon. So... 45 minutes in we were asked what we would like to order... two burgers, fries, one with garlic fries, prickly pear margarita and ice for our water.   15 minutes later we got the margarita and we again asked for ice.   15 minutes later we got our burgers.   His burger was great! The bacon was crispy and thick and the burger was tasty. I know because I took a bite (or 2!!) My burger not only had a rancid smell it tasted bad. I could not eat it. They took off the price of the burger, however, said it was fresh today. I was trained in quality control for the HEB meat plant years ago. I know this meat was not good. I don't know why- it just wasn't.   Garlic fries meant two tablespoons of minced garlic dumped on top of fries. I think my breath still stinks a day later even though I tried to scrape it off.  The margaritas were okay. No alcohol because nothing registered!!   Food was served by the same people who cleared the tables. It was just all around a crummy experience. What I do know is restaurants are now all under staffed and going out to eat is a gamble at best. I would not say not to go to Blue Star, maybe we were there on a super bad day, bad moment in time for them.   We won't go back, but if you're into beer and enjoy their atmosphere... enjoy!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: There is a wide selection of beer but I felt their food was not on par with their price point. The brisket taco my friend ordered was just some meat in a tortilla and not much else. My Blue Star nachos were also not anything worth the $14 price point.  The service was great, our server was very knowledgeable and friendly but I probably wouldn't go back there for food.

reviews.author: Bret S.
reviews.description: Not a bad place if you're in the area.   I got their veggie wrap and it was okay. It just felt they had the veggie wrap just to have a vegetarian option.   There was nothing too exciting about it: tomato, lettuce, and some sort of falafel like thing. No sauce, seasoning, pickles or anything. I had to ask for ranch.   The french fries were good though! They are 4 star fries.   Service was good.   Outdoor spacing for Covid was okay... not great, but not terrible. Some tables were definitely not 6 feet apart, the guy sitting behind me was probably only about 3.5 feet away. Some tables were 6 feet though.  Take out box is styrofoam, which is really unfortunate since they never decompose and can't be recycled.

reviews.author: Bea C.
reviews.description: I got a pretzel and a margarita or two. Pretzel was great it came with cheese. The place was super nice and everyone was friendly and attentive.  My husband had beer flight and he enjoyed them.  We sat at the bar right next to a a cheese cake. It looked so good!!! We regret not trying it. Next time!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Meh.  Beer was decent.  Several were really good.  But don't come for food.   It was mediocre for price.  Service was really slow as well, but was due tim our server as other server seemed on top of things.   Just realize it's hit or miss on service if you go.   And they messed up my bill.

reviews.author: Rio V.
reviews.description: Very laid back vibe.   The set up is a bit confusing but you walk up the side and order and then can sit anywhere. I think even on the river walk. They have a variety of beers and margaritas you can drink.   As a self-claimed margarita Connoisseur,  I was a little let down by how sour they were. My colleagues were really able to enjoy it fully but it was a pretty good size. If you're a beer person, this is your spot. Next time I'll try the food, this was just a Saturday evening stop for me today.

reviews.author: JoAnn H.
reviews.description: Hubby had the wings. Ordered lemon pepper but got the Thai chili. 8 small wings for 15 bucks. Nope. Not worth it. I had the loaded nachos with brisket. Stale chips. Congealed cheese spread. Brisket is dry but tasted. Nope. Not worth it.   On a brighter note the IPA and sour were very good.   Come for the beers but seriously skip the food. Nope.  Not worth it!   We have had such better food at other breweries. I'm so disappointed.  If I were giving stars foe the food they would barely get a 1. The beer would get a 4. I'm being generous with a 3 for both the stuff they call food and the beer together.

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: DO BETTER! You would think with such a beautiful location, they would take more pride in their food and beverage.  The beers my wife and I got were warm...both times. The bacon cheddar burger I ordered was cold and raw in the middle, my wife's turkey BLT was bland and literally just two slices of toast with freezer cold turkey, avocado and bacon in the middle. The cup of chili soup we ordered had the look and texture of dog food.  The only good part about our food were the fries.   I went to the bathroom at one point and the floor was sticky, urinals were filthy, there was no toilet paper, and no soap to wash your hands. And this was on at Monday at about noon.. how do y'all not even have the proper standards to even clean the bathrooms?   This place has soo much potential and I really hope management sees this and decides to make some changes, until then we probably will not be back.

reviews.author: yeymy b.
reviews.description: We ordered the nachos and the portion was so small! Literally 10 chips with melted cheese ! Very bad! Then I ordered the fish tacos and the beans were cold, and the fish was barely warm. My husbands plate was even worse! The fish and chips was not worth the price. I remember this place being great! Not sure what happened. Our server was nice and attentive.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Only selling points, it is steps off the River and you can sit outside. The beer isn't to our liking or the food and the wait staff is either over burdened or inattentive. We've supported this place over the years because it is local and we would love to see them succeed, but after several unfortunate experiences we will move our business to the breweries a few blocks off the river. Still local and a much better experience...you can see a few of my other reviews for breweries close by.

reviews.author: Larry G.
reviews.description: Wow, what a disappointment. I guess COVID-19 really crippled this place. What used to be a source of great food and decent craft beer is sadly only a ghost of its former self. Tasted beers thst are from their standard line up thst across the board were mere suggestions of the quality ales they used to produce. The food also was really sad, US Foods Frozen Products reheated... should have noted the poor state of affairs in the kitchen on our way in... pretty shabby and disorganized - I ha e t seen a kitchen in this much disarray since the last time I watched Jon Tapper on TV. Having been a Craft Beer Connisseur for over 30 years now. This place has all the signs of a dying brewery struggling to gasp its last breath. Good Brewhouse and some great fixtures soon to be bought cheap at auction unless a miracle in the form of an investor with a great chef and a great brewer shows up soon. Save your money - San Antonio has a lot of WONDERFUL Independent Craft Beer and exceptional food out there, why waste it here. Very Sad.

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Beer: Blue Star Brewing has some delicious beer, let's get that right. They are always coming up with new creations and all of them are fantastic. If you'd like to take some of their beer home, you can do so by purchasing one of their growlers. Their growlers are pretty affordable and definitely worth it.   Food: This is where things get a little 3-star ish for me. I've been coming here multiple times, and their food is never consistent. Sometimes it can be excellent and other times way below average. I also think their food prices can be a bit overpriced to what they are actually serving.  Service: If you sit in the bar, you'll definitely get a 5-star service, but outside of the bar gets a little flaky. I've had some pretty horrible service at Blue Star, but it seems that they staff is always changing and every time I come back I see someone new.

reviews.author: Sejal L.
reviews.description: After we finished riding our bikes, we were looking for a good place to cool off and have some food. Blue star brewing has a lot or space and is in a great location in Southtown, so we decided to try them out.   I got the Turkey BLT and Southtown Mule. I specifically asked for no bacon and asked if I could have extra avacado, but the server forgot and he never came back after we ordered our food. Also the sandwich itself was two buttered pieces of bread with deli chicken, lettuce, avacado, and tomatoes and lacked a lot of flavor. The Southtown mule was okay, but I could mostly taste the ice and ginger beer.   Positives: great location, indoor and outdoor seating  Negatives: food lacking flavor, okay service, watered down drinks

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: I had such high hopes for this place. It's Wednesday around 8pm. I had no clue what to do when I got here, wasn't sure if I should seat myself or wait. Finally, I saw a server and asked. It's self seating. She said take a picture of the bar menu then sit wherever . I asked for a sample of beer but it was warm so that didn't work. I thought for sure I'd be offered some suggestions for beer/drinks since this is a "brewery" but nope. I randomly guessed (server wasn't helpful). to snack on, I ordered the garlic and parsley fries. Absolutely the worst. No flavor what so ever. I had to ask for salt. Soggy too.   The atmosphere is nice. I sat outside. If I do come back, I'll just keep my expectations low so I won't be disappointed again. The food isn't pricey at all but I guess it really shouldn't be based on my dry experience ‍

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: A real San Antonio treasure. Right over the River Walk in Southtown without all the hype of downtown.   Good food from a varied menu that has generous portions--and the taste that will knock your socks off (even if you wear sandals).   Depending on your drink preferences and what's in season, you should try what's on tap. You have refreshing and traditional, the raspberry geyser and the King William Ale that are San Antonio's best.   Go now!

reviews.author: Dani C.
reviews.description: The Texas Rangers: Facts you may not know     It's the oldest law enforcement agency in North America. Stephen F. Austin organized the 1st group of 10 Texas Rangers in 1823. They were farmers and ranchers.   They became known as "Los Diablos Tejanos," meaning Texas Devils.  In the early days, Rangers would have to dismount their horses to reload their muzzleloaders. In an effort to be more efficient, they began using the 5-shot revolver (invented by Samuel Colt).  There are honorary Texas Rangers: John Wayne, Will Rogers, President George H.W. Bush and Chuck Norris.   In honor of the department's 180th anniversary in 2004, a Texas Ranger badge was carried into space on the Endeavor Space Shuttle Mission by Col. Paul Lockhart.  The first badges came from cutting a star into a Mexican silver coin. This was a way of showing dominance over Mexico. The nickname for the Texas Ranger badge is Cinco Peso.  Ranger Frank Hamer teamed up with local law enforcement from Texas and Louisiana and is responsible for ambushing and killing Bonnie and Clyde.   Texas Rangers Have Prevented at Least One Presidential Assassination, in 1909, when US President William Howard Taft met with Mexican President Porfirio Diaz in El Paso, Texas.   In World War II, the German press mistakenly reported that the Army Rangers were Texas Rangers. This caused some panic among German civilians, due to the fearsome reputation of the Texas Rangers. Finally, the public was told the invaders were "only" Army Rangers. The average age of a Texas Ranger is 44.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were on vacation for a long weekend in San Antonio and we had a pass for The Buckhorn.  There is a big bar here, but it was pretty early and we headed to the museum  right of the bat.  There are like 1,000 stuffed taxidermy animals here. It was crazy, but pretty cool I don't know if I would be happy if I paid more than $10 here, but they also have a place of circus freaks and some fun circus oddities, like ledges you can stand on, while they look like they are on diagonal planes, you can still stand straight on them.  Fun little place to spend a half hour walking through and pretty close to the Alamo.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: I have to be honest I was only there for the museum so I feel I like I'm not giving a FULL review so take this at face value.   I can say NOTHING about the saloon. I repeat, I can say NOTHING about the saloon.   I received a free admission to the museum with my 3 day hop on hop off bus tour... that's a whole other review.....  Ok... here goes.... My two cents on the museum.....  I'm glad I didn't pay money to see it.....  While there is an amazing amount taxidermy displays... that's all it is... and while they are impressive. That's all it is. Maybe it's just me but.... Umm no thank you. It's just not what I want to see room after room of stuffed bears and lions and snakes.   As I said just my opinion, not my thing, but the taxidermy was impressive.

reviews.author: Frank C.
reviews.description: A must stop while in San Antonio, it's like stepping back in time. Try the museum In side the saloon incredibly interesting facts. Highly recommend . Bartender was very pleasant and friendly.

reviews.author: Christie M.
reviews.description: We came for the museum, and absolutely loved it.  There is so much to see and it is laid out well and easy to follow.  We did not eat there, but it was beautiful inside.  The gift shop is also very nice.

reviews.author: Sabrina L.
reviews.description: This review is only for the food and not the museum. A friend came here to eat a month ago and took pictures which looked amazing so I was excited to give it a try. I didn't realize you had to order your food at a counter and have the food brought to you. I was on vacation with my family and inlaws and thought it was a full service restaurant. I asked if they wanted to eat somewhere else but they said it was fine. The lady at the counter, Rebecca, was very friendly and funny. The kind of employee that makes your customers feel welcomed. We ordered our food and found a table to sit.  My husband ordered a drink from the bar. We did not go into the museum but the dining area was amazing. Food was pretty good. Our burgers was very moist and tasty. The fries and sweet potatoes fries was excellent. My daughter liked the coconut shrimps. Only disappointment was the calamari. There was more deep fried breading and small amount of calamari inside. We did complain and was immediately given a refund, which is great business.  If you don't mind having to order at a counter, I would recommend coming door lunch here and check it out.

reviews.author: Meagan T.
reviews.description: This is a total tourist trap. 80% of the musuem is just gross taxidermy. That's literally it. The rest is gimmicky things like a "real human mermaid mummy" or a "three headed cow skull". There's one medium sized section about Texas rangers and that's it. This is super stupid. I can't stress enough DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: I visited April 2 with a 6 year old. We initially came and ate lunch after getting off the Hop off Hop on bus tour. You have to order food at the counter and then find a spot. The food was descent. I had BBQ Brisket which I really enjoyed and my son had a burger which he did not eat. But, it didn't look bad. The restaurant area has a ton of charm, a lot of history and a cool long bar. Bathrooms in the back with some arcade games and good old fashion shooting game.  We were not certain about doing the museum as I did not think my son would like it if it was a bunch of stuffed dead animals. I asked the guy the guy that worked at the restaurant and he said a lot of kids liked it, so why not? We were there. It was a bit pricey, but ended up being worth the cost. It was a pretty large place and doesn't even appear to be that big from the outside. We spent a ton of time inside and didn't even really see anyone else.  They do have a LOT of dead stuffed animals lol. But they also have a lot of interesting historical items such as furniture, guns, etc. It is actually two levels too. Our favorite area was this area of "show freaks" as they had shrunken heads, mermaid fish, two headed animals, fleas with clothes, etc. I'm pretty sure one of those shrunken heads looked like my ex-husband, or at least in my dreams it did.  It was really fun. They also have some interactive type exhibits that you can walk in, like tilted rooms. Interesting stuff.

reviews.author: Fotee A.
reviews.description: Neat place located near Alamo. The greeter is in character and makes you feel invited. The museum is really slick-lots of Rangers paraphernalia and amazing firearms. The wildlife "exhibit" is huge. Seems like one or more of everything is stuffed or mounted here.   The food was great with huge portions in a nice setting.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: A nice afternoon in the museum, very interesting but pricey at $25 per person. Texas Bob greets you who is a very nice man along with The Bartender however the people back by the resterant inside are not so friendly. However the food is surprisingly pretty good, I had the Chicken fried chicken which was served with gravey and 2 sides. The chicken was flavorful and very juicy and they have the sweetest fruit ever.

reviews.author: Jessica R.
reviews.description: Half the museum is a strange dead animal collection with an even odder section about truly bizarre things like shrunken heads. The other half is pretty cool about Texas Rangers and what I thought the museum would be about. An odd experience to say the least.

reviews.author: Yelena J.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a drink and check out the museum. The museum was closing in 30 minutes though and cost $24 a person, so we passed. I got a tequila drink that the bartender suggested that had orange juice and burned cinnamon. The

reviews.author: Alyssa E.
reviews.description: We are locals and have never come across this place until now. 10/10 recommend. Bartender is extremely friendly and personable.

reviews.author: Rain W.
reviews.description: Last time we only went to the restaurant so we couldn't comment on the museum. This time however we did both. The food was great and you will get a discount on the museum if you eat there. The museum has two main sections. The first part shows all the taxidermied animals, a circus show and mystery town exhibit. The lower level shows the Texas Ranger museum with a mini replica of a town. I personally liked the first part a bit more but both were good. Parking can be hard finding a paid lot so be aware.

reviews.author: Marlon T.
reviews.description: I was staying at a hotel close by and while walking by this place, I could not help but look inside since the entrance is wide open. Stepping inside, you're immediately welcomed by a huge high-ceiling room with walls covered in taxidermy. As a hunter myself, I thought it was very awesome to see that collection. I couldn't not sit at the bar and grab a delicious local brew (lots of options) while I admired the art. I didn't go into the actually museum but it looked worthwhile.  Yes, the big elephant (which seems to be the centerpiece) is real and is from the 1960's.

reviews.author: Ta'Brechi H.
reviews.description: 2019 Yelp 120 Challenge - #100  On our Hop on Hop off tour the Buckhorn Saloon was one of the stops. It said that shortly after opening The Buckhorn Saloon, Albert learned that many folks traveling off the dusty trail didn't have much money. The owner Albert had the great idea to accept horns and antlers in exchange for a free beer or a shot of whiskey from his saloon.   Now the Buckhorn collection has grew to become one of the world's most unique and largest collections of horns and antlers. The impressive horn and antler collection lined every wall and ceiling, which is why it is known as the Buckhorn Hall of Horns. Now different antlers are hung above the entry way to different exhibits.   Cost: You will receive $3 off with a Yelp check-in.  Each ticket is roughly $20 each and you get two exhibits for the price of one.   My husband and I opted out of going into the exhibits and grabbed to cold beers from the bar. It would have been cool if they still accepted antlers or horns in exchange for a local drink from the bar.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We stopped in here while waiting for our dinner reservations across the street.  There was a blues band setting up while we were resting and the little bit we heard was quite enjoyable.  The beer was $9 but I guess that is riverwalk prices.    As hunters, it was cool to check out all the different mounts as well as all the antlers.

reviews.author: Bill A.
reviews.description: At first I thought it was a flop because they have you start up stairs with all the stuffed animals which ended up being rather neat. Then one goes down stairs and sees all the history on the Texas rangers which at first looks small but was more extensive then I thought. They really did a good job with the displays so much information we really enjoyed the experience

reviews.author: Bob K.
reviews.description: Food was good. Wife had asparagus which she said was wonderful with her quesadilla. My burger was good and bun was very good but burger was to small for bun.  Staff was friendly. Museum totally overpriced and we did not go.

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: At in the restaurant.  If you are doing the tour get tickets 1st then you get 10% off food.  Bbq plate was good.  Museum is a little on the high side but really unique and interesting.  We took our time and made it through in about 80 minutes

name: Bowl and Barrel
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

reviews.author: Del O.
reviews.description: A couple of weeks ago when we were here we didn't have such a great experience but today was incredible.  The service was amazing and we really appreciated the staff.  Sal, Hunter, Gia, Gwyn, Andrew went out of there way to make sure that we had a great experience.    In addition to the great service the food was hot, fresh, and timely.  We will definitely be back with the family.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: This is a cool place to grab some food,drinks and bowl your butt off. We really enjoyed the vibe of the place. It's only three stars because we had multiple issues while we were bowling. Our balls wouldn't come back to us and the pins would not come back after the fallen pins were cleaned up.   The manager eventually fixed all the issues and gave us extra time for us to bowl. I will bowl there again and see if the service improves. It's $30 an hour to bowl and shoe rentals cost you $6. If you are in the area check them out to see how things goes for you.

reviews.author: Mrs M.
reviews.description: We had a blast here, the lanes had little things that made it nice, big tables, areas under them for shoes and purses, big booths, great food, nice staff and all around a great time!!!

reviews.author: Caylee C.
reviews.description: Halie was amazing!!!! this place rocks 10/10 recommend!! great service and great bowling!!!!

reviews.author: Amanda V.
reviews.description: I've been coming here for awhile now and every time I go Sal always comes to check on us at our lane. I see him constantly going around checking on all the customers and that is great! I even see him helping servers and bartenders. Truly he is going above and beyond! Thanks for always being so kind Sal!

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: Good bowling, very cool vibe, pretty consistent service. VERY overpriced for the actual activity you're doing (bowling ) but I get it. You're paying for the atmosphere and the "experience." The problem is the experience, while good, does not live up to the hefty prices. Overall fun spot, but you'll definitely pay.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Overall a good time with friends, but I think it is way overpriced for some bowling. It was super cold in here and the drinks were not memorable. Honestly I think I would just prefer to go to a regular bowling alley...I feel like this is upscale bowling (and I just noticed in other reviews it actually is upscale bowling-nahhhh, yall can have that). Service was slow and the food wasn't that tasty either. Just meh for me *shoulder shrug*

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: Nice place for the family or just to hang out with friends. Came during the day with the kids and we all had a blast. Clean, reasonable prices, good food/snacks and drinks. Employees were nice and respectful and very attentive. Would highly recommend and will be coming again!

reviews.author: Alexis A.
