reviews.description: This is a Dallas based company that also owns The Rustic and The General Republic. I loved Bowl and Barrel when I was in Dallas. This is supposed to be upscale bowling, cocktails and dinning. I'm happy that they brought bowling/an activity to The RIM. My main complaint would be it is not as upscale as other locations, and that it is not true bowling due to the strings attached to the pins.

reviews.author: Ashley Elaine S.
reviews.description: Today we stopped in to bowl and eat to celebrate my sons 14th birthday and had such a great visit and service. We were greeted at the front promptly and escorted to our lane by Sal who introduced us to our server Anthony. Anthony was very attentive and had great suggestions for food and drinks. We enjoyed the pizza I highly recommend it if you like Grimaldis this pizza is way better ! We started with spinach dip and fries that were tasty ! Burgers in a bag were a hit with the kids bacon Mayo is delish. Anthony suggested ranch water for a refreshing drink and it did not disappoint. I highly recommend Bowl And Barrel for the food and service !  Not to mention we had the managers come by twice to check on us we were very pleased. We can't wait to go back !

reviews.author: Mandy D.
reviews.description: First time coming here and it was not a good experience. Front host was not welcoming. We ordered food and drinks right when our hour started and we never received our food by the end of our hour. Horrible customer service and not clean.

reviews.author: Lubby L.
reviews.description: This place has the worst service.  The service was very slow, there was only 2 groups of bowlers amd 2 lanes in used.  Pizza took 2 hours before it was serviced, missing foods from our order.  The worst part is that they bowl by the hours and does not tell you.  They lied and told me I had to pay for an addition hour with the kids bowl promo but then also told us we timed up.  At the end we didn't get to bowl our 2nd game.  What a gimmick! If you want to run a business based one lies, then so be it.  Every dog has its days.

reviews.author: Ayah M.
reviews.description: The manager Sal was AMAZING!! Such a beautiful soul and is extremely caring to his staff and guest! Always a great time seeing him!

reviews.author: Rio N.
reviews.description: Terrible service. I placed a food order at the beginning of my 1.5h reservation with my waitress who failed to write my order down after attempting to write my order on her hand but her pen didn't work, she had a pocket full of other pens, mind you. I never received my food. I was with a group of people and instead of splitting our bill as requested, the waitress decided to split the tab however the computer did it, not giving anyone an itemized receipt after charging our cards. I had one drink at the bar prior to starting to bowl and was charged $7. I ordered 2 of the same drink while bowling and some how my bill was $27. I'm no math genius but that clearly just doesn't add up. If you want to be charged correctly and to receive good service, this isn't the place for you.

reviews.author: Angel N.
reviews.description: Tommy the bartender and Hunter the manager made the experience a lot better than I thought it would be. They were really attentive, I felt bad not knowing what I wanted to order but they gave me great suggestions and brought everything in a timely manner. 10/10 I recommend for the memories

reviews.author: Rissa C.
reviews.description: Called and made a reservation for a Saturday night, when we arrived they couldn't find my reservation. I even had proof that I called but since they were all booked they couldn't accommodate us. Extremely disappointed since it looked like a fun place to bowl. It would be really helpful if y'all had some sort of confirmation system.

reviews.author: Adam C.
reviews.description: My coworkers don't know the meaning of being on time  but the staff was very accommodating and worked with me to ensure I didn't miss out on the time I reserved the lanes for.  The fries are aight

reviews.author: Alexandra A.
reviews.description: This might have been worth it if the lane didn't keep breaking down and we didn't have to wait 10 minutes each time to get it fix. Waiter took a long time to get our drinks. Wasn't very friendly or polite because he ignored our light a couple of times. The only plus side was the refund we received. Won't be going back or recommending to family and friends.

reviews.author: Jerrel W.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere to enjoy bowling and friends. Only thing I would say that could be better is pricing for the food. For the price I expect higher quality. But overall amazing place to have fun !

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: Krista Bean is the best! She makes coming here the best experience and I love everything about this place including her. She deserves a raise or something cool . She's not just someone who works there , she knows how to make people happy and  feel welcomed, and always has a smile on her face. 10/10!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: PURE wine, y'all! I've never had anything like it! It smells better, tastes better and you don't get drunk as fast! I never thought I'd call a wine "beautiful". Be warned, the website does not have pricing, and the bottles (no by-the-glass business) starts at $68ish. They do have 4 pre-selected wines you can taste for $20pp unless you buy 3+ bottles of wine, then the tasting is waived.  We were thinking "uh-oh" based on the prices when we arrived but holy dang! Nothing like we've tasted before! Totally brag-worthy! The owner greets you and gives you all the info- his place he built from items from the land, his story (if you want to read it..regarding France) and just his history on wine. A super cool place, super relaxing and QUIET and just amazing! Go inside to look at all his cool collectibles from around the world. He's even teamed up with Jester King! Ask him!  You don't want to miss this place! It's truly delightful, but bring your deep pockets, and they DO take card!  *no kids or pets allowed

reviews.author: Stacy T.
reviews.description: What an amazing, hidden gem near Canyon Lake! First, all the wines are made by natural fermentation (aka natural wine) with organic grapes- this winery is even featured in a Natural Wines book. The owner is so friendly and also has the sweetest dog. The decor is unique, interesting, and definitely sets a mood. The wine is delicious- we had a bottle of the "on-site-only" Lambrusco Pet-Nat, and we bought a couple others to-go. All the local websites were advertising Dry Comal Creek as the only local winery (and I'm sure it's great), but we stumbled upon La Cruz de Comal because Dry Comal closed at 5 and La Cruz was still open until 6pm. We will DEFINITELY be back for more organic, natural wine!

reviews.author: Cici P.
reviews.description: We stopped by on our road trip. Bought 2 bottle to give to family member as a gift. Cost us almost $140 for 2 bottles. So mad when our family members open the paper wrap. The corks on both bottle are soaking wet and cracked. The wines tasted nasty. 1 bottle (supposed to be sweet) taste like nasty medicine. The other one is red wine,  taste like someone opened it for a long time and then put the cork back, we didn't want to drink it anymore even it cost us money. Because it was so nasty. I can't believe it.

reviews.author: Lin N.
reviews.description: They were friendly and have a very sweet dog to hang out with customers. Social distancing was enforced and since there were no other customers when we visited (at the beginning) they allowed us to tour the vineyard. Their wines are amazing.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: Great place! Lovely winery. You don't need reservations, fun to try different wines and very reasonable price to do so. Love the owner! So personable and interesting.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Charming owner who educated us on his background and special grapes.  We loved the sparkling black Spanish wine and enjoyed the atmosphere.  The wine was very expensive compared to wineries we've frequented on the west and east coastal areas.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Great hidden spot in the area.  The tasting room is small but perfectly set up.  They grow their own grapes for the majority of the wine they have available. The sommelier was very knowledgeable but not too stuffy. Great stories about the wine. We brought two young kids and didn't feel out of place. No food available, but able to bring your own.

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Heaven, I'm in Heaven!  Can't say enough good things about this little winery. All wines are "natural". No additives.   The tasting room looks like a little cottage nestled in the French countryside.   The owner/winemaker, Lewis, is a piece of work. One of the most intelligent and yet one of the most obscure and eclectic people I have ever met. A true pleasure to meet and chat with.   Do yourself a favor. Check out the hours and plan to visit this little piece of heaven. You will be thrilled and so glad you did.   I highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Deeah K.
reviews.description: On our hunt to visit a unique winery in the hill country of Texas, we found La Cruz de Comal. When we drove in, right away we noticed the winery's main building and it felt like we were in France. It is an authentic European building, small and cozy and welcoming!  The owner was there to serve his 100% estate grown grapes which boast of no additional acid, sugar or sulfites to his wine. The owner, who is a retired lawyer, Mr. Dickson, calls his wine, "real wine." We tasted four wines and our favorite was the port, it had a smooth and delightful finish. There also is a sweet winery dog who loves to visit with the customers...we had a relaxing time there and would recommend it to anyone who wants to taste "Real wine."

reviews.author: Keyshia J.
reviews.description: I decided to take a trip and visit this place. I researched all the vineyards nearby but this place not only had the highest reviews, it seemed to have a nice scenery. The interior and exterior has french touches to it and you can tell each piece was well thought out.   Now the wine.... my husband and I FELL IN LOVE. At first the prices seemed to be pricey but once you do the wine tasting, you'll know why. The wine is so pure and has so much grace you have to walk out with at least a bottle (we bought three). I like wine but I'll only drink one glass because I get dizzy but when I went hope my husband and I both finished a bottle. The wine here has no sulfites and you can just taste the purity of the grapes.   Pricing: When you buy three wines the tasting fee is waived for one person ($15). The owner gave us a discount so after one wine tasting fee and 3 bottles of wine we paid around $160.   The interior is just lovely here you can just tell each piece in the room was placed there for a reason. The bathroom outside looked very old so I was very hesitant to use it but one you go in it is so cute and was not uncomfortable at all.   So, overall this place was an excellent experience!

reviews.author: Tripp D.
reviews.description: The winery is very nice but the wine is terrible. I have had some wonderful wines all over the states and in other countries. It is very obvious the owner should have stuck to being a lawyer. I understand the all natural thing. But it was awful. I tried to like even one of them or even find something interesting about at least one. With all of the time spent in Napa Valley and in France you would have thought the wines would at least be palatable. The only thing I can figure out is most of the reviewers don't drink wine. And if your thinking about going to see for yourself...I'm being nice in my descriptions.

reviews.author: Rob G.
reviews.description: How often those the owner of a great wine pore You a glass ... This the best sweet wine I have ever tasted I will be back.. With my grill, to hang out longer..

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I love everything about this place! It's a hidden gem tucked away in the hills just south of Canyon Lake.  Lewis, the owner, is a former big-time defense attorney in Houston who found his calling to be one with the grapes and wine. Listening to him wax poetically about what he's doing differently at his vineyard gives you insight into what you're about to experience. He's also a hoot!   Instead of using commercial yeast, the wines ferment from wild yeast/bacteria on the grapes and whatever bacteria is in the HillCo air. This gives the wines an obvious farmhouse character (mild funk/horsey, slightly sour). He doesn't filter so the wines are a bit hazy and have some sediment/yeast on the bottom.   Grapes are either grown on-site or purchased from farms in the Hill Country and they don't add sulfites.  If you like traditional wines, you might not enjoy the wines that much but I still think it's worth a visit.  Tasting: $15 for 6 samples Bottles: Range from $25-$60 Times: Tasting room is open on Sat and Sun from 12p-6pm. What we bought: a bottle of Rose.  The tasting room is an adorable limestone building and the vineyard can be seen from the windows.   If you can't make it to the vineyard, Jester King Brewery just started carrying their wines in its taproom! It's a match made in heaven! Wild yeast for everyone!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Such a surprise! Never been a wine connoisseur but you can definitely taste the difference between his wines and others, and worth the extra price tag by comparison to wineries in the area. The place is beautiful and the owner is full of information.

reviews.author: Suzanne M.
reviews.description: So sad! A beautiful intimate winery however the owner is unapproachable and down right rude. The server was knowable about wine however the wine was awful almost undrinkable. Wine tasting cost as much or more than a tasting in Napa. So don't bother making this trip!

reviews.author: Christian M.
reviews.description: This place has the BEST wine I've tasted....period.  The tasting pours were generous and we enjoyed learning about the differences between their preparation methods versus the larger, more commercial vineyards.  I have to assume it's those differences that led to such pleasant flavors.  I've always been a red guy but found the first white I've enjoyed here.  Another first, I could really discern the various ingredients/flavors in each glass of wine, and the reds didn't have that strong bite to them.  I've been to Napa and Senoma, as well as France and Italy, and I just haven't ever enjoyed the taste of wine as much as I did during our trip to this little winery.

reviews.author: Christopher A.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved this place. The owner was such a nice man and you could tell how much pride he took in his work.   The wine was fantastic!!!!! I just left here and I can't wait to get back. I'd give this quaint little place 10 stars if I could.

reviews.author: Ashley S.
reviews.description: We just left and I'm SO confused... I don't know how our experience can be so different from all the other Yelp reviews. We just parked, shared a tasting and left in about 15 minutes because we felt kind of unwelcome and found the wines to be awful. And we wanted desperately to love this place, because it is GORGEOUS. I'd have been very easy to please to be able to spend time in this beautiful place. But the owner was kind of frosty, barely spoke to us (but was more vocal with others), didn't tell us anything (not even the names) about any of the wines. I complimented him effusively on the place when we first got there and tried to get him to chat during the tasting, but he didn't thaw. I don't know if we made him mad because we chose to share a tasting?? We would've gotten a glass or two once we found a wine we liked. We felt like we weren't wanted, which when you're sitting at the little wine counter right in front of the guy, is really uncomfortable. I could've ignored all that if one of the wines worked for us, but I hate to say it, we thought all 4 were terrible. We drink a lot of wine, not cheap or sweet ones, and none of these tasted like anything we've ever had before. I'm confused that every other reviewer LOVED them and we had such an opposite reaction. We are at a loss for the experience we just had. The winery is so so beautiful though, it rivals CA wineries. So bummed. :(

reviews.author: Marty C.
reviews.description: Go here. The wines are mostly made from grapes grown on the property by a gentleman who has studied wine making in California and France. Tasting is a good value, and the property and tasting room are gorgeous. If you like to taste and talk about fine wine, you will feel right at home. If you don't know much about wine, but want a nice country drive and wines that appeal to a variety of tastes, check it out, too.

reviews.author: Brett B.
reviews.description: One of the most beautiful wineries you will find in Texas! Very well done, it is a must see if you are anywhere close! The owner is a hoot, and the wines are very unique. This is the kind of place you could just sit at all day.

name: Krause's Cafe
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Aaron P.
reviews.description: The best food I've had in New Braunfels so far, a town whose food scene has otherwise been very disappointing. The hunter schnitzel was amazing. It came with a red cabbage slaw that really surprised me at how good it was as that's not a thing I usually like.  Only minus- I'd like to see more microbrews on tap. There are at least 3 breweries in New Braunfels and only one represented here when I went. There's a good selection of German imports but I'd really like to see more Texas beer on tap. If they need to stick with the German theme there's plenty of German style beer from Texas. Fredericksburg is not that far from here.

reviews.author: Ariana V.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place for us every time we're in New Braunfels! We've been for brunch, lunch, and to enjoy beers and apps. Honestly, my favorite time to come is for brunch, especially when it's nice enough to sit outside. The ambiance is amazing: brews, live music, and great brunch! Our first time here was for a Mother's Day brunch, which we were fortunate enough to enjoy wonderful weather and got to sit outside and hear some live music! Their avocado toast is delicious: kale, sprouts, and eggs however you like them. It's perfect if you like healthier fare. Some of the skillets and schnitzels are more popular, but I'd honestly get the avocado toast again as it was THAT good.   We most recently came here for my brother-in-law's birthday dinner and really enjoyed it! For starters, the service is amazing. We showed up with cakes, cupcakes, and an ice chest full of ice cream. The wait was an hour long, but they sat us quickly when they realized how much stuff we had brought. They kept the cake in the fridge for us and provided candles and a lighter, which was super nice and helpful! The service alone is reason enough to come back: they truly go above and beyond. For dinner, I ordered the grilled salmon and my husband had the TX BBQ shrimp. My salmon was cooked perfectly and I really enjoyed the potatoes! The shrimp was amazing - I wish I'd ordered it! It had a good amount of heat to it as it also has andouille sausage. It's definitely worth ordering!  As a side note, this place can get PACKED on any given weekend and doesn't take reservations. Something to keep in mind during peak hours if you're coming starving. Overall, can't recommend this place enough if you're stopping in New Braunfels. It's truly a must-do!

reviews.author: Lourna M.
reviews.description: The place is very spacious with a beautiful mural on the outside - I was surprised at how packed with people it was in spite of how large it is. Definitely very popular. The outdoor seating is ginormous! You could tell they were busy but still Emilia, the manager , who was acting as hostess and all around hands on, was very sweet accommodating all who came to her. She was very quick to meet everyone's needs.   I sat at the bar, thanks to Emilia (the first waitress I encountered at the bar was very rude and actually told me there was a wait for the bar and I needed to se Emilia... she was wrong, bar's open seating as in all places). Cynthia ended up being my server. She was wonderful and quick to take my order and check on me for drinks, etc.   They were out of the Wiener schnitzel, which was the reason I originally went, so it was very disappointing. While the ambiance and space and food were great, I was a bit disappointed at the fact that they didn't have such a signature dish so early in the day (noon). I ended up getting a jager schnitzel which felt a bit dry / over fried, but the mushroom sauce was delicious! It was tasty but I'll have to go back and see if it was just bad luck. The fingerling potatoes were well seasoned and delicious. I don't eat boiled cabbage or sauerkraut, but I tasted it and seemed pretty authentic.   They did have quite a varied menu of both food and drinks and most of the waiters and waitresses seemed to be very on top of service. I'll definitely be back in hopes of getting a Wiener schnitzel and maybe try a few other items.

reviews.author: Autumn M.
reviews.description: I didn't order any food but I was impressed by the selection of German beer. The Biergarten was very nice. Wish I could have spent the afternoon there. I'm going back when I have more time since the menu looked great and there is a lot more beer I need to try!

reviews.author: Tom R.
reviews.description: Some down home good German and American food. Good cold beer with so many on tap you just have to try something new every time.

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Hate to do this but have to amend my past 5 star reviews.  After waiting an hour for food at table, it came out cold.  Others at table were hit so clearly they did bad job of coordinating the food.  Was so frustrated and hungry just ate it.  How they redeem themselves i future.   Never coming in weekend again.

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: The hubs and I started eating at Krause's Cafe a couple years ago.  It took us a decade to get there.   We're not huge fans of German food.  Mustard is NOT our favorite condiment.  One day (a couple years ago) we took the plunge and went to the German food mostly restaurant.  YUM!!   But good news turns to even better news!  Krause's is also a biergarten and boy can it be fun!  Hop onto krausescafe.com and see what I mean.

reviews.author: Melly H.
reviews.description: Everything was delicious! Appetizers we had were the sausage appetizer (comes with pickled veggies, bread cheese and crackers) and regular size pretzel w/queso! BEST sausage we've had in TEXAS!! As a meal we had the spinach apple salad, felt like the salad could've had more apples but all was fresh and ranged beautifully. Steak sandwich was amazing- the bread itself was so tasty, steak cooked to perfection and arugula was fresh!

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: This is as legit a German restaurant and beer hall as you will find in new Braunfels. Lots of great German beer that's hard to find another places and the food is authentic. Do not miss the Jager schnitzel!!

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Visited again so we could listen to Monte Good and the Honky Tonk Heroes while stuffing our faces with sausages and beer on the patio. It was a nice evening and the heaters took the chill off. Food was delicious, beer was cold, and the band was great!!

reviews.author: Darin R.
reviews.description: Visited a few times this last week.   Always enjoy the skillets breakfasts.   And just sitting and enjoying a cold beer is good fun as well.  Friendly service highly recommend to everyone.

reviews.author: Dianne H.
reviews.description: Loved our experience on all levels. Food ( appetizers, food, beer and dessert), ambience) . All staff were delightful.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Food was good. Service was good. Outside eating area was nice and spacious. Dog friendly on the patio. Plenty of beer on tap. Would go again if in New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Emily R.
reviews.description: Was here for spring break and my dad wanted German food. There are lots of advertisements and lots of praise for this establishment. Esthetics is pleasing with a nice outdoor/indoor seating. Our server was less than attentive and clearly did not want to be there. Starters we went for the pretzel, break and cheese sauce was great but there was a film of fried cheese on top. Clearly been under the heat lamp since lunch. My daughter and dad decided to get the schnitzel and I had steak frites. The schnitzel was cold and dry and my steak was clearly spoiled meat! After staring down the server for 30 minutes and waving him over for the chart we was forced to leave a tip per the server due to the credit card machine. It was such a bad experience that my dad didn't even want to try the other German food in the area. Clearly this is just a drinks appetizer establishment.

reviews.author: J.D. J.
reviews.description: We had to try a German restaurant in New Braunfels and everyone said this is the place to go. They have a huge outdoor Biergarten and even the "indoor" Bierhalle is essentially outdoor, with mesh walls and sky high ceilings. Dogs are not only allowed, but encouraged, both in the Biergarten and the Bierhalle. There were several there when we visited and they were all very well behaved.   We ordered a ton of food here, and liked all of it. I'm not usually a fan of shoestring fries, but the ones here were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The broccoli was also prepared perfectly, not over or under cooked. The red cabbage was pickled, making for a unique but very good dish. The Apple fritters were the highlight of the evening. More closely resembling a corn fritter than the Apple fritters you would get at a donut shop, they were crispy on the outside, soft inside and came with a delectable dipping sauce.   A couple of complaints. The live music (a Biergarten staple) was WAY too loud. We had to lean right up to each other's ears to talk to one another. Also, although our main course came surprisingly fast, we had to wait forever for the dessert.

reviews.author: Thomas L.
reviews.description: Giant selection of fresh German beer! The sausage platter and Schnitzel was delicious and authentic. I'll be back for more

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this restaurant and the rating it has on here fits it well. It is not horrible but not overly fantastic. I can see this as a place to hang out with friends for a beer and finger foods.   The day we went there was a farmer's market so we were occupied while we waited the 45 minutes it took to get a table. I am guessing COVID restrictions play part in this, which is fine. The beers are good! I lived in Germany (Heidelberg, Ketch, and Kaiserslautern) for over 12 years and my husband is French and German, born and raised in Schweinfurt, Germany. Going to German restaurants are a treat for us because we like to compare American German restuarnt to the originals. All American German restuarnat cater to the Bavaria region of Germany and this one does a great job mixing both American and German style foods.   I had the Texas schnitel, which I did not care that much for. My husband had the German meatball which was amazing. The brussel sprouts are some of the best I've tasted since moving here.   In all, this is a fun place to hang out with friends and family. They have live music, which I would have hoped was traditional German, but hey! I do see myself visiting a third time.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: Man the food here is straight out LA-GIT!  We took my father-in-law here for his 70th birthday because he wanted some German food and this place did not disappoint! The schnitzel was fantastic and the beer cheese sauce was delicious as an appetizer! They have plenty of great German beer options and I would love to come back here again! The brown mushroom gravy was delicious and they have a cool outdoor seating area and bar as well.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Changing my rating from last time. Service and draft German beer selections have gotten a lot better. Still hit or miss on the table service, but overall they have it down. Being very cautious about distancing and masks.  New and updated menu which has some great items on it. Sad that they got rid of the fried cinnamon rolls but I will live.

reviews.author: Erika M.
reviews.description: Manager Pedro and server Serenity were the best. It's St. Patty's day. We came from SA to have dinner as family and go float lanterns in the river on the anniversary of my mothers death. It was a special day and there was a two hour wait. Pedro understood we weren't there to celebrate, it was a special evening and got us a table right away. We eat here often and definitely highly recommend. The food is amazing, service impeccable and the drinks are great! Thank you again!

name: Alpine Haus Restaurant
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Couldn't ask for a better experience all around.   Awesome beer list, great wines by the bottle.  Service was very attentive and the atmosphere is perfect.  Loved everything.     Spent lots of time in Germany myself....  So happy we tried this place!    We'll definitely return!

reviews.author: Maria F.
reviews.description: If your looking for good food this is "not" the place. Rating it by the following of 1 - 5 being the best.   Starters - 3 (good presentation but just ok taste)  Main course portions -2 ...  (5 if you like paying for fillers, but you won't get much meat or any kind)   Quality of food - 1... (5 if you like it drowned in a bland sauce/gravy)  Service - 2 (waitresses could not get our order right from the beer to the main meal)   Atmosphere - 4   Summary- if you want to pay for a beer and starter with a decent atmosphere you'll be ok. Main meal quality and quantity of food provided are over priced and not worth it.

reviews.author: Misha S.
reviews.description: Pros:  1. Service is great! Knowledgable, excited staff  2. Restaurant is adorable - love the location right by everything - super easy to walk to a bakery or around downtown   3. The food is DELICIOUS. From the rye bread, the schnitzels and sausages, and ESPECIALLY the black forest cake. Seriously, the best I've ever had.    Cons:   1. They run out of the Black Forest cake. Seriously. I went here on my birthday, and they run out of it at the beginning of the week usually. And it's REALLY the best. I hope they start making MOOOOREEE!   2. It's a little pricey, but the portions are huge and sharing is definitely easy.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Family from out of town wanted German food! Outstanding, all were pleased. One of our guests was Minnesota born German, made her very happy. Good beer and service as well.

reviews.author: Daniel M.
reviews.description: Wife was hungry for German food and we used to go yearly for 5 weeks stays each time to Germany!  Picked this place and really enjoyed the service and selection of items!  The rye bread was really great! Then I had garlic soup that was good. The Wife wanted to try the sausage sampler. They had the spicy mustard I like. The only problem I had is, I've never had jalapeño sausage in Germany!! Not my thing.  Then I had the Rinder Goulash that was really great, the Wife had Huhnerbrust Geschnetzeltes. Chicken breast with sautéed spinach with mushrooms that was good as well!  I really like the place. I wish Yelp allowed 3 1/2 stars. Would I go back, you bet!

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: My wife and I had lunch/dinner here several times. We've enjoyed the excellent german food, decor and ambiance. The prices were reasonable and I also enjoyed eating in a historic home in New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Andrea A.
reviews.description: Food was great and served quickly. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The only thing we felt rushed towards the end of our meal and were not offered a dessert only to find that they had ran out of desserts. I'd go back when I'm craving good food.

reviews.author: Cody M.
reviews.description: I wasn't even eating at this restaurant and the owner came out and cussed me out because I parked in a public parking spot that may or may not let some customers come into his restaurant. Plenty of parking was still available for his customers but he felt it was more important to cuss me out then to ask me respectfully to move my vehicle. I've never eaten at this restaurant and I never will due to how the owner acts out in front of it.

reviews.author: Amberly F.
reviews.description: First timers here. We took our daughters 9 and 7 to have some of this amazing cuisine. I will start with the things we lived and work up to what wasn't the best. Firstly the series's great. The waitress was friendly and the place very clean. Beautiful ambiance perfect for a date or a couples dinner night. The food was good both my girls and husband agree it was yummy. All of our food came correct and hot. The beer was cold and the bread was fresh. Something to note while this is not a dress up place it's easy to feel under dressed. Also, this is a great place to try new things but the price is high and the options limited. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet dinner with good food. As far as the food it was a little salty but flavorful. The sausage mustard was to die for and the red cabbage was absolutely delicious. We left full and satisfied.

reviews.author: Phillip D.
reviews.description: Great reviews, great little restaurant.  Many of our usual favorites were on the menu. My better half got Yagerschnitzel and I tried the Zeguenerschnitzel. We both were blown away! We both got the  chicken version. We both got the potato salad and red cabbage both were good but the potato salad was not traditional. It was good. The bread was just sliced marble Rye.  Our service was great and attentive. Our guy was Callan. Made it very pleasant.

reviews.author: Sarah A.
reviews.description: Paid over $100 for not great food. Outdated atmosphere. Get ready to eat a ton of sliced meat (comparable to your last cafeteria lunch) and only one side. ZERO kid friendly options. My kids are fairly cultured but I don't blame them for not wanting a plate of gravy and tough meat. Only stars come from our waiter who was very pleasant. Wait for Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Wayne S.
reviews.description: My lover took me here for my birthday.  Got a 5 star German hefeweizen and the Cordon blue. I have never had an open face version before but it was delicious. The salad was awesome and I could have ate a couple servings. The downside is that they don't serve desserts on the weekend. I have never heard of such a thing and not even sure I want to know the reasoning.  Go, I recommend it.

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: We loved the excellent food. The rye bread is amazing and the accordion musician was such a delight. We will definitely come back

reviews.author: Audri C.
reviews.description: Just moved here from Bavaria. This is the MOST AUTHENTIC Bavarian food in the area and possibly in the state! Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: This is a really pleasant restaurant with great German food.  I got the sausage plate - smoked and bratwurst.  Keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Daniel M.
reviews.description: So far, I really like this place. Live music in this spot is on the spot ( I am Hard of hearing ).  The waiter is amazingly, I do appreciate him check on us and food is on the spot ! I am Chef ....   However,  if Chef Ramsay were here. He will said first thing out his mouth is taking away the scents. It's need to remove and allow the smell from the kitchen brew it.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: HOLY MERCY!  This place was awesome, and eat lots of German food.  This was truly one of the best places I have eaten German EVER.  The food and service were wonderful, and much better than many of the other local German haunts.    I HIGHLY suggest trying this one out.    Excellent food, excellent service, and the young man who was playing the accordion around the restaurant was wonderful too!  Get yourself a reservation first, preferably!

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: This little cottage restaurant has the potential to be a absolutely great German restaurant. However, it has a little house work to do to get there. No doubt it has the charming ambience and Great German food of the best restaurants in the country.   Here is a list of minor items that needs to take care of first.  1. A vase of plastic flowers on the tables needs to have real flowers. 2. The bread needs to be changed to a better hearty German bread instead of the white bread with brown swirls. 3. Do not simply dump a small pile of foil-wrap butter pads, but have a real butter server with the bread. 4. The service on a Sunday afternoon was deplorable. The young man probably was a student from TSU in nearby San Marcos, working on weekends to make a little money for college. He did not repeat the orders from the four of us and therefore our food came all mixed up. He never thought to refill any of our drinks until we finally ask him to. He was a nice of guy  but just not trained to be a true sophisticated food server like this little restaurant deserves.  By the way, having a young singer with real lederhosen amble through the dining rooms singing German songs with his accordion was brilliant. This restaurant is truly a little gem that simply needs to be polished.

reviews.author: Carl J.
reviews.description: Always a pleasure to visit the Alpine Haus in New Braunfels.  I lived in Germany over 12 years and the Alpine Haus has some of the best German food I have discovered stateside.  They are short a baker so they are short on desserts especially their Black Forest cake which the time I had a piece it was spectacular.  I have been told if you go during the week they typically have desserts.  If you enjoy authentic prepared and tasting German cuisine then this is your spot.  Ask for Katherine as your server.  She was friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable.  Bon Appetite and Geschmack gut.

reviews.author: Bill V.
reviews.description: The food we ordered a sausage plate was decent.  The atmosphere is nice in the restaurant. The reason for two stars is we were charged $7.50 for a split plate charge which normally includes the sides on both plates. Nope we were given a empty plate! The waiter should have advised us of this and told us for a few dollars more we could have ordered the sausage appetizer. I wrote them to seek a reply but they never responded to their form on their webpage.

name: Anchor Bar
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Aurora M.
reviews.description: We've always loved Anchor bar, despite the wait. This time was different. We waited for a table even though there was plenty of seating available. But, we understood, staff was probably short. It's happening everywhere. As we were walked to our table the hostess walked to a particular table and just stood there, not saying anything then just simply walked off without acknowledging us.  We had to walk over to her and ask if this was our table. She responded yes. It was just strange. We were greeted promptly by the waiter asking if we were here to eat. I guess that wasnt expected because we weren't sitting at the bar. We thought, well yeah...We ordered and waited a while for drinks and placed our order. The food came out cold. Soon after, we were approached by who we thought was a manager. They offered us a free sampler platter for the wait and asked if the food was okay. We told her the food was cold. They promptly took our food and gave us new hot food.  We were impressed because we didn't complain, but it was like they read our mind. We will definitely return, even if this visit was different than others. Thanks anchor bar!

reviews.author: Dinorah C.
reviews.description: Visited this past Thursday on St Patty's day around 5:30. Service has definitely gone downhill. The hostess need to be trained to smile and be polite to customers. We weren't greeted when we first walked in. Both of them didn't look up to say anything. We hung out waiting to check in (they weren't attending any customers). They finally checked us in and we requested outside. 5 minutes later, the older hostess walks us outside and tried to seat us on the table under the trees (she said three words the entire time). They were all dusty, dirty, and rusted. Why would she try to seat us there when no one else was sitting in the area and there were other tables available?! We requested a different table. She sat us down without utensils, little plates or napkins. Waitress stopped and service was good from here on.   Thank you Reese and other female waitress that were super nice and engaging.

reviews.author: Jackie B.
reviews.description: WOOOOOO doggieeeee I couldn't drive pass this place...I heard some good music with a lot of good fun!!! this place was L-I-T do you hear me....Friend OMG!!!! you can't drive pass this place without being nosey like me lol...I seen the cars and the people going in, so I said (self) and self said yes?? I said we gotta go in there and off I went!!! I was upset over another incident... (look at my review) Any who I quickly forgot that when I open the doors!!!!  First things first...it's in a strip mall type of area and although it has a lot of space...the parking quickly started to decline because everyone and I do mean EVERYONE in the area was over that this spot having a GREAT TIME!!!....There is a bar in there and loads of table space...if you don't like being social..you won't like this place...its build for the FRIENDLY...if your lonely or in need of some cheering up...GO THERE..someone's going to say hello or at least ask you if you want a drink lol...Unfortunately I wasn't there to stay so I ordered to go BUT I was pleasantly surprised being that It was not on the agenda to stop here. I decided to buy some wings of different variety and a large barbecue pizza. In some areas to include the front. It's a bit dim so it was a little hard for me to see the menu but otherwise it was fine...It a bit noisy BUT again this is a place of joy and happiness so YES, they are taking full advantage of being happy! The wings were nice and hot...tasted pretty good.... pizza was thin crusted and cheeeeeeeeeesy...not overbearing with sauce..just the way I LOVE it! Would I go back? definitely and what the heck...bring an ENTOURAGE of people with you....the more the merrier I always say! thumbs up!

reviews.author: Stephen W.
reviews.description: RCJH!!! I love this place! What a pleasant surprise! I was in San Antonio for the Valero Texas Open and needed a place to watch my Jayhawks in the Final Four! The staff was great, and the atmosphere was even better! Thank you for a great time! I will for sure be back next time I am in town.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Best. Wings. Ever!  Without a doubt these are the most incredible wing's I have ever eaten. They were cooked to perfection. Absolute perfection. OMG - this is now my only place for wings.   Ruben the chef was on the floor throughout our meal ensuring we were happy. We were. Service was great despite a small mix-up (we ordered all flats and got mixed) however, the server took responsibility and made it right.   Only critique would be the hostesses. No one acknowledged us when we walked in and we literally stood at the host stand waiting.   Once we found our own seats Westley immediately got us drinks and Noah took our order. Several check backs were done which is a huge plus.   You must try this place!

reviews.author: Patricia M.
reviews.description: Thought we would check out local food.  Actual date was Saturday was a very place.  College football was on almost every tv. You could feel the energy in the establishment. All good, very jovial vibe.    If you find yourself in the area, decide to drop in! You must try the Anchor Bar Dip! Like a mix of queso with blue cheese. Don't try to understand just eat and enjoy.    Drinks were cold and blended with the right amount of alcohol.  So good we had 2 each.     I had the lemon pepper wings. Wow! Loved the crispy lemon pepper wings. Hot and spiced perfectly.  The fries were hot right out of the fryer! I feet compelled to eat all the fries.   Spouse had the Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich. Fresh baked bread, and tasty meat with fresh bell peppers.    The only issue we had was the lack of service. May have been due to the busy night.   Waited awhile for water refills, drinks  and bill.    Overall great place. May return during a slow night.

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times and every time has been delightful.  Unfortunately, I have only one picture of a Bloody Mary to memorialize or summarize all the great food I've had here.  more pictures needed  The chips and queso are always a winner in my book. The queso pairs well with chips, pizza, tots, and wedges.   The queso isn't super spicy so we like to add more jalapenos to the mix. The wedges were super addictive. Nicely fried and seasoned. I'm sure the tots would have been the same, but I couldn't eat any more potatoes.   The habanero ranch lime wings. Those are amazing. So yummy, I'm practically drooling as I think about them. Again, not too spicy, so if you want the heat you might need to ask them to increase it for you. I also really like the garlic parmesan wings, this is actually my favorite flavor, but I'm fairly certain that the HRL has taken the top spot.   Last night we tried a roast beef sandwich. It was ok. The bread was super salty, almost to the point that I couldn't eat it. However, I noticed it was primarily on top of the bread so I just took it off the bread. I probably wouldn't order that again. I'll stick to the queso, wings, and pizza.   I had the pizza back in January. It was fabulous, especially the next day. I loved the crust and I'm not usually a fan of bready crusts.   For dessert, we took caramel churros back home for later. I can only imagine the bliss of eating them warm on site. Those were some damn good churros. Overflowing with caramel and served with vanilla ice cream and an additional drizzle of caramel. It was dreamy!  Oh yeah and so the Bloody Mary. I never knew I liked pickled green beans until last weekend. Maybe I can get a bowl of them as an appetizer next time I'm there.  Omg I'm a jerk for not mentioning the amazing service. Table service and bar service has always been on point. Everyone there is attentive and honestly they have always gotten our order right. This is important because I've been there with a picky....*ahem* specific orderer. Thank you for being patient and pleasant!

reviews.author: Will H.
reviews.description: Great food and great service. The boneless wings bites are so far my favorite and they have tons of flavors. I usually grab extra sauce because they're all so damn good.

reviews.author: Irene G.
reviews.description: .30 more per wing!! 10 wings $14 plus another $3 for the so called "wing shortage" $17 for 10 Wings!! Nah we won't be coming to this place for a long while!! Owner Joe is trying to pull a fast one! What a jerk! BUT he doesn't charge the extra .30 to Buffalo fans! What a rip off, there's PLENTY of OTHER great wing places around.

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Came here a Sunday afternoon with the kids. They played outside while we enjoyed a drink. Food was good. We got the wings and a wrap! They brought the food out to us. It was fast service and the kids loved the playground. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Jando S.
reviews.description: Considering I've eaten at the original location in Buffalo (#1), it admittedly feels strange (yet exciting) to have the option to do so in San Antonio. It is a very different feel but is still a very solid choice for some serious comfort food.  First off, this place is massive. It really doesn't look that big from the outside but there is ample seating and different party rooms. The parking is also abundant and they have a playground right out front for the youngins. This is a place where I would definitely consider hosting a large gathering (#2).  I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised by the food. Everything I ate was a gut bomb, but in the best way. Everything from the burgers, mac and cheese, tater tots, loaded appetizers, and the wings were quite tasty. The portions are excellent and this would be an ideal spot for a very big eater.  The real unfortunate thing is there is a wing shortage, and as a result the prices were a bit on the high side. Nothing's cheap during the pandemic but the quality of the food doesn't necessarily always coincide with the price.  Service is ok but not phenomenal. In dining service seems to be the way to go, even if I'm not entirely sure if the staff is fully masked up. Phone manners were a little suspect in the wait for my take out was a lot longer than I anticipated. In the end, I'm still happy I found this place and look forward to trying it again.  __________ (#1) Where I learned the origin of a "buffalo wing."  (#2) Once the pandemic is over, naturally.

reviews.author: Jen L.
reviews.description: I have found my new home for hot wings.   Just. Total. YUM!!  These are the best wings. Seriously give this place a try. They're were perfectly crisp. Served extra wet as I ordered. Will most definitely make this place a regular spot!!  Thank you Rueben, Wesley and Noah!!!

reviews.author: Kirk D.
reviews.description: Fun place! Great decor, awesome servers. Killer wings, and must-try meatballs. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Haydee G.
reviews.description: Second time coming to this place tried different entrees,Chicken wrap and Mac n cheese sandwich, not that impressed with neither of them.  The wings I tasted that ordered on side which were very delicious! Service takes a while to bring drinks and food.  First time was at FM3009 and 2nd time was at 1604 location both were pretty dead but same service unfortunately.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: Had the worst experience here, everything was BURNT. took forever to get service and they still wanted us to pay for our drinks when we sent everything back. Bad management, everything was dirty. Couldn't even bite into our chicken on a stick, wish i would have gotten a picture. Asked for our table to be cleaned 3 times and no one ever did. Do not recommend.

reviews.author: G M.
reviews.description: I love the food here. Unfortunately, the service is always either terrible or barely mediocre. My last visit, it it was just a group of hostesses, waiters, and waitresses talking in the wait station while the bell in the kitchen was constantly ringing. I was not surprised when my food came out cold.  PLEASE.  Get better staff and you will be one of the best options in San Antonio for sports bars.  Your waitresses are consistently terrible.

reviews.author: Steven H.
reviews.description: Wings are good but Pizza Hut or miss. Think we caught them on a busy day as the pizza we ordered to go was so flimsy the cheese all fell off so the oven must have not been hot enough. Will probably stay away for pizza from now on but then again that isn't their specialty.

reviews.author: Michelle U.
reviews.description: We placed an order for delivery, so we did not expect anything to be hot, which it was not.  But...we weren't expecting it to be disappointing.   The wings were nice and crisp, but flavorless even with the dry rub that was included on the side.  The wedges, well...those we simply threw away as they were not fully cooked yet were very soggy.  As for the side Ceasar salad...there was no dressing on it and none on the side.  It was also all the yellow leaves and the hard backs.  Nothing in there was green so that too was tossed away.  We've eaten in before and always enjoyed it.  This was a huge disappointment and we will not order from here again.

reviews.author: Carolina E.
reviews.description: My favorite go to for Pizza, Patty melts and Wings! The flavor choices are plentiful and I no longer have to wait forever at Pluckers for a table and the wings here are not dry!  The pizza is huge and feeds my teens and 2 adults easily!  Wings are really good especially the Ranch rub and garlic parm with blue cheese which isn't the best but the wings make up for that. If you request celery and carrots, just know you only get 2 small carrot pieces and 2 teeny celery pieces The waitress on our last visit was not real good at keeping our drinks filled, we had to ask for refills, boxes but she was very quick to bring the check and cone back to cash it out.  Also, we were asked to sit at the end of the long bar table top instead of an actual table and there were 5 of us. We enjoyed the NBA final game 4 though with 360° views all around! It was awesome My patty melt was perfect too.

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: We visited tonight for our first time this year and had a great time and amazing service. We were seated right away even though it seemed pretty busy. It looked like they have added a ton of outdoor seating, but it was a bit cold tonight. I don't know how authentic this location is to the original, but we went their a few years ago and have an affinity to the brand. Get the blue cheese!  I got a single order(10) hot and my wife got a snack size(5) medium. Both had a good mix of drumettes and flats. I added wedges, she got tots. The wings and potatoes were all nice and crispy and came with carrots and celery with no up charge.   They have a full bar and the beer is either big brand or local craft, with a good selection of draft and bottles/cans. They also had a lot of specialty mixed drinks, but we like beer with wings. The beers were all around $5 or less from what I looked at.   The booths all had extra plexiglass dividers between them, the tables had plastic sheets on plastic stands, and there was a self service temperature scanner by the door, but we didn't see that until on the way out. Each table had a placard with QR codes for the drink and food menus.

reviews.author: Joey P.
reviews.description: I like to give places 2nd chances. I'm only human, right? With my own opinions and preconceived notions. Well sometimes you have to bust those barriers down and approach things with a different mindset. I had fun! Maybe because it was earlier people were a little less rowdy lol. The drinks also hit different this time. An all-around solid good time.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Easily the most ghetto place I've ever been to in San Antonio.  We went for a friend's birthday party and a fight broke out outside as we were leaving.  Apparently, it was just because someone looked at them wrong.  A lot of very drunk and shady people.  Will never be going back.

reviews.author: Brandye C.
reviews.description: This place had a little of everything and everybody. Not my type of crowd but I was there for moral support after the boxing match. Someone even brought their service dog inside.

reviews.author: Evaristo R.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere to have a couple of drinks listen to some music and have some great  food  from the local food truck

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: SECURITY GUARD, FORAN, IS A RACIST PIG.  I have been here a couple times with my friends. It was super chill. But tonight my friend and I went. We were dancing with these random Haitian girls and this RUDE security guard, Foran, walked up and said control your friend or get out. I was trying to understand what was going on. I don't know the girls or what happened before we got there. So I asked him "what was going on" and "what are you talking about?" All he kept saying was "control your friend or leave." And he told her she had to sit down or get out. There was no explanation or anything. The more I tried to understand the meaner and more aggressive he got.  On my way out, I walked up to him and said "hey we were just having a good time dancing. I don't know those girls or what happened before I got there but you were very mean and aggressive. You don't have to be a that mean. I was just trying to figure out what was going on and why we couldn't dance" he said "I don't go to your job telling you how to work, don't come to mine to tell me." And then he told the other guys near him "don't let them back in." Referring to me and my friend I went there with.  I definitely won't return. Foran didn't say a word to the white girls that were also dancing.

reviews.author: Susie K.
reviews.description: After standing in line for 10min the bouncer came and told me that I needed to stand in another line very AGGRESSIVELY , I told him the bartender already took my order and I'm good he then proceeded to yell at me and tell me to move, the bartender J told him I was good and he went on some power trip. The owner Jesse then came and told me that I needed to leave.   Place is straight TRASH....

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.description: Cheap drinks and food.  There burgers are surprisingly very good.  Bartenders are always friendly.  So if you are in a budget but need some drinks and food this is the spot

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Enjoyed this bar. Has an inside with tables, chairs, and couches. The outside has porch swing chairs surrounding the bar. Mariachis on Friday were great!

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: The music is good but can get a little too loud. The drinks are good; poetry on Thursday was good the one time I went. It can get crowded, depending on which day you go, which is mainly Saturday night, and that wasn't very pleasant. They do have issues with keeping the soap and paper towels stocked. They have a food truck that usually serves chicken wings, pork chops, and sometimes tacos and egg rolls and sides like green beans, mac and cheese, etc. Overall it is a good time and a nice place to go.

reviews.author: Rachael B.
reviews.description: Nice bar for a HH. I hear Thur and Sunday are nice. They only serve food on select events. I went for the crawfish and shrimp platters for $15. I'm new here so brought my 5 yo daughter . Not a place for kiddies, but now I know. It was fine enough to eat and leave. Spicy crawfish, but good. Music was nice. If you like hip hop  love the swing chairs at the bar.  I'll be back for HH, drinks, and music.

reviews.author: Daryll B.
reviews.description: This is a pretty dirty looking bar. The Crawfish boils they put on are ridiculous. There were about 80 people here last Sunday for the $15 AYCE deal. Each time you get in line there are no less than 30 people in line. This went on for 3 hrs from the open at 2. By the way they were 45 mins late from the advertised start serving time.  Anyway, they give you one little french fry tray at a time (about 1/2 a lb of actual crawfish). The average grown Louisianan or hungry Texan can eat 5 lbs. That would be 10 trips at this rate.  After 4 trips, I gave up. I actually ate about 2 lbs for the $15. No difference than going to one of the local restaurants. I heard the day before for the Saturday boil, one man ate 23 trays.  I was also mad at the size of the Crawfish they were known as field runs, the tiniest ones with absolute zero tail meat. Besides my very first tray which was hot and delicious all the rest or cold to lukewarm.   I won't be back to this place. This place just seems like an overhyped sloppily run Place with music and DJs. The restrooms were filthy.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Strong drinks, good music, and Great service! Not sure what else to ask for in bar... It is a fun venue every time I've been in the past. They have an indoor and outdoor bar area.   You'll know if this is your kind of bar upon walking up to it from the parking lot. If it's not, then it's not; but if it is, then go on in! Originally I was just looking for something different, somewhere with a fun vibe and I found it here!  Lookin' forward to coming here during Crawfish Season!

reviews.author: Marie D.
reviews.description: This was my first time here. I had fun! The Mariachi was great and I appreciated the chips and salsa. We meet the owner and talked to him for a while. He was very nice. Next time we go we're gonna sit in the swings! The atmosphere it's chill and the happy hour specials were pretty good.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: This is a Crawfish Boil only review. We visited for All You Can Eat Crawfish on Sunday. We got there just before 1:30 PM and it's supposed to start at 2 PM, but it didn't get rolling until after 2:30 PM. It's $15/person (you pick up your wristband at the bar). It's supposed to include sausage, mini corn cobs, and potatoes. The sausage was in 1" pieces and the potatoes were sliced (not the little whole red potatoes you might expect). There were also bits of pineapple in it, for some reason. It can catch you off guard if you think it's an onion and you're not expecting something sweet. It was really dark inside the bar, so it was hard to tell at first, but there weren't actually any onions, so we figured it out pretty quickly. There isn't any shaded seating outside, which is why we ate inside. The owner indicated that he would be installing a shade awning, so there will be improvement there shortly.  The crawfish was very spicy, which we liked. Every portion I got came out hot, so no issues there. Each person with a wristband has to stand in line. They'll only give you 1 little tray at a time, which you can eat in about a minute, so it was a little annoying to hardly get any crawfish and then have to go stand in line again for 10 minutes to get another little dish of it. They need to get the bigger trays and hand it out in at least 1-2# portions plus the sides.  After our second tray each, they were already out of sausage and they hadn't been serving for very long. I didn't get any potatoes in trays 5-6, but I'm not sure if that's because they were out or I was just unlucky. After our 2nd ear of corn each, we were saying "no corn," so I'm not sure how long those lasted.  We stood in line for what felt like forever on our last trip - they had stopped serving at one point (presumably to take a break). I left my fiance at the front of the line and I went back to the table. I got 2 new cups of water, and I peeled the heads off a tray of crawfish. They weren't providing anything to put your trash in, so it was just piled up in the middle of the tiny table. I had to find a trash can to toss all the trash, then went to the restroom. While I was in there for a whole 2 minutes, someone decided to bus the table - trashing the 2 new cups of water, the tray of crawfish tails, and a tray of corn and potatoes. Who tf does that?? Super frustrating.  After that BS and standing in lines longer than eating crawfish, we decided to leave. We'd been there for 3 hours (half of that was waiting for the thing to start though). We only ended up eating 12 trays total, which was probably 5-6# of crawfish. I got 2 little ears of corn, and the equivalent of about 1 large potato, and maybe 0.25# of sausage. We felt like we at least got what we paid for, but we probably won't go back there. There are places that are better organized for the crowd and they don't run out of sides in the first half hour.  Note: you can also get chicken-on-a-stick for $6, but it's just frozen, breaded chicken fingers that they skewer and cook.They have remoulade for dipping (tastes ok) and Slap Ya Mama seasoning to dump on everything. The Revolver draught beer we were picking was $5 each, but it wasn't as cold as it should have been. We still got 3 of those though!

reviews.author: Trakidra G.
reviews.description: My first time coming here and I have to say it was fantastic! I almost felt like I was home eating crawfish!! Everyone was super friendly and the music was awesome! Not to mention the drinks. I'll be back for sure. Even though we came a little on the late side we were greeted and encouraged to partake in the crawfish boil! It was money well spent. I'm ready for the next once!

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, killer staff, and the best crawfish you can get on. Had a blast and can't wait to make it back down!

reviews.author: Felicila R.
reviews.description: Great place to come.drinks are good nice outside lounge.love it..great place to come after a hard day

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Beer and Crawfish!  I've never really heard of a crawfish bar, but this place has it going on! With a name like Bentley's, it's not as fancy and pretentious as you'd think it'd be. A name like Bentley's made me picture a place covered in marble serving Grey Poupon and caviar. This place is quite the opposite.  It's a dark bar with loud music inside. Sometimes, they bring in a band to play on a little stage that they have set up. They have a bunch of craft beers, many of which are somewhat hard to find. I don't think they have a single beer on draft- only bottles and cans.  The best feature of this bar is that they are usually serving up crawfish outside on the patio. They've taken over part of the parking lot, and are building permanent shade structures with picnic tables and a crawfish cooker and a large BBQ grill. They serve up all you can eat crawfish on the weekends. I know I can eat a ton of crawfish, especially ones like the ones they serve here- they're small, but spicy. To be honest, I've never signed up for the crawfish deal, but I do enjoy coming here to watch people stuff their faces with them, and then stand in line for some more. Everything on the outdoor patio is slightly sticky and smells like old crustaceans and hot sauce. The place could use an occasional good hosing down after all that crawfish juice.  It's a nice bar, especially on the outside. It's a great place to kick back outdoors with plenty of seating, and good beers.

reviews.author: Madison W.
reviews.description: Super friendly people and even better food. AYCE Crawfish for $20. This place wouldn't be the best for kids or big groups of people. But me and 3 of my friends had a wonderful time. They play great music and it's nice and cool outside on the patio. We'll be back

reviews.author: La Shon W.
reviews.description: Cool bar great service... I really enjoyed my self this past weekend with great music and drinks... I was hoping for the all you can eat crawfish

reviews.author: Jane R.
reviews.description: Amazing everything!  Friendly staff, great outdoor ambiance, freakin good food!  We got the Santa Fe and The Alamo wrap, with group beef. The ground beef used it the same for both, so the difference is really the other topping inside. We also got the fully loaded fries... Hands down, best fully loaded version I've had! The fries was prepared well, the toppings were generous. Just typing this out makes my mouth salivate already lol!  I wish we were close to this place, I'd always get their fries!

reviews.author: Samantha D.
reviews.description: They took our money and promised food but they weren't open!   The online system took our order and charged our card, but when we went to pick it up, there was absolutely no one there. Everything was dark and shut up tight( even though online it said they were open) with no sign or anything. We have repeatedly phoned them to check but they don't answer. While we figured out what to do, several other cars pulled up to pick up their online order, but of course, no one was there. Very unprofessional of them and disappointing. After I reached out to my community, I found out this is actually a very common thing, so I don't understand how they can remain in business. This is absolutely unacceptable, especially since they charged my card already.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: If you take 3009 from I-35, as if you're following the signs to the Natural Bridge Caverns, on the right side is a place called Wraptitude, which features amazing burgers, gourmet wraps, seasonal salads and tacos. There's even a kids menu so, just about everyone in your family will be happy.    Wraptitude is a rustic place with most of the tables outside either on a small deck or, fenced yard which includes a playground for the little ones. There's also a small sit down bar inside as well. I had The Maverick burger which includes cheese, avocado, bacon and 1000 island dressing. There's also a Goose burger (are you noticing a theme here?), Viper Tacos and so much more.  This is not a fancy place so, don't get all gussied-up but, it's a nice family place to bring the kids out, meet up with friends.  The staff are extremely friendly and polite.   I hope you have a chance to enjoy this very casual place and with the weather beginning to warm up, eating outside will be fun again.

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: Found this gem while treating a Veteran to a lunch on Veterans Day. It's a nice small indoor/large outdoor restaurant. Upon arrival parking was easy and they have plenty of room. You can see a lot of picnic tables and small playground set.   I'm giving 3 stars because the lady who took our order was super rude. I would ask a question and it was met with so much attitude and unwillingness to help. If it wasn't for me treating a friend to lunch I would have completely walked away from this place.   The bright side was that the food turned out really good. We split an order of sweet potato fries bc it's a huge serving. I ordered the Santa Fe wrap which is Pepper Jack, black beans, corn, rice, chipotle spread with avocado (vegetarian option). It was really pleasing, wrap done right. They also have a nice selection room of craft beers.

reviews.author: Casey P.
reviews.description: Great food... wraps, burgers and fries are the best. Couple that with an amazing drink selection and it's a great place to hang out with friends or family. they're a return spot for us!!!

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I recommend this place, cause when it is nice outdoors, this is a great place to be. Also the food is great. To me, once they change the buns on the burgers, I want a burger now. I didn't like the buns before, so I started getting the wraps, which are delicious, now I'm hooked on the BLT. Plus this place has a friendly staff, they do get busy, so the wait for food may be awhile, but the beer selection is pretty decent.   One draw back is the bathroom, just one.

reviews.author: Laura Grace K.
reviews.description: Always love coming here! Food is fantastic and has its own unique flavors, and the staff always make you feel at home! Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Kristin N.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times now and I've thoroughly enjoyed each visit. Parking is a little strange but I haven't had any issues. Way more outdoor seating than indoor. (Which I love). You can sub a beyond meat patty in any of their burgers. The food is yummy, the beer is good, and the staff was super sweet.

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: If I could give half stars, I would give this place 3.5, but it just didn't deserve 4 stars.   The staff was nice. They weren't wearing masks or gloves, so keep that in mine when going.  The had a little park thing and a bunch of outside seating, so it's great if you have a family!  We didn't get to try any of the beers.  The Cali club was good, but there was nothing special about it.  The maverick was good but again, there was nothing special about it.  The loaded fries were good, but it wasn't as presentable as I could make it myself at home. It also felt like it had waited out for a while before it got to us.  There was nothing really special about this place, but the food was ok.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We had been wanting a try this place for a quite sometime and since we were in the area, we did. We had the Cali wrap and the loaded fries. Both were okay, nothing that I would go back for.  Also, there is very limited parking and inside seating. So if it's crowded and hot, cold, rainy etc., you will be sitting outside.

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: Why did I wait so long to try this place? Wraptitude was on the way to the lake so we finally stopped by.  The outdoor seating is nicely shaded. This place is also dog friendly. Our waitress greeted us and introduced herself. I am horrible with names, but the receipt said Martha. She was friendly had the Rattlesnake Burger Bowl and my husband had the Greek Wrap.

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: Came in for a quick lunch with the hubby. The waitress at the bar was nice. We both hd tea and it was good nothing special. My husband had the 46 burger wrap. It was ok. The sauce tasted like thousand island. Nothing made it special. The menu stated it came with fries, but he didn't get any. I ordered the Hollywood taco. The shredded chicken was GREAT. The price for what I got was high. Just a normal sized taco you would make at home. The tortilla tasted like an H‑E‑B tortilla, not bad just ok. The meat was topped with a few kernels of corn and fresh diced jalapeño. The verde sauce was mediocre. Again nothing special. I added fries to my order and they were good, Very crispy. They were out of fried pickles which was a huge let down since it was one of the reasons we chose to give this place a shot, but I'm not holding it against them with the supply shortages going on right now.  Overall everything was ok, but didn't seem worth the drive or the price.

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: So we're heading to the caverns and wanted lunch.  We ARE NOT chic filet kinda people!!  Found this place on yelp and it was along the route we were taking.  OK yes, it is somewhat of a hole in the wall, or for that matter quaint, picturesque, salon, on the side of the road. Walked in and were greeted by Heidi (one of the owners), she told us to pick where we wanted to sit, so we saddled up to the bar.  Yes, small bar, but very adequate, plenty of tables to sit inside, and outside.   Craving a burger, but not wanting the bun, started reviewing the wraps.  My husband and I both ordered wraps and a order of onion rings.   My Santa Fe with ground beef was wonderful, the cheese was creamy, the beef tender with just a hint of spice.  My husband enjoyed the Alamo wrap and it disappeared.  OH, don't let me forget the salsa she gives you with the wrap, I don't remember what it was but it was super with kick!  The onion rings we shared (small order), was the perfect amount for two people, they were fresh and hot!  We are not dippers, so we did not take Heidi up on the sauces she offered for the rings. If ever back in this neck of the woods, we WILL be back!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Came here with the family after doing Natural Bridge Caverns. First, be prepared to sit outside, there's not much room inside, especially during the social distancing times. However, even though it was over 90 degrees outside the shade and breeze kept it cool enough to be pleasant. Kids had a playground to okay on - though it was a bit past it's prime.   The ordering seemed a bit haphazzard, which seemed to be due to only have one employee working front of house despite it being rush hour lunch time. This caused me to have to stand at the bar for considerable amounts of time waiting to order or when I went to get a beer. Hopefully this was just someone not showing up for a shift and not a perpetual issue.   Now for the food. I had a Santa Fe wrap. Standard Mexican ingredients, but all together tasty. My wife's burger wrap with fries in the wrap looked quite good. Kids chicken strips were solid quality. The fries had good flavor and crunchy outsides. Beer selection was surprisingly good (Blood and Honey automatically  means I'm happy).   Solid, if not spectacular experience.

reviews.author: Shelia C.
reviews.description: I was excited to try this place and loved the outdoor area. My friend and I ordered the Santa Fe wrap and we were quite disappointed. The entire wrap was rice, it was so hard to eat because of the amount of rice made the wrap so dry. It hardly had any chicken, mine had maybe a 3 little pieces of chicken bits and about 6 black beans. Just a drop of sauce and no cheese or corn. I should have taken a pic but I had to open mine up to remove the big glob of rice. Same with my friends. Our sons loved their burger and grilled cheese. Next time I will try a burger but for being called wraptitude, I was expecting a good wrap.

reviews.author: Sergio M.
reviews.description: Service could be better but I love from scratch good food always good and dope area for kids to play at

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: We stopped by after spending the morning at Natural Bridge caverns. We ordered a few burger wraps, chicken strips, and the surf burger from the kids menus. The food was really tasty and fries were delicious. The main issue here was that they seemed to be understaffed and weren't set up very well for social distancing. They have a very small seating area and bar inside and several picnic tables and outdoor seating options. While you can spread out just fine outside, you have to go inside of the crowded small building to place your order. It was a very small space with too many people inside close together. Also, the fountain drinks and cups were self-serve set up right next to where everyone was standing. If they had online or outside ordering so that you could avoid going inside, it would really improve things.

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: This was the 1st meal while in Texas, and we dare say it was superb. The guy running the restaurant was super chill and energetic. The atmosphere was relaxing with the eclectic decor.  The hubs had the burger wrap while I had 3 tacos (pork, asada, and avutarian). We also shared the half-loaded fries.  The fries were amazing! Usually with these types of dishes, the fries become soggy or aren't even crispy to begin with. These had a crunch even to the last few pieces. And not to mention, it was loaded with a lot of beef and bacon pieces. What a value for the amount of meat that's in it.  His burger wrap was seriously da bomb. All the 46 sauce and ingredients stuffed inside the wrap was just oozing outwards. The wrap consisted of beef, bacon bits, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions -- pretty much what a burger is. Biting into this was a wowing moment. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  My tacos were okay. They weren't superb (standard lettuce, cheese, lime, and tomatillo salsa). I wouldn't rec it as this place isn't known for their tacos:  * Asada: The avocados were creamy. This was prob the freshest and tastiest of the 3 tacos. * Avutarian: The flavors were faint at most. There wasn't much wow or anything that made this taco look nor taste diff. * Pork: The flavors were lacking, and the pork looked super bland (see the only close-up pic worth taking).
