Everything about this experience was 5 stars minus my taco choices. The loaded fries and burger wrap were just mind-blowing delicious and at a great price.  Though there were limited parking spaces in the front, the back had plenty of nooks and crannies you could squeeze your car into.

reviews.author: Wilma K.
reviews.description: Just had a great burger. We love the Mavericks burger their fires are fantastic we'll seasoned and hot. My husband loves the beer here, McConahas.

reviews.author: Jonathan P.
reviews.description: foods good but as a black man im always accompanied with some death stares in short theyre probably racist

name: Down on Grayson
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Krissia M.
reviews.description: Great first time experience at Down on Grayson. We came in on a busy Thursday night and although we were told there would be a 20-30 minute wait, we were seated in 5 mins for a party of two.   When eating out somewhere new I like to order an app, salad and entree to get a good idea of a restaurant's menu. It's very rare for me to visit a restaurant where every dish I order is delicious as typically one dish is good and the rest is meh. Well surprisingly that was not the case at Grayson. I don't drink alcohol so even my unsweetened iced tea was good.   I ordered the Thai steak salad which had a light citrus dressing that wasn't overly oily or heavy. The meat was tender, the greens were chopped for ease of eating, and there was a nice mix of toppings consisting of cooked soft noodles, crunchy almonds, and mangoes and onions. So overall tasty and nice texture wise.   For my entree I went with the grouper Veracruz. No complaints here. I enjoyed the side of petite carrots drenched in honey butter.   My favorite were definitely the Parmesan fries. I'm not a fan of ordering fries at restaurants as they tend to be too thick and starchy but decided to try the fries here nonetheless. Their Parmesan fries were slim, delicious, and crispy and weren't heavily coated just topped with soft grated Parmesan (not the Kraft variety either). It almost tasted like there was a hint of truffle oil and it paired well with their chunky garlic aioli.   Definitely coming back here again for the salad, fries, and dessert which I have yet to try.

reviews.author: Niki T.
reviews.description: Down on Grayson is a favorite of ours in The Pearl District. The ambiance both inside and out is perfection and the service is always top notch! Such a perfect eclectic mix of food options and stellar bar service makes this a repeat haunt for sure. Best Dirty Martini in SATX! Make sure to ask for the blue cheese stuffed olives

reviews.author: Melissa I.
reviews.description: This place was absolutely delicious! I can see why it was so crowded, even at 1pm.   The jalapeño pimento cheese was delicious as a starter, so take my advice, come hungry, and have a little bit of everything! Don't forget to add the Parmesan fries to your sandwich. You won't regret it!

reviews.author: Marissa V.
reviews.description: Ordered the crispy chicken sandwich with chips. This is hands down the best crispy chicken sandwich I've had.

reviews.author: Tiesha G.
reviews.description: You have to get the Parmesan Fries! I keep coming back to this restaurant because the food is so so GOOD! I'm going to tell you everything you need to order. First, like I said, the Parmesan Fries. These are some of the best fries I've ever had! That shredded parmesan, roasted minced garlic, and parsley on fries is addictive! And in my opinion, they have the best burger in Texas. It's called the Char King, and I always get mine cooked medium, and ADDING BACON is a must! Even though it's $3 extra, it's worth every penny. If you want something on the lighter side, their Brussel Sprouts are phenomenal! Tonight I tried the Meatball appetizer for the first time, and those were remarkable too! And the Strawberry Frozen Marg, with sugar around the rim is perfection!   The service here has always been great. Tonight our waiter was Clayton, and he was super nice and super attentive. I would catch him glancing at us occasionally to see if we were ok, and I thought: Aw! How nice! He kept saying things like: Let's get "our" appetizers out here. And: What can I get "us" to drink? And I thought: Aw! it's like he's eating with us!  I also really like the vibe of the restaurant. I would say it's rustic, hip, and chill. The entrance is beautiful because you have to walk through the outdoor patio to get inside the restaurant. There's these beautiful lights on the trees, outdoor heaters and fire pits. It's really quite romantic. There's also an outside patio bar seating that faces the interstate, and a nice long indoor bar. I think if you're going on a date, meeting up with friends, taking someone out from out of town, this place would be a great option.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Stopped by Down on Grayson for lunch yesterday.  Great atmosphere and friendly staff with the best outdoor dining at the Pearl.  Started with a wedge salad with bacon and tasty blue cheese dressing...excellent.   The roasted brussel sprouts with house made sirracha sauce didn't disappoint - perfect and a nice changeThe beef in the sliders was full of flavor and juicy.  My favorite is the jalapeño pimento cheese - creamy and crazy good.  I love a   good pimento cheese!  The watermelon daiquiri was the best!   Fresh muddled watermelon and Bacardi without the grainy fruit taste!  Great hangout for a Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: Lorena M.
reviews.description: Delicious!!!  Carb overload was my mission, and it was achieved.  Great patio area for those days you want to sit outside and enjoy the weather.  Top notch place to enjoy the environment and the food.

reviews.author: Leslie H.
reviews.description: What a lovely restaurant! The indoor seating was very nice, but the out door areas were what brought us in, as they welcome dogs Very large outdoor areas with lots of tables  Savanah was our server, she was very sweet and accommodating  It was late so we both opted for tomato soup and amazing grilled cheese...i couldn't finish mine, so filling but so good! They do offer some vegan options Very clean Slightly pricey but not crazy

reviews.author: Theodore C.
reviews.description: In town for business and walked to the Pearl brewery along the river walk...Grayson is set in a nice area and it's a really nice walk if you're inclined.   The atmosphere at Grayson is nice and has a trendy feel.   I ordered the crispy fish and a spicy margarita.  I will say the title of the crispy fish dish doesn't do it justice.  It was an amazing pan fried snapper that had a very unique flavor.    I didn't really enjoy the spicy margarita, and would recommend trying a different cocktail  The outdoor seating area was really neat with  plenty of seating and fire pits to sit by.  I recommend trying this place out

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Came for dinner on a Sunday evening with friends. We walked in around 7:45 PM and had a party of 5 and had to wait about 45-50 minutes for a table. Once we were seated, it took a while for food to come out.   Crispy Brussels: really good! Super crispy and comes with a yummy sauce. Great savory app for sharing.  Lavender lemonade: pretty solid cocktail. It tasted more like lemonade than lavender but it's sweet and refreshing.  Chicken and kale salad: heavy on the kale. The chicken, avocado, and cashews are chopped up and mixed in and the kale is also chopped and marinated in the dressing so it's not tough to chew. The dressing is light, which I appreciate. The chicken pieces are small but kind of tough and dry. It's a pretty big salad and very filling.  Everyone agreed their food was pretty average and nothing to rave about, plus it's kind of pricey as expected of the location. The restaurant itself has a nice vibe with a cool bar and TVs. But the average food combined with such a long wait only warrants 3 stars from me.

reviews.author: Becca C.
reviews.description: This was a HUGE disappointment. We came because we were given a gift card. Evidently they don't take reservations, so we ended up with an hour and a half wait on a WEDNESDAY. It was my birthday, however, so we made do.   In their favor, the building is quite pretty, parking was not hard, and their outside space was really lovely. We passed the wait time fairly pleasantly outdoors with some pretty good drinks. Still, for a Wednesday...   As for the food, I didn't care for the Caesar salad. I got the top sirloin, and he the skirt steak. I found the sear on mine to be simply too hard and crusty, and it made for a poor experience eating. His steak tasted good and was well cooked, but we were again mutually disappointed in the chimichurri- the taste was fairly good, but the texture was simply off. The herbs were chopped in such a way that they were absolutely the perfect size to get stuck in your teeth. I've actually considered using the word "unpleasant" 3-4 times during this review and, with the exception of the drinks, I'm afraid that generally describes my experience here.   Okay, so here's the last part, which I have debated over and over writing. Please note that there is NO PROOF this is true, but merely reflective of my personal experience: I believe I got food poisoning there. I am not a medical professional and I can't be sure, but Down on Grayson was all I'd eaten that day that could have reasonably done it. I suspect my Caesar salad, but to be honest I don't care. I was completely miserable the day after. So take this how you will.

reviews.author: Jeanette G.
reviews.description: Whenever we've come here, the food has not disappointed!! Everything we have tried, down to the drinks, has been delightful!!!  This time, we had a shorter visit. I had the Reuben Sandwich. I definitely recommend it if youre into Reubens. It has garlic toasted bread, crispy while still remaining soft. The corned beef was on point and the I really enjoyed the sauerkraut, it had a balanced flavor, sometimes saurkraut can be too intense for me and I don't enjoy it, but I loved it on this sandwich and the thousand islands dressing went perfectly with the sandwich.  My boyfriend devoured the Char King!!   The reason I do not give this place 5 stars is because the service here has been hit or miss. We have gotten excellent service at times and have also had times when it has not been good. One specific time, our server took an extremely long time to come take our order, did not check in when we wanted to order drinks the first time nor to order more drinks, and was frankly just apathetic overall.  I still come back for great food, beautiful atmosphere, and usually good service, and would definitely recommend.  PARKING***This restaurant has its own section in the parking structure designated to its patrons. The parking area is right in front of the restaurant Josephine Street, and on the intersection between Ave A and East Jospehine St.

reviews.author: Allison A.
reviews.description: Visiting San Antonio for the week for work and I came here for dinner twice. There was no wait during the week for dinner, and they have a nice indoor and outdoor space.   The fish tacos were fantastic and fresh, I would 100% order them again. I got the grouper sandwich the second trip, it was good but I wouldn't order them again.   The spicy margarita was great, I ordered it both times that I was there.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: After many dine ins, Down on Grayson literally has my heart. It's located at the Pearl for one and as the sun goes down the lights are lit up which is very romantic and just sets the mood for any occasion. Who wouldn't enjoy such delicious entrées, beautiful presentation of cocktails, and refreshing ambiance. The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful and lively. Such an all rounded place, perfect after a long day at the office and a great end to a long work week.

reviews.author: Meagan J.
reviews.description: A steady standby of the Pearl area and a reasonable place to get a beer outdoors, but the food has gotten reliably "passable." A plate of nachos arrived tonight with a baker's dozen chips covered in congealed shredded cheddar. An extra $8 gets you guac and a greasy ladling of ground beef. No salsa or sour cream. There were some chopped carrots though. You could also go with the crisp Brussel sprouts. Most of the other dishes are whelming at best.  You could probably do better with your $16, but you can't beat the location I guess.

reviews.author: Walter S.
reviews.description: Such a cute place.  Such a great location.  Such incredible potential. Such a missed opportunity.  Having visited Down on Grayson several times I have always found myself feeling underwhemled when all is said and done.   There is plenty of parking to be found in the area so we've never had an issue getting to Down on Grayson.  They do have a beautiful outdoor space, which we've sat at as well as ample indoor seating, which we've also sat at.  Indoor is fine but outdoor is where ya wanna be....weather permitting.  Service has always been acceptable.  Nothing stand-out or to praise but also nothing terrible or warranting any sort of negative attention.  I guess, for me, where Down on Grayson falls short is the food.  The onion rings are good but greasy and a little goes a long way with those.  The Crispy Brussels are fine and the salads I've tried, acceptable.  The "El Moderno" Nachos claim to be an "authentic version of this south of the border favorite" but if that's auténtico then gimmie the cheap, knock-off version any day.  Meh. At. Best.    Now look-obviously, I am in the minority here and maybe where they shine is their meat-based menu offerings that this vegetarian doesn't eat, so take my opinion with a grain of salt if you're more on the carnivore end of the spectrum. For me, this isn't a place I suggest nor is it a place I must take people.  It's mostly a really pretty patio to grab a drink and then head elsewhere for dinner.  That's my ideal Down on Grayson experience.

reviews.author: Madison S.
reviews.description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Everything I've had here has been really good! I would recommend the parmesan fries as a starter, they are iNCREDIBLE! My favorite menu items are the chopped con and the fish tacos. The vibes here are also incredible. The patio is super nice and dog-friendly. The service is also always great. Please check it out!!

reviews.author: Jen H.
reviews.description: I've passed Down on Grayson many times while at the Pearl and was finally able to dine here for a late lunch/early dinner. Covered reserved parking (for this restaurant only) is available just a few steps away from the entrance. Since it was an off hour (3:30pm), there was no wait for a table. We chose to sit inside, but there is seating outdoors as well. They are also dog-friendly (outdoor seating only).  I started off with a Ranch Water, which has dulce vida blanco tequila, fresh lime juice, and topo chico. The Topo Chico was a bit flat, but the drink aesthetics was on point. Not really worth the $12 price tag in my opinion, but I had to try it since I've never officially tried ranch water before.  The Shishito Peppers ($12) appetizer was definitely a great surprise. The portion size of the peppers was way bigger than I expected, and the peppers themselves were cooked very nicely with a slightly blistered skin. The accompanying sriracha mayo balanced the heat of the peppers.  For the main, I got Fish Tacos ($16). They were one of the best fish tacos I've ever had! The large filets of fish were perfectly cooked and juicy, and the spiciness of the seasoning paired well with the fixin's (i.e. cole slaw, avocado, tomato, red onion, salsa, lime juice, cilantro) on top. It's a must-try item!  Service was also great from beginning to end. Our waitress was prompt and very friendly but didn't overdo it with checking up on us. Even the hostess seated us with a smile, which many restaurant hosts/hostesses fail to do.  Definitely a great place to grab delicious food and drinks!  [An added bonus is the decor in the women's restroom--cute, framed paintings of dogs!]

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Decided to stop by for an early dinner after returning some golf shorts that were SEE THROUGH at Nike. Was not expecting much even though it has pretty solid reviews but to my surprise everything was great!   I started off with the Grayhound cocktail which was basically grapefruit juice and vodka. If you like grapefruit, you have got to get this drink. Super refreshing after a nice walk from the parking lot in the 100 degree weather!   For the appetizer I decided to try out the Shishito peppers and they were pretty good. Perfectly charred and it also came with a light dipping sauce that did not take away from the natural flavors of the pepper.   The main attraction for me was the fire roasted chicken. Tuesday afternoon means we must choose healthier options so of course I had to go with a chicken breast. The chicken breast was huge and was attached to the bone with a nice fire roasted skin on top. The breast itself was nice and tender but not too tender. I'd say it was a perfectly grilled/fire roasted chicken breast. It was also lightly sauced with a honey sauce which complimented the corn well because the corn had just a little heat to it. The corn was sweet and fresh and you could tell that it comes from the cob instead of a frozen bag.   Our waitress was cool too and was very friendly and the service was great. Overall this is a great spot to hang out at because they have good food and a wide variety of drinks!

reviews.author: Ada F.
reviews.description: down on Grayson is probably one of the few places I would never get tired of but I also go once every couple of months haha. The waiters I've had have great customer service and checked in me pretty frequently.  I haven't had any bad experiences here. I ordered a michelada and that wasn't as great as I expected but the food made up for it.  I will admit that I always get this dish so I don't have an opinion on anything else but my dish never disappoints.

name: Liberty Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: P C.
reviews.description: Another fabulous brunch experience today at Liberty!  Delicious food, HiGHLy Covid conscious and hard working employees, plus superb drinks-THE famous bloody mary!  Each time we come never disappointed-this time the wife had the eggs benedectinos and I had the simple breakfast. Also we indulged in the fabulous coconut custard-killer good! Can't express enough how much we appreciate Liberty's stance on mask requirements....we need more of this in the community-thank you for your strong leadership. We are still in a pandemic and this stance keeps people safe-us coming back for more. Keep the fire going!   *Location/Access/Convenience:  4* *Ambiance:  4*  *Cleanliness:  4* *Food Taste/Quality:  5* *Service:  5* *Price/Value:  5* *Pay Process:  5* *Takeout/Pickup Experience:  N/A* *Covid Conscious:  5*  *Likeliness of Returning:  5*  ***Overall Score: 42/9=4.6

reviews.author: Ms. Chew B.
reviews.description: This place is a delight. We came on Halloween evening after an adventurous weekend. Charming neighborhood and SUCH a beautiful building. We got a little lost exiting after dinner, and ended up inadvertently exploring the various dining areas. It's really impressive and spacious and each room is interesting with its own style. It's startlingly cool - but do I belong here? Do you? We both do! How? It's welcoming in addition to the impressive physical environment. Really lovely staff. FANTASTIC music. Somebody's got exquisite taste in there. I was frustrated for a millisecond when a table of empty-nesters sat down nearby and their chatter drowned out the playlist, but then the eavesdropping was great too. So I'm going to go ahead and credit Liberty Bar with that portion of my experience as well: I appreciate the acoustics! - Perfect for fun conversation with your table companion OR listening in on another group of people trying not to insult their own children too much. Ach. Those children - they were so lazy... but had the biggest hearts!  So you don't care about this? What? Okay - the food: DELICIOUS. We had the fish taco appetizer, a salad with asparagus and portobello mushrooms, and a really, really fabulous lamb burger (medium: perfection). The fries were crispy-perfect. Oh yeah - some chocolate cake with ice cream for dessert. So good. I never get dessert at restaurants, but if you do or if you don't - consider getting it here.  We came to San Antonio for a little birthday / long-weekend getaway and had a blast. The Liberty Bar was one of the highlights. If I move[d] here, I'd want to find a place as close as possible to the Liberty Bar so I could become a regular. Good gawd, it's life-affirming.

reviews.author: Teofila R.
reviews.description: We got seated immediately at an outside table in front of the restaurant. Nice patio table with sun umbrellas providing shade. We ordered the chicken tostadas. Delicious ! Fresh avocado slices on top! Fresh salsa just ask for it! Great waitress  Cabernet Sauvignon $8!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: We were exploring King Williams area and the architecture of this building had drawn us in. The food here is just as unique as the building itself with a welcoming front patio. Dined in during the weekend on a cold evening. This place is much different than any restaurant I've been to in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Damaris C.
reviews.description: Our food was delicious. The baked bread and fried chick peas were very good. We had The chicken achiote, fettuccine and falafel pita and we all enjoyed our meals. On a bad note and why we don't give it 5 stars is that we waited over an hour for our food and the overall service was slow. We were seated at a table that the floor vibrated (not sure if this is the case throughout the whole restaurant) but to be honest it was annoying. The restaurant is charming and unique. The food is delicious and worth a try.

reviews.author: Jeremy S.
reviews.description: Service was great, food was delicious, drinks were strong, and the atmosphere was nice. Totally underestimated the French toast. That sucker was big and GOOD! We will be back. If you're looking for a good place for brunch, look no further.

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Great place for a last minute brunch! We were actually in line for Guenther House, but couldn't wait two hours.  Instead, we decided to check out Liberty Bar.  There were seating availabilities and a staff to get us seated right away.  It did take a little extra time for us to get our drink orders in, but no complaints. Food came out in a timely manner compared to time to order and everything was delicious.  I recommend the eggs Benedict which comes with extra thin and crunchy fries that are my favorite!  Also, can't go wrong with the french toast that was soaked for 48 hours!  We felt like fatties, but well worth it.  I definitely recommend brunch here with the quiet ambience and great food.

reviews.author: Christina F.
reviews.description: The salmon was crazy good. The vegetables and the rice paired great with the salmon same with the chimichurri sauce. I recommend

reviews.author: Isaias L.
reviews.description: Love the atmosphere here, been here a couple times and never had a bad experience. Food is great, personally love the Beirut Flashback. Great service every time as well. Definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Mynta H.
reviews.description: We have arrived with a party of 8 close to closing time, the entire staff was so polite, they seated us with no problem.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the food and the cocktails. All of our entrées had so much flavor and was well presented!

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: Very good food, but seem fanatical about COVID and masks when it's not necessary anymore. I'll eat elsewhere until they revise their policy.

reviews.author: Sheila M.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere. Drinks were great. Food was awesome. We had excellent service   Quaint

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Awesome Environment and very creative food. Watch the address close because it's not obvious this is the right location, as it looks like an old Convent which is exactly what it is. Painted bright pink concrete walls will greet you. Being a Sunday at late lunch only the upstairs was open but there is ample seating downstairs for busier times. Nice long bar with just about any kind of alcohol you can imagine and a very fun creative menu. Grab a book and sit down to read if you liked as there are plenty in book shelves on the walls. The only reason why I didn't rate it a perfect five was due to the service. It really wasn't very busy but we had a hard time finding our waiter when we needed him. He seemed to be tired and didn't make any suggestions about the menu or seemed excited to be there. Other than that it was a great experience and we definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Great sound track, music and dessert. Are at the bar on half price wine night. Really a great date night place. Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Matt L.
reviews.description: Took the whole family for brunch. The service was friendly and the food was delicious.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Great service and atmosphere. We went for Sunday brunch and started with perfect Bloody Marys. Loved the food as well.

reviews.author: Jamie S.
reviews.description: I had a great overall experience at the Liberty Bar. Currently, they are only offering outdoor dining but they have a great outdoor area with numerous tables, palm trees, and string lights which makes for a nice ambiance. While the service was a bit slow on a Saturday night, the waiters were friendly and kept us updated. We started with the bread assortment which must have had 4 or 5 different types of bread, all of which were good. I had the falafel sandwich as my main and it was a very large portion. I really enjoyed the dish and came with an option of a side salad or fries.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be challenging, but the food here is excellent.  Steaks cooked to perfection and wonderful starter items. Great craft beers!!! The absence of their steak tartare and a ho-hum wine selection are its only pitfalls.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: Where to eat on a busy Saturday night out during the peak in the pandemic? Outside! In the cold! We stumbled into Liberty Bar because we were specifically looking to eat in South Town and eat outside. Unfortunately for us, Liberty Bar's owner has refused to buy outdoor heating- we were told outdoor dining is only because of the pandemic. Well, we decided to eat and run- bad decision, here's why: the cost is exorbitant for the food!  My burger was small and the sourdough bun was greasy as hell. The side salad had a dressing that also tasted like oil. The good news was the plate suggested by the waiter- beef tips, was a hit. Our margaritas had tequila but were served in super small glasses. I was floored by the cost of our meal- 90 dollars. Bank robbery for the food- with the cost so high... buy a few outdoor heaters! Two stars for the amazing waitstaff but the food, atmosphere and price results in  'Stay Away!!'

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I have always loved the vibes at liberty bar. Such a fun spot in Southtown, picture worthy!   They are currently open during COVID with outside seating only. It seems as though they are still figuring that all out. We went over this past weekend and got on the waitlist but their systems are off as they don't seem to have a host/hostess and their waitstaff are left to figure out who gets seated, when and where. Of course, we will always be patient with wait staff these days as they are figuring out how to work in this new environment.   There drinks are phenomenal, we got the mimosas and bloody Maria's. I highly recommend the bloody Maria's!

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: It was a Daddy-Daughter night @claudehoppers.sa  A night of great fellowship and good food and drinks. Finally, sunny weather to enjoy the outdoors.  Donna and I shared the margarita flight while Donna's Dad tried the thirsty goat. The passion fruit was balanced but the mixed berry was uber sweet. Dad and I shared the fish and chips, which was decent. I think I've been spoiled with Rosey's big fish. Donna's Dad also had the fish and chips and Donna had the pizza - half triple meat and half prosciutto and arugula. I had a slice of the triple meat and the sausage was on the salty side.  We'll have to do this again

reviews.author: Danielle K.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, selection of drinks (huge variety of beers on draft and many cocktail selections too) and there's really fun karaoke on Thursdays! It's such good energy and the DJ is a real treat. If I lived here, I'd go every Thursday. It's a local, small place with a great vibe. Definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: It was a fun relaxing family atmosphere. Staff was friendly and explained all beers on tap if needed. They had a business come in that made 1/2 burgers! Great experience and definitely I am coming back.

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: The place is small and intimate inside with a nice open patio outside. The atmosphere and its patrons were very chill and fun. People were laughing and enjoying each others company. There aren't servers so you have to go to the bar to order food and drinks. The menu is small for food (bar food) but there was a wealth of beers on tap. Bonus: two different types of Yuengling but no Black and Tan. Texas may have to wait a while longer for that one to get here.   The female bartender was a little (a lot) lost. Each time I said an item I wanted she said, "is that it?" which made me think that she wasn't taught the art up upselling yet but that's another story. I ordered food and my drink and then my husband ordered his food and drink. He offered a card and she said she "didn't think she needed that" but then put our order as to-go. ??? We went back to our table and realized that other tables had table tents so I went back and asked if I needed a number and they were like, oh yea! How about this number? And handed me a table tent. We waited about 40 minutes for wings and meatballs.   The Yuengling on tap - not warm but not cold. Meh.  The wine - La Crema Pinot noir. I ask the female bartender if they had Pinot Noir and she said, "oh this?" with a very confused look on her face and showed me a bottle of Chardonnay. Um, no.   Anyway, our food was finally brought out. The wings had a decent flavor but they weren't hot and they were slimy and gummy. Yuck. He asked for blue cheese and he got ranch and one empty and dirty ramekin??? The meatballs were previously frozen, in my opinion, but weren't too bad. But they weren't hot either.  In the middle of waiting on our food, the female bartender came up and tried to had us a very watered down drink I had noticed at the bar when ordering twenty minutes prior. She asked if we ordered this drink and when we said no, she continued to ask around to find the right person.   The piece de resistance was our bill. Everything was of a normal price but my glass of wine...was TEN DOLLARS. La Crema normally sells for about 12-15 for a bottle. I get a mark up to make a profit, but dude. That's just rude.    This place truly has potential but they need to step it up a notch on hot food and maybe a once around from the bartender to check on patrons and to bus some tables. I say this because a gentleman next to us very jokingly but vocally said, "pardon me while I bus my table" as he went back and forth 3 times to empty his table of empty glasses and dishes from the people at his table.   On the pulse side, everyone was very cordial and had great attitudes.  Over all, I give it a 6.1.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Claude hoppers has been on our list for a long time and we finally were able to check it out! They have an extensive list of draft beers/ciders including local options. They also have a full bar/shots/liquor. They have an awesome vibe with indoor and outdoor seating. We were there in a Friday night and they had live music playing. Bartenders were friendly, great drink options, amazing vibe, we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: KATE T.
reviews.description: November 2021 UPDATE: New owners and the place is great!  Happy Hour 3-7 every day - $4 beers and other drink specials.  Super clean and nice.   So glad to be able to put Claude Hoppers back into our rotation.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: The place is teetering a 3/4 star.  Nice little bar with beer and liquor options. The owners make  dumplings which is the specialty for the spot. We've had various samplings of them and they are all delicious.   Suggestions- bathrooms could use a good cleaning and freshen up. Very high-end part of town the bathroom not in high standard could be a turnoff.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Kourt J.
reviews.description: If you want to take a trip to little Mexico this is your spot. If you request any music outside of Latin you will waste your money and have it changed.

reviews.author: Heather K.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere - wonderful place to watch football games. The drinks are great (Strong) and the staff is really friendly.  Glad that it's under new ownership they have changed this place around drastically!!

reviews.author: Karin P.
reviews.description: My all women's volunteer organization hosted a fund raiser trivia night at this bar.  When I got there, I was worried we wouldn't have enough room or tables for the group, but we ended up being fine. It's a small place for a large group, but they were attentive and accommodating. There seemed to be a limited staff working (maybe 3?) but the service was good.   Food menu is small but has some good looking options. It's not on the overhead electronic screens (drinks only) but there are laminated menus around. And pictures posted on the business' Yelp page.  They also have a water cooler (like the kind you have at football games) so you can get water whenever you want.   This is a fun little bar in a strip of other businesses. It may get looked over but if you are in the area, it would be a good place to check out.   The fun: Lots of drink choices with a wide variety of IPAs. All 4 people at our table enjoyed what they had. The Purple Haze was a hit with another at our table. I enjoyed the Crackberry cider. It was a little more tart than I usualoy like, but I thought it was a decent cider. Also some canned and bottled beverages. Max was behind the bar for our event, and he was very friendly. He also handled our large group well.   The less than ideal: The electronic menu keeps changing what is shown on the screen. There are 2 screens. There are 2 pages for the drink menu. However, the part of the menu displayed on each screen changes when the circle at the bottom fills up. It's not really enough time to read everything on one screen before it changes and you have to try to find your place again on the other screen. And some of the drink listed online aren't on the screen (specifically the 1 of 2 tap ciders I saw online). Oh, and there is only 1 women's restroom.

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: My first "beer only" type of pub, and also my introduction to Geeks Who Drink Pub trivia. Claude Hoppers is pretty far out of my way but it's still a grand time when I get to go. They have a nice selection of beer, on par with your local Big Hops, and a mix of high and low seating, as well as a nice outdoor patio.  I had a first date here and when he went to the bathroom, the bartender was eavesdropping a bit and excitedly ran up to me to squeal, "Is this a first date!? He's SO hot, where did you find him!?" So that was pretty adorable.  Pub Trivia is always a blast here, too. It's hosted by Geeks Who Drink, whose format I absolutely love. Build up a team, have a pint, and spend an evening at Claude Hoppers!

reviews.author: Amanda G.
reviews.description: Kirsten was by far the most welcoming and nicest bartender. We enjoyed talking to her and learning about Claude Hoppers. The beer selection was good, they have some craft beer and hoping to get more. They have only been open for 3 weeks, we are excited to try this place again and highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Dave C.
reviews.description: Really nice place, with a great vibe. Cool owners. Right off Blanco road. Bartenders are awesome. Nice selection of beers.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: This is a diamond in the rough!   Prices are on point, better than comparable craft beer bars/growler filling stations in town.   I just moved from San Diego, and this place is awesome. If your into craft beer, you MUST check it out!   They have a small plate menu too! Great good, great beer and great prices!!

reviews.author: Tara H.
reviews.description: Went here the other day to grab some drinks. Overall, walking in the place has a cool vibe. They play primarily reggae music and have about 50 beers on tap that is listed on a screen with the price and alcohol percentage.   The downside of this place is their cleanliness, service, and beer knowledge. We went there and everyone ordered the Ballast Point Grunion Pale Ale. When we drank it though, we knew it wasn't the actual beer and the bartender insisted that it was. Lucky for us, we were with a Ballast Point distributor so he looked at the tap and confirmed that it in fact wasn't the beer we had requested.   The service was highly lacking. There was one lady working and maybe 10 at most people in the place. But it was fairly calm, yet she didn't walk around to ask us if we need more after our empty glasses sat there for over 15 minutes. As for cleanliness, the toilet paper and paper towels were empty in the restroom. Also, there was a pile of looks like swept up trash just sitting on the ground near a table. Sadly, I wish this place was better, but I don't see myself coming back.

reviews.author: Saban P.
reviews.description: Perfect place for the Craft beer lover. The dumplings are amazing. Go and enjoy some good beer and amazing dumplings aka Mo:Mo.

reviews.author: Piyush S.
reviews.description: I have been coming to this friendly bar that has great choice of draft beer and variety of food. Televises various sports and it was awesome to watch Super Bowl on the big screen with family and friends. Owned by a family, they continues to take customer input and have variety of beers, wine, shots and drink! Love to visit whenever I get a chance to relax! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Jonathan G.
reviews.description: Decided to give this place a chance with the new ownership and shouldn't have. It took 20 minutes to get out first drink and were never asked again if we needed service. We left after waiting an additional hour. Dustin cared more about socializing with his friends at the bar than trying to help anyone. There were only 6 people here and I see why. Will not be returning.

reviews.author: Brian F.
reviews.description: Before I dig into this review, I'd like to say I've been to numerous growler stations and think I've developed a pretty good basis of comparison/ expectations.   This place is super far from San Antonio.  Okay I got that out the way.  There's plenty of parking and indoor/outdoor seating.  The outdoor patio is set up kind of like a beer garden, but there's no walk-up window service.  There is wait staff though, so that's cool.  Immediately I was impressed with the selection of beers.  Not sure how often they change them, but for a first timer it was a change for sure.  The indoor area has booths, high-tops, bar seating and a little cove in the back.  Liking that.  The staff was cool too.  The food is better than bar food.  I mean they offer humus and pulled pork tacos.  Whaaaaaat?!   Some things I really didn't care for were no  1/2 pours, flights and condiment taster cups.  If I'm willing to commit to paying a little extra for craft beer, then I'm definitely not okay with plastic taster cups.  Every other craft beer spot offers glass tasters.   I understand they offer flights now, since my visit about 3 weeks ago.  Pros: Beer selection FOOD (Most growler spots don't have food) Parking Growler prices Drink growlers on premises   Cons: No Flights No  1/2 pours (must commit to full 16oz) Distance Plastic taster cups No designated tap handles

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: So, I was able to score a Groupon for this particular place awhile back and wanted to get a really good deal on a growler fill. First off could this place be any further from the city?!! It was like I could see the Eiffel Tower on the next block! Secondly I was anticipating a much bigger space, as all the pictures I saw of it gave me that impression. However, what I've learned as I Yelp is that the disparity between perception and actual experience can be great.  As you enter here a really cool iron fence with ornate lighting opens up the patio, with ample seating and tables to match. By comparison the taproom is relatively small. The interior itself is both sleek and cozy. A small bar area with a few high chairs/ tables gives me the impression the intent of the owner was to create an intimate experience. In contrast it is a refreshing departure from the noise and bustle of other tap rooms. But then again there are people that gravitate toward a busy, crowded bar.  The growler/tap station itself is a small counter space with a healthy beer selection alongside a wall. In addition a small screen displays beers by name, price and alcohol content. Since this location is in Stone Oak prices are in fitting with this area. For example a simple pour of the Real Ale's, "Mysterium Verum Kraken" a rare tap, will set you back $12. Definitely expect to pay a little more than the typical taproom you might frequent, if you choose to come here.  In terms of service the tapmaster was very professional. I like how she moved from patron to patron, able to take orders and fill pours. She knew customers on a first name basis but more importantly knew their drink of choice; which speaks volumes of this establishment. In my tattered slip-on Vans I collected my growler of Karbach's "Krunkin Pumkin" and headed on out.   My only critiques of this spot would be I wish they would post on their page the prices for their beers. And the distance. If this was in the Deco District area I would probably hit this place up more frequently. Still Claude Hopper's is a really cool tap/growler station with a sleek layout. The vibe is laid back, the beer selection is good, the patio is perfect for conversation and the service is excellent. And I think a Friday night after work is the optimal time to get "Krunkin!"

name: Vine in the Village
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Love this place!  Great neighborhood-in-the-Hill Country vibe.  They've really upped their game with their food- With more than just "bar snacks", you can now say it's a dinner destination place.  On the menu are Phillys, gyros (with all the trimmings),  pizza with cauliflower crust and other goodness.  Also, watch their calendar because they host A LOT of great musicians and bands every week without fail.  Not to miss are 80's Night and German Night in the fall ...and jazz on Wednesdays.

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: The coziest wine bar in the area. The vibe is extremely laid back and casual. It almost feels like you're at a friends house, and I mean that in the best way possible. We went on a Wednesday which meant a live jazz band. They were great and included some Sinatra which i appreciated. The main room was a little too loud for our taste given the live music so we opted for the side room which was perfect as we were able to enjoy the music and conversation simultaneously.  We sat and got comfortable just in time to have a glass during happy hour and we ordered the house Cabernet for two. It was decent. Next, the Artezin Zinfandel which was peppery and bold and absolutely lovely. Then, an overwhelmingly smokey Zinfandel that I unfortunately didn't get the name of. That one was my favorite but I'm partial to oaky/smokey notes in my wine.   For food, we ordered the pretzel which was everything you could ever hope for in a soft pretzel. Doughy, salty, and two types of mustard to accompany each bite. We also got the herb cheese dip on the side. For dinner, the prosciutto pizzas. A little overpriced for what it is- very thin crust, personal size, and not much prosciutto for $18. Still good but not worth it in my opinion. Minus one star for that. Lastly, we ordered the salted Caramel brownie and, wow, my mind was blown. The brownie was warm and gooey, had a salty pretzel type of crust, topped with vanilla ice cream, syrups, and whipped cream. Oh my. I would return just for my smokey Zin and the brownie. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this place. A great spot for decently priced wine, live music, and great conversations.

reviews.author: Gary B.
reviews.description: This place just keeps getting better and better. There wine selection is fantastic The food menu  is very good and unique. It reminds you of  "Cheers" where everyone knows your name and you are warmly greeted at the door. A great place to kick back and enjoy your wonderful wine with friends.

reviews.author: Henry S.
reviews.description: Great environment and choice of wines. Staff is friendly and helpful. Would recommend highly.

reviews.author: Helen F.
reviews.description: Oh my, Dana has completely turned this place up twenty notches!! It's a great little "Cheers" like place.  We love going, great food, vino and music! Thank You Dana!!

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to relax and gather with other grownups.  To the person who complained about not being able to bring her 18 year old, there are signs everywhere that state that.  Why leave a bad review for that?  Take your 18 year old to Hooters.  This is a wonderfully run business as evidenced by all the great reviews.

reviews.author: Brandy G.
reviews.description: Cute little spot nestled in the heart of "downtown" Bulverde. It's very spacious spot with a vibe to suit everyone from a beer garden with a large screen tv, to a relaxing porch, bar seating, lounge area with couches, or a more traditional restaurant seating style area. If you happen to be there on a Friday or Saturday evening you'll be in luck for live music as well.  The wine menu is very extensive but I was little bummed to see they only offer wine flights during the week and not the weekend :( . We had several different waitresses checking on our table and unfortunately none were very well versed In wine recommendations so be advised that you may have to just choose blindly and hope for the best.   No wine drinking outing is complete without having a variety of meats and cheeses to accompany your beverage so my friend and I split the meat and cheese board. Their is a short menu of reasonably priced tapas and pizzas that you can choose from as well. The waitress delivered the meat and cheese board with no explanation of what was on the board-so again just kind of jumped in blindly and figured it out as we went.  All in all, I enjoyed a pleasant evening drinking wine on the porch of Wine 101 but I'm not sure I'd make the drive from San Antonio to Bulverde just to go this place alone. If you're already in the area it's worth stopping in for a glass or two.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: This place was amazing!  I cannot stress that enough.  I went on Tuesday and they had live music, which was great.  The musicians played amazingly well and even took requests.  Everyone was extremely friendly, even the patrons.  Our waitress recommended the Prosciutto and Tomato Pizza which was perfectly cooked.  They also had wine specials so be sure to ask.  This place was so amazing, I have definitely found a new favorite place. I did not even take pictures because I was having such a great time. Please check it out, you will not be sorry.

reviews.author: Virginia A.
reviews.description: Great cozy atmosphere. Impressive wine list to pair with a tasteful array of tapas offerings. Had a lovely, relaxing evening listening to live music. What else could you ask for?

reviews.author: Brenda O.
reviews.description: Horrible.... son was with us, but had to leave because he wasn't even allowed on the premise under 21....18 years old, really???  Not even to sit outside!

reviews.author: Greg F.
reviews.description: Had a really nice time...simple menu but most seem to enjoy the wine/good beer on tap and the fellowship.

reviews.author: Annette L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were the first and second members of Wine 101 Bulverde.   We have seen it change hands many times over the years.  Each new owner has added to the place.  The rustic charm is addictive.  The taps have been a welcome addition for those that do not want to partake in wine.     The food is good for the small kitchen they have,but some healthy dishes would help.  Pizza is good and love the cheese trays.   Wine - love the selection for our area and the wine club.  Feels fun to belong somewhere and know a couple people.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Vine in the Village has reopened to full (50%) service! This place has it all!!! Awesome rustic atmosphere nestled in the Village of Bulverde. Fantastic selection of food, wine, and beer. They will be bringing back the live music! They even have a wine club that you can join and become a true regular. You'll love their staff...everyone is fantastic!

reviews.author: Aja P.
reviews.description: Well if your team has to play Pieper Ranch, then I think this is a must stop before the game. :) it's 8 minutes away and it is absolutely adorable.  I wanted to sit everywhere! They have a fabulous bar, a cool chill biergarten, some covered patio tables (my choice), a living roomish area, and some nice tables in the back back that could be used for a restaurant area or a party or a tasting menu.  And lining the walls of the back room are the personalized glasses of the regular patrons.  I even saw some glasses with paper in them, which makes me think they leave each other notes (or free drinks). SO CUTE!   I ordered a fight of wine and the meat and cheese tray.  Let me start by saying that I love Cru. The flight was fine, but all tastings were the same vineyard.  None were particularly fantastic. The meat and cheese tray was HUGE, but... quantity over quality. Also, I have no idea if the selections were local or from the HEB, bc they didn't provide a card or any info about the choices.  This would be a great chance to pair with some local cheese or sausage makers (IMO) but none (except what I think may have been capicollo) were particularly amazing.  Not judging, but it seems more geared toward some "manly men" that come in with their gals, than a "wine" board.  I would definitely choose from their hot menu, when I return.  It was good. Just not fancy-pants.  (No stinky cheese! Lol). My bill was 45$ for the flight, the board and one more glass of wine.  I felt like that was a little high for the quality, but the experience (and quantity of food) made up for it. They def have some cheaper options (especially during happy hour) that I didn't take advantage of.  Everyone that worked there was super polite, I didn't ask many questions so idk if they were particularly knowledgeable, but they sure have a bunch of different wines!  Regardless of my criticisms, I really enjoyed myself, and my experience and I would absolutely return when I'm in the area again.

reviews.author: Belinda C.
reviews.description: Nice wine selection and very cozy inside.   I look forward to returning to try out more of their wine selections!  The owner was there and seemed very friendly. He knew many of patrons that were obviously regulars.

reviews.author: Ernest C.
reviews.description: This place is super cool. Laid back place to hang out away from the city box hang outs. It's like your in a cozy house party with friends. Owner is cool. Food and staff are great. I think I will join the club. Oh by the way wine prices are excellent and there's beer!!!

reviews.author: Matthew J.
reviews.description: The absolute best wine bar around. The owner makes sure every customer is greeted and that their needs are met. A great environment and ambiance. Been going there 2 years.  Love it!

reviews.author: Terri E.
reviews.description: My friend/neighbor and I stopped in last Saturday to check out this place. It it located right in downtown Bulverde very close to where we live. What a little Gem. The wine bar is in a old house that was built sometime in the early 1900's, very rustic and quaint.   We walked into the bar area and were greeted by friendly staff. We told them it was our first time there. We were told to look around and sit anywhere we liked. My friend and I sat in the back part of the house where they had comfortable couches and tables here and there and the walls were lined with hundreds of different kinds of wine. Our waitress was awesome very knowledgeable about the wine. Lucky for us it was happy hour. Happy hour is 4pm to 6:30 daily. Choice wines are $5.00 per glass.   They also serve tapas , appetizers and their version of pizza. We tried their meat and cheese board and their chocolate truffles. Great food to drink with while sipping wine and chatting.   I will definitely be back to try other wines and bring back some of our friends and neighbors. Would highly recommend checking it out, get there early so you can get a good spot to sit, chat and drink wine.

reviews.author: Sara C.
reviews.description: I came here with my mom for a girl's night. We each ordered a glass of wine and decided to split the cheese and meat plate. The wines were pretty good and the cheese plate was huge. It had several different types of cheese, each of which came in several chunks. While we did enjoy the amount of food, we thought slight improvements could be made. The plate came with hummus, pita, and crackers. There was a ton of pita for the hummus, but only a few crackers for a ton of cheese. It would have been better if the ratios were switched.   The staff was friendly and they have several rooms for indoor and outdoor seating. I would definitely recommend this spot of a date night or girl's night, especially when the weather is nice.

reviews.author: Helen J.
reviews.description: It has a new owner and new name. Dana is awesome and doing some really fun things with the business.  It is now Vine in the Village .. She is having different musicians throughout the week. Thursday is Jazz night!  Can't wait!

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: Gas food. Even better tho, our car needed a jump and wasn't charging the battery. One of the managers came out and pulled around 3 cars and 2 sets of jumper cables until the car started! Great food and even better customer service and kindness. Thank you so much Trent!

reviews.author: Andres N.
reviews.description: This is an essential must visit place after a day of being out in the sun and river. It has an amazing menu where everything sounds delicious and lots of drinks to choose from. Not just beer! They also have unique cocktails like a frozen strawberry mule which we enjoyed very much sitting at the bar. They have indoor and outdoor dining seating.  Although this place is big and it does get packed, our service was excellent and the food came out fairly quickly and hot. They definitely have a system down. The queso dip we tried was a perfect start to our meal. Of course we tried the fussy five dip which has everything in it, even corn. So good!  We decided on sharing a burger since they are pretty big. With so many unique and delicious choices on the menu it was hard to pick. We went with the Diablo burger which was absolutely delightful. Pickled onions, spicy ranch, jalapeño bacon AND a jalapeño fritter make this burger a great savory experience. Their sweet potato fries were crispy and perfectly salted and were a nice side item to have.  Overall a 10/10 experience and I cannot wait to come back and try more things at this place next time I am in New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Emily L.
reviews.description: While visiting family in Canyon Lake, we decided to go out to lunch which meant driving 30+ minutes to find food. So we chose Muck and Fuss.  We got there around 1 on a Tuesday and soon realized that parking was going to be an issue. Being that I have an injured knee, we weren't wanting to walk very far. We drove around a few times and finally found a spot on the road across the street. The parking was the only issue we faced though.  There were 3 of us and a baby and we were sat immediately. Out server was Don. He was very nice, patient, and informative. My cousin got the Great Southern Burger with a side of fries. My sister had the Crab Cake Sandwich with a side salad. I had the Crab Cake Appetizer with a small side of Poutine Fries. Don informed us that they have a scratch kitchen and you can customize your order. The food was delicious. We were so glad that we chose to eat here and didn't even mind that it was a 45 minute drive from the house. They have specialty drinks that they're known for and apparently they also have delicious shakes. I didn't try one, but I kind of wish I would have.  All in all, I'd say definitely try this place if you're in/near New Braunfels. They have seating both indoors and outdoors, and a pleasant ambiance. If you don't mind walking a bit for parking... or driving around until someone leaves lol, then this is a place you should try.

reviews.author: Ana A.
reviews.description: Such a great experience at Muck and Fuss  We went on a Sunday afternoon. Assumed it'd be busy but the wait wasn't long at all. We sat outside in the patio since it was nice weather out. They have seating both inside and out.   We ordered the chips and queso as an appetizer along with the cocktail flight. The drinks were really good although I'd wish they have a few more options  on the menu cause there are only 5 to choose from. The mucks cow mule was my fav. For food we ordered the all American classic burger and the born and raised tacos with Mac and cheese. Both were delicious and did not lack flavor.   We already wanna go back to try something different ok then menu.

reviews.author: Lorena M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere to sit around and enjoy your friends' company. We enjoyed appetizers and some boozy milkshakes. Both were great! You MUST try the truffle fries. I couldn't get enough of them.  I will return soon to enjoy an entree because the descriptions written about them sounded delicious.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Every town needs a place like this. Best tacos we have ever had! Menu had so many good choices, were so torn on what to pick!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: This in my opinion was one of the better meals I have had in a long time. We were a large party of 8 and all had different meals. They were all so unique and different packed full of flavor and fun. Our waitress Carson was extra sweet and seemed to make it a priority to make great small talk.   I had the Diablo burger and paid extra for a premium side. They make their own tater tots and they were filled with jalapeños, cheddar cheese and cream cheese. They had a little extra crunch to them but were like nothing I had before.   We shared the apple pie cheesecake which was also good. I would not call it great and a must have but I also think that is because I may have overeaten my meal because it was so divine.

reviews.author: Katharine W.
reviews.description: Great place off the main strip (is it called the main strip?)! Great food and great drinks to try! Asian shrimp tacos and breakfast burgers have been my two tries. Along with their tater tots and sweet potato fries. Definitely a place to eat when you visit NB!

reviews.author: Cydnee R.
reviews.description: This place was amazing!!   I loved the cocktail flight, you get to choose which cocktails you sample and we chose the Sangria, the Mule, the Marg, and the Sipper. Our favorites were the Sangria and their signature frozen Mule.  The sausage dip was okay, not the best I've ever tasted but it wasn't bad by any means.  My bf got the Born and Raised tacos with elote on top. These tacos blew our mind lol. They were so juicy and just everything we did not expect from a ground beef taco. I'm really glad we got these. The Mac and cheese he got as a side was great as well. It had pimento cheese so it had a slightly different taste than we are used to but we liked it!   I had the Havarti Jam burger. I thought the burger was okay, as I've had a bacon jam burger before elsewhere, but it was still enjoyable though. Their beef here is perfectly cooked and tastes amazing. If you love caramelized onions and Havarti cheese, and you don't mind a hint of sweetness from the jam, this burger is perfect for you!   We will definitely be back to try some of their tempura- fried shrimp dishes.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I love this place, the beer and the food and the atmosphere. Lately the burger buns have been paper thin, which isn't very appealing. I wish they would get with the bakery that makes them and tell them people don't want tortilla thin burger buns. It makes all the difference.

reviews.author: Ruben R.
reviews.description: Price: 15+  Taste: amazing!  Recommend: yes try it out!  Experience: this place was really good! They definitely have different things that make you explore and try new things! I was iffy with my Diablo burger but man it was the best combination of sweet, spicy, and meaty! The chips with queso was ok, the chips were a little stale and queso was clumpy. The service was amazing, friendly, and swift. Everyone was happy to help and knew their menus pretty well. Our server was also very experienced when it came to draft and crafted beers along with spirits and fund drinks! I would most definitely come back! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: Fun and Funky Restaurant we went to celebrate our anniversary. There menu was cool and creative and food was seasoned and cooked well. Wait staff was friendly and efficient.   We stopped here on our way up to Austin to celebrate our anniversary. I went with the Mexican Street Food Burger, I think that was the name? ‍ Anyways it was a burger that had a bunch of things on it including Mexican Street Corn. It came with fries which I upgraded to Poutine Fries because why wouldn't I on our anniversary it's time to celebrate. Wifey got Shrimp Tacos with pickled onions on top and I believe some kind of Asian style seasoning. Her meal came with fries as well which she said were good but once she tried my poutine fries she quickly wished she upgraded. We shared my fries because hey it was our anniversary and I'm a nice guy (sometimes).   Overall a good dinning experience. Would reccomend and would return.

reviews.author: Elizabeth O.
reviews.description: The food was good but not great. The reviews had me thinking the food was going to blow me out of the water but the service brought down my rating. We waited around 45 minutes to get our table. The waitstaff didn't really check on us but got us everything we needed. Food took awhile to come out but I felt it was a little over priced. Worth a try but probably won't be returning.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Their website says:  "The health and safety of our customers and staff is our number one priority. That's why we are continuing to take precautionary measures to ensure proper sanitization and minimal contact for all your orders."  Given this statement it seemed odd that no one in the place (except for me) was wearing masks, and the tables weren't spaced far apart. I would be very uncomfortable dining in here. But my order was for pickup.   I ordered a Caesar salad. The online menu says there's a balsamic reduction, but it was nowhere to be found. That's unfortunate. The salad was a decent size. The dressing was good. It seemed like it was yogurt based. It needed something. Maybe more garlic, or some salt.  The Parmesan crisps were a nice touch, and weren't mentioned on the menu, so maybe they took the place of the balsamic reduction. It's a fair trade off.   I'm on a low fat diet due to some recent health issues, so I think the rest of their menu is off limits for me.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Was out touring the area looking for a new home (relocating from San Antonio). All I can say is I will narrow my search to live close to this restaurant!    Fantastic place located right downtown. Walking distance from a local hotel. The beer selection would impress a cicerone (certified beer expert). The portions were huge and the staff was great. Gorgeous decor with an indoor and outdoor option.   Fred was our bartender and he was awesome. Great personality too.   I can't attach any pictures because I ate all the food!

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: We drove by on the way to floating the Comal River and the whole time on the water I was thinking about this spot. Wait was about 15 min for a table for 2. The burgers were awesome. One had pepper jelly, the other with bacon jam.  Service was great. On top of all that, they had live music by Clifton De Leon. He was solid. Played a bunch of country cover songs.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Excellent service and loved the vibe here! Friendly and attentive staff; large draught beer selection; happy hour on M-F from 3-6. Great outdoor space, but it was thunderstorming while we were there.   $17 for a burger and fries is pretty steep though. I got the Scape Goat and the thin beef patty didn't even come close to covering the bottom bun. Disappointing for a burger at that price point. It was flavorful though. Parmesan aioli fries were an up charge; they were pretty delicious.   Basic cheeseburger was deliciously messy and the side salad was beautiful!   We tried the Muck Mule, Peach Sangria, and I had a sample of the Flamingo Fruit beer. All were very good.   Give this New Braunfels gem a try when you're visiting or just passing through!

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, bring that I used to work here this may be a tinsy bit bias. Nevertheless I'm sure my other reviews can vouch for it. THE BURGERS HERE ARE ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!! The fresh baked buns from the bakery around the corner. Everything is made in house and it's so fresh. They have a HUGE selection of beer as well.  MUST TRY: JALAPEÑO CHEDDAR TATOR TOTES

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by tonight because I saw the Spicy Juicy Lucy listed as one of the best burgers in San Antonio/New Braunfels. Arrived right at five and seated very quickly on the cute patio. Service was quick, and my mouthwatering burger arrived promptly. Definitely lived up to the hype, stuffed with creamy pimiento cheese and stacked high with all the good, non-healthy stuff. Just the right amount of spice too, more about flavor than intense heat. I devoured it quickly because the bun could barely hold it all and I just couldn't resist. So tasty.  Also, the service here was so amazing. My sweet waitress came out to tell me they were fixing my order to get me the sweet potato fries I ordered instead of regular fries. I hadn't even noticed the mistake! I ended up with both sets of fries, and then they didn't charge me for either to make up for their mistake. Superb customer service that sealed the deal for me. Going to recommend this place highly to everyone I know. Hoping to try another burger here soon!

reviews.author: Melanie G.
reviews.description: This place is so delicious and the service is awesome. HIGHLY RECOMMEND their peach sangria and piggy tacos. My son (11 and a picky eater) said it was the best burger he ever had. The only thing that didn't amaze me was the queso, which was good but not at all spicy. I'd still order it lol. I'd recommend this restaurant for any occasion, just get there early lol. I live in Pflugerville or I'd be there all the time!

reviews.author: Brad M.
reviews.description: Had a great cherry beer and some delicious focaccia. Pizza looked really good but we just stopped in for a quick drink and snack. The staff was friendly and all wearing masks, inside had social distance measures in place.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: Definitely this is a spot to come visit when you want to hangout, lounge around, or pre-game before going to the brewery next door. Either way, this is a cool, low key joint. Best part is that they serve both wine AND coffee! They are the same company as Wicked Voodoo Coffee, and its super interesting that they have a wine and coffee bar. I love it! The concept and the place is so unique. They also have legit charcuterie boards. The staff here is also extremely sweet and nice. Great customer service, amazing ambience, and a great place to bring friends. They also have a private seating area if you wanted to reserve for a large party. If wine and coffee are your jam, this is a perfect place for you!

reviews.author: Lacey G.
reviews.description: Amazing must go to place!! Wish we had this back home! We ordered 4 coffee flights and not one disappointed!!! Cute vibe place!

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: Loved it!  Quite Thursday night with my wife.  Great wine and cuturie board.  Excellent staff and they have this amazing nitro coffee on tap!..

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Super cute little place, coffee, wine and beer and charcuterie boards! All my favorites in one place. The caramel breve is delicious, the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cute too. Definitely recommend you swing in and visit, hang out!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Popped in for 1st time.  Nice experience thanks to attentive staff.  New manager (didn't get her name) was super sweet and gave us full background I'm the establishment.   Wife had wine that she really liked so they got high marks for options.

reviews.author: Kevin B.
reviews.description: This place was an amazing experience. The German board was perfect for the palette. I really can't explain how detail oriented they are towards picking the right blend of foods that go so well with their wine offerings.  The bartender/host Stuart was AMAZING. She helped us navigate our flight of wines and has almost perfect recommendations.  I would come here everyday if I could. Being right next to I-35 makes it a short drive for me when commuting, and there was plenty of spots to park even though it was busy.

reviews.author: Jared B.
reviews.description: Charcuterie board, love it. Nice little place, great coffee, great charcuterie boards that go beyond the cheddar cheese and regular boards. The coffee was really good and service was spectacular.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: We absolutely cannot say enough great things about this place... Laurel, the owner, is outgoing, very friendly, funny , and knows her wine.  Sheer delight! Then there is Melinda, who was primarily taking care of us.  She was subbing in from one of their drive-thru locations due to being short-staffed, and she was flat-out nails!  Great personality, extremely helpful, and just a lot of fun to talk with. My wife did have the munchies and ordered the bacon donuts, not really reading the description...obviously missing the 'mountain' in the title.  This is enough to feed Joey Chestnut...a huge pile of freshly made rings, topped with bacon and a sticky-sweet glaze...with a side of healthy fresh berries.  My wife has breakfast for the next few days. Great wine selection...coffee smelled great, but did not have any (got a bag of beans to go), and truly outstanding people... We will go out of our way to visit again, for these experiences, even in today's climate, are rare. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: This is a favorite spot to drop in for a quick glass and delicious cheese board. Highly recommend it!

reviews.author: Jacquelyn C.
reviews.description: What a wonderful hidden gem. We had the Italian Charcuterie board and it was fantastic! The blue cheese was perfect, as was everything else on our board. Our waitress suggested a few wines and let us try them before we purchased a bottle. The staff was incredibly attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back.

name: Southerleigh Haute South
accommodations: Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking

reviews.author: Robert I.
reviews.description: I was invited here for my friend's birthday. It sounds like this place is known for their chicken. I instead veered from the norm and ordered gumbo. I am glad I did. It was flavorful, savory, and cooked to perfection. The mac and cheese was moist and the portion was large.  They also offer a fairly large variety of oysters. Their cocktails are handcrafted and worth every drop.   Also there was only kudos heard at the table about the chicken so I would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Brii H.
reviews.description: Our first time trying Southerleigh at the Rim was back in November of last year (2021) The food was amazing which prompted my family to revisit, and the second visit was still amazing.   Our server tonight was amazing and provided us exceptional service, as always. He gets 5 stars! seriously such a kind guy as well as the manager on duty. Both made mine and my boyfriend's third visit back a great one.   I am placing 3 stars because the quality of the food has completely changed. We loved the original biscuit recipe and were served a biscuit that was great in size but did not compare nearly to the original. The Mac and cheese was also subpar and tasted generic and did not compare to the original recipe. I ordered the hot chicken sandwich and the bread used originally has now been changed. I understand why that might be because the bread bun prior was a lot thinner and the sandwich would become messy but in my opinion that's what made it so much fun to eat ( you'll understand if you're a fellow foodie ) The meat of my sandwich kind of grossed me out because of the gristle. I noticed it was a lot smaller cut of chicken from my previous visit. The chicken also seemed to be a cheaper cut as it was not all white meat chicken like before. It was 80% gristle dark meat and 10% white meat.   I hope that Southerleigh at the rim can go back to its original recipes that we fell in love with. The quality of the food will not allow me to revisit. But the great service and friendliness of the staff will!

reviews.author: Cheyenne M.
reviews.description: I have been coming here religiously since they opened this location. I was a DIE HARD fan. I say that meaning my spouse and I where here literally, daily. By all means I am not basing this off the staff nor the waitresses but the food absolutely is horrible now. When we come we never order less than 5-10 items; I have a large family but I am absolutely appalled. My last 3 visits have been very... regretful. I am sad to say this I just hope you all can improved and revive the food being offered as it once was. Both previous visits the managers took our food back at their own discretion and offered is free items to go to compensate. Just sad..   I'm giving 2 starts because I know the waitresses are giving it their all. I recognize one from little ems and still received the impeccable service I did there but she just can't uphold the same standard.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: This is a warning! Do not attempt to use an Open Table reward card at any of their locations. It won't work and they will not accept them because of the issues on Open Table's end. It's not their fault. Open Table messed up.   They have excellent customer service. They took care of me when they were having issues with my Open Table reward card. I tried the biscuit eggs in a basket brunch dish. It was a fried biscuit with eggs ,bacon and cheese in the middle of it sitting on a bunch of fries. It was just okay to me. The biscuit should have been a bit bigger with more in the middle. You do get a lot of fries. It could have been better in my opinion.   The dessert was a completely different story. The fried pecan pie with soft serve was delicious. I love pecan pie and it definitely hit the spot. I highly recommend trying their fried pies when you are eating there. You will be very happy.   The customer service and dessert made it a very nice experience for me. I will be back.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: If you're around the RIM and craving some fried chicken, then skip Chick-Fil-A and head over to Southerleigh. They serve great beer, have wonderful happy hours specials, and serve a delicious fried chicken sandwich.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: The frozen mimosas are a hit amongst my Sunday funday crew! We love going here for some hearty food and great affordable drinks during their happy hour.

reviews.author: Alisha R.
reviews.description: Feeling pretty neutral about this place. The drink menu wasn't my favorite because it was full of sweet options and not many drinks with the spirit I prefer, whiskey. The fried pickles were delicious. I got the hot chicken sandwich and it was pretty good but the bread was very soggy. My friends got different sandwiches and said the same about the bread. Our server was legit! Overall not a bad place but it wouldn't be my personal first choice.

reviews.author: Becca C.
reviews.description: This is such an enjoyable place! I'm only not giving 5 stars because I've been too stubborn to check out most of the menu.... What I've eaten so far is great!   The fried chicken is awesome, and it is, without a doubt, the most tender fried chicken I've ever had. It manages a lovely, yummy breading with an incredibly tender and moist chicken underneath.   For those who have read my other reviews, you may be wondering what the drinks are like. They're great! Well.... The exactly one I have tried is. I can't bring myself to try anything but the watermelon fishbowl with my husband. So yes, my review is based on one dish and one drink....  But I absolutely stand by it.   Oh, and the bartenders are super friendly, haven't met one I didn't like!

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Nice restartaunt. Casual atmosphere. The food was delicious and the waitress was very personable. Great outside area. You can see all the action in the middle of The Rim.

reviews.author: Heidi M.
reviews.description: First off, what a beautiful space.  The restaurant is attached to the Emma Hotel and share a lot of similar decor.  The service was great (thank you, Alejandra), but the food was just okay.  The redfish throats are a must, and the jalapeño cheese grits are delicious!  The cracker crusted gulf redfish was mostly breading and I found it to be very greasy. I wouldn't order it again. For the price point, I had higher expectations.

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
