reviews.description: Came here with girlfriends to celebrate friendships and girls night out!   This location is perfect as you get to enjoy dinner, drinks and a lot of entertainment around you or just sit and people watch.  Reservations were a breeze on open table and we were seated right on time.   What I - the menu, the prices, the choices, clean restaurant. The TVs at the bar and the patio seating just makes this a restaurant with a lot of potential to be a favorite.  Our food experience however was not the best. I think the branding dish here is the fried chicken and we all hit the spicy chicken. The girls added Mac and cheese and I chose the greens as a side. The honey biscuit was of course delicious as you can't go around with fried dipped in honey ...yummy!  The chicken was  nothing special at all. I was expecting this incredible memorable bite full of crunch and flavor...meh. Max wine dive restaurant chicken left me with this response not this place. I also wasn't spicy not very hot in temp.  The greens also were luke warm and loaded with bacon. I love the southern touch but I personally would ask for a little more green than meat. I'm glad I didn't get the Mac n cheese as this was not very creamy, hot or impressive either. Pretty much it was a lackluster eating experience.  I don't now how my gumbo went to terribly wrong but it did leading to 3 failed tries. All I asked for was gumbo (super hot) with no rice. 1st cup comes out borderline cold. 2nd cup comes out thick warmed up full of sticky rice. Last cup was what I presume kitchen making a quick roux and throwing in sausages and that's what I got. I gave up after this. The manager was available, attentive and at least listened to my issue and resolved my taking off the gumbo. But Southerleigh all I needed you to do was just warm up the first cup. Throw it in a sauce pot or microwave and heat it up. I would have been a happy customer. I really wanted to experience the gumbo.  Drinks were superbly made. At least we did enjoy this and had wonderful toast to the night.   Overall there is a lot of things to try on this menu to come back but in my two visits the Luke warm food is one of the biggest opportunities.

reviews.author: Tom D.
reviews.description: I don't like long, dramatic posts.   So......  Let's get to it.   Great layout and design of the physical space make this place a choice landing for a relaxed lunch. (We we're here for lunch...dinner would rock too.).   Service was on-point, knowledgeable and friendly.   Excellent drink selection.  Very, very good food. I'd say something for everyone.   We will be back if we visit SAT again.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: This is our second or third time here. We had lunch here this part Friday at 11.I actually think we were the first ones in here. I ordered the hush puppies for an app, which after we placed the order we didn't see our server until it came out. Hush puppies were very chewy. My husband ordered the 1/4 fried chicken and shrimp boil: he really enjoyed his meal. I ordered the Meatloaf Pie. I'm a sucker for meatloaf and rice and gravy. I wasn't sure where the "pie" factored in, but I was intrigued. It turned out to be their meat pie on a bed of rice and gravy. The meat pie crust was over-fried, hard to chew. What is going on in the kitchen??!. I just scraped the meat out. My meal was sooo disappointing. Oh, and it took an extremely long time for our meal to come out. Again, we were one of the first people in here.  While we were waiting, I noticed the partition next to us (with the bird cage wire) was extremely dusty. While the overall place may appear tidy, it's clearly not clean. Our server was nice. The three stars are for her and the fact that my husband at least enjoyed his meal. This visit solidified it for me that we won't be coming back here when we're on this side of town. DO NOT waste your money on the Meatloaf Pie.

reviews.author: Lorena M.
reviews.description: Shared the rotisserie half bird: Delicious. Biscuits: also delicious. Fries were a mistake. They were cold and weren't worth it. Try a different side, hopefully it will live up to the reputation of the chicken.  Fishbowl cocktail was also a mistake. It was an intense amount of sugar. Struggled so hard to finish it. Honestly I would have left it there after a few sips, but I'm not a quitter. It would have been a better tasting drink if I had ordered it in a smaller size. Gluttony got me that afternoon.  The restaurant itself is very large.. Seems so small from the outside. Super clean. Friendly staff. They have both indoor and outdoor patio seating. TVs surrounded the bar, so no need to skip the sports games.

reviews.author: Julie V.
reviews.description: Had a great meal and service tonight! I enjoyed the hot chicken sandwich and my husband had the spicy fried chicken with Mac and cheese. The Haute tea was a delicious cocktail too! This was my second time and I came back for the honey biscuits and was disappointed that they changed. Bring the honey biscuits back please! The new biscuit was good if you like a traditional southern biscuit but that honey biscuit you had before one was a standout for sure!  The waiter said you have had mixed reviews on the biscuit so maybe have both to choose from, the haute honey biscuit or traditional biscuit.

reviews.author: Alonna D.
reviews.description: My Aunt and Uncle were coming into town, this was their first time in San Antonio. We went to Southerleigh Haute South. I've been here before and my Daddy loves their fried chicken. My Uncle ordered the Oyster BLT. He had never heard of an Oyster BLT. He said it sounds so simple but funny he has never had it before and he is turning 53 at the end of the month. My Uncle loved his Oyster BLT so I wanted to write a review. If you like Oysters, order Southerleigh Haute South's Oyster BLT, you won't be upset.

reviews.author: Jay B.
reviews.description: The Good: the appearance is Great...I love the look of this place.  The Bad: the Chicken and Shrimp gumbo WASN'T...there were NO SHRIMP and we got Chicken skin...if they relabeled it Sausage and Okra Gumbo then you would have something!!! We had to request our Honey Biscuits that were included with our meals...we asked the manager if the Biscuits were made from scratch and he said they are, but they look and taste suspiciously like the were popped from a can.  We both had the 1/4 Chicken w/ Fries...the Chicken didn't standout good or bad...the fries...naw  The Ugly: We noticed the couple behind us get up and leave because they were seated and forgotten...afterwards a Server walked by their table and saluted the table to "the Customers gone forever"!!!  This isn't a bad place, but I didn't have pleasurable dining experience and nothing to compel me back...I hope they tighten up because they have potential...just too many stumbles for me...Good Luck!!!

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: Our server was John out on the patio and he was really friendly and inviting; he had a great attitude and genuinely seemed like he was happy to be at work. It was our first time so he walked through the menu with us and explained how everything went. Our drinks and food came out extremely fast and was delicious.  Our food was super flavorful and we definitely walked away feeling stuffed.   We'll definitely be back again

reviews.author: Jennifer C.
reviews.description: I always get 1/4 of Spicy fried chicken with Mac and cheese, I always add a shrimp boil to it. The honey butter biscuits are soooo good when fresh. Wait staff is always great. I've only gone during Mondays during lunch so I haven't tried their drinks but they look good as well.

reviews.author: Sleazy T S.
reviews.description: This place not only has delicious chicken but great service and in these times of higher prices they have found a way to keep the price reasonable. Nice , bright and clean like an upscale kitchen. I had the 1/4 fried chicken spicy with a side of collard greens and from what the waitress stated the chicken can vary with heat from day to day. You can get it just fried with no spice if the heat isn't your thing. Crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. There is a lot to choose from on the menu so I'll be going back.

name: Spoiled Palate Culinary and Craft Brewery Tours

reviews.author: Asa M.
reviews.description: I think it's hard to dislike any food tour, even if the food is OK, and not that special.  I think they have kind of a "built-in" advantage over other types of tours for that reason.   I'm speaking from experience as we've taken one now each place we travel to (if they have one) for the last 6 years, which is when it seems many good ones began to get started (US).  I noticed the reviews so far are all from people in San Antonio. Nothing wrong with that - I live here too.  However, none mention having taken other food tours they've taken so as to compare it.  When you do, I find this tour a bit pricey and not balanced. I know it's a about the food for the most part and was the main reason we took it despite the cost.  Yet, I was hoping for a true overall cultural experience like the best food tours we've done.  That way you walk away satisfied gastronomically but also feel like you'd received a real "taste" of the city's culture you're visiting while allow your palate to rest while "digesting" things other than food.  As I stated above, most food tours get good reviews, so I believe this is what helps separate the stand-outs from the average.

reviews.author: a d.
reviews.description: We had an incredible time on this culinary adventure. It is such a great idea for tourists that do not  have enough time to try all the hot spots or for locals that want to try something different. Our guide was knowledgable about the places we went and the ingredients used in our food. We had a food and beverage sampling at several popular restaurants. Every place we went had our table ready for us and hot food out within minutes. I am a vegetarian and each place had something for me. At the end of the evening  we were stuffed. The next day we made reservations to return to our favorite place on the tour (Bliss). If you are visiting San Antonio this tour should not be missed.

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: The brewery tour was a smashing success. Great choice of beers, informative brewery tours, knowledgeable and more importantly fun tour guides made it such a fun afternoon. Btw the pretzel necklaces were a nice touch and welcomed snack!!!

name: VFW Post 76
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a couple drinks with a friend. Unfortunately we couldn't stay long because honestly there was a wafting sewage smell that left you gagging. I have no idea what this was about but I couldn't handle more than 30 minutes.

reviews.author: Greg A.
reviews.description: Beautiful building and welcoming staff. Beer was cheap and had live music midweek. Large space with Plenty of outdoor tables. Support this VFW location to make sure it continues for future generations who served.

reviews.author: Kayla P.
reviews.description: Thank you for keeping Post 76 live and well. I met various members of the Chapter and you can tell how much pride and joy they have for their Country and what they do

reviews.author: Steven R.
reviews.description: This is a really nice place to come by and enjoy yourself. The VFW is one of the oldest standing buildings. It is close to Broadway with lots  of neighboring bars. Thry offer parking but if not available have street parking as well. They have cheap drinks along with great food. Turkey legs and street tacos, yum. They do have live bands that come and play and it is easily accessible through the river walk. The staff and people were all friendly.  Had a great time.

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Was walking on the Riverwalk and decided to stop by the VFW. Nice area where we picked up one drinks and chilled outside. Friendly staff and quick. Everyone was having fun, just a nice spot to stop at.

reviews.author: PJ C.
reviews.description: Perhaps I set my expectations too high given all of the rave reviews.  It is a divey place right on the Riverwalk north of downtown and the beer prices are cheap but it wasn't as funky or cool as I had hoped.  They were holding their Halloween party so some of the patrons were in costume which added to the "atmosphere".  The band had one of the worst sound systems I have ever heard - it makes those PA systems on subway systems sound clear.  Overall it is worth the trip out here but not sure it is the five star experience that many claim.

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: Cheap beer... Yes! ... Always cheap beer at VFWs!   Well maybe they don't have the cheapest beer here as this is a little more of a tourist stop being right on the River Walk Museum Reach... but you do get a discount if you are a VFW member, which I am a Lifetimer thanks to my mother signing me up while she was actively involved with the original VFW at Canyon Lake in Satller.  Post 76 is open to the general public and they welcome everyone with a smile... just note, many VFWs are member only posts just to serve our Veterans of Foreign Wars. Please thank them for their service. Freedom is not Free! This post host several events during the year, including Fiesta San Antonio, so keep your eyes and ears open for something in the future. It does get crowed during events tho so just a warning They have a big band stand and beer garden outside along the river. It's really cool place to just hang out. I like it a whole lot better when it's a slow regular night.   VFW Post 76 is the oldest post in Texas, chartered June 26, 1917, by veterans of the Spanish American War. In 1946, They moved their post to this beautiful Victorian house located on the banks of the San Antonio River... and just in this past decade, the River Walk was expanded to what is now known as Museum Reach which makes this such an amazing location.   According to their website: "There are rumors of two ghosts, which also adds to the houses mystic. Members attest to seeing a girl running up and down the stairs and an old man who likes to move furniture. They both share the name of "Charley"."  This is a MUST DO when seeing Puro San Antonio!

reviews.author: Jay B.
reviews.description: The sign outside says it's The Oldest VFW in Texas.  Not sure about that but it is one of the best and largest.  I think it was an old plantation house.  Multi-level with a large patio for entertainment complete with a stage.  Separate room next to the main house for ceremonies and private parties.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Oldest Post in Texas! Open to the public, and they have scheduled concerts on the property.   Suggestions-Bring cash  Moose Out

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: The history alone makes this a great stop in San Antonio adventures, however it's location on the Riverwalk takes this VFW to the next level. My husband and I are both lifetime members and self professed VFW experts. This-location is open to the public. We came by early on a Saturday afternoon with our kids. Drinks are SO cheap. They have karaoke and snacks but no food. Members were friendly which isn't always the case at lots of VFWs unfortunately. My husband is a seasoned combat Veteran from OIF and still has felt unwelcomed at several backwards locations which didn't seem to enjoy or welcome members under 50. I'm female so I rarely feel welcome at Veterans nonprofits. This one was different.  Texas seems to treat female Veterans pretty well. Seems to be cultural. We loved the history and canal view. The yard outside was packed with tourists. We were inside because Texas is HOT! I think they have fun events and concerts here. Too bad they didn't have food though. My kids will enjoy the big yard when weathers better. They have free concerts outside on the weekends.

reviews.author: Rosamaria E.
reviews.description: This is just a great place to come and hang out.  Located right off the Riverwalk, this VFW is one of San Antonio's historical landmarks and is the oldest in Texas!!  It's huge and has a lot of great people that are regulars.  Yes, it is for veterans but it is open to the general public.  With that said, drink prices do vary for general public vs if you are active duty or a member.  Some days there are live music which is pretty cool because they perform outside.  Some days they have food for sale..  that may be tacos or something.  I can say, there have been plenty times we have been able to come and just hang out...  for hours... sit and laugh with friends, watch a game or come and dance.  It is on our must hit spots when we are out and about in the beautiful Alamo City..

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: This place has become a home away from home for this veteran's girlfriend.   The Post is open to anyone, but there is a special kinship between the veterans here. The truth is veterans have lived a certain life that people outside the military simply don't understand. This is the perfect place for them to find the support and camaraderie they often need after they get out.  That being said, not being a veteran myself I love this place. It's often calm with good music on the jukebox, and friendly regulars and members. And did I mention the beer is CHEAP?  They often have events going on with live music, and they are right along a part of the Riverwalk.   If you haven't been here yet it is definitely worth checking out!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: At this point there is no part of The River walk that hasn't been touched by expansion in some way. But as you walk closer toward the area near The Ten-Eleven or The Luxury you will see one particular spot, untouched by time. The VFW Post 76 is a historic place with a lore all its own. It is a place on any given night, especially on weekends where cold beers, jukebox music is blaring and people are having a good time.        It is an old building reminiscent of the one you will find in the King William area. Outside there are chairs and depending on the event the place is either packed or lightly inhabited. There is ample space on the grounds to walk with your drinks. It serves as a good intermediary between some fancy watering hole and an icehouse.       But mainly the VFW is known when it hosts certain events like the various food truck competitions and the numerous festivals it has here. Patrons that frequent this place can run the gamut from Pearl Brewery Apartment dwellers, bicyclists, hipsters, parents, lounge lizards, professionals, seniors looking for cheap Lone star beer etc. Whenever you go you are never sure what crowd to expect.       There is a very laid back vibe intermixed with a quirkiness to it. On one end of the floor you might see a couple straight out of an Urban Outfitters Catalog and just across the way you will see seniors sporting Lite beers, like it was some dance. At night the VFW takes on a romantic quality accompanied by the lights that guide The Riverwalk way.       In addition the servers and patrons alike are usually a friendly crowd. The beers are cheap and the Selena cover bands are even louder. Contrary to what people have said finding a parking spot can be hairy since The Luxury and The Ten Eleven people park in the same area as well. The later you go the less you are inclined to find a space. It's best to car pool with friends, especially when they have events like The Taco Truck Showdown. Either way there is fun to be had by all here.      The VFW Post 76 is a unique spot. It feels like a place untouched by time but relevant to any generation that goes here. The beers are cheap but it is rich in history and charm.    ps. If you are so inclined check out a video of a local band called, "Pillow Talk ~ Slip of the Pen" It was filmed at the VFW and captures the spirit of this place.

reviews.author: Roque L.
reviews.description: A place for veterans, a place for families of veterans. Called the "White House" the Victorian architecture is a shining example of what's being lost all along the San Antonio river as new buildings begin to become common.  As a veteran I'm proud of my fellow compatriots and here we can share stories and create new memories together.   Currently VFW #76 is going under some maintenance and construction to rehabilitate this old beauty.  Come down and enjoy a few pints and meet the San Antonio veterans.

reviews.author: Tamara C.
reviews.description: The folks that make this place great to hangout along the River Walk is the employees who truly enjoy serving to the public and Veterans. Being a child of a veteran of Foreign Wars was greeted with such hospitality in this historical building. We enjoyed a couple beers sitting up stairs on the veranda listening to country tunes. They have a memorial room that was emotional for me as we celebrate soldiers life's for our rights and freedom.  Prices are reasonable for this Beer and Wine establishment. Country tunes are the groove. Totally a fun place to hang out!

reviews.author: Julie W.
reviews.description: The oldest post in San Antonio! Now, that's something to be proud of. Beautiful old building near the Alamo right on the Riverwalk.  Live band in the evenings.  Don't have to be a member to enjoy this place, but your member card gets you reduced prices. NOt that the prices are high to begin with.

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: Thank you for serving our country!  Love your location right on the Riverwalk.  So convenient.  We just happened upon this place on a nice stroll on the River.  Had heard I needed to check it out. It was a Lazy Saturday and not many around other than a couple regulars.  Really loved the casual ambiance.  The venue looked great and next time in town will try to catch some live music at night but what a cool building with great grounds and great location and supports our troops!  5 Stars!

reviews.author: Anna J.
reviews.description: Live music?! Yes, Please! Visited with a friend. We grabbed a bucket of beer and sat outside to enjoy the live music. It was fun people watching if I'm completely honest. They offer family style seating so be prepared to cozy up to someone you may not know. There are lots of seating outside and everyone was friendly. It looked pretty full the day we visited but after asking a few tables for available seats, we found our spot. The beer is cold, music is upbeat and everyone rocks late into the night. Great place to unwind after work with friends. I'll visit again soon!!

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: VFW post 76 in San Antonio Texas is the oldest functioning post in our state. It's equally great regardless of if you are a veteran or not. All are welcome.  In the hustle and bustle of the Riverwalk it's a great place to stop in, relax, have a cold beverage and enjoy the conversation with any veterans that you are lucky enough to encounter. My husband happens to be a veteran and served in Vietnam. I find that it's very good for him to be around other veterans when we have the opportunity. He doesn't ever share stories about his time overseas. Sadly, it was not only unpopular because of the military aspects of war, but many in our great nation were downright disrespectful to the men and women who served there. Sometimes as they were returning home or being dispatched, drafted or not..... Anyway- This VFW post is in a very well-kept older home and reminds me of a plantation style residence. All beverages are icy cold, and it's a beautiful environment. You can sit and watch barges go by on the river and during the holidays the river is lit with thousands of lights and barges full of caroling children! They also frequently have live music.  It's definitely worth a stop.

reviews.author: Jennie K.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to stop into en route to/fro Pearl along Riverwalk. Post is oldest in Texas and full of history and charm. And the darned nicest bartenders in the business!!

reviews.author: Arthur T.
reviews.description: Food was great, wait staff was awesome.  The negative side was I  caught the bar staff skimping on drinks and I ran a tap now I have three charges on my card granted two of them are now pending just waiting to see if they drop off.  All in All this is a place worth visiting just don't run a tab and watch the bar staff.

reviews.author: Leon G.
reviews.description: Like our 5th or 6th time coming here.   We love this place, great beer selection, always something new to try. Had the True Love (sour) beer. Love me some sours!   My favorite is The Cowboy, it's sweet and crunchy. Great weeniers, best meat around when it comes to weeniers for your mouth!   Gotta try the pancake corn dog too!   On top of the great food and beer selection,  the atmosphere is good too, plenty of TVs for watching of the Sports! The outside patio is well set up and awesome even in the winter, they stoke up the heaters and keep ya toasty.   Y'all kick ass Dog Häus!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a yummy chicken sandwich  this is the place for you.  The hot chick is a fried chicken sandwich with just the right amount of spice.  I thought is was very flavorful. Loved the aioli.   The bad mutha clucker is another fried chicken sandwich. It's perfect for the non spicy person in your life.

reviews.author: TJ R.
reviews.description: We Love Weiners! :D Ate inside with a hot date. Open and airy inside, clean. Little confused by the atmosphere: is it upscale? Or easy-going?  Had the Beyond Brat, tots, and a cocktail each. Ordering was easy. Not too long of a wait for the food. Total was about $50 which seems pretty high; really should have been about half that.   Don't get me wrong - it was pretty tasty. The brat was crispy and juicy, toppings were fresh, tots perfectly golden brown. The ketchup was in little packets, which seems wasteful to me. Cocktail was served in a chilled mug, flavorful and fulfilling. Portions were just right too: filling, but not too much food like most places.

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: Hello friends, I stopped by Dog Haus Biergarten Stone Oak yesterday and absolutely loved it. The place is super clean and has a sleek design.   I personally loved their "Chili Idol" ( Chili Cheese Dog with onions ), "Chili the Kid" ( Chili Cheese dog with White American Cheese, Chipotle Aioli, and Fried Onions ) and their "Fonz" ( Sausage Dog with Spicy Italian, Pastrami, and Mozzarella  Cheese ). Chili cheese fries were great too! Definitely a nice addition to the Northside.   FYI: They have a fully stocked bar with all your favorite liquors and at least 50+ craft beers to choose from.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: My Dad loves hotdogs so I thought to bring him to Dog Haus for both of us to try.  There was an extensive beer menu and also cocktails. You go up to the line to order your food and drinks, they give you a number and bring everything to your table. The big draw was the outdoor seating. There's even a small putting green.  Dad and I split the cowboy hotdog and onion rings. I meant to split the corn dog with him too but he was full. The food came out quick and the food was delicious and fresh. Dad had fountain drinks while I had the Sunset Strip.  Hopefully our experience paying was a one-off issue. We tried 2 different registers and I couldn't pay with my credit card. Ended up paying cash. Thankfully, I had cash with me.

reviews.author: Richard D.
reviews.description: (This review is actually from a February 10 visit).  Very nice place with friendly servers.  We sat at the indoor/outdoor bar (the outdoor/patio side) which was very pleasant.  Many, many types of beer are available.  Many reviewers suggested their burgers so I tried one.  Very fresh, tasty and flavorful cheese burger although I am not a fan of burgers served on King's Hawaiian buns.  I was not impressed by the fries at all.  I will probably return and try a dog.  They looked tasty.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: Went here on a Friday night and it was super packed! I like this place because it has a super simple menu, good ambience, and drinks. If you are ever craving a hot dog or burgers, this is the place to go. They have TV's everywhere in case you want to watch a game. This is pretty much a self-serve type of place. You go to the front and order the. Seat yourself. I'd come here again to try the rest of thier menu.

reviews.author: Jose L.
reviews.description: I always have a hard time figuring out what to get because there's so many good options. A place to try if you want burger, or hot dogs in the stone oak area. The hangover burger is a patty with cheese, chili, and an egg on top between slider buns. I made a mess but I could not help it the flavor combination was complimenting each other very well.

reviews.author: Tabitha W.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon to try it out!    Dog friendly patio was nice to have available.   Food was all very tasty and happy hour on the weekend was great.   We will be back,  just with some new found awareness.   Ordering at the counter can be confusing because I wasn't brought the beer I ordered,  so not sure what happened with that- had to go to the bar later and ask for it.   Customers on the patio didn't put their trays away so food and trash blew all over the patio.   I went inside to ask if someone could sweep the patio - my dog was trying to eat all the food on the ground.   Was told they were short staffed and she would let someone know.   I offered to sweep it myself and also to clean down the tables if they would let me.   I understand short staffing.  More outdoor patios should have table cleaning wipes for customers to use when the restaurant is busy.    Eventually someone was able to come out and get things swept and cleaned up.   The staff also couldn't figure out how to get the fans to come on outside. It was nearly 90 degrees and the breeze would have been appreciated.  It wasn't for a lack of trying,  3 different employees tried to get them on.   Mostly this patio isn't ideal for San Antonio as it faces west and south,  so full sun in the afternoon.   After sundown might be better.  Maybe some sun awnings eventually.   Will definitely be back,  the Sunday happy hour was good!  And we thoroughly enjoyed the beer and food selections.  Casual easy going for sure.

reviews.author: Victoria C.
reviews.description: After a morning of fall festivities at the pumpkin patch and corn maze, kiddo and I were looking for something to fill our tummies - so, while we didn't eat there, we did finally grab some Dog Haus to try at home, and the establishment is so funky and pleasant, we definitely want to come back and done in eventually.  I was planning on reviewing four stars and holding off on a rave review until we actually ate inside, but I have to bump up to five right off the bat because my little dude, who can be notoriously picky and outright refuse to eat if someplace is unfamiliar, inhaled his food from here and dipped into mine. And he ate the grilled onions on our food - I don't know if you realize how hard it is to get any vegetable into my four-year-old's mouth without a war breaking out.   We started with the corn dog sliders, and we knew we were in for a good experience because the batter was great and had a perfect crunch to the outside, and was just thick enough. And the actual dog itself? EXCELLENT. Back in California, there was a giant corn dog at a market/fair I used to attend that I loved with a passion, and this made me think of that. In and of itself, the dog really shines in the corn dog.  Moving on the to actual hot dog with toppings, the Cowboy - I have to say I barely got a nibble in of this one, because my son loved it and made sure our plans of splitting everything and making sure he, myself, and grandma got an equal taste of everything went out the window. I sometimes get nervous when I hear "bacon-wrapped" about a hot dog because I worry it will be a thick, gross, undercooked bandage of bacon around a hot dog. Not the case here! No squishy bacon here! Great texture especially with the crispy onions and my son was a huge fan of the cheese sauce.  And the Holy Aioli burger on the Hawaiian rolls? Those rolls are a staple in our house and these were nicely toasted through with a great crunch to them that kept the bread from getting soggy. I wish the meat patty were a little meatier but the toppings were so delicious, I can forgive anything. They could've forgotten the meat and served me a sandwich with just the toppings and I would have no qualms paying full price for that, it was so good.  Overall, I am really happy with this place and can't wait until kiddo and I finally make time to eat there! So good!

reviews.author: Lettie C.
reviews.description: Dogs Haus was really good. They have over 20 different local craft beers. Happy hour Mon-Fri 2pm-6pm Sunday 2pm-11pm. Dogs, sausage and burgers. I ate the SOOO CALI without arugula and tomato's and a order of tater tots. They have a nice area to eat out side with giant Jenga to plays some games or keep the kids entertain.

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: If you like beers and you like burgers and dogs, you found your spot!   This is a cool spot with plenty of TVs to watch sports, a ton of cold beer, and good food, too!   I tried the Big Kahuna Burger which seems to be a limited time offering, but I am  hoping they keep it on the menu.   Served on Hawaiian rolls with onion rings, bacon, peppers, cheese, and sauces, this is a tasty burger! The flavors and textures combine very nicely.   They have fries, tots, and (my favorite) sweet potato fries to accompany the burgers and hot dogs.   A sports bar atmosphere yet very clean and well lit located at 281 and Stone Oak is just what the area needs.   I'll definitely be back.   Check it out and then hit me up on Instagram and let me know what you thought! @CheatDay_SA

reviews.author: LiznJay J.
reviews.description: If I could give 0 stars I would!  This establishment is one of the worst places I have ever picked up dinner from.  Not only was our order incorrect, but we were also missing our daughters burger.  When we called to ask for a refund for the item we ordered but did not receive, an employee picked up the phone but did not answer.  You could hear all the ambient noise in the background going on, and we kept saying hello-hello-hello to no avail.  We then hung up and called back and the employee decided to turn on their voicemail system.  The phone would ring once and go to voicemail.  We ended up having to split our dinner amongst the family with the food we did receive, and had to physically drive back to the establishment to ask for a refund for the 12$ burger we did not receive, all while gas prices are through the roof!  We will never frequent this establishment ever again.

reviews.author: Jose Raul P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out, have a beer, and have some good bar food.   The atmosphere really makes this place shine. They have an ample beer selection and great cocktails to try. The food is good, I don't think I can complain about it. However if you're expecting to be blown away, you will leave disappointed. They are hotdogs with cool toppings. I do think that the toppings get in the way of the quality of the meat and bread. I almost regret getting what I got because the sauces and toppings get in the way of the true quality ingredients. Next time I will try a more classic and basic hotdog.

reviews.author: Kay J.
reviews.description: This place is always hopping!  We decided to check it out for an early lunch when it wasn't so busy. The restaurant is super clean with plenty of tables (indoors and outdoors), TV's, corn hole and a mini golf putting green. They have a huge selection of beers and a pretty big menu too.  The employees were all very friendly and offered plenty of suggestions. The burgers are incredible!  I don't normally love Hawaiian rolls but it definitely works. So much flavor!  The French fries are delicious and we especially loved the onion rings!  Everything was cooked to perfection... so yummy!  We will definitely be back soon to try other menu items!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: The food isn't bad, but it isn't spectacular either. For the price, I can make a feast at home with the same items. I was disappointed that they couldn't do a wurst corn dog using Beyond brat. I was also disappointed that they didn't have the impossible sliders.  So, we ended up trying a regular mini corn dog, The old town dog, The beyond brat, chili cheese fries, onion rings, and coleslaw.  The coleslaw was lacking flavor. Of course, you can't mess up fries or onion rings. Those were good. The beyond brat was smaller than expected, but had good flavor. The old town dog was a lot of bread and a little bit of dog.   For drinks, we had a lady in red and the blind melon. The lady in red reminded me of a sangria. The blind melon was sweet.   You order first and then sit down. Someone brings out your food and drinks.  They have inside and outside seating. The outside seating is under a covered patio. They also have a good list of beers. There's a small area where you can play corn hole. Parking is available on site and plentiful.

reviews.author: Autum R.
reviews.description: DELICIOUS! Need I say more! Yesterday was my first time here, and let me just say I can't wait to go back. The food was amazing, the service was good, and the atmosphere was welcoming. I enjoyed the total experience. I appreciate that the menu has options for everyone. As a restricted eater, I hate going to places that only serve pork or beef. This place has pork, beef, chicken and vegetarian options. So it's great for a variety of people. Def can not wait to go back.

reviews.author: Jenelle S.
reviews.description: Five stars for cleanliness, fast service, and friendly staff!  Went here for lunch today and can definitely say nobody there was put in the dog house!  The menu linked to Yelp is not the same menu at this location. I was surprised to find this is a franchised establishment. Several items were the same, but some items were not offered at this location. I've included a picture of this location's food menu.  There was a "special dog" poster at the register, a bahn mi type, which will be offered for a limited time. We ordered the Old Town, chili dog, a side order of mini corn dog, and a side of onion rings.  The buns are King Hawaiian mini slider buns. They leave 3 together, slice in the middle, and fill. Made it very convenient to cut into thirds and share.   The beer part of this Biergarten is well stocked. Looked close to as many as the monk's....well, maybe not as many, but darn well had a large selection to choose from. We ordered the Save the World 2 offerings- AngusDei and Fructus Bonam.  I preferred the AD to be paired with the food.   They have a nice pub type menu with a variety of foods and beers. Nice to have a great new eatery so close to home!

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: The outdoor seating with the put-put and games is perfect for a night with the family. The service is decent, it about what you would expect at a place like this. I do think the food is a little overpriced for what it is though. With that being said this isn't my top choice when eating out but we will probably be back to enjoy food while our son runs around.

name: Jazz TX
accommodations: Good for Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: My husband and I spent part of our night here for an anniversary, a very dear song to my heart by the carpenter played at the end of the night so beautiful, and memorable experience..

reviews.author: Angela I.
reviews.description: I loved this place! The food was amazing! I had the best burger I've experienced in San Antonio and the BEST pecan pie I've ever had period! And I'm not even a pecan pie fan!! The drinks were amazing! The service was outstanding! And the band was phenomenal! Doc is hilarious and a comedian for sure! Book your reservations early because they fill up pretty fast! But once you come once you'll be sure to be back for me!

reviews.author: Daniel O.
reviews.description: Really fun place for a date night. Didn't try the food so this is only the review for the ambiance and drinks. Great service and music. Definitely coming back.

reviews.author: Steve G.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been frequent guests at Jazz TX since it opened, and the experience has always been outstanding!  From the speak easy vibe of going under the Food Hall to find the club through a small door and behind the curtains, through to the music, the drinks and now an outstanding food menu.  Jazz TX doesn't disappoint. The decor, the lighting, the backdrop and the intimacy of the low stage right in front of you - it is everything I wanted for jazz. We always enjoy relaxing with music from Doc Watkins and his band.  There is a never ending parade of quality jazz artists and ensembles that come through to perform, so check the calendar and make a reservation!  My only request is a little more room between the tables - add a foot in each direction around the table for servers, patrons walking and comfort, and maybe some padded chairs?  I can't complain - its jazz music at its very best in a setting that is every bit a cool jazz bar.  Thank you Doc Watkins for a great place!!

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: Wow, what an experience! Make reservations for the time and date you want, it's a sell out show and a fantastic one at that. Food and drinks were amazing but the entertainment was incomparable! I can't tell you for great Doc Watson and his crew were, you have to experience it! Just amazing sets and an amazing experience. We have already told everyone we know and booked a couple shows for friends and family too. This is not a 1 time outing, this is a good time over and over again

reviews.author: Priscilla M.
reviews.description: What a great date night evening! Attended the Christmas jazz show and it was amazing! I can't recall the martini i ordered but it has a great light pear taste that wasn't overly sweet. Doc Watkins band is brilliant. Christmas show sold out within 20 minutes of tickets release but I believe any show would be just as beautiful to see.

reviews.author: Jesse S.
reviews.description: Celebrated my wife's birthday here.... AMAZING! My wife loves steak and this met all of her expectations! The drinks were good, the food was good, the music was good, and the service was amazing.    We seriously could not be happier with our experience here and we've been to a lot of places in San Antonio!   We will be back soon, and can't wait to do some dancing! Yay Jazz Tx!!!

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: The menu was limited, but every dish we got was excellent! Great atmosphere. Enjoyed the entertainment - a really great night.

reviews.author: Alberto D.
reviews.description: Date night!!! Was so excited to take my GF out.  She loves their old fashion.  Food and drinks were great.  Except, I had to eat my tacos cold.    Faviola was our server.  She gave us time to look at the menu.  We ordered pasta, Bruschetta, shrimp tacos to start off. Later we ordered chips and queso, pecan pie and coffee.  Not to mention her three old fashions and my jack and coke.  Bruschetta came out (3 pieces of bread with shrimp).  Delicious!!!  Then my tacos came out and we waited for the pasta. And waited. And waited.  My tacos got cold as we waited for her pasta.  Finally Faviola comes around, we asked about the pasta and she said she didn't hear the order.  PAUSE: no apology or let me make this right, just I'll go place the order.  So now my tacos get colder waiting for the pasta.  Common sense  as a server is to ask to remake the other dish.    Just need to tighten up that customer service.  I even told my GF that it looked like she stereotyped us before  she came to the table.  Other than that the band was great, food tasted good minus the cold tacos. 3 stars for the food and band.

reviews.author: Gil T.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Good music with Doc Watkins. The bartender was great the drinks were good. There is a cover and a reservation is recommended. They may have some seats but better to make the reservation.

reviews.author: Rick S.
reviews.description: In this review I will cover the GOOD, THE BAD, and THE UGLY.  For my wife's birthday, I took my family (6 adults) to the show and had dinner/drinks where I spent around $500 for the show and dinner.  THE GOOD- location, food, the band, service       Located in San Antonio's  Pearl District, with free parking.  Jazz TX is located in the basement under the Pearl's Food Court.  It was a cozy little venue that holds about 60 people.  All tables had great views of the band's stage.       No complaints on the TASTE of the food.       The singer, "Doc"  and his band were very entertaining.  Doc kept the audience laughing in between songs. They put on a great show.       The service-  a constant flow of people ensuring your every needs are met.  This was great but also added to THE BAD below.  THE BAD - I guess I was expecting a Dinner and a show.  The kind of place you pay for an over priced meal for a free show.  At Jazz TX you pay to watch the show and also pay for over priced dinner options.       Food Menu - Very limited menu.  They have four large dinner items.  If the large plates are the "large" portions, the "small"  must be tiny!  I remind you their food was tasty!       Music - Having visited Jazz venues in New Orleans my family's expectations were a little different.  The music at Jazz TX was more "early Jazz," like the "Big Band Music" genre.  Not exactly what we wanted but we're willing to take in the show.  Thanks to Doc and the Band we were entertained.  THE UGLY - lack of management!  There was a patron who entered drunk, was constantly criticizing the singer and the band throughout the entire show.  He was so loud that people from three rows of tables away turned their heads.  This drunk even faced time somebody, holding his phone up over his head and yelled in order to communicate with the person he called.  I could not believe the employees totally ignored him.  This was quiet annoying and ruined a good night.  With all the servers constantly walking through the very small venue, why would they not do or say something?  So for the lack of management, and limited menu I give the venue an average score of three.  If you want to spend money and allow the management have drunks run the place, then I highly recommend Jazz TX.  Maybe in between the yelling you might be able to enjoy the show you paid to watch.

reviews.author: Travis B.
reviews.description: This place is a treasure.  The food is great, service is excellent, the drinks are the best in town (well-made and inventive), and if you can go on a night when Doc Watkins is performing, the music is absolutely incredible.

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: Love this place. A staple of San Antonio. Great entertainment and ambiance.   I just wish they had more vegan food choices. They used to have  impossible as an option but no longer.  If they expanded the menu, i would be there every week.

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: Service was sub par. Sat 10 minutes before waiter approached table and another 10 minutes waiting for our drink order. Waiter never checked back after our meal was placed on table and never came back till almost the end of 90 minute set to see if we needed a refill of our drinks. Really surprised by such poor service in what appears to be such a nice club.

reviews.author: Nichole S.
reviews.description: This was an amazing date night!   The drinks were fantastic, the food was amazing, the service was wonderful, and the band was spectacular!!!!   We absolutely loved every minute at this venue.  We will definitely be returning.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: Great food, awesome service, and even better entertainment. This was a highlight event

reviews.author: Rebecca E.
reviews.description: Finally got the chance to check out Jazz Tx at the Pearl! I was impressed with the atmosphere and the facilities themselves.   The music was great! Friday night is a great time to come out and enjoy the music especially since they do get crowd interaction.   The food: a few different options to wet any palette but still bar food just a little bit more fancy and overpriced. We ordered the burger and shrimp dish which came out hot and picture worthy.   The burger tasted so good and was cooked to perfection. It was bursting with flavor and the onion jam really did set it off and I don't like onions.   The shrimp dish was very good also. Nothing too complicated or special but tasted really  Save your coin and dine somewhere else and then come and enjoy the music. The food is overpriced and you can enjoy great food somewhere else first. Plus the service was not very good at all. Our server was inattentive and only came back for the check.

reviews.author: Andres Y.
reviews.description: Can't go to San Antonio without stopping here. Best part of my trip hands down. Must see place. Drinks were great service better music spectacular.

reviews.author: Kahsandra W.
reviews.description: This is truly a hidden gym in the Pearl! I never knew it existed! Not only is it an evening if live Jazz music by all talented musicians, Doc is absolutely hilarious and very entertaining! He loves his audience and gives off nothing but good vibes!

reviews.author: diane a.
reviews.description: We celebrated a birthday at Jazz Tx. A really nice evening out. Great food, good service, and really fantastic music! I'm so happy that they survived a very extensive shutdown due to Covid restrictions. Make a reservation and go!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: I've noticed every year more and more events are being planned specifically around, "Dia De Los Muertos." There are food, drink and now the city's first river parade to celebrate it. So why not an event named after a local craft beer? Well the Freetail Brewing Co. has been doing one for a decade named after you guessed it, a seasonal beer. It's called "La Muerta", a much sought after stout in the craft beer circle.  I have been wanting to do this event for years but like Pat Benatar says, "Life's what happens when you make other plans." Needless to say I bought general admission tickets for $30 bucks and some change. The price includes a sample glass, eight tickets for 8 small pours and a bottle of "La Muerta." Initially when I came I was anticipating a full house. Instead the crowd was at a manageable level, you could freely maneuver through. In keeping with the theme there were artisan's booths, mariachis and people dressed in elaborate costumes.  In the main area where the brewing tanks are stationed a sample pouring table is set up. They had different variants of "La Muerta" alongside beers pulled from their cellar. Looking at the sample glass and the size of the pours one assumes if the price merits what's served. However the samples are deceptively strong and sneak up on you. By my fifth pour I was feeling as limber as a ghost. My only critique is in the seating arrangements. There were little to no available tables once it was in full swing. Even the usage of communal  benches limits the spacing of this event. Next year they need to increase possible seating or allow you to bring your own chairs.  In addition whole pours were not being sold if you enjoyed a specific variant. I thought this was kinda lame but not a dealbreaker. I know that a limited supply of barrels are created for the festival. I hope next year they will reconsider allowing you to buy limited snifter sized pours. Having said all these things this festival is still unique. The crowd are all stout- hounds who want to taste a beer that is here from a short time, then is gone. It almost seems like a metaphor for life. Ok I'll stop my Waldo Emerson stylings, at least for now.  If you wanna try something different and you love local craft beer like myself go seek this event. It happens only once a year. Don't forget to leave a drink for your loved ones. Hopefully one day someone will return the sentiment back.

reviews.author: Adam W.
reviews.description: Come ON! How much fun is your own private, traveling bar? Serving only the finest of beverages, you'll have a quality time with these quality brews.

reviews.author: Rita M.
reviews.description: When you hear the word BUS one would normally think about a city bus or there like. This is not the case for the Crafty Thirst Beer Bus, no it's a VW van that is being used to serve beer. We were passing by and noticed a sign that said Grand Opening. We stopped to check out this Grand Opening. We were approached by this creepy guy smoking a cigarette as he said do you have ID, we showed our drivers licenses and instead of saying thank you, have a nice day anything he just stared at us. We were reading the list of beers that were offered. It was a little confusing as there was no direction on what the beers were are how much they were. We decided to order at the VW "BUS". We were asking what different types of beers were available and how much they were. The guy that was helping us (later found out was the one of the owners) passed us to someone else. We thought that was rude but the lady that served us made up for it. The beers were $7.00 dollars for a 9 ounce or you could get 4 -  7 ounces for $10.00 dollars to me that is extremely high. Most of the places in Canyon Lake have beers for $2.50. The beer we had, had more of a foam head on it and we were not offered to top it off. Another guy was serving mixed drinks one with Pecan Rum. The mixed drinks were $7.00 dollars, high for the area and the amount you get. I will confess that the rum was one of the best I have had. A few times I heard other people saying that the price's were too high. If you can get a beer for $2.50 then why would someone pay $7.00 dollars. The band was the only entertainment and they were amazing. There was suppose to be a raffle for the VW BUS but when I asked about it I was told that it was not going to take place. This was troubling being that I was told by the owner that it was the main giveaway.

name: Paramour
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Savannah W.
reviews.description: let me tell y'all.....this is the place to be on a weekend. the drag brunch??? ICONIC. kristi waters, kendoll, mehgan dlux, natasha capri, i would die for any of them. honestly  it was my favorite drag brunch of all time. i told kendoll i would die for her and that i'm in love with her and she said it back and gave me a peck. and on the subject of her, my god y'all she's SO GORGEOUS and her outfits... they make me drool. i need her closet. after the show, i was going to the restroom and ran into kendoll and mehgan at the elevator. we actually had an emotional conversation and i absolutely adore them.  i also went to a peep show here and they had an aerial dancer, dessany, and she is beyond beautiful and incredibly talented. so sweet, too! i spoke with her after the show and took a picture with her, and then spoke with kristi waters, also very kind, and got a picture with her as well.  the queens and other performers here are so lively and fun, the drinks are good, the atmosphere is amazing. the whole place is "instagram worthy" lol. they make you feel included and they're very interactive. hands down my favorite spot in sa and i recommend it to everyone!

reviews.author: Elizabeth P.
reviews.description: THE TWO STARS ARE NOT FOR THE DRAG PERFORMERS! They get a 10/10. The rest of the experience tanked the review considerably. I have not been here since I had my birthday here in 2016, a private birthday/political party in 2017, and the Möet White party in 2017. What a difference a few years makes! First let me give the drag show its props. The show was absolutely amazing. It energized the crowd, it had me on the edge of my seat, they all gave 150%. I loved them all.   Now for the WHOMP WHOMP part...the food, drinks, and billing. They do not have enough tables to set food/drinks upon. Mimosas were ok because we made them ourselves. These $18 "specialty" drinks were underwhelming. The food was very close to being tasteless and there was a hair-thin layer of avocado on the toast, which looked more like the guacamole in a bag from the store than fresh avocado. I pay less for heaps of fresh avocado on fancy toast at brunch restaurants. My friend ordered the charcuterie board and the set-up was unappealing. Paper thin meat slices and cheese slices, a handful of almonds thrown on top, one lone strawberry, and 4 olives. The drink I ordered was all looks and no substance. I never received my last drink, a whiskey Sprite, but I bet I was charged for it because my friend interrupted my itemization with the server, Angie, and told her to charge it all on her card but my card was STILL CHARGED. Not just charged though...overcharged! The server was asking me what was mine, so how could they charge my card anything if they didn't know what I ordered and if my friend then proceeded to pay the whole tab? Plus they do not give you a receipt or anything showing what they charged you for. If this charge posts to my account, I'll have to make a very unpleasant phone call. If you go, just get a bottle of Prosecco and make mimosas and wait to go to real brunch afterward.

reviews.author: Grecia Sofia T.
reviews.description: great drinks but the food is -5/10. Overpriced and just something I could make at home. Sopes had actual pork rinds (like from a bag) rather than actual meat???   View and drinks are great but please save yourself some money and don't eat here. Im going to have a second brunch after this to make up for the disappointment.

reviews.author: Kristina D.
reviews.description: Ok so I'm sorta confused about this place. Went here a couple years with my husband and it was pretty cool with the exception they wouldn't let him vape outside. So I figured I'd give it a try for valentines weekend (this weekend) since he's no longer vaping. I decided to look at the Instagram for paramour last night and boy was I glad I did.  Based on the photos and videos this place has turned into more of a gay bar and male review joint. I'm absolutely not homophobic in any way but I'm pretty darned sure my husband wouldn't be able to appreciate a bunch of dudes dressed up like ladies and grinding and flipping all over the place while we're trying to have a romantic evening.  I noticed there were hardly any photos of the drag and male review happenings at this place on the yelp but their Instagram is pretty much nothing but those things. Either way, I decided to cancel tonight's reservation and find a place a little more tame since it says there is yet another drag show going on this evening there.  If the owner reads this it would be nice to know what's going on over there and if there are any nights where it's just a bar and restaurant for those not into drag shows or male review. Thanks!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: Looove this place. Perfect for a girls brunch as they seat large groups. We had to make reservations beforehand, so there was no problem getting sat. The drinks were super strong and everyone looked to be having a swell time.   The ambiance is really "instagrammable" and I love how all the decorative pillows are mismatched. Be sure to check out the bathroom and the champagne vending machine!!!

reviews.author: Jeret G.
reviews.description: The drag show is amazing! The entertainment is top notch for south Texas and you'll love Kristi Waters! Make sure to arrive early if you're planning on attending the drag brunch so you can sit inside under the industrial size fans otherwise you'll get to experience Texas hell size heat outside.  Bring your friends for an amazing time with the drag show.  Make sure to pre-eat and pre-drink because the food is by far the worst brunch food in SA (sorry not sorry) and the drinks were overpriced and ehhh (unimpressive).  I would have rated a 3 star but for the amazing time we had because of the AMAZING DRAG SHOW!   Come with a group and get there early!

reviews.author: Frank G.
reviews.description: This is not an inclusive bar. First, it isn't sober friendly for people who want to enjoy the drag brunch or experience of a roof top. They have "mock tails" but if i paid $20 for a ticket then why do i have to get a drink minimum? Second, my partner has a bad back and wasn't allowed to use the elevator when we wanted to leave so they're not accessible friendly. Third, the drag queen host only talked about s*x and booze. As a local San Antonian, I hate to think this is what tourists experience when they visit.

reviews.author: Crystal A.
reviews.description: Good drag show but several misses. 1) They don't let you use the elevator!!! In took my older aunt to see a show and they refused to let her use the elevator!! You have to climb 4 flights of stairs! She made it to the top but couldn't breathe for a bit :( :(     2) under the FAQ section, it clearly says that there is a 15% service charge included in all prices... so "tipping isn't necessary but welcomed"..... okay so that justifies the $18 price tag on drinks... WRONG!! When I settled my tab, the waitress asked for a tip?!?! Saying prices don't include tip?!?! Are you kidding me?? 3) not real brunch. There is only like 5 food items :( so get tipsy and walk down 4 flights of stairs!!!   I wish it was better!

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: Bought tickets for Sunday drag brunch. Got an email that said seating started at 10 when really it started at 11 - conflicting reservation / event messages. Got there and the seating process was extremely disjointed. Since we were early as a party, we expected good seating as it is "first come first serve" and they tried to sit our group of 6 on a bench along the wall without any tables. We had to ask to be seated at a table where our group could actually see one another and hang out.   Once we got settled, it was obvious the drinks were ridiculously overpriced. $14 for a mimosa. And they don't have coffee for brunch? Kinda wild. On top of that the menu was extremely limited and for a place that claims they want to emulate luxury and have a dress code, they really don't serve nice food. The avocado toast is basically packaged guac on plain un toasted bread.   The area is nice on the rooftop but honestly not really conducive to a drag show. Depending on where you get sat, you may only see half of the performance.   The queens were great, only good part about the drag brunch.

reviews.author: Ashley S.
reviews.description: I came to Paramour on one of their quieter nights with a girlfriend and still had a blast. The place itself is so cute and beautiful as it overlooks the city. The drinks were just as beautiful and the cocktail servers were so friendly and fun to talk to! This place has a lot of photo ops so be super to snap some cute pics. I've heard a lot of hype about their drag brunch so will definitely be coming back soon.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: It feels so good to be able to go to bars again, especially when they're as cool and trendy as this one! Aside from the beer, the drinks are somewhat expensive, but I guess you're also paying for the view and the atmosphere. The waiters are very attentive, and the place is just as beautiful on the outside patio as it is in the inside bar/lounge area. We had some of their cocktails as well as beer, and all of it was great. This is definitely a cool place to go and splurge a bit for a date night, or a night out with friends!

reviews.author: Kynesha C.
reviews.description: Let me start by saying, I've been to many Drag Shows and enjoyed them all....BUT!!!!! this place was the worse experience I've had this far. And friend and I went to their BDSM show the Nighy before Halloween expecting to have a great time..NO MA'AM!. I purchased VIP tickets to the show expecting to have a memorable night only to be denied a seat in the main area. We got there, and was told there were no seat available and were offered 2 lawn type chairs and a wooden bench for a table to sit at, outside. After inquiring about the seating that was open ( mind you, this place is a FIRST COME FIRST SERVE SEATING place), those seat were reserved for larger parties. Of this place is first come first serve we should get the semi-comfortable couches in the building. No, they told us we couldn't sit in these areas. After having a somewhat heated conversation with a so-called manager our night was ruined. Upon asking about a refund since there was no "seating" available, we were told we could not get a refund but had to reschedule our visit. He were told we could not pick the night we wanted to reschedule for. WTF is that?!?!?  We asked to sit in a certain area and was told it was I safety hazard. Not 2 seconds later someone was seated exactly where we asked to sit. PLEASE DO BETTER PARAMOUR.  Those of us willing to spend our money should be treated better. Moreover, don't over book your shows and force your customers in uncomfortable positions. I will NOT be back despite the fact that I'm a Kristie Water's fan.. Please step up! To you potential customers, find another place to spend your  funds! Furthermore, spending hours to get into your best  threads to walk up 4 flights of stairs, outside,  just to sweat out your clothes, hair, makeup, lashes, brows hope and dreams to pay $18 for a watered down drink is just enough to wonder...Why Try?!?!????? Please do better.

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: So we arrived at 11am picked our seating based on the position on the umbrellas on the patio we sat there for 30 minutes my friend got up got us water . This rude waiter came turned the umbrella I said excuse me. He yelled you need to share don't be rude. Remind you he gave us no warning before turning the umbrella. After watching him serve drinks to everyone around us the group next to us would order water and give it to us. After one hour we left f the show this place sucks and he should be fired. The reviews don't lie this place is beautiful with horrible prices and bad rude service , stay away don't let the cuteness fool you

reviews.author: Delaney M.
reviews.description: Super cool ambiance! The whole place gives off a super kinky/ sexual vibe. All the drinks had dirty names and the throw pillows all said things like "Girls just want to have cum", etc and the ladies bathroom comes fully equipped with eye candy (giant Tom Sellack pictures). Did I mention there is a champagne vending machine?! They also have very neat neon signs everywhere- super photo worthy if you're into that stuff. Drinks were good too. We went 9/1/21 and the bartender said they had just rolled out a new menu that day. The staff was very friendly! We're just passing through town but we would definitely make our way back here again if we could

reviews.author: Chad H.
reviews.description: This was such a weird experience. I showed up and there's someone outside checking ID's. Then, you go to the bar on the 4th floor and you have to take the stairs all the way up. I was waiting for the dude to say he was kidding. But no... 3 flights of stairs. I got up and then the menu drinks were all about $20 each. The outside chairs were so uncomfortable. They also sit parties together. You and your friends could be sitting on a couch in a circle with chairs and if the chairs are open, a random party will join you. It was just ... strange.  I get the vibes they were trying to give off. The place was semi-cute. But the over priced drinks were killer to me. Upscale restaurants don't even charge that much. I recommend this as a place to stop for one drink during your nightly adventure. Not to stay all night.

reviews.author: Irene M.
reviews.description: The moment I walked into this place , I instantly loved it.   The vibe from the get go, was sensational.    I love the color, the ambiance, the lighting, the whole atmosphere.   The staff were Fantastic, and the Mgr on duty, was so in tune.  I mean Brendan, was the greatest, very attentive, aimed to please.  Drinks are spot on, and  the pecan ice is the bomb.  I highly recommend having together A Old Fashion and the Pecan ice cream together.  Great combo. I'm visiting from out of town and will be back for more of this Paramour.

reviews.author: Angel M.
reviews.description: We went for the Drag brunch. On a Sunday. My friends ordered the Barbacoa tacos. They came out extremely cold everybody's order. A friend of mine ordered the avocado toast and the Chilaquiles. The Chilaquiles is basically HEB corn tortilla chips with an egg on top and some mediocre Ranchero sauce. Not worth as much money as it is on the menu. Also was very cold. Avocado toast wasn't even toasted and see photos. Secondly the performers parking situation is unreal they blocked us in they said it was their parking lot there's no sign that says it's there parking lot there could've been an extreme emergency and no one could get out. And lastly me at the elevator does not work so you have to climb up 5 to 6 flights of stairs just to get to the rooftop. Don't drink too much that could seriously be a traumatic situation quickly. This is supposed to be one of San Antonio's upscale places and I'm just not seeing it here and I'm not afraid to speak the truth. Beautiful atmosphere but need some work.

reviews.author: Marcelo A.
reviews.description: One start is was more then they deserve. Planned a brunch for my friends birthday, purchased tickets online, made reservations, confirmed reservations both via text and on the phone with Angie, explained it was going to be a party of 4 (she claimed to have spoken to my fiend twice) and it was all good to go. Two of us arrive early 10:00am , the people at the door allowed 2 girls in front of us that belong to a party of 16. When we were asked if our group was complete, we explained we are still missing 1 people and we were turned away. The gentleman and the lady at the door stayed if they allowed us is it was going to cause chaos. 2 other people in our group finally arrive only for the lady at the door to say she had no idea we had reservation for a party of more. They wanted to give us a couch and then bring two folding chairs to the section. We decided just to go somewhere else. DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY ON THIS PLACE THAT IS SO ORGANIZED. Didn't even get an apology from the girl at the door.

reviews.author: Desi N.
reviews.description: The show and atmosphere was amazing! Service wasn't that great but not cause they weren't hustling, because they definitely were..... just seemed short staffed. The servers were their own bartenders.... so they were definitely running around trying their best! Idk if that's how it always is because it was our first time. We will definitely be going back. Can't wait to take our out of town friends!

reviews.author: De Janét L.
reviews.description: This is definitely one of my favorite spots here in San Antonio. It's a place that seems inclusive. The staff members were very accommodating to members in the party with disabilities (very appreciative of that). I attended Paramour in the evening for a social event and for the drag show brunch event, which was great to see the change in ambience. The music, furniture, drinks, and staff set a relaxing atmosphere during the evening and exuberance during the drag show. They also have great customer service, so I will definitely return to Paramour in the future. Keep up the great work Paramour staff! :)

name: Hills and Dales Ice House
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Been here a few times, including when it was the original Ice House that you picked up the beer out of the fridges.  The new owners put a bar, front patio and added some flare.  Love the plates on the ceiling and the choices of draft beer.  Last time we went, it was after Paintballing for a friend's 13 year old son.  So glad to stop in for a cold beer to help the aches and pain of shooting some teenagers!  Amanda was the bartender that day and was great.  She was friendly and talked with us at the bar.  She works weenends and I will be back for her smile.    This is a great bar near us and place every San Antonioian should try at least once.

reviews.author: Bradley P.
reviews.description: Be careful if you pay with a credit card. The bartenders added an extra tip on 2 separate occasions. I would not recommend this place due to shady business practices

reviews.author: Tony M.
reviews.description: I usually don't make reviews however, it's needed in this case. Night was going great, had a great time with friends until the end. Making my way to the restroom at the end of the night I was forced out (carried out) due to telling a bouncer I had to use the restroom before I left and not to touch me.

reviews.author: Nick M.
reviews.description: Cover is $20 FOR A BAR. Save ur money and go somewhere else. Don't know a club in SA that charges that much

reviews.author: Johnath C.
reviews.description: Shooting happen here.  It's not a friendly place and tons of people driving drunknin the area putting innocent lives at risk.

reviews.author: M M.
reviews.description: Warm beer. Terrible service. Rowdy patrons. Dirty restrooms.   There are plenty of decent watering holes in the area.... pass on this one.

reviews.author: Dikeasha R.
reviews.description: The bouncers here are way too aggressive. Will kick you out just because they feel like it. Literally PUSHED my friend out of a back door. They have no respect for women or their customers in general if you're not their friend.

reviews.author: Luis I.
reviews.description: I must say this place used to be my favorite bar hangout before corona. However, corona caused me to stop frequenting this place. Tonight was my first day back to this bar since corona and it was really suffering from slow service but it was fine. I must admit the place was full but the bad thing was that an individual physical shoved me out of the bar order area because he wanted to order. I bucked back at him told him I was ordering and if he could just wait until I payed he claimed that that was his bar and next thing u know the bouncers kicked me out. All while he kept claiming and screaming this is my bar. I was respectful and calm while he was aggressive and loud yet I got kicked out. If it was the owner oh well, nice bar I used to love it but I will never be back happy 4th but this vet will find another place.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great spot for a drink or just to hang out with friends. They have inside and outside seating. They also have a food truck in the back.  We went on a Saturday night. They had a live band.  Drinks are reasonably priced.  The bathrooms are clean (that's always a plus).  You can take your dog.  Parking is available on site  I will definitely return

reviews.author: Mr-Juan G.
reviews.description: Final update after visiting 3 different times on 3 different days. The first time I went was a good experience, the second time was terrible. The last time went well. I'm presuming that your experience will be based on how packed it is and who is in charge that night. If it's really packed, I don't recommend going. However, if it looks like you can make a straight shot to the bar or restrooms, definitely plan on staying for a few hours. The DJ plays music that makes you want to get up and move. That's pretty much all I have to say.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: Ghetto bar/ club. If you want to see a bar fight, bouncers jumping in, this is the place to go! Over priced drinks, music isn't bad.

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: Not the best place to go even in that area. They have watered down drinks. Rough crowd too. 0/10 would not recommend

reviews.author: Jon G.
reviews.description: Went there tonight after an anniversary dinner with my wife to have a few beers. Right away there's some very aggressive rent-a-cops that were being very confrontational and aggressive and  asking if you have weapons or not. I did not go there to get harassed as I'm walking in to entertain two ass clowns. I have had people ask me politely certain questions regarding weapons and and other details but not bulldogging me right as I walk in. This place is a overrated college bar anyway!!  Save your money and stay home!! #hillsanddales

reviews.author: Cassie F.
reviews.description: Visited on a Thursday night recently it had been my first time back since COVID. I already felt safer because it's more of an outdoor setting and the tables are plenty spaced out. They also have heaters for the colder nights. The hookah worker they had was beyond nice and helpful. Their bartenders were super friendly going around asking if we needed anything so that we didn't need to go up to the bar. The food truck they have is delicious, I tried their Texas size cheese sticks and they were delicious! DJ had a great mix of music going. Overall the whole night was very enjoyable.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Sunday Funday!  That's when I've mostly visited HandD and it's the go to place!  Mostly college students and 20 something year olds, but a chill relaxed atmosphere nonetheless.   Live music is on rotation, and the DJ keeps the mood energized with a good mix of 90s to Top 40 music.   Continued improvements to the plac e as a whole keep it a fun and lively environment. New signage makes great photo ops!   "Giant" beer pong played with trash cans and volleyballs is really fun, especially when you've taken advantage of the drink specials a couple times haha  The prices are fairly inexpensive even when not on HH, which adds to the appeal. So Please drink responsibly!

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: Went on a Sunday, and it was dripping hot outside. Our group and I were celebrating a friend's Birthday. We sat outside under the canopy because inside was packed. It felt really good inside lol but it was very loud. Surprisingly all we did was socialize and hardly drank but it was still a great time, just goes to show that you dont always need booze to have fun. The gorgeous and awesome Barkeep Jordan was very nice and had great customer service skills, her and her mini-hers were working hard and looking good. Jordan made sure everyone at the bar was being tended to. They also have a BBQ Truck in the parking lot!!

reviews.author: Jonathan W.
reviews.description: $15 cover for me to get in but not my fiancé on a SUNDAY. Ghetto ass place with no parking.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: Me and 3 of my girl friends waited in line for about 45 minutes at 11pm while other people were being let in by just walking up to the front. When we got to the front we paid $5 each for cover and was escorted to the back outdoor area where we were told to wait for our bartender to come to us... we waited another 50 minutes and no one showed up. So eventually we got tired of waiting to be served and left to find our car broken into.
