I know that break-in's is not necessarily something that a business can control but I parked in their parking lot where they apparently have security and it still happened. As businesses have to adjust to the new operating expectations, many companies have changed their procedures of service. But in this case we had zero service. One of the guys that cleans tables told us to wait for our bartender after we had already been waiting there for 20 minutes. That's why we kept waiting as long as we did. As long as they continue to operate this way, it's honestly not worth going.

reviews.author: Maria M.
reviews.description: I came here last weekend, and got one drink, my bill was $5 I left a $5 tip. So 10 bucks total right? Why did they charge me $45?!??! I have a picture of my receipt luckily, but every time I call it says mailbox is full. They also messed up my friends bill when we were still there. They charged her 3 extra drinks of bourbon.. when we only ordered a vodka cocktail. The waitress didn't write anything down and kept our cards the whole time. Honestly this was the worst experience.

reviews.author: Maxine C.
reviews.description: This place is great and the staff is friendly but the DJ is what brings this place down. How can a person who is to bring entertainment to their patrons, say F-u we don't play that shhhh here, when you request a song. You need a better DJ!!

reviews.author: Allegra R.
reviews.description: Nothing but fun games and good vibes!  A lot of bar availability, fast workers and clean environment

reviews.author: Sy B.
reviews.description: Every time I go it's the same. Atmosphere is good, cool place, but the bar tenders are ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. The bar is not crowded and they will take 10 minutes to get you a beer. Save your money and go elsewhere

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: It was mine and my boyfriend's first time here last night and we will definitely return! Atmosphere is amazing! Staff is super friendly, it's clean, the music is awesome and the food is great! They even have a bathroom polo in the women's restroom. Nice touch!

reviews.author: Hawk S.
reviews.description: The drinks seem old I hated all the mix drinks I order and on top of that the fried pickles I ordered tasted like they poured half the salt container on them. Every fried pickle I ate gave me heart burn. The crazy part is my girlfriend loves salt and the amount of salt was still too much. The drinks also sucked but I'm tired of going into detail. The only good part about this place is the music....sorry my girl wants to leave ima cut it short

reviews.author: George A.
reviews.description: Watched the fight, had a great burger and I went home. Staff was friendly and courteous, decor could use a little help but it was fine for a chew and screw!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: I10 has been my second home for decades. Good people. Hometown feel. Kinda like cheers. Prices are great. Drama is nill. Great times always and good laughs. Support them. They are your get away from your stressful life. Embrace it!!

reviews.author: Alycia M.
reviews.description: Best drink specials around hands down. They also have a DJ on certain nights and times. They have pool tables, darts, beer pong and plenty of seating and a big outside patio. The wings are pretty good and the chicken sandwich is huge! The owner or manager can be a bit of an ass tho, overall worth checking out.

reviews.author: Cassie H.
reviews.description: I'm here visiting SA and I've been to icehouse 3 times now. The reason I have come back? There's a bartender named Hannah. The second time I came here, she remembered my drink. The third time I came here, she had the drink ready for me before I even asked for it. While I was here on my 3rd visit and sitting outside, when she noticed that my drink was low, she already brought me a new one. Hands down best customer service.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: This bar charges you an extra 1.25 per drink "to stay open during covid" this makes NO sense because they serve food anyway. They said you are buying a water bottle when you are charged the extra 1.25 but when I asked for the water bottle they didn't have it to give to me?? Why charge for something you cannot offer. I ordered a double vodka drink, and was charge 1.25 per shot which was 2.50 total for one drink on top of the price of the actual drink. No other bar is doing this. Just raise your prices and be honest- and I would be more than willing to pay more since I know bars have struggled from covid. But charging extra saying you'll get an item(water bottles/chips) that they don't have or won't give you?? What????

reviews.author: Mikel C.
reviews.description: It's weird that this place that has always served food is adding an extra charge to every drink order under the guise of "COVID" like really to every drink order? Why not just to the ticket not for every drink crazy. Also I'm gay and I sat down in the middle table of the seating area with my other gay friends and nobody came to serve us just the tables around us, even a freshly seated straight couple got served as soon as they sat down. Raggedy bar with bad table service. The lady bartender was very nice tho!

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: I come here often for beer and games with friends. It is a very casual vibe with a lot of different games and activities. They ID for 21+ at the door so for the rest of the night you don't have to worry about carrying your ID around. With three separate bars the service is fast and easy to order. The chili rim for beer is honestly the best I have had in San Antonio. We will always choose this place with coworkers and friends for a chill and fun night.

reviews.author: Jose C.
reviews.description: If you're LGBT+ don't even think you'll get acknowledged by any of the staff.. waited 35 mins and everyone kept walking around us and serving everyone else. Also they make you pay an extra 1.50 on top of EVERY drink you order due to COVID. So not worth it.

reviews.author: Ashley D.
reviews.description: THE BEST BLOODY MARYS AND WINGS IN SA! They have live music till 1 am and they have very afforable drinks. It's a pretty big place, 3 bars and a huge outside patio. I love it here, you will too! Very chill on the weekdays and a party on the weekends

reviews.author: Joanie G.
reviews.description: I recommend everyone review their receipt before signing! We were charged chips and water bottlers we never got and were told that they added it because they need to make up for the beers sold to us to show they are a restaurant so they can remain open!!! My only thought was wow how can you do this to people blindly!  The manager said he would refund $10 of it and apologized stating that the bartenders should have told us that was going to happen! I'm all for bars being open but you can't just add items to someone's bill hoping we wouldn't notice! I can only imagine how many people just sign away and tip without even noticing!!!!! We will not be going back to this shady place

reviews.author: Josh A.
reviews.description: I want to say thank you to I-10 Icehouse last night after my glass was knocked over by an anxious ping pong player. Although I was not too close to the bar, a server noticed what happened and since my glass was mostly full, she kindly replaced it. What great service!   I always enjoy going to I-10 Icehouse and the great drink specials throughout the week. I haven't had food there but the wings always smell delicious. I also enjoy that they have many activities people can be entertained with such as ping pong, darts, billiards, giant connect four, a basketball game, a big screen projector. Good job, y'all! This is what keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: Ari R.
reviews.description: The staff is the only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one because everyone who helped me and my party were so nice. The parking area is small and there was a big dip in the spot so I almost stepped in a puddle of water while getting out. It's a moderately clean place with plenty of seating and like I said, a lot of friendly staff. The food is so sub par. I ordered the sample platter of appetizers and it was really meh. Just grease and little actual flavor, yes I understand it's basic bar fare, but the fried mushrooms were not good. I'm not sure they even cleaned them first. Chips and salsa were fine and the cheese quesadilla was actually ok. I had some beer then switched to water which I drank until I realized (as I was leaving) that the glass wasn't all that clean. Bleh!

reviews.author: Alyssa M.
reviews.description: First of all... basketball is $1. Wurzbach is 50 cents.  Second of all... they took forever to bring us our nachos after ordering them twice.  Third of all... the ladies bathroom is very unsanitary.  #truenews #wewant50centbasketball

reviews.author: Viviana G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I frequently visit I-10 Icehouse for all the games they offer. They have darts, corn hole, pool, ping pong, large connect four, basketball, and Jenga. They offer different drink specials everyday of the week some are actually really good such as 1.75 beers. Parking is easy during the week but weekends it gets very crowded. They show most MMA matches or boxing matches but they charge covers for those nights.   Service isn't that good here or the food but we usually just come to hang out and drink.  The inside is a little drab but very spacious and plenty of seating.

reviews.author: Kiara R.
reviews.description: Really love this sports/dive bar. One of my absolute favorite people there is Jen. First, she's a great bartender. Her micheladas are truly one of my favorites in SA. Every experience I've had with her has been so nice, especially after a long day at work.   Today, Vino, the food manager really made my day. I once had a bad experience with the food and never really wanted to risk ordering food again until today. I just so happened to ask Jen if the cook was in a good mood because of said bad experience and it just so happened that Vino over heard. He made sure my Cheese Burger was hot and exactly how I wanted it. It was SO good. It was also nice how considerate and humble he was. I couldn't have had a better service after a really tiring day. I will be back for my Burger and Micheladas soon!!

reviews.author: Darrian W.
reviews.description: My kind of place! Although around 6pm the bartending could use a little more help, but I'm giving this place 5 stars bc of Veno, the cook. He made excellent food with excellent service. He acted as our waiter when he is not one. Thank you, I've been dreaming of those chicken tenders ever since. LOL!

reviews.author: Lorrisa L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and i venturing around pearls.  We came across to High street wine.   First time here.  It is a great place to sit and talk and enjoyed some wines.  Austin was great.  He was patience and asked what kinds of wine we like and looking for.  Excellent service and very attentive  Lol thank for the off the menu pumpkin pie Will be one of my to go spot now

reviews.author: Kristin F.
reviews.description: I've been coming to this place for years and have never had a bad experience. The staff is knowledgeable, the wine selection is great, and the bites are elevated.

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful Sunday to enjoy The Pearl, wine and a charcuterie board! This place is a must try. We stopped in for an afternoon glass of wine and they did not disappoint.  The menu is pretty extensive with light snacks, charcuterie boards you can mix and match and flatbreads. I would say you will get totally full eating here if you're super hungry but it's a nice spot for brunch, light afternoon meal until dinner.  Hubby and I both enjoyed the wine flight where they pick wines based on you're taste. The waiter did a superb job picking 3 delicious choices for us! Well done.  We picked 4 on the charcuterie board and I added smoked salmon which was an up charge. We will come back as this was a great day date out.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: Part of the Pearl's charm, are the many great restaurants, coffee places and wine and beer businesses located in it. High Street Wine is one of these locales.   High Street is located on the street section of the Pearl. I came after dinner to meet some friends and loved this wine bar's huge wine selection. I ordered a glass of Garnet, which was very good. Their wine by the glass ranges from $11 upward, so it's definitely not cheap. Bottles can also be purchased and they had some good wine flights.   High Street is ideal as an after dinner hangout, or for a pre-dinner drink/ snack. I did not get to sample the snacks, but I intend to when I return.   I really loved the feel of this place and atmosphere. It's an advantage that it is located at the Pearl, which tends to be very active during summer evenings, especially Saturdays. I've already added High Street to the list of places to which I will return.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: This is honestly one of my favorite spots in San Antonio and we returned for Fathers Day weekend !  Just a great selection of wine including some unique finds and all very well priced. Comprehensive beer selection with a wide variety of great ( aka Untappd highly rated ) finds and great food  This time we tried two of their flatbreads which are a newer addition to the menu, their cheese and charcuterie plate , olives and nuts as well as as their champagne , IPAs and a wine flight !   We ended up leaving with a Portuguese bottle of red which as for hard Napa reds is new to us but was a great choice after trying on the wine flight !  Great service , cool vibe and one of my fave spots in SA

reviews.author: Erica M.
reviews.description: Awesome wine place tucked away between Cured and Merit Coffee. They have great selections of wines, but beer is also available if you're not in the "wine mood". Small eats like charcuterie boards are available as well. Staff members are very friendly and knowledgeable. We had amazing service from Matt on the day we went.  Love how the atmosphere is relaxing and away from the crowds of the yard and market areas. This is one of the very few places at the Pearl that has an  unpretentious vibe. Will definitely be back next time we're in the area!

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Last week I visited High Street Wine Co. for the first time since the pandemic started and I had a fabulous experience!  High Street Wine has always been a more intimate wine bar, with only a limited number of sitting space. Due to the pandemic, they've moved most of their tables outdoors which I think is amazing, because their outdoor space is so beautiful and at night you can enjoy the new holiday lights. Another great thing about High Street is that they are located away from the madness of The Pearl's main yard, which made me feel more comfortable and safe. All of their tables have a QR code at the center which you can scan to view their wine and food menu. If you have any issues scanning the code, you can also find the menu on their website. Frankly, I was a little overwhelmed by their menu and decided to just ask our server for his recommendation. He asked us what kind of wine we were looking for and a price range, and his recommendation was on point! Never be afraid of asking for suggestions. The people working here are experts and they will be able to tell you everything you need to know about their selection.   Thank you High Street Wine Co. for a wonderful evening!

reviews.author: Yvonne M.
reviews.description: I just had the absolute best and most informative wine tasting here, EVER! Scott introduced me to 6 new wines and explained their origins and taste  salmon flatbread was expertly made and taste was divine. highly recommend this place for a lovely saturday afternoon

reviews.author: Kay V.
reviews.description: This is a great place to sit with some friends, talk, and enjoy a glass or two of wine.  The wines are great.  There is a wide variety.  I enjoyed a Pinot Gris from Oregon, while my friends had a New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.  The food was great.  The charcuterie board had a variety of meats and cheeses, along with honey, a fig jam, and a great spicy mustard for accompaniments.  The flatbreads might have been a bit crispier but they had great flavor l.  I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: My favorite spot in the Pearl. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. They all know how to find something you'll enjoy from there extensive and exceptionally well curated wine selection. Perfect for a date night or equally acceptable if you're just popping in for an afternoon glass of bubbly after yoga.

reviews.author: Irene T.
reviews.description: The last time we came here they had such excellent wine and appetizers. It was like a meal with all the meat,  cheeses and jams on the charcuterie board. The wine guide was spot on with our wine choices and recommendations!

reviews.author: Ampal K.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots here at the pearl! the charcuterie boards are amazing!   Wanted to go to a vineyard but didn't feel like driving an hr to Fredericksburg so this place was perfect. Close to home and super cuter. You could bring your puppy and have a chill day at the pearl.

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: Where do I even begin. Wow. Welcome to the first and only non-pretentious, highly educated, relaxed environment wine bar to ever exist in San Antonio. Whether you are a suited professional, or a chef that's got a day off and needs a relaxed patio day in chanclas, get to High Street. They truly accommodate your personal wine palette

reviews.author: Rea F.
reviews.description: My husband and I love this place.  We wish we lived closer so we could visit more regularly.  It's tucked away in a corner of the Pearl right by Cured.  This past Saturday was our second visit, and we had a great time.  My husband had the red flight and I had the rose flight.  The server took his time to explain the different wines and to answer our questions.  We then shared the salmon flatbread and charcuterie board, and we had plenty of food for the two of us.  Overall, it's a great place - could not recommend it more!

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: Kelsey was amazing! I loved her!  Her knowledge and expertise took me to another level with wine.  The board was well balanced and the wine was delicious.  I thoroughly enjoyed my evening of celebration.

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: This is my first time going here and I feel like I found a gem. My friend suggested this place to get a drink after work. We ordered a platter with cheese, duck, pork, and jam. It was so tasty! I definitely recommend the duck. It was the right amount of salty and just melted in my mouth.   I also ordered the 'Rose all day' flight, while my friend ordered the 'it's all about me' flight. She mostly got red wines, which she allowed me to sample. There was only 1 wine I didn't like, but I'm chalking that up to personal preference. If you're looking for a laid back place to get good wine and snacks, this is the place for you!

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: The wine list here is amazing and changes regularly. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and will help you make a great selection. During COVID they have intermittently been doing online wine classes which we enjoyed immensely. I highly recommend High Street Wine Company.

reviews.author: Debbie C.
reviews.description: My favorite place to sit and enjoy wine with friends and snack on an exquisite selection of cheeses.  The staff is knowledgeable and attentive.  I'm never disappointed.

reviews.author: Keri M.
reviews.description: I love this place! It is always amazing! A low key chill spot with a huge selection on wine. The staff is always topping of your water or offering to get something.... it fabulous! Forever will be a favorite go to spot of mine!

reviews.author: Phillip M.
reviews.description: If you like wine and want to experience wines you CANNOT find anywhere else you need to try this place. I met Kelsey and Austin today and these cats are on point.  Very knowledgeable and extremely personable. They know wine and they want you to enjoy it. The food was an experience as well.  They know how to pair and more importantly how to explain what they are doing.  Some of the most fun I've had exhorting wine.  Good luck on the exam Kelsey!

name: Gristmill River Restaurant
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Dakota G.
reviews.description: Walked into the Gristmill about 7:55 P.M. on New Year's Eve 2021, not really expecting to be seated.  Surprisingly, the hostesses were very accommodating, and promised us the outside seating we requested "in about 20 minutes".  We were seated in five. Our server, Morgan, a lovely  young woman, a college student at a Texas University,  was impeccable in carrying out her duties, she gave us much better service one might expect on such a busy night as this was.  Everything was perfect, from the seating, to the food - onion rings, tortilla soup, the bronze catfish and the baby back ribs were all excellent. It was an amazingly wonderful experience made so by a diligent and attentive wait staff. Totally recommend the Gristmill River Restaurant

reviews.author: Nrsnik W.
reviews.description: Ambience: the vibe felt great. Nice breeze coming in from the water. Our server was super nice. We went early so not too crowded until about noon-1p. Great surroundings/shopping to walk off all the food.   Food: As we reviewed the menu, our server couldn't tell us too much about certain entrees secondary to his own eating restrictions (which I understand) HOWEVER, does kinda put a damper on things as I was hoping to narrow down my thought options....chicken, steak, burger or what???  I settled on the Bacon wrapped filet because I know that almost anything wrapped in BACON has potential but, I wasn't WOW'd by it. Bacon wasn't cooked all the way, steak was really tender but a little more red, than I like, for a medium well preparation. They also put gravy on my mashed when I clearly said, gravy on the side. Assuming he forgot that part??? No biggie...moving on....  One friend ordered the Trout, really good, seasoned well.  Another friend ordered the chopped steak, really good and the cheese on top totally set it off.  Overall, I wouldn't mind eating here again with friends on another beautiful weekend day!  Just keep in mind, NO AC, just ceiling fans.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This place was really great. Staff at the door wasn't very friendly but we enjoyed our waitress a lot. She was so funny, kind, and really made our experience phenomenal.  The restaurant itself is HUGE and beautiful. Definitely a great place for a date, friends and family hangout, just something for everyone and every occasion.  Food is great, I really see what all the hype is about. They pack their sandwiches FULL of meat. We could not believe the portions we were served and for the price? Absolutely worth it. Wait for a Sunday afternoon wasn't too bad at a little over an hour. Gives you time to hangout around town and enjoy the shops. If you can snag an outside table, I would highly recommend it, like I said the views from the restaurant are great.  10/10 recommend

reviews.author: Tanya B.
reviews.description: We had so much fun at this restaurant! They are currently redoing the back so all of the seating was inside.. they had a nice warm fire going.. great views of the river inside.  It did get pretty toasty inside thankfully one of the waitresses came over and opened up the windows..   I ordered the steak salad and my friend ordered the chicken salad sandwich..  The steak salad was good, there was a handful of the lettuce that should have been tossed out not tossed into the salad which is why this isn't 5 stars.. The steak was good super tender!  We both loved the chicken salad sandwich.. it's not sweet which made it different and even more delicious!  I almost forgot the onion rings! I would absolutely order those again! Only able to eat one so I'd order the small but sooo good and not very oily at all!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Food was amazing but the service was lackluster. I will just blame covid. We ordered the onion rings as appetizers. Obviously we were forgotten. Ours appetizer finally arrived and then our meals 1-2 minutes later.   Good thing the onion rings were amazing. I had the chicken fried chicken and it was cooked perfectly and had a nice seasoning. The flat potato fries were a pleasant surprise with the perfect amount of seasoning salt.

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: If it wasn't for the view/location, I think I can totally rate it as 1, or if any.    The food was not the tastiest thing I have had. It was decent. It is as average as going to Jim's/IHOP (please don't be offended if you are a fan). But the price you have to pay for a side of onion rings (picture below), it was $11.99. Honestly, they were genuinely crazy prices for the quality and quantity.   The customer service is extremely bad. We were walked into our seated area. No one greeted us at a table until about 30-40 minutes in, and that's after we tried to get their attention. No one ever came back to check on us after the food was delivered, and we were even having a hard time to get the check. I personally wouldn't go back again.

reviews.author: James Y.
reviews.description: Absolutely love the few of this old place. Food is delivered at lightening fast speed. Everything we had was amazing. I recommend the onion rings and the ribs... simply fell off the bone!

reviews.author: Krista C.
reviews.description: This is definitely a must go to spot if you're staying or visiting in Gruene. The service was excellent and the food was good. Highly recommend the torpedoes! A unique app that was super good (but warning, also very filling!). I tried to order their filet but the night we came they were out so I was a little bummed by that but their ribeye was also pretty good.

reviews.author: Angie A.
reviews.description: Did a little weekend trip out here. Definitely a cool spot to check out and is a must if you're in the area. Old school texas vibes. Have some beers and kick back with friends enjoy the sunny weather.

reviews.author: Jessica R.
reviews.description: The one spot to grab a bite when you are in Gruene.  I enjoy the nice outdoor seating and view of nature. I had the margarita which was tasty and topped off with edible flowers.  The pulled pork sandwich was enough to share.  November is a great time of year to shop, eat, and enjoy the beautiful little town.

reviews.author: Andrew Z.
reviews.description: The staff was very rude I wouldn't go back and deal with them again. They were dismissive with all their guests and made it difficult to even get a table.

reviews.author: Steph B.
reviews.description: The Gristmill is an iconic restaurant for the Gruen (pronounced "green") New Braunfels (pronounced "new bronzefels") area.   I have been here many times and give the place 5 always because of location and ambiance and the he have had to -1 for food with the comment that sometimes the food is a five and other times it's a 3.   But I come back because it's a really cool place and when there's live music it's even more cool, yea more better.   I don't recommend the jalapeño margarita as it makes my lips hurt but I do recommend the jalapeño poppers because even tho they are hot the taste is so good you would eat them if they were shooting flames.   Have fun!

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Just ok. By no way can I see a four star restaurant. We walked in for what you can consider as aperitif time or early dinner. We had dinner plans already but felt peckish so we had a couple of drinks and some nibbles. Our server Taj was great he was five stars. We opted on first available and were seated in the outside picnic tables. Our first table was next to the area where there is a waiter station but the smell was very off putting and asked to be seated at an adjacent table which was allowed. As we walked by we are several almost uneaten sides being pushed to the side and later picked up for disposal. We saw another table being waited on by a different server that was audibly and visibly upset that their food had yet to come out. We order precisely what we were planning to have a margarita and a sangria. Both were fine. We had the chips and artichoke dip and the half rack. All descent. Not phenomenal but descent. Everything was lukewarm. Our food came out quite quickly even before the steaks from our disgruntled diners. And it's was falling off the bone but lukewarm at most. This restaurant has loads of patrons and they hire a lot of personnel but I think they need to dedicate themselves as well to the kitchen. The coleslaw was not homemade and just about to turn which you can taste and even notice from the bubbly juices of the slaw. Would I return...No just not a four star experience with the quality and taste of their food.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: Must see! Everyone that comes to Gruene has been to the Gristmill. It is located right next to Gruene Hall and the water tower. This building is historic and used to be the cotton gin. I enjoy looking at the building every time I come here. I included a bunch of pictures so you can see the charm of this place.  I got seated right away but if you are coming on a weekend be prepared for a little bit of a wait. They do not do reservations so plan ahead. The good thing is that they have a ton of shaded outdoor seating if you have to wait. For an added bonus you can often hear the music from Gruene Hall.  I ordered the club with fries and it was great. Their fries are the best and I have never had a bad experience here. My wife also got the club sandwich and she loved it.   I have also done work events here and you can rent a room in the back. The service is always great which is nice being this is a tourist attraction.  If you haven't been here before then you have to put this on your itinerary while in Gruene. You won't regret it!

reviews.author: Nina C.
reviews.description: This was probably the coolest restaurant that I went to while around San Antonio area.  This was actually previously a factory of some sort many moons ago.  It looked as if not much was changed from the original, or they just made it look that way.  I have to say, if you like AC while eating then it's best to find another restaurant.  They have fans and shade.  So when you walk in, it's right in the town of Gruene (pronounced Green), you can easily park in the little towns parking lot and just walk (if you're able).  My aunt informed me to NEVER come on the weekend or you'll be waiting a very long time because it's a hot spot.  Off to the side of the building there are countless benches that have mist oscillating fans so you don't have to pass out while waiting in the heat.  They do have live bands that come for entertainment, and an outside bar to order drinks while you wait.  I mean, if you have all that in the waiting area then it really must be worth it.  Luckily we sat right down on the week day.  We were given the option to choose inside or outside.  We went for outside. Now this restaurant has so many levels and stairs that lead you to the back of the building.   The waiter was fantastic, the food was incredible.  All-in-all it was a good experience.  I didn't talk too much about the food because you're more so going there for the atmosphere, and Gristmill definitely wins.

reviews.author: Henry R.
reviews.description: We stopped in for lunch today .. the burger and sausage, etc was fantastic.. my wife had the chicken fried chicken and mashed potatoes.   I wished they had already sweetened tea   All tasted was great..

reviews.author: Christina T.
reviews.description: This restaurant used to be good. The amount of food you got was huge. They were known for their chicken fried steak. Well not anymore, it was tasteless.  The meat and gravy had no flavor. The green beans were good after you added the seasoned salt that was on the table.  It's a shame that the prices go up, portions go down and the quality goes down. The service was very slow. I found out the waitress was new and overwhelmed. We still gave her about a 30% tip because she was new.  I will say that the queso was good after we added pico to it.  Probably won't go back. So many other places are better for chicken fried steak.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: Not pet friendly at all, not even in outdoor spaces! We were told to leave our dog in our car and come back without him and they would be more than happy to seat us!! SMH! If your pets are like family I would definitely not recommend this place at all!

reviews.author: Casey H.
reviews.description: One of the best steaks I've had but my biggest reason for the review was the cook on the steak.  I asked for a medium rare and not only was it on point, it was so tender and evenly cooked.  Fantastic cook on all that came to the table.  My only complaint (it was the end of the night) server never came back with drinks / even after we paid our ticket (and we did ask for refills since drinks were all low).  Haha - she was out! Oh well, I'm sure she was tired, as we were too! We will be back for sure and for some refills

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Took my wife here for her birthday today 3/1/2021. What a great old building and we felt totally safe with lots of distance. The rooms were all wonderful with the large fireplaces.   Our server was Chloe and see was very efficient and kind. My wife loved her fish but was did not love the round fries as much because she thought they were a little soggy. The crispy one were great. I ordered the chicken fried steak and it was perfect. The sauce on the side was great. The mash potatoes were very tasty but could have been hotter. I love hot food. It is a issue I have with all restaurants.   This is a beautiful building and we will definitely come back and enjoy the river once COVID is over. I bet the outdoor band areas are great in the summer. All in all much more to love about this place than minor little things.

name: Halcyon
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ryan Anthony H.
reviews.description: NICE SPOT FOR LOCAL COFFEE and I STRONGLY RECOMMEND ESPECIALLY TOURIST TO COME HERE I came here and really enjoyed it. The coffee was very good and I even ordered a delicious sandwich. My friend ordered a Mac n cheese and she told me it was very good.  I definitely want to come here again and try more from the menu. Also, this place isn't far from downtown so if you are either a local or a visitor you will definitely have to come check this place out.  Great for groups too!

reviews.author: Jacklyn R.
reviews.description: My pals ordered the veggie fried rice and brisket fried rice. Both said they were scrumptious and would maybe order it again. I ordered the Earl Grey 75 and loved it, it's like a sour lemon candy.   They played Bad Bunny for the majority of our time here - which we loved! I couldn't help but think this was some type of way to make POC here more comfortable after a thread on twitter was circulated. In the thread, the writer talks about being asked to move to the back of the establishment to accommodate for other clientele. hmmm.  thread: https://twitter.com/biancamarisaa/status/1495458220885917704?s=21

reviews.author: Amber Y.
reviews.description: "It is so bad I want to give you a zero but that's not possible so I give you a one."  Never tried this spot before but it looked inviting so I gave it a shot. As soon as you go in you can order your food and drinks at the bar. I ordered my food immediately because the host sort of rushed me to. (Did not feel welcome to ask questions over the food.) I ended up getting an Egg Sandwich and a Long Island Iced Coffee. They never brought me my beverage so I went up to check on it on my own and the response I got was they called my name once. My coffee by then had watered down - So it tasted terrible! Then I waited for my sandwich with high hopes. While waiting, I opened my utensils up to find the fork was washed incorrectly with left over food still stuck to it. Swapped out my utensils then my food finally came. The presentation of the food could have been WAY better. They just simply place your food in the middle of a silver tray. Then I bit into my food.   I could have made a better sandwich at home. My side of potatoes were hard and cold! The cheese in the sandwich was stale and gross. And this may be reaching but the music they played was also annoying - matrix lo-fi beats??   Will not come again but hey their esthetic is cute to study at.   Way too expensive for what you get!

reviews.author: Truth S.
reviews.description: I've always enjoyed the Halcyon coffee shops in Austin for years. My friend and I were visiting Sam Antonio and wanted to get brunch. Even though she said the last time she went (years ago) to the SA Halcyon, she didn't have a good experience, we decided to give the place another shot.  I called in an order (only a waffle with fruit and a latte. I was told it would be ready in 10-15 minutes. I had brought my dog to get her out and let her hang with me on the patio; but she is a rescue who sometimes gets nervous in public places, especially if I'm not right next to her. Since my friend was taking a while to arrive, I was forced to leave my dog out on the patio by herself. She started shaking as soon as I walked away. I thought, "I'm just gonna grab my food and should be back in under a couple of minutes. No biggie." WRONG.   There was a group of 3 people together ordering when I walked up and 2 other ladies behind them. I'm thinking "5 minutes tops"...Nope. The woman behind the register (though nice) was taking her sweet time and it took literally 15 minutes for her to take the first 3 people's orders. The 2 other ladies in front of me gave up and left. I didn't know if it was the customers who were so rudely slow or what was going on. Of course, I had the added stress of wanting to get back to my dog (no one's fault but my own); but the line got so long due to the slowness that it was curved almost to the side of the building by the time it was finally my turn!   After 15 minutes (and multiple people in line looking at each other annoyed and even making comments to each other about it), the 3 people finally walked away and it was my turn. I realized very quickly that the lady behind the register (a redhead with black glasses) was the issue. Again, I don't mean this as a personal attack because she was friendly; but my goodness, she does not need to be behind the register at all, let alone when the place is slammed.  There needs to be a separate place where someone is just picking up a to go order and wants to pay and bounce. By the time I finally got my food, my latte wasn't ready. So I went back to my dog and starting to eat. The waffle was totally soggy (from sitting there so long) and they put maybe 6 little slices of strawberries on the large Belgian waffle and maybe 6 thin slices of cantaloupe (I was told it would be strawberries and blueberries) when I asked and not only do I not like cantaloupe but also it's not a good fruit to put on a waffle anyway).  I was told to come back in "2 minutes" for my latte. I gave it 5 mins, walked in, nothing. Came back a few minutes later and he had finished making it (no other drinks were waiting at the bar); but somehow the latte was only lukewarm. My total for a soggy waffle with a few pieces of fruit and a latte came out to just under $19. Yowza.   I will continue to support the Austin Halcyon location but will certainly never go back to this one again. The guy behind me in line said the same thing.  I gave it 2 stars (instead of 1) simply because the two employees I interacted with were nice.

reviews.author: Rich L.
reviews.description: I was über excited to try out this spot after yoga on a Sunday morning as I was a little peckish. I ordered a vanilla latte with chicken and waffles: I received the food way before I received the coffee and it was downhill from there. It took about 25 minutes to receive my coffee and that's after me inquiring about the status of it. The chicken was slightly overcooked, bacon was harder than cement and the waffles were decent but were room temperature when I received them. It's a cool spot but for the time I had to wait, the price and the food being subpar it wasn't worth it.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: The Halcyon is a great spot to grab a drink of any sort with their huge selection and unlimited bar beverage options. We happened to dine in on a cold evening. We ordered Mayan Hot Cocoas which has a kick of spice! Very delicious. Very smooth. It was definitely a perfect time for one.

reviews.author: Rene R.
reviews.description: I came here even through it was less than 4 stars because I know sometimes people can be tough on restaurants but I should have gone with all the averages reviews and not came.  To start of the Benedict's English muffins were not cooked and they were smothered with cold butter, yuke .  Then my wife avocado toast to and out and it wasn't toasted and sent it back and waited almost 30mins and had to remind the person who brought out the food.  Lastly, my son's omelette was over cooked and smelled of it.  Listen, I'm a big foodie and appreciate quality food and don't mind paying more and in fact prefer but maybe what they need is to deliver quality food and not focus on just serving a long line.  Hopefully this doesn't fall on deaf ears, you've been warned.  Quick update my wife toast came out and still wasn't fixed and only half of it was toasted.  What the hell is going on here? Here is a pic to show proof

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: I was excited to try this spot but I was disappointed and don't think I am likely to return. I met a friend for brunch and the restaurant was busy but not crazy busy. We were seated quickly and our drink order was taken. We quickly decided on meal options and ordered  when our drinks arrived. Waited a reasonable time for food. Then we never saw waitress again. I understand many restaurants are short staffed so we were patient. Biggest issue is  food was bland. I ordered a veggie skillet and it look extremely appetizing but it was really bland. I requested some Hollandaise sauce to attempt to add a little flavor and that was a huge fail. The Hollandaise sauce was thick, bland like a side of whipped butter and bland mayonaise combined, unlike any Hollandaise sauce I have ever had and I love hollandaise sauce. My friend ordered the chorizo blanco migas skillet and said it seemed bland except for the chorizo in it. She felt like it lacked flavor despite having so many other ingredients. The overnight french toast had an overload of sugary sweetness but lacked other flavors. It really is more like a dessert.  All in all, I am reluctant to come back.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The coffee was great! And the whole vibe of the restaurant was honestly really cool and they were playing some sweet tunes. Indoor and outdoor seating available which is nice. My only quarrel is that there were A LOT of flies inside. They were buzzing all around and even though inside was nice it didn't feel very clean at all. But my main issue was with the flies, I was kind of shocked with how many there were. It is a nice spot though and the coffee was actually really good so I think it still earns four stars in my book.   Pro tip: get the latte of the week it's usually something dope!    Overall: 3.93 stars

reviews.author: Kali C.
reviews.description: Such a fun little place right on the river! it's on the smaller side and the seating isn't fantastic for groups of more than 4, but the food was great as was the coffee! Although there was a kid's menu online, they didn't offer it in store. They were quick to help me find something full size for my kiddos to share though. The staff was all very nice. I had the veggie skillet, so good! My kiddos shared a waffle and two scrambled eggs and said it was delicious. I would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Nicole K.
reviews.description: I like the menu... but I can't even enjoy the food if I wait over 45 mins for breakfast. Yes they were busy- but there has to be a limit to the wait! As far as the food... it was not good. My sons side of sausage she ordered literally look like somebody has been taking bites of it! See pic for how it was presented to us. My daughters order was completely wrong.

reviews.author: Aubree T.
reviews.description: I've been coming here for the past 4 years and have always loved this place.. but I'm giving it two stars because the past two times have let me down a little.  The place is hot. I work up a sweat in about 10 minutes just from sitting. I had trouble connecting my laptop to the wifi and was told to join a server (by an employee) which did not seem to work at all. I ordered an iced London Fog and a Turkey Brie sandwich. I got a hot London Fog (in August??), my sandwich and a different bag of chips from what I ordered. There are also a bunch of flies in the eating areas. This place is so cute and has the best vibe, I've just been sad my last two visits. :(

reviews.author: Grace L.
reviews.description: Super long wait and you can't make reservations. They seem to be severely understaffed so we did our best to be understanding about the crazy slowness, especially considering they had hiring positions on the front door.   They used to have $1 champagne flute mimosas and $2 wine glass mimosas. Maybe due to COVID it is now $3 and $6, which is still better than every other brunch place especially considering they give you 90+% champagne with a splash of juice, the way it should be :p i hope when the world "gets back to normal", they'll bring those back.  We got lavender mimosa and the grapefruit mimosa. The lavender one was too sweet for my taste, and the grapefruit one was alright.   I got the goat cheese arugula toast, and it was delicious. My boyfriend got the southwestern skillet because he was "suckered into ordering it because of the sweet potatoes", but sadly noted he couldn't even taste any sweet potato. The dish was too greasy and everything in it just tasted like grease.   We got the overnight french toast per a review recommendation, as a celebration for his birthday. The top half was delicious and rich, but the bottom half was literally burnt (pictured)!! I can't believe they would serve something so obviously BLACK and burnt. If i made that I'd cut it off and most definitely would not give it to a guest.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Perfect place to get a cup of coffee or a specialty cocktail-either one will start your morning off right!   Stopped by to get a coffee while waiting for brunch in the area. Not busy at all, COVID measures were taken, masks required and work by staff. Social distancing was enforced as well.   Outside patio was open to sit and was a perfect spot to let the sun peak down on you while sipping your cup of joe.  Always greeted with a smile when I arrive so I am sure I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Lourna M.
reviews.description: Loved their brunch options, the skillet, the ambiance and the mimosas! Prompt service yet they don't rush you out - ample seating area, friendly service - great for brunch with the girls or lunch date.

reviews.author: B V.
reviews.description: I probably had the worst experience I've ever had at a food establishment right here at Halcyon. I came with my business partners for a meeting, we ordered 2 coffee drinks, and 3 food items. The food we ordered was - 2 egg sandwiches, and then a brisket rice bowl. Sit down start our business meeting, 45 minutes go by with no food. We go and ask about it, and they say it will be promptly out. Another 20 minutes go by and still nothing. After about an hour and 20 minutes we decide that this is ridiculous and we want a refund. They apologized to us and let us know they are short staffed. I was completely blown away. Over an hour for small food items, and to be told they were short staffed AFTER we ordered was very unprofessional and unorganized. I understand there are staffing shortages everywhere , but the person taking the orders should let the customer know "Hey we're short staffed. Food is on average taking an hour to get out" then there are no surprises. But this was a huge surprise. We were so so so upset, and I guess a ton of other people are too since you can't review them on Yelp right now, so here I am. I would stay away at all cost , there's a ton of great coffee shops, bars, restaurants and sandwhich shops in the area that will take care of you in a reasonable time. And if they can't, they will let you know when you order!

reviews.author: Tiff D.
reviews.description: A few visits here and I'm indifferent.  My brunch bowl was good but the breakfast sandwich was a sad excuse for a breakfast sandwich.  1 piece of extra limp bacon and no seasoning, overcooked egg...

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: We were here to eat and drink on a Friday night. They were pretty busy, but it was mostly college students studying and drinking coffee. We almost felt like we were disturbing study club - haha! We had the Gouda Burger, Nacho Tots, and a couple of beers. Everything was great and came out quickly. Perhaps a different crowd on a Saturday, but Friday appears to be for the studious!

reviews.author: Daniel Z.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times and loved the Latte. However I made the mistake of getting matcha this time. It was busy noon time, the barista didn't ask me whether I want my matcha to be sweetened, and just added sugar anyway. And it came out way too sweet and completely masked the bitter and savory taste matcha usually has. If anyone wants sweet matcha, why not just eat candy?!

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: Service is so slow. When I got in line there was about 3 people ahead of me and that took about 15 minutes in line. Then I get to the front and I just want to order a coffee for my walk back and the girl decides to stop taking orders to bus a table when there's about 18 other open tables. Instead of grabbing a tray she decides making 5 trips with a few things at a time is better. I'm now waiting an additional 10 minutes just watching them work, granted they were doing stuff but there wasn't enough staff and the lack of efficiency was killing me. The table is clean so I think she'll come back for orders since now the line is out the door and she starts rolling silverware.  I left without any coffee and I was first in line but I figured at the pace they were moving it would be another 30 minutes. This is the second time I've come at around noon and have waited too long for coffee.

reviews.author: Dinorah C.
reviews.description: I finally got to try out this place for the first time. If I could give it 3.5 stars, I would, but 3 is too low.   Drinks- Hurricane was just right and so was the French Quarter Margarita  Food: Ordered the seafood fondue appetizer to start off. The flavor was perfect. For something that should contain seafood in it, it did not have enough to be worth $16. I also ordered the Sea Bass entree. That was also very well made, but not worth the $40 in my opinion.  Ended the night with a slice of cheesecake. It was good, but not great. The crust was too soft.   Service: our waiter was great! Checked on us quite often and ensured we were taken care of.   Will I be back? Maybe

reviews.author: Ashleey L.
reviews.description: Better than papadeux in my opinion as a person from Louisiana.  Catfish and shrimp fried is my go to with dirty rice.  Best bread oil dip.. never knew that was thing before. It's not the best but it will do.  Things to improve, the cleaning of the fish The waiters not remembering what we ask for  Or the Louisiana hot sauce isn't what I would call La hot sauce it's like a off brand I've never heard of EDIT: out of all the  locations  I choose the one downtown as a fav one for atmosphere And location  This location as listed above told my boyfriend he couldn't wear his sleeveless shirt inside. I wasn't aware of any clothing rules.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: Not so bad, not so good. Well, maybe a little more bad than good.  Sunday lunch and an almost empty place.   Their menu is very average for a seafood restaurant here in San Antonio for which there is plenty of competition.   They completely fail with their ambience, which I consider as important as their food. You have to have both in the stiff  competition of the San Antonio seafood restaurant scene.    The place is like eating in an empty church. Dark and dreary with the worst lighting I have seen in a daytime restaurant. Dim lighting overwhelmed by glaring  large-window brightness, making it uncomfortable on your eyes no matter where you sit.  Their background music is so low that you have to stop and listen for a faint chord you might pick up ever so often.   This is supposed to be a festive new Orleans seafood kitchen instead of a quiet room for meditation in a church.  They had better change their trajectory and fast.

reviews.author: Eric O.
reviews.description: I picked up food here on Valentines Day for my wife and I. The food was some of the best I have had in the area thus far. I love cajun cuisine and this restaurant hit the spot. It was also my first time eating alligator and frog legs and they both hit the spot. I will be returning for a meal.

reviews.author: Yvonne P.
reviews.description: This local gem has been around a while. I'm not sure how long it's been here but we came here for an early Mother's Day celebration. We like coming here on special occasions. They sat us in the vey back. I imagine because we had the kids with us. We used their QR code to check the menu on the table. I ordered the Chilean sea bass. My husband ordered the Diablo plate and for my kids I ordered them each a kids burger plate. I loved that when we got our plates they were all hot. I hate getting anything cold. Server seemed busy but always very attentive. Food was taken out by the manager so it assured an extra level of attentiveness. I liked that.  Kids plates came out first: both large in size and tasty, so even a teen would feel satisfied with the size of the meal. When I finally got my Chilean Sea Bass, the fish was so meaty, juicy and delicious, just reached another level of perfection. Couldn't stop complimenting the flavors from it, lol. The capers blended the flavors of the fish (and I don't usually like capers) together with the Julienned vegetables, paired with a the sauce made for what looked like spaghetti underneath the fish, made for an exquisite meal! I enjoyed it so much with my Cabernet. Couldn't stop gloating over my food, lol! Just Wow, amazing perfection! I tasted the Diablo plate and was very spicy. Not for the faint of heart, but still amazingly delicious. We left extremely happy. There was a line of people waiting at the door to be seated still... This place is so popular! I recommend it to anyone who loves seafood! Best Mother's Day dinner, thank you!!!

reviews.author: Coleton S.
reviews.description: Garbage service didn't even eat here called cause I drove past the day before and had seen the now hiring sign...... it's not like I called during busy hours they weren't even open  but dude just straight in the most non excited voice.. "you'd have to come in to see what positions were hiring for" it was 9:30am I know damn well you ain't that busy that you can't tell me what you're hiring for   If it's like this for a non-customer and a potential employee could only imagine what it's like for a customer..

reviews.author: Tee R.
reviews.description: Very good food, fast and the waiter was knowledgeable and had an answer to all my questions. I'm from Louisiana and I not only love good food, but can cook good food. God check 'em out.

reviews.author: Craig M.
reviews.description: NICOLAS MAHI MAHI FISH with garlic spinach, mushroom and oysters and shrimp in a sherry butter sauce with white rice.  ($27.99 btw)  Long time residents of the area, we've been going to Bourbon Street Seafood Kitchen since it's opening and this is the first review I felt compelled to write.  We celebrated our 39th Anniversary by having dinner at our favorite seafood restaurant, Bourbon Street.  Unfortunately it was a far cry from the prior times we've eaten there.    We were happy to see the place seem to be doing quite well, despite the rainy weather.  There were a few groups ahead of us but we were seated in about 15 minutes.  Not bad.  We were promptly served warm bread and oil and ordered our drinks.  Our waiter was genial but we'd like to point out that the restaurant is noisy and it's difficult to hear which is made worse by having the waiter/servers wear a mask.  Noisy restaurants seem to be a thing nowadays. But I digress. Along with speaking up, please explain the specials louder and clearer. Oh, and before I forget, PLEASE provide coasters for drinks. Personal pet peeve but I'm not fond of sweaty glasses that drip on you, your food, the table....you get the idea...I mean, it IS Texas.  Do sweaty glasses bother anyone else?  Back on track.  My wife order the Seafood Cobb Salad:  SEAFOOD COBB SALAD Shrimp, crabmeat, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado,  bacon and boiled egg tossed with raspberry dressing ($17.99)  It's a favorite of hers and she felt it was good, but not as good as she remembers it being. Definitely worth boxing up and taking the leftovers home! It's a large salad.   Unfortunately, my order was waaayyyy worse than what we, (me), expected. The plating was pleasant and looked appetizing. I guess the problem is in the execution.    The Mahi Mahi was extremely dry and overcooked. I mean seriously overcooked.  I tried a couple of bites and it was not good.  Was not moist, not flaky at all and well, seriously overcooked.  Which brings us to the sauce. I had to double check, but I wasn't able to find any recipes that added mozzarella cheese to the sauce.  Parmesan crusted, yes, but not in the sauce.  If the sauce was liquid or even a thick liquid, it would have made the fish easier to get down.  As it was, every forkful was like eating a slice of pizza with the cheese thick and gooey and that you have to stretch the piece of pizza till the cheese separates from the pie.  That's good for pizza, not so good for a sherry butter sauce. As a matter of fact I couldn't readily find a sherry butter sauce that has cheese in it. Not saying there isn't or that there is only one place that does use it, (Bourbon Street) but it was NOT a good idea. It made the sauce a gelatinous mess.  The flavor was ok, plenty of spinach and garlic but that's about it.  The menu says "mushroom and oysters and shrimp". I think they meant "mushroomS, oyster (1) and shrimp (2)". I don't believe the addition of another couple of oysterS and shrimp would have been enough to save the dish though.  Plenty of white rice. Too much I think. It easily dominated the plating. A wild rice or even brown rice would have been a nicer balance to the relatively bland dish.  I will confess, I did eat the 2 shrimp and the one oyster. Tried two bites of the Mahi Mahi and had to give up or swear off Mahi Mahi forever.   When the waiter, 8 Gabe J, eventually came by, my wife had finished her salad and asked for a take home container.  When I was asked if I wanted a container too, I explained to him what the problem was and that I was done eating it. After a moment of silence, he asked if I would like it to be remade.  Hmmm.....not sure what that entailed, reheating or entirely new, but I wasn't brave enough to push my luck.    Normally, when it rarely happens that we get a bad meal, a manager will inquire as to the service and food and why it was sent back.  Didn't happen. Normally, if a meal is sent back, it's taken off the ticket. Didn't happen. Occasionally you may be offered a dessert.  Didn't happen. Normally we refuse both, when offered. Didn't get a chance.  On our way out, I stopped a busy looking guy with lots of pens in his pocket and asked if he was the manager. He said he was.  I explained my problems to him and asked if it was normal to add cheese to the sherry butter sauce.  Both he and the waiter said that they thought they did. If so, so be it.   Lot longer than I expected to share, but hey, when you're on a roll.....  My wife and I both feel that when a place excels at what they do, it should be recognized and we do.  If there's criticism of the service or food or whatever, it should be recognized.  Obviously we do that too.  I'm sure we'll return.....one bad experience doesn't outweigh all the positive ones we've had dining there; I just hope it doesn't take another pandemic or 39 years to return! (smile)  Cmcgee publicmcgeec1@tutanota.com Table 15/1 Chk 522 Server 8 GABE J Aug28'21 08:01PM  P.S.  Yes, we did tip

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the food here, I love Cajun food so when my friend mentioned this place I was excited to check it out.   I was really craving some oysters so I ended up getting the oyster sampler, which had three or maybe 4 different types of oysters on there, so that was pretty good and filling. I also then got the crab cake that was on the appetizer menu. It was soooooo good! It was actually a pretty good size the sauce on it was so flavorful. I loved my meal.   The one thing I'd say though is it's a pretty pricey place. I had these two appetizers and a drink and it was almost $40+   So definitely not a place I'd go on the regular, but worth a special occasion or a treat yourself type of night.

reviews.author: Jessie A.
reviews.description: Oh my heavens. We came here for our anniversary. It is the best food I've had in a good long while. I think the prices are very fair for the food and portion sizes. We've paid more in NOLA at our favorite seafood restaurant, Superior Seafood Company. I had the Eggplant bayou and my husband had the seared scallops. The scallops were perfectly prepared, and, honestly, that's why you leave it to the experts! The eggplant bayou comes with a saffron cream sauce that I could eat as a soup on it's own, it's that good. The service was prompt and the server so friendly. They still have reduced capacity and wear masks, although it seems optional for the patrons. I see they have crepes on the lunch menu, so I see many more visits in my future. This is right at the Redland exit on 1604.  I just wish I had a picture of the dinner. We finished with the pecan bread pudding with bourbon sauce, vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. Oh and fresh whipped cream.

reviews.author: Kathy D.
reviews.description: Food was decent. It's more on the salty side, could be just an off day. The salmon we ordered was dry.

reviews.author: Darren R.
reviews.description: This is probably the worst food I've ever eaten in San Antonio last night my wife and I and another couple pick this place for dinner I tried the combination gumbo the only combination in this gumbo was nothing but vegetables there was no shrimp no crab no oysters nothing but onions and bell pepper my sister-in-law are the blackened and catfish I guess they didn't understand between black and burnt and when they replaced it with the seafood platter the shrimp will burnt the only thing was good at this place was the waiter in the atmosphere the food totally is horrible I would not recommend this place to the devil himself

reviews.author: Adam F.
reviews.description: This is a solid and consistent location to get dinner. We have been there a half dozen time and its been always a workmanlike production.  The decor could be much better as it is more than a bit Spartan. Servers are all excellent.

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.description: It was empty. We used to come here we lived 10 minutes away, 8 years ago and it was always packed. We were wondering if we were too early, if traffic was that bad, etc... Got our food and figured out why. The quality of the food had dropped considerably from before. Now it wasn't bad, just not as good as it used to be.  The specialty drinks were great. The gumbos were good, we liked them.  The Po Boy was ok, nothing special but not bad, just average. Although the baked oysters $36 of garbage. Pretty much inedible. The crab topping was off, it tasted like it was on the verge of gone; the bacon overwhelmed the oysters, and the cheese was so thick on all of them that it needed to be halved and it still would have been too much. Too bad, we used to like this place.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: There was no one at the hostess stand when we arrived, so we had to wait a few minutes before the manager showed up to seat us.  We seriously thought about grabbing our own table for a couple of minutes because nobody acknowledged that we were standing there.  I was afraid this was going to set the tone for service, etc. but luckily, it didn't.  Once we were seated, the service was VERY professional and efficient.   The food: The jambalaya ($18.99) had PLENTY of chicken and sausage - the chicken was chicken breast and was very moist - not dried out, which is easy to do with chicken breast.  However, the jambalaya demi-glaze sauce and rice, seriously was no better than one of those instant mixes out of a box or a bag like Zatarans, etc. the sausage tasted very similar to the local SA brand Kiolbassa.  I just wasn't impressed with this dish, based on the $18.99 price tag it flaunted. Who charges $18.99 for jambalaya???   The Pontchartrain Redfish entree ($31.99) is pan seared, served with mushrooms, crab meat, and shrimp in a brown butter sauce, served with dirty rice on the side.       Glasses of wine range from $8 to $15.  Beer (Abita Amber) is $4.75 for a 12 oz bottle.   Substitutions are frowned upon here. The redfish entree includes two shrimp, but we asked if we could substitute scallops for the shrimp.  The cost was going to be an additional 4.99 for the first scallop, and 5.99 for each additional one after that - but we were assured they were large scallops.  We took a hard pass on the substitution and ordered it with the default of two shrimp.  This dish was better than the jambalaya entree.  The fish was cooked perfectly - not too dry and a good flavor.  Although the service was great, and the food wasn't too bad, it will be a while before I return.  It's just too pricey for the quality and ambiance.  There's a handful of other places that I would rather drop this amount of cash on.

reviews.author: Alexis A.
reviews.description: Bourbon Street Seafood is a nice restaurant across the street from Paramour. It is located within the lower level of a hotel. If you want to sit outside, you will have a nice view of the river. They sometimes have a band playing jazz music on the weekend.   The food here is fantastic, the Red Fish Diablo is one of the best meals I have had in San Antonio. It's similar to the Pontchartrain Red Fish, but with an additional kick to it.   I highly recommend this place if you are a seafood lover.

reviews.author: Vivian W.
reviews.description: Me and a friend stop by the Bourbon St seafood to have drinks, appetizers and listen to live music (Billy Ray Sheppard) the appetizer was so good and music awesome. But the amount of drinks where skimpy I ordered a class of wine and it wasn't even close to a half a glass for the price I was disappointed. But over all a great place.

reviews.author: Teofila R.
reviews.description: Once again back to the patio of the restaurant. I once again ordered the appetizer of frog legs. My friend ordered the appetizer of crab cakes. They looked delicious and he confirmed. Love sitting on their patio and watching the river walk pedestrians, ducks and birds. Olive martini were a hit!

reviews.author: Carlette E. R.
reviews.description: Wow! My BFF was hungry for seafood and chose Bourbons. This was my first visit.  Totally exceeded my expectations. Our server brought out fresh bread. Oil with herbs were thick and fresh. More like a pesto than just oil with a few herbs like I'm accustomed to...I had the chaulk board special.  It was called Diablo... something,  scallops,  shrimp in a butter sauce. While I cannot remember the name of the dish! OMG!! It was beyond amazing!!! It felt like a true culinary orgasm! I can't remember ever having such a perfect combination of flavors.  I didn't think to ask about where the scallops came from but they seemed to have been fresh and never frozen! They were perfectly seared and tender!   A classic martini is not as easy to make as one might imagine,  that being said... mine was probably the worst I've ever had.  Having such a perfect meal with such an awful cocktail  would seem to ruin the meal... but that Diablo dish was superb and absolutely nothing could have ruined it! I definitely recommend the food! But perhaps stick with

reviews.author: Dixie B.
reviews.description: We met friends for dinner recently, and were very pleased with our experience.  Those who follow me know that I am gluten intolerant, and have some other food sensitivities.  Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful; he guided me into a great decision for my dinner -- Grilled Chicken.  Our friends are regulars at this restaurant, and they were obviously happy with their meals!  We would definitely return to this location, and we think you'll like it, too!

reviews.author: Joey V.
reviews.description: A cozy bar I never knew existed. Tucked away on the corner of Brooklyn Ave and Avenue E. I've seen the neon sign quite a bit but never knew where those pics were taken. I think it's a perfect little bar for a quiet low key date night. I ordered a simple drink, staff was very friendly. The neon sign is very instagrammable. Worth the visit.

reviews.author: C T.
reviews.description: The door guy turned us away at the door due to my girlfriend wearing flip flops.... We're professionals in our 30s, no gang colors/ tats, etc. Dude- it's 80 fucking degrees out! No explanation either- "my boss tells me not to let in people with uhhhh... (gestures to feet). "Oh is there a concern my feet might get stepped on, like if there is dancing?" "I dont know they just say not to let them in". The bar was less than 1/8 full, plenty of standing room with a 6' cushion between everyone.   "Cool bro, I'll just spend my money elsewhere, have fun with your not full bar." Save your time and money, don't go. Let the cauliflower ear "door man" enjoy the 5 patrons inside.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: I'm not sure how long this bar has been around, but it reminds me of  old school bars where you could enjoy a night out without breaking the bank. I'm sure at one point that's what it was. They do have daily specials, but drinks can get pricy.   The front of the bar looks a little run down. Once inside, you have your typical bar feel. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the bar staff. It was during the day, so the inside of the bar wasn't busy, but the back patio was. They had a dj playing popular tejano, Cumbias, bachata.  They also had a food truck on site which made it perfect for Sunday brunch.   We took advantage of their mimosa set up. It included a bottle of champagne, orange juice, grapefruit juice and mixed fruit. I also wanted to try their $4 tecate light with Tony topper special. I'm glad I did. The tecate can is topped with tamarindo rim, a slice of pickle and Chinese candy. It does make for a good combination.   Staff was always around to take your order.   The only con is that the bathrooms were out of order and they had Porta Potty's. They were so gross. I held it and made it home, but that only meant that I had to limit my liquid consumption.   Parking is street parking.

reviews.author: Kassie O.
reviews.description: Cuul Spot, Great Character. And the bar staff is quite attentive. Music and outdoor patio added to the ambience gave that Beachy California Vibe for some reason outside??? Lol. Energy/Vibe was Great Cuul, Easy, Chill, Vibe throughout as everybody chatted across tables..."They we're having a "Gingerbread House Competition," that brought such a groovy camaraderie amongst the entire bar... Check 'em out!

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: I'll be upfront. I'd usually never walk in here. It's just not on my side of town, but I was lured by la Fonda de Jaime's trompo negro. Let me just say...that was an experience in itself. But I will say. Even without the trompo I would have been glad I walked in here. While I did think the prices were a little high for the area, what do I know about running a bar? Perhaps there's a special some day I don't know about. What I do know. These margaritas SLAP (as the kids say). Oh yes. A properly made marg? Now that's rarely found. Check it out, and while you're at it, try a house shot. They're probably 30% abv, but once you taste them you'll use them as a chaser rather than a shot. Thank me later.

reviews.author: Abigail I.
reviews.description: Big things come in small packages... and Tony's is no exception! I've been here a couple of times now and I can fully say that this is the place to be if you're looking for a great time. Bartenders are super friendly and can rim a drink properly. Selection of liquors is surprisingly good. The music is always on point. Djs and live music are a weekly occurrence. They've also secured a legit taco food truck with amazing mini tacos! So do yourself a favor and just go. You can thank me later.

reviews.author: Holly G.
reviews.description: Really bad experience. They wouldn't let a friend come in because of his shoes (he was wearing slides) because it would be dangerous for glass....literally 75% of the bar is in sandals/slides/open toed shoes. If you want to have a dress code, it should be posted (online this place is described as "casual") and at least give a reasonable explanation (somehow slides are dangerous but sandals are not) and it should be enforced for all guests. Just so happened our friend was the only African American guy and wasn't allowed in....but white people in sandals are fine. Really disappointed by this place.

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: Do NOT GO if you don't want the bartenders to steal money from you. They went ahead and added a tip on my card even though I had already tipped them 12 dollars on my 22 dollar tab.  This is ridiculous and VERY unprofessional.

reviews.author: Frances M.
reviews.description: Now it's called,  Tony's Siesta. No Bud light, Dos Equis(only draft), no Sol, no Miller High Life. 2 beers= $10.50. A Coors lite and a Pearl. No smoking on patio. Hmmm....We came and saw drank one and off to another .

reviews.author: Salvador C.
reviews.description: I've been here a lot of times and the bartender NEVER tell you the price of the drinks until he make them, then take them to your table with your friends so you have to pay them, I get you gotta make your money but thats fucked up, I got overcharged for some simple ass shit like i was at a Boujee ass place, for what I paid there I could take my friends to "The Moons Daughters" and leave a tip

reviews.author: Jaclyn R.
reviews.description: Listen, don't come to Tony's expecting anything but a family owned dive bar. That being said, do come with plenty of cash because they are a cash only establishment with affordable beer and wine and you'll end up staying a lot longer than originally planned. I don't come to Tony's nearly enough as I should, because this place just reeks of nostalgia to me. From the iron made Tower of Americas outside to the handwritten signs peppered throughout, this is a place my grandfather and his compas would hang out at.  Their micheladas are always affordable and come in a big frosty mug. Their micheladas are simple and to the point, clamato with no frills. You can tabasco to your own liking and they sell chili candy to add to your drink if you feel so inclined. This is a domestics/imports only bar, you won't find any craft beer here. And as a craft beer lover, this is just fine by me.   Tony is the owner/bartender and he's as sweet as can be. Every time I've come in he's asked me what channel I want the TV on and will change it. No real wait for the drinks because they're all pretty simple. They have great bar snacks at an affordable price too.   I couldn't agree more with another Yelper who described Tony's as the quintessential ice house.  tl;dr: Cash only, cheap drinks, friendly atmosphere, puro San Antonio, come here often!

reviews.author: E R.
reviews.description: Fantastic micheladas! Such kind people. I LOVE this place. Shhh don't tell people. Cheers, I will be back. Their jukebox may not please all since lots of Tejano but I was happy!

reviews.author: Brett H.
reviews.description: Awesome local home style place. Two dollar domestics. Three imports of the Mexican type.  Juke box. Pool table some video games.  Laid back kind of place. So how many places make you a home micheladas.

reviews.author: Nickie G.
reviews.description: The reviews of this place piqued my interest and I knew I would have to visit. So we walked over from the Alamo brewery (or whatever it is called). Now, that walk was an adventure in and of itself but we made it. The sign out front said "Open for Beer". Yes, please.  So, wow. This place. This is a proper, off the beaten path dive. It was super dark inside. There are tables, a bar at the back (very small), a stage off to the left, and TVs on the wall. A pool table was in there too. Apparently, this is a Cowboys bar too. Good for them. Anyway, there were two people inside when we rolled up...and one of them was Tony. Cold, and I mean fucking cold, Miller Lite in the bottle and he provided us coozies to use as well. Cash only (I think). We drank our cold beer and decided to play the jukebox. It is full of Latin music, but not the Latin music that is filling up my iPod. More old school Latin but we played the fuck out of it like we knew what was going on. Oh, and some random George Strait.  As we sat there drinking all of a sudden a round of beers materialized from the other patron in the bar that wasn't Tony. So we shot the shit with him. Then another person came in and another round materialized for us. Very nice although not necessary. We enjoyed the front patio tables a little bit too. But in the end it was getting dark and we had somewhere else we needed to be so we rolled out into the night and bid Tony a fond farewell.  This place is a legit dive. LEGIT. No frills, just cold beer, football, and a chill time.

reviews.author: Holly L.
reviews.description: The best local bar I've been to in San Antonio, Tony is always there watching football or the Spurs games, all the regulars know each other and are very friendly. They welcome newcomers. Beer is reasonably priced. Usually at least one female bartender there, I believe his daughter. Another I've seen a handful of times, Usually wearing some Buddy Holly style glasses. Both good sense of humor, quick witted, The best kind of smart asses around, but always welcoming and friendly.
