Never rude. Beer only, cash only. Bring your own liquor. They sell the mixers to make drinks.And I believe I've seen them cook out for big events. Family owned and operated, they make a great team. I look forward to this bar continuing to grow and flourish

reviews.author: Joseph L.
reviews.description: I was attracted to this bar for several reasons. One was the fact that Tony's is a mere quarter-mile from work, and the other - there is a miniature Tower of the Americas erected outside.  The inside of Tony's Bar is half-sports bar, half-lounge, and kind of reminds me of Cheers... but the Mexican version. ;)  You have a small bar area for about 6-8 people, and the rest of the place is old-school tables and red neon diner-style chairs.    The big screen is usually on sports (a.k.a. Cowboys) and when it's not, count on ESPN or ABC.    The drinks are that of a no-frills bar - you have all the basic beers plus some Mexican bottles and a few mini-wine bottles.  Alas, no Heineken.  The prices are great, though.  $2.50 domestic, $2.75 import, and $3 Smirnoff and those little Barefoot wine bottles. Tony even sells snacks like chips, crackers, queso, etc.  Apparently, there is live music performed at Tony's often but I haven't seen any yet.  So that's when the big jukebox in the right corner comes in handy.  Outside are a few wooden benches and, again, that cool replica of the Tower made out of steel.    Tony Lopez is a very down-to-earth guy, and his family are usually with him in the bar at night.  He always tells his patrons to drive safely, even me after only downing a Dos XX and a Smirnoff. But I like this place... it's very friendly... and cheap... and the parking is free in the lot or on the street!    They're open Tue-Fri and on Sundays when "games" are on... I assume that means Cowboys... ;)

reviews.author: Brett W.
reviews.description: This place is a San Antonio absolute gem. Go back in Time at Tony's bar...that is back to a time when you could get a 2.50 beer at a sports bar. Before sports bars served hipster cocktails and craft brews. Plus they have an actual pay phone. Enough said.

reviews.author: Veronica J.
reviews.description: I was in search of a place to watch the Cowboys game and found this place on Yelp. I found way more than I was looking for. The owner Tony is very personable and treats all the customers like family.  The atmosphere is cozy and relaxing.  One of his bartenders Mary was inside when I arrived and remembered me from my phone call earlier in the day. She even served me a plate of chips and queso when the game started.  Service doesn't get any better than that. There is only beer and wine on the menu but what else do you need. This place is a must !

reviews.author: Aleksandr B.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood dive bar! My girlfriend is in love with this place, it's old, cute and friendly. Old man behind the bar is adorable, drinks are cold and cheap. Will be back for sure!!

reviews.author: Cary W.
reviews.description: This is great place to hang out, listen to great tunes on the nickelodeon and enjoy a cold brew!!! Awesome place!!!

name: The Fruteria Botanero By Chef Johnny Hernandez
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ada F.
reviews.description: First timer. I only saw available parking by the building and across the street with a 2hr limit... but I wouldn't know where to park once it gets busy.  Drinks: I ordered the flight (cucumber, strawberry, and pineapple) and omg they were so strong although my friend didn't think so. I am a light weight so I wasn't able to finish the flight but I did enjoy them.  Food:  The food was good but it reminded me of La Gloria where the portions were small. The quesadillas are kind of like empanadas. It's basically a stuffed chicken corn tortilla. The flavors were amazing but It wasn't enough to fill me up.  We also ordered papas bravas and it was also a small portion.  Maybe the other food options are a full plate? But I wouldn't know.  I ended up leaving hungry.  I would come back for the drinks if I'm around the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: This place is SPECTACULAR! Our server was Victor and made our dinner extra special. Here's what we ordered and highly recommend:   - Drinks: Pineapple Mezcal Rita. Las Fresas was also great but a bit sweet. La Sofisticada is everything the name says - even has edible glitter in it. El Cenizo was delightful for any mezcal lover.   - Botanas: Fundido de Frutas (my fave) , Sweet Plantains Mole Tamil (his fave). Chicharrón de Ribeye was just ok.   - Ceviche: ORDER THE PULPO CHILE AJO   We can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anais A.
reviews.description: We came to dinner here with some friends on a weeknight, the restaurant was mostly empty and the dinner menu was very small. We ordered a few rounds of cocktails which were very good, but we were disappointed by the menu items and execution. For an appetizer we ordered one of the ceviche items and the fish was very tough and the corn kernels around the fish were dry and inedible. For entrees we ordered the mushroom quesadillas which were tasty and shared the carne asada plate. The beef needed a bit more flavor, but was not bad.   Originally we were eyeing the lunch menu not knowing it was only for lunch, which sounded a bit more up our ally, so maybe we'll have to give it another shot and come back for lunch. Overall, I was disappointed by our dinner experience here.

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: Wow wow wow! It's been a little under 10 yrs since I last visited and it still left an impression! Our most recent trip was for drinks during a family trip. It was just as memorable as then! The margs were so so good! The cucumber one was amazing- you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Rafe C.
reviews.description: A charming little place with delicious botanically inspired dishes unlike the common Mexican dishes found in San Antonio. Remarkably palatable yet not overwhelming. The atmosphere is vibrantly colorful and it's frequented by artists, writers and politicos. The margaritas are superb.

reviews.author: Helen F.
reviews.description: I loved the infused drinks and entrees! It's so quaint. People are super nice that work there and very accommodating!

reviews.author: Cynthia F.
reviews.description: I wanted to come to this place because I found it on IG and it looked super nice. They have some infused tequila drinks, I ordered the pepino and it was refreshing and very tasty. About the food, we ordered: The quesos appetizer. It was ok, different. Just too sweet for my taste.  The carne en su jugo was not good, it was a small portion, the sauce was slimmy (because it  had nopalitos, but still no excuse) and the meat was over cooked. The chicken tinga quesadillas were ok. Nothing special. The place has a lot of potential because it has great atmosphere, they just need to step up their game on their food.

reviews.author: Janie M.
reviews.description: AMAZING!! Beautiful and tasty. Everything was so elegantly made and you could definitely taste it.

reviews.author: Victoria A.
reviews.description: This place is so cute! Stumbled upon it while waiting for a table at Gunther House and I was not disappointed! We ended up canceling our reservation due to the delicious guacamole and aqua fresas here. Whether you are visiting San Antonio or your a seasoned local, you have got to check this place out. 10/10!

reviews.author: Patricia G.
reviews.description: Awesome for and drinks!! The service is great! The parking can be challenging at times.

reviews.author: Leann B.
reviews.description: Delish food! Has changed my perspective on Mexican food as a Mexican I am loving this vibrant culinary experience. Best service!

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: I live in the neighborhood and haven't been here in years as there are many other choices. Came with out of town friends and was disappointed that many items off the small menu were unavailable and restaurant was closing early on a Saturday night due to staffing shortage.  Came few weekends later to retrieve my friends expensive eyeglasses (which they could no longer find ) and decided to stay and eat. More then half of the small menu was unavailable at 8 p.m. There are 2 HEBs within a short distance from restaurant  that an employee could have gone to for the basics that were out. Manager never even came by our table to offer an excuse or apology. Food and drinks are good but unfortunately I will never return.

reviews.author: Margarita B.
reviews.description: One of the must-do's on our itinerary was to go to the Fruteria. My brother in law could not stop raving about this place and rightfully so!  There was a wide variety of Margaritas, juices, and dishes to choose from that it was a little overwhelming at first.   I ended up going with the Las Fresas Fruteria Infusion Margarita. My husband ordered Los Pepinos and then the Caipiripina. All of their drinks are inspired by flavors found in Mexican Fruterias. The drinks were not too sweet and not too boozy- simply refreshing and flavorful! We also had an order of the guacamole and chips. The chips were freshly made, and I could not stop eating them even though I wasn't even hungry. My husband wanted to try their carne asada and queso tacos. These little tacos were amazing! I was sad that I wasn't more hungry, because I would have wanted to eat an entire order for myself!   The staff was attentive and friendly, and we all enjoyed a relaxing afternoon of chatting over a few cocktails and snacks. Definitely coming back on a future visit!

reviews.author: Ricardo P.
reviews.description: My wife was the one to find this place online, particularly because I had been looking for a good torta place in San Antonio (which I have yet to find) and she knew how much I love eating tortas. So we made the 30 min plus drive to pick up food here. Seems like they are practicing COVID-19 guidelines here when I picked up the food. I had two tortas: the bistec and al pastor. The pastor meat itself was really clean and nicely cut for the torta. There was also pineapple in the torta. Overall the pastor was alright. The bistec torta was much better. Quite savory and the cheese complemented the bistec meat nicely.  The prices were definitely high for the quality of torta. The house made chips were good too. While not the best tortas I have had, this place is at least good enough to try again in the future.

reviews.author: Bobbie B.
reviews.description: Unfortunately I didn't love the food or drinks here. I got a house margarita and a las fresas margarita. Both are very sweet in my opinion. We ordered chips and salsa, guacamole, mushroom quesadilla, plantains, and pulpo Chile ajo. Portions are very small. The quesadilla is more like an empanada. The service was slow, the restaurant was loud. The food just wasn't that great. I wouldn't come back on my own accord.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Been here several times we sat outside and even though it was hot outside under the fans was totally worth it and you are distancing yourself from everyone!! The food is always great and the service is awesome!! These have to be the best margaritas in SA!! I usually don't get margs bc the mix tend to hurt my stomach but these must be made with fresh fruit because they were so tasty and smooth!! Parking is in the front and along the side so make sure and pick a spot and drop by and give the margaritas a try!!!

reviews.author: Gabriela L.
reviews.description: The food is good and drinks as well but they are really small plates more of a drink and chill and casually get a small bite

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Another great lunch at The Fruteria - Botanero! Today it was the Torta de Bistek: chopped tender steak with grilled onions, creamy queso Oaxaca, avocado, lettuce, and tomatoes. The lightly seasoned beef and salty Oaxaca were a nice pairing as they complimented each other. The bolillo itself was soft but sturdy with a nice crunchy crust. Great vessel to hold the fillings.  The housemade potato chips were an excellent side - crunchy, lightly salted, and not too greasy. Proof that something simple can be expertly made.  Only issue was the service, it started strong but flatlined once served our food. We were checked on once towards the end of the meal as the server disappeared. Empty cups and a need for more salsa (tiny bowl for 3 grown men) were a theme. I would sit at the bar next time to avoid service issues.

reviews.author: Eri F.
reviews.description: JUST GO‼ It's life changing.. lol ok, maybe it's a bit of an exaggeration but it's soooooo good! Definitely have the fundido con fruta (appetizer) and the Capirotada (dessert). I promise it's going to change your life!

reviews.author: Catherine A.
reviews.description: Creative delicious innovative cuisine. The chef is the mastermind behind several wonderful restaurants in San Antonio. Went with foodie friends from SC and they loved it too! We will return.

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: I tell you what...I have found this beautiful gem where I can order some food a cold adult beverage and sit outside on the patio overlooking Medina Lake. What a view to look at, especially if you appreciate what mother  nature has to offer.   At the moment they have karaoke on Thursday and live music on Sunday's. I enjoyed my visit here as it allowed me to wind down from the city life. The patrons are very friendly and the waitress was friendly and helpful as well.   The food was not bad at all, the full order of nachos was quite a treat, enough to feed a group of 4. The burger was not bad at all.   My only set back which kept me from givIng this place 5 stars is that it's a smokers paradise In here. By the end of the night there was a pretty good cloud of cigarette smoke lingering above us. As a matterr  if fact if you are not a smoker you will definitely be bothered by the smoke. All in all the  view from the back patio is what I loved the most here.

reviews.author: Perry A.
reviews.description: This place is closed.  It has been closed for over 3 months.  Sad was a great place.  Maybe someone will reopen it

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Just to clear things up......place has reopened....kitchen is not 100% yet due electrical problems.....but still best sunset view around

reviews.author: Kathy L.
reviews.description: Wow!  Just wow!  After a day on the lake, we decided to grab a couple of burgers, thinking, "at least we won't be hungry anymore."  Well, were we pleasantly surprised!!!  They have, hands down, the best burgers we can remember having!  The fries were awesome too!  Prices fair, service outstanding, and drinks cold.  Seriously, this is the first Yelp review I have ever felt compelled to write.  It is so deserved!!!

reviews.author: Rick W.
reviews.description: dancing bear has re opened, as of 12-25-20 we were there, we had baken chees burgers and frys, was a great burger, i'd do a better bun if i was in charge. i liked their stake frys,

reviews.author: Allison S.
reviews.description: First of all it should be noted that this place does NOT allow children even though it serves food.    They told us we could only order food to go.  Our waitress was very rude and told us she was also starving and didn't sympathize with us.    Not sure how this place will stay in business  unless there are really that many adults or that few restaurants at Medina Lake.

reviews.author: Jeff R.
reviews.description: Great times, live music, and a simple menu with decent food. Smoker's dream...one of the last places you can smoke inside. Pool table inside. Great view of Medina Lake too.

reviews.author: Patric C.
reviews.description: Sorry it took so long to update my review. And also sorry if you went here because of my first review, I should have waited for three visits. The beer was not cold, the burger was mediocre at best not, cooked as asked, way over cooked and cold. Only half as many fries and they were cold from the start. It took over 30 minutes for food to arrive, even though no other couples there. It was such a disappointment because it was so good the first time. Will never go back there and we only live a mile away, what a shame. All places at the lake aren't worth the trip, even from Lakehills.

reviews.author: Ed S.
reviews.description: Decent place.  Love the fact they have live music.   Bartender was nice and friendly.  Ordered the frozen margarita and it was great.   And the patio is great cause of the wo fearful view of the lake.  Loved it.  The food menu eh. It was ok.  I Ordered the nachos and were ok nothing special.    Will I be back maybe for the music and a margarita or a beer or two.

reviews.author: Outsourced N.
reviews.description: I love finding out of the way places like this little gem in Mico Texas (or thereabouts!). This was just an outstanding joint (warning they smoke inside) in the middle of nowhere with a really cool vibe (think Grateful Dead), an outstanding patio with a view of the Medina Lake and dam.  Nice menu and we ordered the batter fried mushrooms and nachos, beef on the side.  The mushrooms did not look batter fried, but no matter! Because by god these were chicken fried and fantastic! They obviously used slightly older mushrooms that had a perfectly concentrated earthy flavor excellently balanced with a crunchy tasty crust..I mean I could happily eat 63 baskets of this stuff ..and want more. Coupled with an Anchor porter, this was heaven. Nachos were just nachos, but the beef was well flavored with a touch of cumin and warming heat that made for tasty eating.  They have a pretty nice selection of beers for such an out of the way place. Add friendly service, and this is going on my out of the way place rotation!!

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: We walk in and sat and less than a minute we walk out of the Deol Sports Bar on Culebra Rd due to the music was so loud you literally have to yell at one another and to me that's not cool it get old anyways that's a whole different review on a whole different type of place. So we left and my better half said let just drive up Culebra Rd and see where it will take us and I told her Medina Lake so she said well the first bar we see we'll stop and have a beer there and if it sucks we'll move on that's when we came across the Dancing Bear Bar and my first thought was wow look at all these trucks and Bikers parked here we should have brought my truck and worn my boots cause I was wearing my Sperrys at the time and didn't want to feel out of place,but screw it let's go in and check it out anyways. We see what look like locals sitting at the bar having some beer conversation and people did check us out but no uncomfortable long stares,we ordered our beers and went out into the patio and that's when we knew we came here at a perfect time cause the sun was setting and you can see the beautiful view of Medina Lake with the sun rays dancing on the water very nice and then with a cold beer come on!what more do you want spoke to soon cause that's when the band started their first song Copper Head Road I started thinking to my self glad we came here and never knew about this place even though I use to hang out at Medina Lake like every weekend back in my twenties and watching the sun rays dancing on the lake brought back memories and smiles. At first I felt little out place cause we was like the only Hispanics there LOL and top of that it was St Patrick's Day,but no rudeness here. We didn't try any of the foods but I hear the burgers and mushrooms are really good and I will try it out on our next visit. This is a cool bar with bikers,cool cowboys and just down to earth blue collar people who work for a living my kind of people!Come check this place out and see for your self I know I will be coming back when I am not in the mood to do the  Pearl Brewery,St Mary's Strip or Southtown. You know that song I love this bar listen to it its how I feel about this bar.

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Nachos were big but more like taco bell. Great view if the  lake. The frozen margaritas were really good. The beer was good. They are not dog friendly, which is stupid since they have a nice patio.

reviews.author: Juan L.
reviews.description: Great neighbor place.  Cold beer, good drinks and good burgers.  People who complain that kids and pets are not allowed need to remember it is a bar not a day care or a pet sitter

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: Super delicious, love the burgers and fries Great Lake food or kick back date night. Love the views and atmosphere :)

reviews.author: Sylvia M.
reviews.description: Why do people want to bring children to a bar???  I don't want kids at a bar when I'm chillin'. Have some common sense, courtesy for others and respect for the law.

reviews.author: Yvonne R.
reviews.description: Went for a Sunday drive and ended our day perfectly at the Dancing Bear.  A view of the lake, a cold beer, friendly waitress, and a Big Fat Juicy Bear Burger and hot fries.  MMMM GOOD.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: This place is NOT dog friendly! After asking if we could sit on the patio the bartender straight up said no. Another employee told us we could sit at the picnic tables out in the lawn. After seeing them there was NO shade. We took our service elsewhere.

reviews.author: Maggie B.
reviews.description: Great view of Medina Lake!  Best burgers in San Antonio!  Good selection of craft beers and the owner is super cool. Will be back often!

reviews.author: Kamalan S.
reviews.description: Great burger. Nice beer selection. Nice outdoor patio and view. Friendly staff and good service. BIG downside is the smoking inside and out that you can't escape.  I had the burger with bacon, delicious! Fries were perfect, hot and crispy. German beer was one of many that I wanted to try (if I didn't have to drive I would have tried more!). The view of the lake from the patio was great, very relaxing. The staff were attentive and courteous.   We are glad we stopped here. It was a completely spur of the moment stop. The first impression was bad because of the smoking inside but then we saw the patio and went outside. The smoke actually blew out from the inside of the restaurant towards us and more people came and sat outside and smoked too. Our clothes and car now smell like smoke.  The staff were VERY friendly so we decided to give it a chance. It turned out to be a good choice for all the reasons mentioned above. Will definitely go back  in spite of the smoking.

name: Agave Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Sunday

reviews.author: Eliza N.
reviews.description: Alexander was a great server! Highly recommend the 60 oz margaritas. Had a great time we recommended agave bar to everyone

reviews.author: Madeline H.
reviews.description: Cute little bar right on the river walk. We stopped here about midday for drinks and chips and dip and it was very relaxing and nice. I'd love to come back and have a meal here sometime as well.

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: Stopped by at this bar for drinks Christmas night  Drinks were simply terrible.  Margaritas, sangria and everything else was just bad.  Service matched the drinks - the manager and our waiter (Roberto ) were terrible.  Needless to say - no way we will ever return here

reviews.author: Colby B.
reviews.description: Reallly good Margarita Selection, nice outdoor seating on the Riverwalk, Chips, Salsa and Queso were good.   Food was SO/SO, I've had better Mexican food, I've certainly had worse, Their gonna get business being on the Riverwalk, I'd go back for the drinks for sure ‍

reviews.author: Jordan W.
reviews.description: Not my place... I love to go to sports bars, restaurants, and other hangout spots prior to any events or sports games. I was heading to a Spurs game later that night and thought I'd kill some time on the Riverwalk beforehand. But I wasn't really impressed with what came with this place. Not too much to talk about, but I'll try my best.  They have several drink selections, most of which aren't really that good. The only really good beer they had was Crawford Bock, and they don't really have any of their signature city beers from the brewery; only plain old domestics that I can get anytime at a dive bar. On top of that, I was wanting to try a cocktail or mixed drink of some sort, but I got a recommendation not to because they're limited on their supply, and don't really have any good selections. Oh well, I can always try another good cocktail bar elsewhere.  Another complaint is that the music is WAY too loud. It was blasting when I walked in, and I didn't mind it at first, but it can get annoying at times. So, I let it slide, but if it's not for you, don't bother sitting down inside. The outside seating is spacious though on a good day, so I would suggest that if you want to try this place.  I've been to better sports bars in my life, and I don't think I'll be back. But the staff was friendly, and able to provide me with good locations along the Riverwalk for some dinner before a show or game. But I'd say it's not worth my time.

reviews.author: Jesica B.
reviews.description: Horrible food and waiting staff. The only place with open tables on a Friday night. This is all that needs to be said.

reviews.author: Joshua E.
reviews.description: Don't assume that because the ticket is high, customers are required to tip accordingly.   I tip based on customer service and quality of food. I got 1 margarita 3 kids drinks and an appetizer nacho!!!!!! Why was my tab $43.79 they up charged on the only meat they had, which fajita beef was 5.99 which was also not listed on the menu.   I love tipping. I worked in the industry  and believe heavily on tipping!!!!! Please don't expect a lot if you come here. Ohhh my margarita was 13.99 and was small with no alcohol.

reviews.author: Brenda N.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a wonderful time at Agave bar. Our server/ bartender was Tito and he was very attentive and recommended some delicious drinks. We will definitely be back on our next getaway!

reviews.author: Rosemary S.
reviews.description: My husband and I decided to stop for lunch, this was our first time here...the atmosphere, the service and the food was good. HOWEVER, the food could have been less spicy...it was way too spicy we couldn't finish our lunch. We like to give second chances but not this time. Not everyone likes spicy food.

reviews.author: Chef B.
reviews.description: The food is not that great for the price.  The spicy chicken was dry.  On the low end for Mexican food

reviews.author: Abraham A.
reviews.description: I would have gave it 0 stars if I could.. this location does not know how to tell apart oz sizes my beer was not 20 oz it was more like 14oz it was ridiculous.. I'm still sitting her haven't gotten my check. The food was very nasty the enchiladas smelled gross they smelled like boiling weiners for hot dogs. Probably the worse restaurant I've ate in recent time. STAY away from this spot it is not worth the overpriced food

reviews.author: Teah H.
reviews.description: We stopped into Agave Bar for a quick bite while walking on the River Walk on a Saturday afternoon.  Even though it was a little chilly outside I wanted to sit outside and admire the River Walk.  The hostess happily got me a blanket and turned the warmers on around us.  My boyfriend and I decided to split the 60 oz margarita because why not?!  Their chips and salsa were pretty standard... nothing to rave about.  We decided to get an order of queso and split a chicken quesadilla.  The queso reminded me of when we make velveta with rotel at home... it was good but not the delicious white queso I was hoping for.  The chicken quesadilla came out hot from the kitchen.  The chunks of chicken were pretty large on the quesadilla... I almost wish it was shredded.  The bathrooms were very clean and smelled good.  I didn't expect much from Agave Bar.... let's be real it's a tourist trap on the River Walk.  Our service and food were good.  Would I go back... probably not.  But it served it's purpose to get us a quick bite that afternoon.

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: My husband stopped here for some pizza and beer while on vacation enjoying the river walk. Daniel was our server and we throughly enjoyed him! He has a great personality, fun to talk with and even have us some recommendations while we're here... also helped me chose what nfl game to pick this week for my league, lol! Thanks again Daniel!!!

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: So this place is cool for really affordable Happy Hour prices - margaritas, sangrias and beer.  The food is decent and the portions are big enough to make your tummy happy most meals. Right on the river walk, the large patio has mariachis and across the water, so do other restaurants.  Super touristy, you know you're going to get "cat called" by all the restaurants and bars so that you come dine with them. Definitely fun and worth the stop at happy hour!

reviews.author: Olivia J.
reviews.description: Food was terrible. Service was good, but not worth it. Walk 4 ft past there, walk up the stairs and go to chipotle.

reviews.author: Valerie R.
reviews.description: I went here with my family and ordered margaritas and appetizers. After being seated we waited about 15 minutes to place our order (the server was rude from the beginning). When our drinks finally arrived they were already melted ( which we didn't complain about). However when the nachos we ordered finally arrived, after taking a couple of bites we noticed a hair it. We then called the server over and informed her of the situation and she did not say a word, she just rudely picked up the plate and left. We waited for her to come back for about 30 minutes and she never said anything about the food. So we finally asked for the check as we were reading it over the server said "I didn't charge you for it" with an attitude. I do not usually write negative reviews but this place was overpriced and no ever apologized about the situation or try to make it better.

reviews.author: Jay B.
reviews.description: This place was LIIIT!! The DJ was playing EVERYTHING! The drinks were great and the staff was attentive. I dance for two hours straight. Will be back.

reviews.author: Luke H.
reviews.description: Very tasty salsa, minor spice. We wish this was our first stop. I recommend the Cucumber margarita. We shared a combination plate and every single thing on the menu was fresh and delicious. We will be back.

reviews.author: Mary W.
reviews.description: Looking for the best (and BIGGEST) margaritas in the Riverwalk!? Look no further! Agave not only has a patio with a beautiful river walk view, but it has an amazing selection of delicious margaritas! We went for the traditional 60oz margarita to split. We also split an heavenly avocado and chicken salad to munch on while we tackled our beverage! Agave makes a fabulous stop for your river walk stroll!

reviews.author: Luis A.
reviews.description: Worst restaurant ever no good service and specially the attitude all this people have like wow if you didn't Want to work today you should just not showed up how you gonna come and just throw the plates in the table and stand In front of us doing nothing and when you talking to them they don't even speak in anyway so dry and slow like I can't hear anything sorry to say it but it was a bad experience what's so eve

name: Sternewirth Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Philip B.
reviews.description: My wife and I stopped here for a quick drink before dinner. Today we sat outside because it was beautiful!! We had a white wine and a bourbon. If you are ever in the Pearl Area of San Antonio, you should stop at the Sternewirth Bar inside the Hotel Emma. The hotel lobby and bar are both beautiful. Very ornate and a feast for the eyes.   The only suggestion I have is for them to expand their drink selections. The wine selection was limited.

reviews.author: Desiree V.
reviews.description: Great Craft Cocktails; Tried a Whiskey sour (on point), Mr.Rogers (obscure flavor and very unique), The Musician and the Pepo (would order again; amazing flavor)  Great selection of top shelf spirits: Knob Creek, WhistlePig, Basil Hayden's, etc. Great service everyone very attentive even during a busy weekend. The atmosphere is chill indoor and outdoor. Open seating.

reviews.author: Sabrina L.
reviews.description: Stopped at The Pearl District, for dinner but was early. We decided to check out Hotel Emma. Inside Hotel Emma was an entrance for this place. I think it's mostly drinks and appetizers. We saw another entrance from the other side if walking around the courtyard area. Love the dim lights and cozy feel if you can find a place to sit. After about 5 minutes of walking looking for somewhere to sit,  some ladies got up from one of the couches and told us they were leaving. We got our drinks and relaxed. Glad that we found this place to enjoy and actually went into the restaurant we were going to to see if we could change our reservations 30 minutes later so we could still enjoy our drinks. If you want a place for a date night, for drinks, I would recommend this place.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday night after dinner as a walk in. Tried the Three Emmas (pearl beer and rose cordial, sherry, gin) and Ciudad del Sol (mezcal, xtabentun, vermouth, chartreuse), which were both excellent. The ambiance is great, and there are tables, couches and chairs, but it can get very crowded. We were hoping to sit upstairs, but it was reserved already. There is table service when you sit down, but I had initially placed my order at the bar. The drinks were elegant and out of the ordinary. Def recommend!

reviews.author: Bryce M.
reviews.description: I decided to take my girlfriend to Sternewirth Bar for Christmas eve.  We have not been there for awhile and I decided it was time to go back.  The bartenders are awesome.  They remembered us and knew what we dink which is great.  That's why the bartenders are incredible. The atmosphere is spectacular.  Great place to meet with friends and family.  The drinks are great.  I usually have pearl beer which is good.  Again.... Sternewirth Bar is a destination place I in San Antonio.  FYI.  It does get busy so you might need to wait.  Plus there is free parking in the garage.

reviews.author: Sherrill F.
reviews.description: Gorgeous bar with a cozy atmosphere. I tried their specialty margarita and my husband tried The Three Emmas...we both agreed they were delicious.  We'll definitely be back...the Hotel Emma is exceptional.

reviews.author: Eduardo E.
reviews.description: Great vibe. Would recommend due to top knotch drinks and open sitting that allows you have an overview of the bottom floor

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Food 5/5 Service 5/5 Atmosphere 5/5  Definitely the classiest bar I've been to in San Antonio. And of course, it is part of the nicest hotel in the area- Hotel Emma. This bar has been closed off for awhile and only open to hotel guests during the pandemic, but it has recently opened to everyone.  I came here with a friend on Friday at 5pm and we got the last two seats in the entire bar. I was shocked that it was this crowded so early! The space is large and has high ceilings, but the ambiance is still very cozy and classy. The lighting is dim and the colors are darker. Definitely didn't feel like I was in San Antonio. Guests are spaced out well to follow social distancing guidelines.  We ordered two cocktails: Kingfishers Catch Fire and People of the Sun. Drinks are pricey but worth every penny. Both cocktails were on par with those found in a NYC speakeasy. We didn't try any appetizers, but I would definitely be interested during my next visit.

reviews.author: Ruthie B.
reviews.description: Went on a Sunday night and it was pretty dead. I did not step inside but there were plenty of seating outside. We had the Salami and Brie Cheese Plate and the drink is called Lucile's Day Out. The cheese and meat plate was perfect for sharing if you're not looking for a meal. All the cheese and meats were good and the jam included was very complimentary. The drink was very delicious. It has bourbon, banana liqueur, amontillado sherry, orange, lemon. I'm not a big drinker but it was so good, I could've easily had 2 or 3. The waitress said that the drinks get rotated every quarter or so, so you should stop on by soon as I think it's only available another month.   We also had a cute regular lurking nearby.  Will be returning for the food, drinks and cat.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: Been here more than a few times but it's my first review for this place! And all those times not one has been nothing but ordinary. The ingredients for this place:good ambiance,mix of different ages,good drinks and good looking women equals a pretty cool place to have a few drinks or lots. The wine selections is minimum but they do have a decent selection of bourbons and whisky. Their cocktails are pretty good especially the Sazerac and my favorite the old fashion among other cocktails which they make potent and that's alright cause that's what most of us are there for right?Like any Hotel bar the drinks can add up so keep that in mind. Waitresses are very attentive as long as your nice to them and tip them cause they seem to stay with the tippers and it's beats waiting in line on a busy night. On cold nights you can take your drink outside and sit besides the nice fireplace or check out the lobby it's original and unique. The crowd is a mix of wealthy, blue and white collars,young,middle and older crowd but for the most part not much drama just good cocktails and laughter.The restrooms are attentive and clean and are located outside the bar there's also a family restroom but don't take your date in there. Lol.

reviews.author: Anabel C.
reviews.description: Every time I've gone, the drinks are always very good! Service is always great by Gabby. Environment is great for date night or meeting a group of friends!

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: This is such a cool spot in hotel emma. It's absolutely one of my favorite spots, especially for a quick break when you're roaming around the Pearl. It can be hard to get a table but sometimes you'll get lucky. We only ordered drinks when here but will absolutely be back because the space is so cool.

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Drinks, service and ambiance are wonderful.  The outside patio is great for people watching and dog friendly!

reviews.author: Fussy G.
reviews.description: Absolutely a delight drinks food ambiance and fantastic staff! Have been here several times and always consistent a beautiful European flare always  going there Just wondering if they have a Happy hour?

reviews.author: Rabab R.
reviews.description: Can I just say that my mind is absolutely blown!!!?! The drinks were just amazing. We got a bunch of drinks. I specifically asked for recommendations and the server got me a rum based sweet cocktail. It was so yum and just the perfect sweetness for me! Not too bitter, not too sweet. We also got appetisers. The cauliflower with caramel popcorn - who would have thought of such a combination? It was phenomenal! Loved every bit. I hope to go again soon - maybe the coming weekend again!

reviews.author: Elissa G.
reviews.description: Go right at open for quick service but stay for the crowd. This drink is amazing and definitely going back

reviews.author: Roman C.
reviews.description: Only hotel guest allowed waste of an Uber no where  states this. The staff informed us to call and see if outside guests are welcome. Basically locals aren't invited here.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: What a wonderful little gem at the Hotel Emma.  Several friends and I stopped by after dinner in the Pearl complex for after-dinner drinks.  Sternewirth Bar is an inviting lounge with comfortable seating and some great drinks.  Spicy(!) peanuts are served and there is a menu for other munchables.    This place seems to be known for their whiskey cocktails and has a signature drink called the Three Emmas.  I know there is a story to that, but I did not hear what it was.  Ask your server and they'll be happy to fill you in.  I had an Irish Coffee that was oh so yummy and just the thing for a breezy afternoon in December.  If you're staying at Hotel Emma, make sure you stop in.  If you're dining in the Pearl Complex, make sure you make this your final stop of the evening.

reviews.author: Elizabeth O.
reviews.description: Really cool atmosphere. Phenomenal drinks. This was by far my favorite place we visited in San Antonio and I would definitely go back if I'm ever in town again.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: I would like to be able to review this bar for the drinks but unfortunately the bouncer was a complete asshole and didn't want to let someone in in a t shirt. I'll get over it but why be like that?

name: Barbaro
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Sunday

reviews.author: Joe Z.
reviews.description: The gluten free pizza is really good. They messed up on my order but I got a free pizza out of it lol

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: On a random weekend, my friend and I randomly came across this name of this establishment when looking for a mid afternoon snack.  When we entered, immediately we were impressed by the layout and the amazing bar. Though the restaurant seemed kind of small, the open design really made the layout cozy.  The menu was limited, but all the food is delicious! Everything we ordered was on point. I definitely will come back again, especially when I want to enjoy great food in an environment that I can easily socialize with company.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: The food and drinks are consistently good here. Unfortunately, so is the bad service. Like most of Chad's establishments, their service here is like angry teenagers who feel like they have to rebel against their parents. Slow.... Argumentative... Indifferent... Angry if questioned.  Every visit to this location (and his others) which numbers above thirty over the years, the service is consistently bad on purpose. Their staff are seemingly taught to be this way. So the only assumption is that they learn it from Chad who wants it that way.

reviews.author: Mariah M.
reviews.description: Sorry, i don't have any photos of the food... so tasty that I just inhale the pizza before i remember to snap a photo The highlights: Happy hour, pizza and kind staff! This has become a go-to for my bf and I because of the crafty, affordable booze and the yummy pizza pie!  I recommend the blanche devereaux off the happy hour menu... Absolutely immaculate  and the Carbonara and Benton's are my top 2 pizza favs!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Love their happy hour! The vibe is legit. The food isn't bad either but the drinks keep me coming back! Great date night spot!

reviews.author: Maria R.
reviews.description: I've been to Barbaro for dinner before and it was great and the brunch is just as amazing! We had a pizza Carbonara, some Fried Chicken and Zeppole, and Eggs Barbaro. My favorite was the fried chicken, it was drizzled with honey and it was their perfect version of chicken and waffles. The guys got some drinks and I had a coffee. Everything was perfection!

reviews.author: Alex G.
reviews.description: I would definitely come back for the food, but not for the waitress we had. To start - the garlic knots? Immaculate! The CHARCOOTS? Immaculate! The pizza? Immaculate! We came on a Monday evening and the pizza was only $10 for 3 toppings - what a great deal! My only complaint is our waitress. I don't understand how she went from being so attentive to so non-existent. We could see her attending to other customers next to us yet she did not check on us for roughly an hour while we waited for our pizza. I felt a bit guilty asking other staff members for assistance but it felt like there was no other way to ask for anything.

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: Bárbaro this one is a tough review because I've come here in the past and would recommend the menu and establishment to any one that loves pizza. However our recent visit was a bit of a disappointment and I do give grace to the complexity of the pandemic and impacts on restaurants.  We were immediately seated and the menu had a good selection. This spot has a a lot of options for meat eaters not so much for heavy pescatarian or vegan eaters. The wine and cocktail selection is good. We tried the peach mule and margaritas during the night happy hour, both well made.   Check out the late night menu for pizza by the slice and $5 cocktails which can save you money.   The calamari gets 5. The breading, fried peppers and jalapeños in the mix sets this apart. Loved that it was super hot and we could tell it was fresh made.   The lighting is very dark inside so if you are looking for a bright, large and active place this may not be it especially at night.   The pizza which should be the star is where this experience was subpar. We ordered the Sicilian and a regular pizza came out. So we waited for them to fix another which want a bad wait time and when it came out then we notice they are using regular black olives vs kalamata olives which is in the menu and what asked for. You can't just replace a kalamata with black olive chef they are totally different with a very different flavor. The dough was thick as advertised but the pizza overall did not wow us. It lacked something, flavor. We picked off the olives and ate around it and we didn't want to wait for something else.  I appreciated them comp'ing the pizza but I didn't have a full satisfying meal. We wanted a good night out and this is 40 min ride for us. Last recommendation is to see if you can add in more seafood, or shrimp to put on pizza

reviews.author: Kassie O.
reviews.description: Consistently Dynamic Cocktails and Delectably Delish Pasta, Pizza, Salads and Bread/Pita yum YUm YYYUUUMMM! Bartenders and Servers are Sharp and get it Done!

reviews.author: Eddie G.
reviews.description: Barbara has the right lighting for a great night out for dinner and drinks. Service can be a little slow because it's such a small place I think they may have to balance less staff size to manage more of an area. Aside from that food is always fresh and tasty. I have yet to try something that I haven't enjoyed

reviews.author: Victoria R.
reviews.description: Waited over an hour for pizza.   Favor runner said she arrived, placed the order, and was waiting on the pizza at the location. When they finally handed it to her she headed our way. We don't live too far from the place, but decided "why not order in."  When we FINALLY got it delivered it was literally cold pizza. Looked like it had been sitting out for a good while. If the favor runner was there and the pizza had come out and was handed over to her in a timely fashion and we received it hot like we and anyone else would have expected this MIGHT have been worth it but at this point everything with this order tonight was just a waste.  When we called about the pizza being cold we were told the warmer was broken but the favor runner said she'd ordered it fresh and was waiting there for the order so if it was made fresh like the box it came in suggested then it'd still be hot to moderately warm once it traveled the FOUR (4) minutes to get it here.   To top it off they gave us the wrong cheesecake.   $40+ for a medium sized pizza and the wrong cheesecake. Ridiculously overpriced, cold, AND wrong. Disappointed and a WASTE $40+.   Definitely wouldn't suggest ordering.

reviews.author: Carmen V.
reviews.description: I would give them 5 stars because the food and drinks were tasty, perfectly made, and reasonably priced. The price for brunch's "keep it coming" mimosos and bloody of $15 is excellent!!Unfortunately, I  knocked them one star due to the wait time it took for our food to arrive.  It took a little over an hour to get our food. They forgot one order from our party of 7, and took about 30-45minutes to bring that meal out. They were kind enough to remove the charges for the forgotten meal, apologized, and kept the drinks coming. Because of that I will return and hopefully the wait and forgotten meal was a one off.

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: We came across this place after trying a near by restaurant that had a two hour wait. We were able to be sat right away even though it was busy inside and out. We came during their brunch hours on a Sunday, but only saw their lunch/dinner menu.   We split a medium pizza, which was enough to bring some home. We got pepperoni on the whole thing and anchovies on one side and kalamata olives on the other side. They were very generous with the anchovies. The olives were finely diced, which made it easy to have some in every bite.   We got a side of giardiniera. The portion size was nice and you could tell it was made fresh. The vegetables were crisp and it wasn't overly pickled.   I'm not sure what the parking situation is here. We parked on a side street and walked a couple of blocks.

reviews.author: Sophia R.
reviews.description: My favorite late night, spooky lighting, good music having, fantastic pizza spot. Drinks are good and the vibe is always just perfect. Happiness seems to float through the air and people just seem like they're in another world, relaxed and enjoying themselves.  This pizza..is absolutely my favorite in SA, chewy crust, perfect foldable slices, hot and crispy where it needs it. Just perfect.  We also normally opt for the pickle juice and Aquavit shots which are strangely delicious, we're hooked.

reviews.author: Brianna M.
reviews.description: We have been bringing everyone we know here!!! UHHHH-MAZING!!! The carbonara pizza is a taste I can't even begin to describe! SO GOOD!! The happy hour here is a must try! And the service has been perfect every time we have gone!

reviews.author: Omar R.
reviews.description: This place was recommended to me when I was visiting San Antonio, and it was delicious. We ordered the of the pizzas, Caesar salads, and calzone.  I have had many calzones in my time, and I have to say that this was the absolute best calzone I've ever had. It's not even close. It's so smart how the make it with just the ingredients and out the sauce on the side.  Makes a huge difference!  Believe me, the food here is completely satisfying.  I want more!!!

reviews.author: Bryan S.
reviews.description: It's hard to mess up pizza, so it's always a safe bet when eating out in a new city. Barbaro showed us not only can they deliver a delicious, mouthwatering pie, but an atmosphere that makes you feel like you can stay all night. My only complaint is that the ranch dressing is not up to my standards The be fair, the pizza itself is so good you don't even need it!

reviews.author: Chelsey G.
reviews.description: Good food and location but when it comes to the service HORRIBLE.... I've been here about 4 times and each time it takes at LEAST 15 to be acknowledged by a single server. 10 extra minutes waiting on our drinks-- 40 mins to an hour waiting for food (which wouldn't be a problem if I had good service from to jump). I really love this place but it needs better server management. FYI; if you're a server please make sure you have money on your card because they don't take cash.

reviews.author: Thomas W.
reviews.description: Let's start with service. Excellence. My girlfriend and I walked in on a Thursday night greeted courteously by Austin, manager and host . No table were available inside, but he offered us a seat at the bar or outside. We chose the bar because it was full service. My girlfriend wanted to order drinks while eating so it was the perfect option.   The bar tender was very attentive to everyone at the bar with drinks. His Old Fashion and Lemon Martini were incredible. Sabra and Steven were our bartenders for the night. INCREDIBLE!   Aside from the amazing drinks, the food came out hot. The flavor (Egg Plant Parmigiana and Spaghetti) was terrific. Prices of food, in my opinion, were very reasonable. As well as the drinks. I didn't have any interaction with the rest of the staff but they very busy helping the other patrons. However by observation I would say they were very attentive.   Bottom line- highly recommend this place for lunch and dinner is

reviews.author: Stephanie R.
reviews.description: Benton's country ham pizza is literally life! So so good! If you go on Wednesdays get their chicken Alfredo! It's amazing and huge!

name: Mad Dogs British Pub River Walk
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Leslie H.
reviews.description: For what it was, it was great It was New Years eve afternoon and the restaurant was very busy We had our dog so we sat outside right next to the river...perfect! My husband ordered bangers and mash, he said they were great!   Drinks were excellent  Great ambiance  Very reasonably priced We will definitely return when in San Antonio!

reviews.author: Rick K.
reviews.description: Had a Great Time hanging at Mad Dog's on Riverwalk - Good Food, Live Music - Lots of Fun.   Stayed durning Christmas - ended up at MDB everyday - simply because that it was open later than most other places around that area and it was FUN to hang.  Waitresses are friendly and work super hard, they were constantly moving fill orders.   our regular waitress was Faith - Love Her !  The food is decent - we had cottage pie, cheeseburger and hot cracklings (basically warmed up pork rinds - they were really good). It's everything you would expect from a British type pub,   If you're in the area looking for decent food and a fun time head over to Mad Dogs.  Cheers

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: How to describe this experience?  We went straight in and was seated right away. Service was friendly bit slow. Food was good. They were short-staffed for Christmas Eve night which is understandable. We had run down and get our own silverware so we could eat before our food got cold. Our server did check on us periodically and was running her tail off so we didn't take it personally. Now, the price was a little high but that could be because I ordered a $40 glass of Johnnie Walker Blue. Glad I did before going out and spending $175 to try this whiskey. Definitely not worth the money for this whiskey. All and all, this was a pretty darn good restaurant.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: Fun place for lunch. The fish and chips were AMAZING!! And our non-seafood friend had the burger and said it was tasty too. Leslie was our server and was wonderful and fun. We did get the house margarita and it tasted like watered down lime juice. I'd go with a cold beer next time.

reviews.author: Paul Mark C.
reviews.description: The Boozy Bourbon Bacon Burger from Mad Dogs British Pub at the San Antonio River Walk was definitely a burger unlike any I've tried before. Containing 2 patties, loads of bacon, and a fried egg made my taste buds feel an array of textures. The special touch for me to the burger was the bacon jam, which added a sweet and savory touch to it. I recommend eating it with two hands at all times, because it may or may not slip from your grip. Overall, a good experience.

reviews.author: Steven W.
reviews.description: Just a fun joint on the Riverwalk. Was there for St. Patrick's Day weekend and they know how to party!!!!

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: We've always had good meals and service at Mad Dogs, we did skip them during covid 'cause they didn't have any scotch eggs, they do them very well here and now there back.  Wifey and I shared an order of eggs and an "Italian Job" flatbread.  We drank a nice love street lite from Karbach, an on tap pilsner that hit the spot.  We noticed a small sign on the table advertising a tuesday special 5 dollar frozen daiquiri.....yes please!  The service was as good as the grub.  The men's restroom wasn't Buc-ees but it was close.  If you haven't tried a Scotch egg, do so, you'll thank me later, seriously.  Posted some pics, check 'em out.

reviews.author: Holli A.
reviews.description: Our server was great she was very attentive. The chicken strips and spinach and artichoke dip was great. The jerk chicken dipping sauce was great.  However, the women's restroom was disgusting. The toilets and toilet seats had poop stains on them. There was no paper towels to dry our hands... only toilet paper. I just can't get the visual out of my head.  Again our server was great and so was the food.

reviews.author: Doug S.
reviews.description: On the river walk and did not want TexMex again. It was lunch time Mad Dog opened at noon, so we waited for them to open. Mad Dog has a nice patio good shade, so we sat on the patio. Greeted by the hostess and our waitress very good service. They do have a good indoor sitting area with a large bar if want air-conditioning. When it is very hot, I would go inside.  The food is British pub fare I went with the fish and chips. The fish was fried well a very big piece of white meat fish. Not heavily battered fish very good flavor I would get it again. The chips or fries were good the coleslaw was prepped very well. I love tartar sauce with my fish and Mad Dog had some very good tater sauce. I asked for more because the fish was so large.  It was Sunday and they have drink specials we had a couple of mimosa with our meal. We had a nice time at Mad Dog great location for sitting and people watching on the river.

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Service: As soon as we stepped on the stairs, one of the staffs approached and assisted us. Get us a table and chairs and gave the menu. They even recommend good beer for one of our accompany. They were nice and prompt, which was what we need at that time.   Place: It was a good vibes, even outside or inside of the restaurant. The interior was amazing that feels like you go back to a specific time.  Food: The food was good, there's some that not much really worthy but the egg appetizer was good and fish and dips. The crusty bread with meat and egg on top and meat below, they were the same aside from the top. It's not that good for me. The spinach dip was really good but you can taste the chips was from a bag and kind of stale a little. The beer was amazing especially the one they recommended but for food, it's only few we liked.   We loved the environment and service!

reviews.author: Stacey P.
reviews.description: I appreciate people who not only tolerate me at my worst but can either overlook it or make it seem like they overlooked it.   I came here on my last day in San Antonio. I was a little off kilter because of a variety of events that made me feel stressed. Shortly after being shown my seat for lunch I get this panicky call from work just as Helayna, my waitress, came to greet me. I feel horrid because I have to shake my head and gesture I can't talk right at that moment because panicky work call. I get that resolved and apologize for my rudeness but I feel sprawled out with the work backpack and cords and the whole nine yards.   I feel like an absolute mess.   But Helayna seemed completely unfazed. She smiled at me happily and told me not to worry. She was an excellent waitress checking in on me frequently and making sure that I had what I needed.   I ordered the fish and chips after finding out they were allergy safe. I recall being in London and I will admit this is more classically a UK fish and chips than ones we are here in the US. I can't say it was the most flavorful that I have had, but I still thought the fillet was good and those fries were very easy to eat. The cocktails, too, were very good. I am happy that this was the last place I had lunch.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: Don't go to Mad Dogs to eat.  We ordered a burger, chicken sandwich, and Caesar salad.  All the food was very poor quality to say it kindly.   My friend said the hamburger at McDonald's was better than his burger from Mad Dogs.    Do go to Mad Dogs for the atmosphere along the River walk.  They had live music and also nice seats right on the river.    To sum up, if you are looking for a good place to eat please avoid this restaurant.  If you are looking for a pleasant place to drink and hang out along the river this might be your spot.

reviews.author: Royal S.
reviews.description: Omg the pizza and salad were amazing!!!! Ordered the cheese pizza for the kids and was perfect size and I got the Cajun salad with an Italian job pizza! It's perfect temp, soft dough, and great flavor!

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: This was a surprise win. We were just walking down the riverwalk, looking for something to eat. I'm a vegetarian, so we always have to scope out the menu before we pick a place. And we were surprised to see a few items I could eat, mostly since this was "pub food". I think we got one of the best tables in the house, it was outside, on the top level, and was on the river side.   We didn't see mimosas on the menu, but we asked for them, and I got one. Our server also offered a manmosa, which honestly, we weren't listening when she said the ingredients. And it was a little strange. I recommend sticking with a regular mimosa.   And then there was the food!! We got an order of buffalo cauliflower and both ordered the portobello sandwich. The cauliflower was thick and flakey and soft and covered in soft and it was soo delicious. The portobello was amazing! It popped with flavor. The grilled peppers, shroom and cheese is a winning combination.   Our server was super nice and we even got our picture taken by a rotating photographer on the river.

reviews.author: Jacqueline V.
reviews.description: Wedge okay, fish and chips per my husband we're MEH...however the nachos were yum! Love the live music, but otherwise the atmosphere wasn't for me.

reviews.author: KELLY W.
reviews.description: Oh my goodness.  Elva is amazing it is in the upper 30's she not only brings us old folk a heater but a charger for our phone so we can keep enjoying adult beverages while waiting for a later reservation.  Thank you for caring about your customers.

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: This place is adorable! Cute atmosphere, cute waitresses in cute outfits! Live music! It's just the best. This is located right on the river walk. Stop by for a late night drink and enjoy the live music. The water melon margarita mixed with white claw drink is amazing FYI! I'd go again if I was in the area. Good prices, great people!

reviews.author: Dominic C.
reviews.description: This was a great choice on the river walk   The fish tacos for lunch were light and tasty   Our server Naomi was extremely attentive.  Do ask for her if you come here   The view and setting wasn't pleasent and fun  I would come here agai for sure

reviews.author: Kayla C.
reviews.description: Ate dinner here one night. We had some problems with drinks not being available and not coming out right, but nothing too bad. I ordered the Cod Sandwich and it was very good. It didn't feel too heavy (since the cod was fried) and it was really tasty on the brioche bun.

reviews.author: Richard M.
reviews.description: Call drinks given when we'll was requested, no resolution.  Virgin drink charged as if it had alcohol, no resolution. Said they didn't have a button for virgin drinks.  Manager stated he couldn't do anything about it. What bar manager can't resolve an issue like this. Guy just as well be a busboy. Nice place I guess if you don't get ripped off.

name: Twin Peaks
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Charles O.
reviews.description: Alyssa is my favorite waitress here! She is so fun and friendly, I love the food and environment. I'll be back to sit in her section!

reviews.author: Leon G.
reviews.description: Food was good, atmosphere was good as well. Food came out a little spread apart. The brisket was not as smokey or tender as I would have liked, it was pretty dry.  There was kid that had gotten sick and left a trail of vomit to the door... they cleaned up the table pretty quickly. But the trail was left behind.  Pretty nasty!

reviews.author: Christian V.
reviews.description: Alyssa is an amazing waitress here at twin peaks! She held great conversation, the beer was ice cold and the food tastes great. I'll be back to sit in her section!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Not my typical setting, but I had a fantastic time here! The food was decently good; however, what surprised me was a section on the menu called Grandpa's Stash. I ordered myself a Bulletit Rye Old Fashion.. Amazing!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Wouldn't have received one star had he not gotten food poisoning. Neither of us slept after this visit due to him having nausea and vomiting. He was then down the entire next day.  Absolutely unacceptable. For whoever's information, he had the habanero pineapple boneless chicken.

reviews.author: Alfredo R.
reviews.description: This twin peaks is really good specially cause Brina the server is really amazing,nice,funny and takes good care of you I recommend asking for her when at this twin peaks

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: I'll preface this review by saying you pretty much get what you expect with twin peaks. Ifyou're coming here for happy hour, they have great food /drink deals. M-F 2-7 happy hour.  $4 mozzarella bites, queso, or fried pickles. The mozzarella bites are always solid. Good drink specials. I'm majorly disappointed in the cost cutbacks they've made regarding food. I used to be a huge fan of the chicken Cobb salad that was LOADED with blue cheese, chicken, eggs, cabbage, carrots, and bacon. This time when I got it it was majority lettuce. I didn't find any blue cheese or bacon in the salad at all. Our friends always got the appetizer platter as their meal and they cut back on the size for that as well. So if you're coming for drinks/to watch a game it's great. Otherwise it's meh.

reviews.author: Bryon M.
reviews.description: If you cant tell from some of my previous reviews, I am a fan of Twin Peaks. Pre-covid, I was travelling for work, and I would try to visit locations throughout the country whenever I could. San Antonio has 3 locations. I visted one SA location 3 years ago. This is visit number 2, to a different location in SA. I got seated right away, and the person who sat me was also my server. She was really nice and attentive. The place was busy. Employees were wearing masks and they had divders placed in between certain tables and I think at the bar. Started off with some chips and salsa. Peaks and Chuy's have the best chips. Maybe the same provider? My main meal was the Southern Fried Chicken Sandwich, minus tomatoes. The sandwhich came out nice and hot, same with the fries. It was cooked and prepared perfectly. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Tess H.
reviews.description: So the food at this place is relatively good. The billionaire bacon and the burger that features this bacon happens to be one of the best burgers I've ever tasted. From the seasoning to the toppings, the burger gives you a perfect bite from beginning to end.  I decided to order wings and I feel like Dr. Nowzaradan from my 600lb life was shaking his head with disapproval. Maybe that's why they were red beneath the surface. Yep. I received wings that were undercooked and paid for it royally. Special shout-out to the Pepto Gods for the special stomach coating that shielded me from further harm or danger.   I'm hoping Yelp leaves this up because this is the absolute truth.   Case in point, don't be greedy. The food is good but don't go overboard. I'd rather order takeout because I'm not there to scantily clad women. I'm in it for a good burger and the scrumptious bacon. But for the wings this place would have 4-5 stars.

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: Service was bad, took a long time to get wings and nachos, took 45 mins. Server was not attentive and the place was not crowded at 11p. Take your money to WHATABURGER instead.

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Great quality of food but trash service the server took forever and never went to my table.

reviews.author: Jake L.
reviews.description: Okay so lets face it not many men or women to a certain extent go to places like this for the food. Beautiful women, drink specials and saturation of Sports and music coming from every corner does make a meet up or after work winddown especially inviting. So I met my buddy there looking forward to a meal I actually enjoy here The Chicken and Waffles only to find out thwy no longer serve them. Saddness and disappointment. But that's alright.  Our welcoming cute Pixie server Vida informed us they were still only using online menus. I always thought that was cool unless you didn't have a cellphone, then well therescan awkward moment of havi g to look over at other tables to see your options.  I opted for the chicken and shrimp with a side of Mac and cheese ( the best part of the plate) the chicken strips were tiny and the grilled " blackened" shrimp were light on flavor and sparce. I was a little disappointed in the portions as it looked more like it came off the kids menu. Fortunately they have a decent dessert menu. I ordered the apple turn overs. Vida informed me they were her personal favorite, she had to cut back on ( slight eye roll in the vain of absolute forbidden deliciousness) she was on point they were good, really good. I only wish the rest of my meal was at that calibre. I do enjoy going there, I don't drink and realized a long time ago that the women are beautiful but it's there job and they do it well. So I'm left with gsthering with my buds for a couple of hours of comroderery, maybe some binle study ( just kidding) and the food. As far as that goes, TP you need to bring your game back up because your slacking. If the food was as good as the service that would be fine with me.

reviews.author: nailea j.
reviews.description: Came here tonight with some girlfriends for Valentine's Day, server was really inattentive we had to wait forever to ask for drinks, we wanted one last round of shots but she just dropped the check off. I brought it to MIKEYS attention and he couldn't do anything about it... I thought he was a manager but he was too busy talking to the waitresses.. thanks twin peaks !

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: This place is large, busy and cheerful during this Covid gloominess. The food is very good and priced right. There's not much to complain about overall. Oh, the service...go and judge for yourself.  Their venison chili is spicy and very good and they have good ribs with delicious mac and cheese sides. we did not like their coleslaw, it was terrible. But, heck, that is such a small part of a great place.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Came here for a quick meal, around 3 in the afternoon.  Somewhat busy, but was seated quickly. The server, Sabrina, however was quick to tell us she was behind on service and she had to take care of a big party first. We gave her our drink orders and she didn't bring them back for 10 minutes.  We ordered chips and salsa and the chips came out before the drinks. However, the chips were covered in oil from the fryer, but were cold.  We didn't get to order our actual meals for 15 minutes and they when they came out, it was really disappointing for my son after his game. The fries were thrown on the plate, burger looked smashed down, and didn't have any if the sides in it. He was too hungry to send it back.  Never coming back. I have been let down by this location for the last time. Get better management. I'll make the trip to the other location in town, but they're not great either.

reviews.author: Juan S.
reviews.description: Horrible experience. We sat down I had 2 shots of patron while my buddies had a shot of patron and beer. Right away waiters Litzy our waiters informed us that she was informed we would be cut off if he had too much drinks in a short period of time. We explained that we took an Uber and we have a plan to drink responsibly. We also made small conversation and when I asked for a 3rd shot and refills for my buddies, one of them decided to add a shot of patron to take with me....mind you I had to explain myself that I am on a low carb diet and that's is why I'm doing liquor only at this time and that is why I'm not drinking beer. She was hesitant and she said she had to check...after a short while she came back and said she could fulfill my patron shot but could not get my buddy both. She proceeded to specifically target by buddy. At this time we asked her to close the check. She was very apologetic and said she is just doing her job as instructed. At the time of the interaction 3 managers (2 females and 1 male) were peering job interviews on a corner round table and proceeded to stare until we paid and left. We felt target as plenty of individuals around the bar were drinking hard liquor and had plenty of more drinks than us. We had a multi-racial group ( one Mexican American, African American and Caucasian)...the one she targeted was the Caucasian buddy from having both shot of patron and Miller Light after just one drink. We came to Hooters instead. Don't go to this place!!!

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: We came in for a late lunch today and let me start off by talking about the management, Laura with the crazy red hair, is hands-down one of the most attentive and best restaurant managers I've come across in a long time being in the food industry service for over 10 years myself, she was amazing, I have a dairy allergy, as soon as the server put our food order and she came and stopped by our table and checked in on us to make sure that everything was perfect for me and was just overall very sweet and attentive to not only us, But to almost every other table in the building she had amazing customer service and was just an all around great person, not the normal manager you come across but all the employees seemed to really respond well to her, and that's the best thing you can ask for in any restaurant setting also our server Kiana sorry if I misspelled her name was absolutely super sweet and amazing, compared our last experience here is a complete 180 and will definitely be back and ask for her again

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: They never have blue moon . I love the blue moon draft but they never have it . It's not even busy lol and they don't have happy hour anymore

reviews.author: Yunnán C.
reviews.description: I normally don't bother going to poorly rated places but gave this one a try. I am a chicken wing lover and had never tried these. Ordered them to-go and the girl working there was completely clueless saying things like "uhhhh I think so" when asking if we could order as many flavors as we want. Typically we get to pick 2 and didn't trust her so we picked lemon pepper and garlic Parmesan. The wings came out with no flavor. Hardly any seasoning and the garlic parmasean just tasted like garlic.   Post-stay-at-home wings were disgusting and slimy. I don't know if they are just using old inventory to make up for lost revenue but they were some of the worst, flavorless wings I've ever had plus they forgot our side order of fried pickles. They did not seem to be respecting the required 6' social distancing as the parking lot and lobby were full of people.  If I could rate 0 stars, I would. I don't care too much for going somewhere to eat for girls, at least get the food right...garbage of an establishment.

reviews.author: Kiiya V.
reviews.description: All I have to say about this place is that the waitresses are not trained to serve food and the manager there is racist and homophobic. PERIOD!!

name: Brick House Tavern + Tap
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: The outdoor patio, variety of drinks and awesome service I received the last time I went in was a 10/10. Our server Isabella was prompt, knowledgeable and so great at what she did. She helped navigate the menu to answer all of our questions and continually checked on our table to make sure everything was better than expected. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Elias A.
reviews.description: I love brick house, right as. Hailey greeted me and took me straight for my table I had Savanna as a server and she had my drinks ready before I had the menu fully read through, the pretzel are to die for as an appetizer and the food nonetheless. My regards to the chef in the back it made my Valentine's Day so much better than it could it have been.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Brick House is a Sunday staple for my friend group. We love meeting up here to enjoy food and drinks on the patio. It's convenient and never a long wait. The wait staff is attentive and really takes care of their customers. My go-to is the sparkling sangria (it's not too sweet and very refreshing) and a flatbread. I love their margherita flatbread but have enjoyed all the ones I've tried. You also can't go wrong with any of the apps. The fried calamari and Brussels sprouts are both delicious as well!

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: Service sucks, food meh. Had to ask 3-4 different servers for napkins.  Utensils ect.  Our server didn't even ask what sides we wanted. Cauliflower wings appetizer has 5 pieces at best. Burger was not worth the price. Will not be coming back

reviews.author: Suelo R.
reviews.description: So I won't lie I am super bummed cause I went last week and had the fish and chips and absolutely loved it but today I ordered, and found this weird Brillo brush medal in my fish, I was offered a meal credit if I emailed the photo but the email address bounced back as blocked and then I called to let management know stayed on hold 15 min so decided to just post it here.. super sad and hopefully the photo gets back so they can see this and give me the credit back to my payment or credit to get what we paid for since I had to go to another restaurant and pay for more food.. again think it was a one time thing but super disappointed

reviews.author: Ryan Anthony H.
reviews.description: I come to this place with my friend every now and then. I have noticed that the service has been very slow and at times we don't know where the servers are hiding. We usually go early on a weekday when it isn't too busy so I'm not understanding why it takes 15 minutes to get a server to bring a couple of drinks. Maybe I just went on a bad day

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Met my parent here for dinner tonight! Loved the atmosphere and set up of the restaurant! We got mozzarella sticks for an appetizer and I will say they had some marinara sauce that had a little kick to it. The crust on the mozzarella sticks and a lot of seasoning as well, but if you are one who likes that then definitely order these! I split the lobster Mac and cheese with my mom and we both loved it!
