Tried some of my dad's steak as well as the green beans and I was very impressed. There were parts of the steak that weren't as tender than other parts of the steak, but I still really liked it! I am typically not a fan of green beans, but I'm assuming they were cooked differently with different seasonings and I thought they were so good! Definitely want to come back here again!

reviews.author: Ethan I.
reviews.description: Came in on the Sunday afternoon with my wife for brunch, we were immediately seated and then ignored for 30 minutes before we decided to just leave...place seemed nice but staff walked by several times and just ignored us.  Note to management this was our first time trying you... no 2nd chances, we will never return.

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: This place has been very consistent in service and food. Today I tried their deviled eggs w bacon and paprika and I've had their steak on my previous visit. I had a zombie last time and it was a great treat if you like rum. Definitely consistent on flavor and made with love.  They have many options for all types of cravings and hunger levels. I tried their peanut butter old fashioned this visit and this is a delicious, unique twist on the old fashioned I will return for. The atmosphere is classy and laid back at the same time. Definitely, my type of environment. The customers were mostly dressed up with some in casual wear. I like that the bar wraps around so you have the option to sit inside or outside. I chose outside since it was a nice day in the 70's with good cloud coverage. The attentiveness of the bartender (long dark hair lady ,Taylor I believe ) was perfect. I can tell she reads her clients. She didn't forget about me, but she left me alone enough to enjoy my food and entertainment. Great spot and never disappoints.

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: Ehhh, this place was just ok. The appetizer we ordered they were out of one of the items so we substituted more wings which was fine. Nothing other than the wings on the appetizer was really good anyway so glad we got extra wings! I ordered an old fashioned and it was made with regular ice vs 1 large cube so it watered down VERY quickly which was a bummer. Entrées were so so, Nothing great but nothing terrible either. The place was pretty dead for a Saturday so I'm assuming this wasn't a fluke for the subpar food and drinks. Service was ok, again nothing outstanding but not bad either. In a large city there are so many better places to eat and grab a drink so I don't think we would return sadly.

reviews.author: Justin R.
reviews.description: I had a incident tonight on 02-06-2022 where I was dining in and had my waitress leave for the night and leave me waiting without a replacement server in the middle of her shift with no one communicating to me that she had left.I waited over 30 minutes with no one checking up on me and had to finally get up and walk over to the other side of the restaurant to get their attention shortly before last call to order before close.I had be the one to request and new server who wouldn't have put it in on-time before close had I got up and said something.The new waitress who took my order was nice and rushed my food out to me .I then quickly rushed to eat and asked to speak to the head manager after to tell him how I felt about them not providing me the service of what their prices should hold them up to and that I was not going to be tipping tonight and was I surprised by how unprofessional and rude his responses were.He basically told me that if I'm not satisfied to go eat elsewhere and to not come back.I than went to the front to pay my waitress and asked to pay with Apple Pay as I told her i did there the last time i dined in last week and she seemed confused as to how to complete my transaction with me using my phone to pay and called for him over again the general manager to help her because she didn't know how to do it and he acted as if he did not know how to process apple payments as well.He told me that "You should know you have been here before"I then told him that "You are the manager you should know I'm the customer"He quickly told me to shut the f***up.I told him then "Ok I'm really tempted on just walking out now and having this be on the house for really bad service tonight."He then replied "Than get the f*** out of here mother****** and don't come back.I then proceeded to walk toward the exit to leave and he followed me and out of no where when my back was turned at the front exit before exiting the door in the hallway he kicks me really hard in my back lower section just over my buttocks in spine .I then head to my car in unbelief and shock thinking to myself what just happened and instead of driving off I head back into the restaurant with an Adrenaline rush and tell him"You better put this house the now that you just  kicked me"He then says"It's doesn't matter what you say we have proof you didn't pay and walked out and have your license plate.I quickly called 911 and they sent officer tayler badge id 0358 and he hears my side of the story and then goes in and talks to this manager who is a Spanish guy and a few of his employees and they of coarse have a different story.Saying I was unwilling to pay and that they have closed my tap and calling it theft on my end even though I was still on site trying to pay them before leaving and was kicked out before getting the chance to complete the transaction and was actually assaulted.He told me they are saying there are no cameras out at the front door to see anything and that I did theft by not paying and that a investigative detective will call me tomorrow to get further details of the incident to see if legal action will follow from either side .So fast forward to this moment,I'm now  at the hospital at 1:08 am hours after the incident experiencing severe back pain from the kick that has me in pain and needing medical attention.I didn't realize how hard he actually kicked me till the adrenaline wore off.I'm so disappointed that a after a hard long week of working 60 hours and just going out for a few drinks and burger this is the result.Such a disappointment being that I really like this restaurant and love how nice it is there.This incident will be forwarded to the Fox News tomorrow and will be made public on several local radio stations.I hope situations like this never happens to any customers in the future.I'm still in shock that this happened to me .I'm a 31 year old Mormon guy who has never been in trouble with the law and has a clean record and this here shows that evil does exist. I have never experienced anything like this before.

reviews.author: Bob B.
reviews.description: Overall poor experience. Food was poor to mediocre at best. No military discount. Service was slow but normal nowadays.

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: Brick House Tavern has really stepped up their game when it comes to their food menu. I got to try several different menu items such as their pork chops, ribs, meatballs, pretzels, and deviled eggs. Everything I tried was freaking incredible.  The inside of the restaurant is nice, clean, and sleek and the service is impeccable. They have several screen TV's throughout the establishment and they are strictly enforcing social distancing rules during these Covid times.   I recommend to all of my fellow yelpers to stop by and enjoy some tasty ribs, their Mac and cheese burger or any of their other menu items. You're going to love it.

reviews.author: Ronnie A.
reviews.description: Food is overpriced and subpar at best. Server didn't even know what came on a sandwich they sell. And e don't even think about paying with a Brick House  gift card because they'll tell you they are a "non-chain" restaurant. Trust me you're not good enough to be that.

reviews.author: LaRonda G.
reviews.description: For this Saturday night takeout adventure I wanted to try a new restaurant so I decided on this place. I placed my order through GrubHub. I orderd Guiness onion soup,  druken pork chop with mac and cheese and the crispy brussel sprouts. The food was packed very well in plastic containers and still hot when it arrived. The soup had a good flavor which was perfect for a rainy day. The pork chop was a bit overcooked so it was tough to cut but it had great flavor and marinade so I powered through. The brussel sprouts were cooked well but lacked seasoning. Once I added some salt they were fine. The same for the mac and cheese,  no salt at all. Once I added salt and pepper the mac and cheese tasted much better. Overall I wouldnt be opposed to give this restaurant a try again. That pork chop sauce was really good. I am not sure if the offer bread when you dine in (didn't see it on the menu) but that would have gone great with my delivery order.

reviews.author: Gio P.
reviews.description: Service was great, our waiter was prompt and kind. The food however was a disappointment. The chicken sandwich had little to no actual chicken, it was more of a "chicken breading" sandwich. Very disappointing, and the fries were cold. The photos reflect the little to no chicken in the fillet.

reviews.author: Alan W.
reviews.description: Jan 29 2:45 Dining time. After wanting to go here for so long, I finally made it in, but unfortunately was not impressed. The hostess had a serious attitude problem. Very much a don't care attitude, didn't listen to our table request. Threw menus on the table 2x, because she forgot that she put them down already. I honestly considered leaving because it was very uninviting. Waitress had a better attitude, but was clearly in no rush. For as slow as it was our beers took way too long show up (10-15 min). The food service was ok, although we never got our dressing for our mozzarella sticks and my bison burger was slightly overcooked. Overall, was nice place to try but definitely not going back due to attitude and price.

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: We choose this restaurant because of their advertised gluten free options. Big mistake. I tried to order 3 different things off of their menu and they were out of all of them. I settled for some absolutely disgusting Brussels sprouts that had an even worse mayo type dip that went with them. My husband ordered a burger that was good except for the bacon that he paid extra for was nasty.  My two children had okish meals. We paid $100 and left disappointed and hungry. Our waitress was very nice though.  Save yourself the time, money, and energy and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Joanna F.
reviews.description: Buyer beware! Not only are they barely mediocre in person, they misrepresent themselves as the "Nashville Hot Chicken Shack" on Uber Eats and Grubhub. I make it a point not to get upset about delivery in a pandemic, but the food was so over salted and inedible I had to say something (also inconsistent and missing portions of our 50 dollar order).

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: Service was great! Our waitress, Ashley was very nice. Had dinner and beer with the hubby. Enjoyed the Drunken Chicken with Fries, Deviled Eggs and Avocado Toast. For beer I had the Blood and Honey by Revolver Brewery. Very nice. Hubby had a Samuel Adam's.

reviews.author: Justin G.
reviews.description: TBA is a gem. It's a bright, shiny, diamond, thrown into the garbage line known as N. St Mary's. Oh my gosh! Coffee and Cigarettes is like the best cocktail that I've had in a while and trust me my blood is probably made of 90% cocktails.   All drinks are hand crafted, well made, and you can taste the love and care they put into these confidence boosters. Don't let the prices scare you, they put enough booze to get you buzzing through the night and into your Uber or Lyft.   Hit up this place during happy hour, which is from 4pm till 8pm. Try all the drinks you can handle, and have yourself a nice pre-game.  deuces.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Have to say that this place is a cool little spot to hangout after work or as the start to your night out. Cocktails are great and the people even better! Much love TBA  happy we met !

reviews.author: Meg C.
reviews.description: Such a disappointing evening!  Evidently this is no longer the cool place for a nightcap!! Paige the bartender informed me that I was too intoxicated to have a second 7pz Miller Highlife pony beer!! Yep heard that fight!!  More to follow.

reviews.author: Yvonne W.
reviews.description: If you know what you are getting yourself into when you go to this bar, you'll love it. It's a very low key dive bar. Nothing fancy here at all. I met a couple of locals in San Antonio and this is their favorite place. It's small and they give out free chips. The drink were decent. It's certainly not a place you go to impress anyone. But it's a hometown bar where literally everyone knows your name.

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: TBA is one of those spots that steers away from the hustle and bustle of St. Mary's. Keep in mind TBA has been around before the recent resurgence of hipsters and bar traffic this (once) low-key street is now getting.  Their cocktails here are great and I love the intimacy of this bar. They always have clever names and the cocktail selection is great here. It's a great spot to grab a few drinks and catch up with friends.   As a fan of Rye and Mezcal you'll see some stellar cocktails and some of them are even featured in their happy hour menu.   For those of y'all who are adamant about patio seating don't worry they got you covered. Literally since it's underneath a porch.   I'm always game for their bar food and trust me this isn't your average bar food whatsoever. They know their stuff and you'll be chomping down like the character in Mario. Whether you're hangry or have the drunchies you'll be in pure bliss.  Make sure not to blink while driving here or you'll miss it.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Meh. It's ok. Nothing wrong. Nothing stellar either. I guess I'm in the minority on Yelp. That's ok. I don't venture over to the St Mary's strip too often, so take this review with a grain of salt.  Went here for a date. The place is nice. They have parking in the back and lots of room to sit, although my friend says it gets crowded. It was fairly tame on a Wednesday night.  So the place has a menu of "signature" cocktails. They all seem good but a lot of them seem to be mezcal based and I just don't like mezcal. I had a South Flores which was light and refreshing. It was also pink. But I'm secure in my manhood enough to enjoy a pink cocktail--tho I didn't order a second.  I switched to scotch after my initial drink. They have my current fav Glenlivet 12. That's a plus.  My friend had a Rye N Gosling which gets bonus points for the wordplay. She seemed to enjoy the two she had.   So yeah everything was cool. I like the music. It was a mix of 90s alt rock which was perfect. The crowd was definitely on the younger side--like early to mid 20s young. I'm not sure if that's usual but I did feel my age a bit. But everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.   Prices were fine for the area. I didn't notice what beers they had on tap but a quick survey of the crowd and PBR cans seemed to be the go to.  It's a nice place to take a tinder date for a drink or to catch up with friends. I'll likely not be back but I suspect they won't mind as I don't think I'm their target demo.

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: First date.  Two different races having a good time.   That awkwardness of one of the first dates. "What would you like to eat? What would you like to drink?" Each look at each other with the words, "Whatever you would like."  He looks into her eyes, she looks into his. They converse about everything. EVERYTHING. They compare notes some of the difficulties of their respective occupations.  Yeah. Not my story.  Anyway . . . Back to reality.  Little bar. Dim. Good cocktails if you get right bartender. Lucky for me, the dude manning the bar remembers me from Boiler House (where he used to work at-he doesn't remember occassion or the year/occasion-it's all good since i dont remember him either).  Their recently added food offerings are good.  Their Caprese Grilled cheese stands out, especially when you combine it with the pickled cauliflower. Yes. Damn good. The Westsider - we do not know what was in there but it was good. So yes, their late night eats fill that void in your stomach but wish their drinks were slightly more consistent.  P.s. This place could use a cigarette smoker or two to make it great for some free second hand cancer and more ambiance.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Such a fun find. Friendly and great cocktails. The owner was kind enough to make me a brandy old fashioned in the Wisconsin style. It was delicious and the house cocktail menu was sublime, not to mention all the classic cocktails. I can't get over the great service and the friendly, warm,  inviting atmosphere. It's cute and has an outdoor patio.  Get in here.

reviews.author: Sabrina L.
reviews.description: This little gem is really good for craft cocktails.  It is right off of the St. Mary's strip and is an awesome little place if you love craft cocktails.  Plus, it is off of St. Mary's street so parking is pretty easy to find.  It can get pretty busy depending on day and time but it is definitely worth it. Last weekend I walked up to the bartender and asked him to just make me something and I told him the type of liquor I like and he made an awesome drink.  We were sitting outside and one guy was getting a little rowdy, but he calmed down.

reviews.author: Cecilia C.
reviews.description: In my top three favorite bars on the strip! I like to pick up the tacos up the street and bring them over here to have a seat and drink great cocktails!

reviews.author: Miriam B.
reviews.description: "Get that weak drink drink outta my face!" She said after ordering a drink across the street. " OK she said something to that effect and then I brought her to TBA for a real drink.   "Ahhhh yes" she said with the first sip of her much better drink. I was just thankful she found something she liked. She was thankful that they kept the doubles coming. She's got problems.   I explained to her that this is where you come when you want a good cocktail. She then proceeds to ask the bartender to make her another drink right after his first drag from his cigarette. He followed her request with a gracious sense of confusion. Now that she knows what's up, she'll come back with or without me. That bartender better be ready.

reviews.author: Yelper E.
reviews.description: 2.75 stars.  I wasn't nearly as impressed with this place as pretty much everyone else that has written about TBA so I'd take my review with at least one healthy grain of salt especially given that I've only been here one time.  That said, the cocktails weren't very interesting and weren't balanced very well to boot.  The crowd oscillated between completely barren to moderately lively during my two hour visit.  Bartenders were kind of standoffish without traversing fully into the category of rude.  The most interesting part of this bar was the artwork and the horrible movie I intermittently turned my attention to when my friend would leave for the bathroom.    What would potentially bring me back here is its close proximity to Tacos El Regio and some other above average bars and restaurants.  But standing alone, it wasn't my favorite experience.

reviews.author: Cory W.
reviews.description: Local bar, top-shelf spirits and careful craftsmanship. TBA is a star on every St Mary's pub crawl. Featuring an adventurous cocktail menu and bartenders like Danielle, I'd challenge anyone to find a request unfilled. On weekends it is packed in with locals...weekdays you can get a seat at the bar and pick the bartender's brain. Either way the quality is always top notch. Personally I like to start up at Cullum's Attagirl for great beers and chicken before hitting up TBA on a pub crawl; it never disappoints.

reviews.author: Edith Y.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff! Low key on a Friday afternoon. Sneak over. Park and walk. Very comfy seating!

reviews.author: Michelle O.
reviews.description: This is probably the best bar I've been to on N St. Mary's. The atmosphere isn't annoying, rude, or hipsterish. It's really cute inside with cool decor and everyone seemed really friendly. The bartenders were cool and the drinks are great.  No complaints. Best of all the bathroom is clean and they put effort into decorating it. There is nothing worse than having to pee in a disgusting bar bathroom.  Next time I'm in the area I'll have to stop by again.

reviews.author: Amy B.
reviews.description: We stopped in here for drinks and had some excellent cocktails. Mine, the Chef Jeff's Dilemma, was tequila's answer to the Old Fashioned. I enjoyed it greatly.  Bartender was very friendly and gave us some background on the bar and other places to try in the area. I liked that TBA was small, dark, and seemed like a local hangout rather than a tourist trap. I'd go again.

reviews.author: Melia R.
reviews.description: I like how the drinks are fancilicious (fancy + delicious) for less than $15.   I like how there were just people hanging out here.... different kinds of people; not cool kids versus everyone else.  This spot is gonna be the spark that sets the strip on fire (again).... which I hope turns out to be more blessing than curse.

reviews.author: Rebecca R.
reviews.description: Great selection here, and the staff will help you pair up beer/shot combos. Try the Chimay Grande Reserve with Buffalo Trace, or Real Ale Witte with the Botanist Gin.

reviews.author: Chloe O.
reviews.description: This is probably the most dirty and disgusting establishment I have ever been in. It smells like urine and stale beer and attracts some unsavory individuals. It is awful in every way. Only come here is you want to feel bad about your self then immediately go home and take a shower to get the filth from this place off of you

reviews.author: Abel L.
reviews.description: My friend was sick so I asked for a water. The blonde bartender on sat-sun, April 14-15, rolled her eyes at me and never served me. We had to ask a bouncer across the street at the squeezebox and he ran across the street to help us. Whoever that bartender was is absolutely disgusting as a human being. If I was a business, I would NEVER let someone represent me that way. Get your employees in check

reviews.author: G. Idalia V.
reviews.description: Nice bar. Over priced. Mostly college aged kids come here Great drinks  I had a margarita on the rocks. Delicious

reviews.author: Margaret P.
reviews.description: The Riverwalk in San Antonio is a true gem. There is so much history here and it is just bustling with life. Although most of the restaurants I saw here were mostly chain restaurants, there were a handful of bars and restaurants that were mom and pop. If you decide to try to eat at one of the restaurants here, I'd recommend to try to sit out on the Riverwalk so you can people watch.  BONUS: You can buy drinks from the stands on the riverwalk and stroll with your drink in hand legally!

reviews.author: Zoe K.
reviews.description: *TRY TO BOOK YOUR STAY ON THE RIVERWALK IF YOU CAN*  You will enjoy the whole experience much better that way.  Wear comfortable shoes and watch the little ones, there aren't any guard rails, and depending on the time of day and season, there may be some drunky drunks wobbling around.  The same goes for the elderly, not a smooth walk if they use walkers or need assistance walking but anything is possible just go early in the day when it is not crowded or too dark.  Nice experience, I am really happy I got to go! Take the river tour trust me ;)  Enjoy!

reviews.author: Jenniffer M.
reviews.description: It was a great experience to enjoy the river walk during the winter. There are shops as well as restaurants around the river walk to enjoy with the family.  It was really cold, however, it was worth it to see the lights on the bridge.  The only downside to it is the fact that there are usually a lot of people so you have to squeeze through the crowd. At one point I did feel like a can of sardines, but it was okay because once the evening got colder there were less people.

reviews.author: Diann U.
reviews.description: I was here recently. I had a great experience visiting here for a day trip from Austin. The River Walk has a variety of restaurants as well. This is a great place to go with family and friends.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10/27/21  This was suppose be the #1 attraction in Texas??? I envisioned this place cleaner, and more popping. Maybe I need to come back during the summer?  Quality/Quantity - Plenty of shops but most were closed, maybe due to the time of day..." The emptiness made this a better walking area with the minimum pedestrian traffic.  Atmosphere - Did not seem clean, the water looked dirty. They did have boats giving tours. But I believed the boat "shuttle" service was closed I recommend checking this website before going: https://www.visitsanantonio.com/category/attractions/ We enjoyed the Japanese/Chinese Tea Gardens more (separate 5 Star Yelp Review) The Alamo (separate 5 Star Yelp Review) The Market Square (separate 4 Star Yelp Review) Also check out the following while you are here: Murals and public art pieces San Fernando Cathedral  Service - N/A  Price - N/A, Free  Owner Suggestion - Cool place/city, will have to try again in the Summer because I want to experience the hype.

reviews.author: Kris S.
reviews.description: I came in February of 2018 and I loved it and wanted to go back.  however it's spring break week and it was jam packed with people. we tried to enjoy it as much as we could, with everyone else. Come visit on an off season. Nice walk along the river, see some ducks. lots of restaurants , but be prepared they're all going to be busy, plan ahead.

reviews.author: Jacky C.
reviews.description: Not being a native Texan, I felt very out of place wandering the streets of San Antonio, until I step foot into the river walk. Something about blending in with other visitors and tourists made me feel like I belonged here. A very unnecessary amount of hotels with views of the riverwalk, bars and restaurants to grabs drinks or eat lunch/dinner with a view, and lots of weddings related activities. There's never a dull moment here. Feel free to take a boat tour also. The most popular areas is around the horseshoe bend, the other areas of the river walk is essentially dead. There's a section that leads to the RiverCenter Mall, which is worth visiting and another that leads to Hemisfair Park, also worth the hike.

reviews.author: Mallory D.
reviews.description: Without the River walk San Antonio would have been boring AF. The river walk seems to be the epicenter of SA social life-at least for us tourists! It's super cute and the town does a great job of decorating with with pretty lights and making it an all around visual spectacle. The cruise down the river is so lovely especially at night when all these lights can be seen.  It seems that there are cool places all over the river walk and I'm sure I've only taken in a small portion of them. I just wish that it wasn't like 98% food and drink. Once you eat dinner there isn't a ton to do. And the bars on the river walk don't strike me as bars where you can just hang out and pass the time but instead like bar and restaurants. But it is a very beautiful and unique space that makes San Antonio worth a visit.

reviews.author: JJ J.
reviews.description: This is one of the coolest and neatest places I've ever been too. I honestly had no idea this existed when I came here for an event.  I honestly was just looking for a place to eat lunch. But as I walked outside, I first noticed the Alamo. Then, I heard some water fountains across the street and so I preceded to go downstairs only to find there to be more fountains and more water, leading me to the Hyatt hotel, and then this magnificent place that reminded me of a place called Venice that I saw pictures of before with restaurants, shops, hotels, condos or apartments surrounding this long path of water -- It was remarkably beautiful! Needless to say, I forgot about lunch... So after an hour walking along this path, I then realized there was a mall / shopping center here, which I decided to stop into and wander around for awhile. I then finally got lunch. But man, am I glad I got to come here, it was really cool; and I'll have to come again here some time.

reviews.author: Linette P.
reviews.description: One of those things that you should just do because you're a tourist. Is it something that I'm going to be doing every time I'm there, probably not- but if you haven't  done it I highly suggest that you do. I forgot the girls name but our tour guide was hilarious she had us laughing from start to finish. You should definitely come if you're a Selena fan, it's a really sweet and romantic place. It doesn't have to be Valentine's Day for anyone to do a spontaneous romantic trip any day is perfect for this. Celebrate culture, history and love all on one boat ride.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: River Walk, that's the big deal here and so I wanted to make sure that I visited it on my second time to San Antonio. Fortunately, I met up with my friend at the Alamo and it was an easy walk to the it.   So, after having walked it, I guess it's ok. It's a nice little walk-especially when it was so hot topside. You can tell that walk has seen some better days, it reminded me of those log flume rides at amusement parks, everything seemed wet and some of the maps clearly needed some refurbishment.  The restaurants along the section I was at was mostly very tourist heavy, lot of chain restaurants, nothing that really made me want to stop by.   I think we ended up walking it for about 20 minutes, mostly because I thought I saw someone I knew from back in the day on the other side and we had to find a crossing to double back.

reviews.author: Harish V.
reviews.description: Sightseeing, shopping, food and fun. All on a world-renowned 15-mile urban waterway. The River Walk, or Paseo del Rio, is a San Antonio treasure and the largest urban ecosystem in the nation. Tucked quietly below street level and only steps from the Alamo, it provides a serene and pleasant way to navigate the city. Explore by foot along the river's walking path or jump aboard a river barge for a ride and guided tour.  Just grab dinner in one of the restaurants on the river walk and enjoy the Vibe.   Pros: ----------- Best Attraction in the city Crowdy yet Peaceful in its own way Boat Rides( $13.50 Per Person) Lots of Restaurants Good place for a Date night Good spot for Photoshoots Boat ride covers a lot of spots

reviews.author: PatrickJ T.
reviews.description: While in San Antonio, a visit to the River Walk is a "Must Do"  We spent most of the afternoon walking along the River Walk.  It was cool because we got in some much needed exercise.  There are many shops and restaurants along the River Walk.  So there is a lot to explore on your own if you wish to do that.  I recommend taking the River Cruise if you want to learn a little more about San Antonio and the River Walk.  We did that too.  Not only was it informative, but we saw more sights compared to just walking.  Hey, we had limited time so it helped a lot!  Enjoy your time at San Antonio River Walk and drink responsibly!

reviews.author: Rocky R.
reviews.description: We visited San Antonio. Texas and the RiverWalk is one of the premier things to go see there. It is located in downtown San Antonio and goes on throughout downtown. It is on the lower level of the city street and can't be missed. There are entrances and exits for the Riverwalk throughout town. It stretches on for quite aways. There are a number of bars, outdoor dining restaurants, shops, hotels, apartment complexes. It was during Christmas, so the RiverWalk was lite up and very festive.  It was very clean and well kept and had security throughout.  I would recommend this as part of the trip to San Antonio. It is must!

reviews.author: Chrissy C.
reviews.description: The River Walk is amazing! Not sure about parking as we parked at a meter close to the Alamo and walked over.  You need to experience the River Walk at different times. It's much less busy during the day. It was such a nice walk and we really enjoyed walking along the water while checking out all the restaurant options and shops. We got pretzels and had a nice rest at a German bar with seating outside.  You can take a River boat cruise that run up and down the River Walk. We didn't do the tour, but it was interesting hearing some of the stories as the boats passed us by throughout the day.  Later we came back at night and it was packed, but you could still walk around. All the outdoor seating was full of people eating and enjoying themselves. We made reservations and had a nice dinner near the Wedding tree.   I recommend making reservations.  There seemed to be a lot of seating up and down the River Walk. It's nice just to sit and people watch. We even saw the place Miss Congeniality was filmed, which we gleaned from a passing tour.  I love our canal in Indy, but the River Walk in San Antonio is amazing! I think it would be fun to stay at one of the many hotels on the River Walk for easy access.

reviews.author: Yvonne M.
reviews.description: It's not what I remember.  It's trendy.  I went 20 years ago and then 10 years ago to the river walk.  We tried to go as a family with two kids this evening about 5pm and that was not like I remember with the crowds.  The river walk is extremely over crowded and not good for families in the evenings.  Every place we tried to eat at had a two hour wait time minimum.  The idea is wonderful.  The reality with a family now, is a nightmare.  I don't know what I was thinking.  Not good for small/grade school age at night.  I will say the Pizzarita's restaurant above the river walk saved our asses for dinner and the long wait times.  We will attempt a carriage ride.  More to come....  Yellow rose horse rides a must!  Great for kids and helps to avoid the crowds of the river walk!  The life right above the river walk is where the real fun for families is!

reviews.author: Art D.
reviews.description: We had a great time. Everything was open, people were out and about and everyone was having  great time. We walked around on the river walk and on the streets above. It was a great time. No one was wearing a mask as a side note. For eye candy. Yes there is plenty of eye candy for the young and the seasoned folks.

reviews.author: Nycole R.
reviews.description: When I was planning a trip to San Antonio, everyone I talked to mentioned the River Walk-I knew this was a destination not to be missed. The 20-something mile winding river is surrounded by fun local restaurants as well as shopping. It is well maintained with plants, trees and flowers-I noticed several maintenance boats floating the river early in the morning carrying gardening supplies. This may be a future career aspiration of mine.  If you don't prefer crowds, morning is the best time to visit. I noticed that the attendance started picking up around lunch time and got busier as the day went on. But 9:30 in the morning? Very few people in sight.  The food options are great-lots to choose from, and every place we went had patio dining available. What's more romantic than eating on the water? Well, taking the boat tour would be, although we skipped that due to other plans.  If you're in town, it's well worth a visit to a least walk a few blocks down below the hustle and bustle of the main streets to the beautiful river walk area.

reviews.author: Phil H.
reviews.description: I love walking the Riverwalk, especially at night.  Been here a bunch of times either on biz trips or when visiting family who live here.   Always a fun walk with so many bars and places to eat. From cheap joints to upscale spots. One of my faves to dine at is Beaudro's which has terrific guacamole. A fun spot to drink is Durty Nellie's for its piano bar atmosphere.  You can also charter a dinner cruise down the river. See live entertainment. Shop. Lots to see and do. Or just enjoy a stroll at night when it's all lit up. Can get pretty crowded and touristy.

name: The Lion and Rose British Restaurant and Pub
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Hawk S.
reviews.description: Steak was really good and the burger my girl friend got was the juiciest burger I've ever had. It amazes me this place only has 3 stars. We ordered another order of queso  for the fries because the cheese was so good. I'd definitely recommend this place for a try out.

reviews.author: Kimberley C.
reviews.description: -French Onion Soup 3/10 not the right flavor. Was not pleased with it. -Mac and Cheese 8/10 very cheesy!! It doesn't just taste like a baked wet noodle.  -Beer Battered Mushrooms 10/10 can't go wrong with fried anything. Mushrooms in the dipping sauces was great. -Crème brûlée cheesecake 10/10 crème brûlée flavor and cheesecake texture. Caramelizad sugar on the outsides made it amazing. Went back to get another slice a few days later! -My bf got a sampler platter with fish fry and bangers and mash. He really enjoyed the tartar sauce. They made it homemade and is not your typical tartar sauce.

reviews.author: Lacey V.
reviews.description: My husband and I went here for drinks tonight for the first time.   We arrived between 7:30 and 8:00 on a Saturday which can be busy. There was a bartender and a bar-back working plus a few other employees in the bar area.   We found a couple seats at the bar and a friendly manager greeted us, and got us waters and menus. A little while later another manager took our drink orders and prepared them. We decided to order an appetizer to share and a waitress took our order. She was friendly and knowledgeable. That was the only time I saw her behind the bar so I don't believe she was a bartender tonight.   After a while it seemed like a long time to wait for fries, so we asked the same manager who made our drinks if she could check on them. Shortly afterwards she brought them out, they weren't exactly how we had ordered them but they tasted good.   My husband finished his drink and set it toward the inner edge of the bar with his straw wrapper in it. The bar back and bartender passed us many times without acknowledging his empty drink or even making eye contact.   Finally when the manager walked through again she made my husband another drink.   We decided to get the check because and had to flag down the bar back. He told us our total and ran our card. I asked to see our receipt because the total seemed off. Apparently getting a printed check is difficult because he had to ask the bartender and she had to ask the manager. The total was off because they comped our appetizer since it had never been rung in.   During our entire experience, the bartender and bar back never spoke to us, made eye contact, or acknowledged us in any way until we had to request our check. We could see them talking and chatting with other guests though. They served guests to our right and left but just walked past us every time. They didn't seem to be in the weeds or overwhelmed.   I appreciated the service from the managers and that they comped the appetizer without us saying anything about it.   Next time we go out at the Rim, we'll head to a different bar.

reviews.author: Raed M.
reviews.description: Thank god they closed. Towards the end they really started serving microwaved food. Can't wait to see what will replace them!

reviews.author: Carin S.
reviews.description: I just adore this place. Service is wonderful, beer flights, with a great selection.  Food is delicious, fish's and chips are the bomb.

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: Had a great time as always. "Amy" was my waitress and she was very down to earth and genuine. It has been awhile so I needed some help with making some selections and decisions, and Amy helped out a lot and made the visit very enjoyable. She looked very good in the uniform. I ordered the "Sliders" and they were delish. I also found out that they have a poker league on Monday nights. I cannot wait to give it a try. Keep in mind this place can be alil pricey...but worth it.

reviews.author: Derrick S.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I went to the Lion and Rose this week on her recommendation. The service was excellent and the staff should be commended. We split some chips and beer cheese, which tasted off and lacked in flavor. We also split a Shepard's Pie, which was unremarkable, but fine.  The one star review is because we both got food poisoning from our meal. Needless to say, this was not the same Lion and Rose she remembered.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: We were really excited to check this place out since we heard such good things about it, but we're highly disappointed. The fish was flavorless, oily, and pretty much crumbled when we went to eat it. It was also incredibly overpriced for 16.99 and you barely got any "chips". At first glance, you wouldn't even realize that there were any in the bottom of the container. The coleslaw had no dressing/ flavoring on it and the sauce it came with ended up just being ketchup.  The shepherds pie was the saving grace, it was hot and flavorful to say the least. The green beans were also okay, they were cold and had zero flavor.  The staff was friendly though so that's great. Maybe we just went on an off day, hopefully it will be better next time we decide to try in the future.

reviews.author: Edward O.
reviews.description: I'm pleasantly surprised. I arrived and asked for a seat at the bar. While here their newly hired waitress/bar tender Mary was very professional and continued to check on me. The bar tender"Larry" made me an old fashioned without a cherry or orange but it was a nice flavored old fashioned! I ordered two of them. Then ordered the vegetable curry. Loved the spice and smooth flavors that combined with the old fashioned.  TVs were silent and music played a nice mix of pop and rock. I'll be bacj!

reviews.author: Brian D.
reviews.description: Service this evening was abhorrent. It was as if they didn't want our business. We took a table in the back room and no wait staff ever arrived. We went to the bar to get drinks where we were ignored by 5+ bartenders for over 10 minutes. The music was way too loud to even converse and no one was dancing, so what's the point? We then moved out to the patio where we were ignored by 3 waitresses in cowboy attire. I wouldn't go back there again if they paid me.

reviews.author: Vera R.
reviews.description: We came here for lunch today and I liked the ambiance of the place . The interiors were tastefully designed and the food was pretty good . Although we  did choose to dine outdoors due to COVID .  My husband ordered the Reuben sandwich which was very tasty  while I ordered the Fish and chips which was so similar to the fish and chips I had in Australia several  years ago when I was there on vacation . They were fresh and tasted so good . We will surely come back in the near future as we live nearby .

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: We took a chance at this bar, and I am SO glad we did! This bar took me back to my college years!! The crowd was a great mixture of ages and races and I LOVED every bit about that! I am ALL about diversity. We went on a Friday night and they had a live DJ. They even have a small space to dance (which we totally did) and people eagerly followed because the music was awesome. Despite the amount of people (it was totally packed), the service was great. The staff was friendly and very attentive. We ordered the fish and chips, tuna melt, and ham and cheese sandwich. The plates are huge and can definitely be shared. The ham and cheese comes with mayonnaise and it wasn't advertised on the description, so I would just make sure to ask what sauces are on each plate before ordering. The food was better than the average pub food. We also found ourselves here during the day. The scene was completely different. It was very calm, they had no DJ, and there were way less people. They had all the TVs showing March Madness, and tennis, and the service again was great. The only issue I had was they ran out of a lot of things. One friend tried to order three different ciders on our Friday night visit, and they had run out of all of them. On our day time visit, they also were out of several liquors. I still recommend this place. If you're looking for a fun night with great music, but don't want to get overly dressed up, this is your spot! If you want a daytime chill place to watch sports, this is your place also.

reviews.author: Justin F.
reviews.description: Absolutely not the same place I came to years ago. Bartender doesn't know how to bartend and has the worst attitude. You probably shouldn't talk about a customer to another waitress when that customer is right by you.

reviews.author: Paulina S.
reviews.description: I love coming to Lion and the rose! I literally sometimes come just to have dinner. I'm really disappointed tho because I came again for dinner tonight and the french fries changed and I'm not liking the new ones. Please keep the chicken diablo bites and the fried mushrooms!!! They are beyond my favorite and what I come to dinner for. I would also love it if they added the fried mushrooms to the late night menu please!!! Please bring back the other fries and we will be golden. I also love that they added Truly wild berry on tap! WOW!!! and the manager Omar is so awesome and friendly.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: I had the Black and Bleu Cheese Burger with their great onion rings. Elizabeth andElizabeth made our dining experience

reviews.author: Adrian G.
reviews.description: This place is a must stop! The staff has great hospitality all the round. Sarah is a great manager that has it all together. Definitely will come back. I'm from LA and it feels like home

reviews.author: Keith K.
reviews.description: Great oasis in a dry land! This is code for a great place to hide from the dedicated shopper who dragged you shopping with them. Seriously, this is a fun place to relax and have a cold drink. I could spend a lot of time in this place. I am sure I will the next time I'm in the area. Cheers!

reviews.author: Tyler H.
reviews.description: Worst place ever, just makes me miss the old lion and roses around town, granted all the servers are fairly new and being trained but if you wanna get told your breathe smells bad by the hostess then go here, timing, food and service is trash. Mainly the service. So unless you're some executive or divorce attorney that has money to throw at the girls, and you'd just like a beer and fish n chips? Don't go, save your time and money. Hated this place.

reviews.author: Cassity L.
reviews.description: We came in person to eat. They stop serving food at 11. We came in around 10:20 and told them we wanted to eat. It's as if the host told our waitress not to help us, so the kitchen wouldn't be upset. A manager came and spoke with us and another server to say they'd get us help and stilly en minutes later, NOTHING. No one helped us until 10:50 and then they said it was too late to order food. What kinda general manager walks by a table that hasn't been helped and never returns?????? The girls are cute, if they're lazy, okay whatever at least their cute, but this 40 Something year old man brings nothing to the company, but service and problem solving, AND FAILED. It seemed like he was drinking with a guest as well! They really failed!

reviews.author: Nikkie S.
reviews.description: I came for the Scotch egg and it was very good.  The sausage had a lot of flavor and the breading was cooked to a nice golden brown. I also enjoyed the sauces provided on the side.  We also had the Shepherds Pie, which had a nice flavor.  The Bangers and Mash was okay with the best part being the mashed potatoes.  For dessert we had the toffee pudding.  That was a huge disappointment.  It was far too sweet and could have used nuts or something to break up the sweetness.  The worst part is my husband and I were sharing it, so you can imagine my surprise when I am about to complain how cold it is he says it's burning his mouth.  Sure enough his side was scorching hot.  I guess they microwaved it unevenly.  I don't ever order dessert, so I was disappointed.  A lot of the beers we wanted were out.  I ordered a flight and it sits on a circular carrier, so the girl didn't know which was which.  She was pleasant enough, so I wasn't too put out.   My real issue with this place was the ambiance.  It was late evening, but very bright inside.  Everything felt sticky and the staff uniforms were tacky.  We felt this place seemed more like a chain restaurant (which we avoid) than a hip place at the Rim.  There are better choices.

reviews.author: Elise W.
reviews.description: Amazing pizza and service!   Came here for my birthday dinner and ordered the Margherita pizza. Fresh basil, fresh dough, amazing sauce!!  Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Patricia P.
reviews.description: Pretty great pizza but pricey.  I really enjoyed my meat lover's pizza but at  $20 plus dollars for 6 slices,  I don't know....??!!!??  If you are not concerned about the price...this is the place for you.  Good quality meats, fresh dough....just don't expect a big pie.    Service was not the Best but the pizza  was great just expensive.

reviews.author: Joy N.
reviews.description: This was an impromptu lunch date, and the second time we've visited Dough; it did not disappoint. The place was fairly empty, and our server (didn't catch his name and no name tag) was super attentive and helpful with explaining some items on the menu.   I tried the Dough's Frizzante Dolce, and it was good but (IMO) not worth the $15 price tag. The house made Italian sodas were good as well, especially the strawberry. My arugula salad was EVERYTHING, and my hubby enjoyed his Caprese salad. We ordered the Amore Di Maiale (Pork Love) and Dough's Margherita pizzas (not the Vera Margherita), and both were delicious especially after we combined some of the toppings from the Amore Di Maiale to the Dough's Margherita. This will probably be our "go to" pizza spot whenever we're visiting San Antonio.  Keep up the great jobs guys!

reviews.author: Darlene R.
reviews.description: I always forget about Dough because of its low profile location but enjoy it whenever I visit. The pizza is fantastic. Such a light, crispy crust and the toppings are fantastic. I always think "there's no way I can eat this whole thing" then down the hatch it goes. It was so funny that our table neighbors ogled our meals just as we had stared down those next to us. Everything is a feast for the eyes. We didn't have the burrata because it seemed like too much food but our table neighbors raved about it. Only downside was been seated near front door where the cold air rushed in. Great place for dates or families with well behaved kids. It's too small for crying babies or screaming toddlers. Sorry parents, get take out. We've all had to make that sacrifice . Enjoy your visit to Dough.

reviews.author: Sherry B.
reviews.description: Terrific upscale pizza. Wonderful wines. Busy yet not noisy. Waiters friendly and attentive. Pizza was wonderful!

reviews.author: Olga B.
reviews.description: We were showing my Mom the downtown area and wanted pizza, so I did some research and came across this place. Apparently they were featured on Food Network! It was around 2:30 pm on a Tuesday and we had a short 15 minute wait drinking wine at the bar. The place is super cute and swanky. We got the burrata with prosciutto and salami for an appetizer, then their prosciutto crudo pizza and pizza with its house-made sausage. Everything was super fresh and delicious along with great service! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Veronica Pagán B.
reviews.description: What can I say. What other words can I utter from my mouth that would surpass absolute perfection, nearly divinity, taste bud tantalizing, maddening obsession for more . . . I CAN-NOT get enough of Dough. It's too much for me. I obsess over my next visit. I have eaten here many many times over the past few years and they never disappoint. They never strike out. The day they do I'm going to cry!  This last time we tried many new menu items and they were all delicious! The warm creamy ricotta smeared on crostini was the fluffy little cheese spread you never knew you needed so much in your life! And with honey?? OMG! My mouth waters every time I think of it!  And the oak roasted olives made no sense. I never knew I was missing the experience of eating super hot, oily olives. They do have the pit so don't just jump into it, but if you have any sense you will put it in your mouth, remove the pit, and when all you have is olive, pair it with a bite of crostini with the warm ricotta spread and you will experience something amazing.  The B.T.B. Pizza (Black Truffle Burrata) was exceptional. Take a pice, spread the burrata all over it, drizzle some of that hot oil from the olives, then pass out. When you awake, repeat until full. I can't even look at these pictures without experiencing it all over again!  Our bucatini came out undercooked the first time, but we informed our waiter (who was fabulous, by the way) and he had them make us a whole new plateful. It was perfect the second time around. The noodles needed to be cooked a few minutes longer and they were. The sauce was delicious, and for the mishap, they took it off our bill. Absolute excellent service. We were so happy with the meal we didn't even care. But it was a very kind gesture.   So visit Dough, they will not disappoint! In all the years I've been eating here I have yet to have a bad experience. I just wish they still had the maple cake with pumpkin seeds! And the panna cotta! PLEASE???!!!

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Superb!!!!! I just so happened to be watching Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and it had this restaurant on the show. All the food looked so amazing so I decided to look up the restaurant and couldn't believe I've never heard about this spot. I would definitely classify this place as a hidden gem. There are 2 locations, one downtown and the other off 410/Blanco (the one I went to).   I decided to get the Fontina (Creamy fontina, Extra virgin olive oil, fire roasted onions, oak roasted mushrooms, and balsamic drizzled over it). Hands down, the best pizza I have had in the Inited States. It truly felt like I was in Italy all over again. Phenomenal food and bold tastes.   If you need a pizza fix or better yet an Italian fix.....GO HERE! It is worth it.

reviews.author: Nanda K.
reviews.description: Me and my wife to this joint to celebrate one of our days. We tried a lot of things which was new and expensive.  Burrata Tre Colore - it was nice and good. My wife did not enjoy it much but I liked it. I would rate 4/5  Calabrian Wings - 1.5/5 I don't recommend this to anyone. Not that great and tasty  12" Small Margherita Pizza - we enjoyed this the most. Almost 4.5/5 would be our rating.  12" Small Fontina Pizza - 2/5 The pizza was not that great . I didn't like the taste of the pizza it felt sweeter in taste.  Tiramisu - 1/5 Not all good. It has more baileys in it than it is suppose to.   We don't mind spending money when we get good Food but we felt like we have overspend here with only 1 good pizza and burratas.

reviews.author: Carly K.
reviews.description: Got the pork love. Again. Never disappoints. Added mushrooms this time. Really hit the spot.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Yummy really good food highly recommended  They have good customer service and the wait time is super short

reviews.author: Sa_Ev N.
reviews.description: Heavenly options and never disappointed! From the complimentary bruschetta, to the wine, salad and pizza---all is divine! The service? They rock! From the pizza kitchen to the wait staff- superb!

reviews.author: Mitch C.
reviews.description: I rarely, almost never post negative reviews, but Dough has been really excellent in the past, so my experience this weekend was sadly disappointing. First, our burrata was not good, with an overwhelming taste of heavy cream - almost like you were drinking an entire glass of it straight. Absolutely no mozzarella flavor whatsoever. It was also quite overpriced at $25. We also ordered an accompaniment of wild boar meatballs. They were quite undercooked and chewy - almost raw - then excessively seasoned with massive garlic. Love garlic and love rare steak- but not in this combination which failed. Wild Boar is not something you want to undercook... Next was the pizza. Sauce was good as were toppings, however the crust was completely off, chewy, not in a good way - with no crunch or crustiness - almost soggy in consistency. Very inferior to a Mod's or Grimaldi pizza crust. Did have a glass of red wine which was good, but at 5 star restaurant prices of $13 for 6 oz. I'm sure that paid for the bottle. Overall damage was $120 for two - with two appetizers and two pizzas. At $60, I would still have been disappointed. I realize it's difficult to sustain excellence forever, but I would avoid this location going forward. Super disappointed! (Service was good).

reviews.author: April R.
reviews.description: We really really looked forward to coming to Dough. We actually decided that we wanted it to be the place that we celebrated our 20th anniversary at. They were closed on the actual day but we waited and celebrated on a Wednesday when they did open. The waitress was very pleasant and we ordered the burrata which we were so excited for! It was just ok, the balsamic reduction was like molasses on the plate. You literally had to scrape it to get anything and the crostini was paper thin like we got the leftovers of the bread. The burrata honestly had a sour milk taste that was undesirable. The plate was ok. We ordered the days special and another pie, I don't like the taste of bell peppers and especially green bellpeppers. When our server came out it had them everywhere. We asked for a reorder and she said of course but when she came back said the chef asked if we could just take the peppers off ourselves bc they are in a can pre mixed. I told her no and cancelled that order but if your paying 22-29 for pizza you should be able to get it how you want it. We had a few errands to Run afterwards but that was cut short after a bit bc of us getting upset stomach's shortly after for the night and next day. I really wish the experience had been better bc we've wanted to try for forever.

reviews.author: Stormy W.
reviews.description: First visit. Great spot! Nice selection of apps and entrées. Drinks were delicious. Our server was on point and attentive. Prices are reasonable. Looking forward to the next visit to try something different. Would recommend.

reviews.author: Sheila E.
reviews.description: Came to dinner for Mother's Day date night.  Our waitress Juliette and another waiter (shadowing) were very attentive and answered questions we had and made recommendations.   The wings, pizza and desert were so good and we will be back.

reviews.author: Todd K.
reviews.description: Great place. A must if you're in north SA. Mozzarella is made fresh every day. Can be a long wait so be prepared for it.

reviews.author: jim h.
reviews.description: It's good. I like it. Get pizza here. You will too. Yum yum for my tum tum. You know, because it's good. Wish we could get one in Selma or Schertz.

reviews.author: shamrock B.
reviews.description: Came for pizza told us 45 - 1hr min wait no prob. Asked for bottle wine since it was half off.  Was told manger was too busy and NO with basic a hole attitude.  Just left. What can I say treated liked crap went elsewhere thank you Grimaldi's (Nicole a Sweetheart).    Management get a clue, get organized and teach your staff (hostess) how to speak to customers who are just trying to spend money.

reviews.author: Allison S.
reviews.description: I first learned about Dough from watching either Triple D or Triple G on Food Network and when I learned it was in San Antonio, I knew I had to go. I turned in my final portfolio of graduate school, so I decided to celebrate with some post-portfolio pizza.   The restaurant location is very inviting and has indoor and outdoor seating. I got there around 6pm on a Wednesday and many larger parties had to wait some, so plan accordingly. Additionally, I am not sure if this is every Wednesday, but there were half off certain wines and spirits.   As for my dinner, I appreciated that the virtual menu indicated which dishes had been featured on Food Network, which made my search all the more easy. I decided on a small (12 inch) Pork Love. It was DELICIOUS and the perfect amount for one person. The mozzarella cheese was the ooey-gooey you hope and dream for, while the plethora of pork added the perfect amount of savory and salty. The soppressata salami and speck elevated the dish to *chef's kiss* level and the spicy pork sausage rounded out the dish with a little amount of heat.    I will say my crust had a little more char than I care for and the plethora of pork weighed the slice down some, so I had to break out my trusty fork for assistance. However, these were easily overlooked issues because the taste was well worth it. Lastly, leftovers ate well.   Can't wait to visit again!

name: Yard House
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Amy M.
reviews.description: Judith was awesome. Great recommendations and very attentive.  Great service I would highly recommend anyone going to Kona grill.

reviews.author: Tina B.
reviews.description: Look around in a restaurant. Is everyone happy and chatting and smiling?   This would be just that very place!  It is a chain, but you know what?  The personal and friendly service from hostess and server sets this one apart from the rest!   The food menu is extensive and there is also a nice kids menu. Everything is made from scratch and is good, the kitchen looks clean and efficient.  Beers?  Just wow.  There is an entire cooler room with windows.  The supply tracks go from this room and across the ceiling and to the countless tappers.  Get a tall!   Oh!  Love LOVE the throwback music videos and music.   I say more?

reviews.author: Tammy-Sue K.
reviews.description: It was a bit of a slow start but their recovery was spot on. Yard House is one of those places you can usually count on for a solid experience. After a few stumbles, the wings were crispy and hot and at the end of the day that's all I wanted.  I don't come to this location often anymore. The service is unapologetically and consistently slow and honestly unfriendly at the bar. That bothers me. Everyone's allowed an off day but there was a span in 2021 where they just couldn't get it together. I walk in every restaurant making my vibe clear "I'm happy, I'm hungry and I'm ready to go with the flow" but they just aren't very personable so I just quit going. I'll probably give them another try one day soon. Hopefully I can upgrade this review because it's bumming me out. Ironically, that's why I stopped going to this Yardhouse ....... they were too.

reviews.author: Jackie N.
reviews.description: Been here 3 times in the last 2 weeks because it's just that good! Also, the service is 5 stars!  Since my partner and i started going, we've been treated with the best service especially from our recent waitress, Jackie!  She was very attentive, gave us refills throughout the service, and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of.  Recently, I had their new avocado chicken sandwich which was amazing! It's a little messy, but has so much flavor. My partner always orders the boneless wings with a side of their truffle fries (which are also amazing!). We've also had their house margarita which is mixed with a very nice balance. Not too strong but also not too light, it's just right. Lastly, one of my favorite sides is the mac and cheese. It's so fresh, and full of flavor.   Overall, the establishment is very clean, and we haven't had to wait the times we've there. We always get seated very quickly! 10/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: I was visiting San Antonio for the weekend and was in the mood for a quick bite to eat in between an event. I decided to try Yard House since I have never been to the chain. The restaurant has lots of bar and table seating and could be a good place for a large party. Unfortunately, my experience wasn't what I had hoped it would be. The service was inattentive and the food was not what I was expecting. Many of their items on the menu were not being served and it took us a while to get our food.

reviews.author: Tyler Y.
reviews.description: Large patio and attentive service, it was busy on a Friday night but there wasn't any wait. A fair amount of regional beers, but the main beer list is pretty uninspiring. This was my first time at a Yard House in a few years and I must say that I was impressed with the food menu updates. I ordered the Korean BBQ cheesesteak which was a great combo of sweet, salty, and a slight spice. I would have liked a little more kimchee, but it was still very good. My friends ordered the poke nachos and a burger which were both delicious.

reviews.author: Heidi M.
reviews.description: Good food, decent drinks, attentive service and an overall great atmosphere.  I really enjoyed the poke salad and the firecracker shrimp.  The area tends to be very busy during the evening hours, so highly recommend making a reservation ahead of time.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Other than receiving late service as I was sat down twenty minutes before anyone came to our table, my party and I had a great time. Great drinks, good conversation, tasty entrées, and refreshing atmosphere.

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: After having an extensive tour of UTSA for my daughter the senior, we opted to have a casual meal at the Rim! The restaurant was packed, but we were seated by the bar in a reasonable time. The dining room was loud but was filled with patrons enjoying the music and the games on TV.        Our party of 6 ordered club sandwiches, salads and edamame. My daughter's double decker BLT was savory. My wife's salad was filled with various vegetables and was very good. My turkey club was flavorful but had soggy bread. The bread should have been toasted to help keep the integrity of the sandwich.  Otherwise, the meal was appropriate for the atmosphere and was quite filling and flavorful.       Ultimately, this establishment is casual, fun and worthy of a visit when you are by UTSA!

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: Last night was a 5-star experience. It was a slower weeknight so we got seated right away outside. The weather was a bit rainy but we enjoyed sitting outside on the patio where there is an amazing view to people watch and look at the game on tv.  There is something for everyone here and I mean everyone: pescatarian, meat eaters, pizza lovers, vegetarians, vegans, beer lovers... the menu is huge!  I ordered the blackened tuna sashimi and the garlic noodle appetizers as dinner. My husband ordered the fish sandwich. What was advertised vs what was presented was spot on. Presentation, taste, wait time all perfect.   Check out the salted watermelon margarita watermelon  and the smoky old fashioned! Delicious and unique.  Great weekday dinner experience.

reviews.author: Lane B.
reviews.description: Just WOW. This place ... some of the best food my wife and I have ever devoured. The flavors, the texture, the cook is just SPOT ON. This is a must come place. Our Waitress Kaitlyn was one of the best and even got us a free cake for it being our first time. I mean just heavenly doesn't even describe this place. Do yourself a favor and go!

reviews.author: Frances T.
reviews.description: Yard house has a variety of foods and drinks. We had wings and pizza. Flavor was pretty decent. We sat in the patio area which was well lit and comfortable. The service was ok, we went on a Saturday so I expected it to be a little busy. I did enjoy my time here and was satisfied with the food and drinks.

reviews.author: Zana K.
reviews.description: Yard house never fails!! Our group of 6 got seated right away and our server was very friendly and had great energy.   I ordered the magic margarita and Hawaiian mule. That margarita was indeed "magical" as it changes colors!   We ordered the onion tower for an appetizer and it was hot and crunchy and came with 2 sauces. Everything was delicious! I got a BBQ chicken pizza and my friends got wings. We came for happy hour so select appetizers and pizzas were half off and drinks were $2 off!   We had a great time and i would definitely recommend coming here for a night out with friends or a lil date!

reviews.author: Victor R.
reviews.description: It was an amazing experience at Yardhouse! We  opted for outdoor seating and the view and the warm heaters made it very much worth it. We tried the Nashville Hot Chicken and the new Korean Sandwich. These are a MUST try. The Nashville chicken is crispy, well prepared, and not overwhelmingly hot. The korean sandwich had an amazing tasting bread and some pretty good beef. I enjoyed every bit. The chicken lettuce wrap appetizer is a must try also, although I felt it was kind of on my small side for the price.

reviews.author: Danielle A.
reviews.description: Early evening the website said no wait time.  Walked in with a party of 7. Boy behind register was rude and condescending when he said online waitlist was for normal sized parties and our wait time would be one hour. Left disappointed. I guess they don't want our money. I'd rather pay for parking at river center location as they treat you better. 2/27/2022  Having a large party, the wait wasn't the issue. It was the condescending tone.

reviews.author: Jacqueline J.
reviews.description: Last weekend, my sister, nieces and I decided to stroll the streets of La Cantera and met up with a friend at the Yard House.  We were longing for a cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory, but refused to wait 2 hours for it.  My sister added our names to the Yard House waiting list and I snuck past the hostess and a line at the Cheesecake and walked my nieces to the dessert window.    We eyed the glass window and peeped at the colorful, fruity, Chocolate and Carmel renditions and lime creations of cheesecake, but eventually choose the 1650 calorie Oreo Cheesecake... Yep that's right I said 1650 (YOLO). The girls were excited with our selection and we strolled past the long line of Cheesecake Goers and were called into the Yard House within 10 minutes.   Paul (AKA Pablo) was our waiter. He explained the menu and brought the nieces some crayons and kiddie menus.  Once the little ones were taken care of, he focused his attention on taking care of us.  Within minutes our table had strawberry lemonade and water and orders into the kitchen. The place was packed, but the staff had Social Distancing in mind. Servers wore mask and I saw sanitary actions between guests. For our dining experience, we ordered the Fish and Chips, the Mac and cheese for the kiddos and the Hot Chicken with sweet potato pancakes.   The atmosphere was festive and the foodies seemed to be enjoying a beautiful day out at the mall. The managers at the Hostess station had on their game faces and kept the flow of foodies orderly and expedited. Or food was amazing and Paul kept the dishes cleared and the glasses full.  He didn't mind when the girls cracked open the cheesecake and kept us as his first concern. I would highly recommend the Fish and Chips as the Cod was fried to perfection. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and the cheesecake was a perfect end to our meal.  Even with COVID-19 still an issue, I felt safe, enjoyed my meal and appreciated the outing with the family.  Highly recommended ~ Ms. Foodie Aka Da Islandgal29412

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: Yard House was not as busy as we expected it to be for a Thursday night but we still opted to grab a couple of seats at the bar. I just ordered the Magic Margarita and not that it came out wrong, but it's just not my cup of tea. I'm going through a bourbon cocktail mood right now so that was just a bad call on my part.   Our bar snacks came out warm and delicious. The pretzel was warm and soft, so we didn't have to fight it. The calamari was a little over cooked but still good to munch on.

reviews.author: Milli M.
reviews.description: We just started coming here...and all bc it was close to our hotel room in Houston and we fell in love with the pokè nachos... we came to the yard house in SA and I was a lil disappointed at the portion of poke that is on the nachos, nothing like Houston. The taste is still great, the Korean beef appetizer is enough for a full meal, it's so good! The Korean tacos with vampire cheese tortilla was pretty tasty.. I enjoy the flavors of everything and the ambiance is real chill and we will definitely continue coming... I'll just ask for extra pokè on the side for my nachos

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Came here on a Monday night and sat at the bar. It was super busy for a Monday, but understandable during the holidays. Service was wonderful even though the bar staff were slammed. Everyone was super attentive and working hard so I really hope their management recognizes that work ethic. They also really know their beers. Super informative and helpful with the suggestions. We ordered the House IPA, Liquid Compass and Belgian White - all delicious! We also ordered the Firecracker Shrimp which came on this deep fried rice cake and it was soooo damn good. Like way better than I expected. It was like bang bang shrimp but with a cajun flavor but not too much cajun, idk, just order it. For entrees we got the Poke Nachos (over rice, per our server's suggestion) with the chips on the side and Spicy Jambalaya. Both were so, so good! The Poke Nachos were spicier than the Jambalaya, to me. It's probably the Serrano peppers but either way, delicious.

reviews.author: Jessica R.
reviews.description: We love this place for a date night or family dinner.  It's usually very busy, but we have been lucky to have great service!  I love the hot chicken and fries.  They give you two huge pieces of chicken.  The half yards hit the spot.  I recommend the cheese curds and truffle fries.  Food comes out freshly prepared and how requested.

name: The Sandbox
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: R J.
reviews.description: Best place to meet up with friends and have well made drinks and beer on tab. Pizza and other tasting meals available as well. Not to mention bottle vip service.

reviews.author: Sy B.
reviews.description: Overpriced drinks, crappy music, annoying crowd. Stay the f home or go elsewhere and save your money. Bouncers just mess with people and act tough, their behavior is deplorable. If u like crap music, bratty bartenders, overpriced drinks, annoying fat hoes yelling and annoying bouncers who randomly harass others, this is your place

reviews.author: Krystal C.
reviews.description: I have been wanting to stop in the Sandbox for awhile now. It was my friend's birthday and we stopped by to see what they had to offer. When walking in the door guy rushed to the door to welcome us in. (Don't know where he came from.) The seating was very spread out which was great. However, the only place we were recommended to sit, because no other seating was available inside, was by the corner of the DJ booth. The place seemed geared towards a young demographic (not that I'm ancient), it wasn't what I was expecting.   The service was great! The guy that took are order was very friendly, and attentive to what we wanted. The music was good but I could not hear my friend who was sitting right next to me. I had to lean into her ear so we could "talk." The beer on draft was good. The chips and queso order wasn't great- the c was very watery. Again, not what I was expecting.  If you are looking for a place to listen to music and not the company you're with this is the spot for you. Definitely, not what we were looking for.

reviews.author: Riki C.
reviews.description: Welp, the guy behind the bar instantly got onto one of us for not having my mask on and as we explained One had a medical condition.... he rudely said I don't care. You need a mask.  The bar is completely blocked off to seating by rope... but I guess "regulars" come in and they will open the rope to let them sit ...    Bad taste in your mouth instantly. But then we sit there and he wears his mask on his chin and starts making drinks. ...

reviews.author: Andrew T.
reviews.description: Please don't go here. You will be waiting in line and not get in. People cut in line that know bouncer, please go somewhere else. They just want to take your money. There are plenty of places to grab a drink and dance but this is not the place. It's not even five stars quality. They act like it's a Vegas club. Save your money and time. Bad service!!!!!

reviews.author: Ryan A.
reviews.description: I would give this place zero stars if I could. They harassed me and my entire group. The bouncer made the bartenders re-check our IDS and made us verify with our credit cards multiple times. Would not leave us alone and would not stop questioning us. Do not recommend. if you are trying to have a good time, don't go to this place

reviews.author: Haley M.
reviews.description: Sandbox is always such a fun time and amazing friendly staff. Good drinks and GREAT food. Try the pizza before the kitchen closes. Thank me later ;)

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Update to a my previous review.   One of their partners/managers/ employees (he didn't identify his position) reached out to me on my FB foodie page and left a defensive and dismissive comment.   They doubled down and called me a liar by stating i left untrue and invalid accounts of my visit and tried to insult me by stating I'm no Anthony Bourdain (there was only one, may he rest in peace).   Had they been cordial, apologized for the less than great experience, and invited me to return (without compensation, I'm not looking for anything free) then I would of praised them for reaching out and considered returning to give them another chance.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Drinks are nice and a nice regular crowd that shows up. The fact that security think they are fighting a war in the club is a problem. My friend and I got too friendly to where we started hugging and moving to the music which caused suspicion to the security of violence where they decided to grab my friend on the arm with force which caused me to question their involvement due to their street clothes dress code.
