Today not only did it taste nasty. It was NOT the same pizza from last weekend. I ordered same pizza and toppings. They left out the pepperoni and and all I got was a flat tasteless pizza. With wayyyyy too much cheese. The crust wasn't fluffy and light. It was flat and the pizza itself is dense and soggy. We go there for the great chicken wings, wedge salad with the Tri Tip and their yummy homemade sodas. I don't think we'll be frequenting anytime soon. Threw it out. They need to have some consistency with the way it's cooked and prepared. Really disappointed as the rest of the meal was pretty good.

reviews.author: Patsy B.
reviews.description: Wish I took pictures of the place. There were only about 2-3 tables taken with plenty of empty tables in between. They sat my husband and I in the back room where the staff was having a meeting. I thought it  was weird that they sat right next to their meeting, it was a little uncomfortable cause it felt like we were interrupting there meeting. Then they started to bring more costumers to that same room, I stood up thinking they were packed, but what we realized was that they were seating all Hispanics and blacks in the back. We ordered, ate, paid our bill. As we walked out we scanned the whole restaurant and saw that only whites were seating in the main room. That was unbelievable! I thought discriminating people for their color was over! I guess I was wrong. This needs to stop!

reviews.author: Ethan I.
reviews.description: I've been to this location a couple of times both times the food wasn't good.  I gave them one last chance today and ordered a BJ's special pizza Carrio. He said the order would be ready at 7:30. I waited almost 8 PM before finally getting my pizza, and it was cold and the crust was mushy... three strikes and you're out! We will not be returning to this location ever!

reviews.author: Joss L.
reviews.description: Order shown in the picture. This was my first time ordering this meal.  Recommendations/Review:  1. I would request the tri-tip with the BBQ sauce on the side; the sauce was a bit too salty for my taste, so I had to literally wipe it off with a napkin. I can't knock BJs for it, since there was an option to get the sauce on the side. ThT said, BBQ sauce shouldn't be THAT salty (my opinion, of course).  2. I ordered the salad without croutons, mine came with them. This is not a HUGE deal, since they're fairly easy to take out, but sticking to the order should be the goal.  3. The chicken was perfect!  4. The asparagus was tucked into a corner,  VERY soggy, and a little cold upon delivery. However, taste was spot on.  Note: I did NOT order this meal for "priority delivery" via Uber Eats; perhaps my meal would have been warmer had I opted for "priority" delivery. Do I dare say, though, I shouldn't have to order priority to get warm food. Knowing asparagus does NOT do well in the microwave, I still stuck it in for 25 seconds, not that into cool steak. To the favor of the restaurant, it WAS cold outside and, although I met the delivery person at the door (the food didn't sit outside), I'm sure the weather didn't make it easier to deliver a warm meal.  Ordered: Tri-tip and Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: I don't know why this place is even active in San Antonio. The quality of food is terrible. I've eaten at taco carts in Mexico where the meats were grilled off an old steel auto wheel. That was amazing. BJ's on the other hand is meant to people who can't taste. Well there you go. COVID has taken the taste and smell from the return customers here. That is the only explanation I can come up with. Plus the place was filthy AF. The Mexican taco cart was immaculate in comparison to this restaurant. One one thing that was on point was our server. I'm sure this cat knew how shitty it was to go eat here that he went above and beyond so that we wouldn't complain. Which we never do because I use to work I. The food service industry and the number one rule is don't F with people who Handel your food.   Bathrooms were disgusting as well. I've peed in back alleys at boys town in Mexico what were in better conditions than this bathroom here.

reviews.author: Dylan M.
reviews.description: My wife and I normally enjoy BJs, though usually at the Alamo ranch location with no problems. This location messed us up though. We each had a nutty brewnette to drink then ordered a spicy pig tavern cut pizza and the spicy peanut chicken soba noodles. Both of us had stomach cramps on the way home and found ourselves puking dinner back up 20 minutes later. We both shared the food so no idea which plate caused the problem.   We'll still go to the Alamo ranch location but the rim is out. Really too bad because the service from the bartenders was really great.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Enjoyed an evening dinner here. We ordered classic burgers with add-ons and ended our night with the Monkey-bread Pizookie. Overall, great.

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Had a really good lunch today.   The brisket on a bacon hickory hamburger ... he is in love with it. The sweet potato fries were cooked perfect and seasoned well.    I had the potstickers which had the crispy base and a dumpling sides. The sauce was really good.  I love the tomato mozzarella salad ... covered in olive oil and a balsamic glaze on a bed of arugula.    Service was spot on .. we sat at the bar. TV everywhere ... sports for days!

reviews.author: Mimi B.
reviews.description: We always love going there. I had the salmon and it was absolutely delicious!! The staff is always really nice and helpful.

reviews.author: J T.
reviews.description: Overall eating lunch here was a good experience. The kids had many items to choose from and the regular menu is large as well. I really dislike the digital menus, perhaps I should have asked for a regular one.  My club was excellent, however my fries came out after my sandwich. That was strange, I never have had that happen before. My beer was also on the warm side, I'm not sure if it sat on the bar for a while or their coolers are a bit warm.  I would eat here again, but I would probably go for a mixed drink or try a bottled beer.   The other items brought to our table looked excellent too, I tried the tomato-mozzarella salad, and have to say it was incredibly good.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I stopped by the other night just to grab a quick bite, we sat up the bar he had the nachos and I had the Aki tuna appetizer both of which were great, the bartender however was incredibly hard to find and was often was not behind the bar. It took 10 minutes to get a Moscow mule with that much else going on at the bar, being that we were just there to relax I wasn't super irritated but let's be honest the bartender was Mia 50% of the time we were at the bar sitting down. We got food to go which we found out when we got home that his order was wrong, asked for jalapeños on the his pizza and they put olives but jalapeños was on the ticket so definitely a kitchen error, overall I would order Togo from here again or do pick up.

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: My apologies up front for not taking any pictures.  I had the Ultimate Patron Margarita, the Tri Tip and Baby Back Ribs with Mashed Potatoes and the Mozzarella and Tomato salad.  I was not disappointed.  The food was excellent, the Margarita smooth and tasty.  Our server Chad did a great job.

reviews.author: Mike O.
reviews.description: Overall service was Slick.  I was there for a birthday party for this fine shorty named Ashley. The server kept us well hydrated and handed out some amazing pazookies. Our server sang beautifully and impressed the whole crowd. He needs a pay raise after that solo on god. It was the sound of angels and lemme just say it was music to my ears. He's literally James Charles.

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: Uber Eats took an hour to deliver because my driver had another order before mine and I could see her little car spinning on the app like she was having a wreck or something.   Anyway, the food arrived and yes it was good.   I love the deep dish veggie pizza. I just wish it was just out of the oven. It was still good if cold  but if I am going to be eating that much bread the carbs have to be worth it.   The queso dip with hatch green chilis and chips, good!  Fish and chips were delish, fish was fresh amd meaty, not just breading.    Ok BJ's you did good tonight but yall need to get a drone to bring me my food but please make sure the drone has one of those thermal containers to keep my food warm. Thank you BJ's.

reviews.author: Maegan B.
reviews.description: Went here for desert and was going to order the trio but the waiter suggested the 4 pan that wasn't on the menu and said he would let us know the price. It came with 12 scoops of ice cream which was overkill and was $27! The trio is half of the price and half the food, not sure why we were t explained the size and price. But over all the cookie was good and we ate about half. We got peanut butter which is good but would be better without the whole peanuts, cookies and cream, white chocolate macadamia and the sugar which was our favorite flavor

reviews.author: Rylee B.
reviews.description: Dr.Pepper was really good. If you are really thirsty it's gonna taste really good. The ice is okay if they had nugget ice it would be soo good. But I definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Jade M.
reviews.description: My partner and I are fans of BJ's Brewhouse and decided to eat here for date night. We requested a table outside but the hostess ignored our request and seated us indoors. Not a big deal, however, with COVID-19, I think it's important to honor a guest's request, especially if outdoor tables are available. She also could have let us know that it would be a wait if there weren't tables available. We saw that they had put in plexiglass between the booths and went ahead and sat down in the booth that was offered to us. Something that I did notice were that the tables were not spaced out 6 feet. If you were sitting at a table, you would be back to back with another party and wouldn't be 6 feet away from them.   Our meal was just okay - we ordered the prime rib that is on special on the weekends and a wings appetizer. The appetizer and main entree came out quickly, however, it took some time for our pizookie to arrive. We normally wouldn't order dessert but it came with the prime rib special, so why not? Our server seemed overwhelmed by the amount of tables he was given, however, we still received drink refills and our check in a timely manner. We noticed on our way out that there was a big crowd waiting to be seated and most patrons were not practicing social distancing. We won't be visiting again anytime soon, but I wanted to share my experience in case you were thinking of eating here.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Robert did great!! Came for a friends birthday and he was very kind and knew the menu well!

reviews.author: Leslie M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a delicious lunch today at the BOSTON. Our food was prepared just as we requested.  Our waiter, Joseph McFadden, was most excellent. He was there to get our drink order right when we were seated (and he was tending bar too!). He was quick with drink refills and checked on us very often. We were so impressed with how he tended a full bar (people seated at all of the bar stools) and an area of tables in the bar. He was very pleasant and made our lunch even more enjoyable.  Keep up the great work Joseph!

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: The flavors teas are mixed poorly and inconsistent waiters aren't very attentive order a salad and there was barely dressing had to ask for more

reviews.author: Alexis A.
reviews.description: I came here after a day of hiking. I'm not going to lie, BJ's wasn't my first choice of restaurant to go to at The Rim but I'm glad I went.  I went with a large group. We came here Sunday at 1, and many of the more popular restaurants at The Rim were over an hour wait time. BJ's was able to sit our party twelve immediately.  I like that BJ's has an extensive menu, so there is a little something for everyone. Since I just did a two hour hike I wanted to treat myself. I ended up getting the Fresh Atlantic Salmon (840 calories) and the BJ's Baked Beignet (630) calories. Both were good.  The service was pretty fast and the waiter did a good job managing a party of our size. There were 40 inch TVs round the restaurant for us to catch the NBA playoffs.

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: Located in The Rim shopping mall on I-10. Plenty of parking. Met a group there. We were seated in the back. It was not so loud that we couldn't hear.   I ordered the tri tip sliders.  They were pretty decent. There could have been a bit more meat and I would have liked them better if the buns were warm. The french fries had good seasoning and were served warm, not hot. Our server did a good job keeping up with 9 at our table.

reviews.author: Lance S.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch. Had never been for lunch before so was interested in trying their lunch menu. So the daily specials we were used to for dinner on certain days are only for dinner, so don't go for lunch hoping to get the ribs on Thursday.   I decided to try the Meat Lovers Piadina, comes with pepperoni, Italian sausage, meatballs, basil and their cheese blend. The waitress explained it as the topping wrapped up in the thin crust, so in my head I'm thinking like a calzone. It comes and it's literally the crust folded over the toppings like a crispy panini. First thought, this is different. Comes with a ramekin of marinara sauce to tip into. First bite, wow. The crispness of the crust and the seasoning of the marinara inside with the toppings, just wow. Loved it! Was torn between this one and the chicken bacon ranch, and I bet that would've been just a great!  Wife got the half California club flatbread and a house salad. Crust was just a amazing and the toppings were fresh! Avocado on top was the perfect green and the tomatoes were just right!

name: North Italia - San Antonio
accommodations: Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Jackie M.
reviews.description: Since they opened, this has become one of our favorite places to celebrate any occasion. It's a beautiful restaurant with indoor and outdoor accommodations. The staff always has EXCEPTIONAL service from the hostesses to the waitresses.  They're always so friendly and accommodating, even with my two year old toddler.   Besides service and atmosphere, their food is delicious. The bolognese dish and their scallops are my favorites. I always order a glass of Julietta to complete my meal.

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: ITALIAN BUTTER CAKE! That's it, that's the whole 5-star rating.   But incase you need more convincing for dining at North Italia I'll add more details. Came in for brunch and totally nixed the brunch food. I headed straight for a hard cocktail and pizza (the love of my life). For the cocktail I ordered the Sicilian margarita and it was very citrus-y, like lip puckering but in a good way because I ordered another round. Lil Mama likes a good margarita.   For my meal I ordered the margherita pizza. I was very thrilled to know it's basically their cheese pizza. It came with red sauce and cheese which was all I wanted. The crust was just right, not too crispy, they even had a lil salt on it because it was salty but paired well with the margarita. Lastly I treated myself to the Italian butter cake-oh what a treat!! Like it's one of those on death row what you want your last meal to be? Serve me up some butter cake.   Outside patio was a great seating option. It was a lil chilly at first so they had the heaters on but as the day warmed up they cut the heaters off and opened up some of the Sun screen to let the air in. Service was attentive and respectful. Overall great experience.

reviews.author: Patricia P.
reviews.description: They served us burnt pizza.  We should had sent it back but had already waited a while and needed to be out by certain time.   .  Overall not the best experience for dinner but oh well......life goes on.    Please do not serve pizza like this.  Burnt pizza does not taste good .  Pizza parmigiana was ok.  For a quick dinner I would say it's 3/5.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: This place gets three stars for one reason. Service. I went here for brunch time on a Sunday. I sat with my guest at a table for two outside. There weren't too many people outside but it took forever to get any service. Took 15 minutes to order and get grilled bread and then another 15 min to order our entree. Once we finally got our food (which in my opinion was super good), took 30 min for our server to come back. My guest had asked for Parmesan and red pepper for her pizza and never got it. We also had to give our waiter our credit card without asking for the bill first because we had already been sitting there for 15 min after completing our meal.  The food is high quality so you also expect high quality service and it's just not there yet.

reviews.author: Priscilla T.
reviews.description: If you love delicious food then this place is it but if you dislike waiting a longggggggg time for your food then you better think twice.   My best friend and I stumbled across this place by chance and we're so excited to try it!   We started with a half order of caesar salad that came out pretty quick!   However, when it came to our food we waited a long time. I'm pretty patient and understanding when it comes to restaurants and how busy they can get but this took longer than usual.  I asked a server that happened to walk by to get a manager just to check on the status of our food because our server hadn't checked on us for about 15mins.   When they did finally get someone all the manager did was place the food on the table and walk away.  He did not once acknowledge us or the fact that we had been waiting so long. It was very rude.  Regardless I was hungry so we indulged and the food was delicious! It was luke warm which I'm sure was from the fact that it probably was sitting there before I got someone's attention but nonetheless I will give credit to the good food!   I wish our experience had been different because this place felt like it had it going on!

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: I got a sneak peak yesterday at North Italia at the RIM. The place is gorgeous! Super nice inside and a lovely patio for those wanting to eat outside when the sun isn't melting your face off.   The Glazed Short Rib Cavatelli is absolutely delicious. The short rib melts in your mouth and the cavatelli is mixed in a sauce of Parmesan cream and fresh horseradish sauce. ( FYI I loathe horseradish sauce and I only ordered it at the insistence of waitress who assured me it was so minimal, it wouldn't effect the dish). Very glad I listened! A must if you go here.   The Chicken pesto was fresh and was aesthetically pleasing! I personally thought the pesto was a little overpowering but my dinner date loved it!   The Chef's Board "charcuterie" was tasty and the Sicilian Margarita was great. I wasn't really a fan of the buttercream cake but others may enjoy! All in all, a nice addition to San Antonio's culinary scene. It opens up to the public on June 9th.

reviews.author: Allison K.
reviews.description: I'm not usually a fan of Italian restaurants, mainly because having eaten Italian food in Italy, I'm forever ruined on the Americanized  versions of this cuisine. North Italia may have just changed my opinion on that. Their food is absolutely beautiful in both flavor and appearance. I was completely blown away by their pasta. My husband ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, and I have to say that they are probably the best we have ever eaten stateside. The meatballs themselves were absolute perfection. And the sauce...I don't even know where to start. It was thick, rich and complex in flavor, and I haven't had anything that good in a very long time. I couldn't stop sneaking bites from his bowl it was so good! My meal was the diver scallops, and they were equally impressive. Seared beautifully and again, seasoned to perfection.  The service was fantastic and our server DC made sure we enjoyed every minute of our visit.  Highly recommend this restaurant!! For lack of a better word...YUM!!

reviews.author: Joe W.
reviews.description: I have been to multiple North Italias in Austin, so we were super happy to see this place in the Rim. The interior is always very beautiful, and you can tell it's high quality. The meatballs and garlic bread are both huge favorites. I've had the bolognese before, and this time I tried the spicy pasta. You honestly can't go wrong with any of their dishes, and the wait staff are super informative, so if you have a question, just ask them.

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Amazing dish! Fresh pasta. It would be nice if they added more amount of pasta to the dish. But taste is perfect!

reviews.author: Lorenzo M.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a pizza, salad or pasta. Very nice setting for a relaxed dinner with family or a fun time with friends. I highly recommend the mushroom pizza!

reviews.author: Anthony H.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday evening around 5pm. This was our first time dining here. They were pretty busy but we were seated right away. Ambiance is trendy. There were customers of all ages.   Service was good. Ordered the Arancini as an appetizer, per our server's recommendation. We found it a bit bland, wasn't that noteworthy. Ordered the spicy meatball pizza to share. I added crushed red pepper to mine and enjoyed it but my companion didn't add anything and didn't find it spicy on its own. Although not spectacular, I enjoyed the pizza but my companion didn't care for it that much and thought the crust was overdone.   The check came out to $90+ for an appetizer, 2 glasses of wine, and a pizza. Prices are steep but we're willing to give it another go.

reviews.author: Darlene R.
reviews.description: Great ambiance. Perfect for a date nite. A lot of dishes with pesto which are packed with flavor. I went with a group and everyone loved their food.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: This place has an amazing atmosphere. Romantic outdoor seating as well as tasteful indoor seating. The service was swift and our waitress was pleasant and upbeat. We had a delicious Skyfall Cab and started with the White Truffle Garlic Break. Let me just say this bread was AMAZING! We will definitely be ordering it each time we go. The chicken parmigiana was crisp and the breading was flavorful and it was paired with pasta coded in white Alfredo sauce. We will definitely be back to explore the rest of the menu. Great spot for a date night or just a night out with friends.

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to check this place out for sometime but hadn't had an opportunity until my granddaughter's 18th birthday. She picked it so why not?   Nice ambiance, can be romantic or seat a party of 14 like it did for us. There is no dress code but it's a nice place people make it special. It also has a nice patio outside for those of you who like that vibe.   The drinks were really good I tried the old fashion and would order it again. A ginger margarita and a sangria was also ordered - I forgot to take pictures before we started drinks but everyone said they would definitely order again.   For appetizers we tried the calamari and the white truffle garlic bread both were yummy. With the bread, don't forget to spread the butter with garlic truffle on each piece-not everyone at the table knew to do that.  I ordered the glazed short rib cavatelli it was delicious and the meat was really tender.  The spicy rigatoni vodka, chicken pesto, wagu skirt steak tagliata, chicken Parmesan, strozzapreti and the diver scallops were all ordered at our table and not one person was disappointed- I have to say I did try each one and now need to think about what I want to order when I come back because they were all so good!

reviews.author: Donna P.
reviews.description: I honestly wanted to like the food here, however it wasn't meant to be.   We ordered the #1 and #2 diners favorites listed on the Door Dash menu.   #1  My husband had the chicken parmigiana. It was burnt, dry and lacked flavor. Very little sauce on the chicken and zero sauce on the rigatoni - just boiled noodles.   #2  I ordered the bolognese. I wasn't as disappointed as my husband, but the sauce was as thick as chili and on the salty side.   The non-traditional tiramisu had crunchy chocolate balls on top - which was odd to me. Missed having lady fingers, but overall the flavor was good.  We spent $90 with service fees and tip. That was a lot to spend on what we received. The restaurant was quick to prepare, Door Dash was quick to pick up and drop off, so it had no barring on this situation.   I can see by the other reviews that great experiences are had here. We just weren't as lucky.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: First time visiting North Italia. I had been wanting to go for the longest time, and finally, I had my chance. It is located at the Rim, next to Lick ice cream and Luxor, Mediterranean food. Both added to my list of places to visit in the Rim.  I went to North Italia to meet a friend and we ordered a cesar salad and a pizza to share. Service was pretty good and the food came out fairly quickly. We ordered the Pig Pizza, which has sopressatta, pepperoni and Italian sausage. It was quite good and is a shareable size. I also liked that our waitress separated the salad into two separate bowls.   The pizza prize was $17, which I felt was reasonable, but the cesar salad at $12 was high for the portion. I also felt that the rest of the prices, especially for some of the pasta plates were extremely high. As an example, the Bolognese pasta was $20 dollars!   So, although the service and food pretty tasty, I don't know that I would return due to prices.

reviews.author: Lane B.
reviews.description: This experience was true definition of 5 stars. From the customer service to the vibe from the food to the taste, North Italia checked off everything. The environment was calming and light and as you walk in you feel and smell the Italian culture surround you. Our waiter was so laid back and did his job perfectly. The food proportions were absolutely on point. The wait was seem less and the food came out right as seemed it was supposed to. This a great place for a date night, as it was for my Wife and I. Take your friends, family and peers here and get ready for incredible experience!

reviews.author: Michael V.
reviews.description: First time here and would come back.  Excellent food and service.  Love the atmosphere open kitchen but not noises.  Love the cocktails and really nice outdoor seating.  Busy weekend so parking a little tough as so many restaurants.  The place was busy but our service was fast.  I do recommend you Ewy here.

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: The service couldn't have gotten any better.   My husband and I decided to try North while running some quick errands and we weren't disappointed. We were quickly welcomed and seated by the hostess and this is just a beautifully aesthetic restaurant and you can really tell the time they put into the details.   We had Monique and 2 trainees serving us today and they were thorough in walking us through the menu and taking our orders. We ordered everything they recommended - crispy calamari, white truffle garlic bread, their daily pizza and a chicken Cesar salad.   The calamari was light and really offset the white truffle garlic bread - which was super tasty and I love how they incorporated the truffle.  The daily pizza was an Italian sausage with red peppers and olives and paired perfectly with their Cesar salad.  There wasn't any room for dessert so we'll definitely be back for drinks and dessert.

reviews.author: Bert M.
reviews.description: Since we've moved here to San Antonio, finding good Italian places to eat at has been a struggle.   Well, no more! We have found "our place "! We did have reservations (highly recommend you have reservations as well) and were seated promptly. The young girls that greeted us were very cheerful and welcoming. Definitely the right people at the door!  Our waiter (forgot his name) was great, since it was our first visit, we went with his recommendations and he was spot on from the appetizer to main entrees. Honestly, I wish I could've sampled everything on the menu.   The restaurant was very clean and the kitchen looked very prepared. This place has a very cool outdoor seating area. Definitely a great place for happy hour and meeting up with friends or colleagues after work.   To say the least, this will be our go-to Italian place from now on.   Gray job everyone!

name: The Downtowner
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: What a charming place this was! My friends and I decided to come by on a Wednesday evening for happy hour. It wasn't very busy and we were immediately seated in a nice booth that created the illusion of separation. I couldn't see anything behind me! This is a good thing btw!  We ordered some drinks and apps for the table. A couple Old Fashions, Mexican tea, and a drink off the secret menu that was delicious but I can't remember the name. The drinks were beautiful and tasty.  For the table we had the lemony hummus, the charcuterie, the hot Nashville chicken sliders, a cheeseburger, and honey butter chicken biscuit.  The lemony hummus came with fresh, crispy carrots, watermelon radishes, and celery. The hummus was creamy and tangy. It has a lot of dill, but I didn't mind that at all.  The chicken was a tad burned, but it was good the biscuit was soft and yummy, but it could have used a little more honey. I think the cheeseburger was the star. It was perfectly cooked and just hit the spot. The fries were also good. Just what I wanted!  The charcuterie was tiny, but it had some great treats.   And our waiter was phenomenal. He was attentive and super engaging. He gave us lots of information and we had a lot of fun small talk with him too.

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Food took f o r e v e r  to arrive. Server was nice but food took so long at one point she said it would be here but then It didn't come for another 30 minutes, this was around 4 pm  When it arrived, the scallops had enormous amounts of sausage like ham. Not sprinkled but probably a third of the dish. This was NOT in the menu. It was hard to push aside there were so many and we were afraid to send any food back due to the time it took to arrive. We had 2 orders of scallops around $35 each for only 3 scallops.  We also ordered the special meat loaf, that was good.  Bring a sweater, it is freezing in there and certain booths have the air blowing directly at you.  Interesting place, but too pricey for what you get... not much.

reviews.author: Jeanne D.
reviews.description: This was our first time at The Downtowner and it was great! Had to wait a bit for Saturday brunch which can be expected. Our waitress was phenomenal and the food was impeccable. Best was the bloody Mary's! We will definitely be returning! Excuse the photos my camera is messed up. The only reason I did not give it five stars was the interior was not as great as they made it out to be.

reviews.author: Don P.
reviews.description: 1st off. The atmosphere is amazing. The bartenders are fun, energetic, and welcoming. Signature made from scratch drinks to compliment the scratch made food. How can you go wrong?! Meatloaf!!! honey butter chicken biscuit with a fried egg on top with Tallow Fries! Delicious. Housemade lemon and dill hummus. Amazing. You cannot go wrong with anything on the food or drink menu. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Jenn H.
reviews.description: We use to go here once a week 2 years ago but it has gone downhill. Fried Chicken was burnt, mashed potatoes cold, grilled chicken was steamed not grilled and prices are not worth the quality. Service and drinks were good. Save your money and time.

reviews.author: Danielle A.
reviews.description: Great spot . Cool bar and menu. Ate here twice in 24 hours. Amazing biscuits!  Had the veggies omlette twice it was so so yummy. Great cocktails, atmosphere and staff.

reviews.author: Jeff H.
reviews.description: Awesome place.  Mostly locals with incredibly friendly staff and super mixed drinks. Well situated in the heart of downtown New Braunfels. Stop by after browsing the farmer's market.  Great place to catch a game and have a snack. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: They have lost their passion. Pre-Covid I will say this spot did do a great job on drinks but we visited 1/22 and it definitely was not the same as it was in the past. We had the charcuterie and meats that were on the board were extremely thick. We also had the crab cake and it was mediocre. Not bad but not great. During Covid I do wish they had updated their hours and even now on yelp it states they are closed which is not correct. During Covid it stated they were open when they weren't. No one is monitoring the marketing for what it seems. Hostess cared more about being in the phone Vs caring for guests. Such a disappointment when there is so much potential.

reviews.author: Ardnas D.
reviews.description: I had high hopes based on the menu choices but egads it was bad. Even if their prices were cut in half it would not be worth it. Sometimes places have an off-night, but I would never give this one another chance.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: So this place always comes up on my searches so my husband and I decided to give it a try. When I go to a restaurant I like to evaluate it not only on a basis of food, but also the theme. The servers are in character - they are dressed as if they are mechanics with trucker hats. Nice touch to the restaurant given that it has an overall vintage gas station/industrial look.   Space/layout: Definitely a fun place to go to for brunch. They can accommodate large parties and have a bar. The decor around the restaurant are instgrammable, so if you are into that go ahead and cop yourself a pic.  Food: Not gonna lie, the food we order was a little bit more on the saltier side (Dirty Hash and the Shakshuka). Not sure if it was the cook that day or if the cook over shot the salt, but my husband and I had a difficult time finishing our food since it was a tad bit salty. Portion is great, presentation is amazing, but too salty. I am willing to give this place another try. Other than the saltiness, the food here is really good. But come thru and see how the food taste yourself!   P.S. Order a biscuit, it's really, really good here! Homemade and fresh.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The food was incredible.  The shrimp and grits were out of this world.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  The staff was top notch.  Shout out to Taylor and Chad.  You guys made our experience so enjoyable.  Thank You!

reviews.author: Jill B.
reviews.description: Dinner for the first time since they reopened. They did not disappoint!! Scallops were simply amazing.  Best I've ever had!  Son had the meatloaf and it hasn't missed a beat!   Classic Old-fashion was spot on.  Took home the Wagyu burger for husband and lemon Strawberry shortcake for dessert.  Plates are all clean! Thanks Chad and team for a fabulous dinner!!

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: Went by the Downtowner on Saturday to try the new brunch menu. Had the Chilaquiles with pork belly and the meal was absolutely fantastic. Brought my wife home the avocado toast with eggs and bacon and that was also delicious as well. Overall just a wonderful experience!

reviews.author: Mirta F.
reviews.description: Food was ok.. nothing special. ‍  mimosas were good and location was GREAT.  Service was pretty good. Not sure it's any place I'd be super anxious to go back to any time soon.

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: Hands down one of our favorite places to eat. The food is outstanding all made fresh and the bartenders are so fun! We love Stephen when we go. They are currently open Thursday and Friday nights and for Saturday and Sunday you got to try their brunch! They can make any drink you want!

reviews.author: Layce H.
reviews.description: Our normal breakfast place was packed so we googled and this hidden gem popped up.  It was a bit pricy but OMG that French Toast is 100% worth it. Service was on point too. Our server was Danni and she is a keeper. Will be back.

reviews.author: Ian S.
reviews.description: We didn't set out to dine at this establishment as we were staying overnight not to far away but it started raining and we tucked ourselves into this restaurant. At first glance the menu was a little too fancy for my wife's and kids palate but the food wowed us. Best meatloaf I have ever had and the fried chicken was great. Well done , definitely check this place out! Well worth a drive.

reviews.author: Louis S.
reviews.description: great food and specialty drinks, great art everywhere, owner was a great guy, showed us around

reviews.author: Debby J S.
reviews.description: We went to the Downtowner (First Timers) on Saturday evening to have dinner before our show at the Brauntex ... 'Elvis' ... And he did deliver ... He paid a Tribute to the King!!  So, when we walked in, there were two hostesses at the front. They asked if we had reservations, which we did not. I told them it was fine, that we could walk next door to Krause's and next time I would make a reservation.  Well, all I can say is that those two hostesses moved heaven and earth to accommodate us! They perused the seating chart and came up with a 'plan' for us. As long as we could be done by 6:30p they had a table for two. We told them that we had to be at the Brauntex at 6:30p, so all was good.  At first, we thought they were just going to sit us in the back room.  LOL  We didn't realize that the restaurant went that far back.  And our waitress (Can't remember her name!) What a hoot. She was a pleasure to have. Answered all of our questions about the menu, etc. She brought water out in this cool bottle ... She told me I could have it ... And then wrestled it out of my arms when I tried to leave ... Just Kidding!! And then our food came. It was delicious!  And we were walking out of the restaurant at 6:30p.  KUDOS to everyone that took care of us!

reviews.author: Lizzette C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love this place for brunch on a Sunday Funday! Service is always great, the staff is friendly. Our very first experience, we sat at the bar and Steven was our bartender. He was great and showed us his take on a mojito, which was delicious! The food is great as well, I honestly can't say a bad thing because we've never had a negative experience here.

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: I would just be echoing what most have already written. The other reviews are very accurate.   My big issues included that when I reached out for more information via email I got no response. Also, they offered a pizza meal and it turned out to be Dominos. No offense to them but I was expecting a sit down inside with something more local. Not even paper plates and napkins.   If you are expecting a tour of a winery,  this not that kind of trip. It is a tour of wine places.

reviews.author: Raven H.
reviews.description: So the bus was clean, wifi equipped (though weak), and outlets on the back of each seat to stay charged. Weirdly had no music playing for the majority of the trip, guide blamed it as being unfamiliar with SA radio stations since she had just driven in from Houston.   The tours are supposed to consist of three brewery/winery/distillery visits, I'd assumed it would be all of the same category i.e. all brewery or all winery but we had a two for one perk visiting Ranger Creek Brewing and Distillery in that we were getting to try their beers and whiskeys. We'd anticipated a bit of a story and a tour of the facility but honestly this one went on waY too long. Still, this visit was the high point once we realized we weren't limited in our samples and they were pouring full pints.   Back on the bus to New Braunfels Brewing Co., a brewery known for its sour beers, many made with fruity elements and one spiced pickle beer. These were honestly a trip, we were presented two drink tickets and I sampled a pink beer, sour, and a splash of the pickle beer, spicy and sour. I didn't hate it but I didn't love it, one of the homies running the establishment sounded like Seth Rogen so that was a treat. The majority of the bus seemed to really dislike the visit though and I saw a few people tossing beers into sinks or nearby plants.   Our last stop was the Grapevine, something I was super looking forward to but wound up being the most disappointed.  I was anticipating a couple sweet glasses of wine to wind up the trip but after fighting downtown traffic down a narrow road, we were told we'd get 45 minutes to wander around since that's how long our host figured it'd take the bus to circle back. It was so disorganized, we literally just walked in to what felt like a super crowded gift shop where five or six people poured samples down a long bar. The wine samples offered, while delicious, were barely enough for a SIP. I asked our guide if we were supposed to tell them something to get actual glasses of wine and she told us we had to purchase the drinks, only the samples were free and only three samples at that. Okay, so what was all the money we spent on the tickets actually going towards? We got our tickets at a convention where they were offering a special price, 2 for $100 I think,  then the day of the tour we were told to bring $20 cash for a tasting fee. What the what?  Even after alllllll that, during the drive back to the drop-off point, our guide announces both she and the bus driver work for tips. $70+ at the end of the day and barely caught a buzz.

reviews.author: Ashley W.
reviews.description: I booked the San Antonio beer bus as a last-minute activity with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  The owner, Neil, took my reservation over the phone and was awesome about squeezing us in.    We had a blast! We went to three different places - Ranger Creek brewery/distillery, Weathered souls brewery, and Artisan on Alamo (vodka distillery).    Ranger Creek - hands down our favorite.  The guys working there were amazing, they really went above and beyond to make everyone feel welcome and made sure everyone had a good time.  We got three full pint pours plus multiple samples of bourbon.  Lots of variety in the beer options.  We opted to purchase a bottle of bourbon and some bourbon filled chocolates to take home with us.  The brewery seemed to only be open for tours at the time and were able to focus their entire attention on our tour group.  The next top, Weathered souls brewery was very busy.  They were hosting a party at the time, and about 3/4 of the seating area was reserved for the party, forcing our tour group to the patio.  At this brewery, we received two tokens good for a half-pour of 4 pre-selected beers they had on tap.  I chose the only one that wasn't an IPA (IPA isn't my thing), and it tasted like a very strong IPA.  My husband was sweet enough to purchase me one of the non-tour options that the staff insisted was not an IPA, but it tasted identical to what was already in my glass.  Not a lot of variety in the options here, and the options for purchase were very overpriced (growlers, etc).    Artisan on Alamo was our least favorite stop.  The owner came off as rude and bothered when asked questions.  Our guide boasted about mixed drinks, but we discovered when we got there that mixed drinks were only available to purchase, not as part of our samples included in the tour.  They did, however, have a big selection of cocktails available for a  reduced "tour price" of $5.  The vodka samples we received were small, and the whole place was a little underwhelming.    Overall, we loved the whole beer bus experience.  Our beer bus guide (who I cannot remember his name, oops) was also amazing.  Snacks and bottled water were offered between stops, and the bus played classic rock on the radio which produced many drunken sing-a-longs.  When we arrived back at our starting point at the Lion and Rose pub, we received a voucher for a free appetizer.  We decided to eat there after checking the Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed.  The food was amazing, the staff was excellent and had our appetizer in our hungry hands within minutes.    Tips:  -Get either an Uber or a Lyft to and from your meeting point. -Bring a bag for your swag! We got a pint glass from each of the places we visited, so we left with 6 total, plus items we purchased. -Eat something before you board the bus - our tour started at 11:30 and ended around 4:30.  Even with the snacks, we were starving by the time we got back to the pub -Wear sunscreen! Two of the three places we went had a patio with limited shade, I was very grateful that I lathered up in sunscreen before we left.    We definitely will be doing a beer bus again!  Would love to do an Austin tour or Dallas if ya'll come up north!

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: We got tickets to the Texas Beer Bus not knowing exactly what was involved. All we knew was that we got the tickets for $50, and we were promised a day of breweries. We showed up at the appointed spot, the parking lot of The Lion and the Rose. They didn't have any water waiting for us, and had us stand around in the heat of the parking lot while we waited for a MegaBus that was about 20 minutes late. While we stood around waiting for the late bus, we were told that if we actually wanted to drink beer on this Beer Bus tour, we'd have to chip in another $20. I felt ripped off. Why not include that in the fee? When we finally got going, there was no beer on the bus. They said that was illegal (it's not.)  We drove around in circles for about 20 minutes trying to find the first brewery. They didn't know where it was. Apparently, they hadn't been there before.  When we finally arrived, Ranger Creek did a great job of explaining the beer, the whiskey, and the brewing process.  Blue Star didn't seem to be expecting us. They hurriedly poured us a few ounces of beer while we stood around waiting for something. I don't know what. Nobody told us about the place, and we got rushed out of there almost as soon as we got there.  The third brewery cut my brother off for being loud and obnoxious. I don't blame them.  In all, we went to three breweries. Ranger Creek, Blue Star, and Freetail.  I felt ripped off that the beer tasting charge wasn't explained until we were already $50 into it. Plus, they made us fill out these liability waiver forms after they had our money. Don't like the terms of the form? No refunds. What a ripoff. Who's going to take a beer tour and not drink beer?  The tour was poorly planned, terribly executed, and felt like a rip off. Our guide didn't know the first thing about the breweries (didn't even know where they were).   I'm never taking this tour again, and I discourage you from doing it too. There's other brewery tours in town. Better yet, just go on your own.

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Had to pass on these free tickets to the Austin Triple Brewery tour.   The Austin meeting place is by the Domain rather than somewhere downtown. (They helpfully suggested that we take a $25 Uber ride to get up to their bus. Yeah, thanks.)   Beer tasting is not included in this beer tour! (It's an extra $20 to actually drink beer, paid day of.)   The breweries on the itinerary were Oskar Blues and Austin Beerworks. Both are walking distance from the meeting point.   I am genuinely confused why anyone would pay $125+ pp for this.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Scammers! We repurchased 2 vouchers from them at a comicon that they said were good indefinitely. A year later they refused to honor them.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: Would not recommend this tour. Poor organization. Guide does not guide, expected more engagement and education like I have experienced on other tours. Serving dominos pizza at a location where signs are posted everywhere, "No Outside Food", with not plates etc made me feel like an elementary student on a field trip. Would not recommend at all.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: Don't do it!! Let me lay it out there for you.  I've been on other beer bus tours in other cities so was super excited when my sister in law bought us all tickets last christmas. I don't mean to sound rude but our host needs a new occupation, her monotone voice portrayed the excitement of a funeral or a 0-0 exhibition soccer game. The music on the bus didn't work for over half the ride and it reeked of exhaust the first half of the trip.  The stops were cool but they're independent of the tour co so that makes sense. For the last third of the trip,  we took a 45 min ride through traffic back into town for our host to notify us,  after multiple updates and delays that our third stop wasn't possible. During all this,  we pass a bad wreck which the hosts comments on the intercom and tells us how many people die in car accidents every year. Honestly I cannot convey the level of frustration or dissatisfaction I have with our purchase and this company. #fail

reviews.author: Mary Y.
reviews.description: We have purchased tickets for the Texas Beer Bus four times!  We enjoy the atmosphere and the easy way we are able to tour the breweries, wineries and distilleries in Texas. We have been to North Houston, Dallas and Austin. Our fourth tour will hopefully be in south Houston. We are able to uber to our meeting site and they provide unlimited chips and water on the bus. We eat a good breakfast before we go and they provide pizza at the second or third stop.  There have been food trucks at each stop to purchase food to absorb the alcohol!  We enjoy visiting a new city with someone else driving!

reviews.author: Bonnelle M.
reviews.description: We're currently on our tour... that's how bad this is. We drove to the Domaine to meet the bus. The original bus driver no-showed, when the bus finally showed it was almost two hours late. The first stop was 23 MILES away near Austin Bergstrom-Hi Sign Brewery-decent beer, but nothing special. The second stop was another 17 MILES east To Cedar Creek to a START-UP "whiskey" distillery-Armadillo Whiskey Distillery-the whiskey is only "whiskey" thanks to a loophole in Texas liquor laws, its moonshine and it's terrible. The owner Matthew Wells spent so much time on the tour that he delayed the bus getting to our third stop. At the third stop-Adelbert's Brewery-we had less than 40 minutes to consume four beers.

reviews.author: Mark L.
reviews.description: Please don't waste your money. All you pay for is the bus to drive you around. You have to pay for every stop you make. The places they take you too are downtown Austin (que the fuck that ) and a distillery where again you pay for your drink. So y be like me and pay over a $100 dollars for a bus do it yourself and have a better time.

reviews.author: Katherine L.
reviews.description: I started the process of booking a private event through TBB 4 months before the date. We had a great experience with them on a public tour the prior year so figured it would be great for a birthday event. Unfortunately, this was not the case for the private tour. It was $99/person (which does not include tax OR a payment fee) which includes a bus that takes you to 3 different locations (these will not be confirmed until the week prior...) from 12-5, pizza lunch, and a voucher for every attendee to get a free visit at a later date. When making the payments- which can only be made by 1 person, they continued to keep forgetting to include my original deposit towards the payment.. and when I asked if I could pay in person (cash or check) to avoid the payment fee they simply said no. So all in all, I ended up paying close to $200 in JUST this fee alone.  The day of the event, we arrived at our first location and they had no idea that we were coming. So our group of 38 waited for near 10 minutes before knowing what we were doing. Not off to the best start. At our last event, the tour guide told me it was time to leave at 4 pm... which was 1 hour before the agreed end time. After convincing him to try and call his contact from TBB, he finally said we could stay until 4:40.  They never had any of the vouchers to give the guests. The following week I called to speak to someone about my experience. The woman basically said it was the brewery and the guide's fault and took absolutely no responsibility. She ended the conversation with "we will try harder next time". She agreed to send emails to each of my guests with the voucher by the end of the week. Well, that week came and when I contacted them they said it was too difficult and asked me do it instead which involved gathering 38 of my guest's emails and emailing each person an individual voucher (they emailed me the 38 different attachments......) In exchange for my trouble they sent me a few extra vouchers. I responded telling them how ridiculous this was for me to spend my time having to do all this. No response.  Long story short, for each person to pay $99 and all the different fees that I had to pay - they were incredibly unorganized, poor customer service, and just flat out not worth it. Definitely NOT recommending them to anyone. I felt like I had to spend WAY too much time trying to help organize and figure out the details of the event which in my opinion, is not my responsibility. There are plenty of other tours out there who will provide a smoother and more enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Tyler R.
reviews.description: I wish I didn't have to give one star but I do in order to leave a review. We saw a tent for this company at a festival so we purchased four tickets because we thought this would be a fun thing to do for a bachelor party. We were not told it was a public tour or that we had to register online so we thought we had seats on our private tour. We were told we could have the other groomsmen call and pay for a ticket at a later date once we got all the info for the tour which we were supposed to get the next day. After one week of no response to my email, I called two different numbers, both of which had a voicemail that said email, do not leave a voicemail. I've never heard of a company not having a phone you can call and talk to a human being. I sent an email and got no reply. So I tried again two days later, I sent two and after the second one, I got a phone call. I was told at that time, almost two weeks after I was supposed to get the details, that it was a public tour, now there are not enough seats for everyone who wants to go, we had to register online, the ticket is just a reminder you paid for a tour. I explained that we were not told any of that when we purchased the tickets, the woman told me it's all on the receipt, which, we also weren't told when we purchased the tickets on a Square card reader and the receipt gets sent to junk mail, we knew what the cost was so why read the receipt? The woman on the phone agreed to give me a refund for the trouble and not being clear about logistics and having such a hard time dealing with the company. I sent her the receipt, no response. I emailed two more times, I finally got "it will be processed." Nearly two weeks and 7 emails later, still no refund. DO NOT SPEND ANY MONEY WITH THIS "COMPANY". You are made to feel like a nuisance once you've paid for the service they are supposed to provide. They have your money, why should they deal with you now?? I do hair and the biggest part of providing a great experience for my clients is customer service. If I ran my business the way these people do, I would have no business! WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED! DO NOT THROW AWAY YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY!!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Great beers. I don't like beer and I loved theirs! Friendly environment. Games on all the TVs. Outside seating and food. Dog and kid friendly. Will visit next time we visit Texas.

name: Stone Werks Big Rock Grille - The Vineyard
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: Had good service here. Hilton was our server. The vibe was friendly.  I had oysters and chicken poblano soup. The soup was creamy, which I wasn't expecting. It was good though! The oysters came with horseradish, cocktail sauce, and lemon.   The water here is unfiltered. I highly recommend getting your water with lemon.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Sat outside. Lots of fans, so it was pleasant to be out on the patio. There are lots of Servers, so there isn't an unreasonable wait to order.  Our waitress was good. She got to us as soon as we sat down and continued to check on us. The restaurant was busy, but it did not take too long to get our food.  The unsweet tea was good, garlic mashed potatoes were delicious, so were the fries and blueberry cobbler.  The kid cheese pizza was meh. I got the fettucine alfredo and did not like it. The sauce was thick, not creamy and did not have a good flavor. It came with three toasted breads which did not have butter or seasoning, so were flavorless and dry.  I personally did not like it, but my toddler ate some and seemed to like it.   The Big Rock Nachos were good. In the past, I have tried the "Karat" Cake, which is also good.  I would return to this location, but would get something else next time.

reviews.author: Catherine Y.
reviews.description: Always love coming here to watch games and have a good time. Food is great and staff are usually friendly. The food and drinks always brings me back.

reviews.author: Norma G.
reviews.description: Server was excellent . Food was good . Prices too high 20 for a sandwich!  Nice to sit outside  Hope prices stabilize.   Good place to eat

reviews.author: Kristine D.
reviews.description: We had Huntington B. as our server and he was absolutely great. Had all the answers to all the questions, the house Bloody Mary was phenomenal. Huntington served me with patience, and kindness. Not to mention, that ass was bodacious. You know who I am  - KD ... call me ...

reviews.author: Kanela B.
reviews.description: The place was very well decorated for the season. Our server was Hilton and he was very kind and attentive. They were out of the ahi tuna appetizer the night I visited. Otherwise I would have given them 5 stars. Nice place to come for reliable food and service with reasonable prices

reviews.author: Duke T.
reviews.description: I've been going to this Stone Werks for a couple of years now once a week on average. It's my daughter and i's favorite place to go. The atmosphere is great, the food is great and the service is amazing. We always sit in the bar area so we can have Anne wait on us. She's attentive and friendly and a great waitress/bartender.   Everything I've eaten there has been good. The Caesar salad with salmon, the grilled chicken and Poblano mushroom soup are our go to's most of the time. You have to get their Brussel sprouts as an appetizer, amazing!

reviews.author: Patsy B.
reviews.description: The food was exquisite. The waiter was a nice gentleman. He was very polite. The place was clean.

reviews.author: Mindi S.
reviews.description: Last week we met friends fir happy hour,  when our waiter Huntington asked how my drink was I said not very good,  he did not offer anything.  I ordered  shrimp tacos,  the shrimp was chopped into such small pieces, there probably wasn't e en 1 shrimp in the 3 tacos! Again , Huntington asked how it was, I told him not good! I asked him to tell the manager! He didn't offer me anything. Manager never came to talk to me. Stone Works should take a lesson from  Cover3! When there was a problem, our waiter immediately did something to make it right and the manager came over, comped our food and offered us dessert.  All restaurants have problems, it's how they  handle them that makes the difference! I won't be returning to Stone Works  anytime  soon!!!

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: Hadn't been to Stone Werks in over 10 years.  I had very faint memories of the food being average and overpriced - and with Covid-19 I was worried this place would have a limited menu.   I came here with my grandma and we were looking for some healthy options.  Let me tell you, the food was FANTASTIC.  I ordered the Pan-seared Salmon with a vegetable medley and mashed potatoes.   I am very picky about my salmon because it's very easy to overcook it dry.  The fish was light, moist, seasoned extremely well and it cut like butter!! The potatoes were fluffy and flavorful. The vegetables were crisp and fresh.  Our waiter Josh was very attentive and so polite, even when we asked for extra things.   And one unique thing I have to say is that  the booth seats are SO COMFORTABLE! If I'd brought a blanket and pillow I might never leave- Ha!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the Blanco/Stone Oak area looking for a nice dinner.  This is the perfect spot for a date night or family outing.   Stone Werks has really stepped up their game as far as food and service. I will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Nicole S.
reviews.description: I have no idea who the chef/cook was tonight, but the food was extra excellent!! Everything we ordered was perfect!  Jonathan the bar tender gave us wonderful customer service and being extra busy on a Monday evening didn't keep him from being attentive to us. Panko crusted red snapper was perfect! Been here a few times and something changed,  it's way better !  Coming back soon!

reviews.author: Lisa And Len T.
reviews.description: Another great experience last week. We were served by Millie. Millie was super attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. She made our dining experience very enjoyable, a really sweet person!  Great job, Millie!!!

reviews.author: Edward O.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Amazing staff, outstanding environment, delicious food, connotative pricing, and both high quality indoor and outdoor dining opportunities.

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: Good food, tasty oysters but a little small.  The shrimp pasta was phenomenal all the way around.

reviews.author: Brandy H.
reviews.description: We love this location! Anne the bartender is ALWAYS hustling.  We get friendly/professional service and great food.  Also, we are usually seated quickly - even during COVID.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Gina G.
reviews.description: We have been frequenting this location for a couple years now. Chantell, our favorite server, always takes great care of us. She is very friendly and attentive. I recommend you request her section ;). My favorite things to order are the chicken panini or the big rock chopped salad and you can't go wrong with the cheese curds appetizer.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: Another great experience Friday night. Hostess was delightful and engaging. Our server, Gino, was warm and amazing! Food and drink alway delivers. Our service is always consistent! See y'all next time! (Edit:should be for Alamo Ranch location)

reviews.author: Amber F.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this restaurant! I order curbside for my parents and I, as they are still wary about eating inside. Whenever my dad or I pick up our order, it come out perfect and the hostesses are so friendly, especially Kat and recognize our order now!!!

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: A great place to catch bands and drinks. The food has been mostly a hit and only one miss. But the atmosphere on point for what I like. I gravitate towards laid back, classy, chill vibes and this place has got it.  Every drink I have ordered here has been exceptional. This time I got the Skinny Mojito and it along with the sweet potato fries and turkey burger were fantastic.  The lady at the bar was very friendly and helpful. They have a fire place and heat lamps for chillier days. Today it was perfect weather so no need. I recommend trying this place on a nice day. The patio is so inviting, you will never wanna leave.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Stone Werks is always the perfect spot when I'm looking to enjoy a good meal, some boozy beverages and a side of easy listening. Their menu is packed with options for everyone. Across the board from appetizers to desserts, I've yet to be disappointed. My boozy beverage choice of the evening was this beautiful XX! And if you happen to be in on a night with a live band these beauties are sure to keep flowing! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Scott M.
reviews.description: On every trip we usually take a walking tour and Brent's tour was one of the more in-depth and informative tours we've ever taken. I was impressed with Brent's commitment to learning everyone's name, engaging everyone at an individual level, making sure everyone was comfortable and entertained. It was obvious Brent was passionate about the city, its history, culture and current standing in the world. Comparing the Riverboat tour to Amigo's Walking Tour, the Riverboat Tour felt rushed and kind of unnecessary after the walking tour. The Riverboat Tour had some architecture history that wasn't covered in the walking tour, but still felt very surface level when compared to the Amigo Walking Tour.  Our tour was on the last Saturday of February where the tour guide was forced to compete with a mardi gras boat parade on the river. He did a great job weaving mardi gras references into his stories and really showed what a great guide he is. We have family visiting San Antonio in soon and have insisted they take this walking tour.

reviews.author: Maria N.
reviews.description: Great tour! Loved all the details, the walk, and the stories. I would definitely recommend joining if you are in town. Brent is passionate about his city and it is evident by his storytelling and city recommendations.

reviews.author: Dave-Kirsten P.
reviews.description: Truly one of the highlights to our trip to San Antonio. We learned so much about the city--just the right amount to be informed, but not overwhelmed. Brent was funny and engaging, and very aware of the needs of our group. He made sure to find shade when it got a little warm, and to take a couple of breaks during the tour. Highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Maria L.
reviews.description: Thank you Katia for introducing us to San Antonio. Thank you for all the tips you shared, we immensely enjoyed our short time in the city.    We followed your advice to drive to Fredericksburg. What a charming town. The weather that Monday couldn't have been better to drive to Texas Hill Country. Thank you also for the mango ice cream tip! We made sure not to leave SA without tasting it.

reviews.author: PJ C.
reviews.description: We are huge fans of free walking tours since they rarely disappoint. We have done them all over the world. Since the guides work only for tips the quality of these free walks is very good. This was true with our historical walking tour of San Antonio with David.    He was excellent and his knowledge of history and details was mind-blowing and entertaining.  His stories were engaging and memorable.  We really enjoyed our tour and just wish we would have had time to go on another one of their tours of the area.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Irina K.
reviews.description: I rarely leave Yelp reviews but really really enjoyed this tour and so did my whole family (we had 2 teens and a 6 year old with us)! Brent really passed on his love for his city! You could just feel it. He was informational and entertaining! Took great care to keep everyone comfortable in the hot weather. He made sure the kids were included. Not a boring minute! Would recommend without any hesitation.

reviews.author: Dorothy B.
reviews.description: Great history lesson! Before I took this tour, I did the River Walk boat tour, I took a educators class at the Alamo and took my time after the tour to watch the video and read all the info, I went to Mission San Jose and took the tour there and I also took the Pearl Brewery tour. Then I came to this tour....I had my tour with Brent. Wow talk about having an intimate look at San Antonio. He was full of knowledge. He talked about some of San Antonio's not so well known heroes, but made a but impact in the city. Brent was a great tour guide. Be sure to reserve your spot for the tour and wear walking to running shoes.  On the day I went, it rained in the morning. The rain must of scared some people off.  By the time the tour started it was dry. For my group there was just a handful of us.  The weather in SA is weird. But don't let stop you. Just bring an umbrella and light jacket for the colder months.

reviews.author: Anadrew W.
reviews.description: Our tour guide Brent was very entertaining and walked us all around the city. He explained the entire history from the beginning of its foundation, and he answered our many questions along the way. The tour was about 2 hours long, and even after walking all day before that, it was definitely worth it for me. He told us the history of the Alamo even up to the present day about the conflict regarding tearing down buildings to rebuild the outer Alamo walls. I would definitely recommend taking this tour if you have the chance.

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: Best tour ever!  I would definitely recommend amigos walking tours.    Brent, our tour guide was very knowledgeable and told the best stories.  He was able to give us so much information about San Antonio while keeping us laughing and interested the whole time.  He genuinely loves giving tours and you can totally tell.   Thank you so much Brent!!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Brent was friendly, funny, and knowledgeable. He took time to get to know everyone on the tour and really connected well with each guest. Highly recommend this company and the tour.

reviews.author: Poonam S.
reviews.description: Highly recommend this tour! It's a little under 2 hours. Starts at 6:30pm. Just shoot a text or call. Our tour started at St Ferndando Cathedral and ended at Hemisfair Park. Lots of breaks, shaded areas and A/C. Great way to be introduced into San Antonio!

reviews.author: Ian R.
reviews.description: Our tour guide Myra was knowledgeable in her arts and history of downtown SA! Would recommend for any tourists visiting the area for a quick 2 hour trip exploring the parts of downtown with a tour guide!

reviews.author: Patricia P.
reviews.description: So glad we did this tour with Myra. It was a cold and rainy day, but we learned so much. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting SA.

reviews.author: S.J. I.
reviews.description: This tour was amazing! I highly recommend these tours for anyone interested in learning about San Antonio history. We did the tour this past Saturday from 6pm-8pm, and our tour guide was Brent. He was by far the best tour guide I've ever encountered. You could tell he was really passionate about San Antonio history, and his energy made the whole tour that much more enjoyable. Even my brother who is is Not a history buff, and was doubtful beforehand enjoyed it very much. Thanks for the amazing walking tour!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: I have taken tours all over the world for many years.  This San Antonio tour with Brent as our Tour Guide was the best ever.  He is an absolute gem.  Very knowledgeable.  Very upbeat and energetic.  He clearly loves giving the tours and telling us about his city.  It was absolutely fun.  I was sad when the tour was over.  I could listen to Brent all day.  I HIGHLY recommend this tour. John B.

reviews.author: PK D.
reviews.description: We met Katia for our FREE walking tour. I think because of the misty morning no one else showed up. It turned out to be a private tour. Katia did an excellent job. Very knowledgeable and personable. We started at the San Fernando Cathedral, strolled along a portion of the River Trail, thru the Rivercenter Mall and ended in the Hemisfair Park. A great tour at a great price. I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Ronda P.
reviews.description: This is the BEST walking tour we have been on!  Brent was so full of wonderful stories, recounting historical events...helping us to imagine life as he was describing it.  I loved his different accents he used to help bring the characters he was describing to life!   We took this tour at the beginning of our visit, which helped us get a broader view of the history of San Antonio as were exploring the city. A walking tour is not about the walking - there were plenty of places he offered to stop and rest if we needed it.  If you are headed to San Antonio - don't miss this tour and it's free!  You can tip if you want - no pressure.

reviews.author: Jerie L.
reviews.description: This walking tour was the best ever!!! Don't miss this gem when in San Antonio. We found this on yelp and it did not disappoint. Even in 85 degree weather I could have done more.  We finished the evening with an excellent dinner at The Esquire. Best vacation evening.

reviews.author: Lisa T.
reviews.description: We took a tour of the King William District with Brent as our guide. This was his first time doing this specific tour. Had he not mentioned that, no one would have known. Brent is  knowledgeable, conversational, and engaging. It was great having a San Antonio native as our guide, because he was able to add personal experiences and stories that added depth and even some humor. My friends and I were disappointed that we were leaving that day, because we would have loved to have taken the Downtown Tour as well. Of the several guided tours we took throughout the city, this was by far our favorite! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Seth N.
reviews.description: I loved my first tour with Amigo Free Walking Tours this evening! Our tour guide was Brent Salter, and his enthusiasm, humor, and knowledge of San Antonio and its history kept me entertained for the full tour! Today was one of the hottest days of the year, but most of the tour was in the shade, as the sun was setting, or down on the Riverwalk, where the pleasant breeze made it very easy. San Antonio has been my home for almost 30 years, but I learned a lot, and can hardly wait to come back for more!

reviews.author: Irene Ortiz D.
reviews.description: The best eclectic , woman owned Liquor Store! Best place to walk from hotels and jobs downtown. Call them in advance if you need something special. Friendly, with a smile.

reviews.author: Alina D.
reviews.description: We were visiting from San Diego, and happen to find this liquor store on Google Maps.   When we walked in the liquor store was small, but had everything we needed.  Very intimate with the sweetest owner. She was very helpful and friendly!  I would 100% recommend this liquor store if you're in San Antonio :)

reviews.author: Omer S.
reviews.description: Annette the owner was super rude an inappropriate. I came 1 min before closing (whihus annoying I understand)  I wake a feqxqueztbs so icanchoosexnetter but she was upset form before an was just super rue from no reason. Plz take your business elsewhere.

reviews.author: Adrian O.
reviews.description: Adorable liquor store with great items at a great price. Downtown area and plenty of parking. Owner was very nice and very concerned with the safety of customers.

reviews.author: Tammy-Sue K.
reviews.description: I LOVE PIG LIQUORS! There I said it! And I'm not even a big drinker at all. But this place is so cool. They carry all different kinds of alcohol, many you wouldn't expect to find it a small local shop. It's in this quaint little house one block off of St Mary's behind El Mirador Mexican restaurant. Besides just about any kind of alcohol you can imagine, they also sell cute little things. They've got jewelry and there are usually these cute cards that are handmade by local artists. AND they of course have an amazing fiesta medal this year (2018). They love pets and always have a little doggie biscuit for my puppy. And there's a water bowl outside.  So to sum it up, I love this store, support local and buy your booze here, that's what I'm saying!

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We love coming to Pig Liquors! We love it for the location, the neighborhood, the selection, but most of all, we love it for the staff. The people behind the counter are SO friendly and welcoming, and will answer any question you have with patience and kindness. I frequently come in just looking for suggestions and always leave with a quality new experience. Thanks Pig!

reviews.author: Alison D.
reviews.description: My reluctance to pay $15 for a glass of wine at my hotel led me to search Yelp for a local wine shop. It thankfully led me to Pig Liquors. Funny name, serious selection.   It's tucked away on a side street and in an unassuming house. The owner was super friendly and helpful. You can get everything from single-serve cocktails to local brew to a nice vintage of Tattinger.   Happy drinking!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Absolutely the best customer service in the world. Annette is phenomenal.  Great selection, even though she's not getting support distributors bc she's too small. Support local, support a friend.  I still go the big boxes, but I go to Pig Liquors first!!

reviews.author: Lily F.
reviews.description: I like this place because it's unique.  Tucked away between some unassuming houses is this little place that sells a pretty well stocked liquor store.  They might not have everything but it's a pretty well-balanced selection with both popular items and local stuff.  And because this is the nearest liquor store that doesn't seem shady, I always come here to pick up a bottle of TX whiskey to take home with me.  I will say that being in here 3 times already, the woman who owns the place has both been very friendly and also a little standoffish and borderline rude which I could see some of the negative reviews.

reviews.author: Deborahvie R.
reviews.description: This liquor store is right downtown and does have its own parking spaces. It is located in an older home and I did like the vibe even though it is a bit dark and messy. The woman there did offer to help me pick out a decent bourbon. Their prices are comparable to other liquor stores and if I can support my local business I am all for it.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: I was a little leery because of the outside appearance, a house away from the main commercial street.  But the inside was very neat and the people there were so friendly.  Terrific selection too.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Pearls before swine!  This place is certainly a pearl- a hidden gem in the Southtown area. Have you ever noticed the dearth of liquor stores downtown?
