My husband ordered the chicken fettuccini and it was pretty standard/nothing special. The restaurant was really beautiful/nice ambiance but just overall our experience fell flat.

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: I like good food and service.  This is the second time we've come here for dinner and both times I have been very happy with everything.  Granted we had reservations on Valentine's Day, which means that they were very busy.  But I didn't mind the time between getting my salad, entrée and dessert.  It gave me extra time to enjoy the food and make room for the next dish.  I left satisfied, not stuffed.  On Valentine's Day they did have a special menu, so from the special menu I chose a Garden Salad, Shrimp Scuzzi and their Italian Cream Cake.  Again everything was delicious and we will be back (I forgot the gift card we had, so it's a good excuse to return for more delicious food )

reviews.author: Olga B.
reviews.description: Met here with girlfriends for a Saturday lunch. The place looks old and tired, and smells funny. Everyone ordered a few appetizers to share...they were your typical Italian fair like bruschetta, spinach dip, and fried calamari. Everything was pretty average and underwhelming. For my main meal I opted for Scuzzi's California salad with pan seared tuna add-on. The salad was just ok...I did the enjoy the pine nuts on it though. The tuna was a little fishy, but thankfully seared properly, although lacking much flavor. The best part of my meal were the 2 glasses of crisp house white, which made me temporarily forget how much I was spending on this super mediocre meal.  With so many other delicious Italian places in the city, I will not be back here.

reviews.author: Cherokee W.
reviews.description: Came here to celebrate the boyfriends birthday as we wanted nice food / ambiance but nothing  too fancy or overpriced. Food was good but nothing wowing us enough to come back. Our server Manny was amazing and took great care of us during our visit and is a big reason for the 3 stars.  Drinks: Had a subpar dirty martini and Moscow mules during our visit. Moscow mules won over the martini as it just wasn't tasty or as clean prepped as I've had at other locations. Moscow mules were on the sweet side and could have used more alcohol but it was nice to sip on.  Food: Started with the fried asparagus and while they were good, we have just had better. If you've never had them before, highly recommend but if you're trying to fill a craving, I don't think these are the ones. Birthday boy had veal Parmesan and loved it. Said it was some of the better veal he had had since living in Texas the past 8 years. I had the Scuzzi shrimp dinner. Thought it was good but it needed more salt and sauce. I would have preferred the coating on the shrimp to be a bit crispier but that's just me. While we didn't order or request a dessert on our own, they provided the birthday boy a mini cannoli with a candle. Loved the thought and appreciation but I later found out they charged me for it. I didn't bring it up bc I understand businesses are trying to recover but I would have preferred the option to decline if I had to pay for it. It definitely put a damper on the experience so we probably won't return anytime soon.

reviews.author: Michael D.
reviews.description: Let me start by saying the reason my wife chose this place is because the reviews. Last night, 26 Mar 2022, we had dinner reservations for 700pm to celebrate my 49th birthday, the reason it was a such a big deal other than another celebrated is because I have cancer and lived past my expected lifespan, so every birthday is a big deal. We had our close family, my wife ,our 14 yr old son and my sister-in law. We arrived about 15 mins before 700pm. The place was packed, and smelled just like you'd expect, like a small slice of Italy. After checking in the young lady said they had to get a table ready, she was clearly hustling and very busy, No worries I thought, my wife and her sister can get a drink (I can't drink). After waiting 20 minutes and even more people arriving I got nervous, asked about the table. She said they were very busy and it would be soon, I understood having been a busboy many years ago, and said no worries. We ended up waiting 40 minutes in total to be seated, after one more question to the over tasked young lady at the front desk. Once at our table we settled in talking and looking at the menu, so many delicious choices. Our waiter approached very rushed and was clearly in a hurry. We told him we can order appetizers, dinner, and drinks now to make it easier for him. He expressed how busy they were, then before we could order he said "I'll bring some water and bread" and promptly departed. I thought "did I miss something" we were trying to be helpful and I didn't think he understood or maybe we had some odd miscommunication, but again I was nervous. 10 mins later waters and two little hot breads came. Our waiter said would you like to order? We replied yes we can give our whole order appetizers, soup, salads, and, dinner and drinks again. This time he scrambled for scrap of paper in his apron, which was odd. We ordered 2x oysters, cup of soup, two salads, our main courses, and then drinks (2 refills of drinks from the bar) and a iced tea. He had a hard time taking our order having to look at the menu himself. I though maybe he's new, then he parted as quickly as he came after collecting the order. In the mean time we talked and laughed about events and family situations until we ran out of water and bread, we still hadn't gotten drinks or the appetizers yet, it had been 20 minutes, however we were talking and laughing so time had moved quickly. We started looking around and hadn't seen our waiter again. Other staff members were rushing around in and out of the back past us. Finally, another waiter (not ours) brought us the salads, we asked about the appetizers and drinks, he said "oh I'll ask for you" I was a little put off but ok they are clearly busy. Well the rest of the night was the same, our waiter was hardly present, our food came 30 more minutes later in a confusing way, of main courses first, then oysters which were appitizers and then I had to ask about my soup... and only my tea arrived, no on else got their drinks at dinner. The waiter was clearly overtasked and panicked looking mostly when we saw him. We asked about the drinks he said "oh they come from the bar', looking to the front, "they are so busy". We were all a little put off in the way this evening was unfolding.  Meanwhile, a nice lady refilled our waters, we ate our food it was very delicious. We got our waiter's attention after a couple minutes and ordered some deserts and coffees as another waiter helped box our dinners. Our waiter was frantic looking for some paper in his apron, to write the order down but ours just had repeated it back a couple times and rushed off. Deserts and coffees came a while later, we enjoyed them... my wife was upset saying she had even gotten a call from the restaurant confirming the reservation and that it was my birthday. The person on the phone said they would sing the birthday song, and a little calibration. She said she was sorry the night had went so wrong. I said it's not your fault love, you dont run the restaurant. We got the check and just then happy birthday signing erupted at another table very loudly, first in english, then in what might have been Italian, it was the cherry on top to our evening. I was happy to be leaving after paying the bill, disapointed and very put off. It was the single worst experience I have had at a restaurant of this quality with these reviews. They were terribly disorganized and overwhelmed, our food was great, however we couldn't get it in order or communicate well with our rushed waiter who was seldom there. My birthday celebration ended up being an extremely slowly and out of order delivered meal with drinks on the side and disappointment delivered completely. I gave them two stars because the food was delicious, even as slowly and backwards as it came, however,  birthday dinner was never held really, it was ruined.

reviews.author: Ashli R.
reviews.description: 7 of us (4 adults, 3 kids) eating outdoors. Great view, excellent service (thanks Claudio), great wine, great food. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Peggy W.
reviews.description: This is our favorite Italian restaurant in San Antonio.  The food is delicious with large portions.  Enough to share.  And they will split and give extra sides for only $3.   My favorite is the Gorgonzola chicken.  Then today I ordered a different chicken dish with squash and lemon butter sauce and now I can't decide which was better.  Such a hard decision for next time.   Their patio is beautiful and has a wonderful view of the city.  Also a nice breeze.  Try it out.

reviews.author: April T.
reviews.description: Good food, great dessert! The chocolate mousse dessert was outstanding! Nice Italian atmosphere complimented by Italian music.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Went to a large Christmas gathering and unfortunately the place was not equipped for a big group even they were aware of the reservation. Chairs were touching one another cause the restaurant crammed everyone together like sardines in a can...no elbow room. Food was lack-luster, bland, frozen Italian food. One waiter working hard, one with an attitude and a brand new bartender that didn't seem to get help from manager or coworkers. He did his best.  And the worse part of the whole Christmas dinner was eating off of paper plates. Sad. Won't be back again.

reviews.author: Brittany E.
reviews.description: Where do I even start? I was part of a group event hosted at this venue and the service was god awful. My food was burnt, we were left out on the cold patio where they only turned on one of the 5 patio heaters available. Employees never so much as refilled our water glasses, and I had to ask for a clean set of silverware multiple times before they decided to give a damn. Some guy claiming to be the owner was so rude and confrontational, I felt physically uncomfortable just being near that place. Never again will I return to this god awful place.

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: Stopped into Scuzzi's today for lunch with a guest.  My guest had the Stracciatella soup and sucked it down.  I had alfredo pasta with grilled scallops and my guest the Rainbow Trout.  We both loved the flavors and the attentive service.  I would have preferred to have the scallops be fresh, but we are land locked in the heart of Texas.  My guest took advantage of the $5 martinis on Thursdays and I had a most excellent old fashion.    I rarely have a bad meal here and I caught myself asking why don't I come here more often?

reviews.author: Lana P.
reviews.description: It was my first time and I will definitely be returning!  I had the Carbonara, it was amazing! Perfectly creamy and very flavorful. Best carbonara I've had at a restaurant in years!  I also had a French 75 and Tiramisu for dessert.  I loved the decor and how clean it was. Overall zero complaints!

reviews.author: Gary R.
reviews.description: Very tasty authentic Italian without a long wait time. Parking is easy and convenient. Me and my wife actually tried to meet some friends across 1604 at Paesanos  but the wait time was an hour-long and parking was a nightmare so we decided to check out Scuzzi's across the street.   We were definitely satisfied and somewhat impressed. The wine list is good enough for our tastes and everything else was perfect!  Great spot for a busy Saturday

reviews.author: Allen U.
reviews.description: Visited on a Saturday evening out with family. Upon arrival place wasn't too busy and we were easily accommodated! The service was exceptional, waiter was very attentive and courteous which is why I rate this place at a four star for the most part. The food was moderate, my wife ordered the chicken Parmesan and I order the beef lasagna. The lasagna was soft, cheesy and tomato was ok no too impressed and my wife chicken crusted Parmesan tasted great the noodles and tomato sauce was ok. Overall not too impressed with the food however they do excel at service!

reviews.author: Sharon S.
reviews.description: The waitstaff at Scuzzi's was wonderful. They catered to our every need. The Italian dishes were very fresh and very authentic. Extremely pleasant surprise and such a beautiful romantic atmosphere. Great for anniversary or birthday special treat!

reviews.author: JC S.
reviews.description: My wife and I just had the WORST experience with the supposed owner of Scuzzi's Italian Grill.  I called the restaurant before we came to be sure that we could be seated, and they said that we could.  As soon as we arrived, they stated that all of their indoor tables were reserved.  We opted to sit outside, which we had done in the past.  Due to it being a bit cold, we asked if we could have the outdoor heater turned on.  When our appetizers came out, approximately ten minutes after we were seated, we asked about the heater again, and were told that they did not have the fuel to turn them on.  We then went inside to sit at the bar, at which time we asked to speak to the manager.  A person came to our table, dressed the same as the servers, and identified himself as the "owner".  When asked about the patio heaters, he said that they did not have the fuel, and that we were welcomed to go to Academy or HEB to find some.  I told him that his rudeness was uncalled for, and he then proceeded to tell my wife and I to enjoy what we had on our table and leave.  I asked him if he was really telling us to leave and he said "yes" and walked away.  We have frequented this location at Military and 1604 and have NEVER received such poor customer service.  His attitude and rudeness was uncalled for.  I sincerely hope that he was not the owner, because if he was, he truly needs to learn more about hospitality.  I'd like to add that I called Academy (located right behind them) to ask if they had the propane tanks, and they said they had "plenty".

reviews.author: Tiffany G.
reviews.description: If I could provide this business with a zero star I would because the customer service was the worse service I've ever had. As a foodie great food but I was over charged on my check the manager gave me the hardest time ever. Happy hour was 4-7 we ordered at 620 because our reservation was at 6pm and they rang the check in at 7:04 per what the check stated! He didn't even want to refund me after over charging me. I wish this was a better experience but it wasn't for all my people wanting the best service and food stick to Pompeii! I should have never cheated on my favorite Italian restaurant in San Antonio for this. 4 shrimp for $17.00 ohh hell no!  Please don't ever contact me or any customer for that matter via personal line/text that is just against all ethics to continue to rant about what I said on this site. A customer review is feedback! The thing is I still tipped in cash next time include all the facts!   I really would like to know why wouldn't you offer an opportunity to make it right next time, let the customer know you will always provide superb business. Nope that was not the case! This has now become harassment! It just food people!   Ps I'm not even a food critic! They are much worse!

reviews.author: Jennifer C.
reviews.description: We stayed at the hotel next door and decided to get room service. This restaurant services the hotel. We ordered the Shrimp Bourbon Street and key lime pie.    Blown away by the shrimp. The best dish we e had in a very long time. The key lime pie was also delicious.   I'm gonna say it'd be worth the drive from Houston to have this meal again.

reviews.author: P C.
reviews.description: Second time stopping in at this location as we were in the area. Can't beat the lunch menu till 300PM-great value! See my previous review about the odd parking situation, but non issue this time since we knew the protocol this time. Carlos our server was great-no mask though. A few others we observed were masked up. The place was quite empty which we were happy about. The food just excellent! Wife had the diablo pasta w/ shrimp and lobster bits, I had the pecan crusted tilapia-we enjoyed both! Servings were generous and flavor on point. Let's talk about the bread. Lousy...hard and really no flavor. Recall the bread last visit was also bland. Step up your bread game Bourbon-so many restaurants do this exceptionally well. Again food overall excellent-but real obvious how bad the bread continues to be. I'll look for bread improvements on a future visit.   *Location/Access/Convenience:  3* *Ambiance:  3*  *Cleanliness:  3* *Food Taste/Quality:  4* *Service:  4* *Price/Value:  4*  *Pay Process:  3* *Takeout/Pickup Experience:  NA* *Covid Conscious:  2*  *Likeliness of Returning:  3*  ***Overall Score: 29/9=3.2

reviews.author: Nancy N.
reviews.description: The atmosphere and ambiance definitely takes you back to New Orleans and the menu is pretty comprehensive.   The baked oysters were great and their beet salad is a nice touch. The shrimp and lump looked amazing and came in a pool of butter, it's nice but was annoying to run into little shell pieces when you bite down. Was hoping to redeem the meal with a bread pudding as it was the #1 recommended dessert . Not something I would order again. The texture wasn't soft enough for my taste

reviews.author: Carissa C.
reviews.description: Excellent off menu salad. Great spot to sit outside and enjoy the Riverwalk. Not crowded, good social distancing. Manager is super friendly, greats all the tables. Love the in-house made pesto. Great spot for good food without a large crowd.

reviews.author: Elijah S.
reviews.description: So glad we found this place on a recent trip to San Antonio, great food, great location, great service and not too expensive.  We stayed right by the Alamo on the river walk and all the restaurants had an hour plus wait, we ventured about 15 minutes north in the river walk toward the museum district and found this gem with no wait, with outdoor dining overlooking the river walk and really good seafood.  So many of the river walk restaurants feel like tourist traps with mediocre overpriced food, this place had none of that vibe, and live music to boot.  Everything we ordered was great (shrimp bourbon street appetizer, Diablo pasta, shrimp and lump, and fried shrimp/catfish platter) do yourself a favor and get out of the hustle and bustle and give this place a try.

reviews.author: Nate J.
reviews.description: Walked in and was greeted and seated right away. It was a few minutes before our waitress came by but she was running all over. Took our drink order and we ordered an appetizer. Drinks came right out I had an Old Fashioned that was just great, and my wife had a Cucumber Martini that she said was the best she ever had!!  We got complimentary bread and butter and shortly after our Calamari strips arrived. They were so delicious, crunchy, and soft in the center! Even the marinara was great not just tomato sauce!   We both got Redfish, I got the Pontchartrain and my wife the Diablo. The Pontchartrain was cooked perfectly and had great flavor, the Diablo was pretty bland and no spice at all! The dirty rice was average just seemed like it was out of a box...   Would definitely go back and try other dishes.

reviews.author: Erica F.
reviews.description: A friend recommended this place and we decided to give it a try for Valentine's Day dinner. They don't take reservations but the wait wasn't terrible and we got a drink at the bar while we waited. The service was good considering it was a holiday and everyone goes out for dinner. We started with the alligator for an appetizer which was really good. My husband had the redfish which I tried and it was very delicious. I had the mardi gra pasta which was alright. It lacked salt and was just a little more greasy than I'd have liked. Nevertheless I didn't take any stars away because this is definitely a place I'd come back to and try other dishes.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: I stayed at the Wyndham hotel connected to the restaurant and I am so glad we put this on our to-do list when visiting SA. The staff was very friendly, personable and definitely made us feel comfortable with the execution of COVID protocols and social distancing. I always know what kind of meal it is going to be early on, and when we were given warm bread and a tasty olive oil dip, I knew we were in for a treat!   I had the Louisiana Lemonade and it was one of the top 5 cocktails I've had so far; my entree was a plate of oysters, shrimp and fries- all fried and it was so obviously fresh and seasoned to perfection. I'm very picky about my seafood and this restaurant is definitely on the top of my list of places to revisit!   Bourbon St. seafood is a must if you're visiting San Antonio!

reviews.author: Pam M.
reviews.description: Bourbon Street is a very nice restaurant with the ambience of the fine dining restaurants in New Orleans. The food is delicious but a tad overpriced and not quite as "authentic" as advertised. The dirty rice was more of a darkened rice pilaf than actual Louisiana dirty rice. The group I was with ordered a varied array of dishes and we each enjoyed the food. The order of frig legs that we shared as an appetizer was the BEST part of the meal, they weren't too heavily breaded,  as some restaurants do, and they were fried to perfection and still juicy and moist. I will recommend Bourbon Street Seafood Kitchen for fine dining with a Louisiana  flavor

reviews.author: Rochelle R.
reviews.description: Wasn't impressed with the menu... Everything is pretty much $20 a plate are 3:00. We visited for a birthday gathering and the best part was the bread they kept serving lol. I left 95% of my food. The waiter never asked if everything was okay. Won't be returning.

reviews.author: Charlene H.
reviews.description: My friend and I stumbled on this location as we were walking down river walk and decided to go in for a drink. The weather was perfect, and they have a very nice patio area to just relax and enjoy. We had a great time and the drinks we had were awesome. I would definitely go back for dinner or lunch one day.

reviews.author: Tracy T.
reviews.description: Pretty great food and awesome service. I ordered takeout from this place because I was craving cheese, shrimp and pasta, so fettucine alfredo it is. This place definitely hit the spot. It came with the softest bread and the most unique cilantro-infused oil that was delicious. The noodles and shrimp were cooked perfectly, with just the right amount of cheesy sauce. The portion was a pretty good amount (enough for 2, but I wanted to be a pig, so I ate the entire darn thing...and I have zero regrets). If getting takeout, the restaurant is sweet and adds a York peppermint patty. I don't really do chocolate and mint, but the gesture was really cute.   Highly recommend for taste and promptness. Totally worth the price.

reviews.author: Ashleey L.
reviews.description: Better than papadeux in my opinion as a person from Louisiana.  Catfish and shrimp fried is my go to with dirty rice.  Best bread oil dip.. never knew that was thing before. It's not the best but it will do.  Things to improve, the cleaning of the fish The waiters not remembering what we ask for  Or the Louisiana hot sauce isn't what I would call La hot sauce it's like a off brand I've never heard of  Fav location out of all of them

reviews.author: Christy W.
reviews.description: We were a little skeptical when we pulled up at a hotel for this restaurant,  but it didn't disappoint. Seafood Fondue was so tasty. Had to ask for extra bread for it since it was a large helping. Their Pontchartrain Red Fish could have honestly been just about any fish with all the sauce they put on it, but it was so good I thought I would  lick my plate. Staff needs a little training about taking away extra tableware,  etc when the table was set for 4 and there were just 2 of us. They were very friendly though.

reviews.author: April B.
reviews.description: Tried this place as I was passing through San Antonio and turned out to be pretty amazing.  Service wasn't bad, bartender was a little heavy on ice with the French Manhattan, server spilled water all over my chair and just kept moving along.   Anyway, food was pretty close to authentic Cajun cuisine.

reviews.author: Teofila R.
reviews.description: Eee got there about 6:20pm. We got seated outside because we wanted to listen to Jorge and nicole guitar playing. It was very breezy. My friend ordered coffee and was told they didn't have any. Then they said , okay but we will have to brew some coffee. Then they brought her coffee and it tasted strong and old. After bringing it to their attention, they brought her another cup and it was much better because they made a fresh batch. We requested an inside table due to outside seating was just too breezy. Things got better. Fried frog legs were delicious. Bread and butter and pesto sauce was good. Trout plate and dirty rice good. Pasta seafood plate good. Raw oysters delicious. Waitresses were busy.

reviews.author: Gabriela B.
reviews.description: Shrimp and grits were ok. Not the worst food, but not really worth the money. I also got the oyster Rockefeller, they were good. But again, I don't necessarily love.

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: Nice area as it was just beside San Antonio's Riverwalk. Service could have been better since they forgot to put our utensils before our food arrived. Wife ordered the Eggplant Bayous and while I ordered the Seafood Jambalaya. The Eggplant Bayous was good and creamy. I've had Seafood Jambalaya elsewhere before but this had a distinct taste that is different from the others I had before.  Would have given them a 5 star reviews if it were not for the servers forgetting to give us utensils and having that odd taste with the seafood Jambalaya.

reviews.author: Jason O.
reviews.description: Been to this place a few times and it's just delicious. Nice live music and a wonderful view if you sit outside.

reviews.author: Shelia S.
reviews.description: We ate while in SA for a long weekend. The food was wonderful! We all ordered a different dish and there were no complaints. The spaghetti vegetables with my husbands dinner were perfectly seasoned. We all tried a bite and were amazed at how good they tasted. My blackened redfish was perfect, and served with dirty rice that was amazing. The others in our party ordered shrimp dishes that were cooked to perfection.   Leave room for dessert. The baked Alaska is big enough to share with several friends. Creme Brûlée is my favorite dessert ever, and it was perfect. I'm not usually a fan of restaurant coffee because it's generally a dark roast, but their coffee was smooth and well suited with the desserts.   Definitely give them a try!

name: Eddie V's Prime Seafood
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Fred V.
reviews.description: Great food  Sea Food is great but the Steak is   Good cocktail selection  Staff friendly  Will Recommend

reviews.author: Kate P.
reviews.description: We celebrated my birthday dinner at Eddie's on a Friday evening. I was pleased with the little surprise on the table for my birthday.   This was my first time coming here so I knew the prices were high and assumed I was getting small portions. I was wrong. All the meals came out and were great portions.   We got the calamari, lobster bisque, steak, salmon, mashed potatoes, and au gratin potatoes. Steak was a little salty but everything else was awesome.   For dessert, we had a the banana foster. We didn't like the liquor on it but had great flavor.   Our server was awesome and always asking if we needed anything and provided us knowledge of the menu.   We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Florence A.
reviews.description: Definitely a must. Finally had the opportunity to come here. My goal was to try to go to the one in San Diego when I visited, but the San Antonio location it is. The food is amazing! Came here for a date night and it truly was the perfect place. Definitely a nice fancy spot with delicious food. Definitely recommend making a reservation.   Staff was so friendly and personable. I love that welcoming feeling the moment you walk into the door. Our waitress really knew the menu and even recommended delicious appetizers like the Calamari.   Price: fine dining pricey. So worth it though for those special occasions or if you really wanna treat yourself to something nice.   I'll be back for my birthday dinner next month.

reviews.author: Connie H.
reviews.description: Exceptional food as always- service fell down here. She seemed to forget that I asked for lime and bread on 4 different occasions.  Other than that, whether you have a celebration or not, Eddie V's has always been my go to. This was my first SA experience. We had oysters- the horseradish is the bomb-2 of us had the Butter fish which was a special and it was fantastic- flaky, tender and flavorful. Our other companion got the Sea Bass that was baked- she liked it but ours was better- if you get Sea Bass, I recommend the one on the menu in soy and steamed. Spinach, Au gratin potatoes and Brussels sprouts were the sides. As always during a celebration,(birthday here) they brought out a complementary dessert of bananas foster with a candle. We also ordered the molten cake- very rich-the very light ice cream couldn't stand with it. If you like a lot of alcohol in your dessert, def go with the foster

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: I'd like to give this place 4.5 stars simply because their menu survived in tact with a name change. Can we get a relaunch  on the menu?  I decided to make this place for Halloween night because I knew I would be alone so I didn't want to be that guy who shoos away the kids or makes them walk all the way up the walk to get a thing of nerds. So I set 150 pieces of candy on the curb and bolted.   I arrived to the bar and promptly ordered their house special smoked old fashioned   https://youtu.be/d1iEBP9I2Nc  For bar food I ordered mini filet burgers. Center cut filet, blue cheese and onion jam. Very nice.   My entre was Texas Redfish with rice on the side. Perhaps just a hair overdone.   My bartender heard me say nothing was grabbing me from the desert menu so he orders me something custom on the house. I guess he knew once he did that, I'd be ordering a new old fashioned. This is why he's tending bar here and not Buffalo Wild Wings.   By this time I had switched to their standard old fashioned (12 less than 18). I've been annoyed by the lack of Bulleit Rye in San Antonio so I settled for Hayden's. I managed to hunt down two bottles of Bulleit Rye in town. Bartender suggested I covet those.   I always tell young couples looking for a serious date night to come here. It's rare for me to come here without being dragged by the wife.   If you're from MD and you know what real crab cakes are, all I can say is don't do it. No matter how much the staff brags on them, the MD style crab cakes are a forgery. They will disappoint you like accidentally kissing your sister.

reviews.author: Darlene R.
reviews.description: Eddie Vs is a very nice, romantic, special occasion restaurant. The dim lighting gives the restaurant an elegant, sexy vibe. I was recently there with a client, so no romance for me lol. Our server was Kenya and she was excellent and drives my 5 star review. She has a bright sparkly personality, was very attentive yet not intrusive. I'd say the food is a solid 4 based on this and previous visits. The sashimi was delicious. The crab cake was a bit mushy, but had great flavor. Would have preferred smaller size with more lump crab. I had the filet which wasn't as rare as I'd hoped and this is my second visit where it was too salty. Lesson learned. They are best known for seafood. Chocolate lava cake was same as everywhere. A more creative chocolate desert would be a welcome alternative to compete with the house special, bananas foster. If u want a showstopper dessert get that instead. Oh yes the cocktail was a delight, very unique. I loved it. Another solid visit to Eddie Vs. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Renee J.
reviews.description: We went to Eddie V's on this occasion to celebrate our anniversary. The service is so amazing there that it is a great restaurant to celebrate special occasions. Our server, Steve was so attentive and spot on with his food and pairing recommendations. The environment and staff is great but then there is the food. Whether I order a steak or seafood, their food never disappoints and is cooked to perfection.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: My dad and stepmom came to visit my fiancé and I, and they wanted to eat somewhere good while they were here.  Eddie V's was suggested, so I made us a reservation.  I had never been to Eddie V's before, and it definitely did not disappoint.  Their food and service was fantastic.    We had shrimp cocktail for an appetizer, my fiancé had the ribeye, my dad had the South African lobster, I had the scallops, and my stepmom had the sea bass.  We also ordered the crab fried rice, crispy brussel sprouts, and truffle macaroni and cheese for sides.  For dessert, my step mom and dad had berries and cream, and my fiancé and I had the pineapple upside down cake.    The shrimp we had as an appetizer were nice and big, not to mention tasty.  I tired my fiancé's ribeye, which was cooked perfectly to his liking and was full of flavor.  I also tried my dad's lobster tail, it was sweet and very tasty.  I didn't try my step mom's sea bass, but she said it was amazing.  My scallops were sweet and some of the best I've ever had.  The sides were delicious too.  The truffle macaroni and cheese was bursting with flavor and my favorite out of the sides we ordered.  Probably the best macaroni and cheese I've ever had.  The crab fried rice and brussel sprouts were also amazing.    We also had a wonderful waiter.  He was very attentive and professional and even gave us some small samples of an appetizer they offer and a small sample of their bananas foster dessert they have.    My fiancé and I have lived in San Antonio for about two and a half years, and Eddie V's is my favorite restaurant so far.  It is a bit pricey, but the food and service is totally worth it.  If you like good seafood and steak, I definitely recommend Eddie V's.  I promise you will not be disappointed.  I can't wait to go back.  I  am not sure if this is a reservations only restaurant or not, but I did make reservations for us, and I suggest making reservations if you go there.

reviews.author: Maitina M.
reviews.description: We had an amazing experience at Eddie V's today! We were fortunate enough to have Sean as our wait person who made it a point to engage with the group. There were five women, with one celebrating her birthday. He was very complementary of our looks (apparently, he claims women age better than men....I'll take it ). Other than his excellent service, we were also happy with our meals.   For our sides, we had the following:  Crispy Brussel Sprouts - **** Crab Fried Rice- ******  (amazing!)  Starters:  Wedge Salad - ***** Warm Goat Cheese Salad- **** Classic Caesar - ****  Main Entrees:  Norwegian Salmon - ***** Jumbo Gulf Shrimp- ***** Parmesan Sole - *****  Clearly, we were very happy with the food and the service. Icing on the cake was the surprise birthday trio that was presented to the celebrant. The petals on the table was an added and sweet touch to our experience.  So glad that I finally got to experience Eddie V's!

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: Very elegant restaurant. Polite staff but food was a bit underwhelming.  We ordered a few oysters on the half shell - a bit smushed onto a plate but definitely fresh. Strong horseradish - so be cautious if you don't want to lose the taste of the oysters.  Lobster bisque is poured over a small piece of lobster tableside which is a nice presentation but it does cool the soup a bit IMO. Needed a bit more salt to bring out the flavor. It was ok - nothing stellar - this is generally one of my favorite soups to order but alas this one was just ok  My DD ordered the Halibut which at first we were told was not available and we overheard a different server mention it as a special so we were able to locate ours to double check if it was really available and to change our entree order. It was done really perfectly - definitely would order this again  I was excited to see lobster mashed potatoes - so HAD to order this of course - I have had an excellent rendition of this in SF at Maestro's so was really looking forward to trying this one. Definitely steps and steps below. We ate the lobster on top - ok amount but the potatoes were just warm - not hot and the sauce (not just butter) didn't add to it all and there were chives throughout which really didn't work here. We didn't have much of this and didn't bother taking the leftovers home - which really never happens before - Leaving mashed potatoes is a very strange concept to our family.  Might be worth a second try if we our in the area but I won't be dreaming about coming back.....

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: One of the most beautiful restaurants in San Antonio. I had their Thanksgiving dark turkey meat that was the best I have ever tasted. Stuffing could have used a little more sage seasoning a bit more than 1 tablespoon of cranberry sauce. However, they gave us more of everything when we requested, overall this was no problem.  This is our second visit and both times we found it to be delightful. keep up the good work in the reviews will keep coming in.

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Five star service from start to finish.  Outstanding job to the manager (Mike I think?) and his team of service staff.  Reservations were relatively easy to grab late in the day on a Saturday.  As some have mentioned it's sort of a loud place but the decor and overall vibe of the place makes up for it.    The hosts were spot on, professional and saw us to our table promptly.  The waiter was very quick to recommend, share quick table conversation and most importantly pace the meal so that we had an experience that was remembered and not just in and out.   Food was above my expectations.  It was presented as described, with an excellent temperature and quality.  Plating, we all understand we eat with our eyes as much as our mouths.  Presentation here was without flaws, the culinary team really executed the meal preparation with professionalism and skill.    Desert was placed to go and we were given a small square sample of the bananas foster to go.  One bite, I'm hooked.  This was the absolute best bananas foster I've ever eaten and giving me a small square in my bag was the smartest thing to do.  Otherwise, I probably would have passed it by and never experienced it.  Seriously, if you like bananas you simply must go for the foster.  I have found my newest favorite desert.    Oh, our to go was chocolate cake which while good, it is really overtaken by how good the foster was.  The team here really put fourth a five star experience and served with passion and heart. My second visit is down, and I look toward many more in the future.  The word on the street here is they have a pretty amazing happy hour.  Definitely something to check out in the future.     Five stars for me my fellow yelpers, I recommend you give them a visit and prepare to elevate your evening.

reviews.author: Bibi P.
reviews.description: Excellent food, service was great.  Checking out was a challenge - took 40 minutes to get our check, but in all fairness, we were in a private room of 20 people.

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: My husband made reservations to celebrate my birthday. Upon arrival, we were greeted and seated immediately. Our table definitely looked different then everyone else - there was a Reserved card and it had fresh rose petals surrounding the centerpiece candle. Al was our server for the evening and he was so sweet and walked us through the specials for the evening and his favorites.  [Not pictures] My drink throughout the evening was The Hope's Diamond - gorgeous looking and delicious; can't taste the alcohol so be careful!  For dinner our entrees were the Lobster (my favorite place for South African Lobster) and the Filet Minon with crab stuffed shrimp.  No dessert for us as much as Al tried but it was a great evening dinner all around. I would highly recommend celebrating birthdays here.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: I made a reservation for my wife's birthday.  Wow, I made the best decision. Ever in coming to Eddie V's.  The ambiance from the time you walk in and the reception that you get when greeted started the date off perfectly.    When I made my reservation, I added that we would be celebrating a birthday.  When we were seated, to our surprise, a table of rose petals and a personalized card wishing her a happy birthday was above and beyond what any other restaurant has done.    Nice work Eddie V's!

reviews.author: Carl L.
reviews.description: Where do I start, our reservations at Eddie V's exceeded all of our expectations. The food and drinks were great, probably the best steak I've had, cooked perfectly medium rare just how I ordered. Smoked old fashion had a nice presentation and an even better taste. I popped THE question after dinner, and with some pre planning and discussion with the manager Mike G. for the evening and smooth catering by our waiter Brian C. it was absolutely perfect. I couldn't have asked for a better dinner and proposal dinner!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Supporting Culinaria's "Restaurant Weeks" and local people who work in the industry.   Celebrated a friend's birthday at Eddie V's and it was fabulous! They decorated the table with gold birthday confetti, a birthday card and brought us complimentary bubbly.   We ordered from the restaurant week menu. $45  (4 courses) and complimentary bread and butter.   Be sure to tip your servers!

reviews.author: Beatrice P.
reviews.description: Eddie V's is our celebration place. Anniversaries, 21st birthday and recently our daughters college graduation. It is so special we try to keep it special. We love to get fancy and go all out to be spoiled. From the drinks to the appetizers to the mouth watering fish, lobster and steak. There is nowhere around here like Eddies Vs. our waiters have always been superb, never a problem with the food and the atmosphere is just quiet and calm. Love it

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: Evening started wonderfully, up until my husband and I overheard someone who appeared to be a manager ,start disrespecting multiple staff members and speaking to them in an unpleasant and unprofessional manner. This led to an unpleasant and uncomfortable dining experience.The restaurant is amazing and the food was spot on and our server was excellent, however this incident ruined our special date night .   One star for the amazing server.

reviews.author: Alyssa H.
reviews.description: This place was so great!  We are not San Antonio natives and were looking for a great steakhouse and spoiler alert....we found it!  My husband is a huge steak eater and he is as thoroughly impressed by this place.  The service was absolutely outstanding!  Very attentive.  I highly recommend this place.  The drinks are tall and strong...as they should be.  There's a reason they are known for the hope diamond.  It is a must try!

reviews.author: D J.
reviews.description: Driver, bus #009 to Eagle Pass threw our snacks away while we were in casino. Had loud Tejano music playing as we boarded bus. Played old early 60s music too loud. Had to put paper in my ears to block out sound. Play mid-60s is OK.

reviews.author: Rasiel G.
reviews.description: We`ve used OK Tours on several casino trips. They always do a good job, the seats do become uncomfortable towards the end, I have a bad back so I feel everything. They have deals with Coushatta Casino that are worth checking out. My wife and I always have fun as does my sister and her husband. They make  some stops along the way to get some food and bathroom breaks, since we can only use the bus toilet for #1 only. We are very satisfied customers and plan on going back again.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: My wife and I have taken 3 casino trips with OK Tours. The first time the I10 was closed and the detour made the trip last 4 hours longer.  The seats are okay for short distance but was very uncomfortable by end of trip. The last trip there was a driver and "tour guide ".  The tour guide kept chatting up the driver and to my mind this distracted the driver.  This was evident when a wheel barrel blew off a truck in front of us.  In trying to avoid striking the object our driver swerved onto shoulder at fairly high speed but still hit the object. Very scary. On the way back she missed our exit and had to double back. I'm sure I will never get my wife on a bus again.

reviews.author: Lo M.
reviews.description: DO NOT TOUR WITH OK TOURS!  We have been stranded in the middle of the desert for over 6 hours and we are still waiting for a replacement bus to come get us. We had the A/C unit go off in over 105 degree heat. A young girl passed out and was unresponsive. And what did OK TOURS do??  They said let's stop here and let this young girl gather her composure and then we will take off. Well like I said that was over 6 hours ago. No one has offered to put us up in a hotel room...There are elderly folks out here in the elements. There are people asleep on the concrete sidewalks in the parking lot of a Love's. What the fuck is that??!! (Please excuse my language). But I have been more than patient with this sorry ass excuse for a tour bus company.   I am giving them a 1 only because it will not allow me to post if I do not select at least 1 star.   Sorry to some of the coordinators. They tried their best. But this is ridiculous and we all deserve a refund!

reviews.author: Aracelli A.
reviews.description: Great experiences, have been using them for years. Also have know them personally, trustworthy family and company. Would use them again at the drop of the dime. Clean buses and good drivers .

reviews.author: Charlotte H.
reviews.description: I have been on a few bus trips from San Antonio to Coushatta Casino. I don't remember which company for previous trips, but if I go again, will make sure it is with OK TOURS. The bus was comfortable and the driver made sure we had all information needed. The driver or as I would like to call him, the Captain of our ship, was THE BEST! Captain Mark Cain was definitely the best bus driver ever! His driving skills were evident from the get go and I can honestly say, I felt confident and knew that he would get us there safe and sound (a major consideration for bus travel these days). So take away is: Request Mark Cain for your trips and you will be a happy traveler. And OK TOURS: Mark is deserving of whatever raises he is eligible for. Do whatever you need to do to keep him!! Happy Travels with OK TOURS and Captain Mark Cain!

reviews.author: Jamielynn B.
reviews.description: I work for a non-profit and we used this company to take us to Austin Texas for our advocacy trip. The bus showed up prior to departure and the driver was very professional and spiffy. The charter bus was extremely clean and new. It had outlets all throughout the bus which was perfect for the business professionals traveling on the bus. Everyone was very impressed with the comfort and style all the way to Austin and back.

reviews.author: Cameron K.
reviews.description: Sorry, but when someone has one job to do and they don't do it, um, there's not much positive to go on.  The last time I was on one of these buses, the driver decided we were going to stop after 2.5 hours of driving.  Just because.  No real reason, although it appeared he had a hell of a good time going to dinner with some of the guys on the bus.    That early stop left us a 15.5 hour drive the next day.  Unacceptable.

reviews.author: Chad C.
reviews.description: Me and my wife bought two tickets to go to Coushatta casino.. Well the price as the add shows was 55.00 dollars a person.. So for 2 people that would be 110.00.so when I checked my balance of my checking account they took out 130.00.so when I called I talk to one of the supervisor he was very rude.. So anyways he said he would put the 20 back. In my account but still ain't there. So rules of the bus is you can't have beer or no liquor.. The man that was sitting in the back was drinking beer and whiskey.. Very ignorant and very irritating. We got to the casino well we had to wait like 3 in half hours to get are room we got there at 2..the tour guy Jaime said he would be back at 530 to give us the keys to our room.  Well he was 30 min late we finally went to the room it was the Days Inn it was a dive.. The room was hot AC didn't work.. Carpet was dirty.. So we went back to the casino.. The staff at the casino are rude I had to go to the bar 7 times to get a drink wait staff was no good.. The casino look ghetto.. Stinks real bad.. on the way back the man that was drinking on the bus before well he brought liquor on the bus kept talking to me and my wife I told Jaime he was harassing us and told him he was drunk and drinking he didn't seem to do anything about it. He bought beer at the last stop and brought it on the bus right in front of Jaime and did nothing about it

reviews.author: Adie S.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!  Driver indicted for DWI.  Our Boy Scout Troop used OK Tours to drive us to Georgia two years ago.  We had previously had a bad experience with one of their drivers and requested he not drive our kids on this particular trip.  Yet, this same driver was there on the 2nd leg of our trip home.  His driving continued to get worse as he drove.  Long story short, he was finally arrested and charged with 52 counts of DWI with a minor.  Two years later, the court case is finally over and he's now a convicted felon who will not be driving a bus ever again.  Not once during this time has OK Tours taken any sort of responsibility or returned any payments made even though they did not get us home safely.   We have scouts who will never be able to get on a bus again without checking to see if the driver seems sober.  (Bus on trip to Georgia also broke down leaving us with 50+ scouts stuck in a parking lot.)  OK Tours may be cheaper, but it is not worth the money you will save!

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: Our first time ever using ok tours and was not  the most pleasant trip.  First of all, our coordinator spoke ONLY spanish. I'm sorry but that is unacceptable i didnt understand anything she announced. It was ok for everyone else because they understood but i didnt. Also, the bus was late picking us up from the casino on our last day for the trip home. Really? I dont know if i will use them again, but if  i do i will request printed times and instruction in English or a translation of the trip.

reviews.author: Matt J.
reviews.description: Very tasty burgers, and basically anything fried there is a winner. French fries? Yup. Fried okra? Delicious! Onion rings? Yum! Can't go wrong with Landa Station!

reviews.author: Tony J.
reviews.description: Hmmm. It happens. Stopped in to grab a drink while at swim meet nearby. In my vodka and tonic was a long hair that I didn't see till I was eating my ice. Bartender was serving us and she was unavailable. Saw some lady tucked behind the fountain machine on her cell phone and when I asked for help she said she wasn't on the clock. I'll assume that to be true. Looked outside and saw the bartender having a smoke and putting on makeup. I walked outside to let her know about it and didn't request anything in return. She apologized and offered to reimburse my card (I paid cash prior to my finding and a 30% tip to which I should have taken back, but I did not).   Hope this isn't indicative of their sanitation practices and overall service, but know I won't return as a result of my first experience with this establishment.

reviews.author: Mirta F.
reviews.description: First time visiting yesterday and loved it. Service was great, nachos were great... even the giant Dr Pepper I got was great! Will definitely be going back- often.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: My food was horrible. It was like eating freezer food.  I expected homemade food like they advertised

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The best crispy beef tacos I have ever eaten. Meat was perfectly seasoned. Shells were good-sized and crunchy. Salad, onions and cheese were fresh. I'll be back here again for sure!

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Have to admit, I was underwhelmed. The BLT Wrap would have been better had the tortilla been warmed up just a tad. The crumbled bacon was cooked perfect, but cold and greasy. No wine. Bummer!  The outdoor sitting area is nice. Our waitress was friendly and eagerly shared her suggestions. Will go back because the burgers looked good.

reviews.author: Franklin P.
reviews.description: I went this past Sunday at lunch.  There were maybe three tables sat when we got there.  We ordered the onion rings appetizer.  They were very good except for the ketchup tasted spoiled.  We ordered three burgers where they charge you for the cheese and a different bread if you want it.  I chose the Jalapeno cheese bread.  After waiting about 40 minutes our waitress comes out and says they ran out of hamburgers but rest assured they were making some and ours would be fresh!  My family laughed and said, what had they not ran out would they not be fresh?  Needless to say and hour passed by and our food finally came out.  Trusting the yelp 4 start review I'm ready to eat!  Well my Jalapeno and cheese bun came out and it had no Jalapeno or cheese in it and it was the type that is old and falls apart and was fermented.  I almost asked for my $1.50 back for the upgrade but my family said let's just get out of here and forget about it and not come back.  So for $52 we received an order of onion rings and three burgers and no drinks.  A sign of the situation as well, the table next to us complained of the hot sauce for their tacos being spoiled.  Their 4 star review may have been earned in the past but this place is not something I will ever be looking forward to.  ****Update*****We used my Mastercard here to eat and didn't use the card anywhere else.  I've received two fraudulent charges on the card now.  A girl by the name Jessica used the card to buy pizza in Seguin.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: This place is hidden in plain sight. I live close by and have always wanted to check it out. It's a smaller restaurant with plenty of seating and a full bar (although pretty simple draft choices).  The prices are good, and the food is great! I had the buffalo chicken sandwich on sourdough. It came out fresh and melted in my mouth. I can't say I have had a chicken burger this fresh and moist...ever! My husband got the Texan which was great as well- not too much bbq sauce and the flavors went together great.  While we didn't have room for anything else other than beer, I would definitely be back. Very dive bar feel with what seemed like 98% "locals" or return guests as everyone was mingling with the bartenders a lot. I am happy to say this didn't affect our service since the bartenders were the waitstaff as well.  Definitely check it out! Also karaoke on Saturdays!

reviews.author: Holly B.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem.... LOVE their hamburger steaks!!! Customer service is great. We have been bringing family members back to this place since we found it two months ago and they all love it...

reviews.author: Cameron T.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great friendly service! Try the green tea shots! Nice place for a beer after hanging out at Landa park for the day.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: This should be your new "regular" spot for lunch. The only problem is that it's already the regular spot for a LOT of people so you better start taking lunch breaks early.  I came with a work friend and got a decent table ala "seat yourself". Lots of burger options and that's what they are known for. I had the Texas burger on a bun. Usually, it comes on Texas toast (of course). It was ginormous and well done. The pile of bacon on it was - it amazes me to write this - almost too much. I think there was more bacon than beef. Also a couple onion rings and bbq sauce made this an awesome meal.  For a side I had the tater tots which were tasty and well cooked.   I would have liked speedier service, but the three women serving this place were flat out slammed and doing an impressive job of keeping up with the flow. So go, be patient, and don't fill the place up!

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: Incredibly substantial menu for a dive bar, a ceiling-to-floor menu of shots, super friendly staff, AND , amidst the DosEquis and Lone Star and Bud, a single tap reserved for local Guadalupe beer...LOVE!  Drawn in by the media buffet above the bar (football, football, football, Simpsons, football, football...something for errbahduh!), we parked it there.  There's a great list of pre-built burgers, but also a long list of carb jacket (definitely go for the jalapeño cheddar! Definitely. ) and topping choices from which to build your own. He orders the Australian burger and I beer, I go for a much more Texan option: chicken fingers and fries basket, white pepper gravy duh, and a sweet tea (Don't judge! We had just spent all afternoon at  brewery, and I hadn't eaten. Adultin' like a mofo!) The waitress was kind enough to suggest that the fries in my basket would be enough for both of us. .."*if* I felt sharing", lol. Well played, ma'am! And much appreciated tip, seriously! ...and indeed they were. A very short few minutes later, a veritable mountain of food was placed in front of  us.  Burger: Super!! Chicken and gravy: Really really good. Fries: Old eff'n Bay!!! Yaaayyyy!  Sweet Tea : holy shit, use the lemon! Super sweet and delicious with it. Without citrus...drinking Karo sizzurp through a straw lol.  Bellies : full.  To-go box: also full.  Bartender: Badass

reviews.author: Bud C.
reviews.description: Food quality has steadily declined over the past 4 years. Placed a phone order to go today. Burgers looked less appealing than Whatburger. Formerly juice tasty meat tasted like reheated dried leather. All three orders of fries were cold.  This was once my goto joint. Sad to see how it's gone downhill

reviews.author: Desiree M.
reviews.description: I believe in always starting off on a positive note...  that being said, they played good music while we were there.   We heard the burgers were supposed to be good. Decided to try it out for Mother's Day. NOT for us. Burger was large, but very greasy and lacking in flavor. We asked for extra crispy sweet potato fries, I've had more flavorful and crispy sweet potato fries frozen out of a bag. Menu was a la cart, so we spent way more than we should have for in my opinion, poor quality food.  Customer service (if you can even call it that) was non existent. Will not go back. Pat's Place is definitely much better, unfortunately they're closed on Sunday's.  For the lovely folks letting their small kids scream and fight over the pool table, pool sticks/balls, AND use a stick with no tip on the felt, unsupervised, I'm thinking Chucky Cheese is probably a better choice next time.

reviews.author: Brit W.
reviews.description: 3 crispy tacos for lunch is the best kept Mexican food secret in NB.  LS is Always perfect and it remains a total Hidden Gem.  Outstanding burgers as well!

reviews.author: Jarod M.
reviews.description: Service was great and drinkspecials realky good! I would recommend the fried pickles, but the chicken fried steak and grilled chicken salad seemed frozen out of a package. Would recommend for,bar atmosphere but not much for food.

reviews.author: Lauren W.
reviews.description: This place has so much potential.  Its bar food but its decent bar food. It has a cool patio to drink at. The problem is the service.  We have tried 3 times and every time the server is so put out. It is not ever busy when we have gone so I can't understand it.

reviews.author: Jesse J.
reviews.description: Wanted a burger.  Came here for it.  Was not disappointed.  Tried the blue cheese burger.  #Delicious. Fries were great.  No complaints.  Wife had Buffalo Chicken Ranch sandwich bc that's how she rolls.  She said it was "really good".  Son asked "why are grilled cheese so good?"

reviews.author: Teresa H.
reviews.description: Wanted something diff for lunch at our shop and had heard the burgers were good. Boy are they! Healthy size burger is an understatement! Excellent burger, fresh fix'ns, and the bun options are yummy! I went with sour dough. Co worker had the the patty melt and said it was one of the best he's had. My favorite thing though... CRINKLE FRIES! :) Yummmmm  Burger fries and large sweet tee was 8 bux after tax!   We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Daryll B.
reviews.description: Today, for 8 hours, I've been thinking about downing a hand-formed, griddled hamburger. Where to go? My criteria: new place, no tips, local, inexpensive, and at least a 1/2 pounder,   There are not many places to get hamburgers over here. There is Smashburger, which has been getting horrible ratings, Chilis (my favorite), Texas Roadhouse, Gruene River Grill, the Phoenix Saloon, and Pat's place. Now, places where you can get away without paying a tip--whether that is through the drive though or takeout--are GG's Corner Cafe (Marion), Blakes's Cafe (McQueeney), Kirby's Korner (Seguin), the Longhorn Cafe (New Braunfels), and today's addition with Landa Station.     This dive bar is located about a block past Landa Park. While looking at their menu online, I noticed that all of their burgers are 1/2 pounders (plus); they have one pounders also, chicken sandwiches, and Mexican food (cool). This is a bar folks!  I went through the drive though, after phoning in my order 10 minutes earlier. I ordered a patty melt ($5.75) because I haven't had one since I was a teenager, ions ago. The patty melt was described as a 1/2 pound burger, grilled onions, and swiss cheese on a buttered, Texas Toast. I must have arrived 5 minutes too late because my "toast" was no longer toasted. Either it was not toasted enough, or it steamed in that Styrofoam box and turned back into bread.      The burger was huge, juicy, and was cooked medium, as I had ordered (plus), the onions were great; however, the cheese was a white cheese sauce, or poor quality cheese (I think the former). The cheese seemed almost like white cheese whiz. If these burgers could be improved, I would only serve Wisconsin cheeses. I would pay 75 cents more.  They also have chopped pork, chicken, and many burger combinations. Because of the price, the drive through, and hand formed burgers, I will definitely be back. Oh, and on Wednesdays, when you buy a burger, you get a beer for 10 cents (probably inside only).

name: Taste This Culinary and Craft Brewery Tours

reviews.author: Stacy P.
reviews.description: The best experience I've ever had!  From the manager and staff to the quality of product.  I highly recommend this to ne your go to neighborhood liquor store!

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: This is such a great little store. I always come in with relatively obscure requests and the guys always help me find it or a suitable alternative!

reviews.author: Spencer S.
reviews.description: It was my first time coming here l, and I was excited because they had a bourbon that I've been looking for. They were very rude to me and told me that they won't sell to me because I'm not a regular and then ignored me the rest the time. I wouldn't recommend anybody coming here.

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: Having moved to the neighborhood recently I've visited Seazar's several times. In my experience the staff has always been friendly and helpful, especially Henry. While the store is not big they have a good selection of liquor, beer and wine as well as mixers. This small yet well organized store makes shopping quick and easy. While their prices are a few dollars more than other chain liquor stores in town, I'd rather pay a little extra to support a locally owned business. Also, they offer a members club for a small annual fee, $25 I believe, and with that you get 10% off liquor and wine.   While there are other larger stores nearby, do yourself a favor and shop here; the staff is more friendly and knowledgable.

reviews.author: Frank D.
reviews.description: Great spot for hard to find wine and spirits.  Great staff,  very knowledgeable and friendly. Glad it's my local liquor store!

reviews.author: Lewis B.
reviews.description: Seazar's has an excellent selection and Don White, who literally travels the world looking for excellent wines at reasonable prices, is always happy to share his expertise in order to help you find something you will enjoy.  If you want to buy an expensive bottle of wine, he'll help you do that, but he is also more than happy to help you find really good wine in the $10-$20 range.  Seazar's is a treasure for those who appreciate fine wines and spirits.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Always great, personalized service and great selection--especially of a small store.  And it's clear they care, as shown by their reading and responding to the less favorable reviews.  In this era of huge big box stores, I for one am happy to support Mike and this team.  I have found their prices to be good.

reviews.author: Mama C.
reviews.description: Actually, it's ZERO stars for you. I always support local businesses, even when I travel. My family bottled our third barrel of Garrison Brothers bourbon in April. TABC required us to name a liquor store to receive our bottles, half went to Seazar's and half to a liquor store in Tempe, AZ. As "Wine UnClub" members at Seazar's we always get a discount on all our purchases. For this third barrel Mike decided to up the price per bottle to retail and not honor our discount club card. When we asked why the price was higher this time around we were told they were doing us a favor by handling the transaction at all. Even though I live in AZ I buy a lot of bourbon from Seazar's and I have many friends in San Antonio. You have lost my future business and I will make sure to spread the negative word about how you do business. We have several more barrels coming and they won't be going through Seazar's.

reviews.author: Gabriel G.
reviews.description: The absolute worst experience I have ever had at a store. Asked for a bottle and got berated by some POS. His co worker seemed embarrassed by what he was telling me. Next time try no sir unfortunately we do not have anymore. Instead implying we wouldn't sell it to you if we had it. Please do not waste your time at place unless you enjoy being talked down to.

reviews.author: Debbie S.
reviews.description: Stopped in for wine and beer after going to the natural grocery store up the street. Helpful staff suggested an IPA and several reasonable priced Cotes du Rhône wines. Smaller shop so easy and quick to get in and out. I'll visit again.

reviews.author: Carly P.
reviews.description: This is our favorite neighborhood liquor store. They are always so nice and helpful. Love their selection. Great local place.

reviews.author: Stephen C.
reviews.description: Very nice little neighborhood liquor store. The service is friendly, the employee knowledgeable, the store is clean and it is very well organized to make shopping a breeze.  The wine is in its own room and is a very nice selection to choose from. Also different price points for every customer. The beer selection is not giant but then while they do offer some national brands most of the beer is from smaller breweries. Many are sold by the single bottle so you can try first.   I do recommend this store as a good place for your liquor needs.

reviews.author: Lola W.
reviews.description: For the wino in all of us, I used to live in this 'hood and still frequent it. Nice booze selection. Overall, a well stocked and friendly neighborhood shop.  Check often for wine specials/sales because when they clean house, you score. Located in the Sunset Ridge shopping centre next to Baskin Robbins. Note:  keep an eye out for the little old ladies/men in hats driving cadillacs while backing out of your parking space.  This is a great place to hit up when filling out your picnic basket prior to an outdoor concert at the McNay (if it's not on a Sunday).

reviews.author: Whiskey W.
reviews.description: The gentlemen at Seazar's Fine Wine and Spirits are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. This store is stocked with all the staples as well as the hard to find spirits. If you are in SA and looking for Whiskey, this is a great place to start. Can't find what you are looking for? Need a small batch whiskey that is tough to get? Just ask and these guys should be able to take care of you. If not, they will gladly guide you to the right direction.

reviews.author: J K.
reviews.description: Spirits and knowledge get a good grade. What doesn't get a good grade is all of the extremely expired/foul beer they keep around. Thought it was a fluke but then I started checking dates. Maybe the good people of the '09 don't drink enough lower class beverages to keep the stock rotating, but when I pay premium price for high quality beer I expect it to not be almost a year past its best-by date.

reviews.author: Javier L.
reviews.description: This place is probably one of my best finds of the year!!!!  If your looking for anything booze wise, this is the place to go.  The staff is very knowledgeable and they will help you find whatever it is you like to drink. The store is always stocked, I've always been able to find what I'm looking for.  They have wine tastings on Saturdays, and you can also become a "Member" for $25 a year, and you will get 15% off all purchases when you come in, well worth it when you like to kick back and have an adult beverage as much as I do (maybe I shouldn't admit that).  They also have one of the best wine selections I've seen in S.A.  Trust me, you can do no wrong by going here, just try it out, this will become the only Fine Wine and Spirits store you will go to from now on.

reviews.author: Elizabethgray K.
reviews.description: I am a big fan of this place. The staff is soo knowledgeable. I live nearby but, never came very often.  Then, me and my bf stopped in.. I think to just look at wines. While there, a guy offered to let us try samples of like 5 of the new beers they had just gotten in. Pretty cool! Even cooler, the owner/manager guy.. (he calls himself Captain (something or other).. I forgot) offered to let us try two wines also. Apparently, every saturday there are free wine tastings of the featured wines.. He chooses good and reasonably cheap ones every week. There is even a group you can join to try them every week and get a discount on them.. Then, we returned for halloween and the owner basically showed off his vast knowledge of different alcohols by recommending various tequilas that were within our price range but also very good. Seriously, this guy knows his stuff and he doesn't try to rip you off by recommending the expensive product.. it's pretty awesome! GIve 'em a try!

reviews.author: Charlotte L.
reviews.description: While visiting another business nearby I decided on an impulse to purchase Vodka for Bloody Mary's I planned to serve for my husband this week-end. What a great decision! William was attentive, very knowledgeable and patient. He made some excellent suggestions and recommendations for Vodka and wine. I have been a wine collector for about two years and still have much to learn and I already know William will be one of my major resources. One of the biggest joyful surprises was he was able to find a case of my new favorite Chardonnay in their warehouse. I haven't been able to find this small production wine at any retailer online  and even the winery itself is sold out so this was a real find! I joined their wine club and since I live in the area my case was delivered the next morning when it arrived from the warehouse. You can't go wrong with these guys! Their prices are very competitive and with the 15% discount it becomes a lot easier to purchase the special selections. I just can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: P C.
reviews.description: Finally went to check this place out-Sunday 3/6/22. Learned if you arrive between 10-12 on a Sunday admission is free for Bexar county residents-excellent!  Dedicated parking across the street was like 5 bucks for the day. Overall delightful experience-just so much to see. Really enjoyed the numerous collections. The place is elegant, clean, and inviting. Despite the free admission it really was not crowded-the place is huge. The building architecture is interesting and the exhibits are so well layed out. Plenty of places to stop for a break, bathrooms at every corner, and friendly employees. Regular admission is 20pp which in retrospect is really quite worth it-you get to see so much. Would certainly recommend and go again-wear comfortable shoes!  The mask wearing population was about 50/50, but the place is big so didn't feel crowded at all. Sign at the entrance indicated "masks strongly encouraged" which made us happy.   *Location/Access/Convenience:  5* *Ambiance:  5*  *Cleanliness:  5* *Food Taste/Quality:  NA* *Service:  5* *Price/Value:  5*  *Pay Process:  5* *Takeout/Pickup Experience:  NA* *Covid Conscious:  4* *Likeliness of Returning:  5*  ***Overall Score: 39/8=4.7

reviews.author: Corey L.
reviews.description: It was my first time here. A lot more than I thought. The layout is a little rough but for the space they have I feel they did a good job in setting it up. I struggled with the item number and the write up because they did not always match up or it was hard to determine what the item number was.  We had a good time, a lot of stairs.   I will give more information when I go back. The first time was a quick hour walk through. So if you really like art you can spend all day there.

reviews.author: Nyla M.
reviews.description: Such a great place to be inspired! We enjoyed the exhibits and really got to see so many different cultural pieces. Everything truly is a piece of art here!   From the guy who scans your ticket to get out of the parking lot to the front desk staff - service was above and beyond.

reviews.author: Vanessa F.
reviews.description: The staff was excellent. They were so amazingly sweet and helpful the entire night. The venue was really clean and just beautiful.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: How does one rate art? Just like anything else, it's about the $$ vs experience.  Parking is convenient...not free ($5) unless you're a member. There was some construction, so navigating wasn't the most fun. Service was superb at the front desk...just smiles and respect.  I really enjoyed seeing ancient artifacts and sculptures...esp the coin collection and Greek statues. There were literally pieces that are thousands of years old, even preceding the days of MOSES. Crazy!  I was a bit fan of the Chinese collections as well....however my 4 star is because of my huge disappoint at the Korean collection. It is labeled Korean so I expected a bit more than a few Buddha sculptures and pottery made in korea...thought it would be more of the culture. Oh well.  For $20, well worth it and lots of food options near by too. If you want to find something to do to spend your day but can't decide, then this is a great option to stroll around and enjoy someone else's hard work.  However, this is probably not a place you want to bring young children or strollers, I don't think the experience would be very pleasant with children around. It was pretty cool that they would allow us to take photos of stuff (without flash) so I get to capture some memories with my wife.

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: Great place to go on a summer weekday during Covid. Not too crowded and cool. The museum is rather large with several wings featuring different types of art. I personally found the Greek and Italian exhibits the most interesting. Will return.

reviews.author: Krystal C.
reviews.description: Decided to come to SAMA to escape not only our Texas heat, but to see the metal exhibit. They have a huge variety of art and artifacts. There is a lot to see! When we came to visit, the elevators were down. So if you have anyone who isn't mobile enough to go up and down the stairs I'd call first to see if they have any suggestions. It took a little over two hours to do a 'quick' run through the whole museum, I could have probably spend the day taking everything in. It's a great place to visit! Definitely would recommend anyone to stop in and get some steps in.

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: Enjoyed the Movie Metal exhibition, while small it had a lot of memories.  Also, I enjoyed walking around the other exhibitions.

reviews.author: Traviss W.
reviews.description: If you had told me six months ago that I would find an extensive collection of Egyptian, Greek, Korean, Japanese, and Chinese artifacts in San Antonio, I would've laughed in your face, yet here I am - living right next door to the museum that houses just that.   I decided to check it out and ended up becoming a member (it's a good deal; $60 for a year-long all-you-can-visit membership with some free guests or $20 for a single visit unless you're military, a student, senior, etc.) and I'm already considering becoming a volunteer.  I'm not sure why the name is the "museum of art" because - as far as I've seen - it's mostly historical artifacts, or artwork from 1000+ years ago. Of course, I've only visited once so far so there might be a large section I'm missing but either way, it's a surprisingly large collection in a surprisingly nice museum. (And I know it might sound ignorant to think a museum like this wouldn't be in south Texas, but I had only seen such collections on the East coast of the US, or in capitol cities.)  Highly recommended to check out while you're in SA!

reviews.author: Traci R.
reviews.description: One of my first visits to SAMA was in the 1980s when my parents took me to a Jim Henson exhibit and I've been a fan ever since. I usually visit at least once, sometimes twice a year depending on exhibits. Parking across the street used to be free but they now charge $5 but members can can get validation. I feel like SAMA tends to get overlooked compared to the McNay. The McNay surpasses SAMA with the beauty of their grounds but SAMA also is located on historic grounds of a former brewery. This is the only art museum in town with an restaurant on the grounds out back by the river (the excellent Tre Tratorria) which is great so that you can see the entire museum with a place for replenishment. They still have an excellent and actual gift shop as compared to the McNay, which has significantly downsized theirs.
