I feel like the exhibits sometimes pale in comparison to those at the McNay but right now they have an excellent American Impressionism show and extended the very fun Movie Metal showcasing some of the Transformers and vehicles from Batman shows and movies and back to the Future. The museum is several stories tall so be sure to visit the level with the skywalk that many years ago was used to roll barrels of beer across. They also have very cool old-fashioned glass elevators. Free admission for Bexar County residents on Tuesdays and Sundays (check their site for hours).  If paying for parking make it worth your while and take a walk north along the SA River while viewing more art installations and head to the Pearl shopping and dining district and catch a ride on one of the river barges. There are several less expensive places to eat at within walking distance that are less expensive than Tre Trattoria and the Pearl such as Elsewhere and Rosella. You can also walk along the river towards downtown for coffee or rooftop cocktails and light bites at Paramour. For more art (that's free!) walk a few blocks along Jones towards I-35 to see murals painted under the highway.

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: My wife and I love art museums and this one is in the top tier.   We just moved to the area and are excited to have this resource nearby.   Would highly recommend going before the American Impressionism exhibit ends (sept 6?).    We plan to go back soon as the collection is so extensive it will take multiple trips to take it all in.

reviews.author: Williams C.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. Such a wonderful and diverse collection of art. Absolutely enlightening display of American, Latin American, Asian, Mediterranean, European and contemporary art. Staff were all friendly and a cute gift shop too. Definitely worth the money!

reviews.author: Ta'Brechi H.
reviews.description: 2019 Yelp 120 Challenge - #97  What a beautiful hidden gem of San Antonio. The San Antonio Museum of Art is the third spot on the Hop on Hop Off bus tour. Parking in front of the museum is free. Every Tuesday and Sunday is free admission to the East and West wing of the museum. I highly recommend checking their website for upcoming events or exhibits. On free days for any special exhibit there will be a $5 or more surcharge.   A few beautiful sections of the museum include. * Texas Artist and Texas Furniture  * African Artifacts * Roman Artifacts * European Art * American Art * Abstract Artist  * Modern and Contemporary Art  You can spend all day in the San Antonio Museum of Arts from reading all the information bulletins to exploring the various levels and artwork. I am happy that I was able to see one of my favorite abstract expressionist Helen Frankentheler. What a great family day spent exploring various local and historical artist.

reviews.author: Jenniffer M.
reviews.description: To start of, I would like to say, they have free admissions on Sunday. I had read a lot of nice reviews about this museum of art. It was an amazing experience. We got to see all the art displayed. The bad thing about it is the walking, if you don't like to walk, then this place is definitely not for you.  SA is full of rich culture and heritage. I think the museum did an amazing job at depicting Latin American/European art. If you are in this area, you should definitely check it out. The sculptures are beautiful and it gives you a better understating of what art is.

reviews.author: Man M.
reviews.description: Enjoyable afternoon immersing into the various cultures exhibited. The pop-up installation Movie Metal was a pure delight.

reviews.author: Florence Y.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful place. Employees are very helpful and friendly. $12 per adult (this is military discount). Parking is across the entrance. The place is huge. We were there for about 3 hours. Will come back for sure.

reviews.author: Inga C.
reviews.description: We are museum members who visit often, and here are some tips for new visitors.   A path through the museum. From the Great Hall (entrance lobby), turn left into the Egyptian, Greek, and Roman galleries. Take a ride in the glass elevator to the second and third floors with art from Asia, especially the ceramics from China and Japan. On the fourth floor, Australia and Oceania.   The skybridge is a must-see. It has a beautiful of downtown and the Pearl area. You can see many of the rooflines of the converted brewery building that became the museum.   The east tower is changing right now, but be sure to go to the Latin American wing to see colonial art, folk art, and ancient artifacts.   The museum store is in the bottom of the east tower and has books, postcards, toys, and more.   Checking the website will tell you what changing exhibitions are at the museum. On the way to the temporary exhibitions gallery, you will pass under a Chihy glass ceiling. You'll also find out what events are going on, whether it's a Friday night party for adults, or Sunday afternoon activities for families. The website also has up to date information on free hours and free days, often including the day after Thanksgiving and Christmas.   Along the river, there are coutyards for getting some fresh air, as well as restaurant space, currently occupied by Tre Trattoria. The Luxury (an outdoor restaurant) and Rosella coffee shop are just down the block.   This area of downtown is getting busier, but so far we haven't had a problem finding free parking. During Fiesta parades, however, the museum will close because it is so close to the parade route.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This was hands down the best art museum I have ever been to in my life. We were there for four hours and still didn't get the opportunity to really look at everything. It's literally filled from floor to ceiling with tons of awesome paintings, artifacts, literally anything you could imagine. The place is very well organized and grouped by different countries. I feel like I see the same art at every other art museum but not at this place. There are so many stunning pieces that are indescribable, unique, and overall incredible. The facility was clean, it was quiet, it was just utter perfection when we were there. My family was able to learn so much and experience things we didn't think we'd ever see in person. There aren't enough words to tell you how incredible this place is. They have every type of art, from every type of place, and just wow. It's also located on the river walk, so you could take a nice stroll afterwards like we did. There's also a restaurant with tons of outdoor seating. I'm just in awe of this place. If you're in San Antonio you HAVE to check this place out.

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: The San Antonio Museum of Art was incredible! This museum focused much more on art from antiquity than modern art. The collections are sorted expertly by time period and include plenty of context for each piece. I could spend all day in this museum!  Parking is free and is directly across the street. I saw several kids' programs going on at the time of my visit, and kids looked like they were having a blast.

reviews.author: Allan O.
reviews.description: DISCLOSURE: If you're a lover of art, or have no real interest, this place still has a bit of something for everyone. This can mean a getaway from reality to spend some time in individual contemplation about the ways of the world.  For others, it could be walking, exploring and catching up with a friend of old.  And for that person in need of ideas for a project for their class, the San Antonio Museum of Art is worth the time and day (preferably a free day, so look forward to those Tuesdays or if you're military just walk on in).   Trying to get a feel for a new community that I am slowly beginning to integrate into, it can be easy to drive by this place and not even realize the potential for adventure you'd be missing out on.  This is an instance where one could say "don't judge a book by it's cover" because straight up, being seemingly located in a more industrialized looking area, are two huge brick buildings connected by a glass bridge above the entrance. One would more than likely find themselves stumbling across this place realizing that they've found intellectually stimulating, creative brain splurges splashed onto canvases, molded into sculptures, and numerous other ways with the potential of draining your entire day away in the blink of an eye.    For starters, when you do get to the museum, parking is conveniently located directly across the street and the best part is it's free! If you're looking for shade, just park a little further back so that's helpful.  On your way through the parking lot is a little bit of teaser art that I don't think is associated with the museum itself but if you're looking for a shot for Instagram, consider this little jewel on your way to the treasure chest.   Walking into museum, you'll be greeted by smiling employees at the desks in front of you and along the right wall, so don't be afraid to ask questions about the break down of the establishment so you can organize your trip or adventure any way you'd prefer.  At first it can be confusing considering there are numerous centuries of world art divided between several buildings and four floors.  The exhibition available during my time there was 500 years of Spanish painting from museums in Madrid so check out the central building first to see what new exhibitions they have available.  Aside from these are American art, contemporary art, and my favorite would easily have to be art from Greece and Rome so I spent quite a time in that section.   Know that as in any art museum, keep conversational volumes to a low, be mindful of anyone analyzing a piece, and please do not let your kids touch anything (as well as some adults tbh).  The facility is clean, the employees will answer any questions that they can, so help them out and be a fantastic visitor!  When you're done, they have a nice little gift shop and if you're looking to save a few pennies, ask them to point you in the direction of the clearance items which are just as nice as the regularly priced items. This was a great experience and I will find myself coming back here for more brain food!

name: Huisache Grill
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Florencia Z.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere!  Turkey sandwich was yummy.  Great service. Love the decor and outdoor area

reviews.author: Roger W.
reviews.description: Thursday night we decided to celebrate my wife's birthday,  since they do not take reservations and did not want to chance sitting outside waiting for a table we went at 5:30pm. We were able to park close and was seated right away. We loved the look and feel of the court yard and restaurant.  Cozy is how we described it. Our server was attentive and we passed on appetizers but order a bottle of French sauvignon blanc wine. Very good wine at a reasonable price point. We both ordered the 7oz loin steak. I opted for chicken tortilla soup, tasty thick soup but it was not very hot (Temperature). My wife had the salad with blu cheese dressing (good quality). We were pleased that our entrees did not arrive until we finished our soup/salad course. Again a point of proper service by our server. Our loin steaks were proper Temperature and had a great char crust. Great tasting. Green beans were fresh and cooked with still a bite to them. Roasted potatoes were nice.  For dessert we ordered black coffee that was fresh, cheesecake and a chocolate cake with ice cream. Desserts were very good.  We highly recommend and we return soon

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in New Braunfels! I had a work meeting here and I was looking forward to eating at a restaurant that I have not been to before. I had seen all of the great reviews and even had some friends that Have recommended this place.  I love the decor and the house feel to this restaurant. We were seated right away and the service was top notch. I got the tortilla soup which I recommend and I ordered the steak with the port wine reduction sauce with blue cheese. I am picky about my steaks partly because I think I am pretty decent at cooking my own. This steak did not disappoint and the sauce was amazing.  Afterwards I had the cheesecake which was not only good but also the perfect size. If you are in New Braunfels you need to make a visit here and check this place out!

reviews.author: Dezeray C.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite restaurant; I do pick at lease once every two weeks. It's a great place to have a date the atmosphere is just romantic they have out side sheeting shopping in the area and everything on the menu is just amazing. I usually start off with the chips and three salsa, then my go to entree is the steak medium rare with blue cheese sauce, for those of you who don't like blue cheese still try it even if it on the side because I know I'm not a blue cheese love but this sauce just hits different. If you have room for dessert get the cheesecake that has melted Carmel with  pecans or take it to go it's a great breakfast. They are also kid friendly so it a nice romantic dinner even if you don't have a sitter. The service is always great no matter who's your server just expect a wait Friday, Saturday and Sunday but it's so worth it promise.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Great pre dinner drinks and a nice relaxed meal.  Very friendly service and good solid food.

reviews.author: Rhianna F.
reviews.description: Food - presentation was nice, although the food itself was okay.  It wasn't terrible, but the taste wasn't memorable.  The service was excellent though which made up for the lackluster food.  I have eaten here a couple of times.  Once was just for wine and cheese board, which this seems to be a much better place for, just not the full dinner.

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: I love Huisache.  BTW, it's pronounced wesatche. Huisache has a great feel to it.  It's cozy and cool.  It's quiet and quirky. The people who work there are friendly.   The parking is difficult but the food is worth the trouble. Huisache's meals are one of a kind.  They take fairly ordinary recipes and add little twists.  Those twists make their entrees taste marvelous. Well done Huisache Grill!

reviews.author: Thomas P.
reviews.description: We came in on March 12th, around 3 pm. If I could leave 0 stars I would. First off it was a hassle being seated even though the restaurant was almost empty. The hostesses were very rude and non understanding. We asked to be seated outside near a heater and she threw a huge fit, returned outside and threw our menus and silverware and plates (which were filthy from the patrons before, they had not been cleaned properly and were covered in food). Then we waited for a good 10 minutes and still we're not seen by a server so we left. All in all terrible service and cleanliness.

reviews.author: Kay C.
reviews.description: My SO and I have visited several times for dinner and enjoyed each visit. Terrific wine menu and it is one of the only restaurants I've been to that doesn't overcook salmon. The baked brie is to die for. 5 stars for dinner. Lunch was not as wonderful experience, 3 stars for lunch.

reviews.author: Mccall L.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite restaurant in New Braunfels! Their food is delicious, and service is incredible. You literally cannot go wrong in whatever you order so if you see something that looks good, go for it! 99% chance it will be the best one you've had.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Perfect place for a celebration, my realtor  and the owner of company she works for took me here  as a thank you for using there service.  The food was fantastic!   Service amazing .

reviews.author: Mary R.
reviews.description: Ok, maybe we came on the wrong night? I see this is a local favorite. It was super busy and I love love love the staff. Can't sing enough praises for the staff.   My issue was the food quality. I have run restaurants and I know what should and should not be on a plate, especially with such a busy place. The salad was wilted. My tomatoes were starting to shrivel. The bread had been frozen and not thawed all the way before they cooked it. The meat was a lower grade than we were expecting.   Sometimes it's hard for me to eat out having shopped for three cafes and been a chef for 10 years, so take this review knowing I'm very picky.  My expectations are probably higher than they should be.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Friendly service and pretty yummy charcuterie to go for a nice picnic we had :-) would definitely like to come back here for an entire meal sometime! The patio area looked really nice.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: The food and ambiance is perfect for a date night. I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. The shrimp and green onion cakes appetizer was excellent!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: Went here for my birthday because it used to be my favorite restaurant.  The charcuterie board was the only thing that was edible.  The food was poorly seasoned. The mashed potatoes were dried out. The meat was over cooked. And the waitress was inattentive.    This place used to be a gem prior to the pandemic.  I would recommend it to people from out of town.  Now, I will just warn them to not waste their money here.

reviews.author: Andrea G.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time about 1 week ago. I loved the location, the atmosphere was romantic and cozy. My husband and I thought the place was beautiful, however the food was ok. We started off with some wine, the moscato was great and added to the ambiance. We had the broiled spinach and artichoke dip.  I was expecting a traditional dip, but let me tell you what we got was not average at all. The dip seemed to have a hint of lime in it. My husband loved it, it was not for me. I can more closely describe it to tasting like corn in a cup. They also serve it with bread and chips. For an entre, I had the parmesan breaded chicken breast. It was stuffed with mushroom's, spinach, cheese and  artichoke hearts, served with a side of penne pasta and broccoli. I wish that my chicken was stuffed significantly more. I could hardly taste the filling. The penne pasta was a little bland, but I did not mind it. The broccoli was cooked to perfection and I quite enjoyed it. My hubby got the 2oz mixed grill. He was satisfied, but mentioned it was not for him.   In conclusion, this place is worth a try, the location is beautiful, and they also have cats in their courtyard!

reviews.author: Bill R.
reviews.description: My wife and I stumbled upon this place today and it ended up serving the single best meal I've ever had in Texas: no kidding.  Starters, entrees, beers and service were excellent. I've already recommended it to friends.

reviews.author: Juliee D.
reviews.description: First time to visit.   Was difficult to find the entrance and where to park.   Menu had lots of things I wanted to try but I ordered the salad sampler plate.  Shrimp salad was delicious, the chicken salad was good but the spinach salad was drenched in way too much dressing. So much that I literally couldn't eat it.  I will know next time to ask for on the site.  Loved the ambiance.  Will definitely go back

reviews.author: Tracy S.
reviews.description: First time trying this place out and do glad we did! This restaurant is so romantic, a great place for a date night. Parking is a little tricky but they have a lot available at W. Cross St and this gives you the opportunity to walk through all the cute little shops in the area. The wine list was impressive; they have a wide variety to choose from. The food was delicious and the dessert was phenomenal. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Mike Z.
reviews.description: I ordered the tortilla soup and salad. The soup was thinner than other tortilla soups I've had in the past, but it was delicious. My wife ordered the penne pasta with chicken. Very tasty!!

reviews.author: Darla W.
reviews.description: We had an awesome Missions Tour with Perry today!  We love history and were so impressed with his knowledge and enthusiastic way of sharing stories of San Antonio. Do not pass up the opportunity to learn about this fascinating city from this amazing guide.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: We had a very enjoyable day yesterday, thanks to our memorable driver Lindy, the beautiful Texas Hill Country, the historic LBJ Ranch and National Park, the bustling town of Fredericksburg, the tiny but charming town of Luchenback, and the hospitality and great wines of Sister Creek Vineyards in Sisterdale. All this for $109.  We had 8 folks on the bus, so it was a very informal day where you got to know everyone. There were some issues getting a few of the tourists and the bus to the same rendez-vous point, but Lindy patiently made the phone calls and figured out where the parties were.  The mini van gave us a very comfortable ride and Lindy was an absolute joy and delight to hang out with for a day.  The only quibbles I have about the tour was a) the AC could have been better, and 2) I wish the seats would have had headrests for a snooze on the way back.  Well done, Gray Line and thanks for a memorable day.

reviews.author: Rumit P.
reviews.description: My friend and I bought the San Antonio Explorer Pass from Groupon at $84, which included one premium attraction and two nonpremium attractions; one of the premium attractions was the LBJ Ranch tour. The tour is operated by Gray Line Tours bus service so this review is for that only, not of the Explorer Pass and not of Groupon.  We really enjoyed the tour! I wouldn't say it's worth $109, but a Google search will yield you lots of partners selling the tour tickets at a discounted rate.   Regarding booking, we tried to call the toll-free number on a Sunday for a Monday tour (need to reserve at least 24 hours ahead), but the office was closed. However, the automated message directed us to a cell phone number to call to reach someone directly for booking. My friend texted that number--omitted here for privacy but obtainable by calling the Gray Lines Tours number--and received a response within 5 minutes, if that.   I also called a different number and left a voicemail message just in case, and I was called back within an hour or so and also texted. I really appreciate the effort on the booking agent's part!   Once we were in touch, we provided our San Antonio Explorer Pass voucher numbers over the phone and were told that pickup from our hotel would be at 8:30-8:45 am.   We made sure to be downstairs, ready, and visible from the street. The bus arrive within that allocated time. The bus driver called out my friend's name and we boarded. There were a bunch of others already picked up, and we picked up a few others along the way.  We made a pit stop for bathroom and food about an hour in. The bus driver was super friendly, passionate about his job, and accommodating of passengers' requests. He gave us a lengthy and useful history of the major landmarks, the towns we passed, the important people and what made them significant, and of course much information about LBJ and his wife, Lady Bird.  We stopped by the Boyhood Home of LBJ, the Texas White House on the LBJ Ranch, and saw many animals including longhorns up close and personal. We also got to check out the Air Force One-Half, the plane in which LBJ flew.   We stopped by Fredericksburg TX for 2 hours to enjoy Main Street and have lunch. The pickup spot was easy to find. It's a huge bus after all!  We also stopped by Luckenbach, a small centralized area of land in a town with a history of music and German migrants.   We opted not to stop at the optional winery based on another majority vote.   We were driven back right near where we were picked up and were back to our hotel around 6pm.

reviews.author: Sheree D.
reviews.description: My husband and I loved our super-knowledgeable and fun tour guide Perry! We explored the LBJ ranch and Texas hill country all day, and it was a blast! It was amazing and we highly recommend this guide/tour/and company.

reviews.author: Rocio S.
reviews.description: We just got back from our tour and we LOVED IT!!! Our driver was Jim and he was really funny and made it so special. He was early and very funny. It's a great tour, LOVED the stops and LOVED having lunch in Fredericksburg! The bus was clean and spacious. Overall it was the best tour experience for a first timer like me, I strongly recommend it to anyone in San Antonio who is looking to Explore the Texas Wine Country!!

reviews.author: Chelsea S.
reviews.description: My family and I booked this tour through an offer with Costco travel... it was not what I expected. In fact, the description was very vague and slightly misleading. Nevertheless, we toured Texas Hill Country and it was a good time. Definitely oriented more towards adults (my 15 year old brother was BORED). The day got a late start which put us behind schedule the entire tour. The driver appeared the be in training and the communication between him and his trainer was poor. But other than that, it was enjoyable! Great way to see LBJ Ranch, Fredericksburg, and Luckenbach all in a day.

reviews.author: Renee R.
reviews.description: My husband and I took the LBJ tour. This tour could be 5 stars, but the one we took today was barely a 3-star.  Enjoyable things - the trip itself - there were only three of us and the scenery was nice.  The van stoped at the childhood home as well as the "Texas Whitehouse" home of LBJ with tours of both.  It also stopped in Fredericksburg for lunch.    The issues:  1. The driver isn't trained to know anything about the trip.  There are canned recordings that often don't line up with where we are.  Questions to the driver are answered with "I am not sure but maybe..."    2. For some reason, we had to switch vans midway.  The second van was very noisy (the engine as well as the rattling of the door) and you could not hear the recording at all.  Also the cover for the air conditioner on the top of the car flew off.  We retrieved it, but it was broken and the air conditioner stopped working.  It was up to almost 100 degrees in the van by the time we got back to San Antonio.  If GrayLine took the time to train their drivers to do the commentary (with a speaker system that could be heard) AND ensured their vans worked well, this tour would be a 5 star.  Apparently, the van the day before (a different one from both of the ones we were in) also lost its air conditioning too.    Definitely better than the hot, and crowded amusement parks!

reviews.author: Chelsea T.
reviews.description: I had never been on a day-tour like this so I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was a fun day! It was great to sit back, relax, and be toted around the Texas Hill Country. Each stop was somewhere I wouldn't have thought to stop at on my own, but I'm so glad for each stop! The only reason I didn't leave 5 stars is because we had a late start, and somewhat poor communication about the delay. Once we got rolling though, it was a great experience! I would definitely do something like this again.

reviews.author: Minh G.
reviews.description: Our family spent the day with Mr. Ray touring the Hill Country area of Texas.  It was a really fun, informative, and relaxing experience.  Mr. Ray was patient, entertaining, professional and knowledgeable, definitely worth the time and money spent.  Strongly recommend this tour to everyone.

reviews.author: Liz E.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for a wedding and decided to arrive a day early to take the Texas Hill Country and LBJ Ranch Tour from San Antonio.  Our driver and tour guide was Ray.  He was friendly and knowledgeable.  He was fun and quick witted, which we enjoyed.  Ray was great and overall we give him five stars.  There were a total of ten of us on the tour, which was a nice size. I do think it was too much to pack into one tour.  There could easily be an LBJ tour on its's own and another tour of Frederick and Luchenback.  I don't think we had enough time to spend at the LBJ Museum and probably could have used more time at the LBJ Ranch.  In Fredericksburg there are two museums, shopping, and Das Peach Haus.  Das Peach Haus is own for wine tasting, gourmet sampling, and peach cobbler.  It is in a wonderful location.  Outside has nice sitting areas.  We bought some delicious sauce and peach cobbler to go but had to race if we wanted to get through the Pioneer Museum.    Our group was given the choice of how much time to spend at each location but I wish this tour we would have provided specific times.  There is too much to do on this tour and in reality it is two tours in one.  My husband and I returned on Sunday to visit the National Museum of the Pacific War (it takes about five hours to complete).  I would suggest to Gray Line Tours to split these tours.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Adult playground right here. They have everything you need. Supply is always on point and the service is just as good.

reviews.author: LeRoy K.
reviews.description: Very large and diverse selection of alcoholic beverages of every type. The staff seems to be well informed and helpful, though at certain times they are very busy

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: Stopped in first time today. Great staff. Friendly. Helpful. Beautiful store. I think they have anything you could want in beverages. Will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Thoroughly disappointed in the local San Antonio/Austin craft beer selection especially in the Mix and Match section.  Really wanted 2 good 6pks of local beer to take back home.  Barely scratched out 1 6pk (and one of those was from a Colorado brewery.)  Total Wine in Plano beats this location hands down.

reviews.author: Natalia G.
reviews.description: I was only in the store for a few minutes and Alda was so helpful! She directed me exactly where to find the mini Peppermint Schnapps and then when she realized there were no more on shelf she offered to go to the back to check. She brought a whole box out and made sure I had as many as I needed. She provided this great customer service for just a couple of mini bottles while also directing the long lines (that were moving pretty fast) and making sure one of the employees took her lunch break by closing the line without ruffling any feathers. Her positive attitude was such an inspiration during the crazy holiday shopping. Thank you, Alda, and merry Christmas!

reviews.author: Xavier S.
reviews.description: I've never felt discriminated against because of my race and origin until I went here ! I wasn't allowed to purchase my bottle that I was planning to bring to my family for Christmas because I'm Mexican . The fact that I've been to plenty of other liquor stores and never had this happen to me until I came here was surprising.  Im making sure to tell everyone this Christmas how big corporations like this one discriminates against Mexicans! I cant believe it we are in 2021 and racism like this still exist !!!

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: The variety at Total Wine is fantastic! They always have samples you can try before you buy. John was great during our last visit. He introduced us to a new whiskey, that we loved and bought! He helped us find what we were looking for and was always friendly and fun to talk to. Stephanie Frankie was great too! Admittedly there are definitely people who work here that do NOT make you feel welcome and aren't friendly, the great people make up for the rude ones. You will know who is helpful and who to avoid. K.P. is great too! You can always count on her for help in finding a great wine. Happy New Year!

reviews.author: Melissa F.
reviews.description: We ordered curbside pickup and parked outside the store. Didn't receive an email that our order was ready but it was the correct time. We called the store but the automated system just kept reading the list of options. Finally my husband had to go into the store. Great curbside. Next time we'll just go to H-E-B!

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Quick tactical stop to pick up a wine bottle bag. Customary store layout, as I shop the location in Sunset Valley often enough to be familiar. Score on that count.Total Success!  In this Total, the restrooms are at the back of the store instead of as you enter. It's not something one intentionally seeks out at a liquor store, but I've had the need on more than one occasion. Unfortunately, in this case, it's a matter of out-of-sight is out-of-mind, as I found the men's room a bit dirty and ragged around noon on a Friday--far too early in the day to be due to foot traffic alone. That's in stark contrast to the Total near me with its sparkling, nearly spotless restrooms. If that aspect doesn't seem important to you, remember they hold tastings here. Their brand ambassadors can only be as clean as the facilities in which they clean up.  Then again, alcohol kills most germs, so party on! Four stars, and TOTALLY recommended!

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Let's face it, no one has every selection of wine or beer.  Especially with legislation and rules on how and what brands or alcohol can be imported.  A side desk aimed, I don't buy high end wine and I do. It really see any wine cellar controls in place so I sort of in my mind question how they ship store and control the quality of high dollar bottles so they don't skunk- or have any other issues.   For my purposes and my visit, this store was an unexpected visit but I had been wanting to try it out for awhile.  I was met with friendly staff, and an overwhelming selection of wines and beer.  At about every corner I was met with staff inquiring what I was looking for.  Wine tasting, a huge room for what I assume to be classes and finally a cold and shelf temp beer selection were all cleanly arranged and accompanied with more than adequate signage.    If we speak of selection, I would really like to have seen a better selection of German wine from the Pfalz region.  There is an abundant amount of wine that is from a wine drinking standpoint "must try".  But, I do not see them in any stores around.

reviews.author: Jason P.
reviews.description: For TW, this is a small store, and the craft beer selection is lacking compared to Austin's two locations (and some of the ones we've been to in Houston).  Honestly it felt like half the beer that TW Cedar Park and South Austin have.  Wines fared much better, but still lacking some of the offerings we typically find elsewhere.  Prices were great, as with all Total Wine stores.  Really wish they'd make all their locations the same size so we could depend on them.  Oh well, still better than most liquor stores right ?

reviews.author: Desiree A.
reviews.description: RUDE AND HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!! Turned 21 a few days ago and went in with my friend. She had no alcohol in her hand, and they still didn't sell to me. Other alcoholic stores are much better and nicer. They would never treat me with such a rude tone. Embarassing. Shitty service!!!!! I had a bad feeling too. Gonna stick to Specs (way better service and idiots don't work there). If I could give 0 stars I would. So embarrassed of the way I was treated and will tell my friends and family to not waste your time. Then I asked if I could buy just a soda. And they said "I cant sell u anything" what idiots!!!!!! Ruined my day and birthday! U guys are the worst service I've ever experienced in MY 21 YRS OF LIFE!!!!!!

reviews.author: Jack L.
reviews.description: Ideal for samples!   Friendly staff, decent pricing.   A lot of times I have been there samples were being offered, which is kind of cool. Not just wines or beers, but whiskey and tequila and such. Once I was offered absinthe and the man giving out the samples was the business owner all the way from Oregon! It was like a reverse Oregon-trail, I told him after the sample.  Selection is not what I expect from Total Wine, I have shopped at their locations across the U.S. and this is the least I have experienced. Some of it might be due to Texas Law, as I asked why other stores (such as in Houston) can't ship to this location, and I was told it was Texas law.   A perfect place to pick up mainstream beers and wines, as well as to try the samples (I think they have a schedule for the tastings).

reviews.author: Josette R.
reviews.description: Wine!  Well why not. Omg!  I had gone to Total  Wine for a, as in one bottle of wine. I left a little tipsy and $100 later. Lmao.   The staff was great, hell they got me to spend $90 more than I expected.   Saturday's are the beat days to go. There's sampling stations EVERYWHERE!  Leave your credit cards at home.

reviews.author: Iron T.
reviews.description: I went here and across the interstate to Spec's to see who had a selection of Shinner beer. Total wine not only had more Shinner varieties they also had a bigger and better beer selection. I think they had a better selection of everything period. The staff interaction was pleasant but they didn't have a lot of people on the floor to help you while you were shopping. The other issue I had was actually getting out of the store. They have the doors blocked off to force you to go through a checkout line. This is an issue if you don't need to check out but have to squeeze through people just to leave. Other than that go here over Spec's.

reviews.author: Lopez J.
reviews.description: Yesterday the manager for second time don't want to sell the quantity that I was looking for and I thing she was doing king of discrimination because im Latin ,. I'm reward member and I just to buy same quantities in others days and the other's manager never make question or problems whit my purchases

reviews.author: Wajih O.
reviews.description: John is very helpful and Informative. I like coming to this location because they always have a variety of beer(s) however, I have found other venues that offer much more than I find here. They do have the beer cooler that can magically turn a room temperature beer into a nice and ready to drink one in 5 minutes! Cheers!

reviews.author: Belinda L.
reviews.description: My parties have benefited from all the tasting events I've attended I've learned so much about the wines, champagne, whiskey, vodka and rum I've loved for so long. If you haven't attended any, you'll be surprised what you don't know.

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: I love this place!  OK, Normally I start off my reviews a little but I just had to say it!  This is more than a wine or liquor store.  It is located in the Forum, at the North end near Hobby Lobby.  It is an expansive store with a huge selection of beer, wine, liquor, and so much more.  They have a selection of wines that I have not been able to find anywhere.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: Stopped by this place at the Forum after doing a service call at Chili's and WOW! This place has everything what every whisky,tequila,Vodka,Wine drinker and much much more and don't forget the accessories but they got your back on that too. Friendly service and even tho I was just walking around drooling over all the stuff they have I didn't feel out of place I felt welcome. I am closer to the Rim location and hopefully that one is just as good or even better. Next time when I looking for a particular sprit or something that's associated with alcohol I will defiantly come here.

reviews.author: Bobbie S.
reviews.description: I absolutely love Texas Winos!!! I had my 2nd wine tour last weekend and it was great! Our tour guide was BJ and he not only make sure everything ran smoothly, but he also let us know about a bunch of cool spots to visit along the hill country! He made sure we were taken care of, he was very personable, and he made sure we had a good time. He also had a pretty good playlist! Texas winos allows you to tour and taste at 3 wineries and you also get a meal! The Italian dinner we had was so good. They also have several discounts! Definitely use Texas winos for your tours of wineries or breweries.

reviews.author: Carmina D.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I just went on our Texas Wino tour to Fredericksburg from San Antonio!  We had an amazing time!  Our guide Kris was fabulous!  He was funny and informative. He was very personable and made it a point to meet with everyone.   We had so much fun and will definitely do it again!

reviews.author: Nora G.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to do a Fredericksburg wine tour but didn't want to drive ( in case i have too many tastings)  However, I found the opportunity with Texas Winos from Facebook, my daughter drove in from San Marcos and we had my husband drop us off at the designated area , (and he also picked us up at conclusion ).  It was great to visit 3 different wineries and the Italian meal was awesome!   The stop in Luckenbach was a unexpected treat!  We are definitely doing this again.  Great way to unwind and have a good time and visit great wineries that Fredericksburg has to offer .

reviews.author: Richard C.
reviews.description: Big fan of the bus to Wurstfest and would recommend to everybody. It was super convenient for my group of friends to ride up together and not have to worry about getting home safely. We wound up making friends with the other people on the trip and grabbed more drinks together at the dropoff point after returning from Wurstfest. Absolutely doing this every year from now on!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: 3.5 Stars  When I think of the fine art of wine drinking I always defer to Alexander Payne's film, "Sideways." While I did like that movie it has never really inspired me to partake in the vino. Not in the way it has inspired that industry. Nonetheless I never discount the passion of that specific community. As a craft beer enthusiast I try to keep an open mind and an open palate.   So I was invited to attend this event with my partner in crime. Both of us are novice wine drinkers. Did this bias my review? I tend to think any experience can supersede or dash our expectations by its own weight. Typically Texas Winos does a bus tour where you visit different wineries. This particular festival was held in of all places a civic center meant for wedding receptions, birthday parties and quinceañeras. Personally I have no qualms attending an event at a muddy field, a dive bar or at a boujee affair. I'm wondering if attendees were disappointed by the not so upscale provisions?  You purchase tickets online. It's slightly cheaper the earlier you buy them. You pick a time slot, which are in two hour increments. This is mainly to control the size of the wine demos, but I'll come back to this point later. When you check in you are given a sheet with all the wineries participating. You go to each table with accompanying wines and each label does their spiel. The manner in which sample tastings were handled confused me.   Basically couples of two, a group of friends  and a few stragglers at a time would go through a demo rotation. Some stations had multiple wines, thus you would have to wait awhile before you got to any tastings. Once you went through each offering: chardonnay, pinot grigio, merlot, white, red, rosè, etc. you would be done. Which in hindsight probably did keep the lines at a minimum. However you would be in one line and a group of twenty friends would camp out, with little regard that others were there for the same reason.   In addition I felt there was little time to process each pour. You couldn't move on to the next style of wine without first finishing your sample. Which felt like a class moving sometimes in rhythm but most times at a snail's pace. For the most part demos were very informative. Surprisingly the wines I liked best were done by presenters who served as gracious hosts. But there were a few who were so snooty, to serve me was to undermine their vineyard.  Speaking as a craft beer enthusiast I understand every drinking community has its own set of implied manners. At this event what subtracted from my experience was having ultra pushy festivalgoers. For example I was in one line in the midst of a tasting and some arbitrary dude tapped me on my shoulder to move. In another whilst an owner was presenting her wines "homeboy" asserted himself, completely ruining my experience. You would be waiting in one line and people from nowhere would impolitely cut in. Is this typical behavior at a wine festival?  As a beer drinker my credo is to "To drink and to let drink." Not to say there is complete civility and organization within the craft beer community. It's just that I left feeling a bit hollow. Yes, lines were kept to a minimum but after the rotation the experience felt anticlimactic. I will say one bright spot was a festivalgoer, named Lauren who was having way too much fun. She offered her suggestions on which wines to try. I wish her friendly spirit would've been sprinkled on the crowd that day.   I think if you like wine and want to get sauced for a reasonable price I say this event is for you. It's interesting that a grape, a peach or a strawberry for that matter when fermented can make you tipsy. With alcohol beverage volumes at 12 percent and up I don't expect you to be doing the, "Achy Breaky Heart" perfectly. I'm trying hard to be open minded about wine and maybe I will find one that suits me. But a scene where people are too egocentric, classy gals drop sample glasses and there's no variation in flavors between samples. Well I guess I'm doomed to be a beer guy. Tear.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: If you ever want to go on a beer tour or wine tour, this is the way to go! The owner always reaches out to you personally before the event and if you ever have any questions. The tour buses allow alcohol on them and take you to 3-4 places with the flights / wine tasting covered plus a free meal! Highly recommend!! Thank you Richard!!

reviews.author: Phillip R.
reviews.description: We have taken 3 trips with this company and every trip has been an amazing experience! Give them a try, I promise you will have a great time.

reviews.author: Jesus H.
reviews.description: So let me tell you, I thought I was happy and satisfied as a customer of Texas Winos, but I am not. So let's start at the beginning.  My wife's friend was having a birthday and wanted to do a wine tasting tour with a bunch of friends. So we all decided to get a groupon and go with Texas Winos. When you buy the groupon, you still have to go to their website and register and pay a fee ($72 for both my wife and myself). Everything went smooth until we received an email that there was an issue with processing the payment and that we were most likely affected. The issue was that the processor for their credit card had mistakenly changed the decimal point, so we were charged $720 instead of $72. That's a HUUUUGE difference.  So after I emailed Richard Wino, he said the problem was being taken care of and that they will be processing the correct amount. 1 day later, we get ANOTHER charge for $720 on our credit card, so now our credit card shows that we paid $1440 to Texas Winos.  I emailed Richard Wino again and told him the situation. He responded quickly and stated that he is going to cancel all of the transactions and they weren't going to charge us for the $72 either. Richard Wino even offered to give us complimentary tickets to another even because of the errors. My wife and I were delighted and told him we would love to go to the Wino Fest in November and he said he would take care of it. Well, he didn't.  It took about 1 month to get the refund on my credit card. Really slow compared to how fast they took $720 from my credit card TWICE. And even after going through all that, I thought it was ok since they were being nice and apologetic and offered us complimentary tickets to another event. BUT, we never received our complimentary tickets to another event! I know they're free, but what bothers me is that they went back on their word, and THEY STOPPED RESPONDING TO MY EMAILS after the amounts were corrected. I tried emailing Richard Wino a few times since the end of October when we were told that the WINO FEST HAD BEEN RESCHEDULED AND THEY FORGOT TO NOTIFY US (But we never received tickets or anything to begin with). I know that they were free tickets offered and shouldn't be petty, but when someone goes back on their word and stops responding to emails, it bothers me. What if I had been charged the $1440 and he never responded or even attempted to correct the situation? I am attaching emails which have time stamps of the conversations   PS. The tour bus driver and guide were awesome. That's the only reason I'm giving them a 2 star instead of a 1 Star

reviews.author: Daubin R.
reviews.description: Previously went on a tour in 2018/2019 timeframe and we loved it! Went again last month and it was a COMPLETELY different experience. We had about 20 minutes at each place. Felt extremely rushed. Not once were we told what type of wine we were drinking or how to drink it (like you expect at a tasting). At two of the stops we didn't even have time to buy a bottle because the line was too large and the bus would leave us. The driver/host got lost on the way to the wineries twice which added 2 hours to our drive time. We calculated it later and we were on the bus for 6.5 hours and we only had 1.25 hour(s) between all the places. We ended up getting off the bus at 8pm just exhausted from all the driving. We would have been better just getting a bus ticket to a neighboring state and just bringing wine on that drive lol. It's sad because this tour used to be fun and informative with a good sit down tasting at each venue. Now it is just poorly run and communicated. I would not recommend this tour anymore. Also we met three other couples on this tour. They all had been on previous ones with this company and they all were saying the same things we were. They honestly should have just refunded this tour. Maybe we were just a one off bad tour, but I wouldn't give this place another try unless they guaranteed a better experience. It was just awful all around.

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Justin was a amazing host and we had a great time!  What a relaxing way to drink some delicious wines and not have to worry about having to drive.  Will be looking into other tours!

reviews.author: Joselene F.
reviews.description: We purchased the Groupon for Texas Winos and we had a great time. We arrived at the restaurant @ La Cantera and had a little delay with our departure waiting on a few. No biggie but it did reduce our time at the wineries. We visited 3 wineries. FAT ASS was probably the best one. Their watermelon wine was a hit with our group. 290 Vinery had some great dessert wines. Purchased a strawberry riesling here which was delicious.  We had a great tour guide. The music was dated and not much of a mix but he was able to change some of the music as the day went on. There were a couple of us who were celebrating birthdays. Do bring snacks with you to eat. The BBQ at Vino was just ok. Nothing to write home about. I would purchase a groupon again for this but int feel full price is worth it.

reviews.author: Crystal G.
reviews.description: Horrible horrible horrible. I never like to write reviews like this but I just had to. I booked an event with all my friends for my bday. Even before it all started, there was no communication what so ever. I received an automated email the week before saying we would get detailed emails about our event on certain days but they never came until finally the night before after I sent multiple emails asking what was going on. Richard also finally sent my brother an itinerary (after asking for it multiple times). Our set departure time was 1pm but my brother received an itinerary that said our first stop is for 11:45am. When my brother asked him about that, Richard never responded. Every email we received all said 1pm. So we just stuck with what we had agreed to from the beginning since Richard never responded. Forget trying to call, you will never get to talk to someone. The next day, the day of the event I get a call from the driver saying they've been waiting for us saying we were supposed to leave at 11. Apparently Richard gave us the wrong time. It was a chaotic morning trying to resolve things. We were able to still leave at our promised time but because of this, we were rushed on all of our stops and did not even get to see live music which was something I was very excited about. As disappointed as I was, I am even more furious at the fact that I'm being ignored. No ownership of the mistake is taking place at all. No call to apologize for a trip we paid for but did not get what was included in the package. Sent out multiple emails and of course, no response. Who runs a business like this? I totally understand things happen, mistakes happen but make it right! At least a simple acknowledgment, something! Waste of money. Don't ever book through this company.

reviews.author: BL A.
reviews.description: We celebrated my mom's 60th birthday with a Texas Winos tour to Fredericksburg and had a great time! The bus was a bit old looking, but comfortable and great, cold AC! Our tour guide Kris was fun, prompt, friendly, and informative - he really made the day great along with our driver. I would definitely book another tour with this group. The communication and  experience before, during and after our event was top notch. Thanks, Texas Winos!

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Sunday Funday on Lake Travis on a boat with friends and family!! The best time ever! Thank you to Texas Winos for making this event so much fun! We are definitely booking again!

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: Wr had a fabulous time! Full day of entertainment. I was concerned that it might be too strenuous but you had the freedom to walk as much as you wanted or simply hang out in some really beautiful vineyards. The wine offered was really diverse and I would definitely visit each winery on its own. Coby was a great guide, he kept everyone on an even keel, even as the winner flowed. He was fun and engaging during trips aaaaand catered to a wide variety of tastes. Bella was also awesome as a driver, I felt safe the whole time. Would definitely recommend! Would also recommend getting the groupon deal to save a bit of money so you can pick up a few bottles on the way. Being a little more water than you think you'll need, and dress comfortably. Great time!

reviews.author: Letitia F.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time and I will be sure to spread this company to so many. We had a blast and it started from the transportation driver who did an amazing job making sure we got to each point safely. The Wino representatives Richard and David customer service was impeccable and have an A in my book. This is the way to decompress and just enjoy life to the fullest especially during these trying times. You will not be disappointed and we are looking forward to more tours with them.

reviews.author: Fiona X.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Fredericksburg and Luckenbach for my birthday. And I'm SO glad we did.   The tour felt very family-run - our guide Jordan (who is a hoot) and our driver David were so genuinely friendly and we felt like we got to know them as friends, not just workers.  It's about an hour shuttle ride and Jordan made sure we were entertained with some funny videos, good music, and some jokes.  We had the perfect amount of guidance at each winery and some autonomy so we could wander or relax without feeling like we were on a tour the entire time. It is a full day after all. Jordan was always around to chat or answer questions. You spend about an hour or more at each stop and it was the perfect amount of time.   At the last stop, Jordan made sure to get me a birthday sangria shot from Fat Ass winery which was delicious. I really felt like we celebrated my birthday without being obnoxious/taking over the entire tour.   The busses are really comfortable. On the way back, we played a trivia game and the winner won a bottle of wine!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: So I have mixed feeling about our experience. First off it felt like some wineries were not prepared and decided to take us on last minute especially Mendelbaum and the second one in town. Mendelbaum were so rude. I would have rather done 2 wineries and spent an hour downtown enjoying the shops. Tour guide was fun I don't know how much control he had over the day but he tried. The last winery was the best one with friendly staff that were so cool laughing and joking with us. I think they were called Tejas winery. Overall the bus ride was so fun bc we had fun people on there ! Everyone was ready for a small escape and we enjoyed each others company!

reviews.author: Analisa D.
reviews.description: I first have to start out by saying that we had a really great time on our winery tour. We ended up meeting a great group of people and we all made it fun.   We purchased vouchers through Groupon to redeem through the Winos website. Groupon does not state anywhere that there is an additional fee of $31 per person for the wine tastings - so be aware of that when you book. We booked a winery tour with a private 3 course brunch at a winery with a surprise bonus stop.   Starting our tour, our first visit was to a brewery. We purchased the winery tour so we figured maybe this was our surprise bonus stop. We ended up having lunch here with only sandwich and chips options or a salad option. This was not the brunch we intended on.   Our 3 winery visits were great. Fat Ass was definitely our favorite as to how lively and fun loving the owner was for our group! Texas Hills was great as well because the owner gave great explanations and stories behind his wines and winery. 290 Vinery was less interactive but had great wine options.   Phillip tried to be a good host. He talked himself in circles, could not command the group's attention ever and maybe drank a little too much while on the job.  We will consider other companies before booking another wine tour with this company.

reviews.author: Yin H.
reviews.description: I'm a bit conflicted about the experience. First of all, our guide Taylor was amazing!! He was entertaining and definitely laid down some ground rules that made everyone on the bus feel welcome, comfortable and most importantly, ready to have fun! He set a great tone for the rest of the trip.  The tour itself was just ok. It felt like we wasted a lot of time just getting to the 1st winery, Messina Hof, which was also the best winery of the 3 in terms of service, ambiance and wine quality! We wasted about 10-15 min waiting for someone, got a bit lost in a parking lot for a while trying to pick up the second group, then hit some traffic, etc. The 2nd winery was a bit strange as we were ushered into a dance hall serving Italian food. The wines were not great (food was decent) but we also received such small pours that it was hard to tell. Definitely felt like a tourist trap. The last winery was an Israeli winery. They definitely didn't seem prepared for large groups and the people working there weren't very pleasant or friendly, mostly overwhelmed. It wasn't a fun experience. Given the long lines, you almost had to get a tasting and get back in line while drinking.   Some suggestions 1. The same tours from Austin were also visiting the same wineries. Are there really not more than 3 wineries in the area so you could spread out some of the crowd? Places like the Israeli winery definitely weren't prepared or staffed appropriately. 2. Better winery selection. I would almost rather have stayed and just hung out at Messina Hof with a bottle and a boxed lunch than visit the other 2 wineries.  3. I felt like we had time to fit in a 4th winery but we ended up leaving pretty early and headed back.  4. With a Groupon deal, we ended up paying $75-80 per person. It's nice to not have to worry about drinking and driving but I definitely expected higher qualities wineries.

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I always look for bus or walking tours when visiting new places. It's always a great way to learn about the city. This bus tour was really great. I recommend you do one full loop before trying the hop-on/hop-off option, so you can see which locations you want to see.  Our tour guide, BC, was hilarious and really made the tour fun. There was a lot to see in San Antonio and the bus route made sure to stop at all the popular tourist areas!  Note: Wear comfortable shoes and bring dollar bills to tip your tour guides.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Meh.   Pretty expensive for meh.   The vehicles could be better maintained. They are pretty filthy.   Was with three different tour guides today. None of which particularly really wowed me. Some tidbits I did learn...Didn't know LBJ got married down there or Johnny Cash met his first wife at a HS down there.    They do have water for you at stop 19, but no popcorn like website says (stopped after covid).   Bathrooms are in the fudge shop next door. Not the cleanest, but you do have the sugar aroma.

reviews.author: Carolyn P.
reviews.description: Zero stars should really be a thing. This was the worst bus tour we have done in any City we have visited.  The buses are broken down. One didn't have air conditioning. One smelled of fumes so bad that it has to have an exhaust link. Another died at almost every stop and start on the route. There are numerous detours throughout the tour that they knew about ahead of time but the drivers pretended these were a new thing.  They had combined several stops together making more than 1/4 of the stops inaccessible. The audio tour didn't match up to the drive. The promised statement of being past each stop every 20 minutes is a lie. The whole thing was a general disaster. I called to get a refund. The man on the phone was great and apologetic. He gave me instructions to email to get a refund. I emailed them and was told that I couldn't get a refund as we didn't buy the tickets from them directly. We bought the tickets at the shop immediately to the left of the stand. The one with the EXACT same signage. I said this in my reply email but have yet to hear anything. We spent $250 on this tour. I will never use this tour company again. Stay far far away.

reviews.author: Nycole R.
reviews.description: One of our favorite things to do when we visit a new town is to take a tour bus that will acquaint us with some fun locations and introduce us to the city. So we scheduled the hop-on-hop off bus tour for early in our stay.  We found the stops to be a little underwhelming. Some of them take you to touristy places that you'd expect (The Alamo, Pearl, La Villita, etc.) and other stops felt a little forced. Random streets or restaurants that appear to have no real attraction other than perhaps a deal that a business made with the bus company to put a stop there.  The experience also varies depending on which driver you get. Over the course of our three days, we rode on several busses and found that Kat was by far the most entertaining and engaging. She sang along with the songs, cracked jokes and interacted with the guests. Other drivers hit a pre-recorded track and just drove. I do appreciate that each driver was able to modify the script a bit to match their personality, but some really could have done more to liven it up.  Overall, I'd give this tour three stars due to the inconsistency of the drivers and the strange stops. But Kat was so fun that she earned the company an extra star. She really went out of her way to make our trip fun and memorable.

reviews.author: Linda C.
reviews.description: I took this tour on 2/21/2022.  I booked the ticket on-line for 48 hours.  Loved that it was half a block from the Menger Hotel where I was staying.  That said, the man driving the bus at noon was the best!  Music, great info, nice voice!  I gave him a good tip!  When I visit cities anywhere I am hooked on these buses.  They hit all the "high spots" and I never rent a car.  The key to these is riding the route first, get the information on each stop, then decide which ones you want to visit.  I stopped at the "Pearl" and visited the Emma Hotel on Monday; went back for second visit on Tuesday, 2/22/22, my birthday and had lunch at the "Mon Chou Chou".  Wee, Wee, French Bistro. Lastly, some businesses in San Antonio are closed on Monday and Tuesday. It did not, however, spoil this tour for me.

reviews.author: Raymond S.
reviews.description: So sad I can't give zero stars. The company is very UN-environmentally friendly as the print thousands of schedules they don't follow. We were on the north side of town and the bus was 20 minutes late, or so we thought. Next thing we knew the driver turned off the mapped route and didn't reappear for another 20 minutes (I assume a coffee stop). Bus number 903. As we had walked to the corner to see if he was coming we weren't at the sign, although we waved to flag him down as soon as he turned the corner and saw no one at the stop he hit the gas. We had to walk almost a mile into town to see if we could get a refund-not looking good. Much better to give you money to the numerous vagabond milling about than this company.

reviews.author: Timothy G.
reviews.description: JP was a great guide. We had a ball and learned a lot about San Antonio. We did the whole ride today and we'll use it as a cheap taxi tomorrow.

reviews.author: Shelia S.
reviews.description: This is a pretty good way to explore San Antonio's downtown and find out what is available. We bought the two day pass with the hop-on-hop-off feature. Our first trip we rode the entire route to see what was available. They driver, Jack, did an amazing job of giving us some history and pointing out extra elements. He had a small bit of the tour recorded, but it was mostly live.  After we decided what we wanted to go back to we rode 3 other times. The other drivers were nice, but none compared to Jack.   Even though they say the buses are air conditioned, it doesn't hold up to Texas summer heat. Sitting on the lower level gave a little relief, but not much. The upper level is a neat experience, but I would definitely recommend spring or fall to give it a try.

reviews.author: Wendi W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the hop on hop off bus tour of San Antonio. We took my 80 year old mother for her birthday and she enjoyed it. We took a wheelchair as she can't walk far distances. It took you to all of the good places to see. The top of the bus had much better views and you could tell what the narrative was talking about. No air up top but they had a cover and it wasn't bad for July. Of course my Mom couldn't climb the stairs so her and my sister stayed down below in the mild air conditioning.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Horrible, horrible, horrible.  Paid $50 to do a upper open level bus tour of San Antonio. Dirty bus broke down 2 days in a row according to the driver.  Waited twenty minutes to get on at main Alamo location to get good seat on top only to break down 10 minutes into trip.  Took over 30 minutes to get a replacement bus less than 2 miles from main location only to be almost full on arrival???  It was a free for all and the twenty plus people already waiting forever raced to get on that one.  Then it took another 25 min for second bus????  Driver and office seemed upset that anyone would complain and frankly didn't care.  Person answering phone said "I am an hourly employee" so what do you want me to do????  I want a manager to get involved and solve the situation!  Instead, the manager tells at the driver on walk-in talkie why is that guy complaining?  What the heck, bus #902 and this whole company is broken down.  PS, they gave us an email we could complain to and request a refund, wow!  Update, replacement bus broke down 15 min later at outdoor market....driver acknowledged replacement bus was having mechanical issues prior day???? I am telling you, this company is a joke.  Driver had no answers other than another bus will come along soon and did not give a S_ _ T that about 8 of us were screwed twice.  I could have walked farther in the 2.0 minutes the bus actually operated.  Horrible!

reviews.author: Renie B.
reviews.description: Whenever I go to a city I have never been to, I try to take a hop-on hop-off bus - best way to get your bearings, and find out about the city and what it has to offer.  (When I have NOT done this, I tend to wander around aimlessly - so yes, worth the money, and really it's not THAT much. )  My friend and I took the first bus of the day - and rode it all around one full loop before getting off the next rotation.  John "Pineapple" was our driver - and he was great!! Super-friendly, gave us lots of good tips of places to go and eat.  In fact, ALL the drivers (we had a 2-day pass) were friendly and helpful.  We totally got our money's worth - AND it included a really fun boat ride around the River Walk.

reviews.author: Jason P.
reviews.description: This was an expensive disappointment. In every major city that I visit for the first time, I like to take an open bus tour. This is typically an excellent way to see and learn about the city. Nothing about this tour met my expectation. I would have been better off taking an Uber and asking the driver for anything he or she could tell me about the area.  Hard pass

reviews.author: Mark Y.
reviews.description: Not an awful way to get a sample of the city and learn some things about it.   Just don't sit in the back of the bus.   You won't hear much.  We only wanted to see one thing off of the bus so we rode to it and got off.   When we first got on at stop 1, Jesel was on the bus, I guess as a hostess or something.  She was super nice.   The driver for our first leg was BC.   He mixed up recordings and live speaking and was very clear on the stops.   His narration was informative and entertaining.    Our second leg was 180 degrees.  We could not hear the driver very well at all from the back of the bus.  I was following along on the map and planned to get off the bus at #18.   He stopped at #17 and was talking but we could not hear him.  he then drove right by #18.   He tried to say that #17 was #18 but I'm not buying it.  We got on at #13 and there's no way he made 5 stops before the final stop at #19(aka #1) plus I was looking at the map and knew where we were.  I think he was just taking short cuts.  Your experience will vary wildly depending on where you sit and who your driver is.

reviews.author: Shanea H.
reviews.description: River cruise and bus tour adequate for price. Customer service and instructions are the reason for the low stars. We made the mistake of pre-buying the combo tour and river boat tickets online. We tried to do the river cruise first. Nope. Had to go to the main office to get the Boat tickets. Ended up buying them from the boat company directly as we had already been in line for 45 minutes when we found this out so the online combo is no bargain.  At the bus boarding spot the online voucher wasn't good. We have to go across the street to get tickets printed. Tried to get on the bus and we were given the wrong tickets. Had to go back, missed a bus and had to wait another 30 minutes. Overall poor communication and instructions.

reviews.author: Donna K.
reviews.description: Buses were dirty and no USB ports as promised. They promoted more restaurants and bars than told us about sites.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: We always try to find these tours when visiting a new city, they are a great way to learn some quick history. We had a lot of fun on this tour during our short stay in San Antonio. Our tour guide was Kat and she was very good at what she does and made our trip special. I highly recommend this tour if you want to get the most out of your trip to San Antonio and see more than just the Alamo and Riverwalk.

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: Busses don't run on schedule, they don't stop at the scheduled stops, the information they tell you during the presentation isn't able to be heard/understood......spend your money elsewhere.  This tour was awful.

reviews.author: Shaun R.
reviews.description: I don't usually like to drag a business but it was definitely misleading about the timing between buses. We waited at least 40 minutes to catch another bus. You can really get hurt by the low lying branches that seem to jump out of nowhere and smack you in the face. Driver did mention it after previously passing about three trees. However, there is no signage so be careful. The "stops" were ok and lead to some pretty trendy places. Overpriced for a 24 hour pass on a bus that runs only until 5:30. ‍  Great views of the river can be seen from atop the bus.

reviews.author: Ed M.
reviews.description: The hop on - hop of bus was OK! The girl on the first part of the trip didn't do all that well or know all that much. The gentleman on our second half way home was very good and informative. His line of"Ladies, watch your step, I'm married and I don't want you falling for me" was great. Good stuff!

reviews.author: Terry L.
reviews.description: Really overpriced for what they offered. Bus was dirty, a/c did not work. While not their fault, road construction made it impossible to stay on route although there really weren't any great points of interests. We were most interested in going to the Tower of America's as the last stop. However, the bus dropped us so far away it would have been better for us to walk to the tower from our hotel.

reviews.author: Felix P.
reviews.description: I'm dropping one star solely for the music!!!  After 20 minutes of listening to this 50's s*^t, you start feeling the urge to run out into traffic!!  In the grand generational scheme of things, I've never honestly heard from, or met, someone who thought this genre of music was worth repeating!!   Pleading with you for the sake of future cheeseburger consumption, please cancel that crap!!

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: I've been going to Chesters since they opened across from USAA, so that's at least 30 years.  Today was the first bad meal I've ever had there. Anyone can have a bad day, but under cooked fries and a cold burger? This is what you're known for. Burger and fries. I've suggested for years yall have a beer menu. It's hard to see what you have back there.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Julie F.
reviews.description: Hamburgers here are good. Freshly made with all the trimmings. Comes with a toasted black sesame bun. The sweet tea is good. They don't have combos. You pay separately for each item which is costly. If I have one thing to say that would like to see changed is either the size of the bread or the patty. The patty is not thick enough to accommodate the size of the bread. Too much bun for me!

reviews.author: Eddie T.
reviews.description: The company logo was like a throwback to Happy Days reruns, so I was very happy to walk in to an ambience of jukebox style 50's music. Yay! I was born in the late 70's, but who doesn't enjoy being transported to an era where we can imagine life was a little slower, a little more private and moments were meant to be embraced in the present and not social media.  Ordered the double cheeseburger - I asked for it well done and it was still juicy. After I ordered, I realized it was probably a bit too big for my appetite but I sure did eat it all - it was too juicy not to. :-) I really liked the buns they used for burger too. I'll admit, I'm not sure if it was poppy seeds on top or something else, but whatever it was, the buns were fresh, soft and tasty. Complemented the burger well. I'll find out next time what the bun is.  Who doesn't love freshly cut fires with the skin on? Salted and fried to perfection. Crunchy and soft at the same time. The regular size was a prefect portion.  Oh, this place also has a great peppermint malt shake. Yum! I can do peppermint all year long, so glad they had it well into the new year. They should have it all year - why not?   Location also has several TVs in great spots so you don't miss your favorite team while enjoying a good-old-fashioned burger, fries and malt.

reviews.author: Taylor P.
reviews.description: Came here from out of town and heard the burgers were good from a local. The three girls at the front were absolutely rude. They have terrible customer service and didn't smile once. I had never been before so I didn't know how the fries and drinks worked wether they came separately or not and they were rude and not helpful at all. The busser was absolutely amazing and should receive a raise! He was so kind, our friend left her wallet and he ran out and gave it to us in the parking lot. So so so sweet!

reviews.author: Norma M.
reviews.description: Chester's has great burgers!!!  Their service is great!!!  It's awesome that you can call in orders snd pick up. Great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Alfredo A.
reviews.description: Pretty good onion rings, good burger, and great beer specials! Not too bad for a quick bite and very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Robert Z.
reviews.description: I called in my order. Cheeseburger w/ fries. They tell me on the phone it will be 30 minutes. I said ok. I show up 5 minutes early just to find out they haven't even started my order. I'm walking out 45 minutes later. My lunch is already over. Very poorly managed. Manager looks like a chicken with its head cutoff. Just running back and forth. I understand short staff but come on. It's just a burger w/ fries. Very disappointed. If you plan to eat there. Call in your order an hour before you want to eat. Just maybe it might be ready when you show up.

reviews.author: Madeleine H.
reviews.description: I came here during the COVID-19 pandemic, when the dining room was closed. They seem a bit under-equipped to do take-out orders. I ordered a cheeseburger and hamburger patties a la carte, medium rare. After picking up my order and driving for a few minutes, I noticed the paper bag was leaking and the grease was getting all over my car. I later realized this was because they packed the hamburger patties *swimming* in pan sauce, with nothing in the foam container to keep it from dripping everywhere. I understand that medium rare meats release juices after cooking, but they should have used an air-tight container or put something in the container to absorb the juices.  To make matters worse, I called them to let them know about this issue with their to-go orders. The lady who answered was rude and disinterested in speaking with me. No apology was issued for how the order was packaged and no thank you for notifying them.  I just cannot see myself coming here again during the pandemic. The food was decent but not worth the customer service or the messy packaging.

reviews.author: Lane B.
reviews.description: This place definitely didn't live up to what I thought. From the first sight of the menu and the website to the smells as I entered I thought it was going to be Amazing!
