Worst thing about this place is the staff. Very rude, didn't even welcome us, barly spoke to us, we got snipped at twice, two other people just while we were there got basically Yelled at for masks. Things that could of been handled so differently were not handled well. The burgers and onion rings were darn good but the patty size thickness is very underwhelming. Could of just been a bad day they were having who knows but I prob won't be going back.

reviews.author: Mario S.
reviews.description: The food at Chester's is FANTASTIC... But watching the D*** Head manager yell at his employees on Christmas Eve gives it a terrible atmosphere. The manager needs to get off the employees backs, those kids are working hard and deserve a raise.

reviews.author: Lucy G.
reviews.description: My husband and I were eating a Chester's's yesterday when an employee came in at about 530. The manager I believe her name is Rose, was very rude and very degrading to one of her  employees. Maybe she should take some customer service training and learn to talk to customers and employees. It was very embarrassed for the employee and for the Customer to listen to someone be so rude.

reviews.author: Vanessa V.
reviews.description: Not bad! I've been on the hunt for a good burger lately and this one hit the spot ! I liked the traditional ordering, makes you feel like you're ordering from a small country town restaurant. The burger was pretty good, it did lack a taaaaadddd bit of flavor buuuut!!! It did hit the spot! Fries looked homemade and crispy, needed a bit of salt or spice but overall pretty good. Little sister got the kids chicken basket, it came with the same crispy homemade fries and a free kids ice cream. The chicken nuggets were little dinosaurs kinda cute but also looked store bought. Overall it was reasonably priced, I'm looking for a place that will really hit the spot and I can brag about to all my reviews about .

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: Chester's is our go to local burger joint. It was one of our first local burger places in the big city of San Antonio. Years later, it still fills my craving.   We often order double cheeseburger and split it, this way we get a "whole" burger patty w/o the additional bread. Definitely my hubby's favorite onion rings are from Chesters. Their fries are fresh cut, sometimes they can be a little soggy but its just one of the things that you get used to. Sometimes the burgers are a little greasy, but when they are perfect- they make my heart happy.   The do also have good hot dog- who would have known(?).   They have an incredible selection of bottled/canned beer, some wine (upset that they stopped selling sangria in a bottle).   You order at the counter, they call out your name and you pick up your delish food. On a beautiful day/night, they will roll up the windows. They usually have whatever game is playing that day.   They also have shakes and malts made to order.   You either love it or not, but they must be doing something right since they several locations and have been around a long time now.

reviews.author: David L.
reviews.description: Group of 9 of us went there, all thought the Burgers were good, we can't say the same for the dry fries and onion rings. We all thought they were either overcooked  and not crispy and fresh.

reviews.author: Bill R.
reviews.description: Your diatribe does not acknowledge the following: I called at 11:00 when you just opened; I ordered 2 well done burgers and was told by "Krystal", the order would be ready on 15 minutes; and the burgers were not ready until 11:30.  If you want to leave customers hanging for 15 minutes, that is a serious flaw in your customer service. If it takes you 30 minutes to prepare burgers at 11am, when you just opened, you need to inform your customers it's a 30 minutes wait, not 15 minutes!!!  Your continued excuse for the delay is freshness is unacceptable. Man up and accept responsibility. And by the way, there are numerous other establishments that serve hot, fresh food products, and do not misrepresent the time for preparedness. I will take your advise and go elsewhere for better burgers; I value my time.

reviews.author: Ari D.
reviews.description: really tasty burgers.. just bought the double burger.. very oily tho.. well cooked through as i wanted it. $8.22 just very oily will be back.. the staff is very nice

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: I went here with some of my coworkers during lunch, and I must say that their service was quick, efficient, and wonderful! Staff is attentive and friendly. If you are looking for a good burger place, would high suggest! I will say it - for me, the burgers here are much better tasting than Whataburger and In-n-Out. The portions of the burger is filling, delicious, and full of flavor. I would say however, because the burger is larger in size, the price is a tad bit higher. I ordered a cheeseburger, salad, and tea and it was about $15. But it was worth it!  Also, for you newcomers, this is the type of restaurant that you place your order first and seat yourself. I like the decor of the place and the authentic feel. I will definitely come here again!

reviews.author: Dale W.
reviews.description: Stopped by at 2PM today, disappointed that a takeout order of a single cheeseburger would take 45+ minutes.

reviews.author: Alexandria P.
reviews.description: Can here during quarantine, tablea are spaced out. Every one was wearing gloves. Place was clean. Food was delicious. So over all good experience

reviews.author: Misty B.
reviews.description: This has been our go to pizza place for many years! Their  Monday night large pizza for $7.99( may be a bit more now) can't be beat! Great selection of beers and a nice patio for outdoor dining! They even have frozen margaritas!

reviews.author: Nikki A.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a homemade pizza place with a LOT of amazing beer choices, this is your place! My husband and I have come here for years.  This most recent time, we got the Margherita pizza. It wasn't my favorite pizza I've had here, but it was decent. It was done a little differently than this type of pizza I've had in the past. Instead of slices of mozzarella, it covered the entire pizza.  I do love their ranch dressing. I'm not sure if it's made in house, but it does taste like it is. Their salads are tasty every time. We always get one. And the beer selection!!! They have an amazing beer selection. Something for everyone.

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: Hands down the best place for a salad!  I know wild! But the Apple Gorgonzola salad with chicken added! Amazing! The added crunch from the pecans and dried cranberries *chefs kiss*  Some special dressing comes with it too! I'm in love.   I always get a slice of cheese pizza! Can't go wrong there! Amazing  I've tried their many of appetizer and I ain't mad.   Meatballs are amazing!!   Made myself hungry for this salad talking about it!

reviews.author: Nichole S.
reviews.description: The website is annoying AF. Can't even place an order. So never tried it, but it's annoying

reviews.author: Angie F.
reviews.description: The only things coming out of that kitchen *fresh* are the pizzas and the Stromboli. That's it!! Everything else is frozen and reheated from Sysco.

reviews.author: Veronica E.
reviews.description: The stromboli is delish and the mozzarella sticks have the right amount of stretchiness! I really enjoy their food.

reviews.author: Mariah B.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere and pizza here, I did however have a bug in my beer though and that was a bit of a downer cause I felt iffy to drink the beer they replaced it with. But good pizza

reviews.author: Coleton S.
reviews.description: There's this little white girl they say she runs the ovens she is literally disgusting  and I'm an ex employee lemme tell you the people here suck at cleaning the pipes in the back are always over flowing been a few years since I've worked here and I bet it's still the same

reviews.author: Kristina H.
reviews.description: Let me start by saying that I've eaten here several times before and enjoyed the food every time. However, this evening, Pizza Italia missed the mark. I've never placed an order To Go until tonight. Honestly, I expected great food since my dine in experience had been good but cold pizza and burnt wings and limp veggie sticks...not okay. For having spent 60+ dollars, my whole family and I are/were disappointed.

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: They don't have basil but besides that, every time I've been here, I've been happy with the experience and I've been here several times. I've only had pizza and wings but I've never been disappointed. The service has always been good and the wait for a pizza to-go has never been 45+ minutes like other pizza places.

reviews.author: Ed V.
reviews.description: I decided to give Pizza Italia a second chance. Mistake of the day!  I have ordered from PI for a few years and was initially satisfied.   Then something went "sideways"!  Last summer we received a "blonde bottomed, cold pizza courtesy of "Hunger, no such thing as a Rush".   Looking to see if things had been fixed and a non marinara based pizza, we decided to give them another try.   70 minutes later, we received a Luke warm pizza and the insult of a receipt with an "extra" tip blank and puppy dog eyes of the driver!  I am now officially done with PI and Hunger whatever!

reviews.author: Cecelia P.
reviews.description: They have a new chef and he was behind the bar touting the primavera chicken pasta.  It was a very small portion and pretty much tasteless.  I paid $21 for the plate and a glass of white wine.  The pour was generous on the wine, I will say that.

reviews.author: Elise W.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood pizza! I love to get the margarita pizza and then order a flight of beers. The beer menu is always changing so it's fun to try new things! My friends have mixed feelings about the crust and onions (sometimes they smell weird) but I happen to LOVE the crust and my pizza doesn't come with onions lol.   The set-up of the establishment is a little odd and the staff sometimes are just not friendly- hence the 4 stars instead of 5.

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: Lots of pizza places in SA to choose from. But in my opinion this one stands out from the rest. Not only will the do individual slices of their featured pizzas. Their pizza is amazing. Crust is just right. The sauce stands apart from other sauces at other pizza places. Nice appetizer options and they are super friendly and humble group of people. Thanks pizza italia. If you havent been. Go give them a visit and support them.

reviews.author: James G.
reviews.description: Regular ole run of the mill pizza nothing special it's busying Monday when they have their spec

reviews.author: Pooja N.
reviews.description: The vibe, staff, service, and most importantly FOOD was outstanding! Haven't had a good stromboli in quite a while! I was told the wings were tasty and had the right amount of sauce. Our server was super friendly and even stopped and chatted with us to talk about the restaurant and current events. They have plenty of options to choose from and tons of tables for various sizes! Give them a try! They have been consistently good every visit!

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: The wings here are fantastic. The staff are always really friendly and nice. The pizza comes by the slice which lets me try all the new flavors. Also the beer selection is HUGE. Give it a try and enjoy some pizza and wings! :)

reviews.author: Maricia W.
reviews.description: The Owner of this establishment has refused to pay me wages for hours worked. I ended my employment with this establishment back in December of last year and since that time I have made repeated attempts to obtain compensation for hours worked. Terry who is a manager and apparently one of the individuals tasked to remedy this issue is always "busy" or "with a vendor" when I try to call for resolution. Every other member of the management team has refused to even speak with me on the phone or says of the owner that "if he doesn't think it has anything to do with him he will just ignore it." One manager always puts it off on the next and for months now they have refused to compensate me fairly for my time. The business sent me a tax form indicating they paid me wages last year but refuses to actually pay me what they reported to the IRS in addition to compensation owed for hours worked that would fall under this years earnings timeframe. . According to other current employees of the restaurant the owner has a pattern of refusing to pay owed wages to employees after they have quit. I have gone in person and called multiple times a week in an effort to resolve this issue. I am always polite, courteous and respectful  when I call and leave messages however even my best attempts at a fair , reasonable, peaceful and efficient resolution to this issue have been ignored completely. I would discourage anyone and everyone to avoid working or patronizing a business who is owned by individuals who lack basic integrity and fail to maintain fair business practices with regard to their current and former employees. I am usually the biggest advocate for supporting local businesses but this business significantly fails to exhibit the level of customer care and service that should be expected when allowed to operate in our community. I am in the process of filing a complaint with the department of labor for recovery of unpaid wages. Hopefully they will have better luck than I have. Today the employee that I spoke with when I called and asked to speak with a manager called this employers lack of initiative to resolve this issue "pathetic" litterally said by someone currently working for them if thats any indication of the lack of integrity maintained by this business and its owner.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I'd give it zero stars if I could.   Why is this place busy?  The pizza taste like cardboard.   Ingredients are not fresh pizza is Overcooked and bland.  I covered my slice in parm and red pepper to give it some decent flavor.   I couldn't even finish my slice.  Don't waste your time.  Plenty of other great spots in SA for pizza.   Pizza Italia is awful.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: This is undoubtedly the worst pizza I have received fro Pizza Italia! It is burnt from the bottom of the crust to the top of the toppings. When speaking to the manager on the condition of said pizza, their reply is "well you accepted it, so there is nothing I can do". I have ordered pizza from Pizza Italia for more than 5 years and never been treated like this nor had this bad of pizza. Proves that the bigger you get the quality goes to s**t. We will be happy to take our business elsewhere. At over $25 plus tip per pizza you would think that quality control would be part of the service. Guess I was mistaken.

reviews.author: April H.
reviews.description: This is my first time here! This is the first restaurant me and my parents are eating in Texas. My mom have the salad and soup, and steak. My dad have the ancho salmon. I have a slide of half of Texas cheese fries and a Cajun pasta. The Texas cheese fries and the Cajun pasta were so delicious and good! I really enjoy the food here! The service was really good! The price was $76.44.

reviews.author: Steve M.
reviews.description: Arrived and hostess wouldn't acknowledge our presence, continued to clean menus. After several minutes waiting I asked to be seated. She said nothing. As we turned around to leave she asked if we wanted to eat. We said yes. She seated us at a booth although we asked for a table. We waited there for 10-15 minutes for a server which never came to our booth. We decided to leave since no one was interested in serving my wife and me. This was on a Thursday around 3:30 pm. There were very few patrons there at that time. Terrible service and attitude. We will not return to this location.

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Where do I start. Started with the appetizer and went no further. Tried the triple bites with onion petals, southwest egg rolls and original chicken crispers.   The onion petals were burnt.  The southwest eggs were filled with only beans.  The chicken crispers used to be large chunks of chicken tenders ... these were sliced and pounded, barely breaded, and soggy from oil.  This was a very bad experience.

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: Not a great experience. It was my daughters birthday and Chilis is her favorite restaurant. We went to see Santa at the mall and this was a close convenient location for the chain. We were set right away, but then didn't get greeted for about 10 minutes. Our waitress was nice but pretty aloof. She got our drink order (and chips and salsa) then vanished. We watched our frozen drinks melt at the bar. Finally I just got up myself and asked the bartender if they were ours (they were) and served them to us myself. The fajitas I ordered were sizzling, but way over cooked. My husbands sandwich had frozen turkey. My daughters sliders were good. Not the service we are used to at the forum location so we will not return here again.

reviews.author: Gus M.
reviews.description: Chili's is a good Nieghbor place come chill have some beers and cocktails. The weeknight bartender is the bomb the servers in bar area are great . Ron is the man!

reviews.author: Jay R.
reviews.description: DISAPPOINTED!! ordered a burger on the app to go. Get home, bite into the burger and it's completely burned!! That's for a horrible experience

reviews.author: Asha F.
reviews.description: Sat in the curbside spot for 5-10 mins and watched while everyone who came AFTER ME got their food. Then when I called, they had the nerve to say they didn't see me and I probably went to a wrong location. I know where I ordered - I ordered from them before. Waste of time and lunch break.

reviews.author: S J.
reviews.description: Placed my order online at 7:20P for curbside pick up. I was notified that my order will be ready at 7:42-7:47P. I checked in at 7:38P via the link provided in my email. At 7:43P I called them just to make sure they were aware I was there and was told that my order will be out in 5 mins. It's now 8:15P (almost an hour after placing my order) and still no food. I will not come back here for mediocre food and SERVICE is not worth it

reviews.author: Daniel E.
reviews.description: Oh my God our experience at Chili's was phenomenal. Our waiter was the best I've ever experienced and I go to the most expensive restaurants I know of in the area. I consider myself a food connoisseur and honestly the waitress, Jennifer, made "Me feel God in that Chili's tonight!"

reviews.author: Jocelyn F.
reviews.description: Definitely the service is ok , the food is good just poor quality of service. I sometimes like coming here on occasion but the service has gone down.

reviews.author: Nancy E.
reviews.description: We arrived to this location and it started off horrible. The restaurant is FILTHY! There were Dead cockroaches in the waiting area and it was just over all horrible. Won't be going back.

reviews.author: Erica O.
reviews.description: 09/11/20 ordered my family dinner from Chili's online a kids chicken strip meal, rib dinner, and a burger with a side salad. Side salad was missing, the burger was RAW! We called and spoke to a manager and they were very apologetic and said they would credit us for the burger and side salad. Fast forward to today 10/09/20 called in the order and explained what happened 09/11/20, the employee over the phone stated Chili's will not honor this! We don't give away free food. Free food? We are not asking for free food! I wasnt even able to eat the meal purchased on 9/11/20. The employee said there is nothing he will do about it. When asked to speak to a manager, he stated he was the manager. How unprofessional and rude! This location has lost our business, I DO NOT and WILL NOt recommend eating at this location!

reviews.author: M F.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough GREAT things about my lunch today.  Great lunch prices and fantastic food.  The margarita grilled chicken with black beans and rice was AMAZING! Our server was so nice and great!  A must place to go for fantastic food and fantastic lunch prices/meals.  WTG CHILI'S!!!!

reviews.author: Tabitha C.
reviews.description: Visited for lunch with some coworkers! We received amazing customer service from the time we walked in to the time we walked out.   I ordered the lunch chicken fajitas, and they tasted really good! I look forward to eating here again.

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: The employees were all so nice and welcoming.    But the food is terrrrrible.  OMG  The commercials make the fajitas look so delicious but the reality is something else.   My chicken fajitas didn't taste "grilled," they were just a sloppy mound of wet chicken flesh. The corn tortillas were torn. The taste was terrible, didn't even finish the food.

reviews.author: Robert V.
reviews.description: Sad hostess is rude and no knowledge of being in the customer service business. Restaurant is empty but there is a 45 minute wait for empty tables. This is probably the worse chili's in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: Food was good.  Service was bad. I left my phone at home and the other two in my party were Senior Citizens so we asked for hard copies of the menu.  Our second waitress brought us one menu and said the manager said we could only have one per table.  The menu was in Spanish and when we told the waitress, she said it just looked that way!!! We told her to get us a different one anyway. So we got a third waiter instead. He greeted us and was ready to take our order.  We said we need menus.  He brought us ONE and said the manager said only one per table. After we had to ask for utensils, the rest of the meal went fine. The manager came out and listened to our complaints and said the one menu per table was from higher up.  I've had other issues with the service at this location and I don't think I will return. Even if I liked the food, this disregard for those without technology abilities left a bad taste in my mouth.

reviews.author: Cat H.
reviews.description: Congealed blue cheese dip, and half full soup. This location is TERRIBLE! I'd give -2 stars if I could. Had food delivered via DoorDash and it was just gross when it arrived. Definitely never ordering from this location again!

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: Chili's is gonna be Chili's no matter where you go. The only different may be the service. This Chili's is one of their more consistent places and I can appreciate that. The service was good, we were seated quickly and our server was very attentive.   My vegetarian self loves to order the guacamole burger with a black bean patty. I really adore this burger. The only thing that messes it up is when they over cook the patty. It's kind of like a coin toss of if it's cooked right or not but most times I'd bet that it's cooked right. For my one side I will order a side a broccoli when I'm feeling health conscious but I do get fries from time to time and they are great as well.   With this meal I ordered dessert and OHHHHH MY GOSH I was super happy I did!! I got the salted caramel molten cake and this is some last meal type ish! Like if I had to plan a last meal the salted caramel molten cake would be the dessert.  It was amazing and worth every calorie and the extra running time I put in for it.

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Twice now my wife and I have called this Chili's off 410 at Broadway on the near north side of San Antonio as we are getting off the freeway.  We ask what the wait is for a party of two and are told there is no wait.  We turn under the Loop and pull into their parking lot.  We enter the restaurant where we then find out it's a thirty minute wait.  What the !?  I don't believe in the less than two minutes it takes us to reach them they filled up that fast.  I guess they just say whatever to get you in thinking you'll stay and wait.  Hey, I like Chili's but we are not returning.  For options try the newly reopened Mama's - where we went tonight - which is nearby or the even closer La Fonda.  Nuts!  I'm not going to play their games.

name: Spec's Wines, Spirits and Finer Foods

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: First time I see the clearance right at the front! Always have to ask major liquor stores where it is at. So props. Props also to the samples everywhere of beer and tequila makes looking for booze that much easier.  This place has an epic deli as well and they sell fresh pickles which is always legit. The beer section was small in comparison to other specs but they make up for it with the deli.   Things I would do: promote the October beers in a certain section. Had to go looking for them and that took some work, other than that great place!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Have you ever been the one tasked with bringing wine to a dinner party, even though you don't know jack about wine?  Well if you have (or if you ever are), this is the place for you.  I was told to bring a "moscato," but when I arrived at Spec's, I realized there were half a dozen types of it.  d'Asti, pink, black, dessert, bubbly, etc.  I was like WTH do I do? Fortunately, Spec's has plenty of wine experts on staff and they bailed me out.  Then, my next question was "should it be served chilled or at room temp?"  They said "it depends."  I decided on chilled, and they directed me to this barrel full of water that magically chills the bottle in seven minutes.  It's pure witchcraft folks, but it's free, so check it out.  I'm still in total awe of this magical barrel full of water.  P.S. don't forget that this Spec's location has a deli in the back that's good for lunch.  See my previous review for a few details.  The food is really good.  Why four stars instead of five?  Because they charge a penalty for using credit cards.  They try to convince you that it's a "discount" if you pay with cash, debit, or check, but I see it more as a penalty.

reviews.author: Kathy H.
reviews.description: A unique Texas liquor store. Good for somethings and nah on others. Nice craft beer assortment, wine has lots to choose from, Whiskey/bourbon unique items, cordials good selection, rum is ok and lots to choose from in vodka category.  Tequila assortment is hodgepodge and not to great.  They have a great deli to visit in the back.  The thorn that bugs me is they ask if you want a bag for your purchase. Really? It a tad tacky if you ask me. My previous visit started this little irritation as I purchased a very expensive whiskey for my husband and was asked this question. On this visit as I was checking out I mentioned this past experience. Right after told the cashier what happened and paid for my purchase...what did he ask me? (Yup!) Did I want a bag? I straight up asked him why they ask. His answer was "we don't really want to give them out if we don't have to."  Really? Ok if it's a recycle thing then take the route of encouraging people to bring their own bag like Sprouts. If it's a being cheap thing then find another way to save a buck - your bag with the Spec's name and logo  is important advertising that walks out the door with every customer that spends their money in the store. It's a missed advertising opportunity if I don't walk out with a bag.  My suggestion is to stop having your cashiers ask people this question.

reviews.author: Nanda K.
reviews.description: We made a trip to this place yesterday. I have been here a few times. Alfredo helped us out through out our visit. He helped us in selecting various kinds of liquors and explaining the difference. He took his time to go through everything we needed. Actually their was one other gentlemen who helped us in the wine section as well, I don't remember his man though. Please, start stocking the Rumquila. Specs on the stone oak area has it and it too far for me to drive all the way over there to grab it.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: Everyone here is so nice and helpful. I was asked twice by employees if they could recommend anything or if I had any questions. I've had recommendations from an employee before and it's very helpful..especially when you're so indecisive like myself.

reviews.author: Shawn W.
reviews.description: Anything that you need to make any type of alcoholic concoction can be found here.  Any liquor you are looking to find it is here.......but wait there is more.  In this Specs there is a small deli in the back offering various sandwiches.  Not only do they have a generous selection of sandwiches they also have those back there which will help you choose perfect pairing to go with their adult libations.  These suggestions range from various cheeses to meats.  If you are the cigar smoker, there is a large selection of cigars inside to choose from.  There are various Specs in the San Antonio but thus far this one seems to be one of the larger ones offering a greater selection.  Any bar supplies you are looking for can be found here.  If you are like me, you will walk around the store to see the myriad of drinks they have.  I actually found some various flavors of soju and managed to find a bottle of Brazilian rum (cachaça).  The prices are good and they offer a military discount.  There is also a rewards program.  I know what you are thinking.  If you in there that much that you need a reward card, then you (fill in your judging thoughts). A good place to get lost and find your favorite drink at very reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Joey P.
reviews.description: WOW, this place is great!  Just got my Spec's card today :D I can't wait to start using the crap out of it this weekend!  Up to this point I have always been pretty loyal to Gabriel's, and no disrespect but this place is way cooler!  The deli foods look really good, I was wondering why we didn't come here for lunch instead!  The alcohol prices look great, I always try to compare prices at each liquor store that I visit.  Just like the Gabriel's on 1604, Spec's has two separate prices, one being lower than the other, and all you need is your Spec's card for the additional discount, which is absolutely free to sign up for.  The lady who signed me up also told me that they have special promotions for card holders as well.  I loved the truffles; love the variety of gift-sets; love that they have a HUGE selection of beer, wine, spirits, and ales; love that they've got coffee beans for sale a-la-carte style; love the friendliness of all of the staff members.  LOVE this place!  Highly recommended to anyone, even if you are not a drinker, you are guaranteed to find something you like.

reviews.author: Stephanie N.
reviews.description: First time here! Love their variety of Japanese whiskey :) And i saved 5% paying with CASH!!

reviews.author: Tandy G.
reviews.description: Spec's is one of my favorite go-to lunch places during the work week. The cheese alone makes it worth the trip. Pricing and portions are adequate. The jalapeño cheese bread is a must. You must pay up front before you can get the food at the deli, but that gives you time to browse the candy selection up front.   Downsides can be they change up the menu, not all items are available consistently. As of June 2017, Peppered BLT is gone. :/  Oh well, maybe I'll find something new.

reviews.author: Danny G.
reviews.description: Ive been to other specs and this location employees doesnt seem like their happy at all.

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Gathered items on shopping list for holidays and birthdays at this location. Friendly service no complaints!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: The Northside has been the happening spot as of late. With the addition of The Big Hops Growler on Huebner Road, the influence of the craft brews, wines and spirits on our lives is growing more intense and popular with each day. And while the HEB on DeZavala Road has a pretty decent array of beers and wines to quench the most discerning palate, SPEC'S is the way to go.       This SPEC'S location always reminds me of the one I went to in Austin. It has a pretty diverse selection of beers, wines and spirits alongside elegantly displayed chocolates and cheeses. Unlike the one at Rector, this one is more vast. The lanes open with shelves and shelves of products. There are fancy tequilas, Hennessey, whiskeys, rums etc. with prices to match. They have the customary two buck chuck. Or you can splurge on a high end vodka meant for that special office party to impress your boss and coworkers.   Throughout the store each section is manned by workers who specialize in that particular department.  I'm a beer person myself, so I tend to gravitate toward that location of the store. They have a quite impressive selection of craft beers veering towards Texas, foreign, regional, national and hard to find stuff. On hand they have Trappist Ales, Barleywine, Stouts, IPA's by breweries like Rogue, Southern -Tier, Karbach, Ranger Creek, Mikkeller, Stone, Prairie etc. It is quite a stellar selection of kind brews.    The service is good here and the employees are knowledgeable. And of course you get a deal when you pay with cash or debit. Which is pretty cool right about now. While I do like this place, the sheer volume of items is worth the drive, I do like the one on Rector. It has a more personable touch than this one. Sometimes I have noticed at this location it can suffer from that whole frat boy vibe ala UTSA (I'm not hating, I myself graduated from there!) and they can clog up the aisles. Still when I look and see the selection the other patrons are deliberating on, I have come to the realization that we are all here on the same mission: to find good drink at good prices.   I like SPEC'S, particularly this location. Good products, good service and good prices for all. Total Wine and More. Gabriel's Superstore. Pig Liquors. Many locations of SPEC'S and more to come. Our city is no longer the Heavy Metal Capital of Texas, but now more readily and quickly being recognized as the drinking capital as well...\m/

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: Great prices! Great selection! Knowledgeable staff! Save 5% off all purchases when you pay with cash, debit, or check. Get a Spec's savings card (just a rewards card, not a credit thing) and save on items that are on sale!  Tastings of select wine and liquor usually every Friday's and Saturday's.    Downside I've noticed about this location...not real great about maintaining their shelves appearance. Maybe they are understaffed? I don't know but last night I saw 2 guys working in liquor area but the shelves were a mess!! Nobody fronting or filling empty spots on the shelves. Nobody available to help customers in beer section and Lots of people wandering that area. However, right before leaving beer section with our selection, we noticed someone inside the beer cooler. He was working hard to stock the empty spots in the cooler windows!! So, GOOD FOR YOU, DUDE, FOR TAKING CARE OF BUSINESS!!  Just wish someone else was outside the cooler helping customers, but at least YOU were doing what you were supposed to do!!  Spec's management, you need to work on having your shelves maintained and fully staffed to help customers!

reviews.author: Andrea A.
reviews.description: I went in Wednesday night after work to get margarita ingredients. I'm embarrassed to admit that I'm 10+ years over the legal drinking age and I just got around to trying a margarita. As such, I'm a total novice and didn't know what to get. I hastily Google searched "best tequila for margaritas" and was hit with a million results. Thankfully, I found a super helpful employee to assist rather than Google. I wish I would have gotten his name but he was a middle aged gentlemen with short graying hair and he was so kind and thoughtful as I bumbled my way through the store. He didn't make me feel stupid for my lack of knowledge when it comes to alcohol and was just really non-judgmental and had such a calm vibe. I can't even begin tell you how much I appreciated his suggestions. And he was spot on because the margaritas I've been making at home are delicious! I will definitely go here again when I need more.

reviews.author: Jhosselin A.
reviews.description: I went to Spec's with my wife yesterday. We went to look for some of texas finest wine. Luckily we found it. On our way to the check out an employee tries flirting with my wife and gets in front of her and she's trying to walk around him and he tries to talk to her. I'm behind her watching this unfold. I look at him and I ask him "what are you doing?" My wife is already uncomfortable. He responds with "I'm just messing with her" his professionalism was no where to be found. And his action was completely unappreciated

reviews.author: Amy R.
reviews.description: SPECS, I LOVE YOU.  I have to admit, I have never stepped a foot inside of Spec's. I've heard fantastic things from friends and co-workers about the one over in The Forum so when I saw one was being built by my house, I was pretty excited to be one of those people who bragged about how awesome Specs is! ;)  My first trip here was actually before it even opened. The sign was up, there were minimal cars out front so I wasn't actually sure if it was open or closed. When I walked up to the door, the guy said they were having a soft opening and they actually didn't have any alcohol yet, just food. I passed on going in because I originally wanted a bottle of wine and didn't want to buy anything unnecessary, didn't realize at that time that they have SO MUCH MORE then just alcohol.  When I went back, I probably spent about an hour just browsing the different aisles and all the fine foods they had in the back. It was pretty shocking to me! I'm from England and it's pretty hard to find British food, especially at British restaurants (which there's only one or two in San Antonio anyways) and most of the time, the price is marked up ridiculously. Specs had an awesome selection of foreign foods, including chocolates and frozen meals. It was just fantastic.   Employees are so helpful. I was just here yesterday trying to pick out a Riesling and the man helping me was asking a bunch of different questions about what I'm looking for, he picked out a really yummy one, gave me two different options, a $20 or $10 so wasn't just trying to get me to pay an arm and a leg for a bottle of wine, which made me happy.  Also, if you have kiddos - they have a shopping cart with a miniature car attached in the front, total bonus and another reason why I love Specs. Keeps my 2 year old happy while I browse for wine!! ;) One of my favorite places in SA and would advise anyone to check it out.

reviews.author: Austin F.
reviews.description: Cashier Marisa needs a attitude adjustment. Won't ever shop here again, total wine has better prices and friendlier staff.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: This place is HUGE! It has everything you could ever want or need (at least as far as alcohol goes).   There are so many craft beers here, and I've seen most of the local beers here as well. The prices are great, and even better if you use cash or debit. They offer a rewards program, and they also have wine tastings one Wednesday a month. The tastings offer small bites from the deli, and it's all FREE!  Spec's also has coffee beans - a large selection - and many of them are quite great. Beware though, they are not self service, so it can take some time to get them.   I haven't tried any of the food (except for the small tasting at the wine event), but it always looks good!

reviews.author: Jai C.
reviews.description: I'm perhaps the only non-drinker who loves to shop at Spec's.  Go friggin' figure.  Alright, so I'm not a total non-drinker; however, I did notice that the past couple of times I've been here I bought Sprecher's cherry coke and bar nuts.  Seriously????    Even the cashier asked me right before she started checking me out, "Do you know about our rewards card?"   Me: "No.  I didn't know you had one."   Nice cashier lady: "Yeah.  It's actually pretty good."   Pause.  **Looks over my purchases** Pause.  **Still scans**  Pause.  **One final look-through**  Nice cashier lady: "So uhm.... yeah, you don't have any items here that are eligible for discounts SOOooooooo...  yeah, we have one."    **Quickly checks me out of her line**

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: It is time to start to enjoy your visits to the wine, spirits, and finer foods store.  Spec's has now arrived inside of the 1604 loop and not a day too soon.    If you are persnickety about, well, your wine, spirits, and finer foods, then you're in luck.  Not only does Spec's offer an expansive variety in each of these categories, the staff is incredibly helpful.  And knowledgeable.    Fitting that they opened on the 4th of July.  We are freed from the other San Antonio standards and now have some variety.  During today's impromptu and unanticipated visit, I was asked very politely by no less than two staff whether I needed any help.  I was pleasantly surprised that the service was consistent with the excellent help I have received at other Spec's and they had only been open for four hours!  Now that is something to toast to!  Salud!

reviews.author: Beatrice P.
reviews.description: We get everything from everywhere here! If you can't get it they find it for you. The staff is amazing and always helping everyone. Even when I'm not sure what I want they lead me to things from past assignments overseas that I thought we would never enjoy agin. I honestly love the atmosphere of this store.  The only bad rating I see is from some joker who lives in Florida. Thanks for complaining about carts Corey C. Like the rest of the free world use hand sanitizer and stop complaining about petty things when our stores are amazing!!!!

reviews.author: Artists W.
reviews.description: Honestly I want to give a big shout to Mike. I walked in the store he greeted me then assisted me what I was looking for. He walked me over the aisle the item was out of stock. I asked him should I try something else but he advised he never tried the drink I was referring to within a seconds into the convo he noticed the original drink I came for was at the top of the shelf, grabbed a ladder and proceeded to give me the bottle. That really made me happy bc I've been looking for this bottle or Rose for a while. Thanks Mike

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: If you are buying in bulk, read:  Staff was great at helping us out but beware that you may not be informed that the store will only refund you $500 cash for returns. The rest will go on a Total Wine gift card.  We shopped here for our wedding at the beginning of November 2021 and found out about this local, store policy at the time we were returning the product. It especially impacted us since we were encouraged to buy more alcohol than necessary even after we disclosed our wedding guest count had decreased significantly.  Further, the manager reluctantly refunded us in full and hung up the phone on us after we thanked her and were polite.  I've always shopped here but may go elsewhere in the future.

reviews.author: Dale M.
reviews.description: The last two times I've gone in I can never get any help in this location.  All the employees are standing around talking to each other or they ignore you.  I've always been a good customer but have started going to Specs in Leon Springs where there is much better customer service.

reviews.author: Kassie O.
reviews.description: You can Almost Always find what You are looking for! Or the Awesome Employees are Happy to look into whatever it is they are out of stock of get you an answer as to when it will be restocked!

reviews.author: Janie F.
reviews.description: Love Total Wine, I just wish they carried Sauza 100% Agave white Tequila at Memorial Location. Also deceiving that they deliver free if you purchase $99 but only if you purchase wine! Otherwise I love it, my place to shop for my booze!

reviews.author: Grace T.
reviews.description: This is my family's go to when we need alcohol. They have an awesome selection of wine, beer, cider, and liquor ranging from the cheap of the cheap to the best of the best. Something for everyone. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. They have classes you can sign up for too. My parents have taken a few classes with the staff and they've loved them. Everything from pairing for wine to whisky tasting.

reviews.author: Kara S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough good things about my recent visit to Total Wine. Jose G. was extremely helpful not only to me but to other customers as well. He knew the store very well and helped customers find exactly what they were looking for. He went out of his way to answer any questions I had while also recommending great things to try right now that I bought and in the future. I love learning about wine and spirits and learned more in the few minutes I was speaking with him than at any distillery. He not only made great suggestions but gave me options at multiple price points and told me how many different drinks I could use them with. I have always loved total wine but this experience really cemented that I will be purchasing all my wine liquor and beer from here going forward.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: This is my favorite store to pick up wine and liquor. It's definitely more customer friendly than specs and has a bigger variety than a grocery store. If you need help picking your wine Clay is your guy to go to he gives great recommendations and he keeps you within your price point last time we went he recommended all six wines for me and we loved them all. We just went today and he recommended some Pinot noir some reds and even some French wine.

reviews.author: Hailey Q.
reviews.description: Great selection, young lady at the register was rude and had a terrible attitude. Although the other employees helped me find what I needed and asked me if I needed help, the cashier ruined the whole experience.

reviews.author: Muriel S.
reviews.description: My brain was on overdrive. I knew just what I wanted and they got it for me. The variety is vast and the selections are to die for. They had a great local wine to sample and before I left I had a few bottles to drink and share. A lovely surprise that brought smiles to many faces. I think they are one of the best at allowing you to try many things without breaking The bank.,

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: Raymond was the most high quality employee that has ever helped me out at Total Wine. He gave me a tour of every isle, pinpointing the specific preference I had about wines and specific alcohols!

reviews.author: Darren R.
reviews.description: I love the variety wines and spirits I have a better selection specs and that's surprising

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: They have it all and then some. The place is so well organized and it's huge,the staff know their stuff and are professional. They have huge selection of wine and they have all kinds of Bourbon,Rye,Tequila,Gin,Whiskey and much more from low prices to very expensive like I saw a bottle of Tequila behind a glass cabinet for like $2500!  I went there recently to buy Luxardo Cherries for my Old Fashions and I found that they have Humidor with nice selection of premium cigars so it eliminates two stops in case I am in the mood for a nice cigar with my old fashion I don't have to stop at Cigar shop and traffic in this area can get little crazy so less stops the more better. I am not a frequent shopper here but I might stop by more cause they have a nice Humidor now and I think their prices are little cheaper than most places or competitive. Like to mention that all ready Jell-O shots,Buttery Nipple shots and few more I can't remember the name but have some funny names like for example Twisted Shots and Miami Vice Shots in a 15 count package which come in different flavors and  Wine and More has all your party accessories for your New Years Eve Party!! I am coming back for some party shots!! Oh I just found a bottle Cognac for $3999. Look up there Web Site you can type in whatever your looking for and it will show a pic and description but I recommend you go there instead oh and they have on line pickup too. I have no pics for this review but if you go there you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Melody M.
reviews.description: I walked up to a group of staff, about 4 of them, I asked for assistance looking for a particular wine. They all starred at me with a 30 second awkward silence. Pablo wasn't interested in helping me but the manager Katie was willing to help.

reviews.author: Patty R.
reviews.description: Do not come to this store!!!! People are extremely rude!!!!!! Not willing to be courteous whatsoever!!!! I refuse to ever shop here again!!!! I'd post zero stars if I could

reviews.author: Sam S.
reviews.description: Total wine is my favorite Wine store in San Antonio. The assortment is great and they have good service. They offer wine tastings throughout the month and have a good liquor and spirits selection.   The price range is good for the majority of consumers and the aisles are easily to navigate.

reviews.author: Melissa E.
reviews.description: I'm new to Total Wine and More but I love it already. Each staff member knows so much about their products. If they don't know they know exactly who to ask. Signs throughout the store give you taste suggestions and comparisons to similar products. There are so many products that if you leave empty handed it's your own fault. At almost every visit I am greeted by a vendor representative giving samples. At my last visit, signs listed products you could taste before you buy. The sales woman is also able to give you a history of the maker and other products by that maker. It's so satisfying buying a product you already know tastes great! Tasting classes are offerred almost daily, which I would like to try sometime soon. Other liquor stores cannot compare to the stock availability at Total Wine. I was previously on a wild goose chase for Pearl beer and Total Wine had it. I also wanted a bottle of one of my favorite wines and Total Wine satisfied. There's really no reason to shop elsewhere for your adult beverage needs.

reviews.author: Cory C.
reviews.description: Weren't wiling down carts during the pandemic. Could be spreading infection to everyone that uses certain carts. Unfortunate because it's a good store.

reviews.author: Ben B.
reviews.description: I first learned of Total Wine while living in AZ. I was thrilled to see it move to TX!  I drive way out of my way to get here but the savings are well worth it. If you can find lower prices anywhere, please share!  I'm not sure you can.   The staff are always helpful and know their stuff. I get wine and kegs here. I'm a Costco nut but even Costco's prices don't compare.   Caution!  Go there on a Saturday and you might walk out buzzed. Think Costco sample stations only liqour!   Cheers.

reviews.author: Marne D.
reviews.description: So excited!! Acoustic 57 is playing hope they are inside tonight. Heading down there soon. looking forward to hearing this group again, awesome. Good to have some family joining us on this Thanksgiving weekend

reviews.author: Megan A.
reviews.description: It's was a great distillery with great space for performances and to enjoy downtown. The cigar lounge is super cool and I hope I can enjoy it more since I was outside. It honestly didn't feel like I was sitting outside! Nice bartenders!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Remarkable whiskey; however, the server was quite hostile. I enjoyed the 1920s era vibe and the distillery architecture is quite fascinating. If you see my photos, you will notice a lipstick stain or an unknown stain which was quite alarming, on the rim of the glass.. Not sure if it was put there to add some color to the glass or if my glass was not entirely washed throughly. With Covid still around this was absolutely absurd.

reviews.author: Tenecqua D.
reviews.description: I happened upon this gem by chance. I headed downtown with another destination in mind but while parking my car I heard a jazz band playing. At that moment I decided to give Devils River Distillery a try. There is outdoor seating but I decided to sit inside, in a spot where I could still hear the music but where it wasn't loud too loud to have a conversation. You had to go to the bar to order drinks. They had a menu of mixed drinks using Devils River of course. There is also the option to do whiskey flights or tastings. I decided on the Rasmanian Devil. A drink with whiskey, raspberry and lemon. This drink was very refreshing. Next time I'll be game to do a tasting. The ambiance was cool and I met a cool couple while chillin. I'll definitely be back and bring some friends.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: I've walked past this place many times and I never walked inside. I was missing out on a gem. They serve whiskey and cocktails. The coffee whiskey was delicious and the bar tender was very friendly. The decor of the place is super nice and you must check out the basement when you are there. This is a hidden gem and more people need to stop by for a drink.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Gotta Say... this place is a must go to. Clayton was super chill and the vibe here is great. Had several drinks and each was better than the next. If your in town please stop in and show your appreciation for a local spot.

reviews.author: Jill S.
reviews.description: Great whiskey, so smooth and the bartender was super friendly and knowledgeable.  Try the boulevard flight! Nice relaxing atmosphere.

reviews.author: Tara R.
reviews.description: Shout out to John and Adrian who hooked me up with a coffee flavored whiskey that was delicious.  They are fantastic bartenders! SUPER nice and friendly!  Great atmosphere.  Great whiskey flights and all around great place to chill and relax!

reviews.author: Ron F.
reviews.description: While visiting San Antonio , Riverwalk, we came across Devils River . WOW what a fun find. That night they had Nathan Bibano a electric violin player who was fantastic. He played so many fun tunes people were stopping and listening as they walked by.   As we walked into Devils River we were greeted by Adrian. He talked to us at length about the Distillery and its process. It was different from the ones we had seen and visited at the Kentucky Bourbon Festival. So it intrigued us.   We decided to try the tastings and started off with The Devils Alley which was Devils River Bourbon, Devils River Rye, and Devils River Coffee Bourbon which my wife really enjoyed too. Next we tried the Devils Boulevard which included Devils River Barrel Strength, Devils River Single Barrel, Devils River Distillers Select.  My wife also had a mixed bourbon coffee drink and loved it along with tasting some of my smooth milder Devils Bourbons.   All had its own flavors, from mild to okay that got our attention and YES we have some favorites.. but will leave that to you as everyone has different likes and dislikes for various reasons.. and YES we have well over 2 dozen Bourbons and Scotches in our home bar.    Kudos to JON, Adrian and Muldin for a great night and properly humidified cigar!  Also one of the owners and his wife stopped in to check on what was happening.. great to meet them too!  You now have a fan of your Devils Bourbon as told to you that night.. I already passed it on to our bourbon group.. in Florida and Georgia!     Please do not sell out to the big guys or China Corps as others have and ruin a good thing!

reviews.author: Andrea U.
reviews.description: We stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and were greeted by Adrian. He was very friendly and knowledgeable about the whiskey and distillation process. He made sure we got a tour of the facility and explained each whiskey and drinks of our choice. Overall, Adrian made us feel welcome and gave us a great whiskey experience. Make sure to check it out if you are visiting San Antonio or are a local! Beautiful building, great ambiance, awesome drinks.

reviews.author: Sergio M.
reviews.description: I came here during the first weeks of opening and was one of the few Hispanic people here with my buddy and manager was very rude to non-whites.  I've had multiple people already have the same story. no one is in line and he's having conversations with other employees right in front of us and doesn't even greet us or acknowledge us until he felt like it. Oh this place has very little variety of drinks and really is never busy doesn't seem like they can get their foot off the ground

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.description: This place is AWESOME!! Great variety of drinks. Adrian and John are absolutely amazing and knowledgeable. Ask for them, you won't be sorry!!

reviews.author: Monjan M.
reviews.description: Drake is the gfbtoat or the "greatest fucking bartender of all time"  makes great drinks,  good conversation and makes the devils river that much better.

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: All around best distillery in town. Whiskey itself is still second to Ranger Creek, but Devils River is still great and has an awesome location, with a cool inside, great patio and advertised rooftop patio that I didn't check out.  They off mixed drinks and had a frozen slushy coffee whiskey as well.  I did a flight of the high proof and it was fantastic!  We sat outside and it is on Houston St but has more privacy than some spots and is totally out of the sun.  This isn't a sports bar type place or dance club but has a comfortable laid back vibe.  I definitely plan to return.

reviews.author: Jose V.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good. But we ordered a sandwich and it took for ever.  Drinks are great. But if you want food be ready to wait.

reviews.author: Margie D.
reviews.description: This was such a great afternoon!! John gave us an amazing tour and Adrian was the master of the old fashion!! Best I have ever had!! Enjoyed and will be back soon!!

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Amazing whiskeys and bourbons.  Do yourself a favor and come check out an amazing texas distillery.

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: VERY BEST service!!! The bar tender was extremely knowledgeable, kind, hospitable, he is a great rep for your company. The whiskey was outstanding, his talent in mixology was phenomenal! Best experience thus far in our visit to San Antonio!!!

reviews.author: Tim G.
reviews.description: Great cigar whiskey bar. Awesome workers. Great whiskey. Absolutely no questions asked will spend my nights smoking cigars and drinking their whiskey on the rocks. But they have mixed whiskey drinks

reviews.author: E L.
reviews.description: Just in SA for the weekend and stumbled upon this place. Fantastic place! Such a classy, but all welcoming environment. Adrian is a great bartender! Fabulous whiskey and definitely one of my favorite old fashioneds. Also, the distillers reserve is one of the best I've had in a long time! If you like good whiskey come here!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: They opened for us specially because we could only come on a Saturday. Noel is very nice and knowledgeable. We enjoyed talking with him. Their products are excellent!  The gin doesn't even need to be mixed with anything it has such a good flavor. I never would have thought I would have said that about gin.

reviews.author: ken r.
reviews.description: This is the first time I have had a chance to taste " the black label" and it was delicious. Not sweet but a real bourbon flavor. It is a fair replacement for the " balcones red label" at half the price.

reviews.author: Walt N.
reviews.description: Made reservations for a Saturday night dinner during the Christmas rush.  We had never been and had never heard anything about it - we decided based on their menu.  We are very glad we chose to eat here - we split the Tomahawk and was very pleased with the cut and preparation of the meat.  It could have used a bit more seasoning for my taste, but overall it was excellent.  The Old Fashions were some of the best tasting I ever had.  Top notch dinner!!

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: Don't freak out. It's only 4 stars because I didn't have the time or chance to really explore this distillery.   But the staff was super bubbly when we walked in and gave us their attention immediately. They gave us a quick background on the distillery and escorted us upstairs to the bar/tasting room.   We sat at the bar and enjoyed a smoked bourbon old fashioned and a bourbon straight. We also had some fries, wings, and the charcuterie plate. I'd probably skip on the charcuterie plate next time unless you really need some quick bar snack bites. The wings were amazing though.

reviews.author: Cameron V.
reviews.description: My first night in San Antonio ended with dinner at Maverick Whiskey. Texas beef and Texas Whiskey. It was delicious. The vibe of the whole restaurant was awesome and the staff was great.

reviews.author: Lisa G.
reviews.description: Drinks, food, and service were fantastic.  Take the distillery tour first while you sip a cocktail then enjoy a fabulous meal.  We didn't make it to dessert...too full.

reviews.author: Krissi L.
reviews.description: The ribeye and potatoes were both amazing. The "Draw me like your French girls" drink was very good, and the bar manager and bartenders were super friendly and nice! People sitting at the bar struck up conversation with each other, it was such a nice vibe. Definitely would recommend and will come back if I'm ever back this way for work.  (Wasn't very crowded when I went in on a Thursday evening)

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Fourth stop on our first annual Christmas Eve pub crawl. Located on the corner, outside seating provided excellent people watching, views of carriage rides and entertainment by The Grinch on his violin, taking requests from people strolling by. The bar was pretty much deserted and we got our drinks quickly, which were very good.

reviews.author: Sonia H.
reviews.description: Reservations for a group of 8 placed us in our own private room; very cool. The room overlooked the area where the whiskey is created.  A tour is available if you would like however, I'm not certain what it costs.  The menu changes regularly and is limited. We had a nice meal and service was great. The asparagus surrounded by a garlic aeoli are awesome.  The aeoli is beautifully buttery.  4 of us split the 40oz tomahawk steak.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: While furloughed during the summer of 2020 I would walk around the downtown area of San Antonio. I had passed Maverick Whiskey multiple times when they were only selling hand sanitizer. The place looked cool.   I was downtown for The Monkees show. I wanted to stop by for a drink. The bartenders were very friendly and talented. They had a few unique drink options. The got one of both old fashioned cocktails they had on their drink menu. They were both great. The guys to the right of me were raving about the food especially the fries.   I had to order the fries and they were $11. They had a nice cheese sauce,bacon and a runny egg on top. The fries were super tasty. I will recommend them to everyone. I am looking forward to trying more menu items in the future. I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Maria T.
reviews.description: Phenomenal tasting and the appetizers are not common. They are first class, give your palate a party! The staff are welcoming and very knowledgeable. A must in San Antonio!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We celebrated a birthday here with dinner and drinks. We reserved a table and were seated immediately when we arrived. The dining area is upstairs. It's small, but the tables are spaced nicely. It wasn't too busy when we went.   We had tastings for their spirits and beer. Both excellent. $10 spirit flights are the way to go. We did try cocktails. Their old fashioned was on point. I love their little extras like the ice cube with their symbol.    Food was good too. We shared a pretzel, fried goat cheese, deviled eggs and cauliflower. For my main meal I had the smoked salmon nachos. They were delicious. The majority of the table got the bone in rib eye and were all happy with it.   Staff was friendly.   They don't have parking, but you can find nearby parking garages.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I tried such perfectly cooked steak here and a delicious Old-fashioned. I will definitely return for their whiskey flight, which is an amazing deal.   The staff is amazing! I forgot my debit card and they had already turned it in downstairs with the hostess, before I even made it back. I will most definitely be back.

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Cool little spot to grab a drink or learn some things about whiskey. The kitchen didn't open till 530 so we were stuck with some appetizers, menu it's not real expansive so basic meat which is fine. Dining space is a little tight and can get loud depending on the crowd but overall a cool spot

reviews.author: Will D.
reviews.description: Awesome atmosphere, cool story. Local whiskey distillery and restaurant near the Riverwalk. All whiskey is distilled in the old bank building with restaurant upstairs. The food was quite good - I got the mesquite pork Ribs. They were not traditional ribs, but they were smoked well and were tender. I thought the fries were excellent. The whiskey flight was a cheap and fun experience. Only $10 for a 4 drink flight. Probably equaled about 2 drinks.   I'll go back to try it again and maybe get an actual tour.   The women at the front door were fun and had a great attitude. Service was a little slow, but I had good company so it wasn't as big a deal.

reviews.author: Russell F.
reviews.description: Amazing drinks and the food was good too. Enjoyed the Old Fashioned and it was on of the best I've had. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Brianna M.
reviews.description: My husband and I came here for our date night and really enjoyed it. All staff are extremely nice and gave outstanding service. The drinks were so good! The menu is revolving but if you get a chance to try the goat cheese, DO IT!

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: The food and drinks at Maverick Whiskey are top-notch! Their 3rd floor event space was perfect our event which had around 70 guests.  Chef Joshua's menu was outstanding and the star of the show was his NY Strip Steak.  The well balanced drinks were all made with spirits distilled in-house.  Highly recommend for a large event, or just a dinner out downtown.  Much thanks to Ken for being helpful planning and delivering a memorable event.

reviews.author: Erin B.
reviews.description: This was a huge disappointment for all 4 people in our dinner party. 2 of 4 were vegetarians and while the menu photos had a veggie pasta dish, it wasn't on the menu we were given when we went. There were no vegetarian dishes on the menu. Also, 2 of 3 drinks were so bad they were left more than half full when we departed. And, the place is extremely over-priced with very limited options. We ended up ordering a couple of vegetarian friendly appetizers to split and left hungry.

reviews.author: Nghi T.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. We did the tour which lasted about an hour and a half and had dinner at the restaurant as well. The service was exceptional and everyone were very friendly and welcoming.  Our tour guide, Nicole, was fun, engaging and knowledgeable. The uniqueness of Maverick lies within its rich history and dyanmic cultural narratives surrounding the family and the area, so the tour is a must if you want to fully appreciate the experience! At the end of the tour, we tasted a few of their spirits and their straight bourbon whiskey. This whiskey has a lighter note to it and very smooth. My friend prefered the Alamo whiskey which has a bolder taste.   We also got a chance to hear some spooky ghost stories from Dan, the manager. "Spirits and spirits" ;)   The restaurant is upstairs with an elegant atmosphere and a view of the distillery on the side. The deviled eggs were okay but did not leave a strong impression. But their baby back ribs totally made up for it. The tender, juicy BBQ ribs combined with cripsy fries offered an amazingly satisfying taste. Their shrimp scampi is just as delicious, flavorful and cooked just right. The whiskey ice cream sweetly concluded our delightful evening there. We'll definitely recommend Maverick to everyone!

reviews.author: Diana M.
reviews.description: We had great drinks here - some in the group got classics like an old fashioned, others tried some of the more creative cocktails; the commonality was that all were delicious.  We also tried the goat cheese croquettes (heaven) and the charcuterie board.  The charcuterie board has some different meat choices than you would normally see, but we all really enjoyed everything.  Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Paul S.
reviews.description: This is a cool place, almost hipster/ATX like.  Enjoyed the food and the whiskey sampler.  Ended up buying a bottle to bring home.  The atmosphere is made even better with the nice materials they used to finish they place out in.  We enjoyed it so much and I just can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Walt N.
reviews.description: Great tasting experience.      Our guide was super knowledgeable of the history, process, and flavor profiles!      13 small samples!     Was fun to try them all!!

reviews.author: Dezeray C.
reviews.description: Rebecca Creek is a fun place to go with a group of friends they have a class that you can take and learn about their products. The teacher was so friendly and you can tell he really loves what he does; the tasting are a bit strong for me but my favorite was the coconut pecan omg yummy!!! You can't take a look around at the distillery just because Covid but still so worth the class. After or even before they have a full bar where you can enjoy so drinks or buy a bottle prices are reasonable I paid $25 for a bottle of my favorite coconut one. If your in the area and like bourbon the give it a try.

reviews.author: Bridget C.
reviews.description: This is a super chill spot to hang out at. We started our night with a tour. The tour was guided by a very knowledgeable tour guide and showed the distillery, best part is you end the tour with 9 samples of their whisky and vodka. The tour it's self is $5.00 but well worth it to try all 9 samples.  The location has darts, jinga and other table/bar games. The bar only serves Rebecca Creek products but all drinks are all made with high quality juice and syrups.  After grabbing a drink we headed to a cute picnic table and enjoyed live music followed by karaoke.  This place is dog friendly and also has a bbq food truck/shack. The bbq smells amazing and tasty.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: We have been to Rebecca Creek on multiple occasions, and we've loved it every time we've been. The staff are always very welcoming and accommodating, and they're very knowledgeable on the drinks served there. We enjoyed the tour of their facilities when they were open pre-COVID, and we also enjoyed the outside tastings they're doing during COVID! They have many different flavors of whiskey to choose from, and we love every single one. Our all-time favorite has to be the Texas Ranger.

reviews.author: Nadia D.
reviews.description: It was a nice trip up 281 from SA! But when we arrived we had to pay a cover and then a few locals weren't wearing masks and it wasn't enforced for them to put them on once inside the bar. One of the employees wasn't wearing one either. While there were signs none of the employees behind the bar asked them to put one on.   I get that you have the option, but all bartenders, restaurant owners and places of business should make their employees wear a mask. Other than that the drinks were fantastic even w the $10 cover.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Event review: Bingo Brad is the best Texas bingo caller around! Wednesday night bingo is a blast, as far as luck-oriented pastimes go. I love when you don't have to be good at anything except drinking, eating, and stamping! Prizes, real bingo cards and dabbers, discounted drinks, discounted food truck BBQ, and the great Texas outdoors! You really can't go wrong for a Wednesday night! Plus, it's over by 9:30 PM, which is great because... Come on out!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Always a pleasure dealing with the staff at Rebecca Creek. I just dropped in to purchase a couple bottle of TX Ranger so that I can use as gifts when I am visiting other states. It's not only a great whiskey but also a great conversation starter talking about the distillery just down the road from my house. Due to some restrictions though, I can only purchase 4 small bottles a month   but I can live with this, I guess I have to ‍  Covid has definitely affected the hours of operations but the gift store is still open and they have some GREAT TX spirits as well as gifts.   Oh and let's not forget, they are definitely Military friendly offering Military discounts   Thanks Rebecca Creek for your spirits and hospitality

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I was kind of meh about going here. The Enchanted Rock Vodka and Rebecca Creek Whiskey I have had before and they are veryyy enjoyable. However, not being a huge mixed drink person I was apprehensive, also seeing that they only had mixed drinks- no beer or wine.  We chose a beautiful day to go! All of the seating is outside, with plenty of room for small or large groups. The drinks you can choose on the rocks or mixed- their mixes are delish! I stuck to the vodka with blueberry lemonades and other choices. All blended very well! I was surprised- I expected them to be too strong to enjoy.  We enjoyed a free tour of the distillery and got to sample the vodkas and whiskeys- all very good and learned why their liquors don't burn when you drink them (hint: they do it right). It was all started from a Texas State alumni and there is some history behind the name Rebecca Creek, which I never knew, and thoroughly enjoyed!  There is a lot to do- a good stand (not truck) on site, a live band (the All Nighters were preforming there- which btw are amazing and play everything from Pink Floyd to Foo Fighters), games such as darts, horseshoes and more. They even have a fenced-in dog park!  It's a cute place to hangout. Don't wait forever to stop in like I did. Drink local!

reviews.author: Brandy G.
reviews.description: Love love LOVE to stop in to this place for a lazy Saturday trip. My most recent trip was my third visit to Rebecca Creek to do a distillery tour and tasting and it was as much fun on the third trip as it was the very first.   You can't beat a FREE 20 minute tour and tasting of the five different liquor offerings they offer at this Texas gem. Every time I come I learn something new about the brand and their process and the tour guides provide their own unique flair to the tour. This time I had the pleasure of "Nitro Nick" as my guide and he was AWESOME! A perfect blend of humor, intelligence, and sarcasm :)  When you're done with your tour be sure to stick around and enjoy a cocktail outside on the patio or at one of the many picnic tables scattered around outside. With lots of games (jenga, darts, corn hole), live music on Saturdays and a man named Tommy serving up some of the best bbq in Texas there really is no better way to spend your day.

reviews.author: Matthew R.
reviews.description: If you believe the virus is a complete hoax then this your place. Complete disregard for distance, masks or any protocols.   No one preparing food or serving was wearing masks or sanitized hands.  Gave two stars only because they were really hospitable.

reviews.author: F P.
reviews.description: We finally visited Rebecca Creek and will be back. We enjoyed the Saturday night karaoke. Although the options for beverages are based around whiskey - obviously, there are also other refreshing options. We ordered from the food truck and the brisket was delicious, but the customer service was just horrible. The younger gentleman taking the order was completely rude - absolutely zero customer service. We end up with an incorrect order, but couldn't tolerate his rudeness to go back and have it corrected.

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great area to hang out,  and nice live music. I have a hard time understanding why you guys don't put more thought and energy into your drinks. A monkey could make an old fashioned equal to what y'all did. Put some effort and flair into it and I guarantee people will appreciate it.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: I went with a group of friends, apparently if you have 10 people, and you email for reservation? You get a tour, tasting and a cocktail for each person.   I had originally been to Rebecca Creek Distillery back in 2011, and boy has it changed for the better!   I unfortunately cannot remember the name of the gentleman that gave us our tour, he was in charge of marketing, I do remember that. He was so kind, energetic, passionate about Rebecca Creek Distillery and knowledgeable about the distilling and bottling process. The tour was very informative, you actually go inside the workings and distilling of their spirits. This is where you get to taste their Enchanted Rock Vodka, Enchanted Rock Peach Vodka made with Fredericksburg peaches, Rebecca Creek Whiskey, and their Canadian style Texas Ranger Whiskey, which was sweet and had nodes of caramel and vanilla.   We had our cocktails made by Helena. She was great! So friendly, on top of crowd control and making cocktails FAST! I had the peach vodka mixed with lemonade.. that went down too fast! We purchased a few more cocktails (and if you check in on Yelp! you get $2 off your cocktail purchase! Woo!) We gathered outside on their covered patio, played darts and smoked cigars that a friend had brought. Apparently there is usually food trucks on Saturdays, but the rainy weather had scared them away..   Super cool - they have a dog park on premises!!   On Thursday, its steak and open mic night, Friday, it's happy hour, food trucks and karaoke, Saturdays is live music and food trucks and Sundays is whiskey and wag Sundays.   Dog park is open Thursday-Sunday.   Also - they have their own radio station!! You can listen online, or at Rebecca Creek Distillery.   Do yourself a favor and go check it out, be sure to tell Helena I said heyyy!

reviews.author: Angelica H.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my time here.  Everything was great.  Enjoyed the liquor tasting of vodka and whiskey.  I wasn't expecting it to be so good.

reviews.author: Rose B.
reviews.description: I've never been to a distillery before so this was a lot of fun! I don't even drink whiskey but boy oh boy the caramel one, was just smooooth!
